Finally, we had the quinoa salad with burrata, a simple mixture of greens, tomatoes, and quinoa. The salad was dressed in balsamic vinegar and had a great mixture of sweet and tart flavors.

We had to wait an eternity for the main dishes to come, but I loved the hefty, savory flavors of the lomo saltado--a tender, stir-fried beef tenderloin with tomatoes, peppers, cilantro, potatoes, and rice on the side. It was seasoned with more Asian-inspired ingredients like soy and oyster sauces, which added a great umaminess to the dish. We also had the salmon la mar, a simply-prepared salmon that was still rare in the middle, served over a black lentil cake with a spicy red sauce drizzled all over. The salmon seemed almost a little bit too rare to me, but everything about the dish was delicious!

And finally, dessert--the choco-maracuya was a passion fruit mousse layered on chocolate mousse with almond praline on the bottom--the fruity passion fruit paired so nicely with the rich chocolate. The tres leche cake was perfectly soaked through and moist with the milk mixture and was served with fresh strawberries on the side! 

Though pricey, La Mar's beautiful, quality dishes make this restaurant worth the visit! Just make sure you're not in a rush and simply enjoy the serene atmosphere of the restaurant!
author: David K.

description:
Amazing food, exceptional service, great location and right on water, I can't think of a reason for not giving this place 5 stars! 

We didn't want a heavy dinner so ordered the ceviche tasting, grilled veggies and shrimp croquets, it was perfect amount of food and I loved every single dish - fresh and seasoned well. The ceviche was close to what I had in Peru, which I ranked the best ceviche I've tasted. I saw some very good deserts came out too but didn't have room for it. Definitely going back for a full dinner. Overall a great dining experience.
author: Carol Y.

description:
If you are looking for the best Peruvian food (seafood & others) w/ a great view, THIS IS YOUR SPOT. A little on the expensive side (bc seafood), but definitely worth the splurge. 

We started with empanadas and causa as appetizers for the group. Entrees included ceviche, chaufa (big enough to share between 2 people), and lomo saltado. All food was very authentic and extremely tasty. Service was also great.

Definitely will return next time I'm in SF!
author: Allie R.

description:
My friends and I came here for our birthday lunch and boy were we in for a treat! We came for the food and ambiance, but we stayed for the service! 

First off, our server (Luis) was AMAZING! He truly made us feel special and went over and beyond our expectations. Even giving us an overview of ceviche and the different kinds. I even learned that the limes in Peru are smaller and more acidic than the ones in California. I can't wait to visit Peru now. 

Lastly, the food was so delicious! But that was to be expected. However, Luis didn't let us down. For our dessert he brought us tres leches cake with our own candles (can you say hmmmmmm). This was by far one of the best experiences I've had at a restaurant when you consider ambiance, food, and SERVICE! If you go there, ask for Luis. He is awesome! I'll be back and will ask for him next time just because he was that great....management if you are reading this, give this man a pay increase. He deserves it! And thank you Luis for making our experience so special xoxoxoxo
author: Jessyca J.

description: Finally had a chance to visit this place - amazing food and service. Would come back any time. Thank you for the great time at your restaurant.
author: Nara B.

description:
La Mar is a high profile Peruvian restaurant on San Francisco's waterfront, right near the Ferry Building.  The location is primo with the
nice views and tons of tourists walking by.

Peruvian food has calmed down after a major climb.  This place is fun and convenient but you are paying for all that without a corresponding
lift in quality.  Service is lackluster. Come for the happy hour or just get cocktails and appetizers.

Andes Cafe in San Mateo is a sleeper Peruvian place that does dishes well and does not charge much.
https://www.yelp.com/biz/andes-café-san-mateo-2
 Picks:
Mojito ($14) was full of ice but well made.

Pisco Sour ($13) was also well made, as it better be!

Quinoa Salad ($19) with Seasonal organic tomatoes, organic Peruvian quinoa, burrata cheese and basil dressing was decent but not expectional.

Anticucho Tasting with Octopus (Pulpo) ($49) was a nice sampler to share. The beef and chicken were over done and lacked flavor without the sauce.
The fish (Hawaiian White fish) was also over cooked.

Cebiche Mixto ($19.50) Catch of the day, shrimps, calamari, octopus, in rocoto leche de tigre had a ton of sauce and could have had more shrimp.
It seemed like a bunch of calamari.

Just OK:
None

Would not reorder:
None

Overall - Good
Food - Good
Decor - Excellent
Service - Good
Value - Fair

Would we come back - No
author: Ellen H.

description:
Pretty good food at high prices; service was meh

Delish: 
- Classic ceviche
- Pisco sour
- Pobre Nigiri
- Lomo saltado

Just OK:
- Halibut arroz
- California or Mixto ceviche (I'm not a fan of the mixed sauces they come in)
- Tamarind margarita
- Special ceviche with soft shell crab

Got here around 5:30, asked for happy hour menus. Server (annoyed) said we can only do happy hour in the lounge section (I did not see this clearly mentioned on the website). Overall our server was very meh, seemed annoyed with our questions and didn't really try to make an effort. For that reason and the prices you're paying, 3 stars, probably won't be back anytime soon.
author: B P.

description:
Horrifying NYE experience! Made an opentable reservation a month ago and requested patio seating overlooking window. Arrived promptly but our party wasn't seated until 1.5 hours later! We were stuck at the bar drinking and waiting. Front desk was utterly disorganized. Even after 1.5 hours, we didn't even get the table we wanted. We got an inner table in the patio. Definitely felt like this restaurant was greedy in having 3 seatings when it could only accommodate 2 seatings unless you plan on enforcing a time limit which never happened. 3 out of 4 heaters were broken so we were freezing. They offered us one blanket in return. You would think this restaurant would fix the heaters in preparation for such a busy event!

Long delay between appetizer and entree. We didn't receive our entree until the midnight fireworks show happened and everyone rushed in front of our table so we had to stand to avoid being blocked. By the time it was finished, our food was cold. Food was bland like cafeteria food and service was horrific. The entire restaurant only has 2 single bathrooms which was ridiculous since the lines to use it was almost 30 minutes! Not practical at all! I was so embarrassed for our guests and horrified by this experience. I'm only adding one star because we spoke to the manager who comped one dinner and a round of drinks for us. Considering this dinner cost $140 per person, we were utterly horrified and disappointed. Our guests were visiting from Europe and this left a bad impression. To make matters worse, my husband got food poisoning that night! We will never ever return.
author: Sara K.

description:
Had an exceptional dining experience here this past Saturday for dinner. The restaurant is located on the pier, and has a beautiful view of the water whether you're sitting outside or inside (although recommend sitting outside if you can!).

Service was absolutely phenomenal. One of those rare instances where you are so genuinely pleased with service and have literally zero complaints. 

Food was really really good. It's best eaten family style - order a variety of items to share with the table. We came here after a huge lunch that day, so weren't able to try nearly as much of the menu as we would have liked to. Recommend coming here with a group of at least 4 or so, so that you can taste a bunch of different items and flavors!

We shared some ceviche dishes and skewers. All of the food was full of so much flavor, with a great spicy kick. Also loved the fried plantains and potato chips that were served at the beginning, along with a spicy aioli dipping sauce. So delicious.
author: Kell S.

description:
La Mar is fun!  La Mar is about friends!!  La Mar is about friends enjoying delicious fresh flavorful food and having fun in a beautiful setting!!!  
Staff are gracious and most help so if you need some tips just ask. The menu has lots to offer. 
Get adventurous and try one of the many refreshing drinks like this one made with blue corn - yes!  And please save room for desert. Their chocolate lives up to the Peruvian heritage. Enjoy!!
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Experience based rating:
To be fair our reservation wasn't until 145p and we checked in 20 minutes early. 

Hostess told us we'd be seated closer to our reservation time but last seating was at 2 so know we can order but they were having an event.  

We should've left then but we really wanted to give it a try based on previous ratings so we went into the bar. Unfortunately, we weren't acknowledged for 15 minutes there so finally we checked back in at 152p and conveniently our table was ready but we had already decided to leave. 

I did request to speak to the manager concerning what I thought was poor reservation scheduling based on rushing us out due to an event. Manager was argumentative and not concerned with hostess communication of the situation. In addition the bathrooms were filthy, toilet paper on the floor, paper towels left on stools and scattered all over, as well as trash overflowing.
author: Kristie A.

description:
Of course is by Gaston acurio!!
No complains at all but only ONE!!!
Big plates and little food and expensive!!!
But can't complain about anything else! 
Gaston acurio is a master chef !!
author: Ruby H.

description: The best dinner I've had in years! I had the duck Paella and it was absolutely delicious!! I will be back the next time I visit San Fransisco!
author: Jean R.

description: Thank you La Mar for being very professional and letting us know that the restaurant had to close down due to a fire in the kitchen. What a waste of time driving here for my dinner reservation.
author: Tommy A.

description: I go here all the time for my BumbleBizz meetings. It's a very posh vibe to take your clientele to and great place for casual business meetings. If you're lucky and catch SF day on a non-foggy day you get great views of the Bay and nearby boats!
author: Kayla C.

description:
Had a sub par experience for dinner tonight and will not be back. Host staff was friendly and quick to greet but the service dropped off after we received water and an explanation of the menu. The server forgot to put drinks orders in twice, with no acknowledgement or apology. Empanada was decent, ceviche was good, mains were underwhelming - duck fried rice special was a bit bland ($34 for a few pieces of duck and a lot of not very flavorful rice) and plancha marina with extra $20 for octopus was one piece of octopus - not worth the price. 

Look for less touristy location if you really want Peruvian food.
author: Alexandra H.

description: Oh god! Tonight 9/16 was awful! When I made the reservation there was no indication there was a white patty going on. It was obnoxiously loud, the food was off, the service was horrible and to top it off the bathrooms were trashed and the lines to use them were long, so forget about eating warm food!!! I don't know if this was a one time event but I hope so, because if this was my first time it would be my last!!!
author: Jill T.

description: This is the perfect place to go for a special occasion. We had dinner in the outside patio area looking out on the bay which was beautiful. They had heaters and offer blankets because it can get quite chilly. Three out of four of us were vegetarian and this restaurant doesn't have the largest selection of vegetarian dishes. However, the waiter gave us some great suggestions and we ended up sharing the quinoa chaufa, vegetariana causa, and the veggie ceviche. This was our first experience with Peruvian food and even our pickiest eater was impressed.  Honestly, I was a little apprehensive before trying each dish as they were combinations I hadn't experienced before. Did not disappoint! The unique flavors as well as the use of both cooked and raw food elements in each dish was fantastic. Highly recommend!!
author: Pratyusha G.

description:
Pretty nice and well organized! Great location. This was my first time having Peruvian  food, enjoyed it! The staff were kind and explained the menu well. Our party was more than 5 people, and I'm appreciative the waiter waited patiently for us until everyone got there. The moment we went in it felt so high class. I like the interior design of the restaurant, but the restrooms are a bit small and there is a lack of privacy. The doors to the bathroom stalls can seem revealing. There is a bar close to the entrance and then the indoor space and then the outdoor space. Went there for a birthday. Sat outside close to the water. The floors and tables were clean and tidy. While it started getting cold since it was nighttime, there was a heater on the ceiling that turned on, thank goodness. Though because I was sitting at the further side of the table I was still cold a little bit. The ceviches we ordered were fresh and delightful, the flavors were amazing, some sweet others more sour. 
My main entree was the lomo saltado. The meat was cooked perfectly and i liked the sauce. Although the fact that it came with a side of white rice  was a little bit odd to me, I usually don't have potatoes and rice together, it's an interesting combination. I also had the rose wine, it was fabulous!
The birthday girl got a free dessert on the house. It was the tres leches dessert with a candle in the middle
author: Daniela S.

description:
So expensive, but the food is so good. I came here for a team outing and we managed to spend $899 between 7 people lol. 

We ordered the civiche sampler, lomo saltado, quinoa and halibut, octopus, and more. All of the dishes were the best I've ever tasted. Also tried their chocolate mousse dessert - absolutely delicious with some dessert wine.

As for drinks, I tried the El Volcan, Summer Splash, and the First Aid.  The El Volcan definitely had a kick to it - think Wasabi and ultra spicy flavoring. The more you drink it, and the more the ice melts, the worse & spicier it gets. I don't think I'd ever order that again. The Summer Splash was delicious!  Pretty sweet with just the right amount of alcohol. The First Aid was designed to be healthy, so healthy it was. It was actually disgustingly healthy lol. I don't think I'd order it again, even though it looked pretty cool. 

All in all, the food is amazing here. Might actually be some of the best food I've had. A bit pricy, but well worth it.
author: Destynnie T.

description:
Unbelievably excellent Peruvian food, heavily bent toward the sea.  Limo Salgado with high quality steak will be the best you've ever had!  The Ceviche with Ahi is an absolutely indescribable delight!!!
The empanada's are undoubtedly the best outside of Peru.
Run, don't walk, to this place
author: Loren B.

description: La Mar will celebrate their 10 year anniversary this I have been coming here for 10 years and the food and service has always been excellent   The Lenny's have change over the years but the ceviche has always been fresher and delicious. The pisco sour is fabulous.  The location is perfect.  Enjoy
author: Pedro R.

description:
Terrible service, rude and racist manager, her name is Caroline.
The food is ok at best. Dont even try the anticuchos.
Nothing close to real Peruvian Cuisine.
author: Gene A.

description:
Note to self: Expect lonnnnnng line equaling 1+hours wait on a long Sat. weekend + Farmers Market @ Hog Island.........back up plan to dine here!!   My niece found this restaurant thanks to you 3000+ yelper's reviews and this time you didn't fail 

 their taro mixed chips with that DELISH dip plus a great warm Sat afternoon to sit in their patio.  Hint: If you ladies get cold, they have blankets, so just ASK your server 

Ordered:
Fiesta de Almeja: Geoduck clam served 5 different ways - Fresh, yummy, and too bad not filling 

El Erizo - Yummmmmmmmmmmy Uni!  how it wasn't served the traditional way, instead the fresh uni was surrounded with fresh avocados, pea shoots, diced purple onions, sliced aji chili peppers, and delicately bathed in a yummmy sauce. It was so delish eating as-is or dunking the chips in there that we had to order another one.....BURP!!

Beef hearts - Love the Peruvian corn aka Choclo or Cusco corn and potatoes (wished there were more),  but too bad the inside of the semi-generous heart chunks lacked in flavors. 

Mixto - Peruvian style Cebiche.....Not bad & should try!

I have to say this place is my new FAVORITE PERUVIAN restaurant....had yummy foods, great view, the service was awesome... what more can you ask except MORE food please 


Can't wait to return to try more items on their menu!!!!!!
author: Katy N.

description:
Lovely Peruvian food in a great spot on the water. Ask to sit outside. The menu is pricey, but if you're willing to ball out, the tasting menus are really fun, you'll get a little bit of everything. Absolutely try one ceviche. The "milk" in the ceviche is incredible and a one of a kind flavor. They specialize in ceviche here so don't miss out. 

Expect lots of fresh, colorful, healthy, filing Peruvian food and a pretty packed house!
author: Sela B.

description:
This was a nice, upscale restaurant and a wonderful place to enjoy a special meal!  I enjoyed the complimentary yucca chips as it was a perfect fit for the cuisine, especially when it was accompanied by nice mayo sauce.  The empanada tasting was great, especially the beef and mushroom flavors and I was happy to see they had a choclo one which was a lot of fun to try!  The Peruvian Painkiller was an interesting cocktail, although I really liked the fruitiness and flavors of the Pisco Punch!

When it came to the meal, the lomo saltado was nice but I really enjoyed the Salmon la mar with the flavorful shrimp and the grilled salmon, although it would have been nice if it was served with some grain or starch.  The sauce with coconut milk was amazing and I added as much as I could with every bite!  The tres leches cake was a great way to round out the meal and it was nice of them to provide a candle for a birthday celebration!  We weren't able to enjoy the view this time, but I hope I'll have another chance to visit again in the future!
author: Jenny L.

description:
If you like flavorful seafood and a good view of the San Francisco Bay then La Mar is a good choice. 

We brought my sister, who was visiting from out of town, and had a great lunch here.  Previously, we had taken a larger group of family members here for dinner on a Saturday evening - also a great meal but VERY difficult to get reservations at that time.  Monday afternoon (not surprisingly) was much easier and just as enjoyable. 

All of us ordered drinks (Pisco Sour, Pisco Punch, and a "Prickly Pear Margarita").  And all the drinks were fairly strong (a good thing in my book) Also, the Pisco Punch was sweet, which my wife liked.  Our waiter was good at suggesting things we might liked based on what we told him we were in the mood for.

None of us was particularly hungry so my wife and sister only ordered appetizers as their respective entrees (causa limena and California cebiche w/o salmon) and I ordered an entree (lomo saltado) but with no appetizer or other dish.  We each thoroughly our meals (as well as each other's) and would definitely come back again.
author: Paul O.

description:
Cute, classy restaurant and bar on the San Francisco Pier. While waiting for the restaurant to open for dinner at 5pm, the friends and I squeezed into the pretty packed bar area to order some drinks and appetizers. They do have a happy hour menu - every day from 3pm to 6pm. To note: the empanadas on the HH menu - you only get one per serving. To drink, I opted for a Prickly Pear Margarita. It was maybe just a little too prickly (sour) for me. 

Once they opened the main dining room for dinner, we were led through the expansive restaurant to a table on their gorgeous patio on the water. Wide open glass doors/windows give a nice, bright, open feel and view of the bay, even if sitting inside. I was very impressed that EVERY waiter or worker we walked past on our way outside actually greeted us and welcomed us to the restaurant! Very pleasant, and our waiter was no exception. 

To eat, I tried the Chicken Empanadas. Two decent sized empanadas, stuffed with savory pulled chicken. I got the Causas Limeña for my meal. Aesthetically pleasing, Causas are lines of lavender-colored whipped potatoes, which you can top with a choice of seafood or veggie ingredients. The Limeña option is Dungeness crab, avocado, slices of quail egg, drizzled with a creamy aji Amarillo sauce and dotted with salmon caviar on top. There was a distinct hint of lime I thought. Interesting blend of flavors. The seafood mixture was served cold and delicious. Although it did not look like a huge meal, I was actually full before I got half way through so did not try dessert. 

My only "thing" about the experience was that when the waiter brought us one check and we asked to have it split, he seemed to grudgingly let us know it could be done "but he would have to go find the manager and it may take a while". Definitely got the impression it was not something he wanted to do. So we ended up leaving it as is. (To note it seems like all San Fran restaurants we visited this weekend were not too keen on splitting checks after the fact, so best to let them know/ask up front if you can do separate checks if you are in a party). Food and ambiance was very good!
author: Zita C.

description:
Our party of 8 came in and we were greeted warmly and taken to our nice table out in the patio under heat lamps. Host was friendly and patient, she handed out menus individually. She didn't just slap it on the table and ditched us. Nice touch.

Our server spent a good 5 mins introducing us to Peruvian cuisine and explaining the menu. Very knowledgeable and nice guy.

When it was time to order, I asked for separate check and server said because of the large party, there'll be a 20% gratuity for the entire check but we can pay with two credit cards. It had disaster written all over it but I was optimistic. 

All was well and the first 5 items we ordered arrived. Unfortunately, it stopped there. 6 more items never came. Half the order didn't make the cut. 

We flagged our server and half our party had to reorder their dishes and server wrote it on his pad (again). 

So this is awkward and half our party are eating, anticipating for the rest of our order to arrive. 

Server was a champ, he apologized and asked the kitchen staff to prioritize the order. It came quickly and server gave us an extra causa order for the long wait. 

Our party didn't enjoy the wait but everyone loved the dishes. The server redeemed himself, I thought. Impressive. 

We paid our checks and the 20% party gratuity wasn't added but we paid it anyway because of the friendly staff,  superb service and great flavors!!
author: Pam P.

description:
This is first review in my life ever. Food is so good 
But beware over tips change.I did pay for tips $25 clearly write but they charge me $31.It not possible wrong number for sure,I know it's seem not big deal but I feel not fair at all
author: Poy S.

description: The lomo saltado was delicious as were the empanadas. The Causa de Limeña has purple yam that's squeezed out and looks like purple playdough, which made it odd to eat. As for the $52 Whiskey Smash pitcher, we were told this was 4-4.5 drinks, however it was truly only 3 without ice... beware.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: Favorite Peruvian restaurant in California! My parents were born and raised in Peru and this is their favorite too. Any special occasion, La Mar is our go-to celebration meal. Authentic flavors while still adding a new twist, highest quality ingredients, cool coastal feel, 10/10 all around. Expensive, but so worth it
author: Brittany W.

description:
I use to work for a wine importer and my boss sells wine to these guys.  I heard ok things about them so I thought I'd give it a try...

 It's not bad but not great.  The ceviche and other seafood items are delicious.  I ordered a lobster roll and the bread was like an old hard hot dog bun that you would feed to pigeons.

We brought our baby there and it took forever to order,  took forever to get our check,  all the while our baby was anxious and pretty much had it with the place! 

The service is down right rude, and you get looks and stares for bringing a baby to this totally touristy place. I asked where the bathroom was and our waiter was like uh huh yeah and walk off. He looked confused on where his little drink went to what table. 

The decor and windows inside are nasty,  dirty but the outside seating looked nice. 

Too many good restaurants elsewhere to come here again but Iam glad I tried it.
author: Maria W.

description: My only beef is why Oh why didn't I make dinner reservations here instead of La Ciccia! I came here for a drink and appetizer. I loved their bar, their bartenders were really friendly and I loved their Pisco sour. I love tart drinks and this one was excellent! I ordered their lobster appetizer which was delicious and they bring out house made chips with a tangy green sauce which I loved! I am definitely coming back  and would love to have dinner here! Good place right on the water that doesn't feel touristy!
author: Courtney Y.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF hands down. The food is simply excellent! You've got to order the ceviche sampler (3 types) and the empanadas (you get one of each: chicken, beef, mushroom, and a surprisingly delicious corn empanada). You can't go wrong, I haven't had anything that wasn't great, although the sea urchin was very small for being $30+.

TIP: eat outside! There's a beautiful view of the Bay, and there are overhead heaters for cooler nights. The patio is shaded. 

This restaurant is best enjoyed family/tapas style. 

I highly recommend this restaurant and cannot wait to go back!
author: Leeyen R.

description: Last minute dinner plans that did not disappoint! The food and the service was excellent. We had the Cebiche Tasting and the Anticucho Tasting, both of which were very good.
author: Mike S.

description:
Overall, worth a try if you're willing to splurge a bit and want some scenery while you eat.

Went here for lunch on a Friday afternoon. We were originally worried about the place being crowded, but the restaurant is huge, so there is plenty of seating. We dined in the "outdoor" patio in the back where you get a scenic view of the SF pier.

I got the empanadas as appetizer and lomo saltaldo as the entree. 

The empanadas were quite good. We got the "Empanada Tasting" with each empanada (4 total) having a different filling, but I enjoyed the beef empanada the most. They are small for the price - comparable to a potsticker - but I knew it was that type of restaurant.

No complaints about the meat in the lomo saltaldo. The only thing was the dish was on the salty side, so you definitely need to mix in the rice they give you. The portion is also huge - you could probably turn it into 2 meals. I actually recommend you save half so that you have room for their desserts. I was incredibly stuffed trying to finish my lomo saltaldo and stayed that way for the rest of the day.

This is a good place to celebrate special occasions if you don't mind the price. The staff are attentive and you won't get a bad meal.
author: Taylor K.

description:
Great atmosphere, spacious seating with high ceilings. Also enclosed outdoor seating (with heaters) with a view of the water. For lunch, large windows let in a lot of natural light. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu options and how they were cooked - super helpful for a group of people who have very specific tastes (one person was picky, another was vegetarian and gluten free, and I eat everything buy try to avoid heavy oils and fried food).

After we ordered they brought fried plantains and two dipping sauces (one was mint based, the other with jalapeño) to our table. They felt very light but the flavor was great!

All of the food we ordered was delicious, and the waitstaff was very attentive and kind to us.  It's definitely a little more on the expensive side, but if you come in here knowing this the bill won't be a shocker.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
We walked into the bar to have a drink. I have always wanted to try La Mar. To my surprise no one would even 
Aknowledge us, what a disappointment. We waited at least 10 minutes and I refuse to beg for service, I made my boyfriend walk out even though he wanted us to wait while clearly we were being ignored.
author: Dee D.

description: We started at the bar with cocktails and ceviche and chips, and later made our way into the restaurant's main dining room.  Delicious food throughout.  Extremely attentive and courteous service!  We each got the $69 prix fix experience (14 dishes) and added some empanadas.  Everything that came was beautiful to look at and even more delicious to eat!  It was a lot of food, and we were so stuffed that we couldn't finish everything!  Looking forward to going back!
author: Peter M.

description:
Restaurant week menu.

I'd like to come back again to get a different feel of the place. Although the food was good I wonder if it could be better under different circumstances. 

The ceviche appetizer was pretty tasty. The salmon was okay. Can I have two helpings of ceviche?
author: Chu M.

description: Everything was very good. I normally don't eat raw fish, but their ceviche was to die for. If you're around the pier you should try this place out! Worth your money
author: April Rose C.

description:
This place is really nice! I love the decor during the holiday. I came here with a group of co-workers for dinner. Everything was amazing, the atmosphere, the food, and the service. 

For appetizers, we had the Cebiche Tasting and the Empanada Sampler. Everything we ordered was to share. 

The Cebiche was so good! My favorite is the Nikei- Ahi tuna, red onion, Japanese cucumber, daikon, avocado, and nori in a tamarind leche de tiore. I've never had empanadas before, so this was a good way to sample them. My favorite is the corn and the chicken. They also serve warm plantain chips with spicy herbed aoli dip, which is really good too. 

For the main dish, we got the Arroz La Mar, and the Lomo Saltado. Both dishes where really good! But I would recommend the lomo saltado. It was the best. 
 
We almost skipped out on desert because we where full, but the server told us this story about their famous Peruvian chocolate. He said the chocolate is made in small batches especially for the restaurant and carried by a donkey. After hearing that story, we had to try the El Mousse de Chocolate. And I'm glad we did. It was really good!

I was so impressed with this whole experience, I came back the following week for dinner. And the second time around was just as good.
author: Edie G.

description:
It's unfortunate that the restaurant is called La Mar "The Sea" since all their seafood we ordered did not taste fresh. We tried the Cebiche Clásico and the Plancha Marina, and both you could taste that funky "not-so-fresh" taste.

On top of that their portions are pretty small for what you're paying. You would serve yourself better if you headed to Limón instead.
author: David G.

description: The food is really good, fresh  creative, friendly staff and great drinks.  Nice environment, however the menus is so confusing and irrationally organized that I almost left before dining.  Get over it...it's worth it
author: Reggie D.

description: We came with a group from our office for a team lunch. Heads up that they will require you to sign a contract if you have eight or more people. What's on the contract, you ask?  Nothing except that you are required to provide a 20% tip.
author: Mike N.

description:
Have been wanting to try this spot for years and finally made a stop in while on a business trip. Service was great and everyone extremely friendly and accommodating. 

The plantain chips and Hucatay sauce was an amazing start! Sauce was full of great flavor and spiciness. 

I started with the fish ceviche which was amazing. The fish was fresh and of excellent quality. All the flavor notes mixed perfectly and had the perfect amount of jugo and onion, choclo and spiciness. I just wish the portions were bigger as I wanted more.

Second dish was the anticucho de corazón. This was a bit of a miss for me but not terrible by any means. The meat was on the dryer side and the anticucho flavor was not fully there.  Maybe it would have been better if I went with the steak. However since this is a seafood restaurant, I would stick to the seafood dishes.

Lastly, while the place is nice it beginning to look a bit worn and could use a spruce up and new coat of paint. This is suppose to be a high-end restaurant and they should ensure even small details are up to par. Noticed the bathroom was old, with stains on the wall and doors. Also noticed the plant was dusty and a few other tidbits that made it look a little sloppy.
author: Jessy V.

description:
I came here for Happy Hour, and I was not let down
Their Pisco Sour is delicious and a Peruvian must try. I ended up trying out their Prickly Pear drink as well, and I was taken by this unique flavor. 

If you're a vegetarian, like I am, they had mushroom empanadas that were AMAZING! (Not vegan containing dairy products)

I will definitely come here again!
author: kaitlyn d.

description:
It was pretty good. The ceviche I ordered was good but I've definitely had better. This place is incredibly overpriced. I wasn't a fan of the alcoholic beverage I got either. I did like the salmon my friend ordered. The server was incredibly nice and attentive. The environment here is relaxed, but still fancy. The candle light and décor give the place a lot of romance. I like that the bar is separate from the eating area. The view is beautiful  outside the restaurant, it overlooks the bay. I feel like coming here is more for the ambiance than the taste/price of the food. 

I definitely recommend getting a reservation here, there were several people I saw waiting for a really long time who didn't have reservations.
author: Estela D.

description:
They sat a party of 6 fairly quickly and the restaurant was open and airy. It had a historic beach vibe.

Original server was Gina and she was really friendly. Then a male server came and took over and was really pushy. 

They bring complementary plaintain chips that are delicious and crunchy.

The lomo saltado was one of the best we have had.

The guy had repeated back our order after we ordered and still managed to screw up and not put in order for mom's ceviche. After everything was brought for us and hers wasn't we finally caught his attention. He did acknowledge he screwed up and forgot to place order for hers and within 10 minutes had hers ready.

Dad spoke to waitress before we left since she came to wish us a good day - we expressed we hope her table - us - hadn't been hijacked and she said it was but she was given another table. Minus a star - though the guy who thought he had upsold us and gotten a high roller table must have been disappointed when we didn't take him up on any of his recommendations. No we would not like a $78 full octopus and cocktails at 12pm when it is very hot outside and we have big dinner plans. He never introduced himself with a name so can't say who he was.
author: Janna C.

description:
We came here around 7:40pm and this place was packed.  We sat near the bar at the counter since there was a couple hour wait for the tables near the ocean view.  Our waitress was pretty nice and helpful.  She helped explain a few things on the menu and what people usually ordered the most.  

We all ordered the La Coqueta ($13) drink which was new to the menu and probably may not stay on for very long.  It had a rosemary infused pisco, lychee puree, white vermouth, luxardo bianco, orange bitters, and an expressed orange peel.  My friends ordered their food (I don't remember all of theirs so apologies for the unlabeled pictures) and I was pretty hungry so I ordered two things: the Fritter Sampler ($29) and the Lomo Saltado ($36).

After a few minutes, our La Coqueta drinks came out.  It was good to me and I would recommend it if it was still on the menu in the future.  Our food came out all at once and since I ordered two, there was no room for everything.  The Fritter Sampler was good because there were a few different items on the dish.  The empanadas were delicious even though they were small to me, the croquettes were good and the yuquitas were not bad.  I would recommend the Fritter Sampler if you want more than empanadas to try.

The Lomo Saltado was good if you just eat the meat with A LITTLE sauce, onions, and potatoes.  I emphasized "a little" because the sauce was pretty salty to me.  There were a lot of onions too so I didn't finish all of that and there wasn't enough pieces of meat.  The rice that came with it was a good balance but still way too much salty sauce.  If you can get past the salty sauce, then the meat was the best part of the dish when combined with everything else.

Good place to eat and I would recommend trying it!
author: Daniel H.

description: La Mar was spot-on in every aspect. Beautiful decor and views of the Bay. Flawless service. But most of all the food was incredible. We had the cebiche tasting (3 types), chicken empanadas, and the nikei causa (a dish of whipped potatoes topped with raw tuna and rocoto cream ). With all these different dishes, I'm unable to really pick a favorite. All the raw seafood was really fresh, the empanadas were flaky and savory, and every sauce had bright, bold flavors. The meal was complemented by pisco sours that really balanced the acidity of the ceviches. I also could have eaten the entire cone of plantain chips all by myself. I wanted to return to La Mar again the moment I left, so 5 stars is well-deserved.
author: Sheri W.

description:
This was my first experience at an upscale Peruvian restaurant. I'm really glad I had the opportunity to go.

The location on the waterfront is beautiful, and our table had a clear view of the bay, looking out from the pier. I ordered the chifle, ceviche mixto and crab sanguche for lunch. 

As an appetizer, the chifle was excellent. The dip was perfectly done, flavorful with a hint of spice.

The ceviche mixto's balance was a minor issue, due to the sauce being too overpowering and salty. It covered the freshness of the assortment of seafood in the ceviche.

The main course crab sanguche was plated beautifully. Though, I was a bit surprised at the coldness of the dish.

However, I thought it was a great choice for lunch!
author: Chawntella L.

description: Outstanding Peruvian cuisine, particularly the ceviches, causas, paella and cocktails. This is my go-to place for people visiting SF; a short walk from BART Embarcadero station. Reasonably priced, especially considering you're on the water.
author: George C.

description:
I went to Peru last year and I didn't have anything this good. Then again I didn't ever spend this much...

Came here for an afternoon brunch on a Saturday. The restaurant was not very full, we were able to get a seat overlooking the water. Even though we were technically sitting outside, you can hardly tell.

We ordered the ceviche and skewers platters. Took our waiter's recommendation and added the octopus to the skewer platter. Glad we did cause it was my favorite one! The ceviche was amazing; each one had a very different flavor. Went really well with the plantain chips they give. Also ordered a Pisco Sour, which is like the go-to drink for Peruvians. Even though the drink was smaller than I expected, it was pretty strong! 

Overall, great service and even better food. Definitely would recommend it, especially if you are looking for some authentic Peruvian food!
author: Danny L.

description:
My colleagues and I visited this restaurant on recommendation while in San Fan for a conference. We were underwhelmed with the food and very very disappointed with the service.

They all ordered the salmon which lacked any kind of flavor/freshness and was a children's size portion. 

I had the lomo saltado which was good, but not great.

Things went downhill when I ordered a margarita and asked what brand tequila they use. The waiter had no idea, gave me a blank stare, rolled his eyes, then walked away and didn't come back for 20 mins to let me know which one it was (with a sigh no less). I decided to ask for a different brand and he had the audacity to say (with an attitude) "you should have told me you wanted that brand from the beginning"

I don't think I've ever felt more disrespected and offended that he thought it was appropriate to say something like that to me. 

I would never suggest this restaurant to anyone, I would actually advise against it. I think there should be an option for no stars.

Advise to management: Try to hire waitstaff with less sass, that actually like working with people.

Our server was Raul, just in case anyone was wondering.
author: Natasha J.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF! I love Peruvian food!

The ceviche clasico is a must! Empanadas samplers or grilled octopus are other options to share. For main, I've had the Arroz La Mar, which is arborio rice with shrimp, clams, and calamari. Another favorite is Pasta Criollo, which is squid ink pasta with shrimp and calamari. But my all-time favorite is the grilled catch of the day, one time they had paiche, which is a white fish from the Amazon, it was amazing!

There's indoor and outdoor patio seating right on the waterfront so get a table outdoors on a nice day. Service is friendly and prompt. Restaurant is located in the Embarcadero so take a walk around before or after dinner.
author: Van D.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect, but whatever I had in mind was not the extraordinary experience I discovered.

We arrived about 8 pm on a Thursday without a reservation. Upon seeing that the place was packed, I was concerned we wouldn't get a table. The hostess was able to accommodate us at a table near the open kitchen. I love being able to watch all the activities in the kitchen, plus it makes me feel that the kitchen is really clean.

The restaurant is open, with lots of large windows, and very chicly designed. And that place was abuzz with activity.

Neither my Venezuelan boyfriend nor I have eaten Peruvian food. But we were game to try. We had a great server who took the time to explain traditional Peruvian cooking and La Mer's twist on them.

We decided to share an appetizer. Good choice because it was generously sized as were the entrees. We had purple potatoes with crab and caviar. So good. As entrees, he had salmon, which looked divine. I opted for a traditional beef entree with the most fantastic sauce I've ever eaten. We shared dessert - passion fruit and chocolate mouse. And you MUST try the Pisco, which is a traditional Peruvian liquor. But of course, La Mer creates their own cool, craft cocktails.

The only sad part of this experience is that I don't know when I'll be back in SF to enjoy this restaurant again.
author: Ekatarina V.

description:
Good Peruvian food in a beautiful classy yet lively setting with attentive and friendly staff. We started out with cocktails once we were seated in the beautiful tented outdoor space. We got a lot of food and by the end of it I was so full and taken with my wine that I don't even remember what the dessert was (oops). 

We had to order another round of the beef and the mushroom empanadas because they were surprisingly tasty. If you like short ribs, get the Lomo Saltado. I'm not much of a red meat eater, but I think I cleared half of the man's plate because it was fall off the bone good (sorry dude). We ordered a bottle of the Malbec they recommended and it went perfectly with the meat and seafood dishes we ordered. I'd like to go back in the evening on a warmer day when the patio isn't tented.
author: M C.

description: Every bite is more amazing than the last. If you haven't eaten here yet, get ready to make this your new favorite place. I recommend the vegetarian causa, the jalea, and any type of ceviche they serve.
author: Benito H.

description:
I tried La Mar Cebichería Peruana for lunch a couple of days ago on the recommendation of a friend who praised it a lot. It is located just ahead of the ferry building marketplace. It is a pretty large place with a bar section in the front a main dining area in the center and a patio on the pier outside. The hostess asked if I had a reservation but was cool when she heard that I had none. I was offered a seat in the empty main dining area but I asked to be seated on the patio outside as most of the people were dining there. While walking to the patio the hostess tried to make small talk by asking if I was visiting from outside. I wanted to say yeah from 4 blocks away but I just smiled. Awkward!

Anyway, once seated, I was provided menus, a glass of water and was started off with a bowl of fried plantains and a dip. I decided to start with a soup whose name I don't recollect and went with the short ribs for the main section. The plantains were nicely fried and were not too oily. The dip (Peruvian salsa?) was mild but you could pick up complex flavors. The only thing lacking was a pinch of salt but I understand that the clientele that they are targeting would not appreciate that. The soup was very good. Again it did not have an intense taste but you know that it is well made. The short ribs were fall off the bone tender and did not even have a hint of chewiness. Overall it was pretty good. The only comment that I have about the food is that it felt batch prepared. I mean it felt like a large quality was produced in an industrial kitchen earlier from which different portions were being served. It lacked the finesse and attention to detail that you get when each dish is individually prepared. When entrees cost about 30 bucks a pop I definitely expect that. I'm not sure if I ordered what would be considered to be Peruvian classics so I may have just got something that is not their specialty.

Service was attentive and I was frequently checked up on; the busser, server, section head and manager all made it a point to stop by. It was like they were over-attentive. Don't get me wrong it was not that these folks would hover over you, something that I detest, but it felt like they were trying too hard. Price wise it is like a $$$ place so you should expect that it will blow a hole in your pocket (which it did even without drinks). As already stated earlier I felt that the food was good but it lacked the attention to detail that you expect at this price range. Overall I think La Mar Cebichería Peruana is definitely better than an A-OK but I don't think it is in the Yeah I'm a fan category yet. In the absence of a 3.5 rating, I'll be generous and round that up to a 4.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
My fav restaurant in the city! Love the food! Love the wine and the ambiance!! Sit on the outdoor back patio during Spring or Summer overlooking the water is ideal. There are heaters and see-through cover-ups to block from the cold wind during the Fall and Winter. Ceviche is here BOMB! I recommend to all of the ceviche dishes! 

Love the plantain chips and their dips! Ask them for the super spicy hot dip as well.

You would never think it...and might not ever get to it; bc of being too full at eating the appetizers and enters; BUT!!!...the desert here is freaking delicious! Gotta try the chocolate mousse with quinoa...OMG!!! Pretty much, try to come here with a large party to order everything on the menu. I mean it...try everything. So good!!! Oh! There's HH at the cool bar area from 3-6pm. Can't wait come back!!!!!!!!
author: Lorie N.

description:
Stunning location along the pier looking out onto the bay. 

Yummy: plantain chips, market ceviche, empanadas, grilled octopus, and beef stew 

Unimpressive: their service isn't attentive and seems stoic 

Best Peruvian restaurant hands down. Their grilled octopus is the star here
author: Star K.

description:
Had a blast with the Classico ceviche! Simple, well balanced.  Very good. 
Busy place. Reservation recommended.
author: Laurent L.

description: I've eaten here twice, once for dinner and once for lunch.  The first time was average, but the second time was significantly better.  I've tried a number of different dishes, from the ceviche trio sampler (recommend for 2-3 people) to virtually every causa on the menu.  The causas are just outstanding.  Also love the empanadas and the quinoa salad with salmon.  I will say the service is also top-notch.  During my most recent visit, they had a packed house and I did not feel that any aspect of our service was diminished by the business of our restaurant.  I would definitely recommend La Mar.
author: IYELP U.

description:
Best peruvian house in san francisco. I went with my boyfriend when I got to San francisco, so first night and first place in my mind was Cevicheria La Mar. 
I loved the costumer service, the treat of the manager and the staff. Thank you for my unforgettable first night in SFO.
author: Rosmery S.

description:
My Dad was in town on business so I had a chance to catch up with him over lunch. The restaurant was pretty empty which was welcome since I didn't have a lot of time to get back to work for meetings.

We got seated on the outdoor patio next to the water - which is exactly where you want to be if you end up here. The view of the East Bay was absolutely fantastic with the sun out and a cool breeze blowing.

The food was ordered in a bit of a hurry giving our tight timeline, but the waiters were more than happy to oblige with enough heads up. The ceviche sampler came out very quickly - all three items being good with the Mixto being exceptional. I ordered the Lomo Saltado as a follow up. It was way oversalted and sloppy, probably one of the least authentic and mediocre takes on this dish that I've ever eaten. Probably the least favorite parts of the meal was definetly the bill - between three people we'd managed to rack up almost $175 in what we supposed to be a casual lunch. Yikes.

I probably won't be back. It's a nice view, but I'd rather eat some truly exception food at those prices. This is San Francisco after all.
author: Travis V.

description: I made a reservation for my husband's birthday requesting a table on a patio. Having a table on a patio was a required condition of my reservation, otherwise we would go to a different restaurant . Reservation was made long time in advance before the actual date. When we arrived for the reservation, we had to stand in a crowded lobby for 10 minutes before the hostess informed us we need to wait 1 hour to get a table on their patio. They suggested us a table below a speaker with loud music. Very unprofessional and lousy service, especially if you plan special event.
author: Antonina T.

description: This is one of San Francisco's top restaurant experiences. We held a work dinner here and it's one of our new favs! The petrale sole was divine! You have to try the traditional empanadas in every savory and sweet flavor. The Pisco sours are smooth and pair nicely with the food. We trusted Christian to help guide our dining experience and he didn't disappoint. He is fantastic, spectacular, amaze-balls, and 5 stars. My team had a big crush on him!  We will be back!
author: S S.

description: So this review is just for their happy hour, which is amazing! The happy hour is just in the bar and once I finally beat out the other yuppies, was able to snag seats at the communal table. After three rounds of cocktails at only $7 each, I can safely say that I looooved the Volcan and Pisco Sour. The Volcan had a great kick to it. Service was fast and very friendly as well. If you're working nearby, this is a great happy hour spot!
author: Marissa F.

description:
What a great spot along the Embarcadero.  We started with pisco sours and  a delicious ceviche, super fresh salmon and avacado, perfect marinade.  The cone filled with homemade plantains and chips accompany the ceviches so well.  We shared the tuna salad and purple mashed potatoes topped with fresh crab and salmon roe.  All our dishes were so well presented and delicious.  

Service was very good.  Our table a a nice view of the bay.  Can't wait to come back, a great place to take out of town visitors.  Great ambiance.
author: Carole W.

description: Awesome Peruvian cuisine. Really delicious food. Service is also great. Try their purple potatoes!
author: U V.

description: A very nice fine dining Peruvian place right next to the ferry building in San Francisco. Went here with a few friends. You get a complimentary side of chips for the table. The staff are extremely polite.
author: Nitya K.

description: I stopped here for my last dinner while in town on business and was able to get a table for 1 at 6 on a Friday with no wait. Service was friendly and helpful. My waiter explained the menu, answered my questions and checked in just enough. I loved the chips instead of a traditional bread service. They offer several styles of cebiche and sampler plates to try several. The cebiche was so fresh and delicious. The sauce was just a bit spicy and nicely balanced with the tart lime juice. The toasted corn was a great addition of texture and flavor. Next came the empanadas. You get 2 per order, or you can get one of each type (4) as a sampler. Had I not been alone I would have definitely tried to share and try more flavors. As it was, the beef was tender and delicious with a subtle sweetness in the sauce. The pastry was great as well. I would have loved to try dessert but I was getting overfull. The drink was well made but too strong for me. When my waiter saw I didn't drink it, he said since I didn't like it he would take it off the bill. I argued that it was made fine but a personal dislike and so it wasn't necessary but he wouldn't hear it. So very nice. The atmosphere was nice and also casual. I will be back again, which is a big complement considering all the options available in San Francisco
author: Tammy H.

description:
It was a beautiful, sunny Sunday in San Francisco, so looking for something light, unique and on the water. La Mar Cebucheria fit perfectly. It has a beautiful space both inside and on the  back patio overlooking the bay. 

I tried the cebuche tasting with three Peruvian ceviches - 

Classico (with fresh halibut, habanero, red onion and corn) - had a kick! Really good

The Nikei (with ahi, red onion, cucumber, daikon avocado and nori - like a really good poke, possibly my favorite, although they were all so good.

And Mixto w/ Tombo tuna, shrimp, calamari and octopus, in rocoto leche de Tigre (an interesting orange colored sauce).

Add a glass of Spanish Albariño, and it was the perfect summer lunch. Managed to beat the lunch rush, and despite huge lines at the Ferry building, got right in here. Wish my husband was here to enjoy it - next time!
author: Amber E.

description: Beautiful restaurant, amazing food! My friend recommended it after having a work event here. We ordered the ceviche tasting, salmon nigiri, arroz con calamares, and pulpo entree. The ceviche has delicate flavors, and the octopus was seared to perfection. Highly recommend!
author: Catherine W.

description:
I've been here years back for the happy hour & shared plates of ceviche & empanadas, but today I decided to do lunch & we were able to sit in the outside back area. Heaters on, enclosed, but still had the views of the bay.
We did an appetizer special which was a little bit of everything and were told they were small bites but no that platter was HUGE! 
We really enjoyed the seared Ahi & Salmon nigiri most of all! 
I had the crab & pasta special, pricey because it was market priced but it was delicious, fresh, & light.
My boyfriend had the tuna burger, it was ground tuna, seared throughout. 
The plantain chips & dip on the house are really good to.
The dishes are pricey, but if you just come here & for the sampler of the ceviche & empanadas you won't be disappointed.
author: Nicole A.

description:
After a good lunch, I left my credit card at this establishment. I phoned the next day to verify that it was there. I was told it would be held in their safe. When I came to get the card, I was summarily told that it had been shredded. No one could explain when, why, or what happened to the shreds of my now-gone card. The woman at the front who took my CDL to use to look for my now-gone card had no explanation, no record of any attempt to contact me (I'd left my phone number). 
Unbelievable.
author: Karen L.

description:
OMG...best paella like dish I have ever had - Arroz Norteno was to die for. Most restaurants overlook their shrimp leaving them dry and rubbery. We foodies know that they weren't meant to be eaten like that. 

The shrimp combined with the perfectly cooked rice and seasoned with the most perfect savory blend. The shrimp were joined by succulent scallops and prawns. I will be back for that Fish even if I have to fly to San Francisco for dinner. 

We also sampled the Lomo Saltado - a traditional Peruvian dish including perfectly grilled thin sliced filet with onions, fries and bell peppers. It was delectable as well. 

Our meal started with plantains and a spicy cilantro crema. 

Since we didn't have reservations we sat in the bar, my preference anyways. Our waitress recommended a lovely Sauvignon Blanc to accompany my meal. Love this place.
author: Lisa G.

description: Joselino is the best bartender in the city!!! Ask him anything and will not only give you a tasty drink but the history of it. Ask him about pisco and make you a pisco drink. He will knock your socks off! Thanks man
author: Garrett P.

description: Very nice ambiance. Spacious place and warm service. The food was just fine. I gave it many chances​ but I haven't found​ anything​ really memorable on​ the menu.
author: Rosyan C.

description:
I am so thankful for this place.
I had been on a journey of looking for a good Peruvian food until I discovered La Mar.
I love that they use reeaally fresh ingredients and that they don't over-do the seasoning. 
I brought my cousin here who was visiting from Korea, and she still talks about this place, wanting to eat here again when she visits next time.
If you like seafood, you must give this place a try!
author: Hyemin J.

description:
If you have a passion for Peruvian food, visit La Mar at Pier 1.5. From celebrity chef Gastón Acurio, La Mar SF serves up Peruvian seafood as fresh and tasty as the original La Mar in Miraflores in Lima.

Complimentary plantain chips was delicious. Memorable drinks, including the pisco.

Although La Mar is known for cebiches, the highlight for me are the pulpo/octopus grilled to perfection, and the sous vide cooked beef cheeks (super tender). Char grilled beef hearts is another must order for the adventurous. 

Overall the dining experience at La Mar feels like a mini-getaway. It's a great restaurant for a casual or special occasion. 

The only complaint I have is that the front reception was unorganized and staff was inattentive and rude. There was a crowd of people standing around to be seated at 5:35pm and the hostesses just stood around totally oblivious. They "checked" everyone in to be seated, only to call out names again. Even with a reservation, my party of 2 waited 15 minutes before getting seated, and we arrived on time.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Chef change has really hurt La Mar. Wow, it looks like La Mar had had a rough December and January, from what I've just read from other yelpers, I have to agree. Mediocre  service, terrible paella, sediment filled wine small portions and very high prices all contributed to a bad dining experience. 

First, the restaurant was not nearly as busy as I expected for a 7 pm reservation. The recent poor reviews and dining experiences appear to have taken a toll on the restaurant. 

The service, which was never top notch was slow as usual. The cebeche Nikei was a bit bland, the Tigre de Leche sauce was less acidic and far more sweet than I remember or care for. 

My wife's Loma saltado was flavorful, tender. My Arroz la Mar, however, was inedible. It had so much salt that the dish was almost caustic on my tongue. The very small bay shrimp appeared to be frozen and tasted like it. The ratio of squid tenticle clusters to shellfish was about 6 to 1, like my paella was getting the left overs that could not be sold in other dishes. Not what I expect in a $35 rice dish. Capping off our evening, my last sip of granache was a full mouthful of black sediment.  Our bill came to $200 for two, it was always expensive, and we put up with it because the food was good and ambiance was nice. With the food having slipped so far, there is little left  to make me want to dine here.
author: Brad S.

description: Amazing! Highlight of my trip the food was phenomenal atmosphere stunning out looking the bay , the the ceviche was outstanding I had the trio would recommend you can try all three , the menu is a little pricey but food is worth it you won't leave dissatisfied!!
author: Cisco S.

description:
The prices have skyrocketed and the portions have gotten smaller. The food is good but not to the extent they price  it. 

We had the mixto ceviche, empanada sampler and a couple of beers. The ceviche is fresh, which is a plus. The empanadas were a bit dry but tasted okay. 

Given the totality of the visit, prices, portions and food quality, I have probably had my last meal here. Ridiculous pricing.
author: Sheryl M.

description:
Second time here with the coworkers for a holiday lunch.
I'd only recommend this place as a HH or small bites and drink kind of place.

The cocktails are amazing, definitely get those. I had a Japanese smash and it was perfect, not too sweet, great whiskey flavor. My coworker had a cocktail that tasted fantastic as well. 

Appetizers:
ceviche sampler- definitely a good one to share, better tasting than I remembered 4 years ago.
nikei causa- ahi tuna over some sweet potato, great presentation, tasty
limena causa- crab and avocado over yam I believe, also great flavor and pretty presentation.

I think this is where everything sort of went downhill, for a Tuesday, they were fairly busy, but our waitress took awhile to come back for our orders, so by the time we ordered our entrees, we felt the wait was extremely long. Then the entrees were lackluster.

arroz norteno- basically shrimp risotto almost. definitely get lots of shrimp, but the dish was one dimensional, all smushy and one flavor. Almost like a paella too...but meh.
lomo saltado- my coworker got this and now that I read some reviews, it's very true. super salty. we all had a taste of the beef, which was like FIVE pieces and the rest were potatoes. he actually had to send it back, and they were nice to comp it. 
jalea- fried seafood platter basically as well. nicely fried but you can get this anywhere. it would have been nice to get a dipping sauce or something with this dish. luckily he just asked for more of the sauce they give with the plaintains.

sooooo, definitely a place to impress dates and to take out clients if you aren't in a hurry and not hungry. I probably would not come back....except MAYBE for a drink...but then only during happy hour.
author: Christine M.

description:
Lunch with my nephews at La Mar. had Ceviche tasting sampler, the best one is the one on top, the other two was okay, not worth trying again. I had the fried seafood plate.  Completely not ordering this again........ the best part on this plate was avocado and the one piece of fried fish. This dish was crying out loud for some seasonings.....the jalapeños didn't have much heat, the orange sauce was useless gave no flavor to the dish. If someone who have just sprinkled some sea salt over the dish it would have done wonders and avoided me from wasting time writing this review. Don't plan on coming here again anytime soon.

Service was ok, took a bit of time for the waiter to come and ask me for drinks. 
I ask for ice water and received chilled water, guess they didn't have ice today.... hahaha!
author: Bobby W.

description: This used to be much better that what it has become. Service is really sub par. Food is still relatively good, but for the money I would go elsewhere.
author: Ed D.

description:
Location: right near the Ferry building with a full bar, indoor seating, and outdoor seating on the patio. Make a reservation to grab dinner by the water! 

Service: service is great - our water was always full, food came out quickly, and our waiter was really attentive.

Food:
-plantain/potato chips: free, crispy, and yummmmmy! the salsa that comes with it is also fantastic. 
-cebiche tasting: mixto was my favorite one, but they were all pretty delicious. I wish they would let you choose 3 of what you want (especially since the nikei was not very spectacular).
-beef empanadas: 2 per order, pretty pricey for the tiny portions. 
-lomo saltado: pretty salty, but delicious. I wish there was more meat for the whole dish.
-arroz la mar: yummy! packed with seafood.
author: Shelley K.

description:
I've been here for dinner before, but was unimpressed given the price/food quality. Decided to check out the 3-6p happy hour. The drinks are a pretty good deal at $6 for cocktails, wine or sangria. The pisco punch and pisco sour were tasty.  Beers are $4. The jaleita - fried mix of fish of the day and calamari ($9) was kinda soggy and disappointing and the yuqitas (fried yuca) $7 was so bland. I would not order either again. The quinoa burger was only $6, but it's slider size and was just meh. The best thing we got during happy hour foodwise was the cebiche (fish of the day) $9 during happy hour. It is a fairly smallish portion. 

Would come back for drinks and cebiche, but definitely not feeling any of the other food.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
Very nice place with the good food in a very touristy area. Took a couple of guest from out of state and abroad there for lunch and early dinner. Beautiful view and food to satisfy the picky tourists. ;)
Love the Cebiche Tasting plate and Nikei!
author: Vassilisa P.

description: Food here has gone down hill. Had our anniversary dinner here and food was deeply flawed. Ordered their ceviche sampler and the choices were either bland or too salty. Cool location on the pier but not much else.
author: Foodie V.

description: Wow this meal surpassed our expectations. We received our drinks and initial order fast.  The fusion between Peruvian and Japanese food is amazing. If you want something different with extreme amounts of flavor you need to come here ASAP!
author: Miguel P.

description: Amazing place!! I loved everything about this place! The food was amazing!! The prices were steep, but well worth it.  The lomo was the best lomo I ever had!
author: Drew S.

description: Came for restaurant week brunch service food was good,cocktails were great, prices were high. Had a steak with white bean purée what was just utterly incredible!!! I would return just for that purée!
author: Morgan S.

description: We started off with the cebiche clasico which uses the catch of the day. It was delicious and the fish tasted very fresh. The fish is actually cut into pretty big chunks, and there were a couple of yam pieces and nuts in there too. They gave us complimentary banana chips and potato chips which are house made I believe, along with a spicy green salsa. Also had the empanada sampler which includes all four on the menu - corn, mushroom, chicken, and beef. They were all amazing and bursting with flavor. They were nice and flaky, and my personal favorite was the corn! It was a sort of mashed texture inside and surprisingly very good. And of course we had to order the lomo saltado, which was excellent as well. The beef was tender, onions perfectly cooked, and the sauce just brought the whole dish together. It came with a small bowl of rice which we just shared. I'm very happy I got to try this place!
author: Jeana Y.

description: Delicious! The ambience definitely put me in a wonderful mood to eat. A great blend of Japanese and Peruvian cuisine. The portions are a little on the small side, but, you do get great cocktails, wine, and good food. Customer service is beyond superb. I could just hang in this restaurant and sip on tea or wine all day.
author: Tangible H.

description: We had 2 drinks, unlimited banana chips (complimentary), clasico ceviche, beef empanadas, grilled fish on a skewer and scallops with wild rice. Everydish except the grilled fish was fantastic. The grilled fish was on the grill for probably 45 secs more than it should be. We finished our meal with Tres Leches cake, simply perfect milk to cake ratio. Loved our meal, it is a bit pricey at 150$ total but good meals are worth the price.
author: Balu V.

description:
We were there this past Monday.  We have been there several times before and they were great experiences.  This past Monday was horrible.  We had the worst server, Raul.  He said no to everything we requested or asked about.  He looked at us like if we were insane for even asking a question or asking for something special. 

We were planning on having lunch but he made it so unpleasant for us that we just ordered the empanada sampler and wine.  The empanadas were great, as usual.  So instead of us spending lunch for 4 with all the trimmings we just had an appetized between the 4 of us.  He is a horrible waiter.
author: Emily G.

description:
Spacious restaurant with a view of the water--they have patio seating but you should probably make reservations for that.  We originally tried to eat at the Ferry Building but the wait for the restaurants there were 40 minutes + and it's super crowded in there!  So I definitely recommend eating here as it's nearby and there are lots of tables.

The food is not cheap.  We ordered one of the specials which was grilled tuna belly.  It came with a side of quinoa.  The tuna belly is said to feed 2-3 people, but it actually fed 4 adults and 1 toddler!  We also ordered the fried seafood appetizer, which had some fried potato, squid, fish, and shrimp, with fresh avocado.  They also give free plantain chips.  The tuna belly - o m g!  Grilled to perfection, not overcooked and very tender and moist!  Service was also excellent. :)
author: Miss Maggie C.

description: My terrific lunch was RUINED because management allowed this group to bring their large barking dog into the patio dining area.  I wanted to have a nice lunch with my wife overlooking the water, but no, this thoughtless group ruins my meal by bringing their badly behaved dog and get seated right next to me. I spend over 100 bucks for a terrible time.  Im glad people like dogs but i don't. Why is my right to privacy and enjoyment of a nice restaurant allowed to be infringed on by restaurant management that allow rude dog owners to subject their choice to bring a dog to a restaurant where people are eating. I complained to deaf ears of the manager on duty.  Guess i should have complained before paying the bill. The food and staff were wonderful otherwise. I hope owners/managers give greater consideration to their patrons comfort  in the future.
author: Philip L.

description: My review is based on our experience at the restaurant. It is not a reflection of the service we received. The food and service was great. Unfortunately, our night was ruined when an obnoxious patron on the table a few feet behind us came to our table and made some vulgar comments to me and my girlfriend. I informed the host on our way out. He apologized profusely.
author: Jade Y.

description:
Went here for happy hour with my co-workers on a Friday evening. Only had drinks and a bit of the chicken empanadas, since I'm probably a bit too poor to eat here (still a $$ guy). Nevertheless, this was a fancy locale with good food. Was a bit crowded, but we were probably to blame for that. 

For a non-alcoholic drink, I recommend the Chicha Morada (a classic Peruvian drink made from purple corn). Otherwise, the Pisco Sour and El Cholito are good choices as well. 

Happy Hour is from 3-6pm Monday to Saturday. Great views of the Western span of the Bay Bridge!

Rating Breakdown:
5=Great food and/or service
4=Good food
3=Meh
2=Not so good food/service
1=Terrible food and/or service
author: Felix T.

description: Love the empanadas at this place!  The moctails are good as well.  The atmosphere is authentic too.  Highly recommend!
author: Janet G.

description: Everything we ordered were exquisitely amazing. We had several tastings and none of them disappointed. The paella and trea leches were scrumptuous as well.
author: Jango L.

description: An unexpected treat. Right across from Hornblower docking station. This restaurant serves A+ Peruvian food. A must if you are walking down Embarcadero. I would definitely come back.
author: Omar M.

description: Great, food, drinks and service here. It's a very large restaurant so it's very spacious. Definitely a go-to date spot in SF.
author: Garrett S.

description:
No doubt this place is amazing, beautiful ambiance delicious food. The Octopus dish was fresh and cooked to perfection.  The tapas were so delicious. Everything we ordered was made with so much attention and care. The food presentation was so perfect,  just like out of a magazine. The stuff was wonderful. 


We will return.
author: Mary Kay K.

description:
This was my first time trying Peruvian food, and I immediately fell in love! I ordered mostly tasting dishes because I wanted to try as much as possible. The server was really kind to us and suggested a couple specials of the night: braised beef cheeks, grilled whole halibut, and steamed mussels. 

The complementary fried plantain chips were crunchy and although there was no distinctive or savory taste, the dip, which tasted similar to guacamole, provided most of the flavors. The chips served as a nice table side snack. 

Causa tasting (9/10)
The causa tasting caught my attention as soon as it was served on the table. I expected a lot of colors on the dish, and the presentation was definitely up there. I didn't try all three samples because the plate was almost empty by the time I had a chance to grab a bite. However, I enjoyed what was left for me. I tried the limeña. The whipped potatoes were creamy and mildly sweet, which complemented well with the fresh toppings. 

Ceviche tasting (7/10)
I was generally not impressed with their ceviche. Although I do love their different dressings, as they did not dominate the freshness and quality of the fish, each sample was generally consistent and bland. I wouldn't be willing to finish the whole dish. 

Steamed mussels (8/10)
Exceptional appetizer with appetizing presentation. Each mussel was huge and the portion was filling. The mussels were well cooked as they slipped off the shell immediately when lightly tapped by a fork. The meat was also cooked well and required no effort to chew. There were two slices of toasted bread to accompany the tomato purée. The bread was nice and crunchy while the tomato was not too acidic and tangy. I could eat straight from the skillet and finish it clean. 

Anticuchos tasting, added pulpo (8.5/10) 
The tasting came with beef, chicken, and fish. We added octopus, and I am so glad we did. I did not try the beef, but I was able to try everything else. The chicken was tender and absolutely juicy. The fish, which I can almost confidently identify as halibut, was cooked well with a faint trace of pink in the middle. I had no trouble cutting the fish chunk off the skewer with just a fork because it slid right off. The octopus, which came as just a grilled leg, was cooked and seasoned to perfection. It was not overdone to taste rubbery. The peppery seasoning provided a smokey taste after grilled. I feel like the dish would still be outstanding even without the drizzled sauce because each meat had their own distinctive freshness and flavor.

Lomo saltado (10/10)
I have never had Peruvian food, so I can't compare this traditional dish to other restaurants or even local Peru food stands. But I can guarantee that this will probably be one of the best beef you can get at this price. The portion was good and had a satisfying amount of beef. Each beef piece was juicy and soaked with flavorful seasoning. I never really liked beef and would opt for seafood over beef anyday, but this dish blew me away. 

Grilled whole halibut (9/10)
I loved and hated how they took the fish head off the plate. Loved because it's easier to take a good shot without the dead eyes staring at you. Hated because I love the meat around the cheeks. The meat was tender and moist and slid right off the bones. The whole fish was accompanied by a house dressed salad and wok-fried quinoa. The salad was refreshing and balanced the lightly salted fish. The quinoa reminded me of my grandma's fried rice; I loved it. 

For dessert, we had choco-maracuya, el mousse de chocolate, and maiz morado. 

Choco-maracuya (8/10)
I figured any dessert with passion fruit and chocolate would be wonderful as the sour compote balances the heavy chocolate. You can't really go wrong with it, as long as this two main components are present. The two layers of mousse (passion fruit and chocolate) were smooth and worked in harmony when eaten together. The passion fruit stood out more than the chocolate as it had a dense creamy flavor. The outside chocolate rim and praline added a nice contrasting texture to the mousse. As expected, the dessert was similar to most passion fruit chocolate cakes in other patisseries. 

El mousse de chocolate (7/10)
I generally avoid chocolate desserts as they tend to be too sweet for me. This dish was an exception. The chocolate mousse was mildly bittersweet. The caramelized quinoa added a nice contrasting crunch to the silky smooth mousse. However, I gave it a 7/10 because it's too sweet and heavy for me to finish the whole plate. 

Maiz morado (9/10) 
I loved the irish coffee ice cream. While each component on the plate shared a mild and similar flavor, the whole dessert had a powerful kick to end off the evening. 

The service was great and would definitely come back again to try their empanadas.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Came here for a bday dinner.
1- the food was excellent
2- the desert was better than the food
3- the wine was just ok
4- the Pisco sour was ok
5- the service was annoying. The staff would come to the table every 2 minutes to c if we r done. Then another staff would come to check the same thing. It was a Thursday nite, and the restaurant was not full or had a wait line. Stop harassing people as they r enjoying their dinner. 

Not coming back, unfortunate to say.
author: Mary N.

description:
My favorite Peruvian restaurant in the city, bar none!
