description: Service was very bad. Had to wait 30 minutes after eating for the waiter to come clear the tables. And it took them another 15 minutes to process my payment.
author: Hari K.

description: Wonderful experience. Food is absolutely delicious. Started with the empanada sample -- which was a fabulous way to try each flavor. Took the scallops as my main. So flavorful with coconut and black beans. And then dessert -- a must!
author: Annmarie N.

description: Wow!!! Tastebud treat!!! My first time eating Peruvian ceviche!!! We ordered the sampler and it blew us away!!! So delectable and delicious!!! I ordered the fried rice and it had an omelet over the top! The cocktail menu is extensive! The outside seating is beautiful! My second favorite place to eat in San Fran!!!!
author: Shannon B.

description:
The empanada sampler (4 different ones!) was a delicious start to something that I normally would have wrinkled my face to and said "eww, gross."  So I followed that up with some cebiche (yes, they spell it with a B) which turned out to be "cooked" in the acid from the juices in which it came.  Everything was shared, so my entree was a skewer which was very well seasoned.  

I'd come back.
author: David B.

description: Each robot you may encounter who works here is less friendly and more rude than the last.  Seriously bad attitudes. Watch out for the unpleasant blue hair at the front and the fake nice actually nasty French accented server.  Avoid, and try Slanted Door nearby instead.
author: Ethan H.

description:
Absolutely love this place! Pisco Sour and Inca Kola are two drinking musts, though only the first one has alcohol.

Appetizer: Ceviche.

Entre: Lomo Saltado!! Ask for extra aji if you like it spicy.

Happy Hour is a great time to come after work for smaller plates.

**Call ahead to make reservations for large parties.
author: Natalie D.

description: I have never had Peruvian food before, and I don't know what I was doing with my life until now, but this was so so good. The food was amazing, I haven't tasted flavors like this before! I'm so happy they had enough vegetarian options.The restaurant is beautiful too, seeing the bay bridge all lit up at night was so cute and pretty. Portions are pretty decent, but I ordered a lot and still ate everything, so maybe it depends on your mood. But it will be expensive. I did not like our server though. He was just really pushy and rude and that bothered me a lot. Even the people at the front desk were kind of rude, but the food was so good I want to give this 5 stars instead of 4. Will update my review though if I go back and have to deal with mean people again because that's not fun and no one wants to eat dinner and be sad.
author: Megha M.

description:
I like this place a lot. 
Food is delicious. Cocktails are well made. 
The view of the Bay makes the experience much more pleasant. 
I would recommend this place for romantic dinner. 
Last time I've at the white sand party so I liked it even more. 
Dancing on the pier feels so good.
author: Natalie D.

description: Great place to meet friends and family for good food and cocktails. It's at Pier 1 1/2 In San Francisco, right by the Ferry Building. We parked at a lot right across the street for $25. The food was delicious but pricier than average Peruvian restaurants but the ambience is great, it's right on the water and you can tell they try to do more with each dish. The beef in the lomo saltado was very tender, ceviche was fresh, Dungeness crab over purple potatoes was delightful, prawns over rice made for a pretty tasty paella. We ordered 2 desserts and they were just ok. But the cocktails made up for it. The prickly pear margarita was the favorite at our table. Reservations are highly recommended and outside seating is ideal. We're already planning to come back on our next get together!
author: Trish V.

description:
This is a review of the bar. Amazing place for happy hour fun times, open every day even on July 4, for $6 wine and $7 cocktails. Delicious empanadas at $6 and mini quinoa burgers for $8 and the staff are super friendly and made special gluten free options for my friend. 
Drinks are strong but don't taste like it, Cosy design which always manages to seat you, a hidden treasure in peak touristville.
author: Zara S.

description: Update: My office had our holiday party here last night. It was amazing! The food was outstanding, much better than any other holiday party food I've had (and I've been going to these at various restaurants around SF for 10 plus years). The staff was super friendly and kept coming around offering us delicious appetizers, pisco sours, and wine. Dinner was served buffet style-various salads, a salmon dish, chicken, and steak.The outdoor area was awesome. They had heat lamps set up so it was totally warm enough even though it was a cold night and I was wearing a cocktail dress. It was a great time, and probably the best venue I've been to yet for a holiday party.
author: Jenny R.

description: Excellent device, cooked food very good too.  Particularly liked the fried fish of the day...nit greasy
author: steve r.

description: This is an interesting restaurant, because the type is Peruvian but it is more like Asian, they even have the Korean stone bowl rice.  I came here twice and had the salmon and beef entrees, I like the taste which I can give 4 star, but I can only give 2.5 star for the portion(too small), i would give the view and location 5 star, so overall is 4 star.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
5 stars for the decor-ambiance-location, 4-5 for the food, 4-5 for the service.
This place is terrific and if you're a fan of seafood and cilantro, this is your place.  Ceviche of all kinds, beautifully presented in wine glasses on platters. The best quinoa salad, perfectly seasoned.  
I recommend getting lots of plates and empanadas and gorging on tons of different things.  Share and care and order two plates per person, roughly, to get a good portion.  This is one of those places you can take time and have fun.
author: Dina F.

description: Amazing food. Everything we had was divine. We orders empanadas and had one be the corn one and the other chicken. Both were incredible. We had this causa or something like that that was a potato thing with crab on it and it was stinking amazing! Got this squid ink rice tuna sushi thing too and that was mind blowing. Can't go wrong in a place like this!
author: Megan H.

description: 2 drinks... 1 appetizer...2...entrees..$200. Totally not worth it. I am from Chicago and can appreciate an upscale restaurant but the food actually needs to match the price. The ceviche was excellent but everything else was just good/ok. And come on with that kind of pricing they can make a bathroom that you don't have to wait in line for by the entrance. Overall ambiance was good but the service was was not.
author: Danny D.

description:
This place was yummy! Not wanting to brave the line at Hog Island during noon on a Saturday, we found this place on Yelp and there was no wait! It was 90 degrees in SF that day but sitting outside in the shade near the water was great! This place is quite pricey but I think the quality of the food was phenomenal.
We first got complimentary chips (I believe a mix of potatoes and plantains) served with a yummy aioli sauce. We ordered an ahi tuna salad for a starter to share. For entrees my family ordered the special of the day which was a halibut ($49) that our waiter said was enough for two people. I also ordered the pulpo (octopus) anticucho as my entree. It was so good and the sauces were not only pretty but delicious! The ahi tuna salad had a decent portion. The halibut was worth the price and nearly the entire fish aside from the head was served! It was served on a wooden board and deboned in front of us. I really wanted to try the raw sampler that was $69 but it was a little too expensive. Maybe I'll try it another time. The fish was well cooked and didn't have any weird fishiness to it (weird, I know, but bad fish tastes bad! The cocktails look beautiful here, will try next time! Beautiful views of the pier, great food, what's not to love?
author: Sarina J.

description:
I've paid two visits to La Mar in the past month, and am definitely intending to be back again in the near future - service, food, and wine selection were great. 

I tried both the classic and mixto ceviches, and both were appetizing and refreshing. Came really close to the ceviche I had at La Nautica Rosa in Peru, which was by far the best I've had so far.

Got the limeña causa on both visits because I loved it that much - oh my, the combination of the mash, fresh crab, roe, avocado, tomato...all those different textures, and flavors were divine put together. Ordered the pasta criollo, wasn't a big fan because I thought the flavor of the herbs (cilantro?) was overpowering. But the seafood in the pasta was beautiful - smokey flavor, tender, and juicy. Chaufa aeropuerto was a little too savory for me, but was still good. The lomo saltado was disappointing however, even though it was recommended by our server. Too much soy sauce/salt, and the beef tenderloin strips were far from tender...too dry! Potatoes sitting in the gravy kind of tasted like they'd been sitting in a salt brine, which was pretty awful.

Still giving La Mar 4 stars though, because of the wonderful ceviche, good service, good mains (most of them), and great wines. Tip: don't skip on the dessert wines, because they are really good!
author: Phoebe L.

description:
Went here for a drink with my girl friend and was really happy! The vibe is pretty cool and the service is pretty quick. My friend for a Pisco sour and I got prosecco! 

You can't go wrong with prosecco. However the Pisco sour was delicious (I thought it had too much froth or the egg whites but that's just me being a perfectionist) 

Overall good service, ambiance and drinks! I haven't tried the food here! Will definitely update  my review after trying out their food!
author: Darshana S.

description:
I would say this place is more like a 4.5 stars. 
I have now been here twice and I have not had a single dish I didn't think was amazing. My favorite of the chiviches is the mixto. The empanadas are also great. We also tried the veggie quinoa and it was surprisingly SO yummy. I would recommend coming with a small group and ordering a bunch of things to share. The cocktails are also all delicious and I love that they carry Peruvian beer! The only thing keeping this restaurant from a 5 star for me is the service is on the slow side and the prices are a little steep as well. Well worth it but maybe save it for special occasions.
author: Emily S.

description:
Absolutely delicious. The three of us came here on a Friday night and didn't have to wait at all (not sure if that's common since some other places had 40-minute waits). We had an awkward table that was a bit secluded from the rest of the place, but still got good service. 

Got the scallop, mussels and the ahi tuna. Scallops were perfect - I'd recommend. Well cooked and soft, good flavors that didn't feel too strong. The portions seem small but very filling. They also give you plantain (&potato) chips as wait food, which I thought were really good.
author: Juliana P.

description: This is my favorite pervian restaurant of all time. Some of the best food in San Francisco with amazing service. Moses was our server and he was so personable and recommended the best ceviche dishes, wine and dessert. Highly recommend to anyone who wants an amazing culinary experience!
author: Nate B.

description:
My boyfriend picked out this restaurant from an article called "Restaurants with a view" lol. 

We had to wait about 30 minutes to get seated because we didn't have a reservation. We hung out at the bar and ordered drinks. I got the maracuya sour and my boyfriend got the pisco sour. Mine was so much better. We got plantain & potato chips to snack on while we waited--- BOMB!

Finally got seated out in their patio with heated lamps.

They gave us more of the chips. YUM! We were full even before our entrees came out. I couldn't stop munching on them! My boyfriend got another drink, capitan. It was ...meh. Too cinnamon-y for my taste. 

We ordered power cebiche for appetizers. It was my first time trying ceviche and it passed the test in my book! It had scallops, shrimp, and crabmeat. The waiter said it was spicy, but there was not one hint of spice in there, which is perfectly fine with me.

For entrees, I ordered the pasta criolla. It had shrimp and scallops (can you tell I like scallops?!). The sauce wasn't too heavy. There were only three pieces of scallops, but whatever, I made it work. My boyfriend ordered churrasco a lo pobre- beef tenderloin, egg, and some other stuff doused in some sort of onion sauce. He devoured it all... I think it's safe to assume that it was pretty damn good. Our waiter lured me into getting tres leches for dessert. I have theeee biggest sweet tooth ever. It was PERFECT! The strawberries and blueberries were soooo sweet. Perfect way to end our meal.

I thought our waiter took a bit too long attending to our needs, BUT I did like all the recommendations he made. He was very knowledgeable, really outgoing, and really really busy. The other guys were pretty quick with refilling our waters. I especially liked the guy that kept giving us more of the chips haha! Overall, a great experience.
author: Steffi G.

description: I stopped by La Mar last night for a drink with my wife around 9:30pm. We approached the bartender (Miguel M) and asked for a Pisco Sour. Right away, he told us that the best pisco sours were done at the other bar located in front of La Mar.  Obviously, Manuel didn't want to make any pisco sours for us. The issue is that we didn't like the other bar and we just wanted to have one drink. We decided to stay even though Manuel didn't welcome us. So we ordered two pisco sours. He was obviously not very happy about this and in no time he had two pisco sours in front of us. I asked him if he had used a cocktail shaker and he said no. I was very surprised to hear this because I know the best pisco sours are done in a cocktail shaker. Anyway, we didn't say anything, we had the mediocre pisco sour, paid and drove home were we made our own pisco sour. A friend who used to work at Chez Panisse in Berkeley has been telling me for the longest time that La Mar was way overrated for food and drinks. He was right, so my suggestion for anyone who want to avoid Manuel, the mediocre service and not so good food is to go to SIDEBAR in Oakland for the best pisco sours in the Bay Area and to PUCQUIO also in Oakland for a great Peruvian meal.
author: Hector S.

description:
Nice, chic place to take visitors. Nice views and very clean and messenger looking. It's s place to be seen. 

The food is not bad. I recall liking their appetizers. 

The bar is pretty nice if you just want to grab a drink.
author: Lucky N.

description: Excellent ingredients, excellent care in cooking. Ambition and a great mood. Lovely staff. The food was too sweet and soft, the presentation is a little precious.
author: Sierra S.

description: Beautiful good display and great view. Food is very delicious. Service is a bit slow but you should definitely take time to enjoy it there.
author: Jason W.

description:
Pros:
- Great ambience & service. Very classy fare in a rather touristy area.
- Wide array of seafood options, with their cebiche being a speciality
Cons
- On the pricier side and portions are small
- Very limited vegetarian options...and they aren't very filling. 

Tip: make a reservation in advance...otherwise a 30-40 minute wait!
author: Abhi M.

description:
I have never loved this place for some reason. I mean, it's good, but honestly not as good as other Peruvian restaurants. Especially considering the price to food quality ratio, you're really just paying extra to dine at a nice location on the Embarcadero. A good friend of mine used to work here, and even then I preferred to fulfill my Peruvian cravings elsewhere. When I met my bf and he said La Mar was his favorite restaurant, I was like grrrreat I guess I have no choice but to get over-acquainted with this place.

Their best dishes-- the cebiches. Cebiche clasico and cebiche mixto are the two that you see at most other restaurants, and La Mar does it well. I also really like the cebiche nikei, not just because Asian fusion is sort of my thang but also because Peru is such a melting pot of different cultures and it's great to see a restaurant exemplify that. The tuna is a nice contrast to the other cebiches they offer. They recently added a couple of new cebiches to the menu, and I was able to try the cebiche power in the chef's choice sampler. I was excited to to see a cebiche feature scallops, oysters, and Dungeness crab. It was good, but nothing spectacular and sounded better on paper. Honestly though, my favorite ceviches are at Lolinda... shhhh.....

Bf likes to get jalea. It's fried seafood, so not my thing but gringo thinks it's good. One of my favorite dishes amongst all types of food is LOMO SALTADO. Slices of filet mignon sautéed with onions, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic and soy sauce on a bed of french fries. It's so simple yet so delicious... just not at La Mar. It is at most average. I am repeatedly disappointed by the dish itself as well as paying $30+ for it when you can find it better and for half that price pretty much everywhere. My favorite lomo saltado is at Limon... shhhh.....

I do, however, like their happy hour because the drinks are always solid. Pisco Sours are my drink of choice and I can down them the entire 3-6pm duration. Bf gets the caipirinha, and they do a good job at those too. Plantain chips used to be a given, but these past few times we've had to ask (once we even played along that we were special and no one else could have any). The sauces with it are solid as well.

Other thoughts on dishes:
-Limeña causa - pretty much potato salad + mayo crab
-Corazon anticucho - good charred flavor, but a bit chewy and could be more tender
-Pulpo - the only thing that doesn't disappoint me besides the cebiches
-Plancha marina - very tasty but IMO not worth $36

I expected a lot more from a restaurant by Gaston Acurio, the chef who's famously credited for putting Peruvian cuisine on the map. Unfortunately, La Mar is only worth stopping by for small bites and drinks. It's really not the best, though they certainly charge like they are.
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description: On my go to foodie list in San Fran! Food! Service! View! Drinks! ....did I say Drinks. Lol so enjoyed our experience we ate both lunch and dinner in one day !!! The service is like clockwork! The fresh fish is amazing and the variety is amazing!
author: John W.

description:
Delicious and beautiful food! I came right when they opened on a Thursday evening - thankfully we had reservations, because they were packed! I tried a bunch of things, and everything was fantastic. Some highlights: the purple corn drink (nonalcoholic; basically like a spiced cider); the ceviche, empanada, and causa samplers (try a bit of everything!). The causas in particular were just beautiful (basically the fanciest mashed potatoes you can imagine, though that description really doesn't do them justice). I was pleasantly surprised by the nuttiness in the quinoa salad (I was just going to have a taste, but then I kept going back for more!), and I loved the giant corn kernels that came sprinkled around most dishes. 

For dessert, I had a fruity, mascarpone-based thing with a scoop of THE most amazing coffee ice cream. 

I'd definitely come back!
author: Liz F.

description: The meal was excellent. Staff is great, he watched all the little things, he even quickly got to his feet and made sure that everything is to his liking. Very nice views and atmosphere. I will definitely be back for lunch soon.
author: Alden S.

description: Received push back from hostess to be seated at a table of 4 as a party of 2 at an early hour and for a special occasion. A series of terrible service interactions should have been enough to leave but I had been looking forward to dining here for my birthday. Manager was unapologetic after we pointed out ten table of two were seated at their table of choice on first ask. Food okay and service spotty at best. When we went to speak to the hostess about our experience she was rude, walked away in mid conversation and manager curt and condescending. Save your dollars and dine elsewhere where they appreciate customers and do not speak of policies.
author: M. L.

description: La Mar has been and continues to be one of my favorite restaurants! I was in the area recently and decided to give their happy hour a try and was not disappointed! So good! My only wish is that they add more of their fabulous ceviches to the happy hour menu! The empanadas are the best! Great cocktails, too!
author: Sheila K.

description:
The service in the bar area was superb!  The waitress checked on us several times and also responded to our needs quickly.  The food was good.  We ordered several dishes to share:
Cebiche Clasico - very tasty
Empanada Sampler - good
Anticucho Sampler - good

Not overwhelming with flavors, but overall good, especially in the bar area where we took advantage of the happy hour drinks.  

We will come back again to dine in the dining area where the views are stunning!
author: Nancy C.

description: I had their causa limeña and it was absolutely the best meal I have ever eaten. Tangy and flavorful! Portions are a little on the small side and meals are expensive, but with ingredients like quail eggs and salmon caviar, you get what you pay for!
author: Keepme A.

description:
Last night of our holiday - what a way to finish!

Came here off the back of a recommendation from a taxi driver of all people and we were so glad we did. My friend and I had never tried Peruvian food until this visit and were a little unsure of what to expect... however, hugely delighted in the flavour sensations. Every mouthful we experienced a different flavour and texture. 

MAINS
My friend had the Salmon la mar and I requested the Quinoa chaufa with seafood, but kindly asked the waiter if this could be done without squid or clams, which wasn't a problem. Both mains were absolutely incredible and by far one of the best meals i have personally ever experienced. 

DESSERTS
My friend had the passion fruit and chocolate mousse and I had the chocolate version. 

We left feeling extremely satisfied and delighted with our first ever experience of such amazing food. 

Mid range price wise but well worth it and great portion sizes. Highly recommend. Thanks again.
author: Danielle L.

description: Our server was nice, but he was serving outside and we were inside. He just did not have time to serve our table. For the price of the food the service should be good. Never brought the chips & Salsa he said he would bring. Some of the food was over salty. Had a Cucumber Spritz that tasted like lime and soda. By the time we got him to come back to the table we just wanted to leave. It was disappointing.
author: Bernie B.

description: This is a great place to eat in the city! The view is beautiful and the services is fantastic. Food is delicious. The Tiraditos, Ceviches, empanadas, and lomo saltado are amazing!
author: Claudia O.

description:
Peruvian cuisine with a Japanese twist :)
Great drinks too.
On a good day- ask to be seated outside. It's magical.
author: Deepika D.

description:
Man, I love Peruvian food and was very excited to try this place, however I think I had really high expectations for this place that only met it sub-parly.  Flavors were good but not spectacular, especially for the price you pay. 

FREE PLANTAIN CHIPS W/ 2 SAUCES - 5 stars. I was addicted to these! Both sauces were delicious and the chips were a great supplement for our other appetizers. 

CEVICHE CLASSICO - 3.5 stars. Classic ceviche dish. Many yelpers said it was their favorite of the ceviches. It was good, right amount of sour and fresh. Good appetizer, though not sure if I would order it again, especially because $20. 

CAUSA LIMENA - 3 stars. Dungeness crab, avocado, and potatoes. It was a very creamy and good dish, but I would've wanted a kick or some texture added to give it that "wow" factor. I actually used the plantain chips they provided to add it myself. 

CAU CAU, SEARED SCALLOPS - 3.5 stars.  The scallops were seared nicely, though I think it could've gone cooked for an additional 30 seconds (I like my scallops a little more seared). They were over Aji Amarillo, peeled wheat (rice) and potato stew with turmeric and mint. This tasted very healthy, which is supposed to be good, but if the dish is going to be $30, I want it to taste amazing, rich, bomb, etc. as an unforgettable dish. However, I have to say it was good, but not spectacular. 

ARROZ LA MAR - 3.5 stars. I only had a bite of this, and it's the same theme throughout the dinner. Good, but not spectacular or worth the price. 

MARACUYA SOUR - 5 stars. Delicious! Sweeter version of Pisco sour, since it is just Pisco sour with passion fruit. Yum, I would get this drink again. Dinner price it's $12 when I believe it's only $6 for HH. 

ATMOSPHERE/DECOR - 4.5 stars. I must say though, this restaurant is beautiful! The bar especially impressed me. The restaurant is also huge. There's a HH area, lounge, sushi bar area, dining area, and outside patio that overlooks the bridge. Great for groups! 

SERVICE - 2.5 stars. Our server was very nice and knowledgeable, which is good, but a great server will know how to balance providing excellent service without being overbearing.  Our server was a bit overbearing and talked too much, which kind of interferes our experience a bit. You don't want the server to take over the dining experience. 

OVERALL - beautiful restaurant, nice view, good food and drinks, but too pricey with overbearing service. I didn't think the price was worth the taste and quality of the food, but I guess any restaurant on the Pier would be pricey. If I were to come back, it would be preferably for HH when expectations are lower.
author: Raquel Y.

description:
We wanted to try something different and are very happy we ate here.

I am not familiar with Peruvian food but everything we tried was very fresh and flavorful.  Cocktails were also really yummy.  So everyone had two instead of wine.

We started with the four empanadas on the sampler and then had 3 different ceviches.  Power, and two others.  They were fabulous.  A wonderful blend of fresh  flavors with balance.  Nothing was over seasoned.  Just really nice

For hot food we ordered four more empanadas, the pork belly and short ribs. Not as exciting as the ceviche, but good.

We were too stuffed for dessert or coffee.

We will definitely return.  Not inexpensive--over $300 for four including tax and tip, but a really nice meal in a beautiful setting with good service
author: Joanna S.

description: The service & ambience were amazing! We started with pisco sours, which were a little too sweet but still very good, then the cebiche tasting & tuna causa. Every bite was delicious! The only down side was the lomo saltado. The meat was too fatty & made for a very chewy experience. Not impressed with essentially a $37 plate of fatty meat & soggy french fries. The sauce had good flavor though & the rice was cooked perfectly. All the anticuchos were delicious! Would go again for wine & cebiche. The peruvian sav blanc was a great pairing.
author: Tara B.

description:
Really good, unique ceviches and nice outdoor patio area. Come here on a sunny day for an early dinner and don't leave without ordering their spicy cocktail. I forget the name of it but its fizzy and has jalapeno's in it, very tasty. 

I also recommend their happy hour, get there early though because this place gets crowded! The happy hour calamari is awesome.
author: Sheena N.

description: Overpriced for the food and service. I definitely would skip this if you are interested in trying great and genuine Peruvian food as this food is okay and the price is outrageously over priced for the Peruvian food quality. Service was slow and sever was not attentive in the capacity of having to wait too long to order with less than 15% the room filled. I would not come back.
author: Daniela V.

description:
Came on Friday night, which was super busy, so I recommend getting reservations if you can

SERVICE: the menu was pretty confusing as there are a lot of options, but our waiter was patient w/ our various questions. He was also honest w/ his recommendations,which is hard to find since no one wants to say what's good/not very good on their menu. When it came time to our entrees being served, he took the time to explain every detail of our plates & how to enjoy it best. He never stopped smiling & making us feel welcomed. This is what makes a dining experience - 5 stars. Now on to the food..

FRIED PLANTAINS - complimentary & probably the most addicting, delicious fried plantains ever, so don't overstuff yourselves on these b/c they're that good
 
CALIFORNIA CEBICHE (wild salmon, shrimps, avocado in creamy aji amarillo leche de tigre) - fish was fresh; leche de tigre was pretty spicy, but it added a nice kick. Creamier than traditional cebiches, but delicious nonethless. Recommend getting any of the cebiches as a refreshing starter

ANTICUCHO PULPO (octopus grilled skewer, potato, garlic, olive aioli, & piquillo pepper) - our waiter informed us that this is a Spanish octopus, so it has a larger leg than the Asian baby legs. The spanish octopus was absolutely amazing, grilled perfectly &almost tasted like a steak. Get this, & if you don't like fish, this really doesn't taste like one as it has a meatier taste to it, so get it!

EMPANADA SAMPLER (shrimp, beef, chicken, mushroom) - if you're not sure which one to get, the sampler is the way to go! The fillings in each were so tender and flavorful, and the sauces that went w/them was minimal but perfect. The crust was perfectly crispy on the ends yet soft & flaky on the inside

PERNIL CROCANTE (crispy skin pork hind shank, peruvian corn pudding, adobo w/ wheat & mint salad) - i'm not a big pork eater, but this meal made me a pork lover. The skin was perfectly crisp, not overcooked as the skin can get hard and impossible to chew, but they cooked it just right. The meat was  tender & braised to perfection,& w/ the peach adobo sauce, matchmade in heaven. The sides w/ the corn pudding, wheat & mint salad was a nice balance & refresher from the saltiness of the pork

EL MOUSSE DE CHOCOLATE (peruvian choco mousse, caramelized quinoa meringue & lucuma ice cream) - never had any dessert like this. The caramelized quinoa was surprisingly really good, which tasted like cocoa rice krispy. W/ the choco mousse & ice cream, it complimented each other really well. Not a heavy dessert either, so that was great

Overall, awesome awesome experience. I highly recommend checking this place out! Dine out, splurge, & enjoy w/ good company. Can't wait to come back here again & try out their new menu
author: Trina N.

description:
I have been wanting to come to La Mar for five years and it did not disappoint. The restaurant is beautiful, spacious, and perfect for our large party of 8. Since our table was not ready for 20 minutes and it took another 15 to get menus everyone was extremely hungry. We ordered empanada sampler, cebiche la mar, cebiche power, lomo saltado, anticuchos de pollo to share and we all chose an entree. I do not remember all of the entrees, but they included pasta criolla, plancha marina, BBQ chicharron, arroz la mar, short ribs, and squid ink pasta. 

I loved that we were given plantain, sweet potato, and potato chips to munch on before our dishes arrived. I really enjoyed the cebiche, which were not overly sour. The meat and seafood were cooked well and flavor were not overpowering. 

Entrees are a decent size but the cebiches and appetizers are small. La Mar would be a great date location but I would opt to go in a group so you can try a little bit of everything.

What I recommend:
- cebiche la mar
- empanadas
author: Andrew W.

description:
I hate to write this.  My husband and I have been here many times before.  We even brought friends from out of town here.  The last two times we came the service was terrible.  

Maybe it's partially our fault for thinking we can walk in and get seated at the counter and actually get served.  Last time, we were patient and waited for what felt like an hour before we were acknowledged.  Then the server forgot our drink order.

This time, we really wanted to visit La Mar for the last time before we move out of San Francisco.  We dropped in expecting to possibly wait or sit at the bar.  We were immediately offered counter seating and we took it, despite having a bad experience last time.  Firstly, it seems as if the restaurant did not have enough menus to go around.  Our host (who was VERY nice) had to find menus for us.  We then waited about 5 minutes for water.  Chips and dip were dropped off.  About 2 minutes later, a gentleman came by and asked if he could have our menus, as other people needed them.  Mind you, we still had not met our server.  15 minutes later and we still didn't have our drink order taken.  

We left.  We got up and walked out, which is something we never do.  Upon walking out I felt that we should let someone know, and we told the hosts know that we were leaving and told them why.  They were apologetic.  But seemed liked they could care less, almost as if it was our problem.  

Unfortunately, I would not be able to recommend La Mar to anyone.
author: Meaghan P.

description: Excellent service, fresh ingredients and delicious food. The cebiches (halibut) and steak were delightful. One of my new favorites in SF!
author: Stephen A.

description: Absolutely delicious! Great service, beautiful atmosphere, and overall wonderful experience. I recommend this restaurant to any new visitor!
author: Erika R.

description:
There are a few La Mar (or Le Mar) restaurants throughout the world. I've been to the ones in Lima, Miami, and San Francisco. As you may guess, it's one of my favorite restaurants. I typically have a ceviche dish and a causca dish. For drinks, I suggest a pisco sour - 2 may be one too many. 

The food is fresh and full of flavor. The staff is attentive and helpful. If you haven't been before, I highly recommend that you try this restaurant.
author: Mark C.

description:
Situated in the heart of the Embarcadero I've walked by this restaurant too many times to count over the years, our group decided we should try this on a Saturday evening, well that and it was literally impossible to find a table that could accommodate us(even a week in advance).

My expectations were relatively high given the reviews and a little word of mouth.
I started off trying their famous Pisco Sour drink and wasn't impressed. I've had much better at Speakeasys throughout the Bay Area. The decor and ambiance were top notch however, so I was still hopeful the food would be near dazzling.

We shared the Cebiche La Mar(Mixto), Pulpo(Octopus), and the Arroz Negro(grilled calamari and shrimp) and unfortunately, none were memorable. The Cebiche La Mar was  pleasing but not worth the price of admission.

In the end, this Peruvian restaurant wasn't memorable enough for me to warrant another visit.
author: Dennis W.

description:
We are here after being turned away due to lack of reservation one night. We were successful the following night. My recommendation is if you plan on eating here on a Friday night make reservations it's very busy and what looks like popular. 

Our server was nice and very observant. I dropped my purse she noticed and picked it up. I needed a new fork and she looked at me and said what can I get you. She was quick with drinks and food service. 

We ordered an appetizer that had crab meat with potatoes.... Very delicious. My husband had the halibut it was good. Pisco punch is amazing (2 and done). 

I orders the cebiche with salmon and shrimp. I thought it would be a little more cooked than it was. The waitress noticed I was not a fan and had them take it off the tab and then gave us two deserts. Very awesome. 

Like other reviewers have mentioned bathrooms are not  the greatest but it is sf and that what I expect.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Had a sunny enjoyable Friday lunch at La Mar. Overall, great place for a variety of ceviche, drinks and tasty desserts.

Food - 4.5 stars. I really loved the variety of ceviche. I ordered the sampler and enjoyed 2 of the 3. I didn't really care for the tuna flavoring but its a personal preference. I tried the chicken empinadas and while some really enjoy flaky crust, I really enjoyed their more doughy type crust. For dessert I tried the queso helado. Delicious. I was sharing with coworkers but could have had a bowl to myself.

Drinks - 4 stars. I had the day on the bay weekly special. Its a pretty cocktail but a bit on the sweet side. If I ordered again, I think I'd have less St Germaine.

Service - 3-4 stars. Our servers were really patient with our many requests and reservation change. However, service was a bit slow and the server got one of the orders completely wrong. It was a slight embarrassing mix-up as the server helped my colleague order their dish and then delivered something completely different.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Have been to this place probably 4 or 5 times already.

All the food I had there was fantastic! The space is really nice and super large so good for big groups. In a nice day ask to be seated in the patio on the back. If you just want drinks they also have a great bar in the front with amazing Piscos (Peruvian traditional drink) - my favorite one is the Maracuja Pisco (passion fruit pisco).

Couple of dishes I love there:

- Empanadas
- Cebiches (of all types)
- Seafood rice (fantastic!)

Service is always great. One of my favorite places in the city.
author: Nuno S.

description:
Yummy- Mixto Cebicheria, Spring Fizz... do it!
Very friendly, patient staff at the bar! Also had a nice apertif "foggy..." something, with lychee puree and a lycher fruit orange garnish
I love this place for certain things and highly reccomend to anyone visiting the Embarcadero/SF.Pier
author: Macy P.

description:
Unfortunately this restaurant fell into the category of amazing the 1st time and disappointing the 2nd. Don't get me wrong the food was delicious but the service was incredibly slow - starting at the check in to the finishing of entrees - despite having a 5:45 reservation.

In addition, although the ceviches and caucus tastings tasted great, portions seemed smaller and therefore expensive. The salmon was so memorable last time but what happened! Seems like there were less veggies and the coconut curry sauce was more of a broth - liquidy and thin. As for the skewer tastings, we substituted the beef one for an extra Mahi Mahi skewer (so 2 fish and 1 chicken). The sauce that came on the chicken skewer was delicious and I loved the charred veggies on them but the fish and chicken themselves were nothing amazing. Lots of sauce and not enough protein for $30+. Too many fingerling potatoes on the side also ... would have preferred some colorful sweet potatoes or cauliflower instead.

In other words, I would recommend this place of it's your first time but I'm ready to try other places.
author: Carlin T.

description: Absolutely delicious. Excellent service. We come once a year. Their menu is seasonal so there are slight changes every time. The mushroom empanadas are the best I've ever had, second are the corn empanadas. No free refills on soft drinks (FYI). Last year we had ceviche appetizer and it was perfect. Definitely worth the price. Recommend reservations.
author: Mayra V.

description:
Hmmm in the mood for Peruvian fare but no reservations!  What to do?  So we asked the host at La Mar and he kindly led us to the bar area.  Problem solved and no wait!  It is true, a proper dinner setting would have been much nicer but sometimes it's also cool to just go with the flow.

The feel of the restaurant was energetic.  People looked happy.  Our waiter was very friendly and checked on us fairly often.  I don't remember having to ask for refills on my drinks.  Our food arrived nice and fresh with very little delay.  

The complimentary bucket of chips (plantain, sweet potato and potato) came with two dipping sauces.  They got a little kick to it.  I liked the plantain the most.  The rest of our food was delicious especially the Cebiche Carretillero which was very refreshing.  This dish was small.  We wanted more.  What I liked about the Empanada Criolla was its flaky crust.  The savory filling made it a very good appetizer.

We were skeptical about ordering Anticuchos de Pulpo initially.  Because if you don't cook the octopus right, it's like chewing on rubber tires.  However, these pulpo tentacles came out so tender every bite was flavorful.  I just wish they had put more on the plate!  I also adored the Anticuchos de Pollo.  The chicken was seasoned quite nicely as were the potatoes.  The sauces were tasty, too.  Unfortunately, there was a little bit of fat in the chicken bites that should have been easily cut out during food prep.  

This dinner at La Mar ended our evening in SF pleasantly.  We will definitely come again...with a reservation next time for sure.
author: Allen C.

description:
TLDR - Ceviche was sadly disappointing, but octopus was amazing! Not really convinced to return though. Lively atmosphere but rather expensive and super slow service.

There's nothing I love more than raw seafood. Naturally, La Mar was always on my radar whenever I was considering places to eat, and my friend and I made a weeknight reservation to finally try this place recently. Unfortunately, the popular ceviches were pretty underwhelming..

The place is very lively and energetic. Good for dinner with friends or GNO. There's table and bar seating inside as well as patio seating outside on the waterfront.

Service is pretty slow here. It's definitely one of those restaurants where you order a few drinks and spend a long time chatting while waiting for food. My friend and I unfortunately had plans after dinner so weren't looking for an unusually long meal. We were seated around 7 and got our order taken maybe 20 minutes later. Our first dish, the Cebiche La Mar, came out almost immediately, but our Traditos and Pulpo took much longer to prepare. The Pulpo I can understand more since it's cooked, but I would've thought the Traditos could be prepared much more quickly. The server also forgot to bring us plantain chips until I asked for them. By the time our last dish came out, it was almost 8:30, and by the time we finally got our check and card back, it was almost 9. Basically, dinner somehow took 2 full hours for 3 dishes, all of which were actually appetizers.

Food, overall, fell short of my expectations. Everything looked gorgeous and colorful, but taste didn't quite match up. Most notably, their ceviches are unbelievably sour. I'm used to some acidity in ceviches from other restaurants, but theirs was to an extreme.

-CEBICHE SAMPLER - 3/5
Comes with a sample of 3 ceviches. I normally loveee ceviche. Raw fish/seafood is probably one of the best things on the planet, but their ceviche was honestly rather disappointing. The seafood itself was fresh and had great texture but the sauces made the ceviches overly acidic. At some point, my taste buds became so overwhelmed I couldn't tell if it was still too acidic or if it was becoming too salty as well.

     -CLASICO [catch of the day in a classic leche de tigre w/ red onion, habanero, celery, choclo, cancha and camote] - honestly not very memorable, just the average ceviche but very acidic

     -MIXTO [catch of the day, calamari, octopus and shrimp in a creamy rocoto leche de tigre w/ cancha, choclo and camote] - not particularly memorable either but I remember the calamari being pretty tender

     -NIKEI [tuna, red onion, Japanese cucumber, daikon, avocado, nori and sesame in a tamarind leche de tigre] - reminded me of tuna poke at first, which I liked. but then the acidity kicked in

-TIRADITOS SPECIAL - 3/5
One of the weekly specials. Honestly, I'm not sure how (or if) this was different from the ceviches. It seemed like more or less the same thing, except that the fish was sliced thinly like Japanese sashimi instead. It came with a sample of 3 tiraditos - tuna, salmon and something else (white tuna maybe?). Again, not very memorable in taste aside from an overload of acidity. Each came in a different sauce but they all tasted like the same sourness to me. The sashimi was definitely quality though. I ended up just scraping off as much of the sauce as I could to eat the sashimi as plain as possible instead.

-PULPO - 5/5
[grilled octopus, roasted chimichurri potatoes, garlic chips, botija olive aioli, piquillo pepper] 
Definitely the highlight dish for me, even though I came here excited about the ceviche. The dish normally comes with 3 "skewers", but we added a fourth to make sharing easier. It smelled amazing the moment it was brought to our table! Super flavorful and had some smokiness to it. I could've done without the aioli though; I don't like aiolis in general and I thought the octopus was delicious enough without it. Texture was pretty good. One of the pieces I had was amazingly tender but the other had more of a chew to it. My friend said her pieces were nice and tender.

Overall, I'm not sure La Mar would come to mind for dining out in the future. Definitely avoiding  their ceviches and ceviche-like dishes, but the other skewers and main courses might be worth a try.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Over priced for the poor quality. Disappointing lunch. Absolutely not worth the money spent.

Lomo Saltado $36: mainly potatoes (French fries) with very little meat.

Aereopuerto $27 : bad tasting rice with chicken

Whole fish (not on menu) : Charged $78 for fried fish - less than 20% edible fish and balance 80% was batter and skin. Waiter sold it to us as very good boneless full fish, not on the menu, but did not indicate the price. Our mistake for not asking. 

Not going back again. Definitely not recommending this place at all. 

There are many other good options nearby.
author: Raj C.

description:
Stopped in on a Friday at 5 for happy hour.  The bar was slammed and I couldn't get a seat.  The restaurant opened at 5:30 and was also completely booked with reservations, good for them.  They had a sushi bar style seating area that was open but you couldn't order off the happy hour menu there.  Ended up taken a seat in this area and got good service from the staff.  The vibe and decor was well done too.

I had the mixto cebiche and the cocktail of the day.  Both were good but noting outstanding.  For $40 I would expect better though. I wasn't surprised based on it's location and number of tourists around the area.  I'll try to get there earlier another time for the happy hour.  It looked like it might be better all around.
author: Scott M.

description:
If your down to spend and are not that hungry this place is great. 
If you're hungry and poor don't come here. 

I ordered one of the specials - it was a delicious fish dish that came with avocado, fried artichokes, and an orange sauce. DELICIOUS. But not super filling.  I ate hella plantain chips to compensate for the lack of food lol. 

The view outside is so beautiful if you come on a nice day, it was perfect and totally transports you into another state of mind.  Didn't feel like the hustle and bustle of downtown SF at all. 

Recommend for dates/company lunch/snack time!
author: Christina L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants .Fresh food ,great choices and beautiful view .Highly recommend grilled octopus ,ceviche, lomo saltado( peruvian beef style);salmon .Any dish on the menu will not disappoint you!! Slow service but where to run:)) Here the video of outside and octopus https://youtu.be/Zved6siWWdo
author: Olga G.

description: Delicious meal with great Peruvian flavor.  We arrived just before our reservation and the seated us promptly.  Our server and other staff were on spot and the food was delicious. This is one of the best seafood restaurants in the Bay Area, as well as offering a distinctive range of dishes from Peruvian regional cuisine. The location on the waterfront is one of the more scenic in the city, and though large it's a comfortable place for a special meal.
author: Tony H.

description:
In my book, La Mar Cebicheria lives somewhere between a 3 and 4... but I lean toward 3 for reasons explained below.

What would make LMC a 4 is the creativity of the dishes and great service.

My favorites included 

- Cebiche with vegetables (chosen over seafood cebiche because I ordered a seafood dish).  This came with a nice assortment of veggies in a lemony marinate... though a bit salty.

- Plancha Marina (grilled seafood) that had a nice assortment of seafood and veggies... but a bit heavy on the octopus and cauliflower.

- Spiced soda with ginger beer

Other dishes that were ok but not repeat-worthy included

- Causa Limena (crab with potatoes) - I've had much better causa with chicken at most other Peruvian restaurants

- Carne - served raw and needing a good nuke.

The biggest disappointments were the alcoholic beverages.  I love a good pisco sour... but I soured on theirs.
 
I also found it odd that the back room where we were seated had square shaped floor planks that would teeter a bit every time someone walked by.  It felt like our chairs were constantly being bumped into.

If you dine here, stick with the seating in the front room.
author: Lee K.

description:
Made reservations here for a party of 7 for my birthday dinner and decided to order several dishes and share "family style". The atmosphere, location, and service were excellent. However, I will not be returning because the price we paid for the dishes was not worth it. One of the dishes that stood out was the lomo saltado, which we ordered 2 of. The taste was amazing, easily 5 stars,  but when we actually dug into the dish there were only 4-5 bite-sized pieces of steak. The rest of the dish was fluffed up with 90% potatoes. We were incredibly disappointed, especially considering the dish was nearly $40 each and we had ordered two of them! We ended up having to ration out the small pieces of steak among the 7 of us so that each person got at least 1 piece of steak. How sad is that!

None of us felt full after the meal. Our stomachs felt "just satisfied" due to the massive amounts of potatoes we had consumed.
author: Jane C.

description: Good service, great food. Make a reservation, and try to get the Oceanside seating. Great view for a date night!
author: Emily L.

description:
The restaurant is huge so there's tons of space and you're likely to find a last minute reservation. I loved all the decorations and thought the food was great although expensive! The service was friendly but super busy so they rarely checked in with us and the food came really late (almost 1.5 hour wait after ordering).

The best dish for me was the chaufa aeropuerto ($27) which was pork fried rice. It had both Peruvian and Asian flavors which was unique. It's served with this big fluffy egg on top that the server mixes in. I also loved the cebiche tasting ($34). It was fun to try the different types. My favorite was the mixto which had fish, shrimps, calamari, octopus in an amazing sauce. The limeña causa ($16) was beautifully presented. It was so colorful! I had never had purple whipped potatoes before. The crab was fresh and tasty with the creamy sauce. The lomo saltado ($36) with big chunks of savory beef, potatoes, and onions was equally good. The fritter sampler of empanadas and croquettes ($29) was just okay. It might have been partly due to the dish coming out cold. I think the server had maybe forgotten to give it to us. The pulpo octopus skewer ($28) was cooked well although a little too pricey for what you get.

Lastly the dessert was incredible! We all loved the passion fruit & chocolate mousse dessert ($13) and tres leche cake. It was a great way to end the meal. Overall it might have been closer to a 5 star meal for some of the menu items but service was really spotty on our visit which doesn't really justify the prices.
author: Linda X.

description: La Mar has great food and ambiance. It's lively and fresh feeling. Like you've been transported somewhere tropical. Their ceviches and empanadas are the best in San Francisco. I love the quinoa beet burger only available at lunch or happy hour. On sunny days, it's great to sit outside and enjoy pisco sours. Big space with great music and food.
author: Marilyn N.

description: Met my friend here for lunch.  She is the Queen of Foodies and chose this place during SF's Restaurant Week back in January.  Thus we had the fixed price lunch for $25.  The food was truly excellent and the service impeccable but the portions were really small and the place was so noisy it was hard to hear each other talk.  Food and service alone rated a 5 but the $$$, tiny portions and noise level brought it down.  There are better values for that type of money.  I was still pretty hungry after my meal and I am not that big of an eater either.  And it wasn't because this is a tapas (small plates) type place, I've been to other tapas places and felt full and satisfied. A really nice touch though, was the combination fried potato and plantain chips with their house dip that was given as a free appetizer.  I usually do not like plantains but these were delicious! I would come back if the portions were larger to justify the cost.
author: Annie L.

description: Loved it! Everything from the exquisite food, to the service, to the atmosphere. I ordered ceviche Mercado as an appetizer and the fish literally melts in your mouth. The lomo saltado was delicious, definitely recommend it. To end I had arroz la mar, which is the Peruvian version of paella, which is one of my favorite plates. Our server was super welcoming and explained the whole menu. If you like Peruvian food this place is a must
author: Cynthia A.

description:
First the food..it is wonderful. Definitely 4-5 *  I had special requests for "no galic" (yes I know..it is a Peruvian restaurant, but allergies...) and it was accommodated, even if not easy.
Portions are bigger than expected (especially appetizers) *****
While the location is fabulous ****, the outside patio which was covered at night is so extremely loud, we could not enjoy it and asked to move. This is definitely a turn off.  Inside was slightly better, but still loud, and the music on top did not help. Maybe outside in an open set up at lunch it is ok, but it was just not acceptable. Net rating for customer friendly inside **, but the covered patio is zero* 
The service was competent but stretched out to the point of unable to cope.  Get a few more waiters, this is well within your budget!  **
The dessert (we split one passion fruit/chocolate mousse) was fabulous *****

I was really looking forward to a great meal in a friendly cozy place...left a bit disappointed.  Overall I would rate it 3 to 3 1/2 *
author: Ralph A.

description:
Gotta try their Pisco Sour and the different variations.  I loved their Pisco Sour.  They had all the flavors blend beautifully together and nothing overpowering.  I'll have to try the other variations.  

I tried their arroz la mar.  Super tasty.  The seafood, sauce, and rice blended beautifully.  The only thing I would change, was their small piece of fish that was in the dish.  It tasted a bit rubbery.  I was surprised considering the squid and octopus was the right texture.  

The bar near the entrance was a cool place to eat.  They have the full menu, and it was fun watching the bartenders make the drinks. 

The only thing I would've liked better is if the wait staff was friendlier.  They seem to have a stern face the whole evening and barely a smile.  But at least the food/drinks were good.
author: Shirley C.

description:
La Mar is a special type of high end restaurant. The prices are still manageable and their portions are decent for what it is. This restaurant does an excellent job with keeping the place squeaky clean and making sure their guests are well taken care of.

Everyone is well groomed and their performance is up to par. This is officially my first high end Peruvian restaurant and my experience was tremendous. The menu contains dishes that are originally from the old country with fresh ingredients and classic taste. La Mar is highly known for their award winning Cebiches. They serve about seven different kinds of cebiches including a mix of three different kinds. Each one is $19 and it's portions are enough IF eaten properly and taken time. 

I ordered their cebiche classic which is fresh slices of cubed halibut that is literally butter texture. There is slices of red onion, habanero, cancha & camote. This cebiche is super fresh with chunks of corn and crispy corn-nuts. I scooped it with La Mar's famous plantain chips! It's excellent in every aspect. To drink I had their chica morada which is Peru's traditional purple corn juice/tea with spices of cardamom & cinnamon. I thought this was unique and totally refreshing. This costs $5 so it's well worth the try.

If there is a place where fresh fish should be served and given on a sleek plate with a view of the Pacific, it's La Mar. Thank you!
author: Allister D.

description:
Overlooking the Bay and ferries while tasting three ceviches is the definition of a good life. They each had distinctive looks and tastes.
We also ordered swordfish skewers recommended by our waitress (fish was moist and tasty) and Plancha Marina (prawns, calamari, catch of the day, seasonal veggies). The Plancha came on a steaming griddle complete with sizzling sound effects and steam. The squid and calamari were especially tasty.
As for service we were seated promptly and given a table with water view per our request. They changed plates after the starter and made sure we had water and sufficient beverages. We did let the waiter know we wanted to split the beer but they forgot to provide a second glass. It took a while to get the second glass but it wasn't a big issue.
The patio where we were seated was enclosed and ceiling heaters were turned on to counteract the evening chill. We only wish it could have been warmer but it's not easy space to keep warm.
We ordered the leche de dulce for dessert, also recommended by our waitress. Perfect ending to a tasty and visually esthetic dinner.
Overall a very pleasant experience for Mothers Day.
author: Liana T.

description:
Oh man, this place is good. I love that they even have Peruvian cervezas on the menu. Cuzquena   The cebiche trio sampler certainly disappoint. But next time I may stick with one type, since I didn't love the classic.  Personal preference: Nikei (best flavor) l Mixto (loved the calamari and octopus l Clasico 

Oh and how could I forget about the starter of plantain chips and dip?! It was perfect with the ceviche. I ended up having lomo saltado as my entree. It was good but not quite the best I've had.
author: Patricia N.

description: Wonderful atmosphere and unique tasty food, great cocktails and mock-tails, nice outdoor views, and attentive staff. Highly recommend this place!
author: Susan R.

description: Best Peruvian food ever.  This is probably the best food I've had in SF.  Only suggestion is to add the tuna salad for dinner.  Amazing place.
author: Matt H.

description: This restaurant became very expensive and the portions very limited and less tasty than it was. The ceviche is have what it use to be. Charging $8 for a bottle of Peregrino is a scandal!!! Service went down too. Not going back for now. Tourist love it. We in San Francisco have better local options
author: Patricia W.

description:
We really enjoyed all the food we ordered. The Empanadas were delicious, the skewers were delicious, and our entrees also. I had the Divers Scallops and there were 5 of them. We had ordered so much I had them for dinner again the next night.
CONS: why can't a first class restaurant keep the ladies room clean? It's six o'clock and the tp was almost gone, the waste basket was overflowing....what?  They didn't clean between shifts and it's Saturday night?
I told the hostess on our way out the door.
author: Rosemary H.

description: When we made our choice to go there I was a little skeptical. We wanted to try something new and never had Peruvian food before. We looked up other yelp reviews and checked out the menu online and decided "why not?" Best. Decision. Ever! This place is simply amazing! The food, the staff, the interior, the view, EVERYTHING! But first things first. We went there as group of 8 people on our wedding day. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating and they gave us a table where I'd have enough space to get in and out of the chair with my quite massive wedding dress (they also have huge bathrooms where you have space to turn with such, that as side note). When you enter you're almost standing in front of this HUGE bar and they have all kinds of drinks. An awesome wine variety and if you can't make up your mind, ask anyone that works there. They know everything they offer in and out. The waiters are absolutely amazing. Fast, attentive and absolutely friendly. I was blown away five minutes into being there and I haven't had food or something to drink yet. I was still busy taking everything in. The menus, drinks and food, have a wide variety in flavors. Everything we ordered tasted and looked amazing. I can't think of anything negative to say. Top notch. We'll be back for sure.
author: Ella C.

description:
This review is for the bar area. We had a little 6 person get together on a Friday night. I was expecting it to get a bit cramped but it never got out of hand; just a full house of happy patrons with a good energy level. Awesome place to grab a few of their delicious appetizers and some drinks. 

Pisco sours. Empanadas. Definite must haves.

Service was great. We got a lot of refills of their signature chips and they were constantly checking in on us. Tab was reasonable for all that we got to try out. It'll be dinner next time.
author: Al C.

description:
This spot has so much potential. Epic view, cute bar, beautiful patio, gorgeous dining area....

But for me, the veggie food, falls short.

The empanadas are good, but other than that, not much to choose from for a veggie.

If you're down with good cocktails and empanadas, by all means, do your thang.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Mostly good some items exceedingly better than others, this is a terrific spot for views of the ocean, lovely piscos and seafood. 
We were offered a complementary plate of tiradito which had incredibly fresh Hawaiian white tuna plated with leche de tigre (great fish, bland creamy sauce). Of the three ceviche we tried the Nikei was outstanding. The plancha marina offered a platter of smokey vegetables, prawns, and fish- it was so delicious and a nice contrast to the ceviche.
My only complaint is the condition of the bathroom. The floor and sink area needs a good scrubbing and the staff should check it every hour and make sure it smells fresh and looks immaculate. No one wants to pay high ends prices at a seafood restaurant with an untidy bathroom.
author: Esther H.

description: Beautiful inside and outside (right by the pier)! Very fancy inside. Never tried Peruvian food and was with my Peruvian friend who persuaded me to try. I was glad I did and it was delicious, we got a couple of things and shared (not sure what he ordered but everything was so good!). Always good to try new things!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Love the ambiance, view of the bay, complimentary plantain chips, and lomo saltado (beef dish though this place is known for the seafood). The ceviche is also good, but doesn't fill me up. Pretty pricey so I would rather go for something that fills me up. The tables closer to the entrance are more casual while the ones farther inside have a more romantic feel. Good spot for a date (and after dinner you can walk along the Embarcadero~)
author: Annie S.

description: Location is great but food was just ok. The free baked chips were unique but ceviche and lomo saltado was just ok. Drinks were ok. Nothing great about this place but decent enough.
author: Alicia H.

description: We decided to eat here at 2:30pm on a Saturday and do not regret our choice. The positives of la Mar: outdoor patio seating near the water is beautiful, hidden heat lamps, the music is perfect volume/choice to set an island feeling, staff was very friendly spoke Spanish, and the food was delicious with unique flavors! The downsides the price is higher (but the quality is there) and the menu was limited because only lunch was available at 2:30pm. The limited menu was fine because we ordered the only one main course of delicious beef, lamo saltado, and a side of croquettes chupe to share. The wine menu is extensive. I'll be back on a special occasion!
author: Susan O.

description:
First started going to this place in 2010, when I lived on Beale and embarcadero. The chef that got this restaurant running right did just that. When Gastón took him to travel the world to open Lamars all over, that's when the restaurant went down hill. Had my wedding dinner at this place I was so loyal. But changes came quickly. They see Peruvians come in and they treat you like trash. Don't ever judge a book by its cover. 
Back to the food, water down not authentic. Limón or other places in the bay have a better recipe then Lamar. Even went as far as visiting the NY Lamar when they were open. Got a chance to visit my old bartender from Lamar SF. Sad to say they closed down because they weren't aware of the competition in NY w authentic Peruvian recipes. Real Yucca not frozen, can't fool a true Peruvian. 
Went from eating 2 times a week at Lamar SF, to once a month, finally once every 6 months and now never. When our friends visit from Spain or Peru we take them elsewhere and they are never disappointed. 
Gastón got greedy and forgot about his roots. He can win all of the awards he wants but Lamar is anything but authentic Peruvian dining. 

Review for a visit on Sept 29th 2017
I still take people here because they want to say they went to lamar SF. Sadly there was a hair in their Huacatay Sauce and a fly in their Mixed drink. They need to close this pace down, it's truly giving great Peruvian food a bad name.
author: Jae B.

description: This was our first (and last) time here.  The only reason it earns two stars is because the seating on the back patio is wonderful; we enjoyed watching the ferries come and go. The service was poor; we waited over 20 minutes for our drinks and that was after I had to ask twice.  When I ordered the Churrasquito (steak), the waitress warned me that it was a very large portion and I should either plan on sharing or choose something else. I was pretty hungry, so I stuck with the order. What I got was about 4 oz of beef (with about 1/2 oz of fat and gristle) that had no flavor whatsoever. The cost was $39. To say that it was overpriced is an understatement.  We also had ceviche that was okay, but underwhelming. When you combine all that with long lines for the single-stall bathrooms, we're certain we won't be coming back.
author: Ben T.

description:
I had better and cheaper.  If you are a lover of Peruvian food, then you all know that for some weird ass reason they are pricier than most restaurants.  This restaurant was wayyy overpriced and know that with that price you are pretty much just paying for the service and the ambient.  

The food wasn't bad, flavors were good but if you want fancy Peruvian restaurant I recommend Mochica instead, it's cheaper compared to Lamar.
Also their authentic peruvian menu is a little limited. You get your usual ceviche, empanadas and causas. Most of the main courses are a not really that impressive.  I came to a Peruvian restaurant for my platos tipicos (traditional dishes) and not some whatever main courses that I can get anytime at a lot of the latin restaurants or american restaurants.

We order their ceviche classico, came with big chunks of halibut and it definitely need more marinating, flavor was lacking.
We also got their causa limena, which was very tasty, flavor was spot on but the presentation needs improvement.  It was made of purple potato puree with crab fillings and top with ikura (not necessary at all).  Instead of your usual lasagna like build, they squeeze the potato puree through one of the round pastry tips and the crab salad was put on top of it.  The issue with it is that the potato puree look like turd.  I don't know who came up with that presentation idea but it was a FAIL. Besides that it was delicious. (The only dish that i really liked hence the 3 stars but fail due to presentation)
Then we had a salmon dish and a paella-ish dish, they were nothing special.  Flavors were regular nothing really stood out.

Won't be coming back unless you are really desperate for Peruvian food while walking by the piers, can't get to anywhere else AND have tons of money to burn.  Otherwise save your money and just go to a better and cheaper ones in the Mission like Mi Lindo Peru, Cholo Soy, El porteno and fancier peruvian Mochica.
author: Suzanne L.

description:
Well we decided to make a reservation here. Place is nice and elegant gets busy around 5pm guessing people come here after work. Never really had Peruvian food, but my girl and I decided to give it a try. Seated right away service was nice and friendly. Food is mediocre nothing crazy or over the top. Empanadas are really good though worth a try. 
I got the arroz la mar the seafood mix it was enjoyable. Everything tasted fresh and good but a little bland but overall was a safe meal to pick. My girlfriend got the conchitas picante the scallops were good but the black lentils were really spicy kind of ruined the flow of the dish. Ordered the drinks. I got a el Classico idk this was not worth it in a small glass and didn't taste overly great where I can get one better someplace else for cheaper. My girlfriend got some wine not sure which one it was ok from her standpoint.
Reason for the 3 stars is place is overly price for the quality of the food. It's good portions and sharable. 
I know it's a fancy restaurant but overly my girlfriend and I cook and we know quality when we taste it. It was subpar on our standards. But we don't mind coming back for a empanada as a Togo snack.
author: Leonard I.

description: I love Gaston's place in the CIty, beautiful space and amazing food. We had the ahi tiradito so good and the cous cous salad not peruvian in my mind but was very good! The service was spot on and we had a bottle of wine that was amazing (sandi). You can't go wrong here just order what is best for you!
author: Susan F.

description:
Decided to celebrate Mother's Day a little early so I took my mom out for dinner here. A beautiful restaurant that sits on the embarcadero. The interior is gorgeous, with the bright blue and dark furniture, it makes your feel like your in the islands. 

We attempted to Happy Hour but it was complete chaos in the small bar section they have. And since we couldn't get a table because it was busy or people holding seats, we were a little bummed out and just gave up. So unfortunately we didn't get a chance to order anything at happy hour.  

 Anyways we were here for dinner. La Mar is known for their Cebiches, so we started with the *Cebiche Nikei - It's basically Ahi Tuna, avocado, garnished with onions and other Japanese veggies. What stood out the most was how fresh the tuna was. The flavor with everything mixed in was refreshing. For $25, it's a little high, but it's good.
*Plaintain Chips - house made and complementary to to the dinner service. I wasn't expecting the chips, but they were delicious. If they were sold in a store I would buy some. Some of the best house made chips I've ever had. The sauce they bring with it was also good. Great way to start to meal especially paired with their Cebiche.
*Arroz La Mar - A rich flavorful rice dish with a plethora of seafood like Calamari, mussels, shrimp, clams, and a small piece of fish. The dish replicates Paella so I was looking forward to this. Everything about this dish lived up to my high expectations. The flavor of the dish was rich that had many enjoyable elements. It was hot but not too spicy, you can taste the different spices used, and the seafood was cooked perfectly. The surprising but most delightful part of the dish, was the small piece of halibut on top of the rice. I think I would love to order the fish by itself next time. For $34 I think this is a steal. Great Value.
*Power Trio - weekly special of a Dungeness crab, uni, and scallop Cebiche. My mom decided to order this one. Overall I think it was underwhelming. It was 3 small dishes and small portions. I mean really small portions. The crab came with the shell, but 3 small piece of crab meat and the sauce was decent at best. The scallops were also cooked with a different sauce, it was soft but nothing stood out flavor-wise. The best of the the three was the uni which was serve with avocado. But it wasn't that special, I just thought it was good for not being a sushi place. But for $50 bucks... It's overpriced and didn't even taste better than the tuna we ordered previously. 

The service was great, our server was Pedro, and he was both helpful and attentive throughout our dinner. Overall the food was good, but it's overpriced just be prepared to spend. I really wanted to try their empanadas but those prices are outrageous. Even a sampler for $26 dollars is a little much for a pastry. One of the reason why I wanted to start at Happy hour, but still would have been $9. Not sure if I would come back to try some other things since I think their food is on par with the Michelin Star restaurant La Viga in Redwood City but not nearly as expensive. Still, the atmosphere here is great and place I would recommend especially if you can get a spot at their happy hour.
author: Arron E.

description:
Yikes. For such a beautiful restaurant in a hot location, La Mar failed to execute. 

- service was slow, had to ask 2-3 times for the same drink 
- nobody offered coat check 
- WORST OF ALL, came home from dinner not feeling too hot. At 1am, I started vomiting and I still don't feel good five hours later. Hence I'm up writing a damn Yelp review at 6am. We had the tuna ceviche, fish ceviche, chicken & shrimp empanadas, and the lomo saltado. Not sure which was the culprit, but after reading other reviewers who also experienced food poisoning, the trend seems to be the tuna. For a cebicheria, I would expect them to be especially cognizant of the quality of fish and cleanliness of preparation. Very disappointing. Food poisoning sucks. 

+ awesome waterfront location 
+ the pisco punch was TASTY. The dash of nutmeg on top makes the drink not your average cocktail. 

But truly, the cons outweigh the pros. Go to Fresca for Peruvian food that won't get you sick.
author: Erica L.

description: Good food as always, just a little bit of work needed for the staff that walks around. Ambiance is perfect for a date or an special occasion. Try the ceviche sampler and empanadas if you haven't been here to eat. Agua de chicha is a tradicional drink here also. Arroz la Mar is very good and the gaucho. Will keep sharing moments as i go around.
author: Jorgerewards T.

description:
One of my new favorite places to meet with friends, and enjoy the fantastic tastes of Peru!

The ambience/music is terrific and highly recommend this place for a date or catching up with a group of friends :)
author: Ana A.

description: Very vibrant atmosphere, the food is good. I was disappointed a bit with swordfish. It was moist and Veges around it were great. I just didn't think there was much flavor at all. The other person with swordfish felt same way. You have water views or sit inside area. Service was very good.
author: Joe M.

description:
Well. I've. Never . Given . A. One. Star. The. Service. Was. Awful. For a 205 $ meal. We had to pour our own wine.  NO service whatsoever. So if you want to go to a restaurant which has you serve your own bottle of wine-go
For it.  Check out my other reviews. I have never left ZERO tip so ...
author: Suha V.

description:
The reviews are pretty spot on.. food is good, the views are amazing and the place will definitely empty out your wallet.
 
So be prepared. But that's not the worst part.

What RUINS, and I mean RUINS the experience is the fact that the waitresses try to up sale you like crazy.
And they are pretty sleazy about it too. For instance, we came here for a business lunch the waitress told me that my $32 entrée is normally ordered as a kids meal. She suggested I order at least 2 of them.
She also told my manager that her $25 order was too tiny to be a meal.
Good thing we didn't listen to her because when our meals came we hardly finished them, (the portions were not large by any means but we weren't starving). Though we did get suckered into ordering an $80 appetizer, yes EIGHTY dollars for an appetizer!
This was their "Appetizer Special" I seriously think they should mention that their "Special" is going to be DOUBLE or TRIPPLE the price of a regular appetizer beforehand. Or maybe it brings them joy to see the shock on their customers face when the bill arrives. 

So let this be your WARNING!

All in all, I don't think I would come back. It was not a fun experience. I'd even go as far to say that I would classify this place as a tourist trap in my book.
author: V I P.

description: La Mar= Quality and Super Service!!! I have been at La Mar Miami so many times and it was good. I live in San Francisco and I decided to try La Mar SF...I was surprised!! The service is outstanding and the food excellent!! Must try!!!!
author: Girandi C.

description:
Solid happy hour spot on the Embarcadero with some excellent bargains (e.g., $7 gin gimlets, $6 punch, $6 empanadas, $7 calamari app). All the food we had was great, but the calamari appetizer was my favorite and was a very healthy portion for the price. Additionally the ceviche we had tasted very light and fresh with nice sized pieces of fish. 

Our server was very friendly and attentive too.

All in all a great spot!
author: Taylor A.

description: Came here for our wedding anniversary and this restaurant did not disappoint us.  Husband and I are very much into ceviche and by far we are very happy with our over all experience. We are definitely coming back for some more Peruvian food!
author: Ira E.

description:
Great location and an amazing Peruvian kitchen with a spin on Peruvian food. They use high quality and fresh products for their dishes.

I would suggest you order several different appetisers, Causa, Octopus, steak and Ceviche. They are all delicious.

One dish I  really would like to point out is the Causa. This is made from a Peruvian type potato. Great taste!

The restaurant is located right by the fisherman wharf, has a beautiful interior that is fresh and international. They do have an open kitchen what I always like.
author: Erik Jan V.

description:
Food wonderful, server not wonderful! 
Try the chicken empenadas incredible 
And moist and tender!
