Server was a white male with glasses with an attitude 
Was not explanatory with the menu while I overheard the other waiters very detailed for first timers like my self 
Took a very long time coming back and fourth to order and did not check in on me but did check in on the other customers!
Overall great food, but disappointed with the waiter.
author: Monique L.

description:
Wonderful fare and great service. Atmosphere is gorgeous, as well. I appreciate the servers' knowledge of the menu -- and especially when it comes to dietary restrictions. 

Can't wait to return! We had such a fun birthday celebration at La Mar!
author: gee b.

description: It was an off day for me; nothing works except the starchy Peruvian corns, fingerling potatoes.all I noticed is that the restaurant is noisy
author: Hualin H.

description: I was here for my anniversary, I made a reservation but it was early enough where I didn't have to. Overall, the food were unique and tasty. The service was good and professional. I am all about the service, if the service is bad, everything else would be bad. Ordered some house liquor and were strong too but good. The vibe of this place was good. They do have a bar section by the front entrance in case you want to have a drink while you wait. This is a mixed of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian type of food so be open minded and try little of everything.
author: Jackson W.

description:
Expensive disappointment! 
We got there around 9pm, the girls at the door were terribly rude and not classy, they asked if we had reservations, we said no... and they said we had to wait 45min.... Ok... we went to the bar and I went back to tell the girl to put our name down and we will have a drink and wait, and then she said... "Oh, actually I can seat you now"... wow..... when we got to our table we saw many open tables that stayed free all night... what was that about??? Trying to look cool??? Epic failure!
Then we were ready to try that great ceviche and Peruvian food according to the reviews here and it was a great disappointment.... I know Peruvian food veeery well... this is not! 
Our ceviche didn't taste like ceviche at all... It had too much onion, 3 sad shrimps, some octopus and calamari swimming in an strange orange sauce I've never seen before... not a hint of lime.. it was almost a soup! 
Entrees are ok.... Yuca is terrible... Anticuchos  ok... empanadas no comments... 
It wouldn't be expensive if the food was good but considering the food and the service this place is way too expensive. $190 for 2... (2 drinks each)
Oh and they got 1 unit bathroom for the whole restaurant,  so it took over 15min for my husband to go to the bathroom!
One star for the location and ambiance
There are better Peruvian restaurants in the city, Way better!
author: Lorena A.

description:
Hmmm mmmm, so good! The food here is fresh and the flavors are well-conceived. The menu is fun to peruse, and they offer sampler platters of many of the different types of fare they serve. We tried an empanada sampler plate (empanadas filled with beef, chicken, and mushrooms) and a causa platter. At our table we also tried two ceviches - the clasico and the california (the clasico was so delicious, very dynamic) - and the carne. 

Service is slow, so make sure you've got the time. Food and atmosphere are both awesome.
author: Alex R.

description:
This was our first encounter with an A&G restaurant. We now have eaten at most of his Peruvian restaurants, various locations. In addition to his Santiago and Chicago outposts. 

The food was well prepared and presented. Fresh seafood. Great drinks. Big portions. 

Ideal restaurant for a group outings, to share their many savoury dishes.
author: Eduardo T.

description:
One of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long while.

We showed up at 3:00PM (just in time for the happy hour), and the hostess at the front ignored us for five minutes. Apparently, straightening menus was far more important to her. 

When she finally finished straightening menus, she took us to the main dining area to sit us down. We then waited another 10 minutes, for service. What the hostess had failed to mention was that happy hour only took place in the front area and not in the main dining area. The very same ceviche that was served in the front area was double the price in the main area. The waitress refused to honor the happy hour prices, and refused to transfer us over to the front area as well. We ordered a $20 salad, deciding to eat it before moving to the happy hour area to take advantage of the more reasonable prices. The salad was completely underwhelming, small, lacking in flavor, and generally just overpriced. It also took nearly 20 minutes for the salad to actually show up.

When we finally switched over to the front area, there was actually no waitress to be found. We were told she was on break. We then ordered at the bar, then had a second wait or come over and order with us, and then the waitress return from the break and took our order the third time. When she returned she actually told us that they were out of one of the ceviche's. Out of one of the ceviche? We ate one of the ceviche tallied up and left completely underwhelmed disappointed and having wasted almost 2 hours of our day still leaving with an empty stomach. 

Avoid this place at all costs.
author: Steven B.

description:
I've really wanted to check out this place since my family is from Peru and I've had both their cooking and tried different restaurants in Peru. Often restaurants in the states will alter to fit the taste of American palates and I feel that this is what happened here. I made sure to take some of the food home and have my mom try it (who lived in Peru for the first half of her life) to see what she thought. She definitely thought it was good but wouldn't say it is true Peruvian food. 

Ambiance: Very cute and fun! I absolutely love the décor and if you read my other reviews you can see if I'm very much into the aesthetics of a restaurant. I actually feel this restaurant has a similar feel and style that you might find in a nice restaurant in the Larcomar district of Lima, Peru or the Barranco district. 

Food: As far as it being 100% authentic Peruvian food, no it isn't. It is more along the lines of American-Peruvian fusion but I love it all the same. We ordered a yucca dish which is a Peruvian root cooked in a more American way. Still very good and it came with my favorite sauces: Huacatay and Huancaina. I can't comment on the cebiche but my friend enjoyed it. We also ordered empanadas and I was excited they had a vegetarian one! Its hard to find a Peruvian vegetarian empanada let alone a good one.

The vegetarian empanada here at La Mar was absolutely amazing! It tastes as hearty as the meat empanadas that I remembered from my childhood and made in the same style. I will be dragging anyone and everyone I can here just so I can eat this empanada again.
author: Anya R.

description:
The food is fine, but no better than many other Peruvian places at 2-3x the price. The ceviche "catch of the day" was caught some other day and wasn't fresh, in fact it was fishy. Prices were high for the ceviche, but you get a lot of it. Too much in fact, we couldn't finish two orders (classic and mixto) between two of us. There was TONS of upsell: even though the waiter must've know the huge portions, when my friend said that the ceviche was enough for his light lunch the waiter insisted it was not, so not only could he not finish the ceviche but he did not finish the main course either.

The Classic ceviche was fine but uninspiring, I've had better from Fresca, the chunks of old fish were too big to be fully marinated, thus the off taste. The mixto had too much calamari, and the stingy shrimps were not fully marinated either, and hadn't turned all-white.

The main issue I had was the waiter suggesting the pasta special, which sounded good and I ordered. It was good but too salty, crab-spice-red based, and I couldn't finish it. The waiter did not inform me beforehand how much the special cost, so I assumed it was commensurate with the other entrees.

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!! Silly me!

The pasta was $58.

FIFTY-EIGHT DOLLARS
(in case you think the numbers were a typo)

for pasta

It was worth $28 max, and being lunchtime should've been $18-20. OK, it's downtown on the Embarcadero, nice view of bobbing boats (so what), local ambiance etc, so I'll give it the $28.

FIFTY-EIGHT DOLLARS

Which I was not informed of. One would think if there is a special that is literally double the price of everything else on the menu, the waiter would say so, every other place I've ever eaten at does.

(I hardly think that's good enough, the box should have a big red label Warning: Lark's Vomit!)

Add to that the 4% Healthy SF F--- You Mandate, there's no reason to eat here. It's an expensive tourist trap for the unwary, and I'll not be back.

In the immortal words of the great George W Bush:
Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice? (uh, fumble, stumble, uh, duh)
Well, uh, ............ won't get fooled again!
author: Rob C.

description: Great Cebiche, beatific fresh fish, wonderful bay views. Great informative and friendly staff. Awesome location for a romantic dinner or night out with friends.
author: Heinz G.

description:
Only stepped in for a break walking along Embarcadero, but would have stayed for dinner if we could have - needed to get a toddler to bed! 

We had a sampling of the happy hour drinks, and got to say it was wonderful to have an authentic Pisco Sour - so hard to find outside of Peru itself. $7 too, bargain! We also had a couple of the ceviche appetisers, which were wonderful. Spicy, but in the right way.

I'll definitely be back here, for the full experience.

NB: recommend sitting in the couches in the 'public walkthru' bar area, it's super comfy and kept our lil guy cosy and entertained. They were happy to let us continue sitting there for dinner if we liked, despite being pretty fully booked. Guess you can't reserve these couches?
author: Mike P.

description:
3 stars for the food, 5 stars for the venue for an average of 4 stars!

It was a beautiful Valentine's Day on a Saturday, the sun was out, love was in the air, the Embarcadero was bustling with life. Luckily I made reservations for this place for lunch because I would have missed out on the sweeping views of the bay on such a beautiful day in San Francisco if i came at night! I highly recommend coming during the day for sweeping views of the Bay!

The food and drinks were alright. I got the Cholito, listed as "everyone's favorite" so I had to get it. It sounded really refreshing with Porton Pisco, ginger, jalepeno, creme de cassis, lime and topped with ginger beer. I expected it to have that spicy kick and umph but none of that was present. We started off with the Cebich La Mar for $30 which is a selection of their 4 most popular cebiches (Clasico, Mixto, Chifa, and Nikei). All 4 had unique and different flavor profiles, a very good way to sample them. My favorite was the Chifa because of its strong sesame taste, so fragrant and delicious! Get this and it does not disappoint. 

We also had their brussels sprouts salad with fried kale, cauliflower and bacon strips with a side small bowl of jalepeno goat cheese. It sounds healthy right? Nope! Its super greasy, probably from the bacon fat. I still enjoyed it, especially the jalepeno goat cheese.

My main dish was one of their daily specials. It was a mahi mahi stuffed with shrimp and oysters on a bed of greens and rice. I had no idea, but this dish tasted like Asian Stir Fry! It wasn't what I was expecting, a lot of their menu items have a lot of Asian influences. 

Our server was professional, and the table and chairs were comfortable. Make sure you ask for the complimentary plantain, sweet potato and potato chips because sometimes they forget. I had to "order" them because I saw one on every table and then found out at the end that they were complimentary. I guess our server forgot.  I love the venue, its huge and right by the waterfront, modern decor and pops of color. I can see myself having a private party here to celebrate some kind of life milestone.
author: Janny S.

description:
Food was okay...  
service was terrible for the following reasons:
1. To get a sauce, I had to ask 5 times because I think waiters forget...
2. I got some food to go as well as I had to get food for my husband waiting at home ...and they gave me someone else's leftover instead...  I'm sure it was by mistake but it's ridiculous.
author: H M.

description: Although the food was excellent and service good, our entire table (4) got sick the following evening and the restaurant was very defensive about taking responsibility for it. We 4 are work colleges and this was the only common denominator.
author: Gillian G.

description: The food was great! The service was meh... the attention to the details, making sure things were ok. For the price, it should have been better. Perhaps the staff is over extended. Probably not their fault!
author: Catherine T.

description:
When you show up to a restaurant for Happy Hour or restaurant week, you expect to get somewhat of a deal even if you are just saving a couple of bucks. Not here.

I've been here twice so far, once for Happy Hour a while ago and once for their $25 lunch for restaurant week a couple of days ago. When I was here for happy hour, we ordered a ton of food and I noticed that while the prices seemed lower than the regular menu, the portions were even smaller. After doing to math, it is actually cheaper to buy the appetizer at full price than it is to buy the smaller version during happy hour which is pretty ridiculous. This was based on the empanada dish that I was able to count the number of pieces vs price but it's probably the same for everything else.

When I was here for restaurant week, there was a lunch special where you get an appetizer, entree and your choice of tres leche or sorbet for dessert. I ordered the chicken skewer as an appetizer, the salmon as the entree and the tres leche cake for dessert. It was one small chicken skewer which I thought was ok as an app for lunch but when the entree came my jaw dropped. It was the tiniest piece of salmon that I have seen as an entree. I'm surprised that they weren't embarrassed to serve such a pathetic entree. Just to give you an idea of size since you can't really tell by the picture, it was the equivalent to 2 McDonald's chicken nugget in terms of thickness and length. You can get samples at Costco bigger than this.

Needless to say that I left hungry and no one should have a 3 course meal for lunch and leave a restaurant hungry. Even the dessert was tiny but at least it was bigger than the salmon.

As for service, it was pretty bad as well. Our waitress was also gone and hard to find. When she came to replace our silverware after the app, she brought me a knife and no fork and by the time I realized it, I was busy chatting with a friend who I hadn't seen in a while, she was no where to be found. It took me a while to get a fork. 

Overall, the space is nice and the only reason they are really still in business is because of all the tourists who don't know any better. I don't plan on returning unless I want to get ripped off again.
author: Diane M.

description:
We came here at the suggestion of a bartender at Bar Basic. He said we could get great seafood and amazing ceviche...he didn't mention you'd get great service too! Everyone here was so pleasant and welcoming. The restaurant is pretty big and has an upscale yet not uptight feel. Loved that the menu had a wide array of ceviches....I forgot the name of the one we got, but it had ahi tuna...it was delicious. The shrimp empanadas were the definition of perfection; light and flaky yet almost bursting at the seam with a delicious shrimp concoction inside, and topped with an avocado salsa (more like an emulsion). They only get four stars because the fried fish we got as our entree (one of the specials) lacked flavor. This may be because the dipping sauces provided were supposed to be all the flavor u need, but it tasted like they put NOTHING on the fish.

I would absolutely come back here (especially to try the drinks, which we skipped because we'd been day drinking...and to enjoy the view, since the spot is right on the water)
author: EarthaStarr P.

description: Delicious food and great view! We enjoyed the patio section in the back.  The service was a bit slow tho
author: Anna C.

description: So on my reservation, I let them know it was my GF's birthday. Without prompting them, they came and sang happy birthday and offered a sweet desert.  Class act...
author: Bill G.

description: Wow -- last Monday took 7 to a feast. The diversity of the menu, quality of presentation and tastes were incredible. Great staff. Great view. Great location. An experience you should add to your list
author: Mike B.

description: View was great. Service too. Food was very good but mostly small (expensive) portions and not traditional. Empanadas good. Ceviche micro good but my Tía prefers the more classical line marinade. Got the vegetarian causa and it was gorgeous but tiny overpriced portion. My wife liked the grilled anticuchos.
author: Marco M.

description:
I first visited this restaurant back in October 2016. It was great I enjoyed the Lomo Saltado, the plantain chips were  great and the overall ambience was welcoming. The waiters was very attentive and were willing to help you out with what ever you needed. But, it was pricey $$$.

Fast forward to February 2017 it all changed! 

I came back with the wife and ate the "Nikei Cebiche" it was excellent, outstanding taste. The music was a light Salsa which made it a romantic dinner. We get the Lomo Saltado, my wife tastes the meat and the soy or oyster was too salty for her. First time I came I tasted the saltyness but my wife confirmed it. We continued eating everything was "chill" and then came the dessert. :-)

As we waited for dessert I noticed they changed the music. It went from a light jazz, salsa, cultural music, to hard rock that just didn't fit the setting. 

We ignored it until we were fed up with listening to loud rock BAR music. 

Look I like the rock don't get me wrong but being PERUVIAN and coming to a PERUVIAN restaurant I would expect you to keep consistent with the music. Sure its okay to change the music for a while but keeping it on just destroyed the mood, ruining the dinner. 

Instead of making me want to stay in the restaurant and talk more perhaps order something else I wanted to just pay and get out. It was a real turn off. Lomo was too pricey here and the quality of service was par. 

If you ever go to Portland, OR go to Andina thats real and authentic, and everything felt great and they had live Latin Music.

I was going to give a 3 but just writing this review got me thinking how PISSED OFF I got when you changed the mood. Oh and PLEASE LEARN WHAT "AJI" is LA MAR.
author: Anthony Q.

description:
I was skeptical of this place because it looked a little touristy, but I'm glad I was sorely mistaken. The service is impeccable. Our server, Michael, was superb. Super attentive and fun. The place filled up quick, so come early or get reservations.

There were three of us at opening and we were promptly seated outside with an amazing view is the water . The wait staff were are super friendly and were quick with a smile and a "Hello". After being seated, they noticed our table was a bit wobbly and they were quick with shims to remedy the problem.

Michael went over our menu in detail and I'm glad he did because there a ton to choose from. The cocktails are amazing! So make sure you get one. Also, if you have the opportunity to sit outside, do it. It's a true experience and the view is amazing.

We had a sampling of the ceviche and it was absolute fantastic. Amazingly fresh and tasty. We went on to have a couple other warm dishes, that were all very good, but the ceviche was the tops.

Don't turn your nose up at it if you pass by thinking its all tourists, granted there were a lot of us, but the service and food are spectacular. Don't miss this one!
author: Janet C.

description: Amazing food, location, service. Cannot complain about a single thing..except its hard to find a reservation cuz they are soo busy
author: Ramani M.

description:
This is probably my first 5 star review of a restaurant. everything was just great - from the restaurant location with the beautiful view of the illuminated bay bridge to the slick restaurant interior, the awesome (upscale Americanized) tasty Peruvian food, interesting selections and beautiful plating to the attentive service. We were told earliest table we could get is 9pm but when we got there at 7 just to check in we were seated really quickly. Had a nice table by the waiting area which we didn't mind as it was quieter compared to packed main dining room.

For appetizers we ordered the pulpo, salmon/shrimp cebiche, a sushi appetizer, empanadas. For entrees we ordered grilled seafood, leg of lamb, pork shoulder, grilled white fish, and another fish dish. Pricey but you get a lot of food compared to other upscale restaurants in sf where portions are tiny.
author: p f.

description:
Ambiance is great.  High ceiling and an open feel.  But all menu items are overpriced.  The special has a scallop appetizer - three medium size (at best) scallops for $29!  Ceviche and skewers tasting items are too expensive for what you get.  Waiter is nice, but he seems to keep pushing for high-priced items on the menu.  We also asked for a window seat, but got seated by a post in between two large windows.  So much for a view ....

Their Pisco Sour is one of the best around here.  I would go back for Pisco Sour during happy hours.
author: nardo m.

description:
Wow! Amazing dining experience!

If you have not been here now is the time to go, book a reservation, camp outside, make it happen.

We are a fan of the Gaston Acurio and have dined at some of his other restaurants so when we found a restaurant of his in San Francisco we were ecstatic. We were not let down, the quality, service, and flavors cannot be beat.

We dined for lunch and were seated right away on the patio. Nice views. Our server was pleasant, personable, and efficient. We chatted and noted that we weren't ceviche fans and he later brought out some seared tuna sample. The flavor was awesome and changed our tune on ceviche.

We ordered the lomo saltado. The meat was tender and cooked just right. I had the Quinoa Chaufa and it was awesome. 

The drinks were good too: pisco sour and maracuya sour.

Make this a priority!
author: Tony H.

description: Wow. One of the best meals I ate on my recent trip to SF.  I highly recommend the Neiki Cebiche! I could seriously eat it three meals a day. There were so many flavors!
author: Catherine G.

description:
Visited this evening.  We were greeted by a fabulous host and had excellent service on the patio.  We ordered the crab and halibut specials SO GOOD!
Service, atmosphere and delicious food make it a great experience.  I suggest they put 2 person tables by the water for a more intimate experience :)
author: Heather B.

description:
This place is spectacular and a favorite in a city of great places!

Cant wait to go back in December
author: Russell F.

description: came here for my birthday dinner with a couple of freinds. the food is pretty good here. I cant call it true Peruvian food. it's more inclined to bay area taste. I'd come back here for the view and happy hour but not dinner. our waiter was polite and actually received free dessert for my birthday.
author: Raquel K.

description: Staff is super friendly, the venue is gorgeous, the drinks amazing, and the food... OMG, can't describe. To say the food is delicious is not enough!!
author: Gabryella S.

description: When coming to a place where I am spending over $100 on dinner for two (price excluding drinks) I expect to be wowed throughout my dining experience. The yucca chips were wow. The appetizers - mushrooms and cheese empanadas and the crab cakes were wow. The main course dishes we ordered (salmon plate and the seafood causa) were both mediocre. It was served lukewarm and flavors were not spectacular. Simply said, with all the hype surrounding this place, I expected much more from the main dish!
author: Noor A.

description: Tasty food. Servers hover over you like hawks. Expensive but nice dinner status.
author: Kelly G.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. The fish is fresher than some sushi bars I've dined at. I love the complementary platano and potato chips they give with ahi. The causas are all delicious, the empanadas are awesome and something I don't usually see in a Peruvian restaurant  (and they don't serve papas a la huancaina. Go figure) I only wish they gave a full pour of wine and more than like an ounce of pisco for a $13 drink. I give an A for food B- for drinks.
author: Tess S.

description: The food gets a five but the service gets a one. This is one of our favorite places to eat but tonight it was a let down. We felt rushed, our waiter was rude, he barely talked to us once, and overall the experience was lackluster. The food arrived before our drinks, in fact the drinks didn't arrive until after our appetizer was finished. The food here is amazing! The empanadas are to die for (I like the corn and my sister like the beef, but I recommend the sampler) and all of the ceviche is very fresh and delicious. As I said, this is one of our favorite places to eat, but tonight the poor service left a bad taste in both our mouths.
author: Lexie J.

description:
Great views of the city and the bay
Food was average
Mushroom empanadas ok
Chicken empanadas ok
Squid ink pasta not good
Ceviche clasico very good
Crab sausa not good
Drinks also average: chilascona

Service was great
author: Jones T.

description: Charming ambiance, friendly and professional staff, delicious food and cocktails. Took my friends from out of town and we all had a great experience.
author: Ipek H.

description: La Mar's menu is just delicious. After travelling through Peru, albeit for a few weeks, what I loved the most was the amazing Ceviche. It was everywhere and it was made from all kinds of fish and other seafood. La Mar almost tasted better than the food in Peru! The restaurant is beautiful; right on the water at the Embarcadero, and the staff was super attentive. They also have a covered deck with comfortable seating to have a few cocktails and look out into the bay. This place is incredible.
author: Noel H.

description: Decided to go and have dinner on a saturday night without previous reservation. We had to wait just a little but they were very accommodating. The food, drinks, ambience and staff was great. Had a wonderful time. We really loved everything about our unplanned date night. We'll for sure come back.
author: Beatrice B.

description: I went here couple weeks back for a friend's birthday party. The waiter was so nice to us! We had a huge champagne bottle that we had brought for our friend and he kept it chilled for us in a ice bucket. He also bought a round of champagne out to celebrate for my friend on the house. The food was incredible. I ordered the whole fish. The presentation was beautiful. My friend ordered the whole shank of beef. I don't eat any meat, but fish, but my friends we're raving about the shank of beef. The only complaint I have is the cocktails were definitely too sweet for my taste. Overall great experience. I definitely want to come back to try their other menu items.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
We decided to go at the last minute, and we're happy they had seats. We started with the special sampler platter at the waiter's suggestion. Being raised in Hawaii, we could've done without the sushi. But, the fish cebiche and casas were pretty good. There was also a scallop dish with delicious corn kernels. Next time, we'll likely just stick with the cebiche options.

We also decided to try the empanadas. All four were great! Crispy outside and really stuffed inside. Each had a different relish/topping to complement the stuffing. The sampler came with one each of mushroom, chicken, beef, and shrimp.

To finish, we shared a dish of a Asian-inspired beef. I don't recall its name. Onions, tomato, beef, a savory soy sauce base... Came with a bowl of rice with large corn kernels. 

We were too stuffed for dessert, but it might make its way too us next time. I'll be back again to try other cebiche and casas for sure.
author: Truc N.

description:
Great location, unfortunately, it's gone downhill. $34 for lomo saltado at lunch, with maybe 4oz of meat, and 1/4 cup of rice, potatoes and half a tomato... really over priced. 

Ambience and service was great, but I won't be returning.
author: Heidi J.

description: We stumbled upon this place and I can say everything (food, service, place, ambiance) was absolutely flawless. A bit pricey but not overpriced. A nice place to take a date to.
author: Andre N.

description: I like this place. Food was good. Service was fast.  Pisco sour, shrimp coquettes, ceviche, and chicken empanadas are my recs.  I will be back!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Came for vday with my boyfriend. We had a late reservation (8:45pm). The valentines menu was a set price of $75 each for a three course meal, appetizer, main entree and dessert. 

Food- 
Appetizer - our first choice was cebiche I love you, but they were out of it. 
Instead we got cause de amor "king crab meat" and anticucho "grilled Spanish octopus". Crab meat was tasty with a zesty lemon flavor. The octopus tasted like well marinated rubber. Really, the marinate was delicious. Octopus, I guess is really chewy. 

Main entree- 
We both got El pescadito because they were out of our first choice-the shrimp plate. 
The dish was served in a kind of stew that tasted like coconut milky curry. Different but good. 

Dessert- 
Ice cream. Honestly I don't even remember the flavors served. I was beyond upset that everything we wanted they were out of and by dessert time, we just got whatever was left in the kitchen. 

Ambiance- beautiful. They had tea light candles everywhere. Really set the mood. 

Service - 
I had to ask twice for things from our waiter and even had to stop other waiters to get what I originally asked our waiter for and he forgot. 

Overall, I rate La mar 3 stars. The food was tasty but the overall experience really killed the special dine out night. 
We mentioned our concerns to the manager and he did take some things off our bill. He also promised us champagne to erase the bad memories. Which unfortunately we waited for 20 minutes after finishing our ice cream dessert and never got. We finally got up and left.
author: Pamela J.

description: Perfection! The atmosphere is great but the food and drinks even better. Great for a date night as all the food is meant to be shared with the robust variety of flavors in each dish. Ceviche mixto, seafood paella, and the tequila/whiskey concoction served us well. Not to mention the amazing desserts.  Tres Leches cake is a must!
author: Chris S.

description:
If you've been wanting to try Peruvian food in a convenient location this is the place!  However, it's a little on the spendy side (until you factor in the San Francisco factor).  4 of us had a cocktail each, a bottle of white wine and then did the sampler platters.  The guys were still hungry at the end of the lunch but the ladies were fine
We sat outside, service was awesome and food was very tasty!
author: David F.

description:
This is a wonderfully spacious piece of South America in the middle of Embarcadero. The ambiance is chic casual. It is rustic, yet modern. The kitchen is open and you can hear the conversations, the sizzling sounds of sautéing, and a wonderful aroma of delicious food being prepared. What a culinary delight!

We ordered the empanadas, chicken and beef. They were both delicious but the beef was especially remarkable. I am a big fan of salty and sweet, and adding raisins to the beef was plain brilliant in my humble opinion.

The Lomo Saltado was phenomenal. Cooked to perfection, oyster sauce, fries, softest meat. You can tell right away La Mar is focusing on quality. I also had the short ribs with Kale and polenta. It was absolutely delicious too. These were about $34 each for a rather small serving so I was a tad disappointed. 

They have also skewers, coupled with sweet potatoes for those watching their waist. Service was on point, friendly, fast and efficient. 

Definitely a delightful experience all around.
author: Monique T.

description: Excellent food and service. All the food and drinks we ordered were perfect, so was the hospitality of everyone. This has been the best dining experience of the year so far for me, and one of the best ever! Its not easy to maintain the stellar quality in the Embercadero area, which is crowded with lots of quality restaurants. Keep it up, La Mar!!
author: Arnab R.

description: The view is great, although I have to say the prices are pretty steep for lunchtime (even considering the Embarcadero). The choufa, two pisco sours (which I highly recommend), and an appetizer were very flavorful, and combined with the Bay view--made for an enjoyable lunch with my girlfriend.
author: Nancy W.

description: A fantastic collection of Peruvian and Spanish cuisine. Great collection of cocktails, and drinks. Loved the ceviche, just delicious and melts in your mouth. The service is great, order processing takes a bit of time but totally worth it. If it bright and sunny, ask to be seated outside, nice waterfront experience with amazing food will make your day. We went there for a team lunch - were 9 of us, ordered a whole bunch of things and had a great time.
author: Rohit K.

description: My friends and I have been wanting to try this place out for awhile after hearing such GREAT things about it. So we decided to go last night to celebrate our friendship and have a good catch up session over drinks/dinner. Not only was the ambiance beautiful, the drinks (I had the Summer Splash) and food were AMAZING! All 4 of us had our own meals (EVERYTHING was delicious) and ceviche sampler (highly recommend!); we had 2 mousse desserts- so incredible. This place did not disappoint! We had a wonderful time and I would definitely return for a special occasion or just a random weekday night out!
author: Shilps S.

description:
First of all Yelp, you saved my but. It was my first wedding anniversary and we were vacationing in San Francisco. 

I didn't have a place picked out for dinner and Yelp reviewers came to my rescue again. 

La Mar provided a perfect setting, upscale yet comfortable, lots of space and friendly staff. 
A beautiful and simply design space with vivid colors and art set's the mood for Peruvian culture as does the menu. 

If you're going for drinks, you have to have a pisco sour, the national drink of Peru. 

As for food, we did a peruvian style sashimi to start - AMAZING. 

Two entrees followed and both were fantastic. I had plancha marina, which I can best describe as a Peruvian paella, with prawns, octopus, and a whole lot more of wonderful fresh seafood. 

If you need a place for a special night out in San Fran, La Mar is a contender!
author: Ryan R.

description: For anyone who loves Peru and misses the food, this place will be a hit. Flavorful, tasty, nice portions, ceviches, empanadas and lomo saltado ( you must try and best in SF). Sangria is great and so is Pisco Sour. It's pricey so kep that in mind but worth the coin. Great for birthday or special date.
author: Vee L.

description: We loved our dining experience here!  The menu can seem a little complicated because they draw from several influences, but our server was excellent, and steered us towards several delicious choices. An amazing range of flavors, all very vibrant and drool-worthy.  A re-visit is in order!
author: Tari N.

description:
Some excellent dishes, great service, and beautiful setting.

Starting with the good, I am totally addicted to the Vegetable Chaufa with Seafood add on. Its very good, and you get a generous serving. I hope they never take this off the menu.

I also love the Tiradito Passion, Raw salmon with aji amarillo passion fruit leche de tigre. It is fairly sweet, but still very good.

The empanadas are just average. I much prefer the empanadas at the empanada stand in the ferry building.

The complimentary plantains are great if your are eating in, but you don't get them with takeout.
author: David T.

description: Great! I wish it was cheaper so that I can eat more! It's expensive but comparable to Peru, so now you don't have to travel there :)
author: Dee N.

description:
La Mazing La Mar. Been to this location a couple times and the original one in Lima, Peru. It's in the Embarcadero with a view of the water. They start you off with complimentary plantain and sweet potato chips with two sauces/salsas to dip them in. They're so good you just can't stop eating them.

Ordered the Ceviche Mixto, delicious ceviche with yellowtail, calamari and shrimp. The Causas Limea's are amazing. It's a potato and avocado purée topped with Dungeness crab and quail egg. Your mouth may never be the same after tasting such food perfection. Ended it with the carne empanada, which also packs great flavor. A little pricey for 2 small empanadas but worth it to experience the taste. 

Service is excellent, view is great. Would recommend going to the original one in Peru if you are ever there. Same great taste and service, but at Peruvian prices so about 1/3 the cost.
author: Josh T.

description:
Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.La Mar was a great date place! I went on a Saturday night around 7:15pm, and sat in the patio area. I wish the weather was nicer, but it was quite gloomy and cold outside. We sat underneath heaters though, which was great. The restaurant wasn't too busy until 8:00pm. The patio had a more quiet, romantic ambiance - perfect for a date. The inside was a more lively  - better for larger groups and social gatherings.

Food:
1. The banana chips and sauce were amazing and complimentary! 
2. Classic ceviche tasted so good. Possibly my most favorite dish of the night. The fish was extremely fresh, and the acidity was spot on. Initially, I imagined this ceviche dish to be a salsa for chips, but the dish was a decent sized fish dish - no chips! It didn't need the chips at all. 
3. La Mar Arroz was pretty tasty. I liked the variety of seafood included.
4. Octopus skewer dish was okay. My boyfriend and I weren't the biggest fans. I liked the salad and mashed potatoes that it came with though.

Drinks:
I ordered the passion daquiri. I loved it! I could barely taste the alcohol, but still felt it throughout the meal. I would definitely order it again. 

Service:
Our waiter was very sweet and attentive. He described the dishes well and checked in on us often.

Very pricey though. I would go again during HH. 

Note: only service dogs are allowed.
author: Maritess A.

description:
If you're looking for ambiance over they quality of food I would say this is the place for you!

I went lady and they sat us outside by the water. You must make a reservation to get this  seating. On a warm summer day you can't really beat this place.

When it comes to the food, nothing really stands out except for their salsa and banana chips. If you're looking for seafood you can head about two miles down and find a better selection and fisherman's wharf.

The ceviche I had was extremely underwhelming and was a bit too sour. I love ceviche and this place just didn't do any justice. This place is more of a pricey restaurant so I was expecting more than the usual when it comes to seafood flavor. Good food but not great.

Really nice bar in the front just in case you have to wait for your table. Good place for those financial workers downtown, but you can find better flavor of you look for places deeper in the city. Good good but I would just come here for the outdoor seating.
author: Reliford B.

description:
The major draw when looking for Peruvian food... The lomo saltado... This place targeted that craving and hooked us in. 

The location is great being right on the embarcadero. That can be both a good thing and bad. Good area to explore but the parking... Yikes. Plus you have to pay on weekends now. So no reprieve there. There's bar area prior to entering the main restaurant. The host is cozied up along the side in the hall. Kind of confusing because it wasn't set up like a typical host booth. We got checked in just fine though. 

The restaurant itself looks great. The color scheme had a sure beach color scheme going. Blues and whites and dark table settings. Modern styling. After ordering they provide fried potatoes, like thick potato chips, instead of bread. It comes with garlic aoili of course. We ordered the lomo saltado and the octopus. Both were very good and full of flavor. Portions are generous. Lomo saltado was plenty. My wife couldn't finish it on her own. Thick cuts of beef, tender, and full of flavor. The octopus, the tentacle to be exact, was thick and flavorful. Came with garnishes of potato stacked and decorated for appeal. All very good. 

Would I come back... Maybe not. The pricing was definitely high but the ambiance was nice. Don't have to dress up to feel fancy. Portions are good and the food wasn't bad at all.
author: Jay V.

description: 4th time here. Great food, service and atmosphere. and it was really empty on a rainy Saturday lunch time! They also make an amazing Pisco sour
author: Effi F.

description:
surprisingly nice flavors, excited to come back

LOVED

LIKED
complimentary potato chip w/ nice dip
kabocha soup
ceviche mixto
shrimp linguini
quinoa salad w/ shrimp

DECENT

BAD
short rib stew
tres leches cake
author: Mark D.

description: Wonderful dinner experience at La Mar!  We did a client dinner with vegetarians and non-vegetarians.  Options for everyone which were all delicious!  The ambience, open/air patio and ocean breeze were awesome!  Also, excellent wine list and cocktail menu!  Highly recommend for anyone!
author: Duryea R.

description:
Been here several times and I've always liked the food but the service has never been good. I feel like they put no effort into their service. The ceviches are delicious as is their grilled octopus with the potato purée. They also have a great fried rice which we love. The empanadas are perfect albeit a bit pricy for what it is. They may be the best empanadas in the city but still pricy. 

The cocktails are good and decently priced for this restaurant and space but it takes forever to get refills. It's rather annoying that it can take between 20-30 minutes between drinks. Also it takes forever to get anyone to take orders, get water glasses filled and no one checks on you. It's not like that this is the first time this has happened - continues to happen and I see a ton of reviews with the same exact feelings and feedback but nothing has changed. It's literally the bare minimum that they do. 

So I say 4.5 stars for food. 
2 stars for service
4 stars for ambience
author: Rohan D.

description:
I've been here for dinner and it was a good experience with good food so I expected something similar for Happy Hour but what a disappointment.
The drinks including a sangria, blue mule, and gin gimlet were all disappointments. No distinctness in any of the drinks, little alcohol, and each had a funny after taste. I finished them because I paid $6-7 each so I could not waste my hard earned $.
The appetizer was a bit better with the tuna burger (more like slider, false advertising), cebiche clasico (as you would expect and thus not necessarily a disappoint), and the mushroom empanada (this also was good but I got one empanada for $6). Appetizer portions are small so beware the price to quantity ratio. 
Lastly, service was inconsistent. One bartender was friendly and the others either never acknowledge you or not very approachable.
In summary, NO GO!
author: David H.

description: Can't beat the bayside location.  Oh wait, you can bet it with an incredible menu.  Foodie quality dishes from apps to entrees.  Attentive service and a solid value.
author: Ed J.

description: Oh man so good! Couldn't understand the server cause he talked very fast and it was kind of loud in the restaurant. But I did do some research on this place before I went so that helped out a lot! That and looking around at other people's plates. Drinks were delicious too! Can't wait to go back!
author: Kelli C.

description:
Worst service ever. We are currently sitting at the bar, and it's like pulling teeth to get anyone to pay attention and take an order. The attitude is deep today. The female bartender couldn't be less interested in helping or even saying hi. 
We've been here many times before, but this Friday is a joke. Usually the bartenders are on point and friendly, but tonight, not so much.
author: H. M.

description:
Best lunch of my life! I cannot believe how fresh, flavorful, and unique this place is! 

It only helps how beautiful the painting and decor is within the premises of the spacious area, and the outdoor seating deck has gorgeous, sweeping views of the bay and the city!

The ceviches are to die for, as well as everything else on the menu. I'd highly recommend coming with a group so you can try several shared plates because it's all too good!
author: Meaghan H.

description:
I was in the mood for some delish Peruvian food and my friend suggested La Mar. She gave me a heads up that while delicious, it would also be somewhat pricey. She was correct on both counts. 

There was a lot on the menu to choose from, but we were seated at the bar so we took in pretty casually. Just ordering as we felt like it. The night started with two different kinds of ceviches- I ordered the classic and thought it was pretty good. Fishy, sour, and decent amount. My friend ordered another ceviche (I'm not sure which) and that was good too. We kept the orders up with some of the other dishes, including skewers. Pretty good!

We saw the bartender constantly pouring pisco sours for thirsty patrons and I can tell you that people have the right idea here. Those piscos were pretty good and went well with the food. The damage at the end was around $50 but well worth it. It's a fancy place along the Embarcadero so make sure to get a reservation just in case!
author: Philip W.

description:
La Mar Cebicheria Peruana cannot missed if you were either a tourist visiting SF for the first time or a local Bay Area native walking along the piers. I have always been immediately skeptical of places that cater to tourists so my expectations were very low when our large party was able to secure reservations here on a weekend.


The first thing I noticed is how airy and spacious the dining room felt. The bar and lounge area was quite large as well. I can imagine this restaurant being able to accommodate large parties.

Our waiter quickly greeted us and I ordered the Peruvian soda which was fruity and refreshing. Definitely recommend it if you like sodas.
We shared a few dishes and the Cebiche La Mar stood out for the freshness, tanginess, and quality of seafood. Both the Arroz Negro which had grilled shrimp and calamari, and the Pulpo which was Octopus based were average and not yummy to my tummy. 

Service overall wasn't that good throughout the night. The waiter had to re-confirm our order and our water glasses were not filled until we asked for them to be filled. All in all, I probably wouldn't come back anytime soon. There just is too much competition in SF for space in my tummy.
author: Angela L.

description: Been here a few times and it never disappoints. We ordered: pulpo anticuchos which was very good with a decent amount of crisp octopus and tasty greens;  croqueta de chupe (shrimp croquettes) which had a nice amount of shrimp; and misto cebiche which was also very good. We did find a hair towards the end and our waitress not only offered to get us a new cebiche or a dessert and we decided on neither, so she comped the cebiche. Very much appreciated!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Came here for happy hour 10 minutes before 6pm (when their happy hour ends).  I made an order for a couple of appetizers  and a drink, and the bartender proceeds to take my menu away from me.  I asked to keep the menu since my friend had not arrived, and he proclaims "happy hour is over", even though we had 6 minutes left.  My friend arrives at 5:58, and asks for the menu, and tries to order 2 drinks before end of happy hour, and our bartender proclaims that happy hour drinks are one per person.  I don't know if this is restaurant/bar policy at La Mar, or if the bartender was just being an ass, however, I've never been at a place where they had a one drink per person policy.  Needless to say, I will avoid La Mar in the future.  There are plenty of other happy hour spots on the embarcadero.
author: m k.

description: It's hard to find a place with good Peruvian cuisine or at least that's the case in New York. My boyfriend told me about this place and it seemed interesting! It's right on the pier so I suggest you sit in the outside dining area where you can see the beautiful water and feel the nice breeze. The first dish we ordered was the ceviche tasting which comes with 3 of their ceviches. I suggest ordering this if you haven't been here before because all their ceviches are great! We then ordered the limena causa. I've never seen purple potato before and never heard of it but it's my new favorite thing! We ordered a few more dishes because the portions aren't crazy big. Order their pisco sours! My first drink was made with more pisco than I would like but the second one I ordered was perfect. My boyfriend who is Peruvian and tried their restaurant in actual Peru enjoyed all the dishes and said it was just as good! La Mar please come to New York!!!!! Or come back because the did have a restaurant here but closed. Until then I will be dreaming about your purple potatoes and ceviches!
author: Ashley N.

description:
Having only been here before for drinks, I wondered if La Mar would be just another great looking restaurant serving subpar food in SF.  And in all fairness, when I say great looking, I do mean great looking.  Walk out onto the deck & it's like you've walked right into a Travel & Leisure magazine cover.  But after finally having lunch here, I can tell you La Mar did not disappoint.  
The food...
The causas:
Dungeness crab, tuna tartare, & the octopus.  All delicious, but the octopus was off the hook.  Easily my favorite.

The empanadas:
Chicken stew.  So good.  Will order again.

This was only lunch, & a light one at that, without dessert.  But we left sated & more than happy.  Having a great meal like this outside on the water does a lot for the morale.  Both aesthetically & food wise La Mar crushes it.  This is the way to do lunch.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I went here last week for lunch. Service was pretty lacking. Our waiter didn't come around much, and he never gave us more plantain chips after we asked =(. Despite this, the food was really great and beautifully plated.

Ceviche Mercado (4/5) - Perfect level of acid and nice fish

Lomo Saltado (3/5) - Pretty good, but I think that it needed a bit more oomph, and the beef was a bit dry.

Tiradito Verde (4.5/5) - Visually stunning. Nice mix of creamy, fresh, and acidic.

Pulpo Anticuchos (4/5) - Well cooked octopus with a tasty sauce
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Celebrating the Mr's BDay week, we gathered fun friends for a Peruvian evening

Happy Hour Pisco Sours to start!  Nice & tart w/ lots of foamy egg whites & at $6 a pop, they were a bargain!  Buddy got their Raspberry Gimlet & it was outstanding as well.  The raspberry really helped to mask the harsh taste of the gin & this was a drinky I'd order for myself

Dinner was out on the patio this time & it was very pleasant being on the water & I especially appreciated having it all covered w/ the heat lamps going!

Appies for the table included the Veggie Causas which were 2 dollops of potato w/ diced beets on top.  Very nice pairing & a refreshing couple of bites.

Also shared the Mushroom Empanadas - these were awesome  Lots of mushrooms in a tangy sauce that had just a bit of spice

Entrees included:
Buddy #1 got the mahi mahi w/ sweet potato raviolis & went ape over the raviolis - he was very impressed

Buddy #2 got another potato causa appie but hers had shredded seafood on top.... but she didn't realize it'd be so small, even when the waiter told her it was an appie so after everything arrived, she quickly ordered more mushroom empanadas for herself

Mr & I got the Veggie Quinoa & it was incredible - lots of brown & red quinoa w/ a bit of everything thrown into the wok.....we saw broken noodles, peapods, broccoli, peppers, you name it, it was probably in there & it was delish!

Washed it all down w/ a nice Pinot Grigio - it was BDay heaven!

The BDay Boy had his own Profiterole & Buddy #1 got the Chocolate Mousse - made w/ dark chocolate, white chocolate & passion fruit, this was more of a cake kind of thing rather than a pudding like mousse but he totally loved it as well 

So another successful, fun, enjoyable BDay Week celebration - achieved!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I don't review too often but I felt compelled to leave one after my experience here at La Mar. I visited this restaurant with my family for Mother's Day and we were expecting to have a nice family dinner. We arrived at the restaurant and were sat in about 15 minutes. For arriving without a reservation and having 7 people in our party, this wasn't bad. The experience took a turn after we took our seats. Our waiter took about 20 minutes to greet us and when he finally did he said he'd give us time to browse the menu and decide on drinks and entrees. Another 20 minutes go by and he finally takes our order. About 45 minutes later he comes back and tells us that two of our orders can't be completed because "they're out of salmon". I came for the ceviche and unfortunately I never got to try it. I was shocked that it took the waiter this long to tell me my order couldn't be completed. I asked for a menu to decide on another item and had to wait another 10 min for his return, I actually ordered through another waiter who was in our area. I ordered the Mar y Montaña. After waiting nearly 2 hours for our food to arrive I was greeted by a ridiculously baron plate. I had two laughable sizes of swordfish in my plate, no zucchini (which was included with the entree) and the fried egg which I specifically said I did not want. Thank goodness I'm not allergic to eggs or that'd be another hour of waiting. They also forgot one of our party members' ceviche, which quite frankly wasn't even worth the extra 15 minute wait, and we all basically ended up eating at different times. All in all the small portion of swordfish I did have was delicious I cannot lie, but the service was abysmal to say the least. I won't be returning here again and I advise you to stay away if you prefer a decent dining experience. One of the guests at our table left after the waiter came back and said his order of salmon could also not be completed. Apparently there's a good burger joint around the corner, you might want to give that a shot. You'll probably get better service at a fraction of the cost. 

**OVERALL: 
Ceviche - Abysmal. Severely lacked lemon or any flavor, covered in onions and literally served with about 6 mediocre squared slices of fish. 

Mar Y Montaña - Two of the thinnest, and smallest slices of swordfish ever served, although the flavor was great. Claimed to have zucchini but it wasn't served with it, and the potato was ok. 

Empanadas - Beef and Chicken. Awful. Let's just leave it at that. 

Anticuchos - Tried the chicken, steak and fish. They were honestly just ok. 

DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME HERE! WAY OVERPRICED AND FLAVORLESS.
author: Baby D.

description:
I was torn on weather to give 3 or 4 stars for this review and here's why. Some of the food was a 5 but majority of the meal was a 3. The service was a 4. The atmosphere was a 4. The cleanliness of the bathrooms was a 2. So it was a little bit all over the board. 

Our experiment started off great. We loved the atmosphere. From the decor to the setting to the location. It was great. My only complaint was that the chairs were uncomfortable. But I loved their color pallet. It was very fresh and clean feeling. That was until you got to the restrooms. It was toward the end of the night but the restrooms were pretty gross. There was rolls of toilet paper all over the floor. Their was a strange mildew odor on top of a port-a-potty smell. There were leaks of water on the ground. It was not well kept. 

Anyway, the food was more of a roller coaster. Some highs and some lows. I will say this, you could tell the exceptional quality of the products. All the ingredients were fresh and very high end. 

We stared with a tuna dish (I forget what it's called). It was served on top of potatoes. It had some spicy sauce on the side. It was delicious. A 10 out of 5. It sort of reminded me of sushi flavors. We also ordered the cebiche mixto. Maybe it was simply the wrong choice (they offered like 7 different type of cebiche) but it was very bland. There wasn't a whole lot of flavor to the fish. The fish was very good quality. The calamari were soft and not chewy at all. But there just wasn't any real flavor. 

The drinks were great. My moms drink was on the sweet/fruit side but really good. It was served in a chilled glass with flower peddles. I ordered the pisco punch. It had a great flavor. It was mixed nicely. I wasn't fond of the nutmeg but that was just personal preference. 

Based on many yelp recommendations we tried the empanadas Sampler. The shells were cooked very well. The dough must be made from scratch. It was cooked so well. Nice and crispy.  The filling however was just "off". We like a bold flavor to our food. We like a little spice but all the empanadas seemed to lack seasoning. We also tried a steak fish that was just ok.  

I would definitely go back for the tuna fish and drinks. I would also give another cebiche a chance.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Had dinner here with friends the other night before heading to the Science of Cocktails event at the Exploratorium. 

It's a great looking space. I love the open kitchen layout. Big restaurant, too. It seemed to just keep going.

The menu looked great, with lots of Peruvian specialties. I didn't pay too close attention because my friend ordered for the table.

Drinks were tasty and well prepared.

The food was good, but very little of what we ordered was great. For the prices they're charging, I was expecting to be blown away, and I just wasn't. I've had better food of this style in Redwood City at approximately half the price. 

Service was spotty. Our waitress was pretty good but the drinks took forever to arrive. When food was delivered, we didn't often get an explanation of what it was.

So my overall impression is that this place was fine, but it's way too expensive for the quality of food and service.
author: Jason G.

description: Excellent food.  Too noisy environment and music too loud or would get 5 stars. The potato and crab dish and the classic cebiche were very good with nice presentation.  Service was very good.
author: Paul And Helen K.

description:
The service was comically bad. We were truly laughing about it with other bar patrons. It was as if we did not exist and then everything took forever once it was ordered.
The food was good and the drinks were good too once we got them. But we were minutes from happy hour and chose to leave because we could not imagine sitting and waiting one more second.
For drinks, I had the Cholito and Hubs had the Capitan. Both were good (mine was better) but at $12 each- meh- I don't think it was worth the price tag.
We decided on the Chef's Sampler which was a great idea. It came with a tasting of Causa, Cebiche, a rice and seafood dish, and gelato. All of it was wonderful. I had never had causa before and it was my favorite part.
It's good but expensive and since the service was horrible, we wouldn't return.
author: Andrea K.

description: Nice service and excellent selection of Empanadas, Ceviche and seafood. Pricey for the portion sizes but the location explains why. We had a nice Albarino wine to pair with a mix of there three major foods and all were very good. I would return again to try some other items in the future.
author: Mark L.

description: Great food. Excellent ambience. I have been there several times, and it is always high quality.  I especially like their ceviche and causas.  But really, everything is fantastic.
author: Peter P.

description: We are there because we couldn't get in elsewhere. The cerviche was good and the causa was too.  My main dish, loma saltado was not good.  There was too much sauce and it tasted like it came out of a bottle.  Staff seem very disorganized, they didn't look happy.
author: Teresa S.

description:
I absolutely love La Mar. I've been to this restaurant in three other countries and the food is up to par. The happy hour has changed and so I am reviewing their new menu on this post.

Happy hour is 3-6 pm. 

Drinks: if you want something authentic try a pisco sour. It is sour, very strong and has egg white foam (completely safe to eat). After 2 piscos you will certainly feel it. Cusquenas are the traditional beers in Peru. For $3 during happy hour, it's worth the try. The wine selection is okay...but seriously people don't come to La Mar for wine.

Happy hour menu: my favorite ceviche is the ceviche Classico. It's fish and calamari and some habanero. The ceviche mixto (yellow) comes with the same thing as the Classico but they add shrimp. This one has no spice to it. I order both and then see which one deserves a second order. 

The chips and plantains are no longer free during happy hour but for $4 it's worth the snack. They come with two delicious aji sauces. 

Still on the menu were the empanadas- beef, chicken or shrimp. We ordered one chicken. It was about 5 inches long and 4 inches wide for $6. I would rather order more ceviche. For us it wasn't worth it...I remember when they cost $3. 

New on the menu is a pork (carnitas) taco. It's gluten free (lettuce wrap) and every bite was so delicious! The pork was tender and marinated with a sweet and sour sauce. Absolutely delicious! 

Also new was a calamari dish topped with avocado. Doesn't come with a sauce and the batter was too salty. For $9 it certainly wasn't worth it. 

Conclusion: the new menu is very small but has the old items that are always good and some new ones to try. My only wish is that they would bring back causas on the happy hour menu.
author: Daisy G.

description: Our go-to place for ceviche, sorbet and wonderful service. Everything is fresh, and tasty. Cool atmosphere and not hard to get in for lunch or dinner, which is surprising because it's always packed. I have some dietary restrictions, and they are not only accommodating, what they bring me is so tasty and delicious, they should put it on the menu. Love this place.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Not a pleasant experience for a birthday celebration!

We have gone to La Mar over the years many times and liked it. However last night we had a terrible experience. For a birthday dinner we booked a group of 10 for 8:30pm days before. When we arrived we asked if we can add more chair, and they offered another table for 8:45pm. We waited to be seated until almost 10pm. The drinks didn't come until 10:30pm so we waited 30mins after ordering first round of drinks. Half of the group got the drinks and rest waited even longer for a bottle of wine! Part of the table got their food at 11pm and the rest at 11:30pm. Also food was extra salty!We could leave at 12pm! Oh since we were a large group we had to pay 20% tip for terrible experience and food. Never again!
author: Ergin E.

description: I took my Mom out for an early Mother's day lunch last weekend. The server took maybe 10 minutes to greet us at our table. Once he did, I told him that I had a few allergies (gluten and cilantro) that could not be on my plate. We found something I could order and he told me he was going to make sure there was no cilantro. He brought my appetizer, a ceviche, and told me there was no cilantro in it. As I started serving it onto my plate, my Mom and I both saw that there was clearly chopped cilantro in the entire thing. Once my main course came out, there was a HUGE sprig of cilantro on top, almost as if it was a sick joke. We pointed both out to the server and he got annoyed. His response was "its not like its cooked in the meal, you can just pick it out." Really? With an allergy? He then proceeded to ignore us the entire rest of the meal, did not make eye contact the rest of the time, and also charged us full price for our whole meal. Oh, we ordered two drinks and he brought the wrong ones as well. Over all, we were very disappointed that he did not respect my allergies nor did he even care to address it when there was clearly a bunch of the specific item visibly IN my dishes. Really horrible experience and no good customer service to follow it up.
author: Laily M.

description:
We ended up at La Mar by accident, and it only after I'd phoned to book a table that I realised it was kinda pricey. Thankfully my dining companions forgave me pretty quickly! I'd picked here for two reasons: chicken wings and ceviche. Annoyingly, they didn't seem to have chicken wings even though they feature in a few reviews, I think they're just a bar snack. 

We were seated outside on the deck which was just magical. This place is seriously lovely in terms of decor and a nice relaxed vibe. I enjoyed the food - the ceviche was just lovely, the causas were pretty interesting (although really small!) and for main, I had arroz la mar which was just epic. A really lovely dish packed with seafood and bursting with flavour. 

The reason this place loses a star was the attitude of the staff who at times were a little hostile/unhelpful. Table service in the bar was super slow, they got annoyed that we paid the bar/restaurant bill all together and generally, didn't make me feel like I should rush back. Just lucky the food/view was good.
author: Briony C.

description:
Overall: Excellent!

First of all, I recommend getting a reservation.  If you need to wait, there is a welcoming bar available.  The drink and wine menus are accommodating and extensive.  

The menu is a bit overwhelming (perhaps because half of it is not in English), but our waiter helpfully explained that the left side of the menu are cold plates and the right side are served hot.  This was helpful and we decided to try 2 of each type.  Our waiter was quite charming, sharp, and a pleasure to talk to.  

A generous basket of mixed plantain, sweet potato, and cassava, chips were served to munch on along with two tasty creamy dips.  We decided to have a lighter dinner/very heavy snack.  We tried four tapas-style plates.  They were all excellent!  Our tapas plates included:  

cebiche clásico (house ceviche):  definite must.  A crisp and fresh start.  the dish includes California Halibut  with red onion, habanero, along with Peruvian corn and yam 

causa nikei (tuna tartar):  simply delicious.  Fresh, light, and full of flavor

empanada sampler:  3 small empanada plate that allows for a brief tasting of chicken, mushroom, and beef flavors

causa limeña (Dungeness Crab on top of a yellow potato with
avocado purée, quail egg, cherry tomatoes, and a special sauce):  this plate was my favorite of the night.  The crab was fried to perfection and the accompanying ingredients complimented it so nicely.  

I'm anxious to check out the lunch specials and brunch!  Also, a happy hour menu of drinks and small plates is available Monday - Friday from 3-6.  I will certainly be back!
author: Andrea H.

description:
Last night was a terrible experience! We celebrated our friend's birthday but it wasn't pleasant. We talked about how bad the experience throughout the night rather than having fun!
First, we were seated 1 hour and 45 minutes late. (We had a reservation done weeks ago - we just asked to add 2 more chairs) We were a party of 12 people and we were given table close to the restroom and entrance. Second, the server was definitely not experienced. Our foods and drink arrived late and we left the place at 11:45. The price is definitely not worthed. They even included 20% tip, seriously WTF is that? That was the most terrible service I have ever had. I'm not going back to this place again. It's way overrated and food wasn't decent either.
author: Ilker A.

description:
As said in the previous review, I very much enjoyed the lunch salmon dish and, as this restaurant is kind of out of the way for me after hours, I decided to take advantage of the last day of the SF restaurant week.
I ordered the ceviche and the salmon, of course. Ceviche was ok, nothing to write home there - very citrusy and small but the two dishes make up for the right amount of food for a lunch. So, as the ceviche goes, I certainly have seen better. The big surprise was the salmon - first, it took very long to come - or, at lease, longer than the first time. And when it came, the fish was not well cooked but, the most important, sauce did not have same taste or much of a taste, put simply. So, at the end of the day, the plantain chips and the dip was what I enjoyed most. Note that the food was not bad but it is clearly inconsistent and consistency is very important here...not sure who would want to spend time and money in a restaurant whose food is a  unpredictable hit and miss...
author: VIORICA C.

description:
My friends and I kind of just stumbled upon La Mar, and even though we didn't have reservations, we didn't wait too long to be seated, which was pretty fortuitous for us.

The restaurant itself is gorgeous - spacious, color coordinated, airy, etc. Our server was great at explaining how the menu was laid out, and we ordered 4 dishes to split among 3 people; complimentary plantain chips supplemented our meal.

I'll be upfront: portion sizes here are more akin to tapas, even the main dishes. Had we been famished, it definitely wouldn't have been enough food.

DEFINITELY order the ceviche - in fact, I highly recommend the sampler plate so that you can try more of what La Mar is most known for.

We also had a mixed seafood plate that was vaguely reminiscent of Chinese stirfry (in a good way) and fried yucca - fluffy puffs of deliciousness! I personally would skip the skewers (anticuchos) - not a lot of bang for your buck.

I know I shouldn't be too critical of the quantity for the price, but you REALLY need to be aware of how much food you'll actually get when you order - the bill will rack up pretty quickly!

Otherwise, prepare for tapas-style dining and experience plenty of different Peruvian-influenced flavors.
author: Jerry C.

description:
I went here for happy hour, and I thought it was good.  The prices for the drinks were decent.  I wish I could say the same for the food.  My ceviche was really small.  I took a bite and it was gone.

The seating is first come, first serve, so it can get cramped and competitive really quickly.  I was fortunate to get seats for me and my three girlfriends, especially since we didn't come at the same time.

It's a beautifully decorated restaurant with great views of the East Bay.  And the food is good too.  I'll probably come back again for lunch and dinner, which will be my final verdict on La Mar.
author: Vira P.

description:
My review of this place is for the bar, I did not get a chance to eat at the restrauant of this place, seeing the great reviews if it... maybe It should had been best. 

The bar is okay, their selection is limited and decent. Their bartenders are horribly slow!! 5 drinks took 10-15 minutes to make, I guess?

Overall, would not go to the bar here! Definitely will add into my list of places to eat though.
author: -Johnson- N.

description: Came for the ceviche (which was delightful) but fell in love with the salmon nigiri and tiradito. The complimentary plantain chips and sauce are bomb
author: Ingrid A.

description: Suspected food poisoning that affected four of us after dining there on 1/4/18. I gave them a chance to take accountability and they denied any possible involvement. I read in another review that someone's husband got food poisoning while dining there on NYE and another source shared with me they also got sick after eating there on NYE. I've eaten here multiple times. The food had been good in the past and the ambiance beautiful, but the side effects were painful. I held a meeting in San Francisco and the only people who came down with the same violent symptoms at the same time were the four of us who ate at La Mar. I don't like to complain, but this is a health hazard. I want others to be aware of the possibility of getting sick. The dishes all four of us ate were the ceviche tasting and the paella. Dine at your own risk.
author: Heather D.

description:
This was not my first time at La Mar, so I thought it was time to write a review! If you've never tried Peruvian food or drinks the first thing that might come to your mind when you here "Peru" is probably Machu Picchu or Lamas, but I guarantee you that's going to change after you visit La Mar, especially if you try their Pisco Sour (All bets are off if you have more than three of these delicious cocktails since you will be likely to forget your address!). Any how, if you are visiting for the first time, try to order as many small plates as you can so that you get to sample a wider range of tastes. Order a couple Cebiches or Empanadas (the sampler is a good option). The salads are great (try anything with quinoa in it!). If after trying a few small plates you still have room (very unlikely scenario!), try any of the fish dishes for main course. For dessert ask for the specials. There is always something good on the menu for the day, but do not underestimate the quality of their coffee! I am not sure where they get the beans from, but it smells and tastes awesome!

The service is excellent. Every single time I have visited, I have received great service. The servers are always very knowledgeable and helpful if you need to know more about the items on the menu.

And the view! If you make a reservation and it is a nice day, you probably want to sit in the back porch where you have a nice view of the bay. Gaston Acurio has aced this one!
author: Afshin A.

description: We arrived a bit late due to late flight arrival but we were nicely greeted and were seated within 5 min. Great service, but we're not impressed with the food, the establishment was clean and ambiance energetic. Not sure I would go back but glad I experience Peruvian dishes.
author: Sandra N.

description:
Came here for happy hour after work with some friends and grabbed some ceviche and pisco sours at the bar in the front. They also serve chips which are a combo of plantain and sweet/potato chips. These go down really well with the two sauces that they're paired with. Old Fashioneds were also served on the menu, and they're good, but if you've never tried a Pisco Sour, then definitely get that. It's Pisco (peruvian brandy), ice, lime juice, simple syrup, bitters, and beaten egg whites. The blended egg whites create a foamy layer of froth on the top of the drink that adds a pretty unique touch to the cocktail. 

The restaurant in the back looked nice but we only stayed in the front for the happy hour specials.
author: Jerry Y.

description:
4.5 Stars
One of my favorite type of foods is Peruvian, so I was pretty exited to try this place out. I'm sure there might be less expensive places to try, but because I was celebrating my birthday, I really wanted to come here. Also, I had given up eating any kind of red meat, (for Lent) so eating here would be no problem with the countless seafood dishes!

Here's what we had:

Cebiche mixto: 
Sooo flavorful. Every bite was fantastic!

Causa Nikei:
I've never had a dish like this and I was not sure what to expect. As soon as I "dived" in with my spoon (didn't know how to eat it!) and tasted it, I was sooo happy. Everything about it was delicious. Even the tiny bits of nori made it so much tastier. 

Antichuco Pulpo:
Never been someone to eat octopus. After eating this, I wanted to learn how to make it. (Of course it's never the same when you try to copy a restaurant dish.) The octopus so sooo tender and it had that grilled taste that I can never replicate. Delicious!! And served with whipped potatoes and those cute "corn nuts". 

As for my main dish, I asked for some suggestions from our server and I probably should've went with my original choice. (Which my hubby ended up getting. Wouldn't wanna get the same dish as him anyway.) I got the Salmon Fusion aside from the salmon being cooked perfectly (with nice, crunchy edges) I thought it was just a "basic" thai-tasting dish. Meh. 
My hubby's dish was a 10/10! Plancha De Mariscos!! Definitely a seafood lover's dream!!  The portion size did not disappoint! Large pieces of octopus!! 

As for service, I hate to say it, it wasn't that great. Service was extremely slow that night. Our drinks came pretty late- into our second dish. Also, we were sitting there so long that I think an employee thought we just got there because he ended up giving us a 2nd helping of plantains. Fine by me. I loved all the dipping sauces. 

Depending in where u're sitting, you might as well be having conversations with your neighbors. I felt like we were super close to them. I guess they're just trying to cram as many people into the space they have. 

Ambiance and location was beautiful! Great for taking a stroll along Embarcadero to walk off some calories.
author: Mimie L.

description:
I went to this place a couple weeks ago for a girls night with two other girlfriends.First off, I really liked the fact that they give you an assortment of chips and sauces. We got the cebiche mixto (which was delicious), the quinoa/squash salad and the empanadas. My favorite thing was the quinoa salad. I was really impressed with the textures and the flavors of the salad. It was delicious. We also ended up all getting the rhubarb pisco sour, which was a special for that day and it was delicious! 

I took a star off because we specifically went there for happy hour and then we found out that the happy hour ONLY applies if you get drinks at the bar...and since we were already seated it didn't apply to us. I was a little bummed about that. 

Overall, it was a good experience. 

Tip: If you want the happy hour, go to the bar first before getting seated.
author: Liza C.

description: This restaurant used to be a lot better.  I don't know if this visit was an aberration.  Nice location, good service.  But the menu seemed more limited than in the past:  less authentic Peruvian cuisine (and I have been to Peru three times), and even the classic Lima ceviches were strangely bland in flavor.
