They were friendly so it was fine but I really thought they should have paid attention to the fact that were still eating as one of us was always chewing or picking off the shared plates. The restroom situation is always a bummer with the single restrooms but at least we can go to the clean public restrooms outside that have plenty of available stalls. I will be back soon since the sun will be out later these days and you can enjoy the outdoor covered patio well into the evening. The Happy Hour and bar area looks like fun too.
author: Jen L.

description: Everything we ordered was fabulous. Including the cocktails. I bit pricey for Peruvian food but it does come with great views if you are able to sit outside.
author: Andrew F.

description: Wow! This place is legit! The food is so fresh and delicious! The service was amazing. Our sever was Mateo, and he made it a great experience for us! It was our first time in San Francisco and to the restaurant, he took time to explain the menu and help with our choices. Also- you must try the cebiche and a pisco sour!
author: Gena C.

description:
Food is rarely perfect, yet neither is customer experience.

At La Mar I found both. 

My girlfriend and I love trying things on a whim from recommendations of locals. We tried this restaurant based on the recommendation of our taxi driver for the best seafood experience in San Francisco.

We are from the East Bay, so not unfamiliar with the local cuisine and delicious quality of seafood at our fingertips, but we were simply amazed by our food and our service.

Ian, our server, recommended the El Bicolor, a special that included melt in your mouth halibut, scallops kissed by Posiedon and King crab that lived up to it's royal orgins. 

Our camrones were divine. As well.

There is something else i would like to mention, the service was phenomenal. You can tell they truly work as a team here. We were helped multiple times, not by two, but three different servers. Each just as kind as the next.

Thank you Ian and friends for the great experience of La Mar
author: Kyle S.

description:
La Mar, you are good -- very good. But your server made me feel really uncomfortable! I'm sorry if I'm not knowledgeable about everything on the menu, asked a lot of questions, and that my guest asked if you had "iced coffee" to which you responded, "no" and he asked you if you had "coffee" and you said "yes" and he ended up ordering "a glass of ice and a cup of coffee". Talk about awkward....

But I'll look past that, because your food truly speaks for itself and you also accommodated my request to be seated in the back room with a view of the bay bridge.

I got to try the following:
Quinoa Caprese Salad (this is one thing that you can skip, it was underwhelming)
Cebiche La Mar (Ceviche Sampler - highly recommend!)
Causa Tasting (whipped potatoes w/ a variety of toppings)
Tiradito Tataki (seared tuna w/ a fantastic garnishing)
Empanada Sampler (empanada with fun savory fillings)
Lomo Saltado
Arroz Negro
Paella (can't remember what it was called exactly)

This is a nice place to have an intimate (lots of sharing) dinner with a small group (no more than 4 people because the dishes are small portions).

Like I said, this place is great -- just be ready with your credit card (how it is at ANY tapas restaurant) and nose in the air ('cause they're shwanky).
author: Stephanie B.

description: Service and food were excellent! I got their version of surf and turf and it was awesome. The lime dessert was incredible!
author: Ollie B.

description:
La Mar was an awesome place to arrive to after the Hornblower cruise!  To me it felt kind of snug and packed, but it was on Valentine's day and the pier was booming.  When we arrived I had no idea that it was a Peruvian establishment until I seen the pisco sour drink a customer had ordered.  Then it all hit me, based off of the signs and drinks they had on hand I was extremely surprised that this type of bar existed in the location that we were in.  

I feel as if the bar tender man was too busy to pay more attention to us, so I won't bash him however I didn't get a very personable feeling at this bar, it was more of like "what do you want" they made it, and on with the next type of feeling.  That's fine and all, however if it were more personable I feel as if this could have been a super special place.  They should build more rapport and know their surroundings to make suggestions to tourist like myself.  

Other than that I give La Mar 4 stars and would definitely recommend it to anyone in the area that can appreciate specialty drinks.
author: Vaughn K.

description: Gorgeous restaurant, but you're paying for the ambiance more than the food. The plantain chips that come out as a starter are tasty and I enjoyed the dipping sauces. Next, my friend and I decided to try out various empanadas. They were decent, but my crazy aunt makes better ones and I didn't have to pay her an outrageous price for them. Next came a trio of ceviches. Again, they were good, but not great. Same with the causas. Same with the pisco sour. The seafood pasta was slightly better, but again it didn't wow me and at this price point, I want to be wowed. Overall, I appreciate the notion of wanting to "elevate" Peruvian cuisine, but La Mar just doesn't do it. Try sitting in the outdoor area out back if possible, the view is quite lovely.
author: Hugo C.

description: A friend recommend this place and it was close to my apartment.. I was expecting this place to be better but it was just okay. We shared everything and ordered the classic ceviche, flavors were good and lemony which is what I like but fish were cut too big and chewy in my opinion. Empanada platter comes with 4 different ones, I've had better. Lomo saltado was pretty good but I've also had better. Arroz la mar was a hot place of rice and mixed with seafood... overall just okay as well. Service was good and restaurant had a good ambiance also seems large which is good for large parties.
author: Christine T.

description: We came here for my cousins bday dinner & there was a few positive and few cons about this place. The original rsvp was set for 8:45 pm but arrived early by 10 mins & was told to wait and ended up getting seated around 9pm. We were seated quickly & served these delicious plantains with 2 great sauces. We were very hungry so they were eaten quickly at our table. We all ordered our main dishes & one of my friends and I shared two empanadas. They charged $13 for 2 small thumb sized chicken & beef contained pastries. The main dish I ordered was a cheesy scallop & shrimp pasta for a whipping $30!! They have high prices for not such a great quality or amount of food. Service was okay, my personal opinion is that they could work on their service as our busser. Every 5 mins they would come around and pick up empty plates but yet were so slow to refill our water glasses. They were more in a rush to clean our dishes than serving us & making sure we were doing well. Based on the price & service, honestly I don't think I will personally be coming back unless it was on a special occasion.
author: Lisa S.

description: I am in love with this place. The food and drinks  were amazing. The staff, atmosphere and view are all wonderful. Wish I could eat and drink here daily!
author: Issy G.

description:
The food is excellent.
The (complementary) plantain was crispy and delicious, and quite a large portion for us.
We ordered the classic cebiche (California halibut in a classic leche de tigre with red onion, habanero, Peruvian corn and yam), verduras nikei (seasonal vegetables with garlic spicy sauce), and arroz la mar (shrimp, clams, mussels, calamari, vegetables, catch of the day, over arborio rice); all fresh and delicious.

The view on the deck is gorgeous.
The staff is very friendly.
Definitely worth a try.
author: Yoshikage K.

description:
There are so many wonderful restaurants along the pier.  La Mar is definitely one that stood out to me the most.  Perhaps it's the hues of blue, the beautiful décor, or the palm fronds that whisk me away to a subtropical paradise every time I step in.  Seated just a short distance from the Ferry Building, La Mar boasts bold flavors, a beautiful open space, delicious drinks, and excellent service.

The front portion of the restaurant is the bar where they have a great happy hour menu from 3-6pm everyday.  Drinks are $6 and appetizers range from $3-6.   

Here's the best part:  PISCO SOURS!!!

You can easily spend hours sipping way (or pounding away) $6 pisco sours.  They are light, refreshing, and oh so addicting.  Try the passion fruit pisco sour too!  

Other notable drinks: Prickly Pear Margarita and the Cucumber Gimlet.

I love that the space is very accommodating to large groups.  We had a party of 6 and we were seated very comfortably in our booth.  Our waitress was attentive and very friendly.  She always made sure to check up on us without being overbearing.      

The food here is definitely a form of artwork.  Every plate that came out was artfully displayed with purpose and reason.  The Causa Tasting is highly recommended.  It's essentially whipped potatoes infused with flavor and topped with various seafood.  The Tasting comes with four small portions, each unique in taste and flavor.  It's a great way to get a small sample of each.  

Of course, this review wouldn't be complete without a review of the cebiches.  If you are a fan of cebiche, I would highly recommend the Cebiche Tasting.  It's everything you expect from fresh and delicious cebiche plus the beautiful presentation.  It's pleasing to the eyes and to your taste buds.. no complaints there!

For my main entrée, I got the Chorillana.  It is the catch of the day, which was seabass for us, with red onions, tomato, cilantro and mashed yucca in an ají panca and tamarind sauce.  The flavors here were just perfect.  The fish was very fresh and the tamarind sauce added a nice kick to the overall dish.  

Overall, the portions are quite small but surprisingly filling.  I would recommend making reservations before you go, especially on a Friday or Saturday.  If there's a wait, don't fret.  Just mosey on over to the bar and enjoy a pisco sour or two.  It will definitely quench your appetite as you prepare for a delightful Peruvian dining experience.
author: Cecilia S.

description: Came here for romantic Valentine's Day dining.  Excellent food and drinks.  The service was great and there are fantastic views of the Bay from the enclosed outdoor patio.  The staff is very friendly and welcoming.  Highly recommend this place for date night, or dining and drinks with friends.
author: Caroline S.

description: eh
author: Annie Z.

description:
Delicious!

Ive come here in several social settings and it works well for all of them!

The clasico ceviche, the mercado, and the nikei are my favorite cebiches and YUM they never disappoint.
I usually go for the catch of the day for dinner which is when im feeling like something light. The Lomo Saltado is incredible, full of flavor and juice! highly recommend.
author: Danielle S.

description: I might have gone to Peru to see Manchu Picchu but what I brought back was a taste for the 'food experience'.  I have a particular weakness for fusion food which is probably in my DNA. I was pleasantly surprised by the Asian influences in these South American dishes making a tasty and beautiful union.  The little place that opened my palate was Astrid y Gaston which was recommended to me by my boss, a Peruvian native.  This was a gastronomical BREAKTHROUGH experience for me! Everyone knows I've never been a huge sea food fan and I figured hey if I don't like it in Lima I won't like it anywhere....what an EYE and TASTE BUD opener! The three hour 15 course Tasting Menu with Wine Pairing rocked my LIFE VIEW on sea food!  I've been missing out on this ALL MY LIFE!?!?  Ok so my point here? Well I came to La Mar because it is the little SISTER restaurant to AyG.  Reservations recommended or try hitting the bar, we lucked out getting a table by a no show.  This place is classy beautiful at night with the lights on the water, almost enchanting.  Started with the ceviche sampler: Clasico: halibut in citrus marinade, red onion, habanero. Mixto: yellowtail, calamari, shrimp in yellow pepper citrus marinade with cilantro, red onion, habanero.  Nikei: tuna, red onion, Japanese Cucumber, daikon, avocado, nori, and sesame in a tamarind citrus marinade.  Chifa: yellowtail, peanuts, scallions, ginger, pickled carrots and daikon, habanero, wonton strips and cilantro in a sweet and sour sesame oil.  All were fresh and flavorful with quality fish.  This sampler is like a ceviche journey going from South America to Asia.  The Nikei being my favorite of the four.  Also tried the Empanadas sampler: chicken, beef, mushroom... Meh... Sorry not sorry, for such a traditional dish I was expecting more, I've had better, wouldn't recommend these.  But the barrel smoked octopus (pulpo) is another story!  You cannot leave this restaurant or Peru without trying this dish!  If you've never had octopus don't worry I was VERY skeptical too!  Live a little!! You MUST MUST TRY!! The octopus is flavorfully delicious and surprisingly TENDER!!  Also tried the causa tasting: limeña, pulpo olivo, nikei, and vegetariana.  These reminded me very much of AyG on a lesser scale.  Enjoyed these all except the veggie which was less inspirational.  This place was an excellent experience overall and certainly is a nod to big sister in Lima.  There's a whole world of food out there that I can't wait to discover!  GO outside of your comfort zone, it may change your life!
author: Tracy C.

description: Lomo saltado was delicious. Falls apart in your mouth. Cebiche tasters was a great way to start off the meal. We sat on the patio in the back overlooking the bay.
author: Lee L.

description:
If you are looking for high-quality food and don't mind spending more on dinner, this is the place for you. You can find great Peruvian/Latino dishes, some with an Asian fusion too.

The empanadas are delicious - I've tried them all and would recommend them (even the mushroom one, and I usually hate mushrooms!). The La Mar Arroz is akin to a paella, and is a good one at that. My favorite though is the pork fried rice with the duck egg - that frankly blew my mind!
author: Vic M.

description:
The drinks here are definitely the best part - whoever their bartender is, he/she should get a medal. The Blue Mule is out of this world - and during happy hour it's reasonably priced.
The food is pretty good - lots of interesting flavors without being overpowering. The plaintain & potato homemade chips are pretty addictive - watch out or you'll overeat! Sitting outside on the back deck is the best for dinner - a bit quieter than inside.
author: Claudia J.

description: Fabulous, interesting and very well-prepared food, served by a finely-tuned staff, that was knowledgable, friendly without being overbearing, and extraordinarily gracious.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Jeff D.

description: This restaurant is a happening place!  It was well worth putting up with the din of the clientele once we started eating. The menu was daunting at first because we didn't really know what was what. Once the waiter,Ian, came over and told us the left side of the menu was pretty much all appetizers, that helped a lot!  We let him make the suggestions for dinner.  The cocktail special with mescal gin, and a mango pomegranate ice cube was really something special, and it went well with the ceviche sampler. The seared salmon over those amazing potatoes was awesome. We shared a grilled octopus for dinner which was also delicious. Port wine for dessert.
author: Mary D.

description: Have eaten in this restaurant many times.  Food is very SAN Francisco Peruvian- meaning not that authentic but good.   Tourist spot so I suggest to be patient.  Thankfull, Food is on the fresh side.  I will recommend to people to try, if they want Peruvian inspired seafood.
author: Bennie B.

description: beautiful restaurant, good food esp plantain chips. i love coming back to la mar! also recommend happy hour
author: Taryn M.

description: Solid spot for Peruvian eats that rarely fails to impress. They don't serve guinea pigs like their Ecuadoran counterparts, but they have ceviche in truckloads, and the lime essence is worth partaking.
author: Paula M.
Mike V.

description: Just finished eating here.... We ordered the large appetizer plate. Everything was very tasty....a little spicy for my taste but wonderful! My family loved it!! They had a drink here called  the pisco punch and it  was absolutely delicious. Niyuk was our waiter and he was great.... he explained everything so well and told us just what to order seeing it was our first time here...Will definitely be back!
author: Melissa A.

description: We went there for lunch and told the waiter that we only had an hour. He took our orders right away and served the 4 dishes in a little less than 15 minutes. Carlos (the name on the receipt) was very efficient, friendly and attentive. I've been coming to La Mar ever since they opened and the food and service has not changed!  It's always exceptional any time of the day I come.
author: Carmencita S.

description:
This is a review for the front of the house only, not for the overall experience, since we didn't get to enjoy the overall experience at all.

Last night (a Monday), we arrived at 8:40pm to only be turned away by the host at the front because the "Kitchen has already closed for more than 10 minutes now".

The problem is, before we came here, we had our concierge at Westin St. Francis in Union Square call and was assured while they don't take reservations now, there is no problem for 2 people to just walk in for diner in the next 15 minutes or so...  So we rushed into a cab and came straight over, literally arriving in like 10min.

I mean if you were closing down the kitchen, it would seem normal to me to let someone know that considering you know how far they are coming from for diner service.

Normally I would have just left it at that and wouldn't have bothered writing this review.  But the person at the front became really defensive and rude to us when told that our concierge just called and all but accused us of lying.

Luckily this is not an area without other great choices, and we had a lovely diner right down the street at Coqueta.
author: Yi S.

description: Tasty seafood off the pier in SF, beautiful, friendly staff...this is coming from someone who doesn't eat seafood!
author: john s.

description:
My friend brought me here for dinner as a farewell thing (I was transitioning jobs) and she highly recommended the food. It was 6p on a Thursday evening and I can see the bar/happy hour area is already pretty packed. My friend made a reservation at the restaurant and it was still pretty empty. It got busy later on. 

It's a bit classier than I had assumed, but most people wore business casual. There were even kids in there causing a bit of a ruckus. 

First thing they give you are fried plantains chips and more pita like option. It comes with 2 sauces and both are amazing. I think it'd come back just for that. Food was delicious. We had the empanada sampler platter and a seafood plate (I forgot the name). Empanadas were really good. The beef was my favorite. The seafood plate came with rice and homonie. The sauce was incredible. Seafood was tender and perfect. It was a great meal.

I'm hoping to come back to try out their happy hour menu and to take family here.
author: Christina L.

description: It was ok. Servers were too busy, didnt get a table, when I saw several empty ones. Pisco sour was on fleek. we ordered a platter which was kind of small to share for two if you are real hungry,  it was quite tasty. My friend loved the plaintain chips (who wouldnt) and I would say the service is def lacking. Ceviche was ok, nothing impressive, in itself its the location that takes it away. The whole decor makes you think you definitely are near the water, and that they  might surprise you with some good seafood.
author: Rye Bread C.

description:
Both my fiance' and i where excited to eat at La Mar cevicheria in SF. We had experienced the La Mar restaurant in Lima and it was fantastic. We ordered the ceviche mercado, causa limenia to start then had the shrimp and scallop pasta dish. Everything was ok except for the ceviche, it tasted a little fishy. About 4 AM the next day we both became very ill, vomiting, fever, body ache etc. 

We emailed a letter to the manager the next day to inform him about our experience. This is what he wrote back.

Don't know where he get's his info, but food poisoning takes as little as 1 hour to incubate.

First of all, I am very sorry to hear that you had to experience this kind of illness as it is very violent and unpleasant, I unfortunately had had this before too.
It is completely understandable that you are linking this to our restaurant as you ate here last, but I have to inform you that food borne illnesses usually have an incubation period of 12 hours, so there must be something what you both shared what was even before our restaurant. Also, I have not gotten another complaint of that manner in the past two days besides yours.  Nonetheless, I will keep your complaint live and watch out if there is anything coming in from that day.
 
I hope you are feeling better by now and enjoying Comlumbus day!
Best,
TM
author: Charrua U.

description:
Service is very slow and took over 20 minutes to get a bottle of wine for my table. 

Hugely disappointing.
author: John B.

description:
My first time here for dinner, I had a salmon special with quinoa and purple potatoes - it was alright.  The salmon was cooked fairly well, but it could have used just a bit more salt.  The rest of the items were good.  Considering that the dish was almost $30, it was bit disappointing that I didn't enjoy it more.

My friend really enjoyed her meal.

I would definitely come back and give this place another try, but I would probably stick with a popular item that others seem to like.  The service was friendly and attentive.
author: Ken G.

description:
I ate here a year ago and it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had.  The service was great, personable and engaging, the food was truly memorable.  Definitely, five stars.  Any chef that can make me like Brussel sprouts is a miracle worker.  I looked forward to going back to this restaurant all year.  

I went back a week ago and was somewhat disappointed.  The service was still very good though not as engaging as before.  The food was not as good as what I had had last time. The shrimp was tough and the fish was dry. One of the shrimp was just the head and legs with no body; is that on purpose.  The plate generally seemed overcooked.  They need to do better.
author: M. P.

description:
Okay, table of five, work related, with a couple guys that know good food. Everything we ordered, we ordered to share.

It was amazing. I am not a fan of seafood, and I am saying this.

Great views, GREAT service - they kept our glasses full, the food coming, and the table clean, and even had a couple recommendations (from drinks, to additional plates, to dessert choices).

If you have the cash, or want to splurge (and you like/love seafood) - this is a good spot to check out.

All in all, our bill hit around $660+ for the table, but it was worth it!
author: Keith B.

description: really great food and drink. a bit pricey, so keep that in mind when heading here.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
A great place to take friends from out of town, which I did last Friday evening. The place was bustling, busy and fun, but not overly loud or chaotic. Our server was very pleasant, attentive and efficient, even though it was obvious it was a really busy night for him. Food wise, we ordered a sampler of all the emapanadas, ceviche and tartare, as well as several main courses.  Standouts were the paella (each bite had some sort of delicious seafood in it, thick and hearty) and the lomo saltado (beef was perfectly cooked and seasoned, such a great flavor). Everything actually, was delicious!  The only criticism I had was that the cocktails I tried were syrupy sweet, which did not go with any of the food.
Fun place for a group of friends!
author: Kari L.

description:
This place was awesome. We ran into it on accident & it looked nice inside so we took the plunge. I'm just going to leave a quick review for now so I don't forget, I might come back & edit it:

Great things:
1. The food was perfect. From the complimentary basket of "chips" and incredible dipping sauces, to the ceviches everything was perfectly fresh, flavorful, & delicious. 
2. The atmosphere. Right on the water, light & airy room, gorgeous decor... It was so refreshing.
3. The drinks. We tried several & there wasn't one that I didn't appreciate. I've heard they have a great Happy Hour & I can definitely see myself coming back with friends for drinks & snacks.
4. The service. Our waiter was from Peru himself, & so kind & patiently explained the menu to us & gave great recommendations. He really made the experience special. 

We chose one place to eat during our day in San Francisco & I could not be happier that this was our selection.
author: Kaitlyn W.

description:
Review is based on service. In short - SKIP THIS PLACE. Especially if you get the bad draw and have SHANE as your server. This place could CARE LESS about you, your money, or your dining experience. 

The one star is for the service, or lack there of, we received from Shane on the evening of 8/10/14. What a disappointment and at times infuriating. 

We had an event at Exploratorium and came here for dinner after that. My fiance came here a few years ago and was excited to bring me during our visit to SF. The food was delicious, good drinks and wine list, but our server Shane was terrible and tainted the experience. 

I'm calling the restaurant directly to outline each and every incompetent action and not taking the time to write it all out here. Trust me, there were at least a dozen negative points involved. A few notables:

- our table was not completely set when we sat down. It took until the first dishes arrived to notice that I was missing a fork and knife. we called our server and pointed this out. he looks right at me, doesn't even blink or apologize and ASKS me "would you like some silverware?" Um, YES!!! are you kidding me?? All this while our food is sitting at the table and I have to wait for him to DO HIS JOB so I can eat properly. At a RESTAURANT. 

- he did at least take time to ask us how we wanted our courses brought out BUT ONLY TO MESS IT ALL UP. Huge pet peeve, especially when we're mixing cold & hot dishes as well as ordering appropriate wines to pair. Throughout all this, not even an acknowledgement or apology as to how much of a nightmare this was turning out to be. What a joke. 

- we ask for the dessert menu and he brings it to the table. We decide what we're going to order and I get up to head to the ladies room. I come back thinking my fiance has ordered already but he tells me that he hasn't even seen our waiter. Hmm, what a surprise. So we wait. And we wait. And WE WAIT. nothing. I'm so fed up by this point that I sit up and wander around to look for our waiter and ask for our check. Without question, he brings the check to the table. I ask him, "didn't you know that we were ordering dessert?" And he responds - "YES" Then asks, at that point, would you like to order dessert? WTF!!! I say NO because we've been waiting for so long and just want the check now. His response: "the check is right there." Again, no acknowledgement. no apology. nothing. OMG. Unbelievable...

It was clear that we were seated at the end of the night and the restaurant was closed by the time we left. Even if this had something to do with the disastrous service, why even sit us at a table? Just tell us that you're closed!  And it's not about the missing silverware, the food mishaps, or whether or not this guy actually forgot about us. Things happen. I can understand that. But when you're blatantly treating your patrons with a complete lack of respect: you have a problem.

Skip this place if you're looking for a nice, enjoyable dinner. Not worth the chance of having to experience lame service from someone so careless. There are PLENTY of other worthwhile places in San Francisco that value their clientele. Shane's level of indifference is a clear indication that service and respect are not valued at this establishment.
author: Puny P.

description: Love the food and ambience.  The squid and octopus, plantains and beef heart were delicious.  And you have to try the chocolate mousse with quinoa...wow.  Had the perfect lychee-tini and some whiskey mix cocktail (can't recall the name at this time).  Looking forward to my next visit!
author: J S.

description: For the prices that this place charges, you would think service would be great. However, my party and I were greatly disappointed by the lack of attention. We virtually never saw our waiter again after our food was delivered. Food was only okay- not even amazing. Don't think I'll be coming back here again.
author: naigee S.

description:
3.5 stars...the food is really good! My whole family loved their dishes. We shared some ceviche and empanadas which were also a hit. The service was just ok...our server was really nice but didn't seem super knowledgable about the menu. Maybe he's still learning it.

Also, I have to eat gluten free. There is a separate menu that marks what is gf. I was surprised that a lot of the dishes had to be modified a lot to be gf...it's fish and veggies?! But a lot of the sauces were not safe. I picked something that didn't have to be modified at all...and later that day I still got sick! Probably just cross contamination which I know is a risk I take when eating out but still...I was disappointed.
author: Christina C.

description: This place was really good. The staff were attentive and the place was well kept up. Its a bit expensive but the foodbwas worth it. Its nice to go once in a while check out the pics of the food we ate and the pisco sours. Loved the whole experience.
author: James S.

description: I called for a reservation for my birthday two weeks in advance and was assured a table by the water. This has been a favorite restaurant for many years, so I was completely disappointed when I received a call three hours before I was  preparing to leave for the restaurant and was told by an employee that unless I came in an hour earlier I would have to lose my reservation that I had made two weeks earlier for my birthday! They booked a private party and and swept me and my birthday plans along with my guests coming in from out of town under the carpet without any consideration. They didn't offer any substitute and I was basically left out in the cold. It ended up being a gift and an ugly wrapper, because I went to, Waterbar instead and had an amazing meal, a table with a beautiful view, and was treated with birthday cheer! Needless to say I will never return to La Mar. I will never suggest it to anyone again, and I am extremely disappointed in the way I was treated. Thank you Waterbar for giving me such a great table at the last minute, and for treating me with such warmth and hospitality!
author: Evelyn S.

description:
This is only my second Peruvian restaurant... but it confirms what I knew after eating 4 or 5 meals at "Pekaditos" in Miami... I LOVE Peruvian food. Similar to other Latin flavors and yet unique... they just know how to cook seafood perfectly! My friends and I ordered a bunch of stuff and shared family style. The Plancha Marina (Prawns, octopus, calamari, salmon, portobello mushrooms, aji panca, and pisco sauce) and the Ceviches were so good we had to order more. Everything was spectacular! If I have one minor complaint food wise I would cut the fish in the ceviches a a little smaller... just a personal preference... the flavors and freshness were spot on. 

I'm sad to say that the whole story doesn't end well. The service was spotty at best. Our server who said he had been there 3 years knew nothing of the beer selection. The draft beer was served in a plastic cup! At this level of dining THAT is unacceptable.  We continually had to ask the bus staff for things because our waiter was a rare sight. The worst thing was management's decision to cater to the super bowl crowd. They're "usual specials"... (I know that's an oxy moron... but the specials are painted on the wall!) were not available! No grilled octopus for me! They were replaced with a foolish "Super Bowl" menu featuring burgers and crap! That is some bad thinking. The night was capped off with a forgotten order of Empanadas coming to the table after it was cleared and the check was paid!! The manager seemed angry at us for pointing this out to him. 

Cheers and FIVE STARS to the chef!! Boo hiss and ONE STAR to management!!
author: Robert B.

description:
My friend PS raves about this place allllllllllll the time. And to be honest, I don't really get the hype. My first impression was "what sort of harry potter pier is this on?". It wasn't super obvious to see.

We met up here for HH and ordered the calamari. I had the pisco PUNCH which was really good. I'm not a huge fan of calamari because it's fried but I ate it anyway since I was hungry LOL.

I don't think I'll be back here. With such a touristy area, the least I can get a is a view with lack luster food.
author: Shana B.

description:
Delicious every time!  There are two maracuya (passionfruit) drinks on the menu, and both are delicious.  One of them is only on the happy hour menu, but sometimes they'll serve it outside of happy hour at your request.

Everything here is good.  The freshly made sweet potato and regular potato chips with 3 sauces that they bring out is addictive.  Order the ceviche, any one of them from their large selection.  They are all good.  Many of the happy hour menu items are good.  For dinner, the lomo saltado is the best!  The steak is so tender, juicy, and flavorful. The veggies are cooked just right - not overcooked and not too crisp.  The sauce, oh my THE SAUCE!  I love to soak all my french fries in the sauce before eating them. 

If you make a reservation, you can request a table on their back patio.  When it's too cold, they'll put up a clear plastic cover so you can still kind of see out on the water.  It's so wonderful to sit back there.  I love this place!
author: Jaching H.

description: D.E.L.I.C.I.O.U.S. 100% peruvian food. Totally recommend it! Service was perfect too, it is super fast and the waiter was very nice and helpful.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
I love Peruvian cuisine.

This trip to the Bay Area was for business and I was staying at a Hotel overlooking the waterfront in The Embarcadero. I was really hungry and decided to take a hike to find a dinner spot and happened upon La Mar with no knowledge of this place. 

Walking in, I was surprised at the size of the restaurant. Since, I had no reservation, I was given the "snooty look" hostesses are trained to give and asked to wait a few minutes. She came back and asked if I'd sit in the bar, and I declined holding out for a table. This was a lucky, but brilliant move, as the tables are quieter and the restaurant is really nice. 

I started with the Cebiche called "Cebiche Carretillero" which is chopped catch of the day- Yellow tail, octopus, calamari, shrimp, choclo, cancha, camote, celery, habanero, and cilantro in a classic leche de tigre. Excellent choice and a fairly large serving. Next, I had an Empandada called Empanadas De Lomo Saltado (Peruvian's favorite dish)  which is an empanada with beef, red onion and tomato in soy-oyster reduction, served with panchita sauce. This is an excellent preparation. 

I wasn't going to be able to do an entree after starting "Big", so I opted for an Anticucho called Pulpo, which is grilled octopus with anticuchera sauce, herbed mashed potatoes, crispy choclo, Peruvian botija olive aioli, finished with chalaca chimichurri.

This was the best item I had as the octopus was wonderful and the preparation was wonderful. 

This will be a great spot to bring others as I will not attempt another solo feast. What a wonderful experience!
author: Dave F.

description:
Great service, unimpressive food. Ordered cebiche classico, anticuchos de corazón, and causa vegetariana.  Everything was fairly bland.  Ceviche barely had lime and no seasoning.  None of the leche de tigre flavor you would expect, especially for a $20 appetizer.  The Causa had a grainy texture.  I would have expected an attempt
to use the yellow potatoes or similar to give it a smoother texture.  Anticuchos were rubbery and not cooked consistently all the way thru and smothered in a red pepper based sauce.  Would have been much better with ají.  Our waitress was kind enough to offer a partial refund.  I had heard that the quality of La Mar has dropped since its initial opening but kind of surprised by the lower standard given the number of great Peruvian rest in the area.  Next time will have to either try a main or
skip altogether in favor of other places.
author: Mike J.

description:
This was my second time here and it wasn't what I remembered. Came here for lunch for Valentine's Day and sat on the patio outside. The restaurant is huge and on a nice day it's great to enjoy the fresh air!

Asked the waiter if one of the drinks on the menu was sweet and that I didn't like sweet drinks. He said it was refreshing and that I will like it. Thank god I didn't get it, because my mom got it, and it was awfully sweet. Very strange recommendation.

We got the sampler- Cebiche la Mar and the Tiradito Passion. Then we ordered the catch of the day skewer(anticuchos). Just a warning this place is very carb heavy. Pretty much everything is made out of potatoes, so if you'd like something light, besides the ceviche, you can pretty much forget it! The ceviche was fresh and really tasty. It's a great way to try all of them. The salmon melted in your mouth. The catch of the day was one pleasant surprise and it came with small fried potatoes and Peruvian corn.

After I ordered another Cosmo, I ordered a grilled octopus(pulpo) as our last dish. Waited. Finished the drink and my mom got another drink. Finished that one too. No food. Then the waiter comes with the check and I asked him what happened to our food? He had this blank look on his face like he had no idea. He then said sorry and gave us the check. Awful service. We just sat there waiting for our food for 30 minutes when it was never coming! I think that just killed the whole experience for me. Too bad because I thought their food was very good.
author: Anna P.

description:
Been here a handful of times and I always left astoundingly satisfied.

Amazing food, service is attentive and the ambiance is great.  

Great for all sorts of occasions: from a date night or a simple night out with friends or family.

I certainly will go back.
author: Mr. Food G.

description:
Went here for dinner for my birthday for the second time.

The service was terrible but the food was amazing as last time.

Fabulous cocktails. I think that the appetizers are the way to go more than the main courses. The cebiches, causas and empanadas are exceptional. Best fried yucca I've ever had.

Aside from the BBQ chicharron, the main courses and bigger plates weren't much to write home about. 

The ambience is nice, especially in the outdoor-ish covered patio with heat lamps. 

Delicious maracuya/chocolate mousse for dessert with a scrumptious praline crust.
author: Adrienne R.

description:
my 3rd or 4th time here and the best experience so far. the food has always been great, but previously the service had been mediocre at best. I've seen some bad reviews due to the service, but perhaps they are reading them and trying to step it up. we interacted with at least 3 servers and everyone of them was great. we ordered a few apps, salad and small entree plate and although I was ready to order more, the waiter said he thought we had ordered enough. he was wrong haha, and we ordered more. but it was nice that he wasn't trying to push us to order more than we needed

the plates were small, not quite tapas-sized, but not full american entree-size either. but that makes it easier to order different things. we told the we'd be sharing everything and they split the salad into two plates which is a really nice touch

we had cerviche with had jalapeños which was really delicious. next time I would order a couple of the cerviche dishes, they all sounded good.  followed by a seafood salad, empanadas stuffed with mushrooms, steak skewers and grilled octopus. I'd order any one of them again, but the octopus was fantastic.

wine by the glass was too high, as usual, a Chalk Hill sauvignon blanc was $11 a glass and a bottle retails for about $15 so that's annoying. the wine markup in a restaurant always irritates me. I don't know if they have a corkage fee.
author: Bob U.

description: This review is solely based on service. Not sure if they were short staffed, but we had lunch during restaurant week and service was very inconsistent. Three tables with groups sat down at the same time, one finished before we got our entree, the other was still waiting when we got ours. It took an hour to get our meal (though when it came, the squash soup and beef short ribs were delicious). My colleague ordered the halibut fish special.  It came as a whole fish, and we were shocked when saw on the bill that it cost $70! You'd think the waiter would have mentioned that. The interior is beautiful but can get cold with the wind whipping around. If you go, be sure to ask about pricing and if you are in a hurry, let your server know. No Bueno!
author: Michelle O.

description:
I'm going in the one in Santiago in Chile really often and it's always a good experience. But here it was the worst dining experience I had in San Francisco. 
First of all we arrived they did not have our reservation, we called to book 4 hours before, instead of being sorry they were really cold and unfriendly. We order a white wine (which was really good), four ceviches and an octopus. 
They served the wine and put it in his "cooler" next to a table in the other side of the path ! We asked to have it next to us. The 4 ceviches arrived, they were good. They forgot the octopus, so we ask for it and they bring us a octopus with literally a taste of plastic. They might have burn a plastic when they grilled it but it was impossible to eat, it smelled the plastic. After calling one of the waiter, he told me in a rude way "I don't smell it but I can send it back". He sent it back but obviously charged us for it. The ceviche was more expensive than the one in Santiago for the third of the size. In Santiago the waiter are always extremely nice and professional here they have literally no knowledge about hospitality and don't even worth spending a penny in this place (And I've been working in hospitality in France for a long time). Go in little Italy eating fresh pasta or take a chowder on one of the pier it will be way better and you won't waste your money.
author: Yann C.

description:
The place is huge and always busy!
They have a great bar in the front, plus loads of spacious tables and outdoor seating.
The servers were very attentive and efficient. The food and drinks came at the right time!
I super enjoyed all the fresh seafood!
author: Cay A.

description:
Was in SF for the weekend, so what do you do? EAT and DRINK all day! 

I wanted to treat some of my friends to good Peruvian food while being next to the water. This place is conveniently located in the pier, so make sure you have plans to walk around or ride the ferry afterwards. 

We were there for a couple of hours just enjoying our drinks, while munching on some Peruvian food, and watching the great view. 

My favorite of course was the ceviche sampler. The pisco sour was my top drink of that day! We must have had like 4 or 5 of them!!! They were sooo good! The empanadas were flavorful and flaky. The plantains and their potatoes were on point!!! It's a great filler and will get you really full. 

Overall, a great experience and great service from our waiter!
author: Angelie D.

description:
I like the architecture of the building and the ambiance. The empanadas were yummy as an appetizer at the bar. I was disappointed that the pisco sours were premixed. I expected much better than that and had better at restaurants in Peru.
Once in the restaurant, the table-service was friendly and fast. The other cocktails were yummy. Cebiche tasted fresh and well-seasoned. The causa sampler had much tastier causa than I am used to.
I'd definitely come back again - just won't order pisco sours there, which makes me sad as a good pisco sour was just one of my favorite things about Peru.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Went in for a couple drinks to catch up with a friend when visiting San Francisco.

Good service, although I didn't feel completely welcome by the guy who seemed in charge. Maybe we didn't quite "fit in", plus we weren't consuming that much but dude that's weird.

We only had an empanada sampler which tasted good but $24 for 4 small empanadas? What a rip off. I get better empanadas for $1 by my apt in the East Village (NYC, yes, hate me Californians!!!).

Anyway, popular spot, maybe the chef is famous or something. But not exactly for the casual traveler.

p.s. there's only 3 toilets in the entire pier. Capacity prob over 300 ppl hah!
p.p.s. This was mid-October, I just noticed the review half-done on Yelp.
author: Jorge O.

description:
I love writing positive reviews because I feel it's so easy for people to complain rather than appreciate. The location is awesome and the interior is beautiful. I sat at the bar where they offer a full menu. I ordered the pisco sour. That was on point. I also ordered the yucca huancallina. A Traditional Peruvian appetizer. The sauce was so flavorless it was like a cheesy gravy rather than a sauce with spice and Peruvian flavors. The yucca also did not needed batter. 
The tiradito del mar had a sauce lacking flavor. Spicy yes. But not flavorful. I think la mar can make a come back if the focus on the basics of Peruvian food. Flavor. And less on over pricing their entrees.
author: Carla G.

description: I wasn't very thrilled about this place.  I made a reservation for 8, and when I called to say that we were running 10 minutes late, I was told the kitchen would close if we weren't there by 2:40, when our reservation was at 2:30.  When we did arrive, the hostess told me that my group was waiting for me out on the patio...  I had no idea where the patio was and felt she could have been a little more helpful.  The food was okay, but over priced in my opinion.  As we paid the bill, the credit card machine went down, so we waited for about a half hour to pay our check.  I would not recommend.
author: Alyse S.

description: Went for my oldest son's 16th birthday celebration. Everyone was extremely attentive and the food was simply outstanding. Service was great and we will definitely be back! This is a must-visit!
author: Tania R.

description: The ceviches were amazing reminded me of my travel to Lima, Peru.  The Saltado Lomo is pretty amazing.  All the ingredients were the prime freshness and green scallions give an extra flavor.  Service was incredible.
author: Jerry M.

description:
I have been eyeing La Mar for quite sometime and finally decided to take a spontaneous dinner date trip. We started off with the Pisco Sour due to many recommendations. One drink and I was set for the whole night. We ordered:

- Cebiche tasting = which was four types of cebiche. My favorite was cebiche nikei.

- Arroz Jugoso = love the seafood selection

- Pescado = grilled catch of the day, which was salmon. A little overcooked.

- Causa tasting = whipped potatoes topped with seafood or vegetarian ingredients. Never had anything like this before and I enjoyed it very much!


Would love to come back for a dinner party with my friends because I love the decoration and the outdoor seating.  Also, love their chips and 3 types of dipping sauce! Heavenly good!
author: Owie N.

description:
Awesome spot for a nice dinner date and the best cebiche! My girlfriend and I enjoyed all of the food we ordered and left very satisfied:

Cebiche Chifa: catch of the day was so fresh, never had cebiche like this before.
Causa Pulpo: This is the way to eat octopus. Paired with the spinach causa and aioli... this was delicious!
Passion Scallops and Shrimp: Shrimps had so much flavor and a lovely grilled taste. Just like the fresh fish, the scallops were very soft.
Short Ribs Seco: Good portion of soft meat.

Queso Helado (dessert): reminded me of horchata ice cream, cinnamon, and tres leches all mixed together! Very good! I also ordered a latte which was surprisingly well made with good coffee and not overpowered by milk.

The ambiance is refreshing and spacious with splashes of color around. The place seemed pretty big with a bar/lounge area, main dining room, and outdoor patio. Our waiter was very friendly and the service was good. Definitely make reservations since it seemed pretty full for a weekday.
author: Josh L.

description:
The ceviche trio with the plantain chips. Paleo friendly and absolutely delicious. Never disappoints. Wine pours are SUPER chincy so be warned in advance to drink some wine in your Uber over to compensate. Empanadas were yum as well.
Sit outside on patio on the water for a nice view and some fresh air.
author: Tara T.

description: FrisCo has some boss a** chefs out there man. And La Mar just happens to have one of them! Their food was full of flavor. Authentic with a twist of international street foods but, with class. And if you want, seatings by the ocean side. Sexy ambience but, still laid back. Not sure if it's good for kids though. Over all I love the whole time of dining there. Our waiter Victor was awesome too!
author: Pheap S.

description:
$@?!&/%! Delicious! I've had the pleasure of never being let down by the cuisine or service. Staff is ridiculously friendly no matter how busy it gets. Food is unique and perfectly tasty even to the most non adventurous palate.

Parking can be difficult, specially on a weekend during the farmers market. There's parking in pier 3. Or there is a lot for $20 for the day across the street of pier 9. There's no valet. 

I've been to the original La Mer in Lima. Dare I say I found the ceviche better at this spot.
author: Mouse K.

description: The wagyu skirt steak nigiri is out of this world, I can't describe in words the amazing flavor of this dish. We ordered a number of other dishes including calamari and a seafood dish, but I could've eaten an endless supply of the wagyu skirt steak nigiris as my meal. If you come to La Mar you MUST order this!
author: Anisha A.

description:
One of my best SF dining experiences.  It was so good I actually left trying to figure out how I could come back tomorrow.

I came based on the recommendation of a colleague and based on how good this was, will be trying all the restaurants she recommended.  Overall, great ingredients, very complex flavors, beautiful presentation and fantastic service.

We started with the causa limena, a peruvian potato appetizer topped with crab meat.  Hard to describe but very highly recommended, very complex flavors and not like anything I have tried before.

My friend and I shared two entrees (and our great waitress pushed us to share), the anitchuco mixto (mixed skewers) and lomo saltado.  The skewers (mahi-mahi, chicken and tenderloin) were the surprise hit.  Chicken was very tasty and tender, steak melted in my mouth and the mahi was so good I did not realize it was fish until I was finished.  The lomo saltado was also quite nice, again the beef was melt in your mouth and the sauce very tasty.

One side benefit is I remember when you really should not eat in the Embarcadero, it was full tourist traps of over-priced mediocre restaurants.  Places like La Mar are a very welcome change, you can get a great meal while still enjoying the views and location.
author: Lloyd M.

description: I was visiting a friend in SF and she brought me here.  I am a very picky eater, and I don't eat creamy sauces or seafood so I was nervous about finding something on the menu that I would like. Our waiter was awesome. I told him what I didn't like and he steered me towards "lomo saltado". I'm not going to lie, I was still nervous. However, it was DELICIOUS!    It had amazing flavor.   Everyone loved their meals too...The place had a great atmosphere too. I will definitely be back when I visit San Fran in the future.
author: K W.

description:
I've been here a few times in the past and it's always been pleasant. However, tonight they knocked it out of the park!!!

My mother and I sat at the bar, which we've never done here before, and it was just the perfect setting for our mini celebration.

First the drinks... A pisco sour for her, which was strong and delicious, and a lovely new modelo negro for me.

Cebiche mixto makes our taste buds soar as always.
Our entrees were both excellent.

The staff in the bar area is superb!!!! From the bartender to food runner to bar back everyone was eager to please! And to top it off in the middle of our delightful dinner the manager Ohm came over to talk to us at the bar. She was not only a lovely burst of energy with class, but a very very enjoyable person. We told her what we were celebrating and she made us a special drink which was to die for and basic hung out with us for the remainder of our dinner.

I will have to say hands down my best dinner experience I've had in a very long time! 

It was fun, it was delicious, and we made a new friend or two.

Five stars!!!
author: Mona A.

description: Mahi mahi cebiche and lomo saltado were wonderful.  Looking forward to returning many times.
author: Rebecca R.

description:
I can't comment on the dinner here because I only came for HH. Please note, if you come here for HH and order their signature ceviche they don't give you bread or chips. What? Lol. Yup, you have to eat it plain. Weird.

The wine pours were solid. The other HH drinks were a bit watered down. Might have to come back here for dinner to change my impression, but overall for HH--meh.
author: Tina J.

description:
You can't really go wrong with this place: 

1. Great service 
2. Awesome food 
3. Romantic ambiance 

It's a pretty large space and they have an outside seating area where you can see the Bay Bridge and be by the water. The prices are reasonable for SF but steeper than good Peruvian you'll find elsewhere. But you are paying for the atmosphere and the creativity that goes into each dish.
author: Wei W.

description:
Peruvian deliciousness no matter what you order.

Appetizer: Quinoa some, something delicious.

Main: Chicken Skewers, Empanadas

The meat is so soft and tasty, the flavors exquisite. This place really delivers. In my short 5 day stay in SF, i went twice (and it was considered out of the way).

Also had a Peruvian friend say it was amazing, so you know if a native agrees, it has to be spot on.
author: Chris Mary E.

description: This is a beautiful restaurant right on the waterfront.  The service is friendly and excellent.  We tried a bunch of mixed plates including skewers, and ceviche.  The flavours were excellent.
author: M F.

description:
Went for Happy Hour.  It was good, but they forgot about my order. :/ 
I like the style of the place, its modern and sexy with nice view in the restaurant area. I ordered a Pisco Punch and cebichin clasico from the Happy Hour menu.  Both were delicious.  I am looking forward to trying other dishes.  I will definitely be adding La Mar to my Happy Hour rotation.  BTW.. you gotta try the plantain and potato chips.. sooooo good!
author: Jennifer V.

description:
Happy hour at la mar. Only for the elite few that are able to get started by 3:30. After that is hard to find room at the bar. Finding a table also next to impossible.  \So my tip is to get started early.

I love the Peruvian beer. Feel in love with it in Peru. Happy hour makes it a nice price.
The happy hour menu, on this particular day one of everything is just around $50-$60. So that's my second tip, order one of everything. 
All of the other drinks on the menu I hear are also great. 

The calamari is so so good. The crunchy thin parts taste like bacon. The mussels have a really delicate balance of flavors like corn, tomatoes and salsa. The crab and quail is stupendous. This is a great spot for happy hour, the dinner and lunch menu is also great. The flavors are all FRESH!
author: Ben M.

description: Service and food was amazing!! Ambiance is great and music choices were thumbs up. Pricey, but well worth it! Cebiche, sashimi, steak, beef, fries, dessert, it was all up to standard. Whatever they served complimentary before ordering was so delicious. It was like chips and came with this dip, yummmmmm! Def. coming back :)
author: Kimberlie M.

description: I love this place!!! The food is always consistent. If you happen to be down on the Embarcadero near the wharf you have to stop off here for dinner. I've been trying to figure out the best way to explain the flavors of the food prepared at La Mar. The complexity of flavors in a beautifully rustic presentation along with simple ingredients make for seafood the way it was meant to be eaten. Bottom line is you have to try this place. On a personal note the staff are unbelievably friendly and a special shout out to Alex our server who made a family of five kids included extremely welcome and comfortable. Don't miss this!!!!
author: Lenny G.

description:
tl;dr - Peruvian food with slight Asian influence that's priced at a premium for the view of the SF Bay and ceviche spelled with a b. Try the scallops/octopus/calamari -- some of the most tender I've tried! The Alfajor and Maracuya were surprisingly good desserts. 

I had made dinner reservations for 5:30pm on a weekday specifically so we could get in on their happy hour deals. Unfortunately, happy hour food/drinks couldn't be brought into the dining room. You save about 50% on the drinks during happy hour, and I thought it was unnecessarily UPTIGHT of them to not allow us to bring drinks from the bar into the dining room. I've also never heard of happy hour deals not being allowed in the sit-down dining area. 

Anyway, on to the dining experience. I really liked the patio setting that had an atrium-like feel looking out over the Bay. When we first sat down, the heaters were going full blast, so it felt like it was really summer in Peru. However, as our meal went on, they turned off the heaters for some reason, and we definitely felt the CHILLY SF bay breeze. The menus were really big in comparison to the size of the tables, so careful not to knock anything over. When the patio area got crowded (around 6:30pm), the noise levels became really LOUD, making it hard to hear across the table.

As many reviewers have mentioned, the CHIPS and sauces to start were very much appreciated. There were three types of chips -- yucca (looked like vegetarian bacon), sweet potato, and potato chips. There were two sauces, one had a spicier taste and the other a creamier taste.. The flavors were not quite like anything I had tasted before. 
 
On to the food/drinks. It seemed like several of the dishes had an Asian influence actually, so the food wasn't as authentic Peruvian as I had hoped. I think Limón over in the Mission area has more authentic Peruvian without the Asian influence (and at a lower cost). 

:: Pisco sour - seemed like this was the popular drink of the night. Refreshing drink that's great to start. It has a bit of a sweet and sour taste that reminded me of the Japanese Umeboshi plum. 
:: Cebiche sampler - If cebiche is in the name of the restaurant, you know you gotta try the cebiche. Especially if it's spelled with a 'b' instead of a 'v'. That must make it more authentic....right? Anyway, the clásico was my favorite. PERUVIAN CORN FTW! It's like corn nuts on crack...very flavorful. Loved the tender calamari in the cebiche mixto. There was also the cebiche nikei with sesame oil and nori seaweed that was very Japanese and cebiche chifa with peanuts, soy sauce, and picked carrots that was very Chinese. I would've preferred to try more traditional Peruvian cebiches. Come on...I can handle it! Don't tone down the dish by making it Asian fusion. 
:: Pulpo (octopus) - wins "best presentation" for the night. Came with potato chips, a olive aioli, and decorative dressings.
:: Scallops on bed of red quinoa - scallops were cooked to perfection; slightly browned on the outside and tender on the inside. Like the touch of toasted quinoa sprinkled on the scallops.
:: Causa limeña - the dungeness crab was minced into very small pieces, so I couldn't really fully appreciate the flavors of the crab. It was quite light compared to the yellow potato it was served in top of. 
:: Sálmon Ayacuchano (D.A.T. menu only) - grilled to a nice crispness on the outside.
:: Lomo Saltado - a very safe dish that you can't really go wrong with. Lots of starchy potatoes and rice though. Not sure if it was worth the price that they charged.
:: Choco-maracuya - great dessert to end on! Loved the flavors of passion fruit, chocolate, raspberry, and almond praline/granola combined.
:: Alfajor (D.A.T. menu only) - shortbread cookie filled with dulce de leche 
and drizzled with a dark chocolate syrup. This shortbread was the BEST I've ever tasted. All shortbread should be like this. Flaky and melt in your mouth!! So fresh and light, yet somewhat buttery. How?!


Whew, a two hour meal later -- THE END. Congrats if you've read to this point!
author: Audrey L.

description:
4 stars! Came here for June 2014's Dine About Town lunch. Really great deal for only $18.95! The Dine About Town Menu included Causa Nikei, Cebiche Limeno, Arroz Norteno, and Seasonal Sorbets. We had made reservations in advance and were seated outside on the patio, which overlooked the bay. It was a really nice and warm day in San Francisco. 

Potato, Sweet Potato, and Plantain Chips - Complimentary. Very crispy and tasted just the way they were. Loved the sauces to dip in it. One sauce was creamier, while the other was spicier. ALSO, I loved their presentation of the chips. It looked like a bouquet! :)

Causa Nikei - Tuna tartare and avocado puree on top of rocoto potato with creamy huancaina sauce, finished with nori. The potato part was quite interesting as you eat it with the tuna. The creamy sauce had a small kick to it to bump up its flavors. I really liked the tuna tartare. It tasted really fresh and was not chewy. 

Cebiche Limeno - Not too acidy, just the way I like it. Fish tasted very fresh and was very refreshing. Comparable to other Peruvian restaurants.

Arroz Norteno - Rice with squid, shrimp, mussels and other ingredients. Seafood was very fresh. Mussel was a bit fishy though. Rice was a bit too soft and chewy to my liking, unfortunately. Otherwise, it was really good.

Strawberry and Mango-Passion Fruit Sorbet - Really refreshing and perfect way to end a delicious meal. :)

Inca Kola - Not part of the Dine About Town menu. I've had my first Inca Kola at Fresca, but I think I prefer La Mar's any day. It kind of reminds me of a bubbly/cream soda. A bit sweet. Really liked how it was not watered down. 

Service was excellent. Our water cups were always refilled and food came out at the perfect timing. The staff checked up on us quite often. I'd definitely be back to try more of their dishes!
author: Philana C.

description:
La Mar was pretty awesome - the Pisco sours and Maracuya sours were really good to get started with at the bar while we were waiting for the rest of our party. The service is a little bit slow at the bar though.

Food wise, the ceviche sampler was pretty good! The fish main courses are also insanely large, but very delicious. One of our party ordered the halibut, and it was easily 3x the size of her face, with fish on both sides. It was pretty delicious. I had the lomo saltado, which was decent, but pretty salty. We also had the pork shank, beef cheeks, and squid ink pasta. I'd probably rank the 5 in order of halibut, pork shank, squid ink, beef cheeks, and then lomo saltado. The passionfruit / chocolate mousse was great for dessert! I'd ask to sit out on the patio or by a window, the view of the sunset is lovely.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Lomo saltado was amazing. It was nearly perfect in every way. Chicken empanada was about the best I've had. 

But...

Ceviche was boring. Ordered the mixto (three ceviches). All three were okay, but none of them were above average. I've had much better ceviche at 1/3 the price and with twice the serving size. 

For desert I had a stack of 5 cookies with (what tasted like) Nutella spread between and condensed milk on top. There was a 1-inch diameter ball of a fruity ice cream-like substance on the side. The cookies were dry and tasteless. The cookie and Nutella combination was simply not good. 

As the designated driver, I had Diet Coke while my dinner companions had cocktails. For four of us the bill came to about $500.00 with tip. However, they charged around $3.00 x 4 to refill my 8oz of Diet Coke. 

Service was good. The server was outstanding. The dining area was mediocre--outside on the plastic-ed-in terrace under the heater. 

I've eaten at several Peruvian restaurants around the San Francisco Bay Area, and I've had food that was at least equally as good for 1/3 the price. This restaurant is in a prime location. .
author: scott h.

description: The food was good but I was expecting something better for the price tag. We went for a romantic dinner but the tables are so small and so close together that we could hear the conversation that the pairs sitting on both sides were having. The service was good at the beginning but by mistake gave our main dish to the couple sitting next to us. The real problem was that the waiter tried to give us their dish, which was a total different one.  Then the waiter apologized realizing we figured out what happened. Promising he will give us our drinks for free (at the end that didn't happen). Then he promised us free dessert and instead brought us the bill with a birthday dessert for free (we didn't like it). I complained that we would like to see the dessert menu. He told me that this is what the manager told him to bring. So not only did we have to wait another 10-15' to get our food but we were also punished with no dessert. Probably not coming back.
author: Kate P.

description:
We had reservations and we didnt have to wait too long to be seated. I did notice that since we had our 1.5 year old son with us, they seated us towards the back a little - the only other people there were another family. I didnt mind that until we received very slow service. People who sat down way after us got to order first. When our server finally arrived, he was very helpful with the ordering process. We were served plantain and potato chips once the server came by and started taking our order.

We ordered their fried rice...I am blanking on the name now for some reason but it's the pork and shrimp fried rice with a bit of sweet and spicy chili sauce. the sauce was AMAZING. I would use that sauce for EVERYTHING.

Veggie empanada - it was recommended to us and that was also so tasty. cooked perfectly. 

Plancha Marina - this one didn't live up to its hype as much. I did enjoy the octopus though and will order that separately next time. The reason why I didn't enjoy it as much is because it was a little bland... I was a little disappointed by this dish and at $39 for the dish, I didn't think it was really worth it because it wasn't seasons and lacked flavor. the quality of the seafood in the dish was good though.

in all, this is a solid place. I didn't love it like I thought I would... but I would come back again just for the fried rice and their plantain chips.
author: Katelyn M.

description:
sat in the bar for happy hour (2 glasses of sauvignon blanc and the mixed ceviche) and everything was wonderful. 

returned for their new years eve event and sat on the patio and the food was horrible. It was like an entirely different restaurant. The covered patio was warm and lovely to watch the fireworks but the food was just overall a disappointment. 

Overall, try this place out any time they don't have a prix fixe menu.
author: Valerie B.

description: Great fresh food & great service. Nice views and we'll definitely be back. We had the california cebiche, it was great so fresh! And the other dish was the main Peruvian beef dish I want to say it was called something saltado.. it was really good and tender! Only thing I would say they should change which doesn't relate to the food etc., the entrance needs remodeling. The entire restaurant is modern beautiful except the entrance and for a second when we walked in I wanted to turn around and leave, once we looked around and saw further we were good to stay and the menu was good as well. Also they only have one bathroom stall, which would be odd on a weekend I can tell it gets packed in there. Overall, for us on a weekday for lunch it was all good!
author: Latisha G.

description:
Average enough food for such a pricey place. Ok it's not astronomical but it certainly ain't cheap. The food is nice, but not amazing. Peruvian food is some of my favourite cuisine, and Lomo Saltado is my favourite meal. Ordered it here, and truth be told, it was disappointing. It had all the elements there, but the rich flavours you find in Peru were sadly missing. Honestly, it felt more like a stir fry I'd knocked up myself.

The other issue was the staff - they were rude on several occasions. We waited for 20 minutes at the beginning in the bar before even being offered a drinks menu. I had asked for one several minutes before that and was what I can only describe as scolded for putting them under pressure, the host telling me "We only have one server on the whole bar you know!!!" Hmmm. My apologies if you didn't get your staffing right... At the end of the meal, we had a whole other drama with paying, which I won't go into to save anyone reading this from the massively tedious run down. Save to say it left a sour taste in our mouths.

The setting was gorgeous, and the place has such potential, but sadly in my opinion neither the food nor the atmosphere live up to it.
author: Emily C.

description: The night of la mar goes like this. We were pleasantly greeted by a woman that looks similar to Chandra of the HBO mini series, the night of.  So she walked us to their outside patio area and I thought "sweet! This is gonna be a perfect setting on a rare warm SF night". I was immediately crushed when she turned around and told us that the table she had for us was taken by someone else wtf? Strike one. Oh well indoor seating it is. The inside space is pretty spacious though but because of the higher ceilings and wide open area it is kinda loud and it can be hard to hear your own conversations at times. We ordered a few appetizers and a few drinks to start it off. As we waited, one of the servers gave us the wrong beer. Strike two. Luckily the guy who took our order was on top of it and swapped it out. We soon received our first dish pretty quickly so we were pretty happy. I think we were just happy to eat so we dug in but we realized halfway through the dish that it wasn't anything we ordered lol. They accidentally gave us a skewer dish which was pretty damn good! I guess that's strike 3??? But we were able to keep the dish and just finish it so we got an extra dish in the end for free so that wipes out all the strikes in my book lol. Anyways, what we did order was really good. The nikei cebiche and verde nigiri were our appetizers and very good. For main dishes we got pulpo anticuchos and aroz la mar. Both were delicious. The only dissapointment would be the shrimp empanadas. Nothing really special about it and kinda bland.  Despite a bit of mixup in their service I would definitely recommend la mar. Also the guy who took our order looked like Carson daly. Lol
author: Jennifer P.

description: Excellent food, interesting menu, beautiful ambiance! The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 is due to another patron verbally berating my sister and brother in law for their parenting style. Very rude! Do not seat kid haters next to a large table full of kids. Thank you.
author: Lainie M.

description:
Excellent scallops and blue shrimp civeche, perhaps the best I've ever had.  The pisco cocktails were unique and tasty.  We didn't have a reservation but the manager accommodated us anyways. We had the lounge area which turned out better than expected.

Great atmosphere.
author: Nim N.

description:
Took our out of town guests there on a Sunday night and everything was delicious. Every dish was crafted to perfection. 
Try the ceviche sampler, the paella, passion fruit scallops, the desserts. Pisco sour was yummy as well. 
Beautiful view and great service.
author: Irina A.

description: OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! I had the ceviche sampler.....AMAZING. Followed that up with a shrimp empanada.....MIND BLOWING. The food all paired well with a fabulous Spanish white wine Pazo Senorans.
author: Dustin S.

description: I've been to La Mar a couple of times, and my favorite dish so far is the beef empanadas.  It only comes with two empanadas, but they're pretty large in size.  The ceviche is also pretty good, as are the cocktails (I LOVE the bayflower).  The only dishes I could have passed on were the desserts I tried (pictured below).  They weren't bad, but I feel like I could've gotten something better at the Embarcadero building for less.
author: Cici A.

description:
The location for La Mar is perfect. You could go here just for the view of the bay alone (choose to sit in the covered patio). 

It's also has a nice modern trendy vibe to it. I liked the decor. 

The food was just average. I've had Peruvian many times and have had much better for much cheaper. We had the ceviche sampler, 4 different types for $39. They were Ok ceviches, nothing really stood out. Small portion for the price. We also tried the causas sampler, 3 different types for $19. These were our first causas and they seemed pretty bland to us. They looked very pretty but that's it. For main I had the anticuchos sampler, 3 skewers of chicken, pork, and fish for about $25 I think. These were a big miss. The taste was not very good. The hubs had plancha de mariscos, seafood including squid and fish served with potatoes. He barely finished the plate. It was ok. 

The food is average in my book. But the service was really very slow to terrible. We had to keep asking for items like plantain chips (we got bottom of the barrel bits), water, etc. The tables in the patio seemed tiny, esp with their gargantuan menus. I saw people having to put menus on the floor like we did. Just something amateurish about the place. It turned out to be a very expensive dinner (with wine and cocktails) and a total disappointment. We won't be back.
author: Vol T.

description: I would say this is an average Peruvian restaurant. Nothing that's stands out from the menu. Ceviches are good but not great. Lomo saltado is good and tasty. Pollo nikei is so-so. It's nice to eat at the patio that's overlooking the bridge.
author: Ruth R.

description:
One of my favorite Peruvian places ever. Situated along the Embarcadero Pier 1 1/2, this scenic restaurant serves up amazing ceviche (they spell it cebiche) that hits the spot every time!

Tip: Make a dinner reservation as this place is super packed! For dinner, you can find street parking across the street or just avoid the hassle and park in the Embarcadero parking garage.

Ambience: Great spot for celebrations, business meetings, and date night. The interior is modern, colorful, and just bright and festive. Lots of seating and they even have outdoor dining that overlooking the Bay Bridge. 

Hospitality: Great for the many times I've been there, so no complaints from me. 

Food: La Mar serves up complimentary plantain chips with a variety of dipping sauces that are just divine. Their ceviche and fresh fish dishes tastes as good as it looks! If you're a newcomer, order the ceviche tasting which comes with an assortment of 3 types of ceviche for you to try. My favorites are the ceviche clásico and the mixto since it gives you the right amount of acidity paired with some spicy habanero pepper flavor. I have tried their causas before, but I am not a fan of glamorized potato or starch dishes. I would, however, urge you to try the grilled meat skewers (anticuchos) of pulpo (octopus) or calamari because both are done extremely well. As for entrees, I always end up ordering the arroz la mar which I can only liken to a Peruvian version of paella since it comes with plenty of seafood mixed in with flavorful arborio rice. As for drinks, if it's available, I highly recommend the prickly pear margarita. So good and even prettier to admire for its magenta color. They also have a great bloody mary that has bits of octopus tentacles which sounds so bizarre, but my friend loved it and so I guess it works!
author: Chan K.

description: The overwhelming size of this Acurio establishment does not infringe service and food quality. An excellent experience in an attractive location makes it worthwhile. The restaurant can compete hand to hand with others in the category.
author: Luis Alberto S.

description: This is literally the best cervicheria. I guess the only thing better would be going to la mar in Lima. I got the California cerviche which has the freshest salmon and shrimp, the tangiest broth and delightful Peruvian beans. The empanadas are good but I've had better. The desserts are off the hook! Chocolate mousse with puffed quinoa is delightful - so light, barely sweet and different. The mascarpone and purple pudding is something I've never tasted before - not the best but worth a try!
author: Where A.

description: Very tasty!!! The chicha morada was watery and not flavorful :-( but food was delicious!
author: Beach H.

description:
I've dined at La Mar Cebicheria twice now and I'm officially a fan. A longtime lover of seafood - especially DAMN GOOD ceviche - this resto tops my list. They specialize in all sorts of Peruvian cuisine, including ceviche and lomo saltado. 

The resto is huge - like Texas huge, not San Francisco huge - so there's a lot of room for seating, however I still rec a reservation. If you're gonna sit at the bar, just drop in. I've done so twice and quickly snagged a seat at the bar with no wait.
author: Farrah A.

description:
The food here was amazing. 1st time I've ever had Paiche. The waiter explained every part of the dishes we were interested in to perfection. He made me want to order it! Thanks Mr. Hawaii! 
My wife ordered the salmon la mar. It was also very good. We had the blue corn drink and the passion fruit, both non-alcoholic delights! 
The only problem we had and I hate to be in it up... but when we arrived, there was a woman at the host stand who got the attention of all 5 hostesses while we waited.
