Not all of them were actually helping. We felt a little ignored. And it was my birthday. The hostess asked my wife if it was a special occasion and she said "yes, it's my husbands birthday. To which the response was, "oh that's nice!" But our waiter wasn't told. I'm not sure if they do anything for special occasions or not, but I did see another woman get a small dessert with a candle across the room later in our meal. 
Not a deal breaker for me though. It was busy night and we had a great evening! Go here and enjoy!
author: Christian S.

description:
Tasty x10000. Peruvian seafood? You want it? You get it! The people at the next to me were Peruvian and were loving it - sign of a good restaurant. 

Definitely recommend the ceviche trio with the catch of the day. It was insanely good and tasted very fresh, which is important with fish. Got a wine.. a white - sauvignon blanc honig and it paired perfectly with everything.

Got the Rice with Seafood dish which is what most of the photos on the yelp page show and it was absolutely delicious. My friend got the squid ink pasta with seafood which was good but mine definitely won that round. So fresh and filled with seafood. The shrimp were the best part. Had a mussel the size of my fist - I couldn't manage to eat it, it was so big! 

Totally recommend it, but definitely make a reservation. A place to dress up a little if you want!
author: Gemma S.

description:
An absolutely stunning meal. 

After two days in Napa (Bottega and Ad Hoc), we were extremely spoiled and I had low expectations, frankly. But every course here was a home run. 

Our party of four was not familiar with many of the Peruvian style menu, so we created our own tapas menu. We started with the cebiche sampler, one halibut, one halibut, calimari and scallops, and one ahi tuna. We all could have made a meal of any of these alone. The first two had a kick while the ahi was sweeter. 

The empanadas sampler was next. Chicken, beef, shrimp and vegetable (mushroom on this night). Once again, could have been a meal--perfectly done, with crazy flavors. 

But man am I glad we shared to save room for the Arroz La Mar. Our two couples each ordered this dish and split. The flavors were--well, just unlike anything I have ever eaten. The bowls were cleaned and we just couldn't stop talking about what we had just eaten. 

Then dessert. Our traveling companions had a chocolate dish they wowed about but I could have cared less because our tres leeches cake was the single best dessert I have ever eaten. 

When traveling here again, I would normally hesitate to repeat in such a great food town, but not this one. My reservations will be made well in advance. 

Tip---sit outside. Well covered, well heated, and lovely.
author: Steve E.

description:
Came here for new years day dinner! We arrived for the happy hour around 5pm. It is only applicable in the bar area. 

I got a blue mule and my boyfriend got a cucumber gimlet. They were delicious! For happy hour food I got the calamari appetizer and he got a chicken empanada. Because of the previous night's festivities (New Years Eve) They only had ceviches, the calamari, and empanadas for happy hour. The calamari was good, it came with plantain chips. I would have liked more sauce. I ate too much of this and felt nauseous from all of the fried pieces.

We had dinner in the main room a little while later. I liked that they offered complimentary plantain chips with dipping sauces but would've enjoyed the dinner part better if I didn't spoil my appetite during happy hour. We split a lomo saltado which was perfect for our appetite. We finished off with a sorbet trio. Looking back I wish I didn't eat so much calamari during happy hour but the meal was still delicious regardless.

I will say that the server was a little unnecessarily touchy. I asked if they offered dessert options and he spat back that all restaurants offer desserts, even mcdonalds. That's not true at all.. but I won't let that comment diminish the quality of the restaurant experience.
author: Amanda L.

description: Rude hosts, rude waitress, sub par lunch entrees. The empanadas were great, but would definitely not return here. Do yourself a favor and go down the street to Epic or waterbar for a similar view with way better food and wait staff
author: Alex M.

description:
3.5 stars - a little above average. Everything was decent, but nothing really blew me away except the plancha marina. And I tried a lot!

Had the ceviche sampler (clasico, nikei, and mixto) - the clasico (halibut that night) was disappointing, the other two were better and tasty, with the mixto winning, but nothing amazing. At this price point, I expected much better! 


Followed up with the scallop tiradito special and the plancha marina which were both delicious! I highly recommend the plancha marina! If I return, it would be for that. 

Lastly the sopa sera and alfajor for dessert. Sopa sera was good, but the definition of mediocre. Alfajor was meh, pretty looking but not much better than a stack of cookies. 

Drinks were okay - had the pisco sour and matalache.

Having dropped over $200 for a dinner for two, I was quite disappointed. The dinner was decent, but I could have had a much better meal at this price!
author: Steph A.

description:
Happy Hour Gave Me a Small Taste, and Now I Want More

I first found out about La Mar because many of my Yelp friends have already been there and reviewed that. So when I was in the area around happy hour, I had to try it myself. I was at the bar for maybe an hour. I ordered a pisco punch and calamari for about $15. Both were the perfect treat to end my busy day. 

Now this happy hour taste has me craving more, so I plan to be back for their dinner.
author: Joanna S.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I've been here probably 10 times total (I work at Embarcadero 4). Whether with coworkers, friends, or dates--this place kills it for any occasion. The food, ambience, service - everything I look for in a restaurant exceeds my expectations here at La Mar. 

The food here is super fresh and very flavorful. From the variety of dipping sauces they provide with the root vegetable chips served before your meal to the bold flavors of any ceviche (my fav is always the sampler since I can never commit on one), you will be experience some intense, tasty sauces and flavors at La Mar. 

Everything on the menu is good but my favorites include the ceviche sampler and Lomo Saltado. The service is almost just as important to me as the food quality, and I've never had a complaint about the service -- waiters / waitresses are attentive and catering to your needs - it's the ultimate restaurant experience at La Mar!
author: Heather Y.

description: The food was bomb! I got the marina planchado , we also tried then beef emmmmpanadas and the ceviche. No compliments! I wanted so yummy food and they delivered. Ambiance was nice, I forgot I was in sf for a second, almost had a Miami Beach vibe. Service was great! Con was the "historical bathroom" was kinda gross.
author: stephanie i.

description:
I went here a couple times and it is pretty darn authentic. It really reminds me of all the good food I had when I went to Peru a few years back.
Great cocktails and the ceviche is on point. The plantain chips served with a variety of dipping sauces are so addicting!
Good service and always packed so make a reservation or hopefully catch a seat at the bar.
author: Angela D.

description:
We dropped in on a Tues night. The bar and dining room were packed but we still got seated in ten minutes, no bad. Overall, we liked everything here. Ambiance was great; lively crowd, nice city view from the bar seating area and service was on point. 

Food was delicious, normal portions, we were stuffed by the end. We ordered:

Jalapeño Ceviche - white fish and scallops were my favorite in this mix. Very flavorful, not too tarte or salty.

Skewered beef hears - very tender, fresh flavor not too salty

Skewered steak - came medium rare which was perfect and juicy

Skewered fish - I was worried this will come out dry but it didn't. It was very juicy and nicely flavored. Loves all the skewers! 

Lomo Saltado - they make it very good here. Fries were not soggy and the sauce was very flavorful without being too salty. One of my favorites. 

Cocktails were yummy we had the jalepeno something which had a nice kick to it. We also had the passion fruit cocktail, that was yummy, would've preferred it w more passion fruit flavor but it was still good.
author: Lina J.

description: This place continues to be my gold standard for fun, delicious and inventive seafood in Sam Francisco. On my most recent trip, I got their special ceviche, which featured fried soft-shell crab, scallops, shrimp and more. Amazing. I got the fish skewer for my entree, and it took knocked my socks off. Then came dessert...the passion fruit mousse layered with raspberry compote, chocolate mousse, and almond praline was a magnificent construct and delightful to eat. I was very sorry I had to share it with my friends. :)
author: David B.

description:
This is the second time I've been to this restaurant.  As a native peruvian and a fan of Gaston Acurio (the owner and main chef), take my review with a grain of salt.

The food here is delicious.  I'm not exactly a fan of the price, since I know for a fact that peruvian food uses mostly simple, fresh and inexpensive ingredients.  But I suppose location is everything.  And speaking of which, the location is beautiful.  The ambiance is open, bright and has a beautiful view of Pier 1 1/2.  

I'll start backwards with dessert.

-  The picarones (sweet pumpkin/squash fritters with a molasses-based syrup) is ALMOST as good as the street vendors would serve in Lima Peru.  For someone who has never had them, I would highly recommend this dessert if you want the classic peruvian experience. 
Overall grade: 7.5/10

-  The lunch sampler: almuercito carretillero 15 (Mixed seafood cebiche, chicken stew and rice and yucca fries with huancaina sauce)
First off, the cebiche was (personally) the main highlight of this dish.  Fresh seafood marinated in lime juice with mixed herbs, a dash of garlic and pepper include shrimp, calamari, yellowtail, mussels, red onion, cilantro and the classic (and authentic) sweet yam on the side.  Simply perfect.
The chicken stew with rice was not exactly authentic.  However, delicious in its own right.  
The fried yucca with huancaina sauce was also not the most authentic tasting.  I'm used to eating this dish with a little more kick.  This can be accomplished if you use the rocoto sauce (red spicy sauce) mixed in.  Again, while not exactly as mama made it, it's still quite yummy. 
Overall grade: 7/10

- The appetizer: Anticuchos de Carne (grilled steak skewers)
Normally this dish is served with beef heart marinated for several hours.  However, because I was sharing with a non-peruvian guest, I felt more comfortable ordering the skirt steak version of the dish.  By far, one of my favorite peruvian appetizers ever.  The taste was spot on.  Cooked medium-rare (as it should be) and with all of the respective dipping sauces included.  This was definitely a hit.  
Overall grade: 9/10

- The drink: Maracuya Sour (Passion Fruit Pisco Sour)
Excellent.  It was hard not to order 10 more.  
9.5/10

Overall (TL;DR):

- Location and ambiance are phenomenal
- A bit pricey for my liking
- Food is mostly authentic, fresh, and will leave you satisfied
- Can't go wrong with anything from the cocktail menu
- Great for lunch, a date, or a dinner setting
author: Denisse M.

description:
**PISCO SOUR AND CHIPS AND SALSA**

--Review for the BAR AREA only--

I haven't been here for two years, so it was time for a revisit.

We decided to do the bar scene instead of a sit-down.

We enjoyed the chips and salsa. A variety of eclectic and colorful sauces. I liked the green one the best.

Ordered the PISCO SOUR ($10).

The drink was light, foamy, and delicious.

But not STRONG. Aww, I know.

We sat by the window for great tourist watching on the Embarcadero.

RECOMMEND.
author: Betty N.

description: Apps for 2 in the bar area--6 bites (the nigiri sampler and the shrimp fritters) each plus one beer each: $70. So not cheap.  The bites were each very tasty, but the service was pretty haphazard.   We didn't get the plaintains that had been brought to other tables, and the beers arrived 5 min after the food etc. I would guess the experience is better in the main dining room, which looked lovely.  We will definitely give it another try, though, as the menu is great and the food was delicious.
author: Robbie B.

description: Really like this place! The atmosphere is inviting and the patio is nice with some good views. The proportions are relatively small so make sure you're aware of that when ordering. All in all a great place!
author: Katelynn F.

description:
I had the California Ceviche, which contains shrimp and salmon, it was pretty good, but next time I might try a more traditional ceviche. I just had Peruvian ceviche at Limon Rotisserie the other night and I would give Limon a very slight edge (just comparing the ceviche), but just barely. I liked that La Mar serves their ceviche with chips, eating it with chips tames a bit of the tangy citrus. 

What I really loved about La Mar were the chips they serve, the potato and plantain chips, along with the accompanying sauces, were delicious and addictive. I was also very happy with the service, the bar tenders were very friendly. I ate there for lunch, so it was a bit hard to judge the ambiance, but the restaurant is nicely decorated and at the perfect location off of Embarcadero. 

I would love to come back and try more of the menu.
author: Bryson W.

description:
BLOWN AWAY! Beautiful restaurant and ambience right off the pier of San Francisco!

I came here on NYE 2013 with some friends and I must say, WOW! What an experience. Great friendly service, right off the bat. The awesome servers took photos for my friend and I. They took the time to stop and made sure we liked the photos though they were busy. 

This was my first time dining at a peruvian style restaurant and I love LOVE the flavors. Every dish we ordered was AMAZING.

1) Cebiche la mar - Fresh scallops, squid, yellow tail in a fresh citrus sauce.
2) Causa - Whipped potato with crab on top - fresh crab and light.fluffy potato
3) HUGE fried Red Snapper (entree) - shared between 4 people. The fish was cooked perfectly, the fish meat was so sweet and not overcooked.

Desserts (we ordered three!!)
1) choco - maracuya - passion fruit mousse, layered chocolate mousse with raspberries and almond praline. OMG MUST GET. This was sooooo relish, I want to go back just for this!

2) picarones - warm pumpkin with fritters - Spicy and smells like thanksgiving.

3) pannacotta de lacuma - Awesome pannacotta topped with chocolate, raspberries, with a side of 4 milk ice cream.

We also had two bottles of Cabernet that paired nicely with all the food, but unfortunately I forgot which one. LA MAR was an awesome dining experience where I enjoyed every dish the entire night. Our server was sweet, attentive, and awesome to chat with.

TIP: Reservations are a must!!

5 STARS
author: Karen L.

description: We had dinner for 62 on their covered patio right on the water. The food was outstanding (served family style) and the setting was beautiful.
author: Mark R.

description:
As I proclaimed to my dinner mates, one of my all time top 5 meals.  

Service was outstanding.  Our server took the time to explain some important points to guide us through the menu.  Much appreciated.

First, cocktails.  Cholito. Best described as slightly sweet, followed by a little heat.  Right up my alley!

Next up Causa Limena.  Difficult to split two between three people, but we managed. A light mix of crab and avocado on top of the silkiest whipped potatoes.  Trust me, you just need to try any of the causa's on their menu. 

My entrée, Salmon Fusion.  A perfectly grilled salmon filet, in the most delicious coconut milk broth with curry flavors in the background.  Pea pods and slightly steamed broccoli made this a light but complex flavored dish. Bonus that I usually dine with those that will share a biet or two, their dishes were flavorful and quite good. 

Dessert.  We chose three that sounded good. They weren't over the top memorable, I think I was still so impressed with my entrée (and full)!

The only downside was sitting in the tented patio area where the heaters blew too warm or let the cool bay breeze in.  The cocktails, appetizers and entrée was so delicious, I'm still giving this one 5 stars.
author: Kristi C.

description: I have never had Peruvian food, and after eating here, it may very well be my favorite food now! We had a family style dinner for 25 guests and it was an experience in flavor I have never had the opportunity to have before. If I visit San Francisco again this place will be on the top of my list!
author: Stacey S.

description: Enjoyed dinner here on a Saturday night with my family - it was recommended to us by a sales associate while we were out shopping in Union Square. Joseph was our server and he was great. He really talked up the fish of the day...he was right it was ALL THE THINGS, my mom and I split it and it was plenty. Will be back for sure!!
author: Alexis H.

description: This place was cool until the manager cut us off for no reason.  After the bartender said " I can't serve you guys anymore per my manager".  We had already spent over $483.00 and after asking for the manager, she had no reason or excuse.  It is what it is!  Eeally!? Middle eastern, Indian or what ever she was. The manager sucks!
author: Juan P.

description:
I went to La Mar during Dine About Town. I thought, now's the time to pig out and not end up with a bill the price of half an arm. I was wrong. 

Regardless of my thoughts that this place is pricey, I enjoyed my second experience here. The experience was far from "wow," but it was nice overall. The ceviche is delicious and I absolutely love the Peruvian corn. 

The restaurant is so large. I think sitting in the outside area would be best. I sat in the large dining room which felt like a cafeteria to me.
author: Irina R.

description: The tradito cold appetizer (however you spell it because I know I spelled it wrong) is delicious. I had the Nikie, which is ahi tuna marinated in a sweet soy ginger sauce that pleases the palate from beginning to end. Also tried the California ceviche. It was good and tasted better the longer it marinated. The salmon was better than the shrimp in the dish. As far as empanadas go, the chicken may have been one of the best I have ever had. The pork empanada was yummy and surprisingly sweet.  Veggie and seafood ones were good too but I would stick with the chicken and pork. Ending up here thanks to the concierge at the ritz. Well done!
author: Christina O.

description:
Excellent wait staff and service.
Went without reservations last night on the 4th of July weekend. 
Food was delicious and the service overall was very attentive. Highly recommended.
author: Mike K.

description: excelent service. wonderful food. every item in their menu is good. try tiradito. it's heavenly.
author: Alexis Z.

description:
We were at La Mar on Friday evening, and unfortunately had a less than average experience. Although the food is exceptionally good, the service and the communication between the staff the cook was terrible. We were sold on the special $120 beef from a terrific sales pitch from the waiter.  As we placed the order, 10 minutes later we learned that it was sold out.  We then order the tuna belly (another special) and 15 minutes later learned that it was sold out.  It seemed odd to have had all the specials gone prior to the last day of the specials.  The staff apologized, however did not offer anything to lieu of the inability to produce the specials they had worked so hard to sell.  

In addition, the glass that they served us a cocktail was badly broken on the lip of the glass.

I wouldnt recommend going unfortunately.
author: Z P.

description: The food was four stars, the service was barely two stars.  We had to wait 30 minutes to be seated after they promised us every five minutes we were the next ones to be seated.  Finally when we did get seated we were off in this segregated bar section right next to where all the extra chairs were stacked.  It took 15 minutes for the waiter to come and finally I had to ask the bus boy to call our waiter over.  Our food came out at odd times without any apparent order.  We were handed one of our plates 2 minutes after ordering it from perhaps a table that had changed their mind or a mess up in the kitchen.  Then when it was time to finish our meal we had to hunt down our waiter once again to ask for the check. He did not bring it after 15 minutes so we had to ask once again.  Overall I did not feel like this was a fine dining experience.
author: Ryan S.

description: Only got to try the bar menu items but it was delicious! The seafood piqueos was pretty small, would be hard to share. But very fresh and delicious sauces! The causa limeña was delightfully creamy and rich, a definite favorite. Hubby got the chicken, which had a good amount (topped with a lot of red onions though), and was not heavy at all despite being fried. The yucca fries were yummy and came with the most amazing sauce! I'd like to get the house fries next time - they look delicious too! And will definitely come back to try their lunch/dinner menu (or if they participate in Dine About Town again, it'll be on our list to try!).
author: Melissa L.

description:
Conflicted.

Food was amazing, atmosphere was great. Drinks were incredible. 

However, the service was absolutely horrid. 

We made a reservation. They lost it.

They found it again. When we finally got seated the table wasn't ready. 

We sat and waited 15 minutes for place settings and a server. 

The server took our order then served everyone but forgot the food items for one of our guests. Still charged us. 

I kept asking for a manager. One never came. A bus boy had to help me pay the bill. 

In from out of town. Restaurant came highly recommended. I wish it lived up to the hype.
author: Brittney B.

description:
I LOVE this restaurant and highly recommend going here if you're in SF. First off, the restaurant is HUGE and is right on the water...hence it being on pier 1.5. Secondly, you can't beat the atmosphere here. It's one of those restaurants that's a great place to have some drinks with a group of friends or a date. Kind of a sexy vibe in here. Third - the foooood! I love Peruvian food and while it's not THAT hard to find in LA, I haven't found a Peruvian restaurant that has the same vibe and as good of food. Most Peruvian restaurants here are très casual.

Anywho, onto the food!

- Ceviche - If you haven't had Peruvian ceviche then you don't know what's up yet. Mexican ceviche is whack after having this. Fresh fish (or sometimes other sea creatures) mixed with yams, red onion, peruvian corn (choclo) and habanero. I literally think about this ceviche all the time so needless to say, it's a must order when I go to La Mar.
- Lomo Saltado - I have to start off by saying that it's WAY WAY WAY overpriced here at $32. This is essentially street food consisting of sirloin, onion, tomatoes, rice & french fries in a soy sauce based sauce. You can't go wrong with that combo but again, you can find for less than $10 at a casual Peruvian restaurant that tastes very similar. I would order this if you've never had Peruvian food but if not, save it for a cheaper restaurant.
- Plantain, potato & sweet potato chips - these puppies come to you once you're seated and they're quite addicting. They also come with a trio of salsa's that only enhance the flavor. They used to give you 3 sauces - yellow, orange & green but they seemed to get rid of the green recently. You can still ask for it though.

Drinks are good here as well as they take their time making them. Pisco sours are a great one to try but I stuck to the prickly pear margarita on this trip. It was good but nothing spectacular.

On other trips I've tried various other dishes such as the empanadas, causas, etc. all of which are good. Come to think of it, I haven't really had anything that was so-so. Anything you order off the menu will likely be delicious.

Tip - park in the lot behind pier 3 (which is basically a parking lot on the water). The entrance is about 50-100 feet past La Mar on your right. I've been here so many times and it's hard to find parking until I discovered this lot.
author: Roxana Q.

description:
More like 3.5 stars than 3.  The place is very nice inside (and massive).  The table we were seated at was bigger than necessary, so it was tough to hear each other without shouting  We got:
- Cebiche chifa (4/5) - the peanut and ginger flavor worked well with the fish
- Causa limena (4/5) - big heaps of Dungeness crab that went really well with the potato underneath
- Scallops in parmesan (3/5)
- Empanada sampler (3/5) - the beef empanada was by far the best
- Mixed skewers (3/5) - pretty standard grilled meat skewers, nothing special

The food was decent, but expensive.
author: Simon L.

description: My roots are from Lima and La Mar holds true to my roots. Service is up to par and dishes are excellent. Prices are high but what do you expect in this area of the city. Every time we go on our own or with guests we say "Wow"!!!  Great food. Best in the Bay by far (I have been to them all). Only downside is it will cost you. Group of four with some drinks will be around $300.
author: Michael S.

description:
THE GOOD:
* The fried chicken on the HH menu is good.
* The drink specials at Happy Hour amazing - I could drink the raspberry mojito every day.

THE BAD:
* The food is on the pricey end, I didn't like any of the ceviches. Not fresh.
* The happy hour food menu is discounted but the portions are tiny. It's silly.
* I was sitting in front of my waiter/bartender, who forgot to make my drink. 30 minutes later, I reminded him and he gave me major attitude, while being unapologetic. 

I get that they can get busy, but unfriendliness and an inability to take responsibility for mistakes is not OK.
author: Jess C.

description:
A Peruvian food extravaganza, hosted by our fabulous waiter named Nick. He took my coworkers and I through a beautiful explanation of each and every item menu we asked about. We were served with excellence, each of us ordered one dish to share. 
The causo pulpo was SO FANTASTIC. The most tender octopus I have ever eaten with the brightest flavors. I also tried corazón, beef heart... That was something I have always wanted to try.
To finish, Nick presented us with a passion fruit chocolate mousse with housemade whipped cream quenelles and a very flavorful raspberry coulis. Also we had another fantastic dessert which was a chocolate crepe and a Peruvian fruit filling.... Holy love. 
All in all it was a FABULOUS experience, request nick to be your waiter, he gives you the whole rundown and knows exactly what he's talking about!
author: Jordan G.

description:
Friend was in town and he has never had Peruvian food so I knew the perfect place.

We were greeted by a lovely and charming hostess.  Weather was beyond perfect and we got a table on the patio right next to the water.  Food is delicious and we both rolled out of there will full happy tummies.

Service is friendly and attentive.
author: Lille L.

description:
Eating here was the highlight of my trip.  In fact, liked it so much I ate there twice!  The view from patio was nice.  The staff was pleasant and attentive.  But it was the good that was the star of the show.  Everything was vibrant, fresh, packed full of delightful flavors.  
This by far is my favorite restaurant anywhere!  I will make it a required stop any time I visit the Bay Area.
author: Alexandra F.

description:
One of the best peruvian meals that I had in a long time. First I couldnt get a reservation over the phone or through Yelp but I went straight to the restaurant and they make an exception. We had to wait because there was a Private Party so Happy Hour time!

After a few cocktails and appetizers, the hostess came over took us to a long kind of family style table next to the open kitchen. The server knew the menu upside down. Seriously, he gave us a full explanation of the menu, how big the plates, and if want to try different items and share it will be the best option.

We try the empanadas, ceviche tasting, arroz negro, salmon special of the day, and mariscos a la plancha. 

*The empanadas are ok. 
*The ceviche was awesome, different textures and flavors. The tuna and the passion fruit, the best. 
*Arroz negro was really good. Arborio rice or risotto with squid ink. Now dont think because is black it will taste different. Not at all, taste just like a regular risotto with the parmessan cheese and butter to finish. The squid was so soft and the shrimp taste like poached and then grilled.
*Salmon special had some salsa criolla, arugula, a aji amarillo with fava beans and a pesto sauce. Really good and really recomend it.
*Mariscos a la plancha, now this was my plate. The best dish of all. The grilled seaffod with the anticuchera sauce. Oh my god, soft, flavorful, and nice smoky taste.

For drinks, try the Pisco cocktails and the Passion Daiquiri.
author: Pedro F.

description:
I come here about twice a year for lunch and it has always been a solid go to spot.  With so many options in SF, it is hard to go to a place more than that unless it is truly spectacular or cheap.  La Mar is good but it is neither.

The Cebiches on menu are all really good.  Fresh flavors the balance the taste of the fish/seafood well. I would try the sampler if I was going for the first time.  Same can be said about the empanadas, which I found tasty and well stuffed.  The savory mix of pastry and meats are all well made.  Try the different ones to see which is your favorite.  

One thing I've always liked here is their selection of octopus dishes.  Today alone I had three items that had octopus aka pulpo.  The Causa Pulpo might be one of my favorite dishes here with grilled octopus in a spicey sauce on yellow potato causa of
avocado purée!  It's amazing.  

Whether the food is from the sea or the land, the grill or raw, its all very tasty.

The big drawback here is the price to portion size ratio.  This is a one of the pricier Peruvian places in SF. 

Mixed drinks were pretty good as well.
author: Veasna H.

description: We eat at La Mar in Lima all the time. This location was an utter disappointment. We tried it 4 years ago and decided to give it another try, what a mistake.1. Piscina sour was all mix and no piscina; lomo Saltado had no spice, arroz la mar was tasteless. The fish over cooked. We will NOT be back.
author: Tina S.

description:
Earlier this week, I had an executive visiting from New York and La Mar Cebicheria Peruana was a good choice of the Financial District, San Francisco locations. Service staff was informative and courteous without being 'highbrow' or pretentious. Our table had a nice view of the Embarcadero waters.

La Mar promotes itself as Peruvian Cuisine. The extensive menu ventures into other regions for culinary pleasure of their guests. 
San Francisco has many excellent restaurants to offer and La Mar in SF maybe overhyped in reviews. What we missed from the dishes were distinct flavors and spices.

In short, food was very good, atmosphere was better and service as good as your experience with the waiter or waitress.
author: Ben C.

description:
Very average experience. If I was rating our server, I would give the restaurant 2 stars. He was not attentive at all. I had to look around for him several times and with a restaurant of this caliber that is unacceptable. 

I have been to LaMar in Lima and this was definitely subpar to the other location. The food was ok, I would say 3 stars overall. The fish in the tiradito mix was cut a little thickly but the sauces were good. The plantain chips and dip sauces were delicious. The lomo saltado was good. Drinks were fine.
author: Jenny S.

description: We arrived about twenty minutes early and were asked to wait by the bar until the said time. We were never approached to be seated even after past our reservation time. Patrons who arrived after us were seated but we were still waiting at the bar not knowing what was going on. After we went and Checked in again, they finally seated us. The server who was helping us had no clue there was a separate menu for vegetarians. He seemed reckless when asked for a menu for vegetarians. We were waiting for about an hour to get our first course and drinks. We were not told properly that the appetizer on the New Years special menu was made of uncooked fish (we would not have preferred if it was mentioned in the menu). The portion of the second course was very small(probably less than an appetizer) . As a cherry on top, we were served with wrong dessert and when asked, the server told us to just take it. We really had to ask him to get us what we ordered in the first place. Really not a good way to end the last day of the year. Well, we survived but would never want this experience for ourselves again! Thanks but no thanks ;) !!
author: Madhu N.

description:
I ordered from the Dine About Town dinner menu. The food was okay. Not worth the price, in my opinion.

Causa Limena (Dungeness crab on top of a yellow potato causa with avocado puree, quail egg, cherry tomatoes, aji amarillo huancaina sauce and basil cilantro oil) - Pretty good, but a little too rich. It reminded me of a creamy crab dip, but without the crackers to dip in it.

Cebiche Mixto (Catch of the day, calamari and shrimp in an aji amarillo leche de tigre with cilantro, red onion, habanero, Peruvian corn and yam) - Excellent. This was my favorite.

Lomo Saltado (Traditional Peruvian-style stir-fry of sautéed flat iron, onion, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce, garlic, aji amarillo and fried potatoes) - There were more chunks of fried potatoes and onion than there was steak. It was served with steamed white rice. There was nothing special about this stir-fry. I've had better.

Passion Fruit Tart (Passion fruit mousse tart with an almond crust and garnished with raspberry coulis) - I enjoyed the first few bites, but it was too tart for me to finish. When our waiter asked how we liked the dessert, my friend commented, "It's very tart." The waiter responded, "Well, it IS a tart." Good point.
author: Janet M.

description:
We came here for a company holiday celebration, and they did a great job at managing a big group! The drinks were good, the food was delicious, and service was prompt.  For having a fixed menu, I felt all the courses offered provided a great variety of tastes and innovative flavors. The two cebiches (chalaco which was a mixed seafood and nikei which was a tuna) were delicious, and probably one of the best I've had in a while with very fresh ingredients! The beef tenderloin in the lomo saltado was extremely tender! The quinoa chaufa was different, and I thought it quite strange as it seemed rather fusion with fried egg noodles!

Overall, I was very pleased with the dining experience, and enjoyed the nice ambiance and food.  I'll definitely be back next time for more!
author: Tramy V.

description: I'm from Peru and thus had high expectations for this especially based on the prices. The environment was amazing unfortunately the waiter knew less about the dishes than me and even explained the dishes incorrectly. The plates we had were good and below average. The lomo saltado, one of their proclaimed most popular dishes was incredibly salty. It is definitely not how lomo saltado is based. They went overboard on the soy sauce. I brought this matter to the waiter and was given three desserts as an apology. They meant well and were all great people but I felt that the food was not up to par.
author: Alvaro G.

description:
The food was OK, but the service was horrible. The waiter took the order and never saw him again, the food arrived but the drinks were MIA. I had to stand up and talk to one of the servers and he took the initiative to get me my wine. About 10 minutes delay between food and drinks. 

The waiter finally reappeared to bring the bill.

SF has too many choices to return to this place
author: Manny M.

description:
The restaurant is situated along the Embarcadero at Pier 1.5 with a nice view out across the bay to Treasure Island. This place has got it all: great location, food, service, and view.

They have a bar in a separate room in the lobby of the restaurant where happy hour specials are served from 3 to 6 PM. You can try their popular pisco sour and punch while waiting for dinner service to begin or a nice house sangria.

Patio seating in the back of the restaurant is covered with a plastic barrier to shield from the chilly winds of the bay. Eating dinner out there is a great experience when the skies are clear and the weather is nice, but the breeze in the evenings can still be cold!

The waiter was super helpful right off the bat. We asked for suggestions and he, being Peruvian himself, steered us in the right direction. We ended up ordering way too much food (happens more often than not) because we just couldn't decide between so many awesome offerings. We also couldn't pass up the squid ink pasta special they had that day, too. So between the two of us, we had the plantain/sweet potato chips, causa sampler, cebiche, a skewer, AND two entrees. Yes, it was a lot of food. But we still even considered adding empañadas to our feast.
 
They give you fried plantain and sweet potato chips while you're waiting for your food. Of course we had to go with a ceviche, so we went with the cebiche jalapeño with salmon and octopus. It was a fusion of tangy, spicy, slimy, and chewy all in a delightful bowl. Our favorite was definitely the causa tasting. All 4 of the causas (limeña, nikei, pulpo olivo, and rusa) were delicious. If I had to pick, my favorite would likely be the nikei or pulpo olivo. Next time, I don't think we would mind ordering one for each of us. We went with the beef heart skewer because it was something out of the ordinary. It had tons of flavor and it was a little tougher and not as juicy as steak, but definitely not as strange as I had anticipated.

My family from Sacramento has been here before and keep wanting to come back. This seems like the number one suggestion for where to take out-of-town guests, too.
author: Vivian L.

description: While I like the food, they keep upping the price and removing dishes - like the fried sweet potato chips.  When I ask about either they give me a response like I'm an idiot and could be made happier elsewhere.
author: Curtis S.

description:
I had a big group dinner here several months ago and I was really impressed with how organized and on top of it the service was for our nearly 20 person party! They reserved a beautiful long table for us at the back of the restaurant, where we could gaze out the windows at the great pier views. The night got off to a great start when we were greeted with little Pisco sours... how can you be in a bad mood when sipping that foamy goodness?

The menu was set beforehand but clearly laid out for us so we knew what we were getting into. I love peruvian food but I don't know much about it - I just eat what's set out in front of me. So it was perfect for me to see a parade of delectable shared dishes. My favorite is always the whipped potato dishes and the ceviches. There was one entree that caused much confusion because people couldn't figure out if it was beef, chicken, or fish (and we had some fish-only eaters in the group)... it was weird because even the waiter didn't seem super confident in what it was. I guess you could say that based on this this protein wasn't super flavorful and was probably a bit overcooked (at the end we decided it was in fact fish), but everything else during the dinner was wonderful, especially this stewed beef that seemed to melt in your mouth. 

I do remember the dessert felt like a bit of an afterthought, and I would have much rather used the calories up on more of the main courses. Even considering that, I had an amazing time at La Mar and can't wait to go back!
author: Christina P.

description:
This is a very hard review- food was a 5 but service was a 2. I called this am to make a reservation. Since it was only myself the hostess said no need for a reservation you don't need one we have plenty of space. I showed up ten to 8 this evening and was told the dining room was full. I explained the situation and the hostess with the long brown wavy hair was a complete bitch. They did allow me to "go seat myself" in the front bar room, they were just veryyyy cold and unwelcoming. Very dismissive and disregarded me as I am young and dining alone. Sat myself in front bar room. Long story short my app and entree came out same time. By time I got to main course it was no longer hot. During my entree the waitress was too busy hanging out with bartender to check on me. Finally got water after I asked and received when I was done eating. Not the cheapest place and not most expensive BUT the service sucked- careless, snobby and cold. They acted like they were doing me a favor. Such a bummer!!!

It was such a shame that the staff were so inconsiderate as the food was GREAT!!! Fantastic fresh seafood and delicious drinks. Very good!!! I would come back any day based on foods quality, taste, creativeness and freshness. Sadly I won't because if I spend over $100 on a full solo meal Id like some consideration. 

EL MAR GET YOUR STAFF TOGETHER!!! You can and should do better!!
author: Nala P.

description: Friendly service in a beautiful modern and casual waterfront setting in a historic seaport.  I found the food to just be ok, maybe it's because I am not a seafood eater which is the specialty here, I opted for the steak kabob, I found it good, nothing special and for the price the serving was very small.  The desserts were great though.
author: Charmie P.

description:
We are visiting from Denver and a friend of ours recommended this restaurant. So we had lunch here. Let me describe the scrumptious meal we had:
There are approximately 10 ceviches to choose from, and the 3 we had were the Mixto, Power, and Mar and Montana.... Amazingly fresh with very unique and wonderfully tasty sauces that they call "leche de Tigre". 

In addition to the ceviches we tried the Causa Limena, which is made from super fresh Dungeness crab on top of whipped potatoes. Now, I am not much of a potato fan, but this was delicious. One other potato dish absolutely worth trying is the grilled octopus dish, Pulpo. Perfectly cooked octopus with potatoes and creative sauce. 

They have a few unique cold sake variations which I have not tried before. Almost like sake wine and champagne. 

And for desert we tried the 2 fruity dishes. The choco-maracuya which is a passion fruit mousse. 

Absolutely recommend this restaurant. Worth every bite.
author: Olya A.

description:
I've been wanting to come to La Mar for so long. In synopsis, this place is overrated (read over-priced). Overall the experience was positive, I'll explain in detail below. The food is good, the service is fine, the view is incredible. That's a price gouging* trifecta. 
*Price gouging defined as greater than $125 per person before tip for slightly above average meal

Happy Hour: do yourself a favor and take advantage of their daily happy hours, 3-6pm.
Empanadas: Chicken empanadas were decent, nothing memorable to say about these
California Cebiches: Pretty good, but I think it's weird they use tiny shrimp for how expensive it is. I'm talking salad size shrimp. 61/70 if we are talking grocery store numbers. 
Arroz La Mar: This was meh, again with the tiny shrimp (and one regular sized shrimp, just one) along with the tiniest piece of Mahi Mahi you've ever seen. I'll call it 2"x 1" for imagery purposes. 
Estofado Nikei: The beef cheek was AMAZING! My BF ordered this and I was having serious regrets for not ordering it too. It was $42 but worth it. Call me crazy but I was expecting the entire meal to be this good. *salivates as I type*
Service: The service was fine, our server seemed to have wayyy too many tables. He would leave and not come back for a while. It was fine since we weren't in a rush. He did offer to pack up our leftovers and never came back with them... We were half way home before we realized so I guess that's on me. 

This place could cut it's prices in half and would still be a overpriced IMO.
author: Jenna M.

description: This was for "Happy Hour" at the bar, since the restaurant is closed from 3:00-6:00PM. "Hostess" was rude and dismissive stating restaurant closed, but could go to the bar if we wanted. We had just walked from Pier 39 so were looking forward to drinks and food along the bay, but instead had to sit inside at the bar with limited menu. Staff was not very professional and attentive, actually pretty unorganized. Cebiches, clasico & mixto were ok and beef empanadas just ok and came out before our drinks?! We were charged $5 for canchita salada (roasted corn kernels) which I thought was way too high and another $5 for plantain chips with mediocre green sauce, Overall way disappointed. Expected more especially at that price point/ About $123.00 for light appetizers and few beers, piscos sours.
author: J. C. S.

description:
This place is fantastic and I definitely want to go her again and try everything possible of the menu. The Pisco sours are so amazing!! It's a must-try and is a very fresh and refreshing drink. The ceviche options 
are amazing and I would want to try all of it. The ceviche is super fresh and picks up the flavors it's trying to fuse together. 

I'm a huge fan of the restaurant and the atmosphere it's beautiful and waterfront. It's on the Embarcadero and a good place if you're trying to wine and dine or take someone out on a date. The heat lamps on the deck are awesome and even on a colder day you're totally comfortable!

I love this place and want to go back and continue to try all of it.
author: Priya S.

description:
Peruvian Restaurant on the Embarcadero in San Francisco Pier # 1.5.

First off I have read some bad reviews based on the food not meeting true Peruvian faire. When I asked a Peruvian friend about the restaurant he told me that the food was actually Peruvian Fusion and not true Peruvian. Knowing that ahead of time I was sure to make note of the dishes I had, what I liked and what I didn't. I was able to effectively go over my food selections with my friend.

First off we had the National Drink of Peru; the Pisco Sour; It was like lighter fluid and the fire came right out of my nose and just about burned my nose hairs out.

We started with the Cebiche Chifa: Yellowtail with peanuts, scallions, ginger, pickled carrots and daikon, habanero, wonton strips and cilantro in a sweet and sour sesame oil leche de tigre. I loved the addition of the sesame oil.

A Causa sampler plate with 4 of the Cuasas which are whipped potato concoctions using different types of potatoes. Each Causa was so different but absolutely delicious.

Empanadas de tamalito verde - Filled with sweet corn, cilantro, and queso fresco served with salsa criolla and huancaina rocoto sauce. Sooo delicious.
And we finished it off with dessert:

Picarones
Traditional warm pumpkin and sweet potato fritters with spiced chancaca syrup. This dessert was delicious beyond words. They were fried pumpkin donuts with a molasses syrup.

It is a pricey restaurant, but I loved it.
author: Robyn J.

description:
I came here just for drinks during mid-day and enjoyed myself here.  We sat near the front windows, with a flat screen, and what ever drink we desired.  It was very relaxing and the people there are nice.  I could sit here all day sipping on my wine.  I had their pinot noir and that was tasty.  My only complaint was that my glass wasn't too clean...

I definitely want to come back to try the menu because I hear amazing things about it.
author: Julie C.

description:
Mixed. The space is gorgeous. The food was delicious - shared the ceviche and ate the salmon.

BUT - service was HORRENDOUS. The server acted like we were a nuisance, and we truly weren't. He was a bad bad waiter.

And the bathroom was DISGUSTING.
author: Andrew K.

description:
This was my first time to this restaurant and I was pretty impressed with everything. My friend wanted to celebrate his birthday here and I actually enjoyed myself here at La Mar Cebicheria Peruana. 

Food: 5 stars! The dishes were served on beautiful plates that kept the food hot. I ordered the Lomo Saltado which consisted of tender beef strips, potato wedges, onions and tomato wedges sautéed in a delicious oyster sauce. On the side was a small cup of fluffy white rice that had hint of garlic. SOO GOOD. The beef strips were so tender it almost melted in my mouth. My group ordered an assortment of ceviches that we ate with an unlimited amount of fresh plantain and potato chips. We also shared chicken, mushroom and beef empanadas. The crust was so flakey. The chicken empanada was so moist and tasty! I also ordered the Pisco Punch cocktail made with pineapple juice and rum. It was garnished with a dash of nutmeg which made the drink remind me of Christmas morning. After getting through the nutmeg, you could really taste the pineapple and rum... Don't be fooled by the size of this petite drink...  Having one might leave you a little tipsy. 

Service: We had a reservation at 8:15 and was brought to our table by 8:10. The hostess asked if this was my first time to the restaurant and welcomed me as she brought us to our table. The restaurant was a little busy but our waiter, Eloy, was very kind, and welcoming. He was always available for our party 8. My water glass was never empty and my cocktail always full. Great service. 

Ambiance: We sat in a booth close to the kitchen and every couple of minutes, the flames from the kitchen lit up the restaurant adding a unique ambiance to the atmosphere. Through the window, the Bay Bridge was visible making my friend's birthday dinner very memorable. Fresh cut flowers were towering over us in beautiful glass vases filled with water. The restaurant was decorated with neatly groomed tall palm trees scattered through the main dining room. A great place to bring a date or a group of friends. 

Overall, I would totally come back here for their delicious food and great service! I would love to try the rest of their menu. The price averaged around 100 bucks per person but well worth it. Would love to experience and tryout their happy hour. 

Tip: if you bring your own cake to the restaurant there is a $2.50/person cutting fee. They will store you cake in their fridge and bring it out on your request.
author: Jordan C.

description: Slow service even though barely any customers. Heavily priced for small and poorly seasoned food.
author: Leila N.

description:
The service here is great! The baristas are super nice and down to earth. My friend and I came 15 minutes before happy hour and they already knew what was up! Super chill. The drink was also really really good. It was strong yet super tasty and easy to drink. I had the passion daiquiri - it was so so so tasty. I want to go back right now for another sip of that tasty delight - very refreshing. 
We also had the homemade chips (sweet potato, plantains, potato chips) for $3 and the cebichin mixto and twas good. I will definitely come back here and try out more of their menu. 

La Mar Cebicheria Peruana, you guys have made my first peruvian restaurant experience, the best ~ 

Good service, good food, and good drinks!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Came here for the ceviche, and enjoyed everything we ordered. Their service is great and their employees are very attentive and welcoming. We had a reservation around the time the restaurant opened, so when we arrived early we were offered to take advantage of their happy hour. We ordered our ceviche along with drinks. Very fresh seafood. All the cocktails we ordered were great, and the happy hour price made it even better! 

As far as their dinner menu, I would recommend their empanadas y piqueous appetizer to try the variety of flavors like beef, chicken, or mushrooms. If you're feeling a little more adventurous order the corazon. Yes! Tasty and tender pieces of skewered beef heart served with their fried potatoes. A must try!
author: Danika J.

description:
A massive Peruvian place right on the water, with a massive menu.  If you're like me, this triggers one of a few reactions: (1) beg the staff to demystify it and recommend the best stuff (2) desperately scan the menu for the word "sampler" or (3) look to Yelp to save you.   In my case (3) led to seeking "empanadas" and "cebiche" but each of those came in a bazillion varieties.  So we resorted to (2), and learned (spoiler alert!):
- Mixto and Nikei Japanese were the best cebiches
- Sweet corn was the best empanada (to our collective vegetarian surprise!)

Now that I've ruined it for you, I'm not sure there's much reason to see this movie, especially at $60 a head when you buy drinks (double spoiler alert! - their Pisco Sour is solid and non-(wet-dog-smelling) and so is their gingery "cholito").
author: Aaron M.

description: This was an amazing dining experience. We had the power cebiche (oysters, scallops, and Dungeness crab), nikei causa (ahi tuna over whipped potatoes), and I had the ravioli chupe (squid ink ravioli filled with Dungeness crab and shrimp topped with fried quail egg). My husband had the plancha marina (grilled octopus, calamari, shrimp, and salmon with portobello mushrooms and veggies), which he also really enjoyed. Our server was very attentive and did a great job of explaining the menu to us, he also surprised me with a complimentary dessert for my birthday. We would definitely come back to try other ceviches and other menu items.
author: Denise A.

description:
La Mar is my favorite peruvian restaurant in SF.  I've been here many times, in a small group, in a large group, in the bar, in the dining area, for lunch and for dinner.  I've enjoyed the meal and the ambiance every time.  I'm a big fan of the pisco sours, the ceviche, the lomo saltado, and the (complementary!) plantain and sweet potato chips.

The only reason why it's not getting 5 stars is that I have had some experiences where the service was not up to par, particularly in the bar area or when the restaurant is busy.
author: Janet Z.

description: I was here with my boyfriend in November 2015. We loved everything we tried from the menu. Food is absolutely amazing. We also had some cool Peruvian drinks. We ended up going here for the dinner twice during our stay in San Francisco.
author: Neda P.

description:
Ohh I do want to come here again. Really really. The service was fast, our waiter was friendly, and the food and drink were soo good.

I got a cholito to drink which was absolutely fantastic. To eat we ordered the Cebiche la Mar which was easily split between two. The Nikei was really delicious as were the Classico and Chifa, and we weren't as big fans of the Mixto but they were all soo good so it didn't matter. We also tried the Causa Limena which was also very good, and then my boyfriend was still hungry (for some reason--it may have looked like a lot of small portions but what we ordered was very filling!) and ordered the empanada sampler (which I thought he'd end up taking home but he absolutely devoured) which I tried a bit of and were also very fresh and delicious.

Overall, soooo yummy! I want to come back and try everything again! We got there right when it opened and had no problem being seated.
author: Katie V.

description: I thought this place was just average. I got their rice with their stir fried pork. The price point is really high here for what they serve and I wasn't enthused about anything. Their complimentary banana chips are delicious though. Service there was a but rude since the waiter kept trying to get my friend and I to leave when we were just trying to take our time to eat. He kept rushing is so I was rather annoyed by that. I believe they were judging our "young age" and didn't think we could afford the place (I just look young for my age). They were only nicer when we asked for the dessert menu as well. Needless to say, I was unhappy with their treatment of us and will not be returning.
author: Victoria C.

description: The food was excellent, the drinks were really good too, but the pisco sour wasn't as tasty as I expected, but they had other better drinks. Definitely worth coming here, especially during happy hour, good food, drinks, vibe and music
author: Salvador T.

description:
Was really disappointed that my personal experience here did not meet what my friends told me.  Came here to celebrate a send-off for my friend, and was looking forward to a good evening.  However, the prices are outrageous.  Definitely not worth it.  Think twice before taking a date or treating someone here...count on easily spending over $100 w/o drinks and $200 with drinks...omg....
Things started off with my friend getting a dirty fork....damn nasty...and she almost ate with it...server didn't seem apologetic at all...
Causa sampler was not good.  Ceviche Power with scallops was delicious but we finished that dish with two scoops basically.  Lomo Saltado was not worth $32, despite quality beef...I've tasted better at literally a quarter of that price! 
I was also under the impression that dessert would be on the house when I made the reservation, but that was not the case either...
Dishes are really heavy in flavor and I get really thirsty.  For tables like ours, they should just leave us a pitcher....
I'm glad I tried this place personally for myself...but the burn it causes in my wallet makes this a one-time only place.
author: David W.

description:
Would I come back... of course...

But Temma, why the 3(.5) stars... well let me tell you why...

Once upon a Thursday we came in to eat.  Service was fast and friendly....

However portion control to price was lacking.  Don't get me wrong, I find their ceviches and skewers fantastic... but lacking in substance (i'm not a 12 year old girl, I do need food).  Also their wine selection left much to be desired.

Their potato chips saved their life.  I will come again and maybe update my review.
author: Tiana S.

description:
So nice, just a bit pricy, but some of the stuff is worth it! ! Tasty and spicy...
Probably would live there if it had more specials and coupons or discounts! !
author: Jaime S.

description:
My sister attends UCBerkeley and always raved about this place. After a 7 hour drive from Socal, my family decided to eat here for dinner. We came around 7 without reservation but we were seated right away. They gave us the BEST potato and plantain chips with Peruvian dipping sauces. We ordered Lomo Saltado, Arroz La Mar, and a couple more. Overall, the food was pretty good but not really worth the price.
The Lomo Saltado that I ordered was $34 so I was expecting a pretty big meal, but it was so small with only a couple pieces of steak. 

I love the view of the pier, friendly waiters, and overall ambience of the restaurant. Free parking is a bit hard to find, but there is a parking lot right in front of the restaurant for $15. The food was good, and it's definitely worth trying Peruvian food at least once. 

Food: 4
Service: 3.5
Price: 2
Ambience: 5
author: Ji L.

description:
My husband, cousin & my cousin's boyfriend came her after City Hall Wedding for dinner. For the most part, we had a great experience.

Pros: Great food, nice location & tasty drinks! Also their host & servers were friendly.

Cons: Service is a little bit slow. The server forgot that I ordered another cocktail & our check took some time to get to us. I also can understand since it was a busy Friday night. 

Since we just got married, they gave us a mini dessert & champagne for the whole table for free! 

I'd come back for the food, but maybe not on a Friday or weekend night.
author: Michelle F.

description: If you are visiting San Francisco I would want to stop by this place. It's beautiful, around a million places and has a beautiful water ocean view.  Everything on the menu Delish. You might as well close your eye and point at something random and you will love it. The drinks are tasteful and mouth watering as well. Bring your family, date, friends or yourself and enjoy little bites of heaven.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It's a nice area. It's a nice restaurant. The plating looks nice. 

But that's about it. :[

Who doesn't like a waterfront view? And inside this under-the-sea matchy matchy theme inside the restaurant? But that's really about it. Everything was pretty much average or sadly under expectations. 

I've been here twice. Once on a regular day for an early dinner on a weekend, another time on Christmas Eve.  The restaurant is big enough so even without a reservation, the wait shouldn't be that bad. There are both tables and bar seating, and bar tables up front.  Plenty of space.

So it's a cebicheria, let me follow suits and order a ceviche. Both times I came, I ordered ceviche. First time was why is this so citrusy and sour and what happened to my seafood? For the longest time I hated ceviche. Second time was about the same.  They put too much citrus juice in their ceviches, you cannot actually enjoy the seafood for it's own. It gets a bit overwhelming for me and my tastebuds. 

Alright, let's try other stuff. So we had the arroz de la mar, which resembles a paella without the pan. We had the quinoa salad, what I had might not be the same as yours, since its ingredients are very seasonal. Presentation of the salad was pretty.  Mine had a cylindrical shaped of some yam with avocado on top and spinach and arugula above it all. Then drizzled this mango-like sauce all along the plate and quinoa splattered around. Taste-wise, decent, but the quinoa was a bit undercooked. The rice had pretty good fish, cooked just right, not too tough from being overcooked. Clams were a bit on the bad side, had a strong rotten taste to it.  They didn't do too well masking that taste or the quality of their clams was just barely average. The overall flavors of the dish was a bit lacking. 

What was really bad was the time needed at the restaurant.  I told my server that I'll have the ceviche and the salad while my love orders the rice. It's terrible for me to get both my food before my date. He ended up picking at my ceviche too and munching on the free chips. I basically left my salad sitting there for 30-45 mins while waiting for his rice to come.  Our server didn't really take the initiative to check on our foods either.

But yea, all in all, I paid for my view. YAY!!!!!
author: Connie C.

description: Food was good; service was not as good. We made sure to tell the waiter tonight the list of ingredients that will elicit an allergic reaction from my daughter, but her entree still arrived with one of those ingredients! After waiting quite a while for a "new" dish, her meal arrived and she still found the offending ingredient - 1 pea! We became suspicious that her first dish was probably taken to the kitchen and someone sorted through it and still missed to get every one of the peas. Absolutely not okay; anaphylaxis is not a joke. The manager said that the kitchen would not have done that; that it could have been a cross contamination because it's a popular dish. All I know is that the waiter was informed when we ordered. This type of incident is how a customer like myself loses trust in restaurants. We were provided a gift card after I refused any adjustment on our bill, which was already paid before I spoke to the manager. Disappointing experience. For those with allergies, be very careful if you want to eat at this place. I'm not sure how conscientious the chef and assistants in the kitchen are in listening to their customers. I will probably gift someone with the gift card. I can't take my family here again. We eat at all kinds of restaurants when traveling. I have children with very developed tastes. It's too bad that this particular establishment is careless.
author: Joy M.

description: A great venue on the waterfront brings you to a perfect place to entertain out of town guests. I have been here many times even living locally. The ceviche menu is always on point and their small apps tastings are perfect to just order a bunch share in a  larger group. The main dishes are somewhat forgettable, but still well-prepared. Just nothing extraordinary. Plentiful seating usually means very low wait times, but weekends and evenings should assess the reservation if you can. The happy hour bar at the front is a great starting point or rest stop when you are doing your shopping at the ferry terminal market next door. This place is as authentic as it comes. From trekking. Through Chile and Peru for three weeks, definitely get the pisco sour cocktail to start. You're in for a good time.
author: David M.

description:
Sure, there's good food right at the Ferry Building, but this is the CLOSEST PLACE you can possibly go from there (Pier 1.5) and still find Peruvian DELICIOUSNESS! It's obvious you must try one of their cebiché dishes (start with the clásico), so let's talk about additional elements.

Try to sit outdoors on the back patio. You're literally on the bay, so why not get the view right there? If there's a nice breeze on a sunny day, you're already on a stairway to heaven.

Even though it sounds like a side dish, try the complementary plantain chips with the 3 dipping sauces. You can use these sauces for dipping just about everything served there because they are so flavorful and exquisite!

It is good to know that while their cocktails were seducing (try their Scarlet!), they also can make various coffee beverages. I had a mocha after my cocktail, and it helped wake me up during that Sunday brunch.

Even their pannacotta dessert dish, which was artistically designed with raspberries, graham cracker crumbs and chocolate streaks, is as mesmerizing as it is energizing.

There were a few other main dishes had, and the restaurant was busy the entire time, but on flavors alone, I was so glad to have been adventurous. Now, it's your turn!
author: Garett T.

description:
Leche de Tigre: Hangover Cure? Aphrodisiac? SOLD!

La Mar has been on my radar for over a year now. However, it wasn't until watching an episode of "Unique Eats" on the Cooking Channel and hearing about the Leche de Tigre (Tiger's Milk) and its "healing" effects did it quickly raise the ranks on my bookmark list. My friend also saw the same episode and brought it up in conversation, so we both decided it would be next on our hit list.

On Wednesday, 6.1.11, my friend and I arrived for our 7 PM reservations and were promptly seated. FYI, if you can't find a feasible day/time on OpenTable, call for reservations instead.

FOOD
*COMPLIMENTARY CHIPS  - Yam, Plantain & Potato Chips w/ 3 Housemade Dips: 5 STARS

The chips were perfectly fried to a light crispiness and were ADDICTING! The yam was my fav one as the sprinkle of salt brought out its natural sweetness. We liked the habanero dip the best as it was the most flavorful; savory and garlicky with a huge fiery kick. The other 2 sauce were too bland to even make out what they were.

*CEBICHE TASTING ($31): 4 STARS
1) Clasico (Halibut, Red Onion, Corn & Yam): The chunks of halibut were soft and moist and the tiger's milk gave it creamy tanginess without overpowering the delicate taste of the fish. The corn and yam were a nice addition giving it a hint of sweetness.

2) Mixto (Yellowtail, Octopus, Cilantro, Habanero, Corn & Yam): Although the yellowtail and the octopus were super fresh and tender, this was our least fav cebiche as the chili based tiger's milk was too assertive and overpowered the seafood.

3) Chorrillano (Yellowtail, Mussels, Calamari, Shrimp, Cancha & Celery):  This cebiche also had a chili based tiger's milk, however, the heat and tanginess was more subtle so it didn't hinder the natural sweetness of the seafood. I loved the cancha (toasted corn) which provided a nice crispy texture contrast.

4) Nikei (Ahi Tuna, Red Onion, Avocado, Nori & Sesame): My fav cebiche as it was the perfect rendition of an Hawaiian Poke. The delicate chunks of ahi were dressed in a tamarind based tiger's milk which gave it a subtle sweet and sour flavor. The avocado added a layer of butteryness while the nori and sesame were the icing on the cake giving it that bite of nuttiness. 

*CAUSAS TASTING ($21): 4 STARS
1) Limeña (Crab, Avocado & Quail Egg): My Fav! Savory, creamy and sweet; it was like eating a crab salad sandwich with lightly whipped potatoes instead of the bread.

2) Saltadito (Fish, Shrimp, Calamari w/ a Soy-Oyster Reduction): The soy-oyster reduction overpowered the delicate seafood making the causas too salty. 

3) Nikei (Ahi Tuna, Avocado & Nori): My 2nd Fav! The sweet tender ahi, buttery avocado and toasty nori along with the whipped potatoes was like taking a tuna tartare to a whole new level of creamy decadence.

4) Casera (Artichokes, Asparagus, Avocado & Tomato Confit): Our least fav as it had an unappetizing tangy and bitterness. 

*LOMO SALTADO - Stir-fried Beef Tenderloin, Onions, Tomatoes, Soy, Garlic w/ Fries & Rice ($29) - 3 STARS

Recommended by many Yelpers, this dish was OVERRATED! Lomo Saltado is like a Peruvian version of Vietnamese Shaking Beef with tomatoes and fries. My friend hit the nail on the head when she said this dish tasted too familiar. Although the beef was tender with a good balance of saltiness and tang, it was very forgettable. I had better "shaking beef" at Vietnamese Restaurants for 1/3 of the cost. 

*ESFERA DE CHOCOLATE - Chocolate Sphere w/ Lucuma Ice Cream, Vanilla Foam w/ Hot Chocolate Sauce ($12) - 5 STARS

As the hot chocolate sauce was poured tableside, it slightly melted the chocolate sphere which made it a touch oeeey goeey. The lucuma (tropical fruit) ice cream core was sweet and creamy and its taste resembled a pumpkin with a citrus twist. The layer between the chocolate sphere and ice cream core was the fluffly vanilla foam which helped lighten the dessert.

SERVICE
Friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive; however there was slight language barrier with one of the food runners. He also talked so fast that we couldn't understand him and when it came time to pack up our meal, he had thrown away our rice that came with our lomo saltado.  

Dishes were well-timed and water glasses were always filled which is always a plus.

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR
La Mar is a HUGE restaurant that's perfect for large parties. There's a bar in the front, a lounge area, sushi bar-type seating, dining area seating and seating in the outer patio. The décor is crisp and simple; big open space, wooden floors and furnishings accented with bright ocean blue décor gives it that Miami Beach feel. 

PARKING
Easy street parking before 5:45 PM. Parking lot across the street is $15.

I didn't feel any "healing" effects of the Leche de Tigre, however, I'm glad this is what drew me into La Mar. The food was beautifully presented, fresh, creative and most importantly deliciously tantalizing!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy!! Everything we tried from chicken skewers to sampler ceviche, to the dessert.. Was all so good! But be prepared to pay the price! 

I would definitely come back!
author: Lila S.

description:
La Mar has a cool location right on Embarcadero fronting the ocean. The ambiance is nice...the whole restaurant is in a large warehouse type of structure so you kind of get lost in the crowd of people dining which is kind of cool. 

I started off with the pisco punch which was delicious, but quite costly at $13. I wasn't sure what to order for dinner other than a cebiche that was recommended by friends. I asked our server if the dishes were served ala carte or individual style; he advised us it was individual style (wrong) and that they would be too small to share. Based on this advice, we ordered a cebiche, empanadas, a beef skewer and arroz jugoso. This was MORE than enough for 2 people and we had to pack food to take home. 

Everything was delicious. I could have skipped on the skewer but it was still tasty. 

Minus 1 star for the DIRTY, DISGUSTING bathrooms and minus another for the poor recommendations from our server. I would still give it another try again if I lived in the city, but it is not a must-visit when I'm in town visiting.
author: Richard K.

description:
I've been to La Mar many times and was very surprised to receive really bad customer service. Our server was James who was extremely rude and did not crack one smile, he never said excuse me when placing silverware in front of us nor did he ever say you're welcome. My gf received the incorrect drink and he did not even  apologize. The cherry on top was when I asked him a question and he raised his finger at me motioning one minute and when we asked to have the drink menu stay at our table he placed it on the ground.  

The reason we are giving two starts is because of a bus gentlemen, he was so attentive and checked in with us numerals times while James was absent. He was so great that I tipped him more than I tipped my server. 

I hope that when I come back to La Mar. James will not be there like he was when he was our server.
author: Eliana A.

description:
Unique preparations and ingredients contribute to a very satisfying dining experience. Lots of sustainable fish dishes - 7 varieties of ceviche, which, we learned is Peru's national dish. My swordfish anticucho, a grilled skewer which is typical of Peruvian street food, was simply delicious. The fish used changes based on availability. It is accompanied by small potatoes, large kernals of Peruvian corn and 2 yummy sauces.

Our server was delightful and her upbeat attitude added to the experience.
author: BettyLou H.

description:
Consistently great every time we've dined here, including back when this place first opened.   Clean, modern lofty interior, still as packed, so we couldn't get any inside or outside seating (the patio is great if you can snag that), and had to settle for the bar area at the front near the podium.  It was still nice, with very attentive service.

The food was tasty as usual.  We started with the Cebiche La Mar (sampler), which was the only thing I wasn't crazy about, but everyone else at the table enjoyed.  The Empanada Sampler was a hit with everyone.  My fav was the mushroom one.  The Carne Anticuchos (beef grilled skewer) was awesome.  Other dishes were the Nikei Picante (sea bass with bok choy), the Arroz Norteno (rice with scallops, shrimp, mussels).  All were delicious.  Barely had room for dessert, but we had to try the Picarones and Queso Helado.  Yum.
author: Lola K P.

description: Nice restaurant, good vibe and atmosphere but bad service and slow kitchen ruined it. 20+ minute gap between our appetizers and main entree.I don't feel bad tipping $9 on a $200 dinner when they forget your wine and bring it out AFTER you finish your entree. WTF.
author: Tinou B.

description: Expensive, small portions, inattentive service and a filthy bathroom. That's what you get for $280 for four. Food was tasty enough, but would never return for the price and the lack of service. The bathroom was the last straw.
author: Smart Mama F.

description:
La Mar... what is there to say?! The décor is hip and modern. The dining area is open, with vaulted ceilings and has an amazing view of the Pacific. The patio is gorgeous, the food is rich, the wait staff is attentive, and the management is amazing! Oh - did I mention that the desserts are to DIE for?! Who doesn't like their dessert frosted in 24 carat gold?! 

It is not inexpensive, but last time I checked, this is an era (and AREA!) where we PAY for luxe surroundings and service. My group of friends and I had amazing dining experience all around!

La Mar is the perfect place for a date and or/girl's (guys!) night out. Order dishes and share amongst one another... oh! And do yourselves a favor and make reservations!
author: Sharra C.

description: Soooo good! Landed here and found a great spot for an early afternoon happy hour. Gin Gimlet, Blue Mule and Bayflower are all worth a go; my teeth are currently numb and I can smell colors. Chewed down on the fried calamari, chicken empanadas and grilled chicken skewers served with sweet potatoes. OHMYGOD!! Service was excellent and Rene in the bar looks awesome from the back when she's shaking your drink. Oh, and her personality is pretty awesome too. Love this spot--can't wait to return!
author: Christina W.

description:
View is only based on the bar area-cute spot-good drinks-great happy hour pics & reasonable prices.

We arrived at peak hour-keep in mind America's cup was happening-so on top of all that, place was pretty packed. We managed to find a spot at the bar-ordered some drinks-Yuka Fries, Empanadas & well....we were satisfied. The sauces that come along are delicious-I can not complain-place met my requirements-good food-good vibes-inexpensive. This gal w
author: Priscilla N.

description:
Super tasty Peruvian food! 

Definitely recommend the ceviche or the combo plate. Both were very very good and tasted very fresh.

And an amazing view if you come in the summer time, especially on the patio.

Will be back soon!
author: Christina A.

description: The appetizers were great. Lots of flavor. However, everyone in our party was disappointed in each of the entrees. Salmon was dry and over cooked. Flavor was not as good in entrees. Peruvian beef was also tough and dry.  Go for the appetizers and drinks. I've been to better especially for the $$$.
author: Terry L.

description:
Meh. Good food, but certainly overpriced.

I liked the appetizer chips (on the house). Two of the sauces tasted a bit... odd? I only really liked one of the three.

I got the almuercito chalaco -- platter with ceviche, sweet corn empanada, and grilled skirt steak skewers. I really liked that the plate came with a variety of things to try. Don't be deceived -- the portions look small, but I actually felt quite full at the end of the meal. The meat was a bit too chewy/tough for my taste, but overall, I enjoyed the taste of everything.

The entree was good, but I just didn't feel like it was worth what I had paid. I can get the same (or better) quality Peruvian food elsewhere for a lower price.

Justine L and I decided to polish off our meal with their "famous" picarones. Honestly, I don't really see what the big deal is. I enjoyed the texture/temperature (hot, flaky, and crispy), but the taste was just... bland. It was as if someone had left out some key ingredient.

The server walked by and said, "Isn't it amazing?" as if it was the best dessert in the world... 

... it wasn't. Not even close.

I wouldn't REFUSE to come back, but I would MUCH rather eat elsewhere, given the choice. I don't regret having tried this place, but now that I have, I'd rather move on.
author: Angela K.

description:
20-May, Monday
