The Causa sampling (Saltadito, Casero, Nikei, Limeña) was like a full banquet of whipped and savory goodness within the first bite.. each had a their own unique flavor profiles, but the one that I thought paired the best with the whipped potato base was the tanginess of the Limena.

The Cebiche sampling was a nice way to get a little varietal taste of everything else I have not yet tried, but I still found that my seafood mixto still remains my favorite since the first time I had it here. Tangy, with a slight amount of subdued heat, and thinly sliced red onion that helped to inject a slightly charged sweetness to complement the acidity of the mango hinted citrus juices.

Tacu Tacu a Lo Pobre was a bit heavier than what I was expecting: crusted yellowtail with Manzano banana, salsa criolla & chancaca sauce, but was definitely cooked really well and paired really well with the fried egg on top.

And for desert a very very rich chocolate cake decadently sprinkled with edible gold dust and a scoop of creamy vanilla bean ice cream with Raspberry sauce drizzed on the size.
author: Ty T.

description:
I thought I would never get to eat here again after going to a plant-based diet, but I'm so glad i was wrong!! 

This is still my favorite peruvian restaurant in NorCal for these reasons:

1.  The service isn't flawless but it is gracious. I've never had bad service here, and if it's ever been slow, the waiter has acknowledged and apologized for it.
2. Lots of options-- and vegans, there is a dish for you here: their quinoa causa, subtract the cheese- it's phenomenal! Make sure to take out the cheese though; it's in Spanish so be clear! It was so good and well priced. Definitely recreating at home. Also, yuca fries are ALWAYS a good idea. 
3. Drinks on drinks - Chilcanos to Pisco (I don't drink cause egg), to bloody Mary's and more. This place has wonderful authentic peruvian drinks. 
4. Lovely patio and indoor seating. So light and airy, bright and happy! 
5. Location makes it a great place to go to with visiting family that wants to walk by the water or ferry building.

Last time I came here with my family (8 of us) the bill ended up being around 700, which was unexpected. This place is not cheap, but we did order about six drinks and 6 entrees with two appetizers. Thank you La Mar for always holding up!
author: Ariana V.

description:
A must try if you are in the Embarcadero area, or even if you are in SF.  Peruvian food is already awesome if you have ever had it and La Mar elevates it to the next level.

The ceviche was fresh and done perfectly.  Their play on Papas a la Huancaina was great, and I only wish the serving was a little bigger because I wanted to eat more!

The lomo saltado was excellent and we also had the La Mar entree with an assortment of fish and seafood cooked in a great sauce.  

Do yourself a favor and check this place out, make sure you make a reservation in advance.
author: Reflection S.

description:
Probably the best lomo saltado I've ever had. The drinks were really good, all made with pisco. I had a passionfruit one I really liked (plus a fewwwww other drinks). 

Came here for a friend's bday and it was packed on a Wednesday night! If you can, you should definitely try to get a window spot outside thats right next to the water! 

Menu items: Ceviche was ok, it's expensive but they give you a lot of fish. The potato dishes were great, we got the taster and my favorite was the tuna tartare one. I also had the paella-like rice with seafood. I didn't enjoy it as much as the lomo saltado. I'm writing just to recommend people get the Lomo Saltado. It's seriously amazing, with some sort of vinaigrette sauce that you don't typically get. Try it!
author: Joanna S.

description: Came here tonight for dinner and loved it! I requested patio seating in my reservation and they gave us a table with the most beautiful view of the water. Food was also phenomenal; I highly recommend the Nikei as an appetizer. Service was also great, such as the waiter waiting to pour my after dinner cup of coffee until I returned from the restroom. Highly recommend La Mar for anyone in the San Francisco Bay Area looking for good food with a view.
author: A D.

description: Very enjoyable dining experience! The location and view are great, though we didn't have a table with a view. We ordered the Cebiche Tasting, Limeña Causa, the Arroz La Mar and Pisco Sours. The ceviche and the piscos were outstanding. My peruvian friend recommended this place and said that when her mom visits from the Central Valley, she insists on going to La Mar because they get Peruvian ceviche right. At the beginning of our time there, the waitstaff were very attentive and helpful, but as our dinner progressed they became scattered. It took ages to look at the dessert menu and get our check. But that wouldn't stop me from going again. That ceviche!
author: K H.

description: Ate here on my last night in San Francisco (visiting for the American Library Association Annual Conference). The view was nice, the atmosphere lovely, and the food yummy! (I had the Salmon Fusion.) The service was good as well!
author: Lesley L.

description: I went here for business the other night and sat inside the restaurant but was facing the view of the bay. Our server was very nice and helpful - he explained all of our options and recommended us some good dishes. We ordered the empanada sample as well as the Sálmon Ayacuchano, which was absolutely divine! The restaurant was upscale but casual. I would definitely go again for the food, service, and atmosphere.
author: Selina L.

description:
Nice place with excellent service. Pricey but not so for the area. Small portions, even for tapas.
Wine lists uninspiring as is the beer list but they try. Decent view but there are better. Its all about the location here. Lunch stops at 2:30PM on the patio so be warned.
author: Chris O.

description:
Came here for dinhner and the food was really good. We had a pre -fix menu because we were a big group and we had so much food. We paid $125 per person with atleast 2 drinks and there were about 8 dishes served. My favorite ofcourse was the YUCCA fries, the short ribs, lomo saltahdo, ceviche and the chips. There was so much food by the time dessert came I was so full I had to take it to go.
Pisco sours are the best but don't forget to check out their wine list too!!!
author: Claudine V.

description:
What a great restaurant! Recommended to me by a friend and by my fellow Yelpers! :)

Came here with a friend on a Saturday evening. Food and service were both great. Food came out quickly and was hot/fresh tasting.

This restaurant is HUGE and has a great view of the boats. Plus, the overall design is really interesting/cool.

What we had:
- Ceviche sampler: delicious and interesting
- Pisco sour: creamy (egg white on top) and has a nice kick to it; not too sweet, not too sour; very refreshing
- Arroz Norteno: spicy seafood rice; great flavor--cilantro and onion based; could have used more mussels!
- Also really love the potato/veggie chips and sauces they served before our meal

Definitely recommend La Mar for a unique, delicious dinner. However, it's not cheap. For the above, plus two glasses of wine, it was $100, plus tip, for two people.
author: Jill M.

description: Had a celebratory dinner here last night- such delicious food, attentive service and bomb drinks. Not cheap but worth every penny. Peruvian food at La Mar is unparalleled. You must get the maracuya sour and some cebiche classico with yucaitas. Incredibly good.
author: Em K.

description:
Came here from a late brunch with some friends. 

We were seated pretty quickly, maybe because it was so late. We had great seats, with a GREAT view. It was a nice clear day out too, so that helped. 

The decor is nice, the service was very good, except it took EVER so slightly longer than I would have liked to get the check. Maybe it was cause we were in a rush, so maybe I'm being a little harsh here.

The complementary chips were super yum! So much so that we had to ask for more : ) 

Started with the Cebiche sampler. I had my favorites of the grouping, but they were all good. There was at least one of each that someone in our party really liked.

 I had the lomito saltado which was fantastic. 

The price is about par for the course. Its not a cheap place, but for being in the city, on the water, with good service, you're not going to find somewhere much cheaper than this.
author: Benny N.

description:
Tried the DAT menu again...I wanted to try a different restaurant but my coworker thought this was the most interesting...so here I am again. I opted for the non-vegetarian option this time....you can't expect me to the eat the same thing twice, especially if I have to pay $40 for it!

Option 1 (non-veg) featured the following:
Causa Limena - the fresh dungeness crab was delicious. It was finely shredded and placed atop a avocado puree which was to die for. The basil cilantro oil added just the right amount of kick to this dish.

Cebiche Mixto - the calamari was melt in your mouth amazing. The Peruvian corn was way more starchy than I expected....I think regular corn would have been better. However, overall, I thought the Cebiche was too acidic. I understand the concept of acid cooking, but this was too much in my opinion. I've had it more subtle and better elsewhere.

Lomo Saltado - the flat iron steak was done perfectly...my pieces were ultra tender. There were a crap ton of onions though, that kind of sucked. The fried potatoes were delicious though. It was served with rice that was mixed with some of the starchy corn - in this form, it tasted pretty good though. I was fairly tempted to ask for chopsticks at this point, but I didn't. But I have to say, eating rice sans chopsticks just felt wrong!

Passion Fruit Tart - the menu says mousse tart...what they don't say is delivered frozen. But it was a delicious, totally refreshing end to a pretty satisfying meal. 

All in all good, not as good as the first time, but my tastebuds are a little more experienced these days. Despite being a casual restaurant, definitely not an everyday restaurant for me...so I like my every-once-in-a-while-visits, thanks to Dine About Town.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Checking this place out on our first trip in SF as an engaged couple. This restaurant has a great ambiance with some highs and so so's on the flavor palate scale. Get the prickly pear margarita, it is refreshing and gorgeous to look at. Also try the ceviche mixto it is flavorful. Next time I would come back for drinks and the ceviche.
author: Clara K.

description:
This place has a nice bar area that you can have a drink at while you wait for a table. The seating area/arrangement is interesting. Somehow it reminds me of a contemporary cafeteria.

The food is exceptional. The variety of seafood is all very fresh and the flavors are outstanding. A dinner for two consisted of the causa tasting (I can't pick a favorite. I liked all 4!), nikkei cebiche, mushroom empanada, and the veggie insalata. I was surprised that every dish was so tasty and the portions are perfect for tasting. We were able to try a lot of things without over ordering.

It was dark out and we weren't seated by a window, but I would imagine this would be a nice spot for a date just before sunset. Definitely give this place a try if you like seafood or tapas styled food.
author: Stine H.

description:
From burnt  Picarones to Cuy that was sou vied and then deep fried???? 
Big money for less than roadside stand quality. When I have to send the dessert back 3 times due to burning..... no mas por favor!!!
author: Craig S.

description: Everything about this place was amazing. The venue is so open and airy, right on the water. We started with Pisco Sours, which I love. The we had the Mercado cebiche to start, the verde Tiradito (MY FAVORITE THING WE HAD). Tiraditos are japanese style thinly sliced fish and it is so good, an amazing infusion. We also had Limena which is Dungeness crab, avocado, Tobiko caviar, quail egg, and huancaina sauce - this was definitely the most interesting of the dishes I had. It reminded me a little of potato salad with the kind of flavoring it had so it wasn't my favorite thing on the menu but it was still good. Lastly, we had Lomo Saltado and it was so delicious. I would definitely recommend going for just seafood one time and then going for the anticuchos and entrees another. Definitely the best Peruvian place I have been to so far. I will be back for sure!
author: Samantha J.

description: Fantastic service and delicious food! I would definitely recommend this place. You have to order ceviche to start, we got a sampler of three, the tuna being our favorite. The loma soltado is delicious, and the meat is so tender. Our favorite was the short rib, it was so tender and flavored perfectly!
author: Kime T.

description: Delicious.  Follow your servers recommendation. Cooked perfect, seasoned well.  Yum. Service is great also
author: Noreen S.

description: This is a one time must visit place.  It is semi touristy but overall very nice, unique, and good food/drink.  Only reason for four stars is comfort.  For some reason, I just did not find the chairs and tables comfortable from a layout perspective or a physical perspective.  Maybe I am just getting too picky in my old age as the Pisco's are great, the ceviche is good, etc.  Not sure what can even be done about it but don't let my comments dissuade you from attending, it is worth it.
author: Greg S.

description:
A reservation for 14 was confirmed Nov. 7th for dinner on Dec. 27th with a signed contract. Dinner reservation was 6:30 PM. At 12:20 PM day of the event, I received a phone call that the restaurant needed to close due to lack of hot water. Needless to say, I was speechless. When did you discover this? Last night she said. Why didn't you call sooner?  We thought it could be fixed she said. 

The event coordinator stated that she had emailed all event other coordinator's in the city to see if our party could be accommodated. When will you know?  Not sure she said. Nearing 2 PM, she called with a restaurant...JAPANESE! I love Japanese food but not even close to La Mar's menu. 

We worked with the helpful concierge at the JW Marriott and found a restaurant. 

Here's the issue... Things happen that are out of our control but we do control how it's handled. 

#1. I should've been contacted immediately telling me about he possibility so that I can make other arrangements. 14 people in the city...yeah, that's easy.  

#2. She should've been apologetic rather than sound annoyed when I stood frustrated about what I was hearing. 

#3. I signed a contract that guarantees a payment to the restaurant if not notified 7 to 3 days in advance depending on the situation. Obviously this is absolutely one-sided because I have received no compensation.

"Guest Count - La mar requires a guaranteed final guest count confirmation 3 business days prior the event. If your guests count is less than the number guaranteed you will still be charged for the guaranteed number. If we are not notified by email of your guaranteed count 3 business days prior to your event we will use your original guest count as the confirmed number, and you will be charged accordingly.
 
Service Charge, Tax and Payment - Events are subject to a 20% Service Charge, 4% SF Mandate and 8.75% California Sales Tax. La mar requires a signed credit card guarantee form to confirm a reservation. Payment is due upon conclusion of the event. We accept major credit cards, corporate checks and cash. La mar does not accept personal checks.
 
Cancellation - On reservations of 9 people and larger, there is a mandatory 7 business days prior notice required if you intend to cancel your reservation. If you cancel in less than 7 business days from the date of your reservation, or do not show up to fulfill the reservation date and time, there will be a $25 per person charge on the securing credit card for violation of the cancellation notice policy."

Finally and most importantly, I never heard from anyone NOT even the event coordinator that I worked with originally. 

Beyond disappointing.
author: Sue H.

description:
La Mar has become one of our favorites when in the mood for Peruvian.  We always over order, because we want to try many things, always come away impressed by the flavors.  

It's a very open and barn-like inside, but if food (especially seafood) is your focus, then you won't be disappointed!

Ask for Tony to be your server.
author: Tom S.

description: Can't beat the location, along the Embarcadero.  We had lots of tasty seafood options, including a sampler platter.  The wait staff was helpful and friendly.  The Peruvian beer was fantastic.  Only complain is the paltry restroom situation -- don't have enough, always a long line.  Overall, I'm a big fan.
author: Aim M.

description:
Visiting from New York and I always make this a stop when I'm in town. All the different pisco drinks are light and refreshing, contemplating the ceviches. 

The chips they provide come with a dipping sauce that is amazing! Ask for extra to use throughout the meal. 

Went for the ceviche taster, empanada sampler, octopus and the beef tenderloin. The ceviche taster offers delicious and different flavors, making it difficult to pick your favorite. All the empanadas are solid with different dipping sauces for each. Octopus was perfectly cooked!

4 stars only because it is a bit overpriced but grab some friends and enjoy a great meal!
author: J K.

description: La Mar is such a fantastic restuaurant.  When I'm asked for recommdations in the city, I can't pass up an opportunity to recommend this peruvian restaurant. Their pisco sours, empanadas and civeches are to die for.  It has a nice sea view, fine dining experience but without the pretentious attitudes. The ambiance is relaxed with Latin music playing within earshot - just loud enough to have you singing the lyrics if you know them.  I would say go there on a date or take a group of friends for food, drinks and just an overall great time.  Enjoy!
author: Kim G.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with my friends and we were all really hungry. Assuming the place was packed, I saw a group of people waiting to be seated. The experience started off with the hostess telling us the wait time was 15 minutes for a table so we complied and sat in the bar area to get some alcoholic drinks. We managed to find two seats and ordered the Pisco Sour, which was made pretty quick. The bartender was nice and genuine; he made up for the hostess's mediocre customer service. As soon as we were told there was a spot, we grabbed our drinks and walked to our table. Along the way, I wondered why the wait was 15 minutes if there were a lot of tables free? Nonetheless we got a really good spot outside to see the view... However, it was dark outside so the wait to an exceptional spot was pointless.

I looked at the menu and was disappointed to not have found "pescado a lo macho." If the place is a cebicheria then it should have that particular plate. Bummed out, I scanned the menu and ordered arroz con mariscos which was listed as something else. We ordered and out came complimentary plantains chips. 

Our dishes came; my friends ordered the Lomo Saltado and it smelled fantastic. My dish had saucy rice with fish, shrimp, squid and calamari and was garnished with parsley. The rice was good but compared to the authentic Peruvian food I have tried, this dish can't measure up. I think I will stick around in the mission to get my palate satisfied.

The ambiance is nice but get ready to spend  a whole lot.
author: Brigitte B.

description:
Our local friends recommended and met us at this amazing restaurant. What a great meal to start our California vacation with. Authentic Peruvian food, beautifully presented and expertly described by the attentive staff.
We ordered many small plates and then main course. The four us us shared everything so we got to try lots of different dishes. 
I was a bit leary as the restaurant is located at the harbour front a prime tourist location but clearly, it has won it's merits because it does a great job and serves delicious food. Excellent wine list. Interesting cocktails.
If you like all things fish and seafood, this is the right spot! Although saying that, the braised short rib was to die for!
author: Natalie B.

description:
After being very underwhelmed by most of my dine about town experiences, I was a little apprehensive about the prix fixe menu at La Mar. However, I decided to face my fears and give it a chance.

Started off my meal with delicious chips (plantain, potato, and another vegetable) and a michelada. Glad that the meal was off to a good start.

Next came the ceviche and octopus. The octopus was extremely olive-y (I hate olives) but the ceviche was good. The fish in the ceviche was tender and full of flavor. My favorite part of this course was definitely the corn kernels in the ceviche. Holy crap, these corn kernels were HUGE. Like ENORMOUS. I was blown away. Where the hell did they find ginormous corn to obtain these comically large corn kernels from? So curious...

Anyways, the main course was Paella - like and full of seafood goodies. Probably one of the best dishes of the meal.

I wasn't blown away by the Dine About Town lunch I had La Mar, but I was by the service and the ambiance. I think that restaurants don't necessarily put out their best items on their DAT menu... so I definitely want to come back to try some of their other items.
author: Michelle L.

description: This review is based on Happy Hour only. It's been one of my most favorite spots to come - convenient location, time (3-6), very delicious drinks (try pisco sour, gimlet, and moscow mule!) their appetizers are yummy too. great place to have a drink after work, before dinner or movies or stroll at embarcadero.
author: Dimi N.

description: My friend was telling me about that place for long time already . We finally had opportunity to go there together . We was surprise how unfriendly was bartender who check  ours ID but lady who actually took ours order was super nice and she made ours cocktails just amazing . All five stars to her . I think she is a manager there . And if she is not , then she should became one :)
author: Alisa L.

description: I only write positive reviews now. Yelp tends To bring the critic out in everyone. I would prefer to tell you what was AMAZING. This is the 5th time I have held a company dinner here. And the 5th time everyone at the table was wowed. Service:aces. Food:aces. Space view people staff everything god damn aces. We had two extremely knowledgeable servers who were attentive kind patient and enjoying what the fuck they did. There was originally 60 of us to 55 to 60 to 40 to 60 back to 40 and la mar was understanding patient and lovely. Resos were for 6:15 the group as company groups do were running late but i showed up at 6:10. I sat at a central spot as the organizer, met the two gentleman that would be serving our chaos. They said whatever you need . We walked through the drink menu some apps and began our food coma journey. They knew...got it....were on top of it. Never over ordering never taking advantage always checkin with me to make sure all was ok and good. They went above and beyond. Places like this are rare in sf. Quality, quantity are equal here. Big groups small groups they will always make sure your experience is personal and delicious. Thank you to the staff. All made what I do look pretty damn good. Cheers and see you soon! Mateo and mate you two are rad!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
This place was awesome, from the ambiance, to the view of the bay, to the delicious cebiche! I relocated to SF from DC, and this is the first restaurant I ate at, and I must say it was a wonderful experience. 

The flavors of the food reminded me of home (Lima), and the freshness of the seafood was something that I don't experience unless I go back to Peru. The staff was extremely friendly, and where willing to do whatever to assure that your experience at La Mar was nothing short of fantastic! I say this because my gf wanted to meet the Exec Chef  and our waiter made it happen (needless to say it was a very busy time of the day). Diego Oka still found a way to stop by our table and have a brief but very pleasant conversation that made our dining experience so much more enjoyable! Keep up the good work boss!

If you're willing to pay the price, then this place is awesome! I gave 4/5 stars because although the cebiche was absolutely amazing in taste, the portions were a little on the small side. And for those who have been to Peru, you guys know that our portions are anything but small!
author: Marco G.

description:
Very inattentive service from the Female Bartender. I asked for water 4 times until I finally got it with a very displeased face . The food arrived and she didn't even ask how was it . Didn't check on us at all . We had to ask for more drinks . I asked for a glass of ice and she forgot or purposely ignored me until I asked three more times and got it . 
I eat out every single day and not always have time to review things but this experience was far from good . Very subpar . The yuca plate was a complete rip off . 6 little pieces of yuca with spicy sauce on top for $9 dollars. Horribly overpriced . Ridiculous menu .
The jaleita ( a bunch of fried fish ) was decent and somewhat tasty .
The wine pour was decent not great . We went for happy hour and spent about 70 dollars for two people so it was not a great deal but the place and area are really nice .
Really deserves a ONE STAR . But if she hadn't been there it would've probably been a better experience ( if the bartenders are at all attentive) she was not whatsoever .
author: Junior V.

description:
I arrived with a group of coworkers, ready to wine and dine on the company's credit card. We started with drinks; I had a pisco punch (fruity and sweet, with an alcohol kick), sangria (super sweet and cinnamon-y), and something our waiter told us was the Peruvian version of a Moscow Mule, and it was amazing. I don't know what it was called, but it was super similar to a Moscow Mule, but with a fruity twist.

But we came for food, and we ate until I was more full that I ever have been in my life. Our table was set with these incredible sweet potato and plantain chips that we ate two baskets of while we waited for a cebiche sampler, which included every cebiche they had. Our favorites were the tuna cebiche, which was perfectly sweet and wonderfully garnished, and the white fish cebiche, which was accented perfectly with sweet red onions.

For my main course, I had arroz la mar, which came with shrimp, little octopi, a nice slice of white fish, clams, oysters and something our waiter called Peruvian corn. It was amazing, but I definitely couldn't finish it all on my own. Two of my coworkers had lomo saltado, which is beef tenderloin with tomatos and French fries, and they adored it as well.

And of course, no meal is complete without some dessert to share, despite how full we were already. We got a plate of every dessert and shared, and they were all beautifully plated and delicious. I would be more specific if I could remember, but I was rapidly falling into a food coma at this point.

La Mar mixes a mean cocktail, is generous with the shots, and cooks many a tasty dish. I'm a big fan! I'll be back...after my next paycheck.
author: Christina S.

description:
I've wanted to come to La Mar for a while-- and lucky for me, my boyfriend finally took me on Valentine's Day for a double date!

Let's start with the cocktails. I ordered the pisco sour and Matt W. ordered the pisco punch. As usual, we had to do a switch-a-roo because mine was a shot of something strong and he ended up with the fruity girly drink! The pisco punch was yummy and strong enough to make me red but not strong enough to give me a buzz!

I loved the chips and the dipping sauces! In fact, I think the sweet potato chips were my favorite of the night! 

For starters, we had the cebiche tasting and empanada sampler! All the cebiches were good but I think I'm just not really into that tangy taste of cebiche. I loved all the empanada -- but I especially LOVED the beef and the avacado ones!

For entrees, our table ordered the Loma Saltado, Cau Cau and the tenderloin dish with all the seafood. I loved the loma saltado-- the beef was perfectly tender and the sauce was to die for. I was underwhelmed by the Cau Cau even though I was very excited to try it in the first place. It was a bit salfty for my taste. I didn't try that last dish but my friend did not seem happy about it at all!

Dining in La Mar definitely made me feel like I was dining somewhere in the tropics. I loved the simplicity and openess of the decor. 

One thing I did not like, though, was the amount of time we had to wait between our appetizers and entrees. Not only did it cast a very awkward waiting time on our table, but it also made us so hungry that we weren't hungry anymore by the time the food got here!
author: Tiffany U.

description: 3 stars for the wait, very long wait.  One of my colleagues had to leave and offered us to eat her food.  I ordered the pasta with scallops and shrimp.  It was decent, but not good enough to wow my mind.    The place looks really nice inside and staff are very knowledgeable about their menu.  Overall, good place for plates $26+.  Orrr you could just walk down the pier more and stop at Pier 23 for some live music, drinks, food and a good time.
author: Joane B.

description: After 9 months of pregnancy I couldn't wait to have some ceviche! The ceviche itself was nice though cut way too big and the Peruvian sashimi dishes were even better and all served with warm root vegetable chips. The problem? It was lunch and it seemed like they couldn't wait to get us out of there. We asked that they wait between dishes and no later had we taken our last bite when the plate was whisked away. The same happened with our second sampler - we weren't finished mopping up the delicious sauces with the chips while finishing our drinks before they were whisked away.  I understand you want to maximize lunchtime but in the interim you sacrificed 2 customers that won't be coming back...
author: Donna G.

description: Hosted a company dinner at La Mar and had a great experience.  They did a great job of ensuring all my guests had drinks and food was brought out at appropriate times. Atmosphere and location couldn't be better.
author: Amber A.

description: We stopped because they had great reviews but I were hesitant because I read that the latest 10 reviews weren't good. Usually that's a sign that they haven't maintained their quality. We were seated immediately despite the craziness of the pre super bowl 50th festivities. Staff was very nice and attentive. Our children were so hungry and grumpy we ordered their salmon entree plate immediately. It came out fast and hot. The food was so good. Extremely small piece of salmon but it was marinaded and cooked to perfection. No one likes a rubbery piece of fish. The quinoa was a creamy corn kind of consistency and my kids love corn so it was definitely a hit! I was so excited about the rest of the food we would order next. The cocktails came out first and they were really good. I ordered a jack and Coke and who ever messed that up should be stoned! Lol! But the pico sour  was just amazing. I've never had one before and I know it's a Peruvian liquor but it tastes to me like a clear whiskey. The froth with a perfectly amount of tart and sweetness was a define cocktail! The chips and plantains were perfect crunchy and salted... Went well with the cebiche. Cebiche from the lunch menu was interesting. Very different to those I've tried before. Very tart and it had a creamy turmeric/curry sauce over it. I didn't love it or hate it. It was different. Them the lomo Saltado came out and gosh... What a ginormous disappointment. Although it's a Peruvian seafood place... The lomo Saltado is a simple authentic dish gone so wrong here. Steak tasted like a cheap quality steak that was tenderized so the quality itself was way off. And then the flavor... Salty and a synthetic like gravy. Like pf changs of Chinese food. Although the there were bell peppers and onions in it the flavor weren't in the dish at all. It was strange. The chicken wing was super spicy which I love and super salty. That was it... Inedible and nothing in between. It tasted like bachelor food... Deep fried wings with lots of shiracha and table salt. Bleh!!! 4 of 7 of our guest at our table hated it... 3 were kids that didn't touch it. Lol! The mixed seafood sizzling platter tasted decent  which is why I gave them an extra star. The seafood was good. It was cooked to perfection and the parsley onion mixture on top was a great touch over it. The sauce was just not anything good which it why I can't call it a must have dish. It was very red so I expected spicy flavor but nothing that was spicy or garlicky, just rich in color but nothing. I think if there was garlic and something else along with the parsley salsa mixture it would've made it a 5 star alone. My gf ordered a burger and they didn't bring it out but since the rest of the non seafood dishes were so bad we packed up and left. There was some strange surcharge for the city on there also but expect a very high bill and not high quality food. Since it at a convenient location and a big venue to feed the hungry and larger quantity of people fast... Just stick to the seafood dishes. It's the safest bet.
author: Linh T.

description: I like it this place for drinks and hors d'oeuvres, but this was my first dinner. I was equally impressed. The restaurant was packed and lively but we could still have a quiet conversation.  The location offers a view of the bay bridge though it was foggy that night. We went with a sampler of different dishes: tiraditos verde, causas vegetarian, empanadas, and anticuchos carne.  All fresh and flavorful.  Beautiful dinner all around.
author: Gordon H.

description:
It was 'meh' for me. 
We went with the recommendations and ordered the ceviche sampler, causas sampler, arroz norteno and lomo saltado. We paired it with a bottle of Malbec. The portions were adequate for three people. The ingredients were fresh but the flavors were nothing spectacular. 

The complimentary plantain and sweet potato chips were yum. The picarones we had for dessert was pretty good.
author: Debbie H.

description: The freshest ceviche I've ever had! We went as a big group and shared the dishes tapas style. Everything was delicious. My favorites were the Clasico (halibut was the catch of the day) and the Nikei. It is a little on the pricey side but very worth it! I took off one star because we were seated in the front room, away from the main restaurant, despite making a reservation a month in advance.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Loved the colors of this restaurant! White and blues are my kinds of colors :) 

We came here at lunch during Dine About Town. We made reservations but they have a really big space and there was a good amount of seating available, including a patio area with a view of the bay. There were two prie fixe menus, one with meat and one that was vegetarian. We decided to try one of each. They brought out some chips with dipping sauces before our first course, which I really enjoyed. The potato chips were good but I enjoyed the sweet potato ones more. They were cut pretty thin and weren't that oily so you could really taste the sweet potato. 

Causa Casera - Yellow potato was really good! Avocado was prominent but I wished I could have tasted a bit more of the artichoke flavors as well. 
Empanada K'apchi - Super crispy and the mushrooms were delicious, I just wish there were even more of them!
Arroz Fusion - Good flavor. Not quite as exciting as the Arroz Norteno on the other menu since that had seafood, but it was still very tasty.
Mango Sorbet - The menu had a Peruvian purple corn sorbet listed, which I was excited to try, but I ended up lovinnnng the mango sorbet. I am quite picky about my fruit flavored desserts because I want them to be more tart than sweet... this mango sorbet was so tart and delicious!!! It is probably not for everyone though. 

They also brought out some complimentary house made jellies at the end, I loved the blood orange sauce that was on the plate with the jellies.

Overall a good dining experience! Would definitely recommend for Dine About Town as well because you get four courses for lunch instead of the usual three at other restaurant (yes, they are a bit small though) and a tasty freebie before and after your meal as well!
author: Sophie Y.

description: Ridiculously good. Everything. If only I made more money, I would be here all the time. They have made classic Peruvian dishes with a modern twist. The Ceviche, the plantain chips, the seafood, and my favorite, Huancaina sauce (yellow aji chile and cheese sauce) is sublime. Definitely make a reservation, or enjoy a pisco sour at the bar.
author: Angela F.

description:
Few Americans have been to Peru, and few know much, if anything, about their cuisine.  This restaurant's ownership involves Peru's greatest known chef, a man who has probably done more than anyone else to expose Peru to the international culinary world (TV food shows help a lot with that effot). 

The restaurant is sensitive to the unfamiliarity, and makes efforts to help diners interpret the large menu and make choices appropriate to their taste.  Out waiter was very professional, personally engaging, and effective.  Since we were there on a Tuesday, the restaurant was not completely full, but it had filled most tables.  The noise level was fine for talking, despite the fact that the space has a lot of "hardscape."  It would be louder on weekends, of course.  

The food was excellent!  The Pisco Sours were excellent.  Of course, the fish is Sashimi Grade, so the freshness and flavors were what one should expect in cebiche.  I had one cebiche dish (not cooked with heat, cooked "chemically" by the acid in the lime juice) and one cooked dish, the Pulpo (octopus) skewer.  As I'd expect from a restaurant of this calibre, the pulpo was not rubbery, but was tender and flavorful.  My dining companion had a seafood salad, which she loved.  My cebiche was so flavorful that I ensured to get every last drop of the liquid, when I'd finished the fish.  That liquid, which they call "Leche de Tigre" (Tiger's milk -- but nothing to do with the beverage by that name) is so tasty they sell it by the shot, too, aside from its primary use in cebiche.

It was a nice touch when Enrique, the manager, came by to check on us to ensure that we were happy with everything.  We were!

As an interesting side note, our waiter told us that this restaurant sells more pisco than anywhere else.  They've created many cocktails using that liquor to showcase its versatility.  Of course, they have a full bar for those who want other drinks.

Enough. Just go ahead and make that reservation.
author: Dick B.

description:
La Mar Cebicheria is a Peruvian restaurant on pier 1.5. While many Embarcadero restaurants are touristy (Waterbar, Epic Roasthouse etc), this one fared above average as the seafood and flavors are fresh. Everything from presentation to flavors is minimal, no frills.

Chips (plantain, kettle, sweet potato): Great crispiness. Thin and lightly salted. Came with 3 housemade dips.

Lomito saltado: Sandwich with Acme bread with melted gouda, avocado, and papas al hilo. Uninspiring.

Cebiche clasico: Clean flavors, fresh California halibut, red onion, habanero, yam, and Peruvian corn. They have many other cebiche choices (mixto, chorrillano, nikei), and I highly recommend ordering a few.

Arroz negro: Great grilled flavor. Calamari and shrimp on squid ink rice with ahi panca, aji amarillo, bell peppers, choclo, parmesan, and rocco creamy chalaca. Beautiful presentation.

Hamburguesa a la pobre: Kobe beef burger with fried egg, banana, gouda, tomato, jalapeno, greens with a salsa criolla sauce, and acme bread. Excellent amalgamation of flavors. Top notch. One of the more memorable burgers I've had due to the contrast and pop of flavors.

Tocino del cielo: Coconut flan with pineapple and peach tartar, carmel pineapple mouse, and tuple. Good flavors, but texture was more firm than I prefer.

Months later, I still recall how good the kobe beef burger was, tender and thick, flavor aplenty.
author: Jay C.

description: Service needs help. Food is decent but not astounding to justify the price. I do love their free chips though. The sauce you dip them with is soo delicious. Definitely would go back for their chips and drinks. Have to compliment them on their bartender. Really good drinks. Definitely a spot to chill but not a spot for lunch to eat. Not sure about dinner though..
author: Fuki D.

description: Joe was a great server. Attention to all the little details. Picture perfect Saturday brunch.
author: Brian A.

description:
Wow! Possibly even better than La Mar in Lima. Had Anticuchos de Pulpo, so tender how do they do it? Anticuchos of shrimp outstandingly tasty in a weird way since I had no idea what's in the sauce. The beef heart anticuchos was cooked to perfection, a little pink inside. For the entrees we started with the beef cheeks. Love the consistency, reminds me of braised tongue. Next came Arroz La Mar which looked like a paella but tastes nothing like it, the indescribable sauce again! The presentation  of everything was as amazing as the taste.
We shared three different deserts: mixed sorbets, tres leches, chocolate passion fruit mouse. They were all delightful. Service was great, pleasanr space. All in all a memorable dinner.
author: P T.

description:
I went to La Mar on Saturday for lunch with friends, after they told me the restaurants had great views. They were right, the restaurant is big, spacious and with windows facing the waterfront. You are not crammed with other diners. 

The reason for only three stars is that the ceviche was totally bland and I did not taste any citrus or chilli. After visiting Peru and eating there and also visiting Limon in the Mission, I was expecting more.

The chicken skewers were better and the pisco were great, but the ceviche made us go elsewhere.
author: Moshe B.

description:
I cannot believe this place have four star rating in Yelp, maybe because of the location. 

Positive:
- Location (Embarcadero next to water)
- Service (The waiter was nice)

Negative:
- Less than average food
- Over priced (They even charged for sparkling water, most restaurant with $$$ sign provide this for free)
- Menu changes every 3 month, so what you see in Yelp might not be available.
- Hard to read menu (Font, layout and color bad choice)
author: Tom L.

description: I love the view of the harbor and the fusion flavors. Have eaten at La Mar in Lima and quality wise this is just as good.
author: Bonnie W.

description:
I Heart La Mar!!  I heard that because SF Chefs was going on, La Mar was offering a special lunch tasting menu for $20 - ooo, I hopped on that as soon as I could!  :)

First, I love the chips (regular, purple and sweet potato chips plus banana chips) they give you at the start of your meal with 3 different sauces - mmm!  

The tasting platter included:

* Cebiche Clásico (California Halibut in a classic leche de tigre, red onion, habanero, Peruvian corn and yam - classic it is!  Just spicy enough and refreshing, lovely taste, ooo I love ceviche!)
* Causa Camaron (Sweet and spicy poached shrimp and fried onions on top of purple potato with leche de tigre aioli - nice combination of flavors, the aioli is heaven!)
* Lomo Saltado (Traditional Peruvian style stir-fry of sautéed beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic and soy sauce, with fried 
potatoes and rice - this is classic Peruvian food at its best!  This is my favorite dish when I come to La Mar - you *must* order this!)

And I had a pisco sour - mmmmm!  Refreshing at anytime of the year!

Then the dessert tastings were: 

* Pie de Limon (Lime cream, lime mousse, lime sorbet, and Italian meringue with an almond crunch - tart, fresh and tasty, ooo I wanted more, next time I come back I am definitely getting this!)
* Chocolate mousse with dark cherries (Ooo, the Pie de Limon could not be topped, but this one was right up there with it, mmm!)

The service is always lovely, attentive and very charming!  They make you feel you are at home.  Love it and I will always *Heart* La Mar!!  :)  Mucho gracias!!
author: Maile N.

description:
You know somebody cares about you when they are allergic to anything that comes from the ocean and anything associated with the word "nut" and they still take you to a Peruvian seafood restaurant for a fancy romantic meal.

Dressed to the nines, our classy sexy selves began our night at the beautiful modern bar to taste some of the cocktails raved about by Mizz Betty N. and Mizz Janice C.  And I was not let down!  The bartender treated me to a little sample of the pisco sour while I waited for my date to park the car (that's right, he dropped me and my 5" stilettos off before finding parking, so sweet)  

The Drinks:
Pisco Sour ($10)--pisco quebranta (peruvian brandy), lime juice, simple syrup, dash of egg white and a drop of regional bitters.  
One of the best pisco sours I have ever had. It rivaled my favorite pisco sour from SideBar in Oakland for sure!

Waikicha ($11)--pisco 100, pomegranate, lemon, mint
Not too sweet, healthy and well balanced.  The egg white gives it a smoothness and body that I have never experienced in a pomegranate drink before.  I even had two of them!

Chicha Tu Ma  ($10)--pisco quebranta, triple sec, passion fruit and chicha morada
Was NOT on the menu! =( I was really sad that this was not on the menu since Mizz Betty N. raved about it so much in her review.  But never fear!  My delightful Latin bartender made it happen for me and I must say, it was amazing!  Lots of tasty tipsyness!

Next was the part of the meal where our wonderful waiter was very accommodating to the allergies of my date, was very friendly and attentive.  The main room has a big and open floor plan and huge windows overlooking the harbor/bay.

The Food:
Cebiche Mixto ($16)--Mahi Mahi, calamari and octopus in ají amarillo leche de tigre with cilantro, red onion, habanero with Peruvian corn and yam
I died and went to heaven. All the seafood was astonishingly soft and fresh.  This seriously elevated my expectations for fresh and tasty seafood.  There was a decent kick of spice to the dish and I just loved it.  MMMMMM!  And so healthy!

Causa Chicharrón ($12)--Purple potato causa topped with fried calamari, quail egg, avocado purée, salsa criolla and Huancaína tartar sauce
Not so Healthy!  But also delicious.  This dish was only a little above room temperature, but I think that is intentional. The whole thing was to die for. Crispy squid, rich potato....I wish I was eating this right now.

Anticucho De Carne ($15)--Grilled skirt steak, fried potatoes, Peruvian corn, spicy panchita and rocoto sauce  
This non-seafood, non-nut containing dish was also DELICIOUS. The meat was very tender and the interesting assortment of condiments actually paired very very well.  The sauce was perfection.

Sexy people. Sexy food. Sexy views of the bay. This romantic and delicious modern restaurant has "Sexy Classy Date Spot" written all over it.
author: Susan C.

description: The best ceviche I Ever tried ,sopa seca is out of this word and Nikkei delicious. The service was just excellent. It was our first time in San Francisco also in our wedding anniversary. We are very happy to choose this restaurant.
author: Juana G.

description:
Went here to meet a a few friends for an afternoon Sunday brunch on the rear patio. which was perfect because the weather was perfect. This place is a little pricey, not only are you paying for the view but the food and drinks are top quality. 

I ordered the grilled octopus which was on par with some of the best I've had. Also tried some of their cerviche which was also delicious. The Pisco Sours they make are authentic and delicious, highly recommend getting one.

I've sat at their bar before as well and the service was also excellent there.
author: Michael C.

description: Stopped in because Saturday happy hour - rare! My husband and I each ordered a cocktail ($6) and classic ceviche ($9). I studied abroad in Peru, and I can say this ceviche took me back - fresh fish, sweet potato, choclo, and leche de Tigre so good we finished it off after the fish was gone. Also, no pressure from the servers to order more than HH fare. Awesome spot - will be back for dinner!
author: Laura M.

description:
Decent spot with a nice view of the bay on the patio.  Typical overpriced SF restaurant ($600 for ceviche appetizer, 8 empanadas, 1 grilled skewer, 3 entrees, and drinks for 5) .  The fish is fresh, and the flavors are bold -- but, bold doesn't always mean harmonious or delicious.

Ceviche -- tried three different types, along with some salmon sashimi.  Ceviche was standard, nothing noteworthy.  The salmon was the blandest, least flavorful piece of "salmon belly" I've ever had... no richness or fattiness at all.

Empanadas -- pricey ($15 for 2), and not even close to the $4 empanadas from Porteno, in terms of quality.  This was the most disappointing item we had last night.

Corazon -- well cooked and tender, but rather flavorless.

Sopa seca -- the sauce was very watery, and not all the shellfish opened up (ie: they were dead prior to cooking).  Pasta lacked any chew.

Pernil -- best dish of the night.  Crispy exterior, rich porky interior.  The portion was also huge (albeit, it's supposed to serve two).  Great dish.

Overall, it's a good spot to come if you're entertaining clients.  Relaxed, yet classy atmosphere.  The service is good, and the cocktails are excellent.  But, the food itself is underwhelming.
author: N H.

description:
Hostess was away from the stand for 10 min before coming to let us know it'd be 15 minutes.. we r waiting for our food and the buss boy drops empenadas, and we say we didn't order them. He picks them up and puts them on the other table without even showing any inkling of caring. 

An obvious example of a good restaraunt protected by its goos location and food to the point that it's service falls into a comfortable mediocerness.  

whomever is in charge of service should put some stricter policies in place and train the staff how to interact politely with their customers.
author: Darren C.

description:
I came after a day flying kites and launching rockets at Crissy Fields. It happened to be happy hour (Monday-Sunday 3PM - 6PM) so I couldn't not get a few dishes and some drinks. Everything was tasty and fresh--drinks and food. Make sure you get an empanada with aji de gallina. Peruvian food is amazing.

We sat next to a gay guy (he told us he was gay) who started every sentence with "I love you guys, but..." He was nice but he didn't say bye to us.

This may be one of my favorite places on the Embarcadero. Highly recommended place for drinks and/or food.
author: Marlon T.

description: Good peruvian food with an amazing view of the bay. I came here for lunch and dinner and would suggest coming for lunch and sitting out by the water. Really romantic place. The drinks were good, could be a little stronger. Loved all the food and the service pretty good. I would come back!
author: Leah P.

description:
I have been wanting to come here for years. When we were meeting a friend staying nearby, we suggested this place for dinner and drinks.

The bar and restaurant is beautiful, (but a tad loud for dinner conversation.) 

We had a drink at the bar while we waited for a table, (without reservations, the wait was totally reasonable.)

The drinks were good, but not as outstanding as I was expecting. (Especially given the price.)

After we were seated, it took us a bit to decide what to order. Our server was patient, knowledgeable, and charming.

I had the Arroz Jugoso. It's similar to paella, with "prawns, clams, mussels, calamari, white fish and vegetables in a juicy arborio rice with a blend of peruvian ajis - served with rocoto aioli and toasted bread." 
It was delicious, and all the different seafood was cooked perfectly, Nothing was rubbery or overcooked.

My husband had the selection of empanadas. I had a bite, and they were totally underwhelming. Our friend seemed to enjoy his dish, but it wasn't anything amazing.

I liked my dish, but the rest of the food and drinks weren't anything special. I also noticed the lomo saltado was over $30. Really? This is such a cheap dish, and so much less on every other menu I've ever seen it on. 
Obviously, the location drives the prices up here.

If you want better food, lower prices and less ambiance, there are better spots for Peruvian food.


***Unfortunately, for such a nice place, the bathrooms are disgusting. Even the guys in our group thought they were GROSS.***
author: Amanda G.

description: Sat at the bar for 6-8 minutes. It was quiet. Two bar man completely ignored me despite eye contact. Super weird and incredibly rude. Never again.
author: Pete H.

description:
This place is lovely! 

- the service is good
- the food is excellent

inconvenience:
- the vegetarian risotto was to die for and its been off the menu forever
- there are not enough vege plates for SF
- you always need a reservation
author: Sara S.

description:
I recommend the yellowtail, chicken & meat skewers and pisco punch - Yummy!!

Friendly staff - sophisticated and sharp but NOT uptight or pretentious.

Room is wonderfully open, spacious.

Reasonable prices for the quality and location. 

Menu is well done- easy to understand & navigate.

You'd feel comfortable dressed up on a date, but I saw groups and some had shorts & tennis shoes on.

Also, you'll see "fancy" presentations AND a chalk board w/the specials. Nice blend of "high end" and casual.

We did open table res 1.5 hours prior on a Sat night and were seated right on time.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Ok I am a weak women. I went back. 

The view and location are too hard to let go of. 

This time my cousin and I took it for a spin. The service was much better. The view was still incredible. The sangria was delicious. But I am still a tad disappointed by their lunch menu. I had the beef skewers and while they were ok they left something to be desired. 

The ceviche like before was exceptional! 

This place is just going to have to be the spot for sangria and the view- which cannot be beaten.
author: Michelle I.

description: Whenever I feel like having Peruvian, the Lomo Saltado is usually my choice. But, when you're in San Francisco, you do want to jump out of your comfort zone!  La Mar is a beautiful place (especially for dates) on Embarcadero Street.  Whenever I am here, I usually would grab dinner then take a stroll around town before uber-ing back to the InterContinental. Their complimentary Plantain Chips are made from scratch and fresh everyday. They are just low-calories munchies that I truly enjoy. The empanadas appetizer dish is also amazing! I love the just-right portion as they are already enriched with their respective flavorful stuffings.Their ceviche mix is also beyond par! Fresh seafood and does not disappoint for a place by the pier. Lastly, I got the charred barrel octopus and Arroz La Mar. Top that off with their infamous Pisco Sour and I have one remark for you: splendid.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I had a wonderful dinner at La Mar. I actually don't eat seafood, but there were still a bunch of good options for me.

To be honest, I don't remember which dishes we got. I went for a corporate event, so the menu was pre-selected. But everything was very tasty. There was a steak dish that was particularly great. The steak was so tender and delicious. I also like the little brownie cup I had for dessert.

The location is great -- right on Embarcadero. We were on the patio, but since it is November, it was covered and had heat lamps. There is a partial view of the Bay Bridge from the patio.

I would definitely recommend La Mar. (Though I probably would have liked it less if I had to pay the bill haha.) It is great for a date, nice family dinner, or corporate dinner.
author: Elise M.

description:
When my coworkers decided to have a gift exchange for Christmas, I was pretty discretely irritated. I have enough gifts to get, why are we doing more gift exchanges! I am the type of person that resolves with my family to "not get each other gifts", and here I am having to give my coworkers gifts. I sucked it up and agreed.
Then they suggested that our gift exchange lunch be at La Mer, and I thought "great, so now I have to buy a gift and buy an expensive lunch." Grr...I would have been just as happy at McDonalds or some $10 sandwich place. But again I sucked it up and agreed. $25 gift and $25 dinner later, I am happy that I had lunch here. La Mer was delicious. I mean really...DELICIOUS. The food was cooked perfectly. It was light, healthy, and just simply delicious. I did doggybag the cooked plantains that they give the table at the beginning of lunch. #noshame
So in summary..I would go here again, but I would probably speak up and say I could do without the gift exchange.
author: Julianna I.

description: Excellent international food with friendly staff.  If you like seafood, especially think of this as a Peruvian version of Japanese food - sashimi, terrific spiced fish dishes.  Excellent variety.  Definitely different.  We have about 10 different dishes, and they were all terrific.  The lamb and beef are also really good.   Nice view of the bay.  $6 Meter parking available about 3 blocks north on opposite side of street.
author: Bernard G.

description:
Lots of tasty bites, but this is one of those places that favors presentation and plating over portions. It will look pretty as a picture, but you'll be done in 3 bites and out loot. Not a place to go with a diner appetite. But, it would be a decent spot to impress a date. 

Also, our waiter had incredible halitosis. As in, plants were wilting and children were crying halitosis (please, make the bad man go away). I'm not gonna deduct a star for that, but it did, ahem, affect the "atmosphere" at dinner.
author: Rob R.

description: Mediocre food, crappy service in the bar and two restrooms for a huge restaurant. Stay away!
author: Marlin P.

description:
Great ambience, menu and even better service!! Friendly staff and amazing atmosphere. 5 stars for an all around good experience!!! Kudos to my server Nick, best service I've received in ages!! 

Ceviche Classico- refreshing and fun flavor !

My boyfriend also enjoyed the daily catch special, he appreciates fresh quality seafood!
author: Mika K.

description:
Came here for happy hour and was really impressed. La Mar is right on the pier the bar area is beautifully and playfully designed with blue and green accents. Great deals on pisque sours and cocktails ($6). I got the raspberry gimlet. Very girly. very tasty. Great deal. My boyfriend and I had never tried pisque Sours before and supposedly that is what La Mar is known for so of course we asked about it and the bartenders gave us little samples (very nice touch! thumbs up!) 

I personally didn't really care for the pisque sours. I'm sure they were good but its just not my type of drink. Although we didn't taste any of the happy hour appetizers they all looked divine. Will come back again for happy hour specials!
author: Sam L.

description:
I'm from Peru, and unfortunately the food does not taste authentic, was very dissapointed with flavor of dishes, food did not taste bad at all, but it wasn't authentic flavor, more americanized. Nothing wrong with that, but i should of known better, usually some upscale peruvian restaurants change the authentic flavor.
Over price! Lomo saltado cost me over $25.00, i have never paid so much for this dish. Usually ranges from $10.00 to $16.00. Paying for location.

The reason i decided to bring 2 non peruvian friends was because of atmosphere, location, fun environment with an outstanding view. Service was great, very friendly staff. Reason of my 3 stars.
author: Melina C.

description:
Excellent food! A great culinary experience for your palate! Downside: They did not record our reservation and atop of that the waitress accommodated us but he was specific that we only had until 8:00 pm to eat because they had all sold out. That, in my opinion, is a huge lack of respect and no appreciation to the clients. We kind of felt discriminated. Better would be for them to tell us that there was no space to accommodate us than setting us a deadline for eating. 

What we really regret is that this was our second time in the place. The first time was so good, we sat at the bar and the waitress was very polite and of a great help to chose our dishes. The experience was so good that we wanted to repeat it again when our family came to town to visit us. Unfortunately, it was disappointing. 

Bottom line, great food, need to improve in the treatment to the public...
author: Jose T.

description: Freashly squeezed juices for screwdrivers/greyhounds. AWESOME! Had the empanada sampler, California and mixto cebiche. All were excellent. Highly recommend. Ole'
author: Rojelleo H.

description: Food was pretty good, got the civeche and paella. Pisco sours were yummy too. Food is a little pricey. One of my spoons was dirty so dropping to 4 star. Our waiter was really nice though! He recommended dishes and drinks and stuff.
author: Christopher S.

description: OMG. I love la mar. Absolutely delicious. I've tried their lomo saltado, jalea, and ceviche mixto as well as their pisco sours. There are no words to explain the flavors and quality of their food. Yes they're quite expensive, but totally worth it.
author: Francina O.

description:
I want to give this place 5 stars because I love the food and I really love me a good pisco sour. I had been here a couple times years ago and had been hyping it up to my family.

However as others have noted service is now crap.

Our waiter was slow, never came to take empty dishes off the table, forgot one of the appetizers we ordered and then got our desert wrong and proceeded to argue with the kid that he got it right. He retreated pretty quickly and promptly took it off the bill which was good, but seriously wtf?

Food is still great tho, we had the ceviche sampler, causa sampler, empanada sampler (which came with the main dishes cuz the fool waiter forgot them). For mains we shared the skewers and the short ribs. All delicious really. 

Seriously though service was a total bust.
author: Lulu S.

description: I recommend the california ceviche and a pisco sour for happy hour!
author: Vincent M.

description:
The Cerviche at this place was great
Decor is nice, good place for a date
The other items that they had, they were OK
On top of that, their prices make you go "Hey...."

My friends got the lunch options 1 & 2 and they seemed like small portions.  Definitely a place for foodies, however, the people who ate said that the place was OK...  Their chips and dip (not the classic tortilla chips mind you) were really good, but it's sad when the free appetizers, the sandwich, and the dessert get rave reviews more than the regular entrees.  I'd give this place a 3.
author: Dennis K.

description:
For all the reviews and attention this restaurant receives, it's honestly nothing special. All food I sampled tasted disgusting (either too spicy, too bitter, too cold, or too earthy). 

I came here with a large group for a party but I really didn't enjoy it. The food was good LOOKING but not all that great tasting. You are really paying for the name here and not for the food. The ambience is nice but thats about it. The complimentary Yam, Plantain, and Potato Chips w/ 3 Housemade Dips were dry, and nauseating. All other food was generally the same.

The atmosphere is very tiring, and pretentious. Every table has bright, blinding tableclothes and I felt like I was going to throw up! The place is packed with lots of business men either trying to get lucky at the bar or come here for business dinners, so make sure you dress nicely. 

It's definitely pricey so be prepared to waste your money! I don't recommend coming here unless someone you know is having an event or party here.
author: Emmanuella Z.

description: This is my favorite Peruvian restaurant ever. Their food and drinks are delicious and fresh as always. I was there with my colleagues last week. Ordered ceviche dishes and a couple of steak dishes and they were all yummy!
author: Salisa K.

description:
This is a tourists review. 
I'm not gonna turn into the guy that gives 5 stars to everywhere he goes, don't worry. 
La Mar was just delicious, no other words for it! flawless food. Myself and my GF sat by the water and sample a lot of the menu. zero complaints!  
The waiter was a bit self righteous but in a funny way more then an obnoxious way so i'll let it slide and rest of the staff were polite and made us feel very welcome. Expensive but worth it as a treat.  
Go, go, go!
author: Neil B.

description: The food was great! they even offer a few vegetarian options which make them a very friendly place. Cant wait to come and taste some other dishes as well.
author: Neta S.

description:
La Mar has been on my to eat list for awhile now. Being both a fan of seafood and good Peruvian food, I made a reservation for lunch with my friend's pre-birthday and our monthly lunch. We pick a new restaurant each time.

Today was simply gorgeous, our current heat wave made me crave the sunshine and sitting on the bay. I simply couldn't sit inside. Since there was a wait, we went to the bar. I ordered a  Waikicha, a pisco drink with pomegranate, lemon and mint. 

When we were seated, the view and feel of the outdoor lounge made me feel like I was somewhere else. Watching the boats go by, sitting in the sun, perfection.  We ordered the: 

*Cebiche Classico: California Halibut and red onions in habanero pepper leche de tigre with Peruvian corn and yam. VERY GOOD, also No. 47 on the 7x7 Big Eat List. Checked off. :)
*Rollo Encebichado: Shrimp, dungeness crab, cucumber and avocado roll topped with sliced ahi tuna and an aji amarillo jalapeño sauce. Really great~! 
* Lomo Saltado: Traditional Peruvian style stir-fry of sautéed beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic and soy sauce, with fried potatoes and rice. Beef was so tender and good, I was really pleased with my order.
*Sudado Mochica: Today's Special - Traditional Stew of the north with fresh shellfish of  the day, with Aji amarillo and yellow squash. So savory and good, the seafood was so fresh and delicious. 

Just looking back at the pictures I took, it makes me hungry and reminds me of what a great experience I had at Lar Mar today.  I would not only want to go back, but will keep them in mind as a place for a special dinner or event.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Great drinks and impressive ambiance, but the food is generally underwhelming(and pricey).  

I've tried La Mar a few times and each time I leave with the same unfulfilled feeling.  The food isn't bad but it doesn't live up to the hype. There are multiple better Peruvian options in the city, most of which are half the price.
author: Nick M.

description: Delicious!! We went for happy hour and got the ceviche, beef empanada and yucca croquettes. Everything was excellent. Only bad part was you didn't get chips with the ceviche but you didn't need them!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Amazing food, drinks and service!  Went to celebrate a special anniversary and couldn't have been happier.  Thanks Roberto for making our big night extra special.
author: Elvis S.

description:
Beautiful restaurant with vibrant colors.  If I knew about the decor and prime location, I would've considered using it as a wedding reception venue.  The food could be better though.

Rollo Norteno - I'm not sure why we decided to get a Japanese sushi roll but it actually wasn't that bad considering that they were using really fresh and plump shrimp.  That really carried the roll, otherwise it wasn't that unique. I found it strange that the soy sauce was not very salty. 

Empanadas de lomo saltado (Stuffed with beef tenderloin, red onions, and tomato) - Speaking of salty, the meat was too salty.  One order comes with two big pieces which are piping hot.  It came with a side of thinly slicked, pickled red onions.  The flavor of the meat and the texture of the pastry was really nice though.

Cebiche clásico (California Halibut in a classic leche de tigre, red onions, habanero, Peruvian corn and yam) - I was really disappointed in this mainly because most of the dish was lukewarm.  The juice was a murky white color.  The halibut were nice, big pieces but overall the flavor was a bit bland I couldn't even taste any lime.

Arroz norteño (Cilantro fried rice with a seafood combination of mussels, shrimp, octopus, and Huancaína sauce) - This is one of those dishes that tastes better the day after as leftovers.  The flavors are able to seep into the rice a bit more because when I had this dish at the restaurant, it was a bit bland.

One big plus are the chips that you get in the beginning.  They're a combination of regular potato chips, sweet potato chips, and plantain chips with three dipping sauces that aren't too different from one another.  Service is TOP NOTCH and everyone is really friendly.
author: Shannon L.

description:
No doubt the food is INCREDIBLE but the service has gone way down hill!!

We eat at La Mar about once a quarter, and decided to try take away for my fiance's birthday. We ordered the ceviche sampler and naively assumed the chips that are served with it at the restaurant would also be served with the 'take away' version. Well never assume! There were no chips, and when I called to ask about it, I was told that I should have known better (!?!?!?) and chips are extra for take away. I would have gladly paid for the chips had known. Super Sad Face La Mar!!!
author: Alexzandra H.

description: Amazing. Love this place, the very different menu with Japanese influence was extremely tasty Every dish was superb, a must for raw fish lovers, the cerviche was fantastic.  Service a little over the top. Great venue on the pier, highly recommend,
author: Kym H.

description:
Work lunch...so I got to taste a bunch of different stuff, so that part was good. We ordered 2 ceviches and empanada's sampler, all good. I ordered quinoa dish with seafood, which was also very good. 

The service was slow and our waitress was rather mechanical.  We spent an hour and a half there and ran out of time to order dessert. We had to leave for the meeting and the waitress didn't come around, so we walked towards the exit holding the bill. It was rather comical to see her expression on her face as if we run out of the restaurant without paying!! 

I understand that we should expect to stay a bit longer than regular lunch places, but I wish the service was a bit faster. The timing the waitress came to us for taking orders, bringing a check and after we're done with the appetizers and the main dish came, everything was slow. I've eaten in other nicer, but more crowded places with less time, so it could be done.
author: Yoko S.

description:
ceviche is fresh and tasty, highly recommend you try it! 
Drinks: get the pisco sour
author: Korissa S.

description:
First time at La Mar for my daughter's School graduation. 
As Peruvian, I was not very satisfied with the amount of food this place served. 
The taste was OK. You may pay a lot of money for the "scenery" and the location.
author: Juan M.

description:
We gambled on no reservation and won! They had a wedding going on and although they were packed, the hosts were helpful and welcoming. We found a spot at a community table. Multiple waiters made sure had everything we needed. Staff was friendly, fun and very good at explaining a good way for 2 people to sample a lot of the menu.
Food was fresh, inventive and full of flavor. I also appreciated the attention to texture. Yum! Cocktails were divine.
author: S C.

description:
Venue is modern and classy and has a nice view of the bridge at night.  

Free sweet potato and potato chips will fill you up if you're not mindful.  I ordered the cebiche tasting and passion scallops and shrimp.  I liked the nikei (tuna) most and will order that alone instead of the tasting next time.

Passion scallops and shrimp were OK, but nothing special.  I would have preferred the scallops more tender.
author: Emily W.

description:
Food was good ...service was slow...drinks came with dinner (given we ordered at the same time) but still.
Empanadas were delicious as well as the steak skewers 
Recommend if you're not in a rush
author: Courtney M.

description:
Went here for dinner (not drinks) earlier this week. We ordered 2 small plates and 1 big plate, and everything was subpar - we didn't want to finish anything. The only thing that was half decent were the free chips they give you when you're first seated.

I've heard great things about this place for happy hour, but I would not come here for food. There are plenty of better Peruvian options in SF (Fresca, Limon, food trucks) which are also better priced (this meal cost us $70). You're mainly paying for the view, which there too I'd say other Embarcadero restaurants have it better.
author: Amit V.

description: Wonderful service but was unimpressed with the food. The cebiche was really acidic. The lomo saltado was chewy and the sauce was like salty gravy. The chicken had the texture of well cooked trout. Dessert was delicious though and the chip dip was great.
author: Ana M.

description: A favorite of mine in SF, over at Embarcadero, La Mar has interesting variations of traditional ceviches and Peruvian classics. The desserts are just as interesting and the cocktails are non-traditional treats. The ceviche sampler is for a lack of better description - simply amazing. Services is typically very good but it gets quite busy at times so hit the place at off peak hours to compensate. Cheers
author: Mark L.

description:
Party of six.
Inside rear.
Noon Friday Aug 29th.

I paid the bill and left a 20% tip, only for the one waiter who who earned it (tallish white guy 30 ish close cropped hair).

But the rest seemed frazzled. One other waiter was outright rude when one of my guests asked him to snap a group photo (short black guy "I'm very busy right now" - he had the other table); I've never seen that before anywhere.

The drinks were sub par. The two bloody Marys were not drinkable. I didn't make a fuss but one guest asked seriously, "what kind of dump is this?"

The food was as it's been - passable.

To Management: fire the rude guy. Tell your staff to get their feelings under control.

I might (might) drop in again by myself to see how things are. But La Mar is off the list for my entertaining.

Really unpleasant for anyone with experience in fine restaurants. If you don't want to be embarrassed in front if your guests, avoid.

I invite the floor manager to contact me.

The place was maybe half 1/3 full.
author: Marc V.

description: This place is to die for! The service was great and the food I cannot even describe how good it was. I will literally just come to San Francisco to come eat at this place. I am not too crazy about Cebiche but I can say it was really good, we also ordered the Bandeja Criolla and that was delicious we got to taste a little bit of everything, lastly we got the empanada sampler and they were very tasty and the dough was flaky and yummy! I highly recommend La Mar.
author: Yazmin V.

description:
We went back early January 2015, the quality of La Mar has lowered, you get dishes the size of your palm ( I am a woman with small palms), and $150 later, you walked out feeling less fullfilled. Our very mild mannered mexican waiter with full body tattoo was very nice, but he couldn't pull a rabbit out of his fuzzy braid with this meagerly offered quantity. 

If you have a big hunger, avoid La Mar at all cost.
author: Tobi B.

description: As with most  at the Embarcadero area  - over priced to pay for their high rents for what you get - sm. to med. amts.- but good quality. Get better authentic, servings & prices w/ equal quality elsewhere - e.g. - in East Bay to where rents are less and thus many chefs & owners have migrated. If you aren't concerned with where - look in W.C. & Cncd. for examples for more & less of all desired for Peruvian cuisine - most more authentic too - not for "mixed tourist clientele".
author: Tony S.

description:
I came here for dinner with a group of friends on a Saturday night. La Mar is located off the Embarcadero and has a nice, colorful location. I liked the ambiance here also-very spacious dining room and plenty of areas to hang. 
I ordered the Lomo Saltado and the chicken and corn empanadas. The empanadas were good and the Lomo was definitely rich and tasty. 
Service was OK and our waiter was very eccentric. 
Prices were typical for this area, but worth trying. I wouldn't mind returning to La Mar if I was looking for Peruvian fine dining- otherwise I'm also OK with my Isabella's In San Jose!
author: Miss H K.

description:
Went here with the family to celebrate a birthday. It's located right on the Embarcadero just north of the Ferry Building which obviously means that surrounding areas and views are beautiful. 

The service was very attentive and answered any and all questions, although it did seem like our waiter was getting a little tired of us (hard to blame him since we had a Sunday night 8:30 reservation). 

I started with the Tuna Ceviche ($16) (not going to try spelling it correctly) and it was fresh and delicious. The portion was substantial, which makes sense given then price tag.

Since I wasn't too hungry I followed it up with Chicken Stew Empanadas ($11). The size of the dish was pretty small which is fair given the price. The dough of the Empanadas was really good, flaky and crunchy, but I wish I could have tasted more of the chicken and less of the potatoes. 

For dessert I shared the Queso Helado which was a light coffee tasting ice cream that I would recommend. 

Others at the table got a mixture of beef and fish for the main course and all enjoyed them. I tried a bit of the Yellow Tail fish and it was very well seasoned- definitely recommended. 

I'd say this is a good place to go out to for a nice dinner for all ceviche and Peruvian food  enthusiasts.
author: Tomer S.

description:
Go-to place for their ceviche! Huge fan of raw fish, so any kind of ceviche is my favorite thing there. I particularly like the classic one. 
The ambience is pretty nice, and the place is pretty big overall. I like their beef dish as well. Once, I got the fried rice, and I definitely wouldn't recommend it for the money. It was absolutely nothing special, unfortunately. 
Again, if you are a fan of raw fish, definitely check out La Mar and their ceviches!
author: Luba Y.

description:
One of the best restaurant experience that I have had in a long time.

Service: Absolutely great. Attentive but not over bearing. Knew the menu and had great suggestions. My first time here but others in the party had been before so they assured me this was typical and the food would be even better.
