Yellowtail tuna is never a misstep, and the Chifa has it topped with peanuts, scallions, ginger, pickled carrots, habanero pepper, wonton strips and cilantro in a sesame leche de tigre.

But my favorite was a switcheroo we made - the Crudo, a near-sushi-like creation with prawns, sea urchin and scallops swimming in a sea urchin leche de tigre. The combination of all four cebiches was quite a treat, and we washed them all down with a couple of Chicharritas, one of several pisco concoctions they make here, this one Drambuie, chicha morada, and orange juice. The homemade potato chips were a nice crunchy contrast and accompanied by three sauces of varying temperatures. I'll be back for a real Peruvian feast at some point. 

FOOD - 4 stars...fresh cebiche (or ceviche...whatever) in many colors...like a Miss Universe swimsuit competition
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...spacious and modern, a nice add to the waterfront 
SERVICE - 4 stars...polished like they've been well trained to be composed 
TOTAL - 4 stars...upscale Peruvian is getting to be as popular as upscale Vietnamese in this town
author: Ed U.

description:
Came here for their Dine About Town lunch  menu and they had 2 options: veggie and non-veggie. Didn't care about veggie option. 

Got the chips (plantain, yucca) with yummy sauces as complementary.

Started out with the empadana samplers. The crust was right amount of flakiness. We like them all except the sweet one.

The other option is half ceviche and carne as entree and lemon custard as dessert. I ended up just getting the full plate of carne instead. Which was just rightly cooked and seasoned.

Only 1 person in our party got the DaT menu and it's pretty good representation of the actual menu. The rest got sandwiches and ceviche. I didn't try any but my friend liked it.

Overall it was pleasant experience and good food. Just not special and unique enough. I'd go again but it didn't make it to my favorite list.
author: Agustinus T.

description: brb just now coming out of my food coma from our 2 pm lunch.
author: Karen R.

description:
I came to La Mar with a group of four from work for a quick happy hour. The venue is quite small and right on the Embarcadero, so there is great people-watching potential.

Between the four of us, we ordered two cucumber gimlets (one was mine), a prickly pear margarita, and a Moscow mule. All four of us were quite happy with the drinks, and I can personally vouch for the cucumber gimlet -- it was refreshing and delicious.

Our small plates included the classic ceviche, mixed ceviche, yucca fries, and four empanadas (beef, chicken, sweet corn, mushroom). I have to say both ceviches were phenomenal -- they were fresh and tasty with fabulous sauce. YUM. On the other hand, the empanadas were just OK. I tried all but the chicken, so I can say the beef was pretty good, the mushroom was passable, and the sweet corn did not really meet my expectations. I would definitely not order empanadas here. Lastly, the yucca fries were just a bit too salty for my taste.

Service here was average. We had to hail a server to take our order after waiting for a while, but after that, she was attentive and professional.

I give three stars for the location, good drinks, and delicious ceviche. Other than that, I'd say this is a decent place to stop by for a typical happy hour but boasts nothing too extraordinary.
author: Tanya P.

description:
Yet another bonus of working in the financial district in SF - plenty of access to Dine About Town restaurants for a weekday lunch!

The DAT menu at la mar was a surprisingly large amount of food - four courses:
two appetizer samples, small entree, and dessert.

We started with buckets of chips - potato, sweet potato, and plantain with two delicious dipping sauces.  Our party of 6 quickly polished off two baskets and the wait staff were quick to bring more.

The two appetizers were ceviche with yellowtail, squid, and shrimp, and causa (cold mashed potato) with octopus tartare and avocado.  They were pretty creative but somewhat lacking in flavor.

The entree was very similar to paella, chock full of seafood - shrimp, calamari, with a mussel on the side.  This dish definitely made up the flavor factor - very good!

We finished with a scoop of chicha sorbet (made from purple corn!) and rolled ourselves back to the office.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Long Over Due Review.

Parking - plentiful street parking near Embarcadero 4 (1.5 block walk) or you can valet.

Ambiance - causal, higher end dining experience but not your typical fine dine environment. 

Service - Great, waters were never empty.   Waiter gave great suggestions for Peruvian newbies like ourselves.

Most restaurants give you bread and butter, but La Mar curbs your hunger with freshly made CHIPS.  Chips for dinner? YES, count me in!!  There's three types of potatoes chips: 1) Sweet Potato Chips, 2) Plantain Chips and 3) Potato Chips .  It also comes with 3 dipping sauces (Green - Spiciest, Orange, Yellow  - I forget which one is the mild and which one is the bland sauces).

Cebiche Tasting ($29) - great variety sampler which consists of the Nikei, Clasico, Mixto, and Chalaco Cebiche.

- Cebiche Nikei - Ahi tuna, red onion, Japanese cucumber, daikon, avocado, nori, and sesame in tamarind leche de tigre.
Ahi tuna was very fresh and drenched in this fusion tamarind sauce (very similar to Ahi Poke at Pacific Catch).  TRY THIS!

Cebiche Clasico - California Halibut in a classic leche de tigre, red onions, habanero with Peruvian corn and yam.
It was my first time consuming raw (California) Halibut and it was a tad chewier than expected.   I think I would prefer my halibut cooked, more specifically seared.  The sauce was also quite bland, white-murky color - not very appealing. SKIP THIS!

Cebiche Mixto - Mahi Mahi, calamari and octopus in aji amarillo leche de tigre with cilantro, red onion, habanero with Peruvian corn and yam
It was also my first time consuming Mahi Mahi raw and I really enjoyed it.   It was very fresh (and soft) and good.  TRY THIS!

Cebiche Chalaco - Mussels, scallops, octopus, calamari, shrimp, and red onions in a rocoto leche de tigre with Peruvian corn and yam.
Mussels had no sand residue (which is great).  First time trying octopus raw, really chewy, but the sauce complimented very well.  TRY THIS!

Anticuchos de pulpos ($16) - grilled octopus skewers, herbed mashed potatoes with chimichurri sauce and aji panca.
Ahhhhh - these were so DELICIOUS!!  The chimichurri sauce was bursting with flavor and the spoonful of mashed potatoes was a great compliment to the grilled octopus. VERY GOOD, TRY THIS!

Lomo Saltado($27) - Traditional Peruvian stir-fry of beef tenderloins, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce, garlic, fried potatoes and  rice. 
This dish is somewhat similar to San Diego's notable Carne Asada Fries but with rice and higher quality meat.  The beef tenderloins was the most tender and sauciest beef cubes I've ever tasted in any Lomo Saltado.  Only downer was that it was a tad bit too salty.   Its because they salt the fries and the soy sauce they use to marinate and cook the Lomo Saltado in is naturally salty - so its like a double dose of salt.   *Maybe next time, I can ask for them to go light on the salt?

Disclaimer: 
(1) All descriptions of the dishes consumed were taken from their website.
(2) Use the restroom in the main room and not the one in the waiting room. 
There's a partition between the cafe and the main dining room.  I horrifically stumbled across a single unisex restroom in the waiting room.  Unlike normal single stall restrooms, there was a door partitioning the waiting room and the restroom itself.  As you walk in, you see a sink and a separate toilet partition (with which there was no lock).  As I entered the first door, a woman exited.  So by natural deduction, I assumed the restroom would be vacant, to my surprise there was a man with his drawers down - the oddest thing for me was that he seemed so causal about me walking in on.  I, on the other hand was so flustered with embarrassment, I waited outside in the general waiting room.
author: Steph L.

description:
Super friendly wait staff, was quickly seated by the hostess who was very friendly. 

The food was absolutely superb and I was very pleasantly surprised to also receive some complimentary fried banana chips, sweet potato chips and potato chips as an appetizer. 

Highly recommended!
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Great for a date night as the decor is trendy and the location provides for a perfect post dinner stroll to up the romance. But make sure you have a town car on call because getting a cab after was a challenge. 

The cocktails are authentic and interesting. They provide a big basket of plantain chips when you sit down.

Generally, the food lacked a bit of kick for my palette and the tables were a little close together, making it impossible to have a truly private conversation.
author: Rebecca F.

description:
Loved my lunchtime visit!  

Ambiance - it's an ocean/beach-side theme in a warehouse-esque space; there's high ceilings, lots of natural light, and open space. There's also an outdoor patio which I look forward to scoping out at a later date.  

Food - delicious.  The four of us shared two cebiches as appetizers.  The clasico was halibut in a milky broth with onions and habanero mixed in and corn and yam on top.  I didn't like this one as much as the nikei which was tuna in a soy sauce-y broth -- much lighter than the clasico and it reminded me of tuna tartare. 

I had the lomo saltado entree - true comfort food; it's a mix of beef, french fries, sweet onions in a salty broth with a side of rice that has corn kernels mixed in.  It's a large portion size, very filling, and delicious.

All around very positive experience - and a place I would not hesitate to recommend.
author: Kimya P.

description:
Drinks are strong. Worth the $10 price.
Ceviche Classico was 'okay'. The Anticucho Carne was really good!
author: Oren F.

description:
**4.5 STARS
I came here a few days ago with my co-workers for lunch to celebrate our the end of the year. We had reservations for 8 initially, but widdled down to 5. They were a little hesistant to put us at another table (so it seemed), but it worked out fine. 

They come out with some yam, potato, and plantain chips. I'm a sucker for plantain chips.

We ordered quite a substantial amount of dishes, including the following:
1) CEBICHE CLÁSICO: Absolutely delicious. You can't go wrong with a classic ceviche.
2) CEBICHE NIKEI: Adding some Japanese influence to it, it was SO good -- I'm also a sucker for avocado.
3) CAUSA TASTING: We weren't a huge fan of the causa, mainly because it was cold mashed potatoes and all. However, from the three (vegetarian, nikei, limeña), the nikei was the hit among our table.
4) ANTICUCHOS MIXTO: It was pretty good, however, I wouldn't really recommend getting it. I think you can definitely get the better bang for your buck with other dishes.
5) TIRADITO: We actually got both of them. However, one of my coworkers had ate one of the plates entirely by herself (due to her many allergies). We were QUITE pleased with both dishes, and would definitely recommend them both to everyone.
4) LOMO SALTADO: You can never go wrong with lomo saltado at a Peruvian restaurant.

It was quite delicious, however, I felt the food was super expensive for Peruvian food (we are definitely paying for the ambiance). My friend, who is from Chile, stated that a lot of the food that we were eating (including the ceviche; and empanadas, if we were to order them) were street food.

Another reason for less 0.5 stars? The waitress that we had wasn't the friendliest.
author: Joanne W.

description:
On a warm sunny day like today, it's just the ideal place,  out of the hustle and bustle of the crowded Ferry Building, to get away from it all and sit out on the terrace ( make sure you get a sunny spot if you are skimpily dressed like I was) soak up the sun, look out onto the Bay, sip a long cold beer and eat one of the tastiest cuisines. So many mouthwatering items to chose from that I ended up asking our server ( a really sweet girl who knew the menu so well ) to recommend a dish - which she did with gusto! Thanks Tatyana!
Water arrived promptly as did our drinks followed by the most delicious home made chips in town, in a metal bucket with 2 yummy dips on the side which were quickly devoured. 
Beware! They are filling... So don't order a 2nd one like we did!
When our food arrived, they were everything you would imagine a heavenly dish to taste like. My beef strips melted ing mouth. The sauce was rich and so exquisite. The potatoes & onions were tasty. And there was more. A bowl of white rice with giant white pieces of corn. A really enjoyable meal. THANK YOU LA MAR FOR THE FINE CUISINE EVERY TIME. 
THANK YOU TATYANA FOR A GREAT SERVICE. 
THANK YOU TO THE GUY WHO SHOWED US TO OUR TABLE AND WAS SO ACCOMMODATING WHEN WE ASKED TO SIT IN THE SUN. 
I am a very happy girl! 
One suggestion: warm up the plates so the food remains hot.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Given the location, I was kind of afraid that this place would be just another crappy excuse to extract money from tourists. The setting is lovely, and it's easy to imagine such a place staying in business in spite of bad food, just based on people who walk in once and then fly home the next day. But I was pleasantly surprised by everything we ordered, from ceviche to some elaborately presented potatoes. Some very tasty dipping sauces and home-made chips got the meal off to a good start. They do a solid Pisco sour, as well as plenty of other interesting cocktails.

Service was a bit random, especially at the start, so not quite perfect, but still a good overall experience.
author: Bruce D.

description:
Oh sweet sweet merciful Heavens, this place is head to toe scrumptious. The way I was acting at every bite of every stage of this meal, you would think I had never been to a restaurant before. We were seated outside, it was a beautiful day and we had a lovely view of the water and boats docked. Baller status! 

We had a sampler appetizer with yummy ceviche, calamari, and an awesome whipped potato/seafood thingy. Yum, yum and yum. AND they serve you these plantain chips with delicious dipping sauces. I ordered the picu picu special of the day over a lima bean cake (!), which i wolved down with the ferocity of a sumo wrestler. I washed it all down with a traditional Peruvian drink, which was different - it had an cinammon/cumin flavor but was refreshingly good. Still eager for more deliciousness, we all split dessert - key lime pie and these chocolate beignets which squirted chocolate lava happiness. What an excellent meal! The ambiance, the food, the sheer excellence. It's pricey but worth it.
author: Hanan H.

description: Excellent ceviche (the ceviche nisei is reminiscent of sushi, and very delicious), anticuchos, and empanadas for our dinner, complemented by excellent chicha morada and cholito for our drinks. The ambiance was very hip, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, and they have a dog-friendly dining area at a waterfront location. Highly recommended!
author: DV P.

description:
I absolutely loved the food I had here. We came for lunch without reservations, and were seated in a nice quiet spot outside in the shade. I had the Cebiche Barrio, which has Condensed Milk, Habañero peppers, Cilantro, Lime, Red Onion, and a beautiful variety of succulent seafood: a HUGE scallop, Ahi Tuna, Prawns, and Squid. It was of course what seemed like a rather small portion, but the concentration of the flavors was so intense that it was thoroughly satisfying, especially when I dipped some fried Plantain Chips into it. 

My one gripe with the restaurant was that I told the Waiter I needed Gluten-Free food, which he accommodated by giving me a Gluten-Free menu. However, he forgot to tell me that the dipping sauces for the Plantain Chips have crushed crackers in them. I did not appreciate this at ALL, but he made up for it somewhat by giving us a free dessert. The sorbet sampling was very satisfying, and I would likely come back again, but I would be more adamant in stating my Gluten-Free needs.
author: Cecilia F.

description:
Have eaten at La Mar cebicheria several times and recently had a special anniversary dinner there. The food is fresh and bright, just like you want Peruvian food to be. The causas are the best, and if you can, order a few different kinds. The grilled octopus skewers are probably the best dish on the menu; perfectly cooked and full of a sweet spicy sauce. 

To read about our experience and check out all the awesome foodporn pics of our meal, visit our food website at the URL below:

http://eatsporkjew.com/restaurants/la-mar-cebicheria-peruvian/

Can't wait to go back!
author: Philip H.

description:
I wanted to choose a fun spot for a first date in the City that had all the style and class to impress my date but without a stuffy atmosphere. I remembered going to La Mar for drinks after a friends Christmas work party a few years ago. When I suggested this place to her I knew right away it would be a good setting for us to meet for the first time.

I got there really early , I had been pacing up and down the Wharf area because I was nervous as hell. Ended up being so hot and overheated on that rainy ass night my glasses were literally steamed up. Got there at 5:30, 15 minutes  early for my reservation. I enter and there is a group leaving. The front desk guys offered them a friendly farewell and thank you. I walk up to the desk. I'm standing there. These jerks barely look up from their silly little lists. I waited for them to acknowledge me so i can get to my table. Nothing. im feeling a smart ass remark on the tip of my tongue. Swiftly the Hostess intervenes, swoops in with a friendly greeting and takes me to the table.



I sit at the table, i'm 30 minutes early. i'm burning up now. Thank god my waiter must see the panicked look on my face. He came by to get me a drink order and some water which was invaluable by now. I pound through like 2 huge glasses of ice water and a Peruvian beer in about 10 minutes and I finally got my nerves and everything chilled out so now im just waiting for her now.

She gets there at around 6pm. Looking amazing. The waiter promptly greets her and gets her a drink with a very subtle suggestion Pisco Sour without being pushy. 

We were having a great time. The atmosphere is perfect inside this place. It puts me in a relaxed mood. The Menu was pretty huge. She wanted a Tuna Appetizer and I ordered the Beef Empanadas . The Tuna dish was a lot more simple and sparse then I expected.  The fact i'm a Chef myself I was really hoping to see some better presentation because the photography of the platings online was very colorful and impressive. Still with all that being said. Both appetizers were nice. The crust on the Empanadas is perfect with beef. When you take all things in to account: Location, Quality, Price, Style, Originality, Service I can't complain at all

At this point I've lost track of time. We were super deep in to conversation and the overall vibe. The Server kept the drinks coming. My date's second drink was some crazy Raspberry,Sparkling Wine, and booze cocktail. It's garnished with mint and is very pink. She thought it was the best "fruity" drink that she's ever had. I agreed with her that it was awesome but i wouldn't order it for myself because it wasn't macho.


By this time the tables on our right and left have turned over once each and new guests were seated. The waiter managed to convince us to get our meal. By this time i was not focused on food at all. I ordered the most expensive dish, I think $32  , it was Beef. It came out and was another underwhelming presentation but the food was quality. It came with some white rice that had a shellfish broth. Still definitely not bad at all. The couple next to us had a beautiful entree platter set on the table and my date and I were wishing we had ordered what they had. It was some kind of Seafood mix with rice. It kinda reminds me of Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura on top of Seafood Paella. Next Time!!!  

We finished up with some coffee and a desert that was like pumpkin and Cinnamon ice cream. It was awesome!! Get that. She loved that. It was a great way to finish up the dinner.



Now here is the main reason why I give this place a solid 4 Stars. They didn't rush us at all. I sat down at the table at 5:30 pm and we left  La Mar at about 10:15 pm. That was the most obscenely long dinner for two i've ever heard of. I was shocked at how long I was in there. But this place was fun and I was in the groove. I had like 4 beers, She had 3 fancy cocktails, 2 appetizers, the most expensive Entree, Dessert and Coffee. The bill was only like $137. I tipped $60 because the service was awesome " Other than the desk guys" and they never tried to rush me out. Still I felt like I made out like a bandit  on that sale. She loved the place and night we had so that's what matters. I will definitely be back and recommend you take your date to La Mar. Literally about a 10 minute walk from the  Embarcadero BART Station. If you are from out of town and unfamiliar with most of SF this is super easy to find, get in and get out. I'll be back for sure!!!!!!!!!!!


Don't underdress but at the same time be comfortable
author: Dan J.

description:
We visited La Mar with friends on a Sunday evening. Considering we had reservations we were promptly seated by our host. Here is a quick review for our DINING experience only.

HITS
-- Appetizers : We had the Empanadas platter and the Ceviche Mixto. Both were well made and hit the spot with the correct balance of crispy-spice on the Empanadas and the fresh-tart on the Ceviche.

--The complimentary Chips ( Combo of Plantain, Sweet Potato and Potato ) and sauce combo are perfect accompaniments to your cocktails.

-- Drinks : We had the Pisco Sour, Spicy Mango , Bar Special and the Cholito. Each and every one of these cocktails were well made and are worth their price.

-- Ambience: Located right next to the Pier 1 SF.. This is a prime location. The dining room is huge..The ambience is elegant and warm.. Perfect for Dinner.. though I am sure with huge French Doors in the Dining Area .. this is will be a good spot to grab lunch/brunch as well.

-- Service: 
The wait staff and our Host for the evening were both attentive and courteous. They make sure to check with you from time to time and make sure that you are well taken care of.

MISSES
-- Entrees
We had Loma Soltado, Anticucho Mixto and Arroz Negro. I don't know whether it was the fact that it took a long time to send our Entrees out OR something else but barring the Loma Soltado ; the remaining 2 Entrees simply failed to match up to the dishes that preceded it.


OVERALL
-- Good Ambience + Excellent Service
-- Well made Appetizers and Cocktails.. 
-- This is a good place for Happy Hour in the Embarcadero Area considering Appetizers and Drinks are what stood out for me.
-- This place is PRICEY considering a 3 course dinner with round of drinks easily set us back by 200+ $$.
-- Personally I think Limon Rotisserie in the Mission is a much better bet  for Dinner / Lunch.
author: Abhishek R.

description: Great place for lunch... amazing Ceviche, and nice view of the bay
author: Rozita N.

description:
We had reservations at 6:30 p.m. We sat outside facing the pier, but the outside was enclosed and the heat lamps were going. The music was festive and it gave the restaurant a lively vibe, but romantic. Since my two fellow friends and I love Peruvian food, and my two friends have been to Peru, they wanted to eat here. It is true, you have heard right. This is the best Peruvian restaurant that we have eaten at.  The server recommended some cocktails for us. We had the punches and passion andina. Since it was so yummy and perfect for girls, we had another round. Potato chips with sauces were served instead of usual bread and butter. Gosh, I think I have died and gone to heaven. I love potato chips and I love dipping things into sauces. God has answered my prayers! My friends were laughing at me when I kept on munching on it with our drinks. Yum! The chips didn't go very far, it sat on the table right next to me. :P Next, we started off with the cebiche tasting since we couldn't decide which cebiche that we wanted to try. Hmmm...all the cebiches are delicious, but we had a favorite. Yes, we ordered another-our favorite cebiche. Our favorite was the cebiche mixto. It was perfect-especially with the cocktails. 

Our entrees were arroz norteno, arroz juguso (prawns, clams, mussels, calamari, octopus, white fish and vegetables in a juicy arborio rice with a blend of Peruvian ajis. Served with rocoto aioli and toasted bread), and a sero cordero (Braised lamb chank with baby carrots and peas served over cannellini bean tacu tacu.) We didn't finish everything of course! Gosh, the entrees were sooo good! ). We had to save room for our dessert. Who could turn down bunuelos de chocolate (Orange glazed chocolate beignets with banana and passion fruit ice cream?  It definitely was a treat for us to eat here. YUM! Great service, great food, and great atmosphere. I know I'll come here within a heartbeat. :)
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. It was a really busy Saturday night. Seven of us were very excited to try some Peruvian food. I had tried a couple dishes in the past , so I knew exactly what I wanted to eat.

We first started with drinks, and of course we had to order pisco sour. It did not disappoint. (can't wait to have some of that again!). The waiter was nice enough to tell us a little bit about the dishes and its sizes, so that we could kind of figure out what to order. I ended up getting Causa Limeña and Anticuchos de pollo. Both dishes were absolutely amazing! 

At the very end of the night they brought my friend a small dessert to wish her a happy bday, which is always a very nice touch! Gotta come back soon to try some more bomb Peruvian food!
author: Yamileth O.

description:
I received this really nasty message from the owner of the establishment. 

"Stop complaining and go to the Health Department."

Since Victoria D.  has suggested I should inform the Health Department then I think it is only the proper thing to do.  I will call the Health Department with her suggestion. I will also follow it up with a written letter stating what occurred.  Since San Francisco is such a tourist destination the last thing we want to be known for is to serve cuisine that might make our guest ILL!

Victoria D.  Thank you for your wonderful suggestion since I neglected to notified the Health Department.
author: Jim J.

description:
The food was fantastic, but it was the service that deserved 5 stars! Our server tended and checked in with us through out our meal. He wasn't pushy and offered great suggestions. Polite, humorous, courteous and very knowledgeable!

We started with the Cebiche La Mar which is a sampler of 4 of their best cebiches. The halibut and tuna cebiches were our favorite of the 4. Next up was the Causa Taster which serves 3 decadently whipped potatoes each with their own topping of crab, beets and spicy tuna. Each was delicious in their own rights! Then came the Passion Scallops, seared fresh scallops on a bed of passion fruit infused quinoa. Sweetness of scallops and the tangy flavors of the quinoa compliments the dish perfectly. Lastly, the best dish of the meal was the Pulpo, grilled octopus with mashed potatoes and salsa. Never have I eaten octopus so soft and masterfully prepared. 

My girlfriend and I aren't very big dessert eaters, but considering it was Valentine's Day we ordered a dessert for the heck of it. I picked the Limon Pie, served in a cup with fluffy lemon meringue and custard on top of a pie crust bottom. A bit tart for my girlfriend, but I liked it. 

Great place to take a date!
author: Philip K.

description:
I spent two weeks in Peru and am always looking for reminders of how wonderful the food and people were there!

La Mar is such a beautiful restaurant. The first two times I went (2 years ago), I was so impressed. The last several times, not so much. The portions are not worth the price (ex: lomo saltado = 4 pieces of meat in the entire dish) and the quality (beef empanadas with two bites of meat, one was straight gristle) has gone downhill. The service is really bad. As the daughter of a chef who owned his own restaurant, I know when the food arrives to your table LUKEWARM or COLD, it's the server, not the kitchen. 

I had dinner there this past week. My friend and I mentioned to our server (who came by ONCE after the meal was brought to the table) about the empanada issue to the server. His response? "Sorry." That was it - then he walked away. He only came back to offer dessert and bring our check.
author: Paula W.

description:
I love this restaurant and can't say enough good things about ambiance, delicious food, and addicting pisco sours.  But this Yelp is all about our fabulous server my group had last night, the one and only Victor!

Victor is charming and good looking with fabulous hair and ponytail that made our follicle challenged male companions pea-green with envy.   Victor has an undeniable love of his homeland Peruvian food and couldn't wait to share to his favorite dishes with us.  We trusted him immediately, returned our menus, and told him 'Just bring us what you think we should have.'  

Cebiches and causas and anticuchos.. oh the delights!  And those veggie chips.. superb!  A bottle of Albarinio and a bottle of Malbec.. perfectly paired.  Sorbets and something deep fried for dessert, followed by a pisco chaser.  Everything was so yummy!  

And the service!  Each dish arrived perfectly timed.. no rushing and our table was not over-crowded with too many plates or glasses.  It was one of the most perfect dining experiences ever!

Thank you Victor for a truly memorable evening!
author: Maggie S.

description:
Spent my first bday dinner here, place and food still deserve 4stars...love all their ceviches! The restaurant is so romantic and our huge family table which sat 16 was just lovely and private. Our server 'Mario' was wonderful.
However, when it came to alcohol, we ordered several cocktails and wine...we ordered 4bottles total: the red was fine but when we ordered a bottle of white @ $75, the wine tasted muggy, looked like 'pee', and don't even want to describe the taste of it....horrid! Bitter and sour!!!! We explained to Mario the situation and his manager came over. She had the utmost disturbed look on her face and said "just so you know, almost half the bottle was gone BUT we'll still take it back and take if off your bill".  Of course it was half gone, we all tasted it and was disgusted by it!
FYI: our dinner was $1200 so we def were not trying to pull a fast one on you lady!! 
Either way, we still ordered additional wine. 

Lost a star in my book for the unprofessional manager but it's not the end of the world...i'll still return (one day)
author: Vee V.

description:
Came here mostly looking forward to the  ceviche. It was different than I was expecting: way more citrus flavor than I've ever tasted in ceviche. Definitely good, although pretty overpowering for those last few bites. The causas was a good pairing with it.

The flat iron steak was also very good, I really enjoyed it and I'm not even a big steak fan.

The never-ending plantain and sweet potato chips are great! 

The only real negative was the noise level: the restaurant is in a redone warehouse space/old ferry terminal. Architecturally interesting, but it's a big cavernous space, filled with people and conversation on a busy night. I could barley hear my companion across the table. Good place to take your load party, you won't disturb anyone. But not so great for a quiet date. The bar, on the other had, looked quiet and low key.
author: Kelly T.

description:
I've been to La Mar two times. My boyfriend and I went the first time and got cebiches, both were very light and delicious.

We went back recently, a few weeks ago, and decided to try out a few other options on the menu. The server was knowledgeable, but also quite the salesman, which is why I knocked this down a star. It was a little too much pitching of the menu. 

It is a pricey place and advance reservations are a good idea. I reserved our table a week ahead of time and only had 2 time slots to pick from. It is located on the embarcadero, so you probably get a good amount of tourists here and can explain the pricey menu. 

Overall, a really lovely date night place with pretty views and really stellar food.
author: Laura C.

description: I feel like this is one of those places you get excited about, but end up disappointing you. The location is awesome and they have a decent happy hour, but the dinner/food was just very meh.  Nothing really stood out, except that I remember my food was very very salty. The portions were on the smaller end as well. Definitely never going back. If you're looking for a cute place on the water, try coqueta instead.
author: Lisa H.

description: A little overpriced but all the food was delicious. Got the shrimp empanadas, catch of the day skewers and one of the cebiches. Not a ton of food for 20 dollars worth of food per plate but good for a light lunch and everything was very good
author: Alexandra S.

description:
I've been 3 times now so I feel like I'm ready to weigh in. It's not 4 stars, it something better than that, perhaps 4.25 (that's the precise engi-nerd in me talking, shhh). 

I'm a fan of ceviche and I'm a fan of lomo saltado, fortunately La Mar delivers wonderfully on both. The steak served with the lomo saltado is very soft and juicy and the fried potatoes just right. I also enjoyed the ceviche tasting, I can never make up my mind with so many intriguing options. Leche de tigre was fun, zesty sauces and different sea creatures in shot glasses.

The noise level is rough, hard surfaces and high ceilings do that. Decor is light and festive, bluish-green watery themed. I like it, not too trendy, but not playing it completely safe either. A nice bar up front to wait for friends or grab a drink with your date.

Service has varied widely, but has been anywhere from good to mediocre depending on the server (most recent visit was best, so perhaps they are getting into their grove).

Bottom line: I'm definitely recommending it highly to friends (and panning it to my enemies).
author: Jeremy S.

description: La Mar is a good Peruvian restaurant with a great space. I love coming here when it's good weather outside and sitting on the patio. (Granted, that doesn't happen as often as I'd like considering San Francisco weather, but it's a great lunch when it does). This past time I was dining for a business dinner with 4 other women. We ordered all of the samplers basically: the ceviche, the causas, the empanadas and a few entrees: the halibut, the salmon and the seafood arroz. I've never really understood the causas. They're good, but nothing to write home about. The ceviches and empanadas are always good here and I liked their entrees as well (but always default to the ceviche if I have to pick one). Overall it was a really nice dinner and they put us at a great table in the corner so we could chat without it getting too loud. I would definitely do another business dinner here.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Oh my God, if I lived in San Fran, I'd be a regular here!!!!!!

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. He loves hispanic food & I love seafood so what would've been a better combo than La Mar Cebicheria Peruana?

Although it's a cebicheria, my boyfriend & I didn't feel like ordering cebiche the night we came here.

So what was on our list that night?
- The homemade chips are unlike your usual chips. It was a mixture of plantain chips & potato chips. They complimented very well w/ the sauces.
- The causa nikei was a small portion but enough to satisfy 2 people. The potato was whipped to perfection & matched well w/ the tuna tartare.
- The carne anticuchos was juicy (not dry at all) & tasty.
- I ordered the arroz criollo, which is pretty much paella. It was one of the best paellas I have ever had! The rice was succulent & not dry. Every bite was blasting w/ flavor. & they didn't skimp out on the seafood at all!
- My boyfriend ordered the special, which came on a skillet. The mixture of seafood was so satisfying & delicious.

This place is perfect for a group of friends or a date. La Mar is simple yet trendy. Staff was also very accommodating & friendly. They also sang happy birthday to my boyfriend, which I had mentioned on my OpenTable reservation but totally forgot! Haha.

Totally worth going to!
author: Olivia S.

description:
Yum!! What a great place to try during Dine About Town! So worth it! 

First of all, the decor of this place is bright and very simple. I loved everything about this place! Pops of blue, green, and orange remind you of summer and the ocean. 

We got the tuna ceviche that our waiter reccommended and the sauce on that was deeelicious. BTW the chips they give you are awesome, except the orange sauce that comes with it. 

As a part of the Dine About Town prix fixe menu, we started with seafood ceviche and octopus tartare. The tartare had an olive taste and the potato under that with the sauce is an amazing pairing. The seafood ceviche is good but i feel like the sauce lacked something. I love the corn that was in it though.

Next we had the paella-like dish. It was sooo good and perfect. Lots of calamari in there and a mussel. My favorite dish of the day. 

Dessert was a guava sorbet which was good but tasted like Kern's guava juice to me.

As for drinks, we got a chicano pepper something - its a ginger based cocktail and a Peruvian beer. Both were so good!!!! But this day they had pesco sours for $5 each! Will get that next time. 

Will definitely be back to try the other ceviches and paella!
author: Jenny A.

description: Such rave reviews online dragged me to this restaurant today! The location is spectacular. 5 stars for it. Can't get better than this. Seating ample and comfortable. The banana chips and the dip they serve is just superb! My problem was the waiter I got. It is but obvious you will ask the waiter for suggestions when you are trying a new cuisine. I told him I like something spicy. And trust me there are plenty of spicy options on the menu. What does he do. He disregards your needs and disregards the fact that you are by yourself and suggests grilled halibut. The most expensive of items which you discover is 20$ above the rest of the menu only when you receive the bill. It's not listed in the menu. It is bland..or the blandest thing on the menu far away from your specific suggestion on wanting something spicy. I don't even know what was Peruvian about it. It was just a huge piece of fried fish with no spices! You don't take advantage of a persons lack of knowledge and cheat them into buying the most expensive item. The experience left such a bad taste. I wish there weren't such unethical people. I even asked him why no one else is ordering it if he said it's the best thing the restaurant offers. And the restaurant was full. To that his answer he only had 3 tables and can't speak for others tables!
author: Hs M.

description: I came here for lunch and sat in the outside area. There is a gorgeous view of the bay back there. Dine about town is going on so I decided to do their lunch special. I must say there was a great presentation and the first course was delicious! It was followed by a mussels and clam plate. It was fresh and had a great taste. It came with a side of rice and I definitely had the broth with the rice. The desert was 2 scoops of a 4 fruit blended sorbet ( both scoops were different flavors) This was the best lunch I've ever had!
author: Reyna V.

description: What happen to the service here, the bar Manager and another short haired bartender where so uninviting and basicly I was made to feel uncomfortable, Tall bald bartender always professional and another tall bartender with curly hair ,very pleasant, but I couldn't believe how this guy talking with bar Manager was staring at me rolling up his sleeves , did I miss something is how I felt and this will be the last time I patronize this establishment, I was stunned as to how low the standards of there staff has gone for every 2 you have 2 horrible ones , must be new business marketing I'm not seeing the $$$$ but Ciao I had 1 beer and got up never once acknowledged by bar Manager who happened to serve I said thank you he said nothing , this kind of service only lasts in places that have customers no matter what, rather than enhance the experience Upper management has depleted it by putting Un qualified people I positions of authority shame it was such a good spot before
author: Robert G.

description: Free sparkling wine for a special occasion as specified on our reservation. The interior decor is fantastic. Loved the background Latin music! Food was okay, not out of this world. Portions are small but filling. Prices are very reasonable for the area. Would come back just for the appetizers and drinks.
author: Dani P.

description:
Being vegetarian, I was a little unsure when my family (not vegetarians) wanted to go here. It wasn't obvious from the menu what I could eat and what would be interesting.

But I tagged along, and while we waited to be seated we each had a very nice cocktail. Good start.

When the time came to order food, I decided to put my decision in the hands of the waiter. I told him what I wouldn't eat; he told me what I should eat. And I did. And it was excellent.

For one thing, my food (like all the food at the table) was beautiful. I almost didn't want to eat it because it was so well put together. But I am so glad I did because it was delicious too. It always makes me really happy when upscale restaurants like this manage to amaze people with "special needs" as well.

Everything was good about this place, to be honest. Location, service, food, drink. It wasn't too noisy. Just don't hesitate. If you can afford it, eat here. (Everyone else was very impressed with their food too. Just to clarify.)
author: Sara N.

description:
~Ode to the Twelve Days of Christmas~

On a cold and drafty Tuesday night at La Mar Cebicheria Peruana, my true love gave to me:

Twelve Peruvian fusion entrees (like scallops, risotto, ahi tuna, pork chop, lomo saltado, causas),
Eleven divine dining companions,
Ten Granny Smith green apples,
Nine Tiffany blue backed chairs,
Eight the magic hour,
Seven clicks of the camera to preserve the night,
Six sweet little beignet balls filled with warm melted chocolate,
Five foamy Pisco Sours decorated with red dots,
Four ceviche samplers (mixto, clasico, ahi, yellowtail),
Three baskets filled with crunchy plantain chips,
Two more desserts - Tiramisu & Dulce, and
One Perfect Birthday Dinner!
author: Peg S.

description:
Our waiter preferred larger groups than us. Heater outside didn't work. 
Ceviche tasting was on the plain side
Lomo saltado shy on meat
Jalea- nothing special
Their pasta with the black noodles was great.
Overall, not your $$$$ worth.
If you want really good peruvian food, try MOCHICA or better yet LA COSTANERA.
author: L S.

description:
Went here while on vacation.  Fantastic Peruvian food.  The service is good, but the food is simply top quality.  I highly recommend the sampler appetizers, as well as some of the cocktails.  Okay beer selection (nothing amazing).

Great location, right on the Embarcadero.

They opened one of these in NYC but it went out of business pretty quick.  That was a real shame, as I was really excited to have a La Mar in driving distance.
author: Devin H.

description: La Mar is a great spot for food and drinks. Good service, not too overhwleming. I've been here for a few group events where there was a prix fixe menu, which was totally fine, but their full menu is great. You definitely need to try a few of the ceviches. The Nikkei is my personal favorite. And a bonus point - if you buy a bottle of wine they'll waive the corkage for one you bring. So you can bring a bottle, buy a bottle, and it ends up being a pretty good deal for drinks for a group. And I LOVE the plantain chips!
author: Tbone M.

description: They have a really fun menu. Keep in mind their brunch menu is slightly different from the regular. The portions are just right and food presentation was very good. Slightly expensive but a great spot to grab few drinks and order tapas.
author: Hailey Y.

description: Peruvian ceviche is the king of all ceviches and La Mar certainly does not disappoint.  We were a group of two couples and a toddler and the staff was very accommodating.  All the dishes and drinks were well done.  You are paying a premium for the location, but La Mar is worth the price.
author: James P.

description:
Great place to take your parents. Back patio lends views of the bay and a ferry gently bobbing up and down at the dock. Smell the ocean as you feast on its fruits, namely fresh fish ceviches and other seafood dishes.

Went here with a large group for a birthday lunch. We were served promptly by a platoon of vigilant waiters. My glass of water never ran out nor did my complimentary paper cone of plantain chips. 

We had causas, sushi, ceviches, lomo saltado and braised pork with giant corn kernels, topped off with dulce de leche sandwich cookies. The vegetarians and celiacs among us were pleased with their quinoa and arroz criollo dishes. Color, seasoning and portions were festive. 

Inca kola and chicha morada (traditional purple corn drink) were hits and so were the inoffensive south american wines.

Patio could use some music. Peruvian pipes?
author: Lum P.

description:
Went to this place for New Year's Eve and not sure what all the fuss is about.

The Good:

Had the Cebiche Clasico as an appetizer.  The ceviche was really fresh and is easily some of the best I have had.  I would definitely go back to try more ceviche.

The Bad:

Since it was NYE and Embarcadero was full of pedestrians, someone decided it would be nice to let said pedestrians use the bathrooms near the hostess table and in the restaurant.  Nice? Sure, but not when you are a paying customer and have to deal with a line of 20 just to get to a stall.  Works out well since the waiter never asked if we wanted a second round of drinks...maybe he was just looking out for my bladder?

The Meh:

I was told to try the Lomo Saltado, which is supposed to be one of their better dishes.  I could be mistaken, but I thought the menu said it was kobe beef.  In any event, it doesn't matter.  The dish was way too salty to taste the beef anyway.  It tasted like a stir fry that I used to make when I was young and single.  It was pretty underwhelming and I wish I had ordered something else. meh

Maybe it was New Year's Eve, or maybe it was all the build-up of other people loving this place, but I only thought it was so-so.  I'll probably come here again to have ceviche and try some of the fish dishes.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: I've never been a huge fan of ceviche, it's okay but not something I seek out. But, I'm a huge fan of the cebiche at La Mar. Wow, was it good.
author: Patricia G.

description: Good was phenomenal.  Had the short ribs and Peruvian beer. The service was a bit slow for a ties night but right on the water.
author: Todd A.

description: I've been here several times and this place never disappoints.  I love Peruvian food.  This place has a delicious selection coupled with an amazing atmosphere.  The staff is always friendly and it's normally pretty easy to get a table because the dining room is huge.  On a warm evening be sure to ask for a table outside where you will be dining with fantastic views of the water!  My favorites here are the various cebiches and their version of paella.  Classic, but prepared exceptionally!
author: Gloria Y.

description:
Yelpers seem to like everything, especially if it's new & trendy.  Well, Peruvian food isn't new, there's a few places I've been that are way better & less expensive.

This place is Expensive!  For 2 at lunch on a Sun afternoon it was $52 + $4.42 tax = $56.42 Before Tip!  Can you say Sticker Shock!

Eat all the FREE chips/plantains - that's the Only way to fill up here.  3 sauces given - all pretty Bland!  Green sauce - bland, Yellow-bland, Orange-Bland!

You get tiny amounts of food people.  For a 1/2 order of Cebiche Clasico $9 you get maybe 4 tiny pieces of Calif. halibut w/ tiny slices of red onions & habanero pepper leche de tigre w/ Peruvian corn & yam.  Full portion is $15.  Drink the sauce - you paid for it & it was recommended.

Another dish we got: Cabiche chifa $9 - again that's a half order which had 4 tiny Yellowtail tuna w/ peanuts, scallions, ginger, pickled carrots & daikon, wonton strips & cilantro in sesame leche de tigre.  Drink the sauce since you paid for it & waitress recommends it.  Maybe so u can fill up too.

Sopa Parihuela -$11 - it's a Bland soup w/ mussels, calamari, clams, mahi mahi, ginger & red onion.  Tasted like tomato sauce w/ the seafood in it. Bland!

Arroz Norteno $19 - a bland rice dish w/ 2 mussels, some other seafood, yellow sauce, green rice.  

Only got 1 drink: Chicha Morada $5 on menu, but on Bill only $4.  Classic Peruvian refreshment made of maiz morado (purple corn).  It's sweet, but not too sweet.  I liked it, but I also had it before in other Peruvian places way cheaper.

It's also Way Too Loud in there.  If you like to shout when you want to talk to your companions then come here.  Otherwise, Skip it.

Two unisex bathrooms in the main lobby - One on the Left, One on the Right.

Skip it unless you want to Blow Money.  They must be Laughing at all of us to their bank.
author: Ann L.

description: Last Friday night was our first time dinning at La Mar. My girlfriend and I were taken care of by Gilberto, very friendly and food/wine knowledgeable waiter. We decided to go with some of his recommendations, we shared the Ceviche Taste, Anticucho Corazon and the Grilled Halibut. We had a great dinning experience. We are definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu. Thanks again Gilberto.
author: Carlos F.

description:
Tried La Mar after grand reputation and mixed reviews.

Atmosphere is great, with water views and open/airy feel.

Food was an interesting mix of choices and flavors.  Highly recommend the cerviche  and empanadas.  Server was well informed and very helpful.

Service was very slow.  Long wait for the first round of special cocktails (from the menu, so you would figure they could push them out quickly.  Appetizers came before 1st round of drinks. Even round 2 (bar special mixed drink and glass of wine) took way too long.  Either the service bar is poorly staffed or the server was overwhelmed.

Tables are very close (NYC style close) together and our neighbors orders (food and drinks) came before ours, adding to the slight.

For $90pp, I recommend trying to find an off night to see if it is a staff training or staff capacity issue.

One weird thing was there was a photographer taking pictures through the window INTO the restaurant.  Later he was wandering around the dinng room taking photos of patrons. Thought he was a tourist, bu it seems he was working for La Mar.....hmmmmm
author: Gary J.

description: First time trying Peruvian food and I am a definite fan. I am big on sushi and Peruvian food has a lot of fresh fish. Highly recommend trying the cebiche sampler. So fresh and flavorful! I think I'm drooling just writing this review. Beef empanada was juicy and has a good amount of spice to it. But the octopus skewer is a must have. We had so many appetizers that we didn't even get any entrees. I will be back :)
author: Stanley W.

description:
I heard all this rave about La Mar, so I walked by a few times, glimpsed at the price, squinted, and gave my lady the Kevin Hart excuse for not going in. "So the way my bank account is set up, it takes about 3 days for it to clear.. so umm we can't eat here."

So one beautiful afternoon, I walked by and I struck gold. By gold I mean Happy hour at La Mar! "So my bank account finally cleared, we can eat at this fancy spot baby.. my treat" 

The happy hour takes place at the bar area between 3pm-6pm. The bar is a nice cozy area with high stools, not as romantic as the main dinning area. And not good for a baby! No high chair can reach the top of the tables. The happy hour was a big disappointment, though a delicious one. We ordered 4 plates off the happy hour menu and a cocktail (at $6 a plate, sounds like a good deal right?). 3 ceviche dishes and a chicken dish. It was so gosh darn small! Like my ex-girlfriend would say about her new boyfriend.. when she unzips his... Anyway, the food was delish! Especially the chicken pieces, had a unique taste that my daughter loved! But the plates were so small and not filling. The cocktail was nice, a whiskey sour topped with egg white, good stuff!

At the end, I stared at the $45.00 bill while my stomach growled. So my lady asked, do you want to eat some place else. "So the way my bank account is set up, I can only eat at one unreasonably expensive small plated restaurant, about once every 3 years."

Seriously, it wouldn't hurt to make your plates a bit bigger so I'm actually eating a reasonable portion. Seriously.
author: Sani S.

description:
I've dined in twice and had take out once and let me tell you, all three of these experiences have been top-notch. 

They give you really tasty complimentary sweet potato and plantain chips with two different sauces, one of which is spicy. If you like the chips, there's actually no need for an appetizer. But if you're like me and your eyes are bigger than your stomach and you love having leftovers for lunch the next day, be my guest!

The mushroom empanadas are an excellent aperitivo. I know that I should try the ceviche here but I am absolutely and unequivocally obsessed with the seafood quinoa. It's the perfect balance of sweet and savory and served the portion is really generous!

The location of the restaurant itself is really beautiful. The bright blue chairs are a little startling but also very cheerful. Last but not least, they seem to only hire very attractive  female hostesses.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
I was the guest of honor at a luncheon here recently.  I wouldn't have chosen La Mar myself, but it was definitely a change from our usual places.  The interior is pretty different, with very high ceiliing and full of light.  I would love to eat lunch on the patio on a nice day and enjoy the view.

We had a prix fix menu, which was a bit of a disappointment since I wanted to try all the different ceviches!  The one that came with our meal was mostly calamari, something I never eat.  I enjoyed the empanadas and salad that made up the rest of the first course.

The second course was not very successful.  A gigantic platter of fried seafood, again mostly composed of octopus and calamari.  The loma saltado fared much better.  That will go down as one of my all time favorite restaurant dishes and I cannot wait to go back and try it again!!!!  The last dish of the second course was mahi-mahi which was again, fantastic.

I will definitely be back to try some different ceviches and to eat the loma saltado again!

Oh, service was pleasant but really really slow.  We had a prix fixe, arrived on time, and still wait ted around 20 minutes of our first course.  Not good, especially since the restaurant wasn't crowded at all.
author: .Hon H.

description:
WOW!
My husband and I tried La Mar for the first time on a Saturday for lunch.
We sat out on the deck.  What a wonderful view. We would go back just to relax on the deck, but the food was a knock out too!
We ordered a cebiche dish and the coles de brusela.  Unbelievably good. Bright, fresh and complex.  
The cocktails we interesting and complimented our dishes.  The wines-by-the-glass varied and not ho-hum. 
Our server was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive.
All-in-all a wonderful experience.

I do have one comment about the infrastructure.
The space is large and will serve a lot of customers.
It is just wrong to see long lines snaking out into the public area from inadequate restrooms.  They are way too small.  Such a shame.
author: Carol H.

description:
Had a great time here, we came for dinner on a Tuesday night.

Service was good, they definitely paid attention to us - checking up on us several times throughout our meal and making sure our drinks were never empty.

We tried a little of everything and enjoyed it all:
Cebiche nikei - Loved the mix of ingredients, very refreshing.
Causa tasting - Never had a causa before, so had to try it.  It was really just a lot of whipped potato.  Glad I tried it, but not sure if I'd get it again.
Carne Anitcucho - The skewer was delicious
Empanadas tamalito verde - Was great, a good break from all the meat/seafood.  Would be a great option for any vegetarians diners.
Cau cau - My favorite dish.  Perfectly seasoned.

The only sad part was that we were too full for dessert.  Will have to try it the next time I come out here.
author: Gloria N.

description:
While the food is really high up in the scale of aesthetics and flavor, a common denominator for Peruvian restaurants , and this one is no exception, is the poor service
- it's not just crazy me, but you will find this on other reviews as well. I found myself arguing with the waiter whether I had ordered chicken versus calamari.  I think, and will give myself the benefit of the doubt, I ordered the calamari which took 25 min during happy hour- a record!
author: Victor F.

description:
La Mar can be your answer to a fun Peruvian-food filled meal.  Lots of variety on the menu to accommodate all different palates. Go early and get a drink in the bar (have a pisco sour at some point!), it is slightly detached from the dining area and fun to hang out in.  Also, go with a group so you can try several dishes.  Reservations probably required if you go during prime hours. 

We tried several cebiches, causas, empanadas, and of course, cocktails. No complaints here!
author: Brianna M.

description:
Decided to celebrate Valentine's day on 02/15/13 instead of 02/14/13 to avoid the over priced valentine's day menu that goes on everywhere. We made reservations for 8:15 pm.  I had high expectations based on the yelp reviews and was sorely disappointed. 

After arriving, we were asked if we wanted to be inside or outside and took outside based on the recommendation.  It was a great view of the waters.  The weather was not too bad since we had the heaters above us. 

The server was super slow in taking our order and coming around to our table was almost non existence.  We ordered the empanada samplers to start.  However, based on the yelp reviews, I know the potato chips and different sauces to be an excellent start.  We had asked for our complimentary potato chips but they never arrived.  After about 20 minutes, a bus boy came to a table right next to us to wipe down and clean the table, we had asked if he could get some for us.  We watched him walk straight to the kitchen, asked the workers there for some and he brought them out to us.  WTF. I was bothered that it was that easy and we were sitting here for 20 minutes waiting patiently. Strike one!

Appetizers: Empanada Samplers - I had asked the server how I could identify which empanada samples were which.  His response was "I don't know, I already placed the order." The empanada's arrived shortly afterwards. The server from the kitchen who brought out our empanada's was able to easily identify them for us as he mentioned that they are always placed in a certain order. Strike two for our server!

Dinner:  I had ordered the chicken skewers and the mate ordered the Lomo Saltado with us sharing a bottle of wine.  We shared and sampled each others dinner. Both were amazingly excellent.  

Overall: Excellent food. We saw the waiter maybe three times our entire time during the hour and a half experience. We would have stayed longer and had dessert but was too turned off by the waiter. The only reason we saw him the third time was because he was trying to up sell dessert to us. It was a perfect opportunity for us to ask for the check. Strike 3! For the $115 I spent there for two , I expected better service.
author: Sokha S.

description:
This place is AMAZING, and that doesn't even cover it. If I had to pick my one favorite place to take out of town guests when they come to visit SF, it would be La Mar. Mainly due to this fantastic concoction they call Pisco Punch. Honestly, the best drink I've ever had. Ever. Sweet, but not too sweet. Strong, but not too strong. With a stir-stick of fresh pineapple. MmmMmm. Trust me, you cannot have just one. 

Next, instead of free bread, delivered to your table without you even asking are these amazing "chips" - a mix of sweet potato, banana, etc., with 3 different dipping sauces on the side. I love anything I can dip, so they had me at hello. 

Moving onto the cebiche. My favorite is the chifa. I've been known to literally drink the marinade (leche de tigra) directly from the bowl, it's *that* good. And don't forget the causas tasting. These fantastic little whipped potato "rolls", accented with different and creative toppings. Unique and perfectly flavorful. 

Now, picture yourself outside on a beautiful patio, overlooking the SF Bay, while enjoying all of the above, and more. Or even if you don't happen to pop in on of those beautiful SF days, their inside decor is just as welcoming and beautiful - bright blues and greens in a wonderfully open space gives the place a fresh clean feel. Trust me, it doesn't get any better than this.
author: Natalie N.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. It has a prime location located on the Embarcadero facing out at the water. It's a perfect walk if you're staying in one of the Embarcadero hotels. The atmosphere is lively and festive just like the food. Come with a sense of adventure, everything is a little different and very colorful. I especially love that the wait staff is so knowledgeable and engaging. The drinks are beautiful and the food is delicious. They sepcialize in cebiches so be sure to plan on one of those. We have to eat hear at least once on every trip. I highly recommend it.
author: Traci L.

description:
We kicked off my 30th Birthday trip at this swanky gem. I booked reservations months ago and they were accommodating enough to bump up our table to 7 people last minute. I picked it because first because I LOVE Peruvian food and also because of it's stellar reviews and prime location at the ferry building. Aside from the crowded scene and bit of a wait, the food was worth it.

We shared a few samplings of the numerous cebiches (ceviches), empanadas and appetizers, the halibut cebiche being my favorite. The octopus app was a little adventurous for a few at the table but I thought it was awesome. My sea bass dish was perfectly cooked and everyone seemed happy with their entrees as well (paellas were amazing). We shared several delicious bottles of wine suggested by the house somollier. Overall a very nice experience and I would recommend sharing multiple dishes as they are small.

The only thing I was disappointed about was the plantain and sweet potato chips everyone keeps raving about? We were served plain old potato chips and dip, literally. The dip was delicious but I was really looking forward to the famous chips, bummer!
author: Lianna S.

description: I have had dinner here three nights in a row. The ceviche is an explosion of flavors. The Paiche was cooked to perfect. The octopus melts in your mouth. Every dish I've had has been exceptional and makes we want to travel to Peru. When traveling to San Francisco this restaurant is a MUST.
author: Ana M.

description: It's a bit overpriced for what you get. There's better Peruvian food in the Bay Area for less money - specifically San Mateo. Service was nice. Outside can be a bit noisy if there's another party out there. The trio of ceviches are delicious.
author: Mimi T.

description: I went here for a business lunch and was not impressed. The service was rushed and the dish I ordered would have been good if the cook knew how to cook meat properly. I ordered the Pollo Skewers and 2 of the three pieces of chicken were severely under-cooked - did I order chicken Ceviche? Yuck! I couldn't eat the meal and didn't want to make a big deal out of it because I was with a a group of Colleagues. I will not be going back!
author: dylan b.

description: Great ambiance and service. Unique and perfectly blended flavors. Very fresh seafood. Love the ceviche and various sauces. Try the little smashed potato appetizer. The patio view is fun with the boats, water and distant East Bay hills.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Conveniently located on Washington St and Embarcadero, easy access from BART/Muni stations.   
Made reservations for Saturday dinner for me and my friends and got seated right away.  I liked that they served various chips(plantains, potato, sweet potato, yuka and others) with 3 different types of dips, instead of bread.  The spicy dip had a strong chipotle flavor to it and the medium spiced dip was the most preferred.
Ordered casua camarón - plate of 2 poached shrimp on top of purple potato with aioli dressing.
Casua Casera (vegetarian) - plate of 2 yellow potato cutlet with basil cilantro oil.
Empanada sampler - plate of 4 pastry empanadas one of chicken, beef, mushrooms and sweet corn.. the sweet corn empanada tasted awesome!
Quinoa Chaufa(vegetarian) - fried quinoa, eggs and other veggies served on a wok 

When its time for dessert, the waiter brought in a cream puff topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate drizzled with a side of candle LOL (that was sweet of my friend to tell the staff about my birthday).  I did not find the pastry item on the desserts menu list but anyway ordered the trio something dessert - 3 glasses. one had lemon pie, another vanilla and another with strawberry.  

A must try restaurant.  Ambiance is excellent. Both interior and outside dining experience is great. Although outside patio did not have full view of the bay bridge.. partially hidden due to one of the building jutting out on the pier.  Highly recommend for special occasions here.  I had a great time here and thanks to my friend for treating me here =)
author: Hema K.

description: I enjoyed La Mar, it was a very pleasant experience, the ambience was cool in terms of food I really enjoyed the cebiches which is what they're known for, service was very attentive, the only complain the I have is that the meat on the skewers was a bit on the dry side for me, we also tried the empanadas and lomo saltado they were both good.
author: Mario T.

description:
Love the yucca, plantain and potato chips that they give you when you get seated. The Hamachi Ceviches was the best I have ever, ever had. 
The Steak Skewers were really yummy too.
I could do without the empanadas.
Now, you are wondering why I am only giving them 2 stars? It's because there was a BIG ASS RAT scaling on the side of the wall behind the bar....
author: Annie T.

description:
Oh My God! This is my new favorite place !! We just moved to the area and this my new favorite spot.
The wait is a little long, yet so worth it!
author: Caroline E.

description:
Food: 5 stars
Value: 3 stars
Service: 2 stars

La Mar's FOOD is EXCELLENT.  Every dish I had was exceptional and would highly recommend-  Hamachi Cebiche; Causa Tasting; Scallops with Quinoa(special); and Choco Maracuya (desert with 24k gold).  Even their complimentary chips were delicious.

I felt the prices were very reasonable and GOOD VALUE for everything EXCEPT the woefully under portioned Scallops w/ Quinoa special that night.  $24 for 2 scallops- as in $12 per scallop. C'mon.  They were delicious though.  

SERVICE WAS THE LOW POINT of the experience.  We were "served" by "Manuel" who had both mechanical and attitudinal issues.  While Manuel was sub-par, the food runners and bus-staff were actually very friendly and helpful.

One particular bummer was that it was my girlfriend's birthday and I noted it as such with the hostess, but the restaurant did nada to recognize.  If they would've just thrown a candle on a cupcake and brought it to her, I would've tipped 25% instead of the 15% I did leave.  I guess they actually saved me some cash. Thanks!
author: Duke K.

description:
I went for an office celebration - there were about 10 of us so we ordered a LOT of food and I was fortunate to try most of it.

Let's start with the delicious vege chips - Oh my, I could've stopped with the chips and been completely happy with my "meal"!  But thankfully my meal didn't stop there!

Next we had the cebiche tasting...  Then the causa tasting...  And then the anticuchos and some empanadas... Everything was soooo good but I was getting soooo stuffed and at some point it's hard to truly enjoy one thing over another.

Finally, I ordered the lomo saltado as my entree.  Honestly, by that point I only had enough room for a couple of bites and then I took the rest home to my son for dinner (along with some leftover appetizers).  But, the couple of bites that I did have were just as delicious as everything else I tried.

For such a large party, our service was great!  Everything we asked for (whether it was extra vege chips, extra dipping sauces, extra plates, or more wine) came very quickly.

I will definitely be back!  Actually, I heard that another group from the office is having lunch there later this week and I'm trying to get an invite!
author: Laura L.

description:
I came here for happy hour. Portions were small for the price and the server was not attentive. The ceviche was a little on the fishy side as well.

It's a beautiful place though and I would give this place a second chance, maybe for dinner.
author: Junia L.

description: Valentines day first time trying Peruvian food. Damn this shit is a party in your mouth. The food is here is freakin awesome!! Recommend empanadas!! Seafood  in here is delicious super flavorful. Definitely hits top five for their food. Vibe here is a little different ambience I would not consider fine dining but must come for bomb ass food!!
author: Pham L.

description: Amazing food and some good wine As well!  Generous portions.  Initially our waiter couldn't understand my wife had onion and garlic allergies and made the food sound it was going to taste like sh*t.  But it came out and it was amazing.  I have the cebiche and it was awesome.  Beef empanadas (super spicy per my request) blew my socks off.  So good.  Definitely check this place out.
author: Michael L.

description: We sat at the bar after a quick wait for available seats. The bartendes were attentive and made sure we at least had drinks. Cocktails were yummy, the pisco sour especially and a classic gimlet. We like Peruvian beer (it has a molasses flavor) so we were happy it was offered. For snacks, we got plantains, and two skewers (fish and chicken). Both delicious and the mixed chips and sauces on the side were a great compliment. The bar manager was super friendly and you could tell she loved her job. I can always appreciate that! Your attitude always reflects in what you offer! Though it is an indulgence to go to, this place is worth a visit.
author: Zara S.

description: The food was very good here but the cocktails were extremely weak.  I really don't like paying $12-$15 for watered down gin and simple syrup.
author: Michael S.

description:
BEWARE!!  This was my 3rd & last time EVER eating here!!  We came in on a 3 day weekend on a Saturday to enjoy some supposedly good appetizers, drinks & $150 later only to end up at home 4 hours later in horrible pain & sickness for 2 days!!  

My friend and I both ate the same items: classic cebiche, causa tasting, cheese empanadas & the lomo saltado and both ended up w/serious food poisoning.  

After our horrible experience I contacted the restaurant only to be put off to 3 different people via email, not even 1 phone call mind you and then to never hear from them again once they found out I paid cash & not a CC!!  Ridiculous!!!    

They have been completely unprofessional in handling our situation!!  They said they would send us a refund, but obviously because of their lack of knowledge on how to keep happy customers, and lack of professionalism they will lose our business and many others who have had bad experiences here recently too!!  

**I have also just heard that 2 other friends of mine who visited this past weekend who attended a private day event had the same horrible experience with the food.

EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!

Lastly... after reading the reviews and seeing this place has been known for these issues with poor food preparation, etc we all will also be contacting the health dept. to file complaints!!
author: R. R.

description:
I wanted to love our dinner, but I left with a "I'll probably never go back" feeling.  The decor and the front desk were fantastic.  Our server; however, was not.

I'll spare you all the list of complaints I could give.  In short, our server just didn't bring the level of experience and expertise that matched the price tag. 

The food was ok--not amazing by any stretch of the imagination.  

If you want a lovely and chic dinner out--this could fit the bill, but if you want to enjoy a fantastic dinner in The City, I'd find somewhere else.  If you're seeking good Peruvian, I think you'd be better off in a smaller Mom & Pop type of place.

Lovely location. Lovely decor.  Service lacking.
author: Lisa G.

description: Amazing food and ambiance! Went for a work dinner and we ordered an assortment of ceviche and empanadas. Everything including the drinks were out of this world!!! Nothing negative to say about the place which is quite rare. Will definitely come back with my boyfriend.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Pros:  Location, drinks
Cons: Overpriced, underwhelming food, service and management

Strike one:  Our party of six tried several cebiches based on the server's recommendation.  He pointed out that the specific difference between mexican ceviche and peruvian cebiche is that cebiche was not lounging around in lime, but it is freshly made to order.  It was clearly evident that wasn't the case when the cebiche arrived at our table. 

Strike two:  Busboys and their pretentious attitude.  I'm used to a little snootieness but the "are you DONE with that yet?" with a look and a head twist was a first for me.  Geez, you thought I stole the bartender from you at the Lookout or something...

Strike three:  Five of our six mains come out.  Three to four minutes later, our server comes by and says "oh it hasn't come out yet? let me go check."  Front of house manager walks by a few minutes later and looks at our table, says nothing, walks off.  Five minutes later the manager comes by and nonchalantly says "we made a mistake, we'll have that right out."  

By that time we were all basically done eating.  

Another five minutes, and the manager delivers the plate, saying "because we made the mistake it's on the house."  I appreciate that.  

The server comes by later to make us aware that it wasn't his fault - "the kitchen has been screwing me all night - they did the same thing to the table next to you."  As if his explanation/excuse (I call it blame shifting) makes me feel better about this place.  

All of this may be forgiven if the food was amazing.  But it's not.  It's just okay. 

Look - if you're on an expense account and you want to wow your customers with a nicely located venue and "exciting" cuisine then go for it.  But if you're here to eat, there's nothing you couldn't find at a half decent Peruvian restaurant.  Save your dollars and frustration for other things.
author: Eddy L.

description:
Dined there on 2/12/15. Excellent food and service. Mario was amazing!  

Items ordered

-Lomo Saltado: The steak was very tender. This is a safe choice but tastes great! 

-Picante Mariscos: A must try for seafood lovers. The sauce was excellent. 

-Rice: Came with our food. It has hominy in it.

-Pollo Antichuchos: The chicken was well seasoned, juicy and tender. Nothing unique. Might as well try other appetizers. 

-Plantain and sweet potato chips: Complimentary. Comes with two kinds of dip. The orange dip was tasty. 

-Dessert: Choco-maracuya. Try it. 

-Drinks: NV Brut Rose of Pinot Noir (sparkling wine that went well with the Picante Mariscos). Trumer Pils beer. Paired the Lomo Saltado with a cabernet.
author: F D.

description: If you like ceviche this is the place to come ,the ceviche was excellent and the service too
author: Paul n.

description: The food was really very good (we tried about 10 diff dishes and I liked every single one) BUT I wouldn't return cuz the service was severely lacking. From the moment we walked in all through dinner, dessert, and departure, I don't think we got a smile from any staff at any point. Host did not greet us upon arrival. When I said hi how are you? He said fine and did not ask me back how we were doing. I said we had reservations he said ok. After a short wait, we were seated. We received only one drink menu to peruse (party of 8). It took a minute for the waiter to get to our table and he did not prompt whether we wanted to just order drinks first or food as well. It was well past 8:30 so you know, our asses were gettin hangry. The restaurant was loud and the acoustics bad. Yet the waiter stood at the far end of the table to try to take my order. I had to ask him to come around cuz I wanted to ask a question about the menu and couldn't hear him for shit. They were out of about 5 different things we tried to order (both food and drink). Now why didn't U just say off the bat that certain menu items were out already when we first got the menu? I just spent 10 minutes deciding what I want and now I gotta decide on an alternate as you hover my shoulder? Shit is serious ok! Well he seemed indifferent answering question, also did not return to ask how things were going. So, yea, food is good but at this price point, I definitely expect better service. I mean, you got pork on the menu for $50! I'll pay that for a well handled cut of beef (hello house of prime rib) but sorry it ain't happening with pork. Glad to see at the end that gratuity had not been automatically added.
author: M S.

description: DO NOT go to this restaurant, unless you want to be treated poorly.  I went there for lunch last week, and the outside patio had just a few tables occupied.  I asked to be sat out there and the receptionist said they were setting it up for a private function.  It was still the lunch hour, and there were dozens of tables.  CLEARLY as I was a single woman, it was ok to be so rude to me.  They don't belong in San Francisco.
author: Kris W.

description:
Came here with a few friends for brunch, We ordered some of their specialty cocktails which were well made. I am a fan of Pisco Sours and they made a pretty decent one there. Menu is a bit overpriced for what it is, but you pay for location and it is situated on the embaradero. Cerviche was the most enjoyable. I would recommend passing on the pork belly, as it was just over-fried bacon (at least it was prepared that way when I was there.)
