Overall, the experience was fun, relaxing atmosphere and it is what you expect it to be. Water was very professional, upbeat and even cracked a few entertaining jokes.

The plantain and sweet potato chips/fries are great and so are the sauces
author: John H.

description: Holy Jesus, get the rice pudding at the end of your meal. Trust me,  you won't regret it.
author: Holly C.

description:
Had dinner here with family and the bf - didn't get a seat overlooking the water, but overall enjoyed the place!

Service was ok for a place at this price point, with slight mishaps in terms of water spillage and table clearing between courses.
Food was good but a bit overpriced.

The ceviche sampler was a fun intro to the variety they offered, fresh and tasty.  We decided to also share samplers of the empanadas and grilled skewers - very tasty and large portions.  We definitely didn't need entrees after all that!  Food was well seasoned although the sauce for the skewers seemed the same as the dip given with the fried plantains, so perhaps a little redundant.  

Highlights were the jalapeño ceviche, chicken empanadas, and the chicken skewers. 

None of the desserts really appealed to us.  Wine list was a bit overpriced!
author: Kim N.

description:
This is one of our favorite places in the city: great vibe, good food, and beautiful view...
Try to get a table at the deck overlooking the pier, and enjoy the music and the complementary chips and salsa. We especially love their arroz compoio and the nikai ceviche.
author: Shiri K.

description:
Nice dinner date spot prior to any kind of event down by the embarcardero. we went before the journey concert at the america's cup pavilion, had a few drinks, cebiche, and some pretty good entrees.

The cebiche was probably the most outstanding of the stuff we ordered, as the entrees were good, but not great. It's pricey, but when you put those fishies in your mouth, you'll forget it. I would be careful about what you order for entrees, as while our server was great, his suggestion about the beef tenderloin was disappointing. Probably safer going for the fishies.

The capitan cocktail wasn't bad.
author: Stephen H.

description: If you enjoy seafood with a twisted this is your place and great atmosphere...the paella was phenomenal and great empanadas
author: Javier C.

description:
First time eating here with my best friend and I was amazed at how delicious Peruvian food is. 
The cebiche sampler is a must! You will not be disappointed. 
I also ordered the picante dish with white bass. The fish was perfectly braised in the sauce and contrasted well with the crunchy vegetables. 
I would definitely come back for more. This restaurant is located right by the pier and you can easily take a stroll to go see the Bay Lights to walk off all the food.
author: Danh N.

description:
My friend from Costa Rica has been craving PERUVIAN for weeks now......we finally found this place......

This is a pretty big place on Pier 1 1/2, we found tons of street parking right across the street....easy 6 bucks....lol

We opted for outside sunny, with an awesome partial view of the Bay, couldn't ask for anything more beautiful for a lunch seating.......
The inside decor is simple and lovely, open kitchen, a very, big kitchen at that...........

They start you with a basket of fried chips including plaintains, comes with 3 dipping sauces on the side...........we enjoyed 2 out of 3, not bad....

We ordered the suggested empanadas pollo, good....11
Steak with veggies and fries....the sauce was great....28
Also ordered the seafood rice dish, kind of like a paella with much more spices......very good.......17

Pricing is kind of high, considering the rent they have to pay.....and the view......

Service was great.....

Next, we will try the other places recommended from yelpers.....mi lindo peru, limon and fresca....yes, those will be next....

I would definately recommend this place for bringing out of town guests or for celebrations of any kind........

This place should have gotten a 5*, but the one thing that threw me off was the shrimp, they weren't deveined, nasty........
author: Leslie Y.

description: I'm not the biggest fan of ceviche, but I do love South American food in general so we headed here for a co-worker's birthday.  The view of the bay was nice and our waiter was wonderful and very helpful.  The food was absolutely incredible!  I'd highly recommend asking your waiter for the favorites as it was clear that he knew what he was talking about.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Oh so good! i cant wait to be back. Cevice is their specialty and all the other dinner menu items, just superb. i want to go back as soon as i can! 
Beautiful atmosphere and professional service too. Kudos.
author: C A.

description:
La Mar Cebicheria Peruana. Hello can you hear me? Nope. This place has a really huge dining room and a lot of people in it. The noise from other people talking just makes things really noisy here.

== Food ==

The fried banana chips that comes free is simply amazing. There's two different type of banana chip in here and one kind potato chip.

Empanadas were good! There's different kinds of fillings. They were pretty much all delicious.

The causa sampler is definitely a must get dish here! It's four potato things each with its own unique flavor and sauce. 

== Service ==

Service was okay here. There's a lot of people in one large room and the waiters make their rounds so it can be a bit of a wait if you need something right away.

== Overall ==

Nice place to go to for food, but a terrible place to go to for a conversation.
author: Steven B.

description: Great date/happy hour place with small tapas, santa Maria cocktail was yummy, and decadent desert (I highly recommend the caramel ice cream cookie plate)  we were full but not overstuffed.
author: Alissa L.

description:
Ohh La Mar! 

I really enjoyed this sexy Peruvian reataraunt right on the water. First and foremost, make reservations! This place is very busy and you likely won't get a table without a significant wait. Instead of waiting we sat at the bar which I have no problem with because it was just as fabulous.

The taro, yam and potato chips are so good down to the very last. So I felt there was so much to choose from and I wanted it all so i settled on tasting a little of everything. The Cebiche tasting is wonderful and you get a nice selection, perfect for sharing. We also tried four different empanadas. I can't recall which but it doesn't matter because they were all great. Another must try is the causas. I only tried the causa limeña which is whipped potatoes topped with Dungeness crab, avocado puree and quill egg.

Last but not least the desert brought me to my knees. Alfajorzón. Here is the description from the menu: Homemade vanilla ice cream marbled with manjar blanco and alfajor cookie served in a tuile bowl. Just take a minute to imagine it. 

I really really enjoyed this restaurant. The food, the ambiance and the cocktails. It's the perfect place to cool off on warm SF evening.
author: Denise S.

description:
I absolutely loved this restaurant. I had made reservations for 3 about 3 days prior to going. My friends and I arrived about 15 minutes early. They were not ready to sit us yet, so they motioned us to the bar while we wait for them to set up our table. Since we are at a Peruvian restaurant, we all decide to get their Pesco Sours. DELICIOUS. 
 
Next, we move on to food. We all want to share our food so we order a bunch of small plates. We had the Ahi Ceviche and the Yellowtail Ceviche. All the flavors were on point. The mix between citrus and sweet was impeccable. Moveover, we tried the pork and chicken empandas. The dough on the outside flaked off perfectly to complement the perfectly since meat inside. Our last small dish was the carne skewer. The meat was grill perfectly. The juices locked in the tender flavor. It sat on top of a bed of veggies with a spicy sauce on the plate. Lastly, we order the rice milk ice cream prepared 3 different ways. A perfect way to end a delicious meal.

Overall, service, drinks, food and ambiance was great! I would definitely go back again and recommend friends to go here!
author: Katie H.

description: Met friends here for dinner last night and we had a great time. Mario L was a funny and entertaining waiter. And the mixto and specials were great. The pasta la Mar was my favorite
author: Kiyomi R.

description: My wife and I came here to finish the night. Bartenders look frustrated we came in on a Tuesday 30 minutes prior to closing. We had to ask for a drink menu and were met with otherwise cold customer service. Had it helped, I would have told them I was only in for one drink waiting for a cab but there wasn't hardly enough contact with the wait staff to even inform them. On the other hand, the pisco punch was spectacular once we finally go it which is the not thing saving this experience
author: Gerald H.

description: Went to lunch at la mar and had the worst restaurant experience of my life. The hostesses essentially ignored my entire party of five. They seemed extremely annoyed by the fact that we asked if we could sit outside on the patio. There were tons of seats outside, yet they insisted that we must sit inside where the music was blasting. Our waitress only recommended the most expensive items on the menu. The sandwiches were bland. The salads had the same flavor. Their cocktails were the only semi redeeming thing, but still I would never return. Rudest staff!
author: Hannah L.

description:
Are you looking for a hot restaurant with great atmosphere and ambiance? Well keep looking because this place isn't it. I was sincerely expecting a colorful ecclectic kind of restaurant. Thsi place is very contemporary. Clean white walls and black or gray accents. Just not the type of place I want to go for a dinner.

The food itself was good not great. I've definitely had better peruvian food. For my first course I ordered a ceviche with octopus, cancha, red onion, and either jalapeno or habanero. I expect with either of those peppers the dish would have some spice. This was totally not the case. In fact, I'm pretty confident they just left the pepper out all together. The dish had nice flavors, but just left me disappointed.

My second dish was the causa limeña. This was actually a very nice dish. The avocado puree and sauce complimented the crab so well. I was disappointed that the quail egg was cooked. Typically I have raw quail egg on sushi and it just gives it such a smooth texture. I was expecting the same thing with this dish. The potato causa was soft and full of flavor. I would highly recommend you try this.

My final course was the short ribs seco. The short ribs were cooked perfectly, they literally just fell apart at the touch of my fork. But the flavor was completely missing. They were supposed to have been braised with cilantro but I could not taste that at all. The rest of the dish was just average. It was a very filling and was very good for left over dinner.

The server was very nice but incredibly slow and not very attentive. He also tried to talk me out of ordering three courses. That just annoyed me. As a server you should be making recommendations not telling people they shouldn't order food. Overall, I would say if you're in the area you might enjoy this place. But there are plenty of better options for peruvian food.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
I had a great time at Happy Hour here with some co-workers.  I love the deep blue decor -- makes me feel like I'm on vacation.  We got a table on the patio, so had a gorgeous view of the Bay.  Our favorite tapas are:

causa limeña: Peruvian potato topped with Dungeness crab, avocado, quail egg, and cherry tomatoes
yucca fritas: yucca fries
sanguchito de atún: seared tuna slider with tomato, mixed greens, and passion fruit dressing
cebichin mixto: fish, calamari, habanero pepper, cilantro, and red onion
rollo fashion: Dungeness crab, cucumber, and avocado roll, topped with tuna and rice noodles with a sweet soy reduction

Everything went really well with my refreshing pisco sour.  My co-worker thought the pisco sour was so good that she put breastfeeding on hold for the day so she can drink!

1 star off: pricey -- each BITE of food came out to about $5
author: Ally W.

description:
Had dinner here last night with a group of friends.  Awesome location right on the water.  We all had an amazing time!  Everything from the food, drinks, service and ambiance was incredible.  Will definitely come back again and again!

Highly recommend the Arroz La Mar entree and chicken empanadas.  So much flavor!
author: Kimberly A.

description: The food is good, but very pricey for what you get. Part of what you are paying for is the nice waterfront view in a touristy location. Good seafood and ceviche. Portion sizes were quite small for the high price. Would I go back? If I'm paying myself, maybe. If someone else is paying, most definitely.
author: Erica C.

description: Yummy cebiche & sea bass choc mousse,  All the food looked really good here.  It was so good we wanted to go back the next day.  I was not going to think that I was going to be impressed but I was surprised.  The flavors of the food were amazing.  I was very happy after giving this place a try.
author: Mark H.

description: The Cebiche Mixto was excellent!...I also tried the Arroz Criollo thinking, as the menu says, with seafood; however, it only comes with calamari and a few tiny shimps. I rated this restaurant 4 stars because of the Cebiche.
author: Richard C.

description: Rating happy hour. It gets packed! And reason being, the amazing award winning pisco sours and Pear Margaritas! Some highlights were the lomo saltado, the ceviche shots, and did I mention the pisco sours? 4/5 judochops I will return since apparently I missed Jessica Simpson the night I was there bummer.
author: Dustin G.

description:
Upscale Peruvian food. It's pricier than other peruvian restaurant but the restaurant is very nice and clean and the food quality is much higher as well. 

It's located to the left of the of Ferry Building so it's in a very nice location. The view of the bay from the patio is very nice.

I had my Peruvian staple lomo saltado and I have never had chunks of beef as big as the ones I had here.
author: David N.

description:
My friend and I decided to treat ourselves à la Parks and Rec by dining at a nice restaurant. After some deliberation, we decided on La Mar. 

Unfortunately, we were seated at the front bar area instead of inside the restaurant. This was in large part our own fault because we didn't have a chance to make a reservation. We ordered a few appetizers to start us off. 

The ceviche was really bland and the little empanada looking things (?) were disappointing too. I expected a flavor filled bite but was left completely unsatisfied. 

We were hoping that their main courses would be better and made the mistake of ordering entrees, which were equally bland. I don't even remember what we ordered probably because I wanted to block the whole night out of my memory. The check came and I paid reluctantly.

Supposedly La Mar has very good happy hour specials that includes half off their drinks and appetizers. Considering their food's lack of flavor I think that's about how much it's worth (maybe even less). 

The service is also nothing to rave about.
author: Raha G.

description: One of the best meals I've ever had. The ceviches are excellent the pasta. The dessert EVERYTHING
author: Jess B.

description: Beautiful location if you can snag a table on the patio. Recommend the fresh cold items like the salads and ceviches.
author: Molly N.

description: Had a wonderful dinner at La Mar, starting with delicious cocktails (pisco sour and an excellent one made with pisco, ginger, and ginger beer). Loved the complimentary "chips" (yucca, regular potato and sweet potato served with creamy salsas). The four of us dined family style, ordering ceviche Classico and the causa nikei (both excellent!), followed by the most delicious, fluffy, creamy on inside crispy on outside fried yucca served with spicy creamy sauce; Lomo Saltado (delicious tender beef, crispy potato fries and rich tasty broth, onions and tomato); melt in your mouth short ribs served with creamy quinoa polenta and crispy kale; and an arroz dish with shrimp. With the exception of the shrimp dish, everything was incredibly good. We sat on the patio and had a beautiful view. Our waiter, James, and the other staff were friendly and took good care of us! Plenty of food for the four of us.
author: C Q.

description:
OK place but not the greatest.

Best pick were the ceviches - although one was on the fishy side and the Peruvian fried rice.

The cocktails really were less than impressive and very overpriced.
author: Claudia M.

description: Perfect way to start the Sunday stroll along the pier.  Light, airy and spacious with bright blue seats easily reflecting the sea.  My expectation of grilled octopus was charred tentacles with a dipping sauce....could not be any further from the truth!  WOW.  They looked like lobster claws and were equally as tender.  But the show stopper was the olive aioli....a bottle to go, please!  Sharing the octopus plus a fresh salad of greens, beets, tomatoes served on a lentil puree and cebiche and we were good until our 7:30PM dinner reservations
author: Carol C.

description:
HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT...................................... VERY SMALL PORTIONS
*************************************HUGE BILL! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !!

 A GF and I wandered into LA MAR one Thursday on our way to The Ferry Plaza Farmer's Market.  The restaurant is very hard edged industrial, softened by interesting lighting fixtures. We decided to go back one day.

ONE DAY was YESTERDAY - 28 SEPTEMBER 2012.

It was Sixish and crowded with a private party going on to the left of the entrance.  IT WAS SUPER NOISY due to the Very High Ceilings, the20-30 something crowd is so loud wherever they gather.  It seems scream is what young women are supposed to do....UGH.

We were seated at a long bar just after the entrance.  We were looking a Bobble Heads as the the cooks and platers couldn't be seen unless we stood up a bit.DUMB IDEA not to make the divider a bit lower.  We missed the action and would have really enjoyed watching the action and the well plated food.

We were seated immediately.  The server was nice and brought us the delicious Terra Firma Chips....plaintains, sweet potatoes and yucca,,,,,,  truly addictive.  But, they seemed to forget to replace the salsas which were pureed ??. We would have truly enjoyed more salsas, weasked and it was delivered.

Service uneven but done by pleasant Latino homres.

THE FOOD::::::::::::

We tried an the Cebiche Sampler, 4 cebiches on a grand 4 section plate.  But, thst was it as the portions were so small.  The waiter told us that it was great TO SHARE....NOT TRUE. MyGF had to CUT the Lone Prawn in half!  The best tasting was the "Chifa" (means Chinese in Peru) but so tiny..... it was made with sesame oil, peanuts, blah, blah, blah.  There was one that was some sort of mushy white fish and I, THINK, Squid rings.  If I weren't with a friend, I would have stabbed her hand while she cut the LONE PRAWN......  No memorable at all.

My friend ordered the white fish entree with lima beans and a SUNNY SIDE UP FRIED EGG. Why on earth is a Fried Egg on a piece of fish???  I didn't know it was breaded and I prefer not to eat breaded fish..  The crust was beautifully golden but it was so thick that it was mushy and I didn't each much of it as PREFER NOT TO EAT breading.   I really do not like MUSHY
BREADING. Basically, I ate a dish I DIDN'T CHOSE, DIDN'T LIKE and PAID FOR.IT!!!! MY GF Took it home and she got a free meal.

NOTHING WAS ESPECIALLY BEAUTIFULLY PLATE.

I drank a PISCO SOUR and a PISCO PUNCH,  The sour was so small it made me sour for $12.00.  The punch was much bigger and much better.  We both ENJOYED......... THE FREE CHIPS and Forgotten Salsas

WE EXPECTED SO MUCH MORE!

After dinner we both agreed that we would NOT GO BACK.  We can eat better
ceviche in the Mission!


                     ##########TACKY, TACKY, TACKY##########

I NEEDED TO GO TO THE LADIES ROOM......... 
IT IS ... IN THE RECEPTION AREA, RIGHT ACROSS FROM THE RECEPTION DESK....YUCK

PLUS IT IS .......  UNISEX     INDUSTRIAL.... WITH A WHITE DOOR with THE UBIQUITOUS BLUE TRIANGLE with the Male-Female SIGN.  
WHAT WERE THEY THINKING??????  Plus it is so sterile and, what woman wants to look AT A URINAL EVER!!!!?????  

ESPECIALLY in A SUPPOSEDLY HIP and GREAT PLACE.. URINALS...UGH!
author: ELINOR H.

description: great day to sit outside in the back by the water.  Enjoy the ocean breath, have a few glass of drinks, and appetizers to share.  Who serve sweet potato chips and free refill-definitely better than bread.
author: Savvy C.

description:
For the price and quality, this place was okay. My mother ordered the special, an Amazonian fish, and it came very salty (soy sauce and oyster sauce combo) ... she had it sent back but came back the same exact way; ended up getting something else but it said a little about the service here -- they were accommodating yes but did not hear our concern about the saltiness of the dish. I had the seafood fried rice, which was like a jambalaya. We all felt really thirsty after the meal as if there was MSG?

Appetizers are what these pictures show; small but tasty. If you're willing to drop $30 for the taster, by all means, but in my humble opinion, it could be spent better for more food elsewhere at a restaurant with the same vibe and atmosphere next to the Bay.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Restaurants should not have a happy hour if they are going to treat their HH patrons like second class citizens. My experience here a few weeks ago was sorely lacking. The prices seemed reasonable, until we got the dishes! This was because the portions are insanely small. The drinks are good and stiff, however. The waitress and manager were rude from the minute we walked in the door up until we paid. They added a 20% mandatory gratuity even though we were just three, and they also calculated the tip on top of the tax and sf health fee! That adds up to a 30% plus tip! 



Shady, shady. 


There are much better Peruvian restaurants in the Mission, and they are much cheaper also.
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
The La Mar Cebicheria Peruana's ceviche is listed on 7x7's 200 things to eat in SF list. During the day its a cool space for relaxing and at night its a hot spot on the waterfront. 

Stopped in at 2:25 on a Friday. They still served us Ceviche, even though kitchen breaks at 2:30. They offered seven ceviches, all fairly unique. You can order half of full portions. Offerings included a California seafood mix to a haibut with purple yam. We ordered yellowtail ceviche and the fish quality was superb. Ceviche was served with peanuts, cilantro, carrot matchsticks, fried sesame noodles, and slivers of green onion.
author: Mairead R.

description:
Review for Happy Hour.  In comparison to Pasion in the Inner Sunset, La Mar falls short on drinks and value.  Yes, the food is slightly yummier and catering to the more refined palate of the after work business crowd but for double or triple the price.  Everything, including the drinks are 50% smaller than Pasion.  Bar bites are exactly what they say they are -- a bite or maybe two.  Not for sharing among friends.  We had:

food - 4 stars for taste, 2 stars for value (esp the cebichin & empanada)
cebichin classico
chicharron (5 stars but a bite)
empanada del dia (chicken)
yucca fritas
house made chips with salsas de ajies

drinks - 3 stars
pisco sour
prickly pear margarita
passion daiquiri
caipirinha (why is this not being made with simple syrup or cane syrup like they do in south america?)
sangria
raspberry gimlet

we left slightly buzzed, underwhelmed & hungry.  Even though I've moved from the Sunset to Russian Hill, I would drive to Pasion over walking to La Mar.
author: Catherine A.

description:
Lar Mar, La Mar, tu eres mi amor! From cebiches to causas and anticuchos to empanadas, you did not disappoint! 

Im serious. Try the cebiches and the causas. 

I was reborn that night.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I've had Peruvian food before but not Peruvian ceviche.
I was excited when my girlfriends and I decided to celebrate a bday here.  (I've been wanting to try this place a year).

I really loved the colors and the decor that they have.
The blue and green combination was definitely pleasing to see.

For dinner we ordered:
Causa tasting
Ceviche samplers
Chicken empanada and
Beef antichuchos

Causa: I've never had before. the looked good but I couldn't taste the difference between the samplers.
Ceviches: they're too sour for my liking.  I personally like to be able to tase my fish/seafood not be overwhelmed with the lemon/lime and onions.
Chicken empanada and beef anticuchos were really good.
We also had the beignets for dessert and they were awesome.

I'm not sure if I'm just expecting a lot of a restaurant like, that supposedly has a few restaurants outside the US. I was definitely disappointed with their food.
author: Learnee L.

description:
My boss is Peruvian and he took us to dinner here after a day long meeting. 

I have to say, up until last Monday, I haven't had a meal that knocked my socks off  since my honeymoon in Hawaii back in September. This place is fantastic!  I was the last to arrive at the restaurant of our team of 6 and met up with them at the bar area.  My boss ordered a Pisco Sour for me which arrived a minute after I got there.  Yum! I had two of those that night. 

I LOVED the cones of assorted fried potatoes and bananas or whatever was in that heavenly basket of goodies, served with 3 dipping sauces. My favorite was the spiciest sauce, which wasn't very spicy to me. 

Tried a couple appetizers: 
Cebiche Classico- OOOH. I would go back just to order that again.  So refreshing and yumalicious
Causa Limena - interesting group of flavors (to me) but it worked well and it was delish!
Empandadas del mar - very yummy! wish there were more to share.

As for the entree - I came in thinking I would order something seafood, but ended up ordering the Lomo Sortado since my boss suggested it. OOOOH. It was fantastic. The flavors were so good.  I was raving about it when I got home. 

All of us cleaned off our plates, even one picky eater (a Texan who usually has a conservative palette). She even LOVED her meal. 

I'll have to take my husband here. I must go back! I'd like to come back on a beautiful San Francisco day and eat outdoors on their patio area.
author: Dawn D.

description: I went here last night for dinner and couldn't have had a better experience. The food was amazing. The service was top notch and the atmosphere was beautiful. I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Lisa S.

description:
Sigh, I really wanted to love this place. The interior and the location are simply divine - the experience unfortunately wasn't. 
It started off with a fairly rude hostess - hey everybody has a bad day, so let's not deep dive into that. 
After we were seated at the bar, the service was really slow even though it was only 5pm and the dinner rush hadn't begun just yet. Anyways, the food was just so so for me. Overall the dishes were very heavy and I say stick with the Ceviche. 
I'll be back and give it another try - everybody deserves the benefit of the doubt.
author: Sonja S.

description:
This is a fun place and very reasonably priced in a cool area! Thats as good as it gets!

The great thing about this place is that their menu has so much variety on it without being muddled or pretentious. I had this sampler type entree (forgot the name) but it was excellent. And it was something like $12!

The only caveat ill put in here is that its probably a bit more enjoyable as a lunch place than for dinner, but it depends on your personal preferences. Its now one of my favorites in the city!
author: Ash S.

description:
I usually wait a few days after I've visited a restaurant to absorb the experience before I fully make up my mind about it, but in this case I just have to write my review while it's all still fresh on my mind. Yes, needless to say, I am not very pleased. 

I made reservations on Open Table a few days prior for Monday at 9pm. I was planning on calling to relay the fact that I chose La Mar for a special occasion birthday dinner. I called and spoke to a very polite young woman. I told her that it would be my first time visitng the restaurant and asked if she recommended a table inside or the patio. She recommened the patio and told me that she would note down it was my boyfriend's birthday. I specifically told her I suck at being sneaky and have failed horribly in the past with the whole Slyly-Let-Your-Server-Know-There's-A-Birthday situation, which is why I was calling in advance. She laughed and assured me again that she would make to make note of it. 

We get to La Mar for our reservation, and had to wait about 15 minutes for our table to be set up, which I didn't mind too much because we weren't in any rush. We're finally seated, not outside but inside. I kindly tell the host that I had called early and requested patio seating. So we wait about 5-ish more minutes for them to accomodate us to a table outside. 

Okay at this point I'm slightly annoyed, but I was in a great mood feeling extra fabulous and extra sexy in my brand new LBD from Zara. So okay, I can let things slide... I like to think of myself as an accomodating person. 

We get to our table and frankly, I'm not impressed. The patio was loud and we were placed at an odd corner. At this point I'm sadly glancing inside with puppy eyes super disappointed because I was thinking that a table inside would have been much better (pero ya que!) I can't help but be a little upset at the lady who took my call earlier who RECOMMENDED the patio. Strike 1. 

So i'm trying the make the best of the situation, and of course, I'm still feeling and looking fab in my LBD... so it's a little easier to let things go... 

For drinks we start with 2 Pisco Punches (delish!) and we decide on and order the Empanada sampler as an appetizer. Our server comes back after a while of us enjoying our drinks and kindly lets us know that the kitchen is a bit backed up. So we place our dinner order. So we're enjoying our drinks when the ceviche we order comes out, FOLLOWED by the complimentary plaintain chips (which obviously should have been the first thing to come out, followed by our still missing appetizer). Strike 2.

At this point I'm peeved, trying to hide how annoyed I was at the situation. 

So Strike 3, while the Boo slipped to the bathroom I figured I should double check with our server to make sure he knew about the birthday. Of course, he said he was not told and didn't know. Seriously??? I know it's not his fault the message wasn't passed down, but I was so disappointed. 

But wait, what about the food you ask? Not like it even matters to me at this point since I'm highly unlikely to return. But, the empanadas are worth it to try and the Ceviche Clasico wasn't as tasty as the ceviche I had at Limon. The Lomo Saltado, however, I have to admit is hands down the best Lomo Saltado I've tried (definitely a must order). 

Anyways, moral of the story.. trying to plan the perfect birthday dinner is H-A-R-D. Quality restaurants should make the extra effort to have it go smooth, especially if you tell them (in advance!!!) that it's a special occasion.
author: Kay M.

description:
Dinner with the boyfriend? Always fun.
Dinner with the boyfriend and his parents? Eeeek.
An eeeek on top of that? Having to suggest a place for dinner.

Boy am I glad I chose the right place! 

To drink: 
SCARLET: pisco quebranta, champagne, cranberry juice, raspberry purée, sugar cane, lemon juice. 
++Pretty tasty, but the best:

PISCO PUNCH: pisco quebranta, lemon juice and pineapple syrup. 
++The clear winner here. VERY good.

To eat:
CAUSA LIMENA: crab on top of a yellow potato causa with avocado purée, quail egg, cherry tomatoes, ají amarillo Huancaína sauce, and basil cilantro oil. 
++I like to equate this dish to a Peruvian egg salad, a fancy one, even though there was only a tiny piece of a quail egg.

CEBICHE CLASICO: California Halibut in a classic leche de tigre with red onion,
habanero, Peruvian corn, and yam. 
++I had this as my meal, and though it definitely didn't fill me up, it was delicious enough for me to be happy about.

CHORILLANA: Alaskan Halibut with red onions, tomato, cilantro, and mashed
yucca in an ají panca and tamarind sauce. 
++There was nothing yucca about this dish. Though tiny, it was delicious.

PROS:
Tasty, tasty food.
Beautiful view/space.
Great drinks.
Good service.

CONS:
The dishes aren't very hearty.
It's kinda pricey.
author: Adena B.

description: This place is all surprises on the menu. The meal starts with the amazing plantain chips and dips. Great selections of cocktails and entree items.
author: Sid B.

description: I really like the color choices of the interior design. I like the color of the menu and chairs too. The appetizers, I think called "caus" or something was good. My favorite part of the meal was the appetizers. Potato at the bottom and fish and beets at the top of that dish. YUMS! I also like the veggie/fruit chips they serve in the beginning of when we get seated, too. Had scallops, steak and beef which was very tender and good. The fries with the beef was good too. The scallop dish didn't have much flavor but it was alright. Was an experience, maybe I'll be back one day. The service was also good because the servers were attentive and refilled our waters ASAP.
author: Amanda C.

description: A must try at the Piers! What a delightful menu. We have eaten here a few times and it is always an adventure. The Peruvian menu is true to form and offers some delightful combinations- all artful as delicious. The drinks are also unique. The service is often a little off- strange waiters a few times and slow sometimes, but they get it done.
author: Kym F.

description:
Could not decide between 3 and 4 stars. We went for happy hour and stayed for dinner. The ceviche and the drinks were fantastic. Fish and shellfish unbelievably fresh and tasty. The main dishes all seemed a little too salty to me and I like salt.
They are quite booked up for reservations and the hostess was very pleasant in accommodating an unexpected table of 7 early in the evening on a Saturday. We were seated in the enclosed outdoor area in back and had a view of the bay. Our server was unpleasant in a strange way, gave some shrugs and eye-rolling when asked questions about a cuisine that she knows is unfamiliar to quite a few of the people who visit.
author: Kathy R.

description: Daily HH from 3-6pm, $6 drinks - pisco sour , pear margarita among others. Food between $4-$6 during HH.  Bartenders are great and very friendly.
author: Magda G.

description: One of the best lunches I have ever had. Service was great and efficient but the food was impeccable. Best food I've had in San Fran yet! Highly recommend the Pulpo and Limena.
author: Kelly K.

description: Great Verity gourmet Ceviche, and drink menu.
author: Robyn P.

description:
Walked by and drove by La Mar many times and never did I come in but the other day after we got our marriage license without planning, we finally got to try it.  Upon walking in, it has a feel that you're in Havana or Miami where you're enjoying seafood by the beach kind of setting.  It definitely has a great vibe; the big windows that look out to the bay and the blue color decor makes it feel very summery, beachy, coastal restaurant.  Of course it also helped that I came on a 70 degree sunny day.

We all ordered the Challenger which offers three courses.  The appetizers mainly are a ceviche and a diced squid with what seemed to be potato.  That was excellent, I definitely wouldn't mind having more.  The entree was average mainly because they told me it wasn't very spicy but my mom and I both couldn't handle the bite it had to it.  Dessert which was a sorbet was a good way to cool down.  I enjoyed the chips they give you to share which seem to be sweet potato and banana chips served with a sauce which was excellent.

All in all, I would come back and eat here again.
author: Pierre L.

description: Came to La Mar to meet up some friends for lunch. I love the complimentary plantains and chips with 3 sauces, sooo good! Ordered the cebiche tasting, causa sampler, arroz criollo (essentially paella). Food was good, but nothing I'd want to come back for on my next SF visit since there were some other places that just blew me away. Service was good, very attentive.
author: Corinna W.

description:
La Mar...  I like to come here with my coworkers and we find it quite tasty.  Each time, we have tried ordering a variety of different ways.  We have done shared appetizers, followed by an individual entree each.  We walked out of there very full and satisfied with the meal although we all ate too much.

The last time we went we decided to order two plates of the ceviche, two plates of the empanadas, two quinoa salads, and two entrees.  We split everything among the six of us and were very satisfied with the meal and found it just enough for everyone.  We also had a nice selection of cocktails and wine.

The servers are genuine, they explain what they are putting in front of you, and they do not rush you.  We had a baby in our group, and they were all very accomodating and sweet to her. 

Highly recommend that you ask for a table outside if you are coming with a large group.  The view is beautiful, the heat lamps are a nice touch.  

This place remains high on my list of great places for team events.  Nice job to the cooks, and the servers here!!
author: Ana W.

description:
Great ceviche. Got the sample cebiche la mar - it was excellent. 

Also the mixed skewer combo plate was on point.
author: Ahmad I.

description: This review is for the bar , the services sucks , three bartenders and nobody came to ask us if we need a drink , I would not recommend this place.
author: M Z.

description:
Enjoyed this restaurant immensely!

Right by the water, the restaurant is nice and spacious.  Very open which is a bonus for any SF restaurant.

Came here to celebrate with some girlfriends.  Food and drinks are all good!  Will definitely be back next time I'm in town.
author: Kay R.

description:
La Mar is one of those rare restaurants that combines a particular culinary niche--ceviche, in this case--with some superb artistry to produce some truly excellent food.  Add to that their inventive drinks and swanky surroundings, and you've got all the makings of a great restaurant...even if it *does* come with the inflated prices of Fisherman's Wharf.

But is La Mar's food truly Peruvian?  Only if your idea of Peruvian is an upscale fusion spot in Miraflores.  But who cares?  La Mar has delicious fish, a beautiful patio and San Francisco's famed brunch weather on its side.  Lima, the land of a "thousand hot hazy days" just can't compete.

So for outstanding food and drinks, great service, sophisticated atmosphere, and a superb dining experience...5 stars!
author: Kvatch K.

description: Food was great and portions were decent for the price...service was a bit slow, but not my first time here, so I know it might be a matter of timing.
author: Betty A.

description: Good service from start to finish, from host to wait staff to busboys.  Terrific.  Had the steak with grilled veggies, pal had the pork fried rice.  It was quite good.  Recommend.
author: Dan B.

description: The food is excellent and the view is great on a nice day. Unfortunately, the service is terrible. It took forever for the hostess to appear and acknowledge we existed before we put our names down. Also, the table service was rushed and inattentive.
author: Lance C.

description:
Great for Happy Hour.  Good drinks.  Gets a little crowded but that's because it's happening.  Try to grab a bar stool or else you'll be standing around and not giving those who are sitting personal space....as you probably know, We didn't get personal space.  Hey, it's a bar!!  

Good stuff..
author: Michael T.

description:
This place is aaaamazing. First time having "Peruvian" ceviche and I think it's my favorite.

My boyfriend and I are still talking about the empanada we had here, it's was full of tender, juicy steak. The pastry was so good, crispy and browned. But the sauce it was served with was the best part. In stead of your traditional chimichuri, it came with a mustard sauce that had indescribable flavor.

This is it people. This is where you want to go.
author: Natalie K.

description: This had to be one of the best meals I ever had - for sure my favorite since I've been here visiting from NYC.  Came here with 6 other work colleagues, including the client and his wife and we ordered appetizers and entrees to share between the entire group.  I had things I'd probably not have picked on my own, but everything was absolutely delicious. Amazing.  Incredible.  Can't say enough good things.  The service was amazing.  Drinks were great.  Not always easy to get a reservation, but even though we were 15 minutes late, they accommodated us.  I can't WAIT to go again.  Heaven!  My only critique was that I wish they were open later and I wish they had a dance floor cause the music made me want to dance!
author: Cindi M.

description:
We had a ceviche sampler and and empanada sampler.  Both were fantastic.  I've dined here before and the food and drinks are great.  
Avoid going at 9pm, even on a weekend, which is when they have their last seating.  We were seated outside along with a number of other groups, and the staff turned off the outside gas lamp heaters towards the end of our meal and we hadn't yet finished our food.  We asked our waiter to turn our heater back on but he would not, so we left since it was quite cold.
author: Rahul S.

description: too overprice for the food that doesn't even tasted like peruvian food! i went there once and I'm not coming there ever again and i always try to advice people not to go there because the food is too expensive for the portion of food the give you. DONT COME TO LA MAR!!!
author: Eliaz M.

description: In many ways, the work of a critic is easy. We risk very little, yet enjoy a position over those who offer up their work and their selves to our judgment. We thrive on negative criticism, which is fun to write and to read. But the bitter truth we critics must face, is that in the grand scheme of things, the average piece of junk is probably more meaningful than our criticism designating it so. But there are times when a critic truly risks something, and that is in the discovery and defense of the *new*. The world is often unkind to new talent, new creations. The new needs friends. Tonight, I experienced something new: an extraordinary meal from a singularly unexpected source. To say that both the meal and its maker have challenged my preconceptions about fine cooking is a gross understatement. They have rocked me to my core. It is difficult to imagine more humble origins than those @ La Mar's, who is, in this critic's opinion, nothing less than the finest chef in the United States! I will be returning to La Mar's  soon, hungry for more.
author: Juan R.

description: The best Peruvian food I've had. Like the decor as well. Great refreshing ceviches and almost everything I've tried had been good or great. It is definitely quite pricy to eat a sumptuous meal though.
author: S M.

description:
Been here a few times. 
Always fantastic!! 
Lomo Saltado is the best I've ever had. The Ceviches are amazing and all the Causas are great!
author: Matt B.

description: Looking for some good Peruvian dishes? Then u'll like this place.  A bit pricey but u get what u paid for.
author: Marjorie U.

description:
I love this place, everytime my Mom comes to visit me we make a stop at this place. It has a very nice terrace by the bay, great atmosphere, we could sit there for hourse.
The service is really good, every waiter is very attentive and provides very good service.
The food is really good as well, they have geat ceviches and empanadas. Also, theyy have an octopus with chimichurri which is really really good. 

I personally love this restaurant!
author: Lucia C.

description: Had a great meal, the Cebicheria California, chicken empanadas were both delicious and well seasoned. Good wine selection, although the per glass prices are high. Also had the mahi mahi kabobs. Fish cooked perfectly, moist and tender. We will come back!
author: Keith M.

description:
This place has one of the best happy hours I have ever experienced. $6 hand crafted cocktails that are superb! And very well-priced food items. 
I strongly suggest the fried rice and a civeche. Amazing food!
author: Cesie A.

description: Drinks were delicious and the yummy food! Just bit expensive for a casual restaurant like this one! No fancy decors but I guess because it's the location!
author: Mido E.

description: Highest recommendations for La Mar while traveling through Lima, so sad that I had missed the Peruvian experience but absolutely impressed and taken back upon entering the SF version! Seafood and ceviche as delicious and tasty as anything I experienced in Miraflores! Lovin that pisco sour!
author: Miss H.

description: We started with speciality drinks, especially enjoyed the prickly pear margarita!  Then onto the cerviche sampler, delicious, fresh and unique and then onto to the empanada sampler. All outstanding.
author: Dottie R.

description: Great food and atmosphere, but over priced for what you get. Though not by a huge margin, I would still recommend the restaurant! Wait staff was friendly, though a little lost and out there at times. Usually when you needed them they were literally lost out there somewhere...
author: Gary W.

description: One of my favorite places in SF. Fresh. Inventive. Consistently good. No better pisco sour anywhere. Ceviches (for some reason in Peru they are put a B where the V is) are all delicious. Just go.
author: Patty M.

description:
I've heard about this restaurant from my Peruvian friends.  And I was so excited when they chose to have dinner here.

I like the place, very positive vibe.  Good lighting, very good ambiance. 

We didn't have a reservation and we were told there will be a 2 hour wait to get a table if we didn't want to be at the bar.  For that we opted to sit at the bar.  We didn't want to bother waiting.

While we look over the menu, they served us potato, banana and yam chips with 3 types of dipping sauces that goes from mild, medium and spicy. - - - Very Good!

I got the Inca soda.  It tasted like bumble gum but I had to have it, it added to the whole Peru theme :) 

Me and my friend shared:
1. Causa Tasting for our appetizer.  It was a platter of mashed potato or yam with different toppings, 2 were of fish and 2 were of vegetables, with four different sauces. - - - Very Good!

2.  Arroz  Parihuela for our main dish.  This is like paella.  It was rice, mussels, octopus and shrimp.  This was really very tasty and spicy I can't stop digging in.  I wanted to close my eyes and savor the moment.  That's how delectable it was. - - - Very Good!

3.  Crepe de chocolate and picarones for dessert.  The crepe was on a bed of orange sauce with ice cream on the side.  Wrapped inside was chocolate mousse.  Picarones was fritters that came with a honey sauce spiced with cinnamon or mint maybe?  It was a perfect way to end our meal.  Just divine. - - - Very Good!

I liked how everything was very tasteful with the right amount of spiciness.  Our food was well portioned.  Although me and my friend shared, we were satisfied and did not feel like we didn't have enough.  

Our server was awesome too, just awesome.  Of course I forgot to ask his name, but the Mexican guy deserves a BIG shout out.  Thanks for making our dining experience very pleasurable.  

(Oh, that blonde girl who sits people gave my friend a look I didn't like when we entered the door.  I didn't appreciate that but I let it go.  Also, she wasn't that friendly when she was explaining our table situation.  Nevertheless, I'm not letting her take away the five stars).  

Be ready to pay a lot.  This is expensive.  Our bill came up to $80 plus tip.  That's $40 per person.  But but but believe me when I say you will leave very happy and contented.
author: Pam S.

description:
The food was great.  The Ceviches, pescado- anticucho, arroz norteno, empanadas, causa tasting were flawless but also expensive. 

 The service was terrible. The waiters took forever and didn't even tell us that the kitchen was about to close. The waitress was rude and condescending with a disrespectful attitude. 
They definitely need to train their staff how to deal with people, customer service and mostly efficiency.
To top it all of, the manager could care less about our complaints.
author: Nikita B.

description:
Went here for happy hour and they have a really good one.  The cocktails are only $6 during happy hour and are very well-made.  I enjoyed both the pisco sour and the pisco punch, but out of the two I preferred the pisco sour.  The cucumber gimlet my hubby had was also one of my favorites, it was just so refreshing.

We had both the cebichin mixto (mix of different seafood) and the cebichin clasico (fish only)...both were great but I liked the all-fish version better.  The portions were a little small, but it was enough for us since we didn't want to fill up too much before dinner.  The chicharron de pollo had a much larger serving and was a good contrast to the cold fish.

I would go back here again for happy hour.
author: Arlene M.

description: Ok food but was pretty expensive for such soso quality.  Nice location by ocean and friendly staffs.  However it is overrated in my view.
author: Danny K.

description:
This place is amazing, and hands down one of my favorite restaurants in the city, or ANYWHERE for that matter!

I used to work here, so I might be a tad bit biased. However, I've worked at a ton of restaurants before, and this will be my first 5 star =) Read on..

This place is absolutely gorgeous, from the bar, to the dining room, all the way to the back patio. The view is incredible by the patio on a sunny day, or you can people watch by the bar in front as well. 

Service is excellent and tentative. Everyone is very knowledgeable about their dishes, and their wines :)

Lastly, the FOOD is obviously the best part! I can go on about the many dishes I've tried, but I think I'll stick with my all time favorites. 

- Cebiches are all amazing, but my favorite will go to the cebiche clasico. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water right now.

- Causa limena is absolutely amazing, and although we order this as one of our appetizers every time, I would gladly eat all 3 pieces BY MYSELF =D

Those 2 are my MUST-HAVES at La Mar, but the arroz norteno, pescado nikei, and lomo saltado are also extremely delicious. 

And I must not forget about dessert! The picarones are probably high on the list of heart-attack creators, but you will die a happy person. They are THE BOMB!

They have specials every week, so definitely inquire about those. And for 1st or 2nd timers, I'd definitely recommend ordering and sharing a BUNCH of small plates and ordering a couple of entrees for the full experience. The entrees are great, but the small plates are where it's at!

Trust me, it's worth the pennies in your pocket. Alright.. maybe a little more than pennies.. but you know what I mean.
author: Elaine H.

description: cuzceana and crystal beers to remind you of south american excursions while you eat some of the best cebiche you could ever hope to taste.  Everything on the menu was fantastic from the cebiche to the empenadas to the arroz.  If I hadn't been spoiled by the prices at the Lima location, this would easily be a 5 star review!
author: Cody P.

description:
bonjour mon ami, I'm sorry I've been slacking (laziness) 

It was a cold overcast night, and the streets of San Francisco were wet from a small drizzle that had fallen hours before. The restaurant seemed so big with many sections and at first glance I thought it was empty. 

We didn't have a reservation so we were at the mercy of the hostess. We were told the only available seating would be on the patio but were assured the heating lamps made the patio warm and toasty. We were escorted to the patio, a number of tables were filled so it was nice to not be the only outcasts :) 

As we were seated I quickly discovered that there was no middle ground for the cold or heat. If you sat directly under the heat lamp it was too hot and if you weren't it was too cold, so I spent most of the night heating up and then cooling off. 

You've probably read about the fried plantain and other chips with the dipping sauces they serve; and for good reason, they are delish! I have a thing for empanada so I just had to order the empanadas de lomo saltado (skirt steak). My date ordered the cebiche carretillero as well as a glass of Argentina Malbec wine that she thought was good but overpriced. We also ordered causa casera (vegetarian). BTW causa causa are whipped potatoes that look like mini cupcakes. 

I enjoyed my empanada dish. To me it's a dish that I like to call "the perfection of average" so simple in preparation and ingredients that if you can't make this good, what can you make good. My date didn't really enjoy her dish. After tasting it, I didn't like the citrus of the lemon combined with leche de tigre. 

The causa causa looked like potato salad and had the consistency of potato salad but there were so many different tastes that my taste buds were confused after trying to process and make sense of how the different tastes were supposed to play off of each other. My date was my dessert so we didn't order any from the restaurant ;-)

There were some aspects of the restaurant that I really enjoyed and some that didn't move me. The server didn't reveal his name, but he was very nice and attentive. 

The presentation of the food, I think was "fluff" I know they have to make it pretty but when I think of down home Peruvian food being prepared by a Mom or Grandmother, does it look the way it was served to me? 

Great energy, good lighting and ambiance. Overall, not the best but not bad.
author: ARSON P.

description:
This review is mostly for our waitress. Despite being visibly pregnant, she did an absolutely excellent job of taking care of our party of 12. Super attentive and just incredibly sweet and receptive to drink orders. You know birthday parties can be a little demanding. I'd give five stars just for her if I could. 

There were only two things I didn't really like about this restaurant:
1. For large parties, the host is required to set a menu in advance. Though it was great to taste a large variety of what the restaurant offers, it also would have been great to have a little more choice, particularly because my boyfriend and I don't eat a ton of fish. That being said, the food was very good. 
2. The prices. Because we never saw a menu, we figured that dinner would be decently expensive but nothing over the top for a restaurant of that caliber. We were estimating the bill would come out to $60-75 per person, but it was more like $115. Given that the party was on a Sunday night and therefore nobody was really drinking heavily, we were needless to say a little surprised. 

For more specifically on our experience, you can also check Alice P.'s review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/la-mar-cebicheria-peruana-san-francisco#hrid:gdPwCaBoUjIVjbl7kvi2kQ
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Once you get past the mean host you can enjoy a great view at your table. Just ignore the host table. Why not they ignore you. 

The food was good. I would probably come back again.
author: Steve S.

description: Very nice atmosphere! Big space with high ceilings, beautiful white walls and large windows. We went during lunch time. The outside area was full so we stayed inside. We were given yucca frita with dip as a we sat. I had the Inca drink and my daughter the inca Cola. We had the empanada sampler as an appetizer, Anticuchos made of fish and octopus. Everything was delicious! Especially the Inca drink (I had two)
author: Eira R.

description:
Two words: pisco sour.  

Get it for $5 on weekdays between 4 and 6 pm.
author: Kristen S.

description:
I love the food here but wow, definitely bring your wallet :)

Happy Hour has some great deals but you'll still drop a good $25 or $30 pretty easily on some tasty appetizers, mini-cebiche plate and a couple of excellent cocktails.

Dinner was stellar here, the quality is excellent and the vibe at dinner is better than happy hour (it was way too busy at happy hour when we went, not enough servers and not enough space for the amount of people that wanted to be there), but dinner time is when it shines. The service at dinner was great, and the food was awesome. Fantastic flavours and quality, and definitely in the fine dining realm - the food is great but the portions are not super huge, so be ready to be satisfied but not stuffed.
author: Mike J.

description:
I'm not sure I'll be satisfied with run of the mill ceviche after having the "cebiche" sampler here.  I'm ruined!   If you like ceviche you might not want to eat here because you'll never be satisified with regular old ceviche EVER again. ;)

La Mar is a little spendy for the portions but the flavors make up for any lack of food.  The plaintain chips with dipping sauce are a nice way to start your meal!  Don't forget to wet your appetite with a pisco sour!  DELICIOUS!  For my main dish I chose the Corazon "skewered beef hearts", they were grilled perfectly.  I traded a couple heart pieces for some grilled yellow tail that one of my friends had ordered.  The yellow tail was also very good!  La Mar serves melt in your mouth good food for sure!  I'm looking forward to returning on a sunny day to enjoy La Mar's great patio.
author: Kari S.

description: My first exposure to Peruvian cuisine was fantastic. The catch of the day skewers were delicious and our waiter did a great job of explaining the menu. Overall great experience
author: Nate F.

description:
Literally just got back from lunch here and am wasted. Yup! Lunch work gone right. Turns out my favorite bartender, Andrian (he works at Colibri as well) works here as well, and he managed to get us nice and sloshed for our work farewell lunch for one of my bosses.

Amazing food. While a mainly seafood focused menu, still managed to have some amazing food here. The Ahi Tuni ceviche is quite yums, but was really into the vast amount of choclo available as garnish or as main empanada dish. Beef heart was fantastic, as well as skirt steak and chicken skewers. While you can't compare to Espetus in town (totally different style and theme) think of eat as the seafood version of deliciousness. 

It's pricey, but the service is impeccable, the suggestion dead on and the place itself make ti's worth it.
author: Alita M.

description:
DINE ABOUT TOWN

The food was great but simple, which makes it all the more frustrating that for a four-person $250+ dinner the service was some of the worst I've received in San Francisco.  

The DAT menu is either seafood or vegetarian.  The waitress jumped the gun and brought us four seafoods, and when we pointed out that nobody had taken our order and that we had wanted to try some seafood options and some veggie options, she fought on us it, told us we had indeed ordered, and said if things were really serious she would have to get her manager to discuss.  What the hell?  We tried the tactful, "there was a misunderstanding, we had actually wanted ___ ..." approach, and were met with basically, 'you ordered what you ordered, I've done nothing wrong and if you have a serious problem here I can get the manager.'  So I guess four people all ordered, including ordering dishes they didn't want, and then we all forgot about it?  Come on.  We just took the seafoods because we didn't want the manager to come over and escalate things.  Still, there was a tension from the very start of the meal because the waitress did not like us and made that fact clear.  To her credit she came back later and offered mid-meal to switch us to what we had tried to order but really we just wanted to be out of there.

Nobody explained the dishes as they came out, our waitress would walk away in the middle of new drink orders (and when we'd ask her to come back she'd say, "I'll be back in a minute"), and so on.  Thanks, La Mar, for completely mortifying us to the couple we had taken out to dinner.
author: Charles Y.

description:
First, happy hour specials are excellent. $5 cocktails and wine and apps as low as $3 each. But you only get this menu at the bar from 3-6. They broke their usual rules and let us sit on the patio last night because it was so warm, but usually this isn't an option. 

It was such a gorgeous night, so we stuck around and ordered food from the pricey dinner menu. 

The free chips and dips were delicious. The sauces were cream-based, so how could they not be good? We split the empanada sampler and the cebiche clasico. Empanadas were scrumptious. The cebiche? Not so much. The halibut was tough, which is unforgivable at a cebiche restaurant and the sauce needed seasoning. 

The two dishes and three glasses of wine were $75. Too high for the quality, in my opinion. 

It was packed when we left around 7:30 p.m. - it seemed like mostly tourists and businessmen. 

If I return, it will only be for happy hour.
author: Kim C.

description:
The halibut ceviche was ridiculously good. The sea food was fresh and the sauces were citrusy and amazing. We tried several of their cocktails and they were ok. 
Can't wait to go back!
author: Baharak S.

description:
The food is good (largely), but it's very overpriced, even for San Francisco. When I went, the view was not great because boats blocked my view to water. 

If I went again, I'd order the ceviche again (which was probably the best thing I had while there).
author: Amy L.

description: Went here on a Thursday evening. We were early for our reservation so grabbed a drink in the bar. Amazingly delicious drinks, and great bartenders. Once we got sat, that changed. The food was really great, the pulpo and pork rice were my fav. But our server kinda sucked. He brought the wrong drinks to our table and mixed up our checks, and really just seemed like he didn't want to be there or help with anything. I'd go back 100%, I'd just try to avoid that guy.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
SO DELICIOUS! I can't wait to come back!

ordered: Ceviche tasting, causa (peruvian whipped potato) sampler, Arroz Jugoso, and the Empanadas  sampler...and EVERYTHING was good. the Arroz Jugoso was the least tasty dish and it was still pretty yummy. We also ordered the "scarlet" for drinks boy do I wish it came in a pitcher because it was SO good.

The wait staff was so nice and we were sat right away since we made reservations. Great ambiance. Quite pricey, but the food was definitely worth it. 

FIVE starts and I'm so going back for the corn empanadas and the causas!
author: Sai K.

description:
Food was delicious 
Service was a bit slow (but it was a busy Saturday evening)
Staff was friendly 
Loved: Carne and Pollo dish, Tomatillo empanadas
Not a fan of their Sangria 
Will definitely go back!
author: Martha C.

description:
Food / Service: 
Our waiter was super friendly (an Argentinian gentleman) and he gave great recommendations on what to order. I tried the pescado nikei which was had tons of delicious spices and overall really good.

Setting : 
 The decor of this place is rather lagging. the setup is a little cold and it really lacked the warmth that most Peruvian restaurants have. Full of tourists (what we sf natives hate) so because of that, I give it a 4 star.
author: Yas G.

description: Great food, but the poor service is really distracting.  It's like they are out of practice serving food.  Maybe taking a plate to-go is the best bet.
author: Sam E.

description:
UBER expensive but you will leave hungry.

I had the kompachi ceviche and the ice cream dessert.  Service was super nice, but super slow.  We came at 5:30 and it wasn't that packed at the time but it did get busier when we left 2 hours later.  

The ambiance is nice, the waiters are friendly and it was very clean.  Even the bathrooms were surprisingly clean.  Men's bathroom were in the lobby and I was surprised to see no graffiti.  To me it's a place you have to try once but if it's not for you it's not for you.. for me,  I probably would come back on a special occasion and make reservations!.
author: Toby I.

description:
La Mar has an amazing open-air patio--perfect for those elusive warm days--second only to Epic Roasthouse and Waterbar.  You also don't need a reservation for brunch, which is why my boyfriend and I found ourselves here (all good brunch spots in SF demand either a reservation or a minimum 30-minute wait, of course).

We began with bloody marys: me, the bloody bacon and DF, the pisco mary.  They were savory and spiced, but IMO bloody marys at Epic Roasthouse are unbeatable (http://www.yelp.com/biz/epic-roasthouse-san-francisco).  How can La Mar's bacon or shrimp bloody mary compete with one boasting pork belly, prosciutto, salami, AND olives?  It doesn't--and that's why it's $3 less.

I decided to order from the lunch menu because brunch is clearly an American concept (not a Peruvian one).  I had the almuercito chalaco (seafood cebiche, grilled skirt steak, and a corn empanada) on one sampler plate.  It was good and gluttonous--seafood, steak, and dessert for lunch FTW!  DF opted for brunch and ordered the Italian sausage and yucca fries topped with a poached egg.  Although he ate it ravenously, I think he was more hungry than impressed with the dish. 

Two drinks, two dishes, and $60 later, our server gave us the wrong bill.  For the relatively small portions and high prices, I would've expected better service and especially, a correct check.  I'll be back for happy hour 3-6pm for $6 pisco sours and cebiches but likely not for lunch.
author: Liz T.

description: My SF friends recommended this place. We called ahead, and the La Mar hostess said they wouldn't accept reservations, but to come on in as they were not running a wait. We arrived within the hour at 9:15, 45 minutes prior to the scheduled kitchen closing time. The hostess with her nose in the air said they weren't seating anyone at this time. We asked why the website said the kitchen closed at 10:00. Her response: "I am aware of that. We still won't seat after our reservations."  I cannot comment on the food, but after that first impression, we were more than happy to take our business next door to Coquetas (Which, by the way was excellent!), who was equally happy to take our $250 dinner tab. So thank you La Mar - in spite of your snobbery, we had a phenomenal tapas dinner at Coquetas!
author: Rachel J.

description:
came here for lunch after the exploring The Exploratorium. The food was good, however service was not comparable. Our waiter checked on us once, gave us a different table's bill and didn't even apologize. Don't think he was so happy to be working on a Sunday afternoon. Price points are kind of high but i guess that goes along with being on The Embarcadero.

If i want Peruvian I think i'll stick with Piqueo's
author: Jennifer P.

description:
- Ceviche was amazing but the pieces were too big so the fish to sauce ratio wasn't right. 
- Seafood stew was so good, the mussels were perfect, the fish was cooked perfectly, the gravy was good too.
- Lucuma Panna Cotta was just unbelievable, it was so different and blew us away
author: Sonia R.

description:
I've been here so many times, a review is long overdue. I love the happy hour, which is M-F, 3-6 pm. I was lucky enough to make it once at 3, and man, did I go through a lot of piscos. Although, when I usually make it around 5, I tend to order a half dozen piscos anyways all at once. 

And the drinks are only part of the goodness. The food is delicious, although I tend to order tons of small plates rather than an entree. The cebiche is so fresh and light, the empanadas buttery and flavorful, the causas filled with a generous amount of crab. 

The decor is sophisticated and clean, with the bar up front, a sushi bar and loungy area in the middle, and a huge dining area in back. It would be fantastic if they had an outdoor seating area. I've actually only been to the restaurant area once, and tend to like camping out at the bar. The place is pricey, so going for happy hour is a less expensive way of getting your taste of Peru. Just be careful! After many $5 piscos, once the happy hour ends I'm so tipsy that I end up blowing my paycheck ordering so many things off the regular menu!
author: Ai S.

description:
La Mar Cebicheria has been on my bookmark list forever so I was terribly excited when Andrea R told me we were heading here for dinner during my recent SF trip.

First of all this space is huge, but not in a sterile way. It still manages to be a sexy, cozy space even with all that room. I started with an amazing easy-to-drink pisco cocktail. I have no idea what the name of it was, but all the cocktails seem to include pisco so you probably can't go wrong. If you pick one that comes in a martini glass and is purple you just might have gotten the one I ordered.

Our group was a little on the larger side and so we shared a few things - ceviche tastings, empanada tastings, the whipped potato tastings. All of it was yum, but I could have eaten my own order of the corn empanada. Perhaps I will next go around. I also ordered the beef skewers, which were served with hominy. And it was quite delicious enough for me to eat it all.

The only downer? We were celebrating a birthday and the bartenders refused to make us chocolate cake shots. Who does that? Especially on a 30th birthday night? And to be clear they told us they had all the ingredients, they just didn't want to make them. Harrumph.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Again, we had a good experience.  Not over the top wonderful like this must be THE place to have dinner.  Started with happy hour in the bar.  Seems like we always have Mr. Grouchy the bartender who always tells us how long he's been there that day and how frazzled his day is going.  Gee, sorry buddy but not the best way to great guests.  Anyway, we enjoyed a Blue Mule (or something like that), which the bartender fixed without any enthusiasm because he told us it was the thousandth time today.  I had a Peruvian beer, which I had tried last time and enjoyed it.  Beer was very cold and crispy and went down easily since it was so stinking hot in the City that day (90 plus).  For dinner, we asked for Nick but he no longer worked there.  So we had Breno, who was pretty good. We shared the causa limena and arroz la mar along with a very fine Spanish white wine (Pazo Senorans).  Very nice; the rice dish reminded me of paella and was probably not the right dish to have on such a hot day.  But, the seafood was really good especially the mussels.  Could have used more seafood, but not bad for the buck. No dessert this time.  One other comment is with regard to the host: Zack.  He was very friendly and helpful but disappeared about the time we were ready to eat.  Seems he got sidetracked by a table of VIPs that needed some special attention.  Anyway, he was good about it and seemed interested in seating us where we felt most comfortable.  Would again recommend this restaurant to locals and out of towners like us.
author: Greg C.

description:
This is a wonderful place for first-time ceviche/cebiche/seviche experiences. Although I am unfamiliar with Peruvian food, the waiter gave a quick run down of the menu and even offered many suggestions, making my decision on what to order easy! Overall, the service was excellent--I never had to ask for refills on my water cup. 

While waiting for the entrees, they served unique chips of different kinds--potato chips, plantain chips and sweet potato chips--accompanied with three different dipping sauces. Do try the sweet potato chips (the dark orange chips) with all three sauces!

For my cebiche tasting, I got the day's special, Cebiche Chorillano, which was made up of mahi mahi, mussels, calamari, shrimp, cancha and celery in a creamy rocoto leche de tigre. This was DELICIOUS! Everything was extremely fresh. Be careful of the habanero chili as a garnish at the top! The dish is already sufficiently spicy (enough to make me drink water, but not too much that I am dripping sweat), and accidentally eating a habanero chili would be a tragedy, at least for me. 

By suggestion of the waiter, I decided to also order the Lomo Saltado, Peruvian stir-fry beef tenderloins with fries and rice. DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE PRICE ($28). It was basically an upscale version of Bo Luc Lac (Vietnamese shaken beef). It was bit on the salty side. I would have rather saved my money to try their potatoes which looked AMAZING. 

I'll return for the cebiche and happy hour!
author: Cindy N.

description: Didn't have dinner but sampled a few appatizer that were very good from the Empanadas to the beef skewers.  Would have gave it 5 stars but the drinks were on the smaller side in volume and higher in the price catigory.
author: james v.

description:
This place has a great atmosphere with bright blue and green accents throughout. Cabana casual, tropical, and clean. This place has a pleasant, fresh location on the water and would be a great place for happy hour.

Everyone must try the Pisca Sour. It has a soft yellow-green lime color with 75% foam and looks absolutely refreshing. With your first taste you will realize it is powerful! So BEWARE. I had 1 1/2 and had a tum ache later in the evening. My suggestion is to go for happy hour, which is 4-6, because the drink is half off... only $5. And you can get by with ordering one glass. Get there early and you won't regret it.

They give you great chips to snack on while you wait... love the plantain!

My dinner entree was the asado de tira...aka the short ribs. The first half was great, the second half was not. When I pay $25 for short ribs I expect the selection of meat to be more lean than fatty, but half of my pieces were nothing but fat...a disappointment. The sauce and side (choclo pepian...a corn dish similar to polenta) were excellent. The greens were way too salty. I'd like a little more value for their prices.

Great busser / server assistant. The server took a long 10-15 minutes to greet us and was not around much. She was definitely in the weeds, so I'm glad the busser compensated.

P.S. I thought it was weird that the bathroom is apparently a historical landmark. Can anyone explain this? It seemed like any decent single-stall bathroom.

To conclude:
5 stars for ambiance
4 stars for the drink
3.5 stars for the food
3 stars for service
4 stars for the restroom
author: Kelly T.

description:
What not to like about this place, right on the water, spacious room, nice bar, awesome drinks & great food!

Recommendation? Anything  CEBICHE!

Empanadas Del Mar stuffed with fish and shellfish in ají amarillo cream; Anticucho De Carne grilled skirt steak, potatoes, peruvian corn, spicy rocoto sauce; are great dishes for sharing! & everything else on the menu is very refreshing! 

It's also a great date spot I think! You can sit at the bar, very cute, & if the date doesn't go well, there's always some cute bartenders to rest your eyes on over the Pisco Sour drink!

Did I mention conveniently valet parking there as well for only $10!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: My friend recommended this place for lunch. We sat outside to catch up and enjoy the view. Everything we ordered was great, even the ceviche which was a first for me. Those plantain things are addictive. I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant and the staff were professional and friendly
author: Shale O.

description:
Came here for a celebratory brunch...love the waterfront seating..and the food was pretty good..but the service was extremely slow..boarderline frustrating.. 
Had a drink at the bar also and the bartender was less than friendly...
author: Mimi T.

description:
Generally good food but overpriced. Good service. (So really, my average rating would go from 3.5/3.75 stars)
I loved the service here - my waitress was great and attentive. She explained the cocktails thoroughly, and offered some suggestions on the menu. 

Now the food:
Cebiche sample ($30): 4 diff types of cebiche. tuna, yellowtail, halibut, and shrimp/scallops. 
The fish was good, but I was expecting fresher. The sauces were good and the portions were decent. However, I still found this to be slightly overpriced given the quality of seafood.

Beef empanadas: Good!

Skewers (chicken, beef, yellowtail): All were cooked right, but again I thought it was overpriced for the amount on the plate. 

The bottom line is: La Mar has a nice ambiance and great service, with good albeit overpriced food.
author: C K.

description:
Came here for a large work dinner with high expectations given the quality of the yelp reviews. I've noticed that SF is just more generous with their yelp reviews than the east coast cities as a 4-star in SF according to yelp, is moreso comparable to a 3.5-star in DC/NY. Wiith 4 stars and almost 2k reviews I was dissapointed with the food. 

I managed to save the tasting menu so I'll go throuh each dish we had.

Cebiche Clasico - this was very good and I enjoyed this dish the most out of anything else. The fish was perfectly tender and the juice it was in had the perfect balance of acidity and savory flavors.

Causa Casera - This was strange as I was expecting the dish to be hot given it's a whipped potato confit. Eitherway, this dish lacked seasoning.

Ensalada Limena - standard run of the mill arugula salad

Empanada de K'apchi - merh. Have had way better empanadas at street side vendors.

Quinoa Chaufa - This was my second favorite dish. Imagine fried rice but with quinoa, the mother of all super grains. Extremely flavorful, the quinoa had a delightful texture with the perfect mixture of grain to vegetables.

Chorillana - The mashed yucca in this dish was very good but the fish was of uneven thickness. This caused the fish to be overcooked in some spots and undercooked in others.

Lomo Saltado - this stir-fried beef dish was one of my least favorites. Very one-noted on the salty side and lacked any character or big flavors.

Overall, the service was excellent and the decor was modern without being trendy and open/airy.
author: Michael S.

description: Went for drinks on a Friday night; the bartenders were friendly and professional and made good drinks. My wife for the Bay Flower, which she really enjoyed. The drinks were a little pricey, but the atmosphere and clientele were upscale. Overall a nice experience, I would come here again.
author: Matt C.

description:
I've been trying to make reservations at La Mar for months and finally succeeded last week...yaaaayyyy! Since it's so hard to get a reservation here I figured it was a tiny restaurant with just a few tables. Um, wrong! It turns out to be one of (if not THE) largest restaurant I've dined at in SF.  It's just super busy because it's that delish.
