They decided to cook it again for her, and this time was better, but this time the rice wasn't fully cooked. That was unbelievable! I ordered the chaufa and the taste seem odd, probably because of the salty rice and too much spicy sauce on it, but I had no patience to request it again. I can see the place has good reviews, but probably the chef and the crew were having a bad time and they really ruin our food. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and waste your time and money.
author: Cisco F.

description:
Can't go wrong with ceviche and Pisco sours!! They do happy hour Monday-Friday 4-6 pm. I can't believe I had never tried this place before...this is seriously one of my new favorites for happy hour. The ceviche is not the typically wimpy stuff you get at other restaurants...this is the real deal with fresh seafood and amazing spices!! I am already fantasizing about the next time I visit....

We went during that awkward time between lunch and dinner so there was a limited menu. i am confident the dinner would be great, though!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Great drinks and specials. 
Great service.
Great and varied menu. 
Plenty of cebiche, but that is certainly not ALL they do. We had a damn fine crab and himachi sushi and some CRAZY good empanadas as well as fresh seafood. The worst dish at our table, if you can call it remotely bad, was the rice and seafood "paella" type dish. It was a little overly oily and the rice consistency had turned to rubber along with the calamari. I would not suggest the rice dish. 
However, we had three desserts and two of them were spectacular. The fried yam doughnuts are very tasty and interesting as were the beignet type chocolate filled pastries. The rice pudding was, to my taste, too runny and the flavors were just ok. 
Overall, still a 5 due to great, quality ingredients and great service, location and vibe.
author: Melody M.

description:
nice ambiance.  excellent food.  starts with perfect sauces for plantain chips, regular chips and sweet potato chips. enjoyed the cebiche tasting (4 types though high price).
cebiche nikei was nice because it was like poke.  cebiche chalaco was interesting with the peanuts, but better to have cancha to be more accurate, so cebiche clásico had more of the leche de tigre and everything was fresh.  the cebiche mixto was ok.  had causa limeña whipped potato but wasn't doing it for me, so maybe better to have an empanada.
best dish was the special-- El Gran Bife.  the ribeye was juicy, cooked perfectly, tasty sauce, side also good with tomato, onion, tacu tacu, and light maduros.
mochica still might be better.
author: Rob C.

description: Worst service ever! People were unfriendly and took 30 min to even ask us our drink orders. Host and hostess were extremely rude as well and did not feel welcoming whatsoever. The food was good, but the service soured it.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Delicious, beautiful food and great service! Went as a group of 8 for a friend's birthday dinner, and the restaurant was very accommodating allowing us to bring our own cake. Amazing location right on the harbour with a view of the bay.  Will definitely come again!
author: Xin S.

description: We ordered so many small plates of ceviche, causas, empanadas, etc. that we didn't have room for any main course dishes. Absolutely delicious, elegant presentations, creatively improved versions of traditional dishes still dominated by the native peruvian ingredients. Reasonably priced wine list as well.
author: Todd A.

description:
Go to La Mar for happy hour in San Francisco if you are by the Embarcadero. 

Get the friend chicken thigh on the happy hour menu. Maybe order a couple other tastes. Have a drink or 2, and then move on your next destination. Not a place to spend a lot  of time, but a nice pit stop after work, before your night begins.

A great place to stop in for a quick bite, and again, try the fried chicken thigh... it was awesome.
author: Ocean F.

description: Service was outstanding, we did not have reservations yet the host worked diligently to find us a nice table in the patio. The food is made with fresh and high quality ingredients, loved the cebiches, the empanadas flavor was one of the best I have had. We tried the maracuya sour cocktail, a lot better than a margarita. Take the time to enjoy the food and the view from the patio. I'll make sure I have reservations next time!
author: AF G.

description:
I love this place! I love everything thing about it 
from the friendly Pisco making bartenders to the 
Beauttiful colorful menus to the Ceviche! The main room 
Is bustling and sometimes a little loud but that is
about the only complaint I have.
author: Les S.

description:
La Mar has never failed me from a special date to dinner with parents or out of town guests and most recently a visit from my boss and and colleagues.  Everyone is always impressed and I look like a hero.

Telepathic service, fresh, creative food in a beautiful, fun setting with cocktails to die for- what else could you want?
author: R G.

description:
Totally fantastic!!! We had an awesome time.
Recommend the "mixtos" so that you get a sampling of it all if you only get 1 chance to visit La Mar.
author: Carol G.

description:
The cebiche (per the 4-cebiche sampler) was better than other SF cebicherias, but still below our expectations (admittedly we go in for the less traditional types like you might find at a Segundo Muelle in Miraflores). 
The causa sampler was better, with one or two little stacks of potato and seafood distinguishing themselves a little better (though mostly with a little sesame oil). 
Waiter and other staff were calm and quite friendly. Dishes small and pricey.
author: Rick S.

description:
Been here twice, once for dinner and the other for lunch.  Better as a lunch spot because the view and patio on a sunny day make it more enjoyable.   Great location on the water over looking the bay.

Food presentation was awesome, food tasted so so.  Everything was overly fishy tasting.  Our waiter was helpful and selected a nice wine to compliment the food.  Pretty modern and large restaurant.
author: Tashie P.

description:
Prices are high and food is not very good.  I ordered a tuna sandwich and the slices of tuna were as thin as the lettuce--I should've just walked over to Gott's and ordered myself a tuna burger and would've gotten 7 times more fish.

Ceviche is decent but again, seafood portions were very small.

You're really only paying for location and decor  Maybe worth it for happy hour.
author: Kim C.

description: We started out night here. The ambiance was very nice and relaxing. We ordered the Ceviche Sampler and is was absolutely delish! If your looking for a great drink, this is the place! Pisco!!
author: Carla F.

description:
It was too expensive for what it was.

Great drinks (especially ones with Pisco!, the maracuya sour is awesome) 
Great ceviche (although the portions are small) 
Lomo saltado was ok - nothing to write home about though. 
Dropping $100 for dinner for two, not so awesome. The lomo saltado was a beef dish with potatoes and rice, no way was that worth $32 smackers. 5-6 pieces of beef cubes and a bed of french fries..... am I missing something here? 

Great location on the water, but it's a BIG restaurant. Perhaps they were trying to make up for rent with some of their crazy prices? SF is SF, but I can get a better meal for $100 

An aside this is the only restaurant I've been to where the ladies room is a historical bathroom....
author: Joyce T.

description:
My friend took me here one night because he ate here twice before and said the food was pretty good. Sadly, I just thought it was A-OK. 

The hostess was nice enough to seat us about 30 minutes earlier than our original reservations were for. While we were seated next to the kitchen (something that I specified I did not want when I made the reservation), the restaurant itself was loud enough to drown out the noise of the open kitchen. Their ventilation must also be very good because I did not smell anything! 

We started off with their complimentary chips of taro, yam, plantain and potato. The dipping sauces that accompanied them were pretty good. My favorite was the one that had a spicy kick to it. As I've never tried pisco before, I decided to go with the Waikicha, which has pomegranate puree in it. I enjoyed it a lot more than my friend's Pisco Punch. 

It took the restaurant a really long time to finally get us our appetizer of Causas tasting. When it arrived, I was surprised at how cold the dish was. I thought perhaps they took so long because they were cooking it. The whole dish tasted like cold mashed potatoes with cold deli-toppings. My favorite of the trio was the Causas Nikei, which has spicy ahi-tuna on top. 

When we asked our waitress when our entrees would arrive, she said in a slightly condescending tone that appetizers are always served before entrees. Well, duh! I know that! But we left some of our appetizer untouched because it wasn't that good and we were looking forward to the entrees. She informed us that she would put in our order and that there would be an overlap between our dishes. I was confused because we were DONE with our appetizers so how could there be an overlap?! Regardless, my friend's Lomo Saltado was better than my Bass Nikei. Both dishes came with a bowl of rice (mine was "fried" rice while my friend's was rice rice). We were quite full and didn't touch most of the rice, but I will say that the Lomo Saltado needs the white rice because the sauce can get a tad salty. The crimini mushrooms that accompanied the bass wasn't very good. I would think that the restaurant would go something like shitake mushrooms. 

Overall, I was really disappointed because I had high expectations for the restaurant. Next time, maybe I'll come around for lunch, as my friend told me they have an excellent appetizer special then.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Great location, nice, modern interior with splashes of color, waterfront property. Delicious, beautifully plated, colorful food, friendly service, and fortunately for me, a warm sunny spot to sit. Great spot for a business lunch. Ceviche is delicious, portions of most items are small, we ordered ceviche and 2 entrees and left full. Love the plantain chips.

2 small criticisms-
-There was no kick whatsoever, some chiles/jalepenos would have been nice. A little bland.
-Mas limon!
-I thought that was really steep for what we received. We enjoyed it though. We eat out all the time in SF and can often have a nice DINNER, 2 glasses of wine, and tip for about $100, so for $100 for brunch without champagne....?

PS- the causas are delicious, but very tiny (about 1/4 cup serving or less).
author: J B.

description: Escape from the Embarcadero .. Have a seat at the bar and have Edgar make you one of his signature drinks .. This guy is a pro .. Great atmosphere
author: Spyglass H.

description:
Date & Time:  Thursday December 11, 2008 @ 6:30pm(The Only Rezzie Available for The Entire Evening- 6pm)
Company:  Norman(Michael's Rockstar Cousin) & Michael
Crowd:  Attractive 20-40's Something Execs in Prada Suits & LBD's w/ Knee-High Boots
Vibe:  Energetic
Decor:  South Beachy.  The Bar is a Hot Spot w/ Girls in DVF Dresses.  Turquoise is the Choice Color of The Interior from The LoveSeats in The Lounge Area to The Banquettes in The Main Dining Room to The Menus.  Big Rectangular Ceviche Bar Filled w/ Sophisticated Foodies.  The Main Dining Room is Bright & Airy w/ High Beamed Ceilings, Huge Bay Windows w/ Expensive Drapes.  Specials Written on Big BlackBoard.  Nicely-Spaced Communal Table & Tables for Quatre by The Window Overlooking The Pier where Passers-By Linger to Look In.  Tightly-Packed Banquettes for Deux & Quatre and Intimate Booths for Deux.
Service:  Gorgeous Hostess in LBD & Nice Peruvian Waiters
Imbibe:  Pisco Sour & Non-Alcoholic Juice Drink(forgot the name- it was a deep purple)
Devour:  Cebiche Sampler, Limena(Potato Stuffed w/ Crab & Avocado) & Octopus Skewers w/ Mashed Potatoes @ The Bottom, Seafood Fried Rice.  Complimentary Chips w/ Trois Dipping Sauces
Skip:  Soup(Tasted Like Mud Water) & Beef Tenderloin(Flavorless)
Total:  Big Thanks to Norman & His Expense Account
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Amazing food. It's a must place to eat. The most unique food and presentation I've ever seen. All in a casual setting
author: Bridget B.

description: The food was excellent! We had the ceviche which was very fresh and flavorful! The la mar pasta was delicious and the grilled seafood was very tasty. Mario L, our waiter was attentive with a great sense of humor.
author: Lan D.

description: The food reminded me of the wonderful food experiences we had in Lima. Pisco sours, ceviche.. Delicious
author: E G.

description:
Truly outstanding spot. My family was in town for a whole week, and by the end we were quite tired of New American food. La Mar was exactly what we needed for a change of cuisine. 

We tried a bunch of ceviches, causas, and empanadas. Everything was fresh and delicious. Some people got fish entree specials too and enjoyed them. My favorite was the causa limeña (dungeness crab). I could have eaten ten.

Not many people mention the wine list: it is quite extensive. Superb selection of Spanish and South American bottles (California too of course) with an eye towards varietals that complement the food. So many places phone in the wine list, but La Mar clearly puts some work into this one.

Also very important - this is a place where you can actually hear your dining companions without having to shout. The setting on the water is also quite pleasant. I can't wait to go back.
author: Greg H.

description: Fantastic for a light bite during the afternoon. The calamari was stunning. Chips (fries) are also great. Will come here often.
author: Paul W.

description:
We stopped here for lunch last week when we were on vacation.  It was in between the lunch and dinner rushes, so we had to sit in the bar.  We were told to hurry up and order since the kitchen was switching to dinner.  Other than taking our order, the bartenders seemed more focused on cutting limes and getting things ready for the night shift.  Next time I will definitely come during lunch or dinner and make a reservation for the dining room.

We started with a half portion of the ceviche clasico, which was perfection.  Lime-y, fresh and tasty.  I had the atun sandwich, which was a seared tuna steak with lettuce, veggies and a really delicious sauce.  I could have this every day and not get tired of it. My boyfriend had the fish skewers, which made the fish taste like it had been at  a barbecue joint.  The Peruvian corn and the sauces that accompanied each dish (not sure what they were) were our favorites.  They should bottle those and sell them!

The service wasn't great, but the food was.  I'd definitely go back the next time we are in the area.
author: Lauren K.

description: Went here on a date. It has great atmosphere for a date or special occasion and the service was great. However, I found the food to be good but not great. I tried all the samplers to get a representative taste. I didn't find any of the food particularly mind blowing -- especially given the total bill at the end.
author: Victor W.

description: Food was average. Seafood cooked perfectly but flavors were bland and the rice dish needed salt. Service was fair. There are better restaurants around.
author: Karen S.

description:
I actually only discovered this place a few months ago, and had been wanting to dine here due to the incredible decor and views. Hostesses and servers were excellent.  Nice wine selection focused primarily on South American and Spanish varietals.  Had an excellent Pedro Jimenez white.  I knew the Ceviche Tasting was on the 7x7 mag's top 100 food experiences, and was not let down.  Succulent fish, well garnished, with incredible sauces.  So good.  Only complaint: there was not nearly enough for even two people, especially not for the price.  

The chips and dipping sauces they bring out are also a nice appetizer, especially the plantain chips.  

I also tried the Anticucho de Mahi Mahi (my favorite fish), and was very pleased. They even accomodated a request to blacken the fish.  Only complaint, once again, is that the portion was too small.  

We sat outside on the patio, and admired the incredible views.  The crowd was mainly suits from the FiDi, with a few couples strewn in for good measure. ;)  Heaters are provided for a portion of the outdoor seating area.  

All in all, this is a great place to come with a large group, business associates, or on a date.  Wonderful views, great tasting food, and good service.  Only slight issue is value: would have liked to have seen either larger portion sizes or slightly reduced prices.  

However, I'll definitely be back and look forward to sampling some other dishes and wines.
Cheers!

Food: 4
Value: 3
Service: 4.5
Ambiance:  4.5
author: Ethan R.

description:
My mom came for a visit and was staying at a hotel in the area. I'm not familiar with dining in this part of town but after some quick yelping we decided to try La Mar. 

I went in with low expectations, expecting the possibility of a tourist trap, but left pleasantly surprised. 

We managed to swing a last minute reservation and were instantly seated upon arrival. Our waiter was very attentive and offered some good recommendations. The vegetable chips they served in place of bread were a nice treat and the ceviche was excellent. They were also able to make me a Chilcano de Pisco which it seems like no one outside of Peru (or at least Peruvian restaurants) knows how to make. Yum! 

We left stuffed and very satisfied with our meal.
author: Jake M.

description:
I love raw fish and have tried an enormous amount of sushi/sashimi/ceviche in my life thus far....

La Mar's ceviche definitely makes my top list -- I've tried the ceviche sampler as well as ceviche off the specials board (that changes from day to day) and have enjoyed all of the myriad flavors the kitchen comes out with. 

As for cooked entrees - the seasonings are great and I enjoy the food but over $20 for a plate of lomo saltado? waaaay expensivoo ~ 

I will say that the chips (potato/plantain) they serve with your meal (and the trio of dips that come with) are super addictive!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I am a big portion woman. I like my plate to be stuffed until the very edge of it, and preferably a bit over the edge. Here, unfortunately, you won't get that. But oh, how my tummy is happy about that! I can actually enjoy the conversation instead of laying horizontally on the chairs groaning in agony for over-eating in pure stubbornness.

The food was nice for a dinner party where conversation is more important than food, and the small plates really accommodates a nice evening out. Tastewise it wasn't phenomenal, but okey-ish.

The staff was very professional. Even when half the table was engaging in some innocent "sexual harassment", the waiter still managed to be very kind and professional.

This it the place to bring a group or two, I don't think I'd go here as a twosome though.
author: Martie K.

description: The portions were generous, more food than I expected.  The ahi tuna ceviche was taken over by the strong red onion taste. The skewers were delicious.  The service was good.
author: Danielle W.

description: This place was definitely not a let-down. The decor was very nice and beachy. The food was great- I tried the ceviche sampler and I would highly recommend the original and mixed ceviches, but not the Asian-inspired ones. They overpower the seafood. We also had some of the skewers and empanadas, which were all amazing. Will definitely be back!
author: Clarissa B.

description:
Beautiful place for dining very modern and clean lines on the decor. Had both lunch and dinner and I tried to stick with more of the traditional dishes of Peru and stayed away from any sushi. So far all of the dishes were very good and the service was fine. 

The staff was exceptional considering I definitely put them to the test as I was at a lunch date which turned for the worse. I ordered a Pisco Sour (very delish) and clueless my date had an allergy to eggs.  Oops!  After a small taste he got so sick  he stayed in the bathroom for 20 + minutes. I commend the staff and even our waiter that after such a busy lunch hour they made sure we were okay. 

For dinner on another occasion they were very attentive and answered any questions about the menu and paring with their wines. The food was very good no complaints here.
author: Shirley P.

description:
We were hungry after trekking all over S.F., and we found ourselves on the Embarcadero, looking for a reasonably priced, somewhat down to earth place to eat.  We ducked into La Mar, and decided to have lunch at the front bar (I guess it's called Cafe La Mar).  The very friendly chef made us feel right at home, as he started us off with some amazing root vegetable chips with three (!) different dipping sauces.  The sauces were colorful, fun, and made from traditional Peruvian ingredients.  I don't know what exactly was in them, but they were unlike anything we had ever had.

For the main course, we ordered up some Pisco Sours (traditional Peruvian Cocktail) and a couple of the tuna sandwiches.  The sandwiches were delectable, and looked amazing as well!  Perfectly seared fresh ahi, served on the freshest bread imaginable, again with some magical sauce.

I would have given this place 4 stars, but I have to throw in the extra because of the entertaining visual experience that we had as well.  Towards the end of our meal, another chef came out, set up shop behind the bar with a huge tub of Limes, and began cutting them up and juicing them for that night's ceviche, using a very specific technique.  It was nothing short of hypnotic, as he hummed along at lightning speed, slicing and squishing those limes in fluid motions.  He said that the technique was necessary to avoid using the more bitter juice from the cores of the limes.

Overall, 5 stars for a delicious, unique, friendly, and entertaining trip to Cafe La Mar!!
author: Ellis H.

description:
This restaurant was recommended by some locals that we met close by. We did not have reservations but we were offered to sit by the kitchen door, at a high table. Big mistake. The door opened constantly and it was away from the fun, trendy atmosphere. I asked if we could be moved at a near by, low table  but they did not accept in case a larger group came. The table stayed empty the entire time. Very disappointing. 

We waited a while for our order to be taken. Our waitress was neither friendly nor "antipática" pero she tended to forget about us. We waited too long for our check, too long to pay our bill, too long overall. 

When I read the review about the bucket of chips, ours was too long to arrive (our food came very soon after) and we did not have the plantains that everyone is talking about. 

Our experience in terms of service was not more than a 2 but we still had to give a tip because we are polite. This is not a cheap place so you would think that they care about making everyone feel special, even little people like us.

The food was very, very good. If I had to rate it I would give it a 4. We both like all our dishes and I was tempted by so much more.

I feel a bit disappointed that we were not worth their attention. One thing that was quick to come, the wine! That's right they make big money on it! They are very quick to offer you another one... just add it to the bill. 

I wish they had been that quick with our chips, bill and smiles!  I will go back but will make sure to reserve and won't expect too much about the service.
author: Pascale H.

description: Really bad customer service!!!! I called to make a reservation for my wife's birthday told the girl named (Fatima) that it was a party of 18. Firs of all she had an attitude with me the whole time. Then she said we had to pick from a special menu that was $79.00 per person, I asked why we couldn't pick from the regular menu, she answered with an attitude "Well that's the way we do it here, if it's a party over 8 you must pay that much"!  I ended up making reservations somewhere else, that bad attitude is not getting my business!
author: Marvin R.

description: Had the Dine about Town earlier this week, weekday at around noon. Service was a bit slow, but very tolerable, and every single other food item (including the cebiche clásico - perfection) was top notch. Will return.
author: Nick L.

description: Amazing cocktails and food. Never disappoints. Order the tuna ceviche and piece punch!
author: Rose A.

description:
The ceviche is probably the best I have ever had in the US. 
The place has this great airy and unpretentious vibe to it. Reminded me of Miami with a lot less drama. 
Highly recommended. Large tables make it easy to go with a large office group as well.
author: Neil B.

description: La Mar is to Ceviche lovers what the Vatican is to Catholics. Trust the waiter, ask for suggestions and try it all. Careful with the Pisco Sours.
author: Sam C.

description: Great food and a good atmosphere. Make reservations if you want to sit on the outside deck. Went for lunch and had the empanadas and the grilled octopus for apps and the tenderloin sandwich. All was great but a bit pricey for the size, especially the appetizers. But all in all a good experience. Would definitely go back again. Staff was good but the place does get busy so stay ahead of your drink orders cause you order from the waiter and then someone else brings the drinks, which takes a bit of time. 4 stars out of 5, enjoy
author: Marino L.

description:
Plantain, Sweet Potato and Potato Chips. SO DELISH! I love these, they're part of why I enjoy eating here. 

Habanero Chile, Avocado and Peanut Salsas. DELISH with the chips. I pretty much love all their salsas. But if you can't take spiciness, I'd advise against the chili salsa even though it's damn good, it's got a kick to it. 

Pisco Sour. Pisco Quebranta, Lime Juice, Simple Syrup, dash of Egg White and a drop of regional Bitter. This was pretty good, actually kind of reminded me a bit of a mojito without the mint, slightly more bitter and definitely more sour.

Inca Kola. Peruvian version of Cream Soda. This was pretty good, but definitely very sweet and creamier than normal A&W and even Schweppes.

Cebiche Tasting. (Clockwise from Top Left) "Platter" of various ceviches: Chalaco (Mussels, Scallops, Octopus, Calamari, Shrimp, and Red Onion in a Rocoto Leche De Tigre with Peruvian Corn and Yam), Mixto (Catch of the day, Calamari and Octopus in an Ají Amarillo Leche De Tigre with Cilantro, Red Onion, Habanero with Peruvian Corn and Yam), Clásico (California Halibut in a classic Leche De Tigre with Red Onion, Habanero, Peruvian Corn and Yam), and Nikei (Ahi Tuna, Red Onion, Japanese Cucumber, Daikon, Avocado, Nori, and Sesame in a Tamarind leche de Tiger). 
This was bomb as always. Probably because I love the different varieties of flavors and trying all of them. And also because I love the texture and nomminess of sashimi and this is pretty similar though the seafood is "cooked" with the acidity of the sauces.

Empanadas De Lomo Saltado. Skirt Steak, Red Onions and Tomato in a Soy and Oyster Sauce. These were bomb, definitely the best empanadas I've ever had. I loved the lomo saltado inside the empanada it was very tender and flavorful. I mainly tried this because I wanted to get a taste of lomo saltado, so the next time I come back to La Mar I'm definitely getting a whole plateful of the lomo!

Causa Tasting. (From top to bottom) Selection of Causas: Sureña (Orange Potato Causa with Panko Breaded Shrimp, Red Onion, Olives, Lima Beans, Queso Fresco and Ocopa sauce), Casera (Yellow Potato Causa, Artichokes, Asparagus, Avocado and Tomato Confit with Basil Cilantro Oil), Nikei (Ahi Tuna Tartare and Avocado Purée on top of Whipped Orange Potato with Creamy Rocoto Huancaína Sauce topped with Japanese Nori), Limeña (Dungeness Crab on top of a Yellow Potato Causa with Avocado Purée, Quail Egg, Cherry Tomatoes, Ají Amarillo Huancaína Sauce and Basil Cilantro Oil)
This, too, was bomb, as usual. My favorite is still the Limena, though the Nikei is pretty good as well. I just love me some seafood and I liked how the dungeness crab was really fresh and tasted oceany. I also liked the ahi tuna tartare a lot, definitely good quality tuna. NOMS.

Anticuchos Pescado. Grilled Halibut with Fried Potatoes, Peruvian Corn, Spicy Panchita and Rocoto Sauce. This was delicious! The fish was grilled to a soft, almost pillowy texture and the flavors of the spices with the sauce was amazing. 

Anticuchos Corazón. Grilled Beef Heart with Fried Potatoes, Peruvian Corn and a Spicy Panchita and Rocoto Sauce. I'm usually a big fan of organ meats, especially hearts and kidneys, yes I am THAT Asian. And these were bomb, definitely the best beef hearts I've ever had and way better than that Brazilian BBQ place on Market. These were well flavored and delicious! FYI though, you can taste the metallic-ness of the blood when you bite into them, so if you're not a fan of that I wouldn't suggest it.

Pescado Nikei. Poached Sea Bass over Crimini Mushrooms, Ginger, Scallions, Bean Sprouts, Cilantro, and hot Sesame Oil served with a side of Chaufa Rice. This was bomb. Our server told us they cook it in plastic wrap so the fish stays moist and tender. Loved it! I would totally get this again, it was so good. I wish I could have eaten more of it but I was so full. 

Chaufa Rice that came with the Pescado Nikei. This was bomb rice, even though I'm not really a fan of rice I liked it a lot. Nicely flavored yumminess.

Crêpe De Chocolate. Chocolate Crêpe filled with Lucuma Mousse and Chocolate Ganache, Meringue Ice Cream with Cointreau and fresh Orange Sauce. THIS WAS BOMB! I'm a major fan of lucuma and surprisingly its flavors mixed really well with the chocolate and orange. If you've never had lucuma before you should definitely try it, it's a fruit from Latin and South America and it has a really distinct taste that's reminiscent of maple, but it has a different sort of texture, more starchy than the typical fruit. LOVES!

I wish I could give more than 5 stars because this place has REALLY good service and BOMB food. Our server made sure we were attended to and made sure the heaters outside weren't too warm nor too cold for us. 

I will be back soon La Mar!
author: Constance C.

description: Ceviche here is very good. So are the paella-like rice dishes. On the down side, the place is a bit too pricey for what you get: about $30 per dish. The drinks were so-so.
author: Quarup B.

description:
Wonderful! My wife and I stopped by at 11:45 on a Wednesday without lunch reservations. We were seated quickly and the waiter served us a trio of fantastic chile sauces with chips. "Peruvian chips and salsa" was great, and a wonderful introduction to the menu. The waiter took the time to explain Peruvian cooking and suggested a wonderful cebiche, a mahi mahi skewer and fish empanadas.

Great food, great staff and a wonderful location.
author: Geoff B.

description:
Although the atmosphere was very modern and the outdoor seating overlooking the bay is very pretty, the food I felt was just ok.

I heard a lot of great reviews about this place so maybe my expectation was just too high. I started with the house special bacon bloody mary and asked for it extra spicy. It was not spicy at all and tasted very watered down.

Even though their fish skewers were great and their house home made chips were excellent, I felt that their food was just mediocre for their prices. 
If your looking for a great atmosphere for a date and small snack this place is fine.
author: Cole L.

description: If zero star option is available I would give it a zero.  If the restaurant does not appreciate customers ordering the "dine about town" menu, then why bothered to offer it? The server asked abruptly this question when he saw us reviewing the "dine about town" menu......"are you guys here JUST for the dine about town?"  The tone of this obnoxious waiter was telling us that we were cheap.  Within two minutes after our appetizers came, the entrée arrived.  Looks like they were pre-cooked and that's why they came so quickly.  The beef tenderloin was so tough, salty and it was way overcooked.  The French fries were soggy and covered with sauces.  That was extremely gross.  To add insult to injury, the waiter gave us the bill without asking us what dessert we wanted.  This showed how bad the waiter's attitude was towards us just because he did not like us ordering the dine about town menu.  Once again, if the restaurant is so insincere about "dine about town" and gave us crappy food as a result, then why bothered to offer it?  Nobody forced you to participate in the program!!!
author: Fong K.

description: If you love ceviche you will be totally blown away here.  I was originally thrilled to go because it literally sits on pier 1.5.  I figured there should also be a pier .5 if there's a 1.5.  It is a bit pricey but definitely worth the cost.  Service is adequate but as long as you're choking down some ceviche you won't care if the service is good or bad (it's good).
author: Bryan T.

description:
I don't know what it was about that day, but I wasn't completely WOW-ed by La Mar for its $25+ entrees. Maybe it was what I ordered (it looked like mongolian bbq stir fry you get at the mall) or the fact that it was virtually one server at our party of 10+ (since they KNEW they were getting gratuity), or that we constantly had to beg them down for refills on chips/plantains or water.....

Undeniably, the location is great, but I expected better things from a "high class" Peruvian restaurant on the Pier. I think I need to go somewhere else to find legit Peruvian food.
author: Liane T.

description:
Big, wide, open restaurants are a rarity in San Francisco. I'm so used to the tiny, narrow hidden spots - that when I enter a space like La Mar - I can't help but be wide-eyed.

Located on the Pier, La Mar is already buzzing with the who's who of San Francisco. Their bar area, even late at night is alive with eager people waiting for their table, and those dressed up in their finest "business casual" on the prowl for some good conversation. For those who find themselves waiting for their table - be sure to take full advantage of the outstanding drink menu at La Mar.  Their Cholopolitan, a cosmo with Pisco Acholado, is excellent and fruity - without being too sweet - and takes the edge off the wait nicely.

Since we were at La Mar for a birthday dinner - we were a big group. Peering into the sprawling room, decorated with whites and popping brilliant blues, we kept on wondering where they'd seat us. Finally a host greeted us and led us to a private area, off of the main eating area in the back for the restaurant. It was perfect and secluded.  We could hear each other speak, with glimpses of the main restaurant, and with a gorgeous view of the water. As we peered out the window, we could see the outlines of an impressive patio deck with stacked chairs. I'm not sure if the patio is open yet, but it's sure to be one of the hottest spots in the city on a nice day (let's hope La Mar decides to serve brunch :) )

Our server, was extremely well versed in the menu, and made sure to give us some superb recommendations when it came to ordering.  The cerviche sampler was fresh tasting and the flavors strong and different. It's a must try. I ordered the Halibut, which was cooked just right, and surrounded by an array of fresh vegetables. Absolutely delicious. Being that I eat every meal in a matter of seconds, it was no surprise that I was the first to finish, which allowed for sampling of the rest of table's meals. Each was outstanding. Every dish was unique, and distinct in flavor - a strong testament of the diversity and skill of La Mar's chefs.

The night was a huge success, and we all left with big satisfied stomachs, and smiles. If you're looking for a new "scene" in the city, and are interested in broadening your taste buds - make a reservation at La Mar. If you arrive, and find yourself with a wait,  take a deep breath and grab a drink at the bar. Prepare yourself for an electric night full of authentic beautifully prepared Peruvian dishes.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I am a regular customer here at La Mar. I have a real passion for peruvian food and, since I discovered it, few years ago, I must have it at least once a month. La Mar serves an upscale version of peruvian cuisine, and it has no rivals here in San Francisco. I went there last night with some friends and, as usual, everybody was impressed by the excellence of the food but, the real surprise of the night, was actually our server. He literally was icing on the cake!! First of all, he was a real peruvian, lovely accent and south american charm included! He wonderfully guided us through our dining experience, perfectly describing every dish and he even gave us a brief and funny history about food tradition in his country.  We let him order everything. First he brought us a ceviche sample, octopus appetizer and a crab potato tower (as he described the cause plate, :) ). My friends stopped talking. They were to busy savoring those delicacies and they couldn't believe their taste buds. Main course: our star of the night, brought out lomo saltado, a must-have classic, and 2 orders of lamb chops. I never had that dish before, I guess it was a special. It was simply perfect! I can't list recall all the ingredients, but I won't forget that flavor, divine! 
Thank you La Mar for the usual amazing experience, and thank you lovely peruvian guy (sorry, I am terrible with names) who made our night even more spectacular.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Came here for dinner with the office chicas. 

My first go, with peruvian food was quite successful. 

For dinner we had:
(group)
-cebiche mixto - the sauce that the seafood was in was the best part. tangy with a kick it was a nice mix. 
-empanada sampler - we couldn't decide so of course we got the sampler to try all. each one had a unique flavor, they were platted beautifully and the dipping sauce was a great accent

(personal)
-jalea-there was so much seafood. iLOVED it. I always go for the seafood when I eat near the Pier and it has never disappointed. Fried with a great sauce to accompany and good to share. It could have been for the group with as much as they gave me. 

Had the inca cola, which is a soda local to Peru, delicioso. I'm not a soda drinker, but I wanted to taste something autentico. 

The waiter was super helpful translating and answering any questions we had, he got an extra tip. 

I loved the blue around the restaurant, it was too distracting but gave a nice feel to the space. It was a great buzz, not too roudy just the sounds of people enjoying good company and good.
author: Grace K.

description:
Big, gorgeous restaurant and bar with a Latin American vibe. The atmosphere is fancy and fun without being stiff, the waiters are hot, and the pisco sours are absolutely, and without a doubt, TO DIE FOR. It's a great place to see and be seen, and the view of the water is spectacular on a nice day.

I love the fancy take on South American street food, although it is a tad pricey, so I'll be saving this spot for special occasions.

Good for drinks/happy hour, dates, or a girls night.
author: Amanda F.

description: My brother had visited the one in Peru and this one lived up to my expectations. Peruvian Food made to perfection and all dishes shined and delivered what you expect of a chef trained by Gaston Curio.
author: Perry D.

description:
I'll be honest, I wasn't thrilled to be going to a Peruvian restaurant, especially when I saw they were known for ceviche which I despise, but I was part of a bacholorette party so I couldn't say no. I also have a bad taste in my mouth about Peru because I  dated a crazy guy who used to travel down there and dig up some root drug with his cult friends and take it and hallucinate his problems away, wwhhhattt ...needless to say I didn't marry him, but again I digress

So we had a set menu with 3 appetizers, 2 main courses and dessert. The tuna appetizer was to die for, I couldn't get enough of it. It was chunks of raw tuna in like a sesame oil, with avocado and cucumber and just soooo delicious! The steak filled empanadas, just melted in your mouth, wow! The traditional steak main dish was made with such high quality steak pieces you could simply cut it with your fork. 

I wish I could remember the name of the items off the menu but the bottom line is this sampler was enough to text my non drug taking husband, in the middle of the meal that WE HAVE TO COME BACK and explore this menu! 

Also, I can't comment on the alcoholic drinks, as I am 4 months pregnant, but I did ask for, bc I was craving a tangy fruity drink, and I got some passion fruit concoction that hit the spot! Totally satisfied, will totally come back!
author: Jennifer T.

description: I have never been so insulted by the treatment we got here.  It was 1pm and we wanted to have a couple of appetizers and drinks with a view of the water.  We were told that unless you ordered lunch, you cannot set in the view area but were welcome in the non-view bar area.  There were plenty of open seating areas in the view area and we probably would have spent $50+ but passed.  Never coming back here.  Business must be good when you can turn away customers wanting to spend money.
author: Gary D.

description:
Please dont skip dessert when you come here. You have to experience the genius of Pastry Chef Astrid Gutsche. 

I had the hot fudge filled bunuelos... they may have taken them off the menu, but I would come back in a heartbeat if they bring em back.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Fine, just fine.  Service was fine, food was fine, nothing stood out, nothing made me want to come back.

The cebiche mixto was actually pretty tasty -- large, fresh pieces of seafood and a creamy, sweet aji sauce.  The corazon anticucho (beef heart skewers) was flavored nicely, but very tough and gamey (though maybe I just don't particularly like beef heart.)  I ordered the arroz limeno, which tasted a little like a soggy paella.  Still tasted good--even bad paella can be tasty--but not memorable at all.  

In short, everything was passable.  Food was passable, service was passable, nothing was outstanding.  I went to Peru when I was in college and was blown away by how amazing their cuisine is.  La Mar was a fine imitation at five times the price.
author: Matt Y.

description: Disappointing!   Our waiter kept forgetting our drink order, food was lukewarm, it was just plain disappointing!   What happened?  Thought it was supposed to be great.  So sad.
author: K G.

description: I came here for SF Restaurant Week 2015 with my boyfriend and am so happy we tried this place. It's walking distance from the Ferry Building and has a great view of the city (if you sit in the bar area). The waitress recommended the special drink (pear-sage concoction), which I decided to order and LOVED. It had the perfect amount of alcohol and fruit/whatever goodness is in there. They start you off with a side of sweet potato and regular potato chips, paired with this spicy sauce that goes perfectly with it. My boyfriend ordered the 3 course meal from the restaurant week menu, and I got the lomo saltado. Highly recommend the lomo saltado - it's really tender and the sauce that it comes in is great! Lastly, the dessert.... the dessert (this cookie) that came in the 3 course meal was SO good. It's really rich and our waitress even told us that she had other customers order the whole $40 3-course meal just to get the dessert!
author: Katarina D.

description:
Kinda expensive as before but service was great. Six of us and fast service because end of the night. 
Cebiche and Causa were exquisite and we tried a lot of them. Empanadas not great at all. Skewers con Carne well cooked. Corazón tough. Setting of the restaurant is nice. Good place for visitors as the location is great. Hostess could definitively be better with a twist of humor
author: Christophe K.

description:
NYE at La Mar, oh yes!

They did a great job accommodating our large group on a very busy night.

The food was delicious but some of the portions were small.  There were ups and downs to the meal.  For example; we were served an amazing and crab appetizer that had a wonderful presentation, but it was followed a little later with a very simple salad that looked like it came out of a bag.  The Ceviche dish was tasty and had large chunks of fish.  
One negative thing was that  they forgot to serve 2 of the dishes of our multi course family style menu but they did reimburse the price difference.  
I had a great time and we had a great view of the fireworks.
author: Robert S.

description: I came back here for another client lunch and really loved everything I had. Of course the empanadas and ceviches are outstanding. The first time I was here, my main course left a little to be desired but this time, I was wowed. I had the fish sandwich which for a fish sandwich, I wasn't expecting a whole lot but it was outstanding. It had a super crispy panko crust, moist tender inside and a slaw and pickled onion that added a tangy element to cut through the fried fish perfectly. I still think about that sandwich to this day. I'll definitely be back.
author: Shariyah M.

description:
I so want to like this place, at times it has it all, food, service, ambiance, and presentation.  Other times it lacks all those things.

La Mar is too many things at the same time.  Its a bar (front area), its a raw bar (middle area) and its a fine dining destination (back area).  Trying to be everything to all is a tall order and expectations are too high.  My suggestion is to focus on its core mission and that is food and build around that.
author: G R.

description: Drinks are amazing! Food is always good too! Only draw back is the ambiance...it has amazing waterfront view... but somehow the bright lights remind me of a dinner....
author: Trudy N.

description:
La Mar's colorful, classy, and lively restaurant was the perfect pick for a fun birthday dinner party. Upon walking in the Pier's double doors, you know you're in for a good time. The spacious  building houses several different seating areas for any Peruvian party size. Bright hues of green, orange, and blue welcome you as you take your seat. Cocktail list is extensive - the house specialty features the unique pisco sour, a must try for the "authentic" Peruvian meal. The menu is separated into two parts: first with Peruvian tapas: ceviche, causas, and other delicacies, second with traditional appetizers, sopas, and main courses. It's fun to pick and choose from the wide array of delicious options and sample several different treats. Share and socialize as you enjoy a series of sea creatures :)

The wait staff is attentive, knowledgeable, and fun loving - for our large party of 9, they served us like royalty. At this unique and enjoyable restaurant, you will get a lesson in fine south American dining as well as a full belly. Don't be afraid to branch out and try something new (maybe even purple) while dining at La Mar - you will be pleasantly surprised! Que Bueno!
author: Caroline J.

description: We met up with a friend to eat here for dinner, and even on a Saturday night, we were able to find a place to sit at a table near the bar within 10 minutes of getting there. The food is absolutely brilliant. I judge food at restaurants based on if it's better than anything I could make at home and how good the sauces are. The sauces that came with the food and with the plantain starters were all delicious. We ordered a bunch of ceviche and I had the sampler with blocks of mashed potato under a variety of toppings. I always knew I loved Peruvian food, but I never thought I could enjoy ceviche so much. It was very expensive, and the bathrooms weren't very readily available. Other than that, this is a place I would definitely come back for ceviche.
author: Anusha M.

description:
We didn't make a reservation here, but decide to walk in and got seated right away at the bar. 

Our eyes were bigger than our stomach, but everything on the menu looked so good! Ultimately, we decided to start off with the ceviche tasting which consisted of mahi mahi, calamari, and octopus in four different aji sauces, mixed with cilantro and onions.  I liked how each tasting was so fresh and lite. 

The seco de cordero- braised lamb shank, served with smashed rice and bean with cilantro sauce was my favorite for the evening. Cooked to perfection, the meat was so tender it fell right off the bone.  We also had one of their regional rice dishes- the arroz norteno with calamari, mussels, clams and prawns with fried rice in a spicy ají sauce.  So much seafood in one dish.......it was a mouthful! The chalanita came with a total of twelve tasting portions of potatoes (causas) pressed into bite size dumpling-like pieces.  Three pieces of each of the four types of causas were served: Limeña, Criolla, Nikei and Vegetariana. I got bored of the consistency of the causas after just eating a few pieces. I probably wouldn't order this dish again. 

Even before finishing the main dishes, we had our eyes on the Picarones- a fried dough in a shape that resembled a doughnut, filled with pumpkin and spices, served with chancaca honey. Since it is one of the most favorite Peruvian desserts we had to try it, and it was not a disappointment at all. 

Overall, waiters were knowledgeable about the food, attentive service, lovely atmosphere.  The dishes had a Japanese/Asian influence....the raw fish, sesame, lots of onions, rice dishes. If you're a big seafood person, this place is worth a try! 

If you read their menu, there seems to be so much history involved in Peruvian food...it makes you appreciate the food that much more knowing what and how the dishes came about.
author: Lisa C.

description: My wife and I visited Lima Peru last year and everyone kept telling us, La Mar Cebicheria in Miraflores, which turned out to be the best meal of our Peruvian holiday...5 stars!!!!! This year while on a short weekend trip to San Fransisco my wife and I were excited to come here to La Mar for the Cebiche Clasico and pisco sours. It was good, not great...but how can you ever compare to the original? Here we had 2 orders of the Cebiche Clasico, 1 of the Cebiche Mixto, 1 of the the Fried Calamari from the happy hour menu. Then off to dinner; 2 orders of Tiradito Cremoso (excellent) and the Lomo Saltado, plus around a dozen Pisco Sours. Service was good/ordinary, location and atmosphere the same. I would recommend coming here if you will never visit Peru, as this is a famous Chef owned restaurant with modern-original Peruvian dishes. However if your a foodie who really appreciates unique atmosphere coupled with authentic dishes, or if you haven't visited the original La Mar, it's not going to be impressive.
author: Jason O.

description:
Solid place for Happy Hour in the Embarcadero.  Came here twice with friends.  First time was on purpose and the second was b/c the line at Hog Island was atrocious.  Haven't been here for dinner yet, although I hear it's quite good.

I think the pisco sour is overrated, even though it's on the 7x7 list.  I would definitely go with the caipirinha instead.  It's refreshing and slightly sweet, just perfect.  I had the rollo fashion, SO YUM and awesome at $4, and the cebichin mixto, which is basically a combo ceviche with shrimp, fish and calamari. 

It's a great little place to go with friends for an after work catch up sesh.  Only down side is that happy hour ends at 6 :(  So you gotta order quick, but they let you pre-order drinks, and stagger serving it to you which is nice.
author: Sarah C.

description:
The sebiche sampler was amazing - best I've ever had and would go back here just for it.
The portions are tiny - the beef kabob was $16 - one kabob.
I also had one problem with the service: I ordered a Peruvian beer to try (hey when else do you eat Peruvian?) and was served a Japanese white beer instead and told "it's pretty much the same thing."  To make that worse, I was charged for the 3-times-as-expensive Japan beer that I didn't order.  However the server fixed the charge upon asking.  All in all, a minor hickup in an otherwise great meal!
author: Brian Z.

description: This was great date night and unexpected too. We made a last minute decision to go this place without a reservation and found that the wait was too long. We popped into the first come first serve seating at the bar and ended up loving the impromptu plans. The drinks were great and the food is salty hearty fresh deliciousness. While sitting at the bar, we must have seen the bartender make 20 of these white drinks which had a Peruvian liquor and egg whites. We didn't order it this go around but apparently it was a hit amongst the other patrons. We will be back again soon to give it a try!
author: Jay Z.

description: Took my wife here past Valentine, so now I want to give your opinion about this place. It's pretty big. The ambient is pretty nice too. Got seated in 5 min and of course we had a reservation.  Wife ordered cabiche sampler and  a whole fried trout and I forgot what I got, but I still remember that we were pleased. I love their pisco sour drink.....And yes , they have a nice outside patio seating area over looking to the famous SF GG and Bay bridge. It's at the pier of course...
author: Ben B.

description:
I had an amazing meal at La Mar.  First with a Pisco Sour and then the server picked out a great bottle of wine for us to go with our meal.  Our server was awesome and it made the experience that much better. 
Ceviche was perfect.  The Quinoa salad was delicious and refreshing. Empanadas killed it and then topped off with Arroz Jugoso that was like a tasty paella.  Oh, and the best of all was the tasty pie de limon dessert!  Oh so good.
author: Jason M.

description: kicking pisco sour. Though it's in a touristy area, I still love this place. It's by the water, where you can stroll Embarcadero and check out the Bay lights and the food is really good. I loved their steamed fish and the way they flavor the rice. You'll fit in dressed up or casual and place is lively :P Arguably the most unique spicy restaurant on the stretch with piers.
author: Emm C.

description:
Nice presentation and beautiful food and location on the water.  Service needs an improvement. We went for lunch and not very busy. Took over 5 minutes for a server to show up. 
A bit over priced for what you get.
author: Matt R.

description: Had empanadas and a pisco sour. $40.00 empanadas were dry and the pisco sour was so tiny. It may as well have come in a shot glass. Will not return here.
author: David R.

description:
Top Reasons to Come Here: 
1. Pier 1/2 has a free public boat dock, which is right behind the restaurant!
2. Great Happy Hour Specials! Such as $5 Sangria (delicious!), $3 Beers, and $5 Cebiche. 
Although if you walk in here wearing boat attire - you will not blend in very well!  Most people seem to be coming to Happy Hour straight from FIDI. 
If it's sunny and warm enough- they have a pretty nice deck in the back that overlooks the water.
author: T K.

description:
Best seafood restaurant in San Francisco! Start with their Pisco Sour cocktails, then a wonderful ceviche! Amazing Peruvian cuisine that is now considered to be the best in the world. You can't miss with their causas, anticuchos and empanadas.

If you have not tried Peruvian cuisine, you haven't tested the best food in the world.
author: William M.

description:
La Mar was the most incredible ceviche experience of my life, right up tere with Fresca. Everything was unbelievably fresh with complex flavors and spices. 

The most memorable dish, surprisingly, was the octopus skewers. I had this beast once before at a sushi restaurant and didn't care much for it, but La Mar grills it and keeps it tender and delicate. An amazing treat. 

The pisco sours are fantastic, be sure to order one. Interesting wine list with lots of good selections from Spain and South America. 

The location and space are trendy but welcoming and the wait staff is very knowledgeable about every dish. 

I can't wait to go back.
author: Andrew K.

description:
My friend and I snuck in here before happy hour ended and were able to grab a couple of seats at the bar.  I tried the pisco sour just because my friend was on a mission to check down her 7x7 list, but I thought it was okay.  I decided to stick w/ the caipirnha for the rest of the time.  We shared some empanadas, ceviche classico, ceviche mixto, causushi limena, and a few other things.  All of the dishes ended up being really good, but don't expect to be full.  

Our bartender was really cool too.  I forgot his name, but he was a nice guy and let us get in an extra order of drinks before happy hour ended.  The rest of the place looked pretty spacious, but we stuck around in the bar area before heading out for some actual dinner.

Good spot for happy hour if you can get a seat.
author: Tom Y.

description: Haven't been here in awhile and decided to take my coworker here for his birthday.  Food is delicious - I had the opportunity to sample the chicken causa (potato), classic cebiche, mussels and sorbet for dessert.  All the flavors are well balanced, fresh fish and ingredients.  Coworkers' dishes looked perfect too, love the presentation - full of color especially the different color potatoes.  Love the atmosphere - very cool and nice Latin music in the background.  Definitely a great place to check out.
author: Regina N.

description: This was a great place for my birthday lunch. My fave is seafood so they got bonus points off that bat. The Causa Limeña is what we started with, it was so delicious the crab just melted it your mouth. The anticucho de corazon was super tender and flavorful. The service was really good and drinks were on point, although I thought the sangria was too sweet, the others in my party liked it. Only thing that bugged me was the waiter seemed a little pushy as to what we were ordering, I felt like he thought we weren't ordering enough. That's tough to say when you're spending over 100 bucks a person...jeez...lol...but overall, it was great and we will be back :)
author: Liz T.

description:
I was fortunate enough to be invited to the rehearsal dinner of the new Gaston Acurio cevicheria in SF. The location, at Pier 1 1/2, just north of the Ferry Bldg, is gorgeous. You walk down the Embarcadero and enter the historic building, with a hopping Pisco bar just next to the greeting station. Through the doors is the main restaurant, with huge, high ceilings, open kitchen, and casual elegant seating. 

The Pisco drink menu has a dozen variations on the Peruvian brandy. I had one made with chicha morada, an infusion of purple corn cooked with apples, cinnamon and other goodies. It was delicious, and strong!

The dinner menu has 5 pages of creations that could only come from Peru: ceviches in 7 different flavors, tiraditos (sashimi), causas (cold pureed potatoes topped with fish or vegetables), a dozen appetizers, soups, stews, rices, and entrees. The explanations on the menu are simple, fun, and full of Peruvian ingredients. 

La Mar is more than a traditional cevicheria, as they also serve meat and vegetarian meals, taken, I understand it, from the menu of Astrid y Gaston's in Lima. So everyone can find something delicious, new and fun.

We tried a ceviche sampler and a causa sampler, both of which were exquisite. Many of the sauces are made with Peruvian peppers, and while they've toned it down for Americans, I discovered a small yellow chili that knocked my tastebuds for a loop. But I'm a wimp. Most people will love the spice and ask for more.

We also shared an entree called Sudado Limeno. This is a broth made from clams, mussels and a mild chili called amarillo, served in a clay pot. It is the perfect balance of sea and earth: the stock tastes of the ocean, swimming with salt and seafood, while the peppers and herbs keep the land in sight, so you float on the flavors, waves of taste washing over you. Paradise!

Save room for dessert, too, because there's an entire page of treats, from picarones (pumpkin fritters) to creme caramels. We tried the Clasico Suspiro Limeno, a dulce de leche mousse that was like sipping a freshly made caramel, and the maiz morado, a creme brulee made with chicha morada (that purple corn & fruit compote).

Although we couldn't have eaten another bite, the food was not heavy, just marvelously satisfying. And healthy.

The service was outstanding. We were greeted as new friends, and our waitress, Carlotta, was thrilled to be working in a restaurant of her home cuisine. She, and all of the staff, were excited to be ready for the opening. Since the kitchen is open, you can see what's happening. I was lucky enough to sit near it, and the energy was fabulous--at least 20 people were working fast and moving around each other, flames were shooting up from saute pans, sauces were poured, stock was stirred, plates were arranged--and not once in the hours I was there did anything seem amiss or even strained.

Every detail has been seen to well--the tables and chairs are perfectly balanced between casual and elegant, the table service is simple and beautiful, the staff are dressed so you can recognize their roles immediately (cooks with black hats, bussing staff in all black, table servers in white shirts with black vests). 

All in all a fabulous experience, and since the menu is so large and varied, I'll be back many, many times, with many, many people.
author: Renee B.

description: Very large selection of Peruvian dishes.  You will want to order a lot of things and end up having too much food and a lighter wallet.  Food is excellent and the dining area is  large and bright.  VERY busy, and as a result, the service lacks just a bit.  I saw a server open a bottle of wine at a table and smell the cork in front of the patrons.  If you want to sample great Peruvian cuisine, this is the place.
author: John K.

description: This place is awesome. The food is beautiful and also tasteful. You can watch the chefs making them. Very innovative, colorful dishes.
author: Ashley C.

description: Im a little torn about this place... It is beautifully done, spent tons of money on decor and renovation, maybe too much... makes you wonder where the $ came from?  food is okay, not true to peruvian cuisine as much as cheaper, low key venues around the city... But the location is so beautiful and the decor so nice it makes it feel like a special night out.
author: john s.

description:
Wow!

We came here for lunch today. Despite the gloomy weather, we still enjoyed a nice view of the ocean.

Can I just say that La Mar has the most incredible ceviche. It was so incredibly fresh and bursting full of flavor! One of my favorite dishes were the causas (whipped potatoes with various toppings). We had a serving of the causa sampler and the dungeness crab was the best of them all! Everything was unbelievably fresh with complex flavors. I enjoyed every last bite~!

They definitely have a wide variety of wines to choose from, many selections from Spain. However, despite the temptations, I am always loyal to my moscato wine.

They are conveniently located on pier 1 (i believe), close to embarcadero 3. The wait staff is very knowledgeable about every dish, which I love because I was so overwhelmed with all the delicious appetizers.

I will definitely be returning soon!!

Lunch tomorrow, anyone??
author: Linda P.

description: Really good ceviches! I had a ceviche sampler, a quinoa salad, and passion fruit chocolate mousse. The ceviche was just perfect, the quinoa salad had a terrific contemporary twist, and the mousse was to die for. Oh, and the service was as good as the food! I had a great night!
author: Steven R.

description: Great location. Very hard to find a better address.  Food is tasty but is prob the priciest Peruvian food you're gonna find. Ceviche is awesome but petite. Yellow Tail- Don't think any other rest will have that as the fish featured in their ceviche. the best fish you can get. i prefer to visit at Happy hour. 3-6 daily.  Their Chicharon sandwich is awesome. And the rest of the HH plates are tapa sized, small and tasty.  This Peruvian restaurant is by far the nicest setting of any is sf.  I come here to enjoy the setting, bevs and not to fill my face/belly.
author: Fred V.

description:
Tip: sit outside - it's beautiful.

Been here twice, for both brunch and dinner. I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the service wasn't the best - the hosts were a little rude, and it was hard to get the server's attention.

LOVE LOVE LOVE the plantain chips with both the dipping sauces (the potato chips are so-so)

Definitely order:
1. Salmon Fusion - AMAZING! perfect red curry flavor, but not too much coconut milk and not too runny
2. Pulpo - the grilled octopus was yum, but the olive aioli, chimmichurri and potatoes were perfect complements
3. Quinoa and Scallops 

Didn't blow me away:
1. Lomo Saltado - though the meat was delicious, this was your average beef stir-fry
2. Empanada Sampler - these weren't bad, but I've had better. Out of the three, the sweet conr was my favorite
3. Cebiche Nikei - I love ahi tuna, but what I didn't love about this dish was that there were a little too many red onions and it was too watery for me
author: Gia K.

description:
Went with a table of 8 foodies so we literally got to taste almost every dish:
Appetizers:
cebiche mixto - very fresh; lime overwhelms the flavors - the corn is the highlight
empanadas de aji de gallina - the aji de gallina is a very creamy, almost curry-like flavor... amazing slow simmered pulled chicken in an empanada (fluffy not crunchy) and the sauce on the side is ok - would have liked something more spicy

Main Courses: 
ají de gallina - Again the slow cooked chicken is really just amazing... it comes with white rice (bleck) but it's just fine by itself... amazing dish
atún - ahi tuna (about 3 oz) paired with these amazing purple potatoes (about 2 oz). Not worth $30... it was the smallest plate and I believe the most expensive. 
cordero - lamb shanks, mmmm, who doesn't love a good slow-braised lamb shank on fluffy risotto? Yeah big dish worth the price
arroz jugoso - large jambalaya-like rice plate with shrimp, mussels, clams, and other seafood... very yummy and flavorfull, spicy but not "hot" spicy. 
jalea- basically a different ceviche version of the appetizer. It was good, but no different really. 
chupe de camarones - beautiful soup... seriously. The look, the smell, the whole she-bang... beautiful soup. 

Dessert - Picarones - warm doughnut-like "fritters" which tasted like plantains or bananas but they were made from pumpkin and yams I guess... hm, anyhow they were just right. Sweet, not over the top. Dip was a dark honey - almost tasted like chocolate a little. :)

Drinks? Well they have some beautiful Spanish wines... although the bartender is unhelpful and doesn't know anything about them. lol. In fact he happened to think a Pinot was a white wine... hm. 

Anyhow, they were ok in service - had to remind the waiter 3 times (or maybe more) that it was our lady of the evening's bday in order to get a dessert. They also didn't comp a drink which was split on behalf of a clumsy waiter (which we had to ask for a replacement - when it was initially his error). On a $500 bill I would have hoped for better service.
author: Melzie C.

description:
Going to La Mar was like a first date with a really hot, but boring guy. Throughout the date, you're enamored by the look, but afterward, you realize he wasn't all that interesting.

I wanted to love you, La Mar.  Instead, let's just be friends, ok?  At least so I can keep coming back for more of the yummy passion andina cocktail. God, I could have 4 of those (oh wait, I did...)

Cebiche clasico - meh, whatevs
Empandada sampler - good, not great
Lomo saltido - decent enough...but small portion

Yes please to everything on the dessert menu!!!
author: Susan L.

description:
I don't think this place was worth the money. That being said the food is really great, the service was very good. 

We got the cebicha classico, which is a halibut cebicha.

Then we had the causas with tuna tartar. That was a great bite of food and wanted more! The tuna tartar was amazing and the whipped yucca was nice and fluffy. For an entree I had the halibut in tamarind sauce which was served over mashed potatoes. It was good, but nothing I would return to the restaurant for.
author: Brandon R.

description:
i'm a huge fan of ceviche so i figured i'd give this place a shot and was disapointed. You're only paying for the location.
Piquoes is much better.
author: Layla L.

description:
Wow, the food here is amazing! YUM!  I was torn between a few dishes and our waiter was super helpful in his recommendations.  I ended up going with the lomo saltado (one of my go-to dishes). Oh my goodness... it was so flavorful! The only thing I would have liked was that there were a few more pieces of beef in the dish. The balance between the beef and veggies in the dish was skewed to the veggie side. My friend got a dish that was similar to a seafood paella. He loved it & ate it all up!

The chips and dipping sauce provided was very tasty.  We shared an appetizer - I believe it was the Causa limena (forgive my spelling)- basically dungeness crab on top of mashed potato pile with green and yellow sauces. I am not doing the description justice, but wow- it was gorgeous to look at and even better to eat. A mix of many flavors - so decadent. The food was so good, we had no room for dessert. Although, if they had had an alfajor on the dessert menu, I would have jumped at it. (For those who don't know what that it, it's a dulce de leche cookie which if made right, can be one of the most amazing off-the-hook desserts there is.... even better than chocolate & I'm a huge chocolate fan!) 

The one thing that some folks may not like is if you have a small party of 2-4, like us (a party of 2), you tend to be right on top of your neighbors. This is in the interior of the restaurant- not sure what the outside seating is like.  You could really meet some fun & interesting neighboring diners that way & intrude on overhearing conversations unintentionally.
author: Tara R.

description:
We went on Thursday after work for drinks and snacks.

Good food and ambiance but don't go if you're short on time. It was busy but it wasn't jam packed. And it didn't seem understaffed either, but service was TERRIBLE.

We saw our waiter every 10 minutes, even after we specifically asked others to go find our waiter. Oh and it took 15 minutes for him to process credit card payment after he picked it up.

Can't say enough about the food but won't be coming back too often because of service.
author: M L.

description: Food is good service is not. I ordered the mixto ceviche followed by the mixto skewer entree. The food was really good and very flavorful, however our waiter was non existent for most of the meal and very un attentive. I also ordered a side of steamed plain vegetables which I was assured would be as so, they came to me drenched in soy sauce... waiter clearly didn't listen to me.
author: Jaime M.

description:
Locals beware: this place is a touristy ripoff. 

Though the food looks elaborate and exotic, it's mostly bland and incredibly over-priced. 

The worst part is they take advantage by ordering for you.

And when they do, you can rely on your waiter to direct you to the most expensive dishes. They do it every time. 

The $12 cocktails are way too sweet. Stick with beer or wine.

I've eaten at La Mar four times over four years (when it was new, it was less expensive and they didn't pull the "let me order for you" stunt).

I will not be returning.
author: San M.

description: Had Father's Day lunch and what a treat!  We had so much fun trying all the new food items.  We had the cebiche mixto- excellent.  The empanadas were probably our favorite.  We tried the sampler then had another chicken and mushroom empanada since we enjoyed them so much.  Then we had the anitcucho mixto.  Another treat!  And finally, we tried the causas.  We did a variety of them as well.  And once again, we loved them.  Atmosphere was great!  Our waiter was wonderful explaining all the food items to us.  Drinks were fun.  Just an awesome place to relax, enjoy good company in a great location with an amazing view.  Been to the city many times and have missed out on this treasure.
author: Patti A.

description:
OMG! This place was incredible! The spice and the citrus of the Cebiche is so delectable. We had the combo plate with the Clásico, Mixto, Chalaco, and Nikei Cebiche plates. It's the the best option. I also ordered the Causa Limeña. Amazing! The Carne Anticuchos also super fantastical. I can't wait to dine here again. 

oh yeah, the interior is lovely and the the patio is very nice also.
The restaurant features an open kitchen design. Its nice to see your food coming!
author: Kameelah R.

description:
La Mar is an amazing restaurant when it's nice outside. Call well in advance if you want to attempt to snag a table outside (there are plenty of great nearby spots if you want to kill an hour before your table is ready, I recommend Slanted Door).

It's a great restaurant to share food with if you're on a date, there is also nearby parking.
author: Jason M.

description:
I came here with 2 tax professionals and 2 other girls interviewing for a Big 4 firm. We came here for our pre-interview dinner where the firm wines and dines us to try to get us to sign with the firm. 

We could get drinks, but since I am still underage, I got a drink recommended by the waitress - the chicha morada. She described it as a virgin sangria. Sounds good to me. It was quite weird since it was made with corn, but the spices within it were delicious. 

We started out with 3 different sampler type dishes. 
cebiche tasting - This included the Mixto, Chifa, Nikei and Clásico cebiches. All of them were delicious. I really don't remember which was which, but my favorite was the Nikei and the Clasico ones. Get it if you can.
causa tasting - This included the Limeña, Criolla, Nikei, Casera causas. causas are apparently mashed potato type things and they have a great topping. I tasted the Limeña one and it was delicious! 
empanada sampler - The 4 different empanadas were amazing. I loved the beef one that I had tried. 

As for the main dish, I tried the arroz norteño and it was delicious. All the different types of seafood worked well together, but really, it was too much food. I barely finished my dish, but the seafood plus rice was amazing. I would totally go back just to get that dish itself. 

For dessert, we got the picarones which were this pumpkin, sweet potato donut looking items. The honey that went with it was great too. The whole dessert just tasted like fall. We also got the buñuelos de chocolate which were this puffs filled with chocolate and oh so yummy.  Breaking open the puff and then the warm chocolate oozes out - my favorite part. The ice cream was really good as well. The banana and passionfruit surprisingly works well together. 

Overall, I had a great time at the restaurant. The waitress was knowledgeable with her foods and we all ate wonderfully. I would totally go back with friends and try other things and drink - when I finally can.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Had a lovely dinner here last night w/2 of my girlfriends. This place has that whole Miami feel because of lighting and color decor in their dining area. Very spacious, high ceiling, open kitchen, and beautiful people. 

Food: We shared the cebiche tastings. My fave was the the clasico w/ halibut. I second the Ahi tuna just because i love ahi poke. As for my main course, I ordered the Arroz Criolo it was excellent. We ordered one round of the Pisco Sour Andina and that was the yummiest drink I've ever had. Then we ordered a bottle of Verdejo, Rueda white wine. To finish off we got a dessert wine "La Playa" loved the name. lol! Our host was the best, he gave each one of us a house special dessert. 

Overall, my first experience at La Mar is a memorable one. I love how our host accommodated our post birthday celebration by offering complimentary dessert (cream puff dipped in chocolate, side of vanilla ice cream). He was very knowledgeable with the menu...Thanks Nick ;)
author: Maria S.

description: You cannot leave without trying their ceviche. I've tried all of them and can't decide which one I love best. So freaking good!
author: Andrea O.

description: Great service. Pretty venue. Has a southern plantation home feel to it with the large windows and bright sunlight. Food are good but over priced for sure. Ceviche sampler was good. But I've had better. No worth the 34 dollars. Causa sampler was interesting. Had a variety of topping son mash potatoes. Exquisite display, taste good, but nothing extraordinary. Not cheap either. Probably wouldn't come back again for the price.
author: Carrie T.

description:
I've been here on multiple occasions, once for my birthday, business meeting, and to show an out of towner around. 

La Mar never fails to impress with attentive waitstaff, fun decor, and great food. Being an avid fan of sushi, ceviche, and raw food in general, I was thrilled to hear about a Peruvian place. 

I usually order the sampler cebiche dish since i love variety and tapa-served food. The empanadas and causas are also good and come in sampler or a single large order.

Prices are reasonable for the type of clientele it attracts but it's not a place to stuff your face. I don't have much more to say so I should probably stop in for a refresher.
author: Hannah N.

description: Ceviche and empanadas are delicious...great service and amazing location on the pier.  Highly recommended!
author: Mei T.

description:
1st time trying Peruvian food.  It was small tapas, and pricey, but tasty nonetheless!  Love that they are firm believers in sustainable seafood.
We had
- cebiche tasting
- the empanadas filled with sweet corn, cilantro, and queso fresco,salsa criolla and Huancaina Rocoto sauce
- empanadas with Pisco flambéed shiitake, crimini, and oyster mushrooms, with aji amarillo, aji panca, huacatay, and queso fresco  (SOOOOOO GOOD!)
- so giant corn, the biggest i've ever seen
-lukoma ice cream?

Service is good, but the lukoma gave me an upset stomach.  We ordered 4 more dishes but I don't remember what they were.  It's too pricey for my wallet, so as long as it's a business lunch, I'm kosher!
author: Dee H.

description: Came here years ago waiting for the ferry, returned today for the restaurant itself. Incredible food and drinks. My family loves this place and we'll come back. Doreen, our server was great and made up for the really terrible service by the hostess. We almost walked because of the hostess' attitude. Yeah, it's open seating but she was extremely condescending and not welcoming. Otherwise this place is amazing. Gotta get the all day $6 Pisco Sour!
author: Boom Y.
