With four different areas and all with their unique, decorative tastes, they manage to complement each other perfectly for almost any occasion/gathering. 

The specialty drinks here are mostly pisco based and so if that's not your thing, there is a pretty extensive wine list from South America. I tried the chi-cha tu ma and it was great (pisco, chicha morada, triple sec and passion fruit shaken and served with an orange twist). I later learned that it's one of their most popular drinks and rightfully so - very smooth and full of flavor.

As for the food, I decided to go with one of the few beef-based items on the menu - rocoto relleno. A little spicy and a little sweet nonetheless, but bursting with so much flavor. A dish this size would usually leave me feeling hungry still, but not this time (quite a feat).

Yes, this place is the new, trendy 'it place' in SF (i.e. swanky blue/green lighting at the bars) but once all said and done, this place will continue to go strong and serve a greatly ignored niche in the SF restaurant scene - great-tasting, upscale Latin food in a classy,chic venue. The salsa music playing in the background is the perfect touch for a place like this.

Fyi, lines for the bathrooms can be long - two unisex bathrooms for a place as big as this is not enough.
author: E E.

description:
My wife and I were recently entertained here by one of her reps.  The atmosphere was "nice" and the menu was fairly creative.  We were plied with a few rounds Pisco-this and Pisco-that before appetizers arrived, so my recollection of the food is a little soft for the most part.  The standout was the grilled octopus skewers with a sauce along the lines of chimichurri.  The chicken and peanut stuffed dungeness was anticipated, but did not live up to the expectations.  The wine list was dominated by Spain (a good thing). We tried three new labels, a white (ordered before I arrived), a Malbec and a Tempranillo.

Service was fine, food was fine, ambiance was fine.  I'd return on my own dime.
author: Michael F.

description: Love the atmosphere here and all the colors!!  Great pisco sours.  Ceviche is delicious, everything else ok (I prefer Fresca overall).  Pass on the causas - tastes like chalk in your throat!!
author: Anna V.

description:
I take the time to swing by Cafe La Mar for a quick healthy lunch any time I'm in the area.   The indoor courtyard is a spacious and relaxing place to chill out in the middle of a busy workday, and the food is fresh and delectable.   

I usually choose the seared ahi tuna sandwich with a fresh salad as a side and it's amazing-  fresh soft role, tangy aoli, and just slightly seared fresh fish.   A sandwich doesn't get much better or healthier.   

enjoy!
author: evan h.

description:
We had a fabulous lunch at La Mar for my mom's birthday yesterday! 

Most important, the food!  What good is a restaurant if it doesn't have character and good food to back it up?  La Mar had a wonderful menu and had more than just your average ceviche, which is what most people know about Peruvian cuisine.  

I will confess that I don't know much about Peruvian Gastronomy other than my love for ceviche, which is why I had been wanting to try out this new spot.  We didn't count on experiencing getting an education while chowing down on a great meal.  

The menu was rather diverse and a lot of fun!  It was exciting to pick out some new items.  Though, be warned, the ceviche is not what we Americanos are used to!  Despite this, the food was lovely.  Even better, our server, Melissa, was very knowledgeable about the food.  She not only understood the food and perhaps what wine to pair it with, she also had an opinion!  Most servers are neutral and will almost agree with you on anything, but Melissa was refreshingly honest about what would excite our palates and create a lasting impression.  

So, let me wax a little more about our server because she really does deserve it!  I was getting a little impatient that our food was coming out quite slow (to the point that sauces congealed a little bit by the time they arrived at our table, which meant that they had been sitting out quite a bit overlong).  Melissa did take note of this and comp'd our dessert.  Not only did she notice and take action, she also made sure that the wine my boyfriend ordered was served by the glass even though a menu change had taken place and this particular label shouldn't have been available.  Wow!  Kudos to Melissa for being attentive and intuitive.  And, Kudos to the management for being savvy.  

Mmmm...dessert...amazing!  That's all I can say because I am daydreaming about how incredibly light, but still rich and gooey, the chocolate was from the beignets.   

We were also impressed with the wine list.  While we aren't too familiar with Torrontes or Albarinos, it was nice to see other labels being presented to consumers.  It shows risk taking and a thoughtfulness about pairing certain cuisine with its regional counterparts.  

The only reason I shy away from the 5 stars is because of slowness of food service.  I don't mind lingering over my meal, but I don't think it shows well for a restaurant when food  is prepared then sits too long at the counter waiting to be served.  

Overall, a wonderful dining experience.  I would love to go back!
author: Piat O.

description:
ate at la mar last nite and...

F it, I'm going to south america today.
author: Brad C.

description:
I have been to many Peruvian restaurants in San Francisco, but this one really outdoes them all. The ambiance is really cool - it's clean, modern, interesting - great atmosphere. I loved the music they played there as well.
Delicious Pisco Sours - really, really, really tasty! Yes, they are a little expensive- but they are delicious. ($10/each)
The food - What can I say? AMAZING! We had a cebiche sampler as well as a empanada sampler - both good, but the cebiche was better. Every single ingredient tasted fresh & delicious!
Also, I had the lomo saltado - YUM YUM YUM...I know this is repetitive but it was freakin' deelish!
Our server was very pleasant and was extreemly accomodating to my fiance & friend who both have food allergies. 

It was a real pleasure to eat here and I cannot wait to do so again!
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
Love the morden setting. Ceviche was really good. drinks and main course are really good.  Nice and helpful waiter.

Will come back to try desserts.
author: Vicky F.

description:
La Mar must be reading Yelp. All the things that were previously issues for me were resolved and last night we had a lovely dinner. The portions are much bigger than they used to be and very flavorful. The wait staff was on the spot and took the time to explain options and make our dinner a good one. 

Maybe it was because it was a Tuesday instead of a Saturday.
author: Don B.

description:
location embarcadero at washington....pier side off sidewalk....la mar opens doors...busy bar scene in afterwork hours....foo-foo drinks packing wicked brandy kick....names complicated rememberance...pisco fruit punch, cholo something, chicha tu ma and such....excuse if name and spelling incorrect....lengthy wait almost one hour past agreed upon reservation time....passing time with foo-foo drink indulgence..one, two or ten...who is counting?....$thirteen for fruit punch...$eleven for other foo-foo cocktails...(after additional tax added to listed costs)...plus $extra for tip......liking word "foo-foo"....foo-foo drinks..foo-foo drink pricing...foo-foo delicious pretty girly looking drinks....drinking three sheets style with pinky out...."zane!...check this place out!"

la mar cebricheria peruana...whatever that means...gladly tasting cebriche since in name....tasting order of four...higher sweet level for one....other tastings milder....quick change of taste...with quick snack of plantain and pototo chips with trio creamy saucing dip....thick mayo-like flavored saucing....additional bites for skewered octopus tender chew....so tender, so excellent....non-tough octopus magnificant, but almost beef-like texture....tired of foo-foo seafood and going for meat....only option being lamb shank....higher salt level...fork cut tender lamb shank...braised and resting over unknown potato-like pancake....delicious!..did suck marrow from shank..mmmm...overall a fantastic dinner pricing not bad at $sixty-three per person...

foo-foo fruity drinks with pinky out, reasonably priced tasty sharing meals, beautiful largescale casual restaurant and wonderful company...
author: Hen A.

description:
Wow. First they gave us a table despite the fact that I insisted I had made a reservation on Opentable. (They have an Opentable terminal but haven't put the restaurant up on the sytem yet.) And then, when we were finished, they comped us the meal, which the waiter said they were doing in compensation for us telling them what we thought. I'll get to that, but suffice it to say that this place has a great attitude toward customer service. 

And the food's really good too! I've only been to Peru once, so I can't attest to authenticity (but it feels good that there are already restaurants in Mexico and Costa Rica in addition to Peru). A whole section on ceviche; we each had a half order each of criollo and chifa, both excellent with distinct tastes. (Recommend trying as many as possible in the tasting version.) I had the sopa parihuela and the soup itself was rich and spicy and the fish done just right. We shared the ricoto relleno, which my lunch partner found too spicy (occasioning hickups!) but I found just right. He had the atun entree, spiced and seared tuna with purple corn sesame sauce and a pineapple chalaca salsa; his complaint - not enough salsa for the volume of tuna. 

Since they comped us the meal, I didn't get a price to compare to. But I'm going to make this one a regular on my foodie itinerary!

2nd visit on 9/30: Popularity is the enemy of this restaurant. Our waiter was overwhelmed. Despite that, we didn't like him because he kept popping to tell us that he would be right with us and then didn't return. I actually went to the service bar to get my own glass of wine. Food was just as good as the first time (try the Lomo Saltado!), but service was the opposite: incompetent and inconsistent. Hope they figure out how to manage such a large restaurant soon.

Also: Note to the wise. It's a loud restaurant anyway, but don't sit near the front door if you don't want a squalling baby sound in the mix. The restaurant seems to park families with really loud babies at that one table inside the door. We thought we were saved from the first one when the family left, but the next family had an even louder baby.
author: Stewart A.

description: Awful. Terrible service; inattentive waiter forgot dishes, brought wrong ones. Dishes served cold and flavorless.
author: Michael F.

description:
What a great place for happy hours! After a long day of work and the gloomy wet weather La Mar was a great choice for drinks and food. It was a little pricey but we were not disappointed.

The atmosphere was warm, cozy with abundance of windows for natural light.

Must try their Causa Nikei; Purple potato causa with Ahi Tuna served with Nikei sauce, avocado puree, creamy ají amarillo and rocoto Huancaína sauce.

We'll be back again.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
I came back with some friends and had a great experience.  We had a cocktail at the bar and the bar tender was fun and great.   We then had to wait for our table since the hostess was not there.   We had a reservation.

We had an amazing lunch.   The albarino wine was amazing and we got a bottle.   I am addicted to the spicy tuna with the purple potatoes.  And the plantain, sweet potato and potato chips are great.   My friends had a seafood ceviche (I'm allergic) and loved it.   We also shared the steak stir fry, which was absolutely delicious.

The service was excellent this time and the last experience I had was part of the past.   We had a great time.
author: Ayelet B.

description:
In a nutshell, there's an extensive menu but many of the options contain the same basic flavors (lots of Japanese-tasting soy or teriyaki dishes, salty home-cooking style fried foods, or things containing peppers, corn and potatoes). Nothing I'd want to eat again.

Ordering is a gamble. Beware! Some of the food  is waaaay too salty (Octopus skewers = salty like jerky, inedible and chewy) and barely palatable. The night that we went, the prawns were all "turned" and we had to return 3 of our dishes that contained the vinegary, rotten shrimp. The chef tried one of the dishes and agreed, and apologized, which was nice I guess, but kind of unsettling.

The ceviches ("cebiches," whatever) were just OK. I went with a group of 6 people, so between us we all shared:

Mixto: OK - nice & fresh. The Mahi Mahi was actually pretty good.
Chifa: There was something funny about the sauce on this one. Curry??
Clasico: Again, not bad, but not great, either. Looks better in the photo.
Nikei (contained the rotten shrimp.) Sauce was hardcore teriyaki-tasting.

Nikei tiraditos: blah, more of that soy-drenched flavor. It sounds good on the menu, and supposedly has passion fruit and honey in it, but it really just tasted like teriyaki.

Causa tasting: Yuck! Four beautiful little cupcake looking things made of a base of mashed purple or sweet potatoes and topped with either crab, asparagus, tuna, or other seafood. Bummer that they did not taste any different from the stuff we'd been eating all night. Bland - doesn't taste a fraction of how good it looks.

Empanadas: blargh, like eating a bouillion cube-stuffed fried pierogie.

Octopus skewers: avoid at all costs. Burnt, dry, and SALLLLLTY!

Also, the dungeness crab stuffed with halibut and prawns was spoiled.

The dessert was equally bad: 
Fried yam donut things that tasted like fish (fried in the same oil?) came with a Dr. Pepper-reduction flavored nasty dipping sauce. haha, funny, and fun playing "guess that flavor," but disgusting.

Another dish had some kind of awful lemongrass and chile pepper yellow stuff on it that looked like deviled eggs. We had some good laughs over all the gnarly stuff that was served to us, until we got the bill. Now who's laughing...the staff at La Mar Cebicheria. 

Avoid! The decor is nice, though.
author: Heidi G.

description:
Limon and Fresca....I'm sooooooo sorry, but La Mar makes you both pale in comparison.

What an amazing menu. What a beautiful space. I've been fortunate enough to be able to dine twice during the soft opening. The dishes I've tried are the various cebiche dishes, several tiraditos (thin slices of fish, similar to sashimi - no onions), the causa sampler, empanadas, norteno fried rice, the halibut entree, and the lamb entree. These dishes are so creative and so flavorful. The cebiche is bar none, the best I've ever had - these aren't too acidic, which I find a lot of cebiches to be.  I would have liked the fried rice dish to be spicier, but the mussel and clam in it just melts in your mouth...amazing. More mussels please!

Basically, if the food is this good during the soft opening, you know it will only get better when it officially opens.

As far as alcohol, you can't go wrong with the pisco sour. YUMMY. Very refreshing and somewhat similar to a margarita - but way better. If I weren't such a lightweight, I could drink these all night. The other drink I tried is the pisco punch. This is a bit sweeter and is delicious as well (did you know this drink was made popular in San Francisco? I sure didn't!). 

Street parking around here is easy and free after 6 or 7pm. If you must, there is a parking lot directly across the street that charges a $10 flat fee at night.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Went here a few months ago, it was good.

My only complaint is that the tables in the restaurant are insanely close together - it felt a little bit awkward sitting so close to the people next to us and any lull in a conversation makes it feel like the you or others are eavesdropping.

Overall, great food, great drinks (pisco sour, as recommended by all the fellow Yelpers), and a great atmosphere.
author: Ben B.

description:
There's alot to talk about at La Mar... but I want to dedicate this ode to one of the finest dishes I've had in awhile... the "arroz norteno!"

First, its green.  Why is it green?  I don't know, but these days, green is good!  Second, it's got delicious creatures from the sea... like squid, octopus, shrimp, and muscles!  Third, it's nuclear... the aji amarillo sauce is supah tasty and glows yellow like unstable plutonium.

All told, the rice and seafood dish is excellent and has replaced the dish that I always get at peruvian restaurants, the lomo soltado.  I didn't think that steak, rice and french fries could ever be supplanted by another rival, but I suppose you can't stay on top forever.  Thank you La Mar for introducing me to the Arroz Norteno!
author: Mars O.

description:
Let me begin with saying I am Peruvian and very critical of food from my motherland.  With that being said, I was pleasantly surprised.

The location is perfect, and the outdoor seating available makes it even a better choice on a beautiful day.  They have a small bar on the way in, and then a bar inside that wraps around the kitchen.  The restaurant is full of color and is very modern looking.  The staff was very friendly and attentive, making great recommendations for what we should try for our first experience.

I started by ordering a Pisco Sour, the flagship drink of Peru, which to my surprise was made correctly and served in the right glass.  I knew the food was going to be amazing after this good start.  They came to the table with chips and dipping sauces.  My favorite was the papa a la huancaina sauce which was not to cheesy and also not to thick.

We started with a sampler of three cebiches (Mixto, Clasico, and Nikei).  The mixto and clasico were traditional chebiches you find in Peru.  Full of flavor and you could definitely feel the freshness of the products.  They had just the right spice to them, and the presentation was very nice.  The Nikei was made with tuna and avocado, a surprise combination for a Peruvian.  It was definitely something different, nothing you will find in a traditional Peruvian restaurant, but a good option to have something different.  My only complaint is that the portions were VERY small, but the price was not.

As my main course, I had a very traditional selection in Lomo Saltado.  The beef tenderloin was very soft and cooked to perfection!  The taste of the fresh cilantro, garlic, aji amarillo, and onions brought back many childhood memories of all the lomo saltado's I had with my grandmother at all the restaurants she use to take me to in Lima. 

Overall, lunch for two did come out to $100 and the portions of the food are a little small.  For us Peruvians who are use to eating big portions for less than $10 a plate, stay away from this place.  But for a nice evening out, or to show your friends some of the wonders of Peruvian cuisine, La mar is an excellent new location in San Francisco.
author: Jose C.

description:
I can say after two visits to La Mar's soft opening week, that I would go back in a heartbeat. Walking in, you are immediately warmed up by the colors in the lounge and ceviche bar area. The elemental hues set the tone for a comfortable and lush experience.  The service was very attentive and friendly, with great food and drink suggestions. 

The menu was full of items that jumped off the page and I can't wait to go back and try more. The sampler cebiche is a must-try if you are new to cebiche or want to become familiar with La Mar's range in flavor. My favorite of the 4 types of ceviche that come with the sample dish was the Chifa, a chinese-style leche de tigre. The other flavors were fantastic too, this one just stood out as having the most texture and freshest taste.

For a main course I tried the seared ahi tuna (Atun), and my date had the Halibut. Both were brilliant in taste and presentation. During the second trip to La Mar, I was with a bigger group and was able to try several other main courses. The most notable was the beef dish, the Lomo Saltado. The description from the menu says "Traditional Peruvian style stir-fry of sauteed beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce, garlic, aji amarillo with fried potatoes and rice." All I can say is order it if you love meat, you will not be disappointed!

My favorite drink was the Pisco punch, it had fresh fruit in it along with some other great tastes. I also tried the Pisco sour, and about 8 others! This place has lots of new things to try, so I suggest going there hungry and thirsty.

For dessert, the hands down favorite was the Bunuelos de Chocolate. They are like little chocolate fritters covered in a delicate batter and lightly fried. So tasty! Also of note was the Tiramisu and Creme Brulee, order them all.

See you on the patio!
author: Dave M.

description: Excellent atmosphere. We enjoyed sitting out on the patio on a sunny day. Service was a bit slow but incredibly friendly. We tried the mixed plate of ceviche and enjoyed the variety of flavors. Drink special was delicious and refreshing. Also shared a mixed seafood grill, everything was very fresh and tasty. Would love to go back and try everything on the menu :-)
author: Michelle M.

description:
I made reservations at 8pm. We got there early at 730pm, and we were seated right away. As the hostess sat us down, I hear the waiter say "I can't take anymore tables". Then we waited 15minutes without the waiter coming to our table to say at least I will be with you guys in a minute. So we walked out and informed the hostess about the horrible service. All she can say is ooooooo I'm so sorry, when u guys come back, we will make it up to you. There's no way in hell 
that we will come back here. In boston, going to up scale restaurant, we had no problems at all, I guess la mar is not considered up scale.
author: Jason K.

description:
Order about three half orders of Cebiche and you'll be three times as happy. Excellent selection of fresh ingredients and a cute atmosphere to boot - even in the scheme of what can be the overwhelming Pier area.  
* Cebiche Nikei (Ahi) took the cake - Japanese style, similar flavors to an Ahi Poke
* Peanuts make the Cebiche Chifa  (Mahi Mahi)
* The spicy mayo on the Causa Nikei (Ahi) was unlike any I've ever tried - delicious
author: Lesley R.

description:
I'd come back for drinks at the bar, but not again for dinner.

The service was poor, the entrees overpriced, and the food just wasn't that good....a lot of fried potatoes and rice (and two hairs in the potato chips).  We enjoyed the cerviches but that was about it.

All in our party of 7 were pretty much on the same page as far as the mediocre-ness of this place...
author: Greg A.

description:
As mentioned before, Limon and Fresca have nothing on La Mar! The bartender.. "tony' ..i think, awesome! Shaking that shaker with all his amor and Peruvian-ess. It's an incredible use of space, it has it all, a bar, lounge seating, cebiche bar seating, formal dining and out door space. LOVED IT, my only reason fron not giving a full 5 red stars, well I think as any soft openings, things need to be fine tuned and I can't wait to see it it full force. 
The ceviches were great, although I might like one or two from I think Fresca more (I know I know). mmm the arroz criollo ....mmmm super amazing and to finish it up, the donut like desserts were orgasmic. 

It was an amazing night and it will do well and become one of those "great sf spots". Parked in the meter space across the street after 7pm for free!!

And the drinks... well for this little MExican....it gives tequilla a run for its money..mmmm pisco.. 

Great romantic, date spot and after work groups!

I can see how the bathroom's may become an issue on a busy night. As all restrooms are co-ed and I only saw 3 in the main lobby, I could be wrong though....

Felicidades y suerte!!!
author: Gen O.

description:
Came here with visiting friends at the end of June, and I'm still thinking about it! We got the cebiche tasting (four different ceviche), the causa tasting (again, four different causa), the empanada sampler (four different empanadas...do you see a trend here?), the ensalada limena, and the lomo saltado, which is apparently both a Chinese stir-fry and a traditional dish of Peru! How odd!

My favorite was the cebiche clasico, although all the ceviche was really good. Yum yum! The causas were all my least favorite - somehow the concept of piling toppings on a dense cylinder of colored mashed potatoes just didn't work for me. 

Looking around the restaurant, the non-sampler portions of the ceviche looked fairly large, and if/when I return it'll be hard to decide whether to do the sampler again or just go for the cebiche clasico.

My friends got the bunuelos chocolate de caliente dessert, which turned out to be little round dough balls with melted chocolate in them, with ice cream. Wow! For chocolate lovers, I'd definitely recommend it, although the "banana and passion fruit" ice cream flavor only tasted like cinnamon to me.

As far as service goes, it was slow, but we didn't mind. If we had been in a hurry, it might have been more of an issue.
author: yolanda y.

description: Five stars for the food -- really great ceviche, minus one star for the service, which was lacking the last few times I've been.  Waited over an hour for our waiter to take our order last time we went.  Love the outdoor patio seating with views of the water.
author: DL M.

description: I liked our dinner experience. The food was good, the staff was friendly. The only thing that I hated was the super unorganized unisex restrooms. It works for a dive or gay bar but if you're paying $$$ for food - you shouldn't be fighting to get in the restroom.
author: P.H. D.

description: This place Rocks....one of the best recommendation some has given me for San Francisco. The choices of Cerviche' and service were excellent. The atmosphere, the people, the service, the presentation of the food, the quality of the food, and the fun all ROCKED
author: Marcel S.

description: had VERY high expectations of this place and it fell a little short. Pros: 1) the service was good. Our server was very informative, warm and checked in on us at regular intervals. 2) The food was very well prepared. We had the udon noodle stir fry and the poached halibut over mushrooms with chaufa rice. The empanadas were simply divine and the causas were beautiful little bites. The ceviche was also excellently executed, very fresh. Cons: 1) we asked for minor omissions in our entrees (no squid in one and no bean sprouts in the other) and neither entree came our correctly. 2) the restaurant was very loud. Granted, it was a Friday, but it felt like a sports bar at times. 3) they're soda's are in bottles and they charge for refills.
author: Lord Edwin C.

description:
Refreshing fun bustling atmosphere
Refreshing mostly Peruvian staff
Refreshingly unique menu
Refreshingly unique architecture/design
Perfect preparation and presentation.  Wow, and only open a few weeks!

I'd suggest having your server choose what you get.    We got the cebiche sampler with everything from classic to a more Japanese prep.  (Random trivia: Peru has a large Asian population so they have Japanese influences in their food.)  

We also got the causas sampler which are basically super soft purple and yellow potato chunks stuffed/topped with various things.  Some melt-in-your-mouth seafood; some vegetarian.

For entrees, we got grilled octopus skewers on herbed potato mash and chimichurri sauce.  They love them potatoes.  And some lamb shank cooked perfectly and with the most wonderful rich non-gamey flavor.

Nice wine list and great cocktails...Pisco Sour!

FYI - There's also a whole separate bar and lounge area from the main dining room.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Food: 4
Service: 1

I go to La Mar quite often for happy hour. But this was my first time there for dinner. Should have stuck w/ the happy hours. Was I in for a surprise last Sunday night.

First, everyone got their food but me. Apparently, the waiter gave my entree to another table. I suppose that can happen anywhere, so that's not the troublesome part. It is that the waiter did not come back to make sure everything was ok, so never even noticed it. I had to flag him down after everyone was already 1/2 way through to inquire.

Second, when my entree finally came out, it was the WRONG DISH. I told him don't bother, I don't want to wait anymore. By then, everyone was almost done w/ their meal, so I did not want to make everyone wait so I ate what I did not order.

Last but not least, our check for a group of 6 came out well in excess of $1000. That was clearly in error. And so when we questioned the bill, the waiter argued with us. It took several rounds of protests before he finally realized he was wrong.

How embarrassing. I am from the school of thought where the only thing one should remember about their meal is the food. In this case, we were so shocked by the service that it kind of put a damper on the evening. And we all vowed never to go back..
author: Jasmine C.

description:
I don't know what all the bad reviews are taking about!  This place is phenomenal!  It sounds to me like those people are just impatient and picky.  

The food was absolutely decedent! 
The service was perfect... personal and timely.  
The space was breathtaking.. I felt like I was in Peru!
Awesome vibe.  Highly recommended.

5 stars all around.
author: Marilyn H.

description:
Overrated!

The food IS good but by far, not the best ceviche I have had.  The fish is fresh though.  Their prized "leche de tigre" is not exactly unforgettable...

by far, their biggest flaw is the service!  We did not get all of our dishes served together, the waiter forgot part of our order, and it was a sub-par dining experience.
author: Melissa G.

description: We didn't get a chance to try Gaston Acurio's restaurant in Peru so we were excited about visiting La Mar Cebicheria in SF. We had reservation for 2/21 evening and arrived early, so we were asked to wait until they began seating, which was okay. Then it was seating time. The hostess couldn't pronounce my name and kept calling me by last name. When I tried to confirm that it was indeed my name she was calling, she gave me a smug face full of attitude. On the flip side, our server was great. The appetizer and empanadas were delicious. The snapper fish and steak andino were decent, but not entirely memorable. The pannacotta du lucuma (dessert) was yummy and since it was a birthday dinner, we also received a complimentary, which was really good.
author: Wil P.

description:
Although La Mar Cebicheria has not yet officially opened, those of us who are lucky to be invited to the soft opening can not rave enough about the savory food, its presentation, service and atmosphere. It has surpassed my expectations.

Gaston Acurio's high reputation restaurants in Lima and other South American countries presented a challenge for reproducing in SF. Certain traditional ingredients in the preparation of Peruvian food, such as, the tantalizing taste of its hot peppers and the diverse local sea food, which abounds in the coast of Peru, are not so easily available here. But Gaston and his dedicated team of food prepares and bartenders have proved that it is possible to succeed when pride for one's own food heritage exists. 

Gaston's vision of making Peruvian culinary treats known in San Francisco coincides with the re-emergence of Pisco, Peruvian national drink, a tasty and clear brandy that is in high demand by mixologists because of its versatility in the preparation of delicious cocktails and punches. The pisco bar in La Mar is another treat for cocktails aficionados. 

Don't miss the pisco sours along the tasty cebiches, they will bring pleasure to your palate. 

Congratulations to the food managers for bringing to San Francisco a truly Peruvian fare..
author: teresa s.

description:
Set on the water, La Mar is picturesque and the vibe is good. 

Bustling but not too loud or crowded. The wine list is solid with a nice mix of CA and Spanish wines. 

That said, the food is overpriced (although presented beautifully), the service was sub-par and overall I rather spend less, skip the view and be at a place more cozy with knowledgeable servers.
author: Nissa A.

description:
Excellent!  I especially recommend this place if:

1)  You need to impress a client (fancy, fancy...)
2)  You are on a date and want to score (very romantic)
3)  You feel like spending tons of money (you will)

Tried their cebiches, causas, empanadas for appetizers.  It's nice to get the samplers and share so you get to try a little of everything.  For the main dish, I got the cau cau, which was delicious.  It was the first time I had Peruvian food and I have to say I thoroughly enjoyed it.
author: Michelle N.

description:
all the hype was right bout this place. 

it's a pretty big place and it is pretty busy. 

Instead of bread, i love the chips they give you with 3 different dipping sauce. i can just eat that all day

*cebiche clásico 18
California Halibut in a classic leche de tigre with red onion-least fav dish out of everything i had. nothing special about this at all

*causa tasting 19
Selection of four causas: Limeña (crab), Sureña (fried shrimp), Nikei (tuna tar tar), Casera (vege)

they come on top of different color potatos. all of them were so good. my fave is the fried shrimp. gives it that extra crunch

*ensalada limeña (vegetarian) 12
Organic arugula and spinach, cherry tomato, hearts of palm,
choclo, queso fresco and balsamic dressing-just something to lighten our taste buds. i liked it a lot

*empanadas de lomo saltado 11
Skirt steak, red onions and tomato in a soy and oyster sauce-the waitress told me this was the best one. it was really good and they are pretty big. you get 2 pieces

*pescado nikei 26
Poached Alaskan Halibut over crimini mushrooms, ginger,
scallions, bean sprouts, cilantro, and hot sesame oil - served
with a side of chaufa rice- (BUT THEY HAD SEABASS INSTEAD) cooked perfectly and the rice was soooo good.
author: Karen H.

description: La Mar continues being my favorite restaurant...!!! I normally go for dinner, but most recently I've gone a couple of times at lunch and discovered their cool combo lunches. You get to taste a little bit of several things and that's a great treat because the hardest thing for me to do at La Mar is figure out what one or two things to order...I want to order everything on the menu!!! Enjoy!
author: M B.

description:
Not quite sure if I should have had the cocktails, but this place was just ok. Nothing that special. Service is trying to get it down, but they are still pretty rough. 

The space was awesome, bright, and the colors were cool. The bar did not match the other parts of the restaurant, but all in all they did a nice job. The place was really noisy, but you can't do much about that.  Note that I usually like noise, but I could not hear the person next to me, which would have been fine, if the food was all that. Unfortunately, it came a bit short. 

We ordered most of the small plates and entrees that came recommended by the server. While there were some hits, most did not even come close. The cebiche sampler was interesting enough. There was another fish sampler appetizer that we ordered, with small pieces of fish almost in a sushi presentation.  It was decent but not great.
I would stay away from the halibut entree, which was very uninspiring and bland.  The sea bass entree, which was a special, was almost like a Gordon's fish filet over a McDonalds hashbrown, topped with a fried egg.  While I think that is a cool concept, the textures were all very similar and the egg made both the fried filet and potato soggy(and not isn that good way eggs do your hasbrowns for breakfast).  They also had a fried banana on the side, which did not really mix well with the other flavors.   

All in all, probably a 3 experience, but when you pay as much as you do here, you need more than just average.  I will go back to see if things get tightened up a little bit, but as for now, just an ok experience and therefore an ok rating.
author: Kapeli M.

description: I'll have to come back here again. We ordered ceviche/cebiche and the empanada sampler, which was just ok. Also got the drink, chicha morada, made of purple corn. It was strange at first but kinda grows on you. But I must say, the pie de limon (Lime cream, lime mousse, lime sorbet, and Italian meringue with an almond crunch) in a glass was divine! Loved the lime and meringue! Will HAVE to get that again. Next time I'm going to try the entrees.
author: M K.

description:
This message is for the La Mar owners: 

Your cuisine:                         5 Stars
Your wine list/Sommelier:      5 Stars
Your bartenders:                   1 Star

With the exception of Jose and a very attentive woman whose name I didn't get,  your bartenders need to be taught some basic customer service skills.     I thought it might just be me, but on 3 separate occasions my friends and spouse noticed that we become invisible when seated at your bar.   What's up with that?
author: Fred X.

description:
I went here for a birthday dinner with a group of girlfriends and had a great time.  Service was excellent and food was very good.  The only negative was the wine list, I tried a couple of different wines and couldn't find one I liked.  I ended up having a mojito and it was very good.  

We started with the empanada tasting which was probably my favorite of the whole night.  We also tried the mahi mahi skewers and the beef stir-fry, followed by the chocolate-filled donuts for dessert.  So good!  I'd definitely go back!
author: Kim D.

description:
I walk past this place everyday from the parking lot to my office and literally witnessed it get outfitted and transformed from a shabby old building to a swanky new bar/restaurant.  I finally got a chance to check it this past Friday.

I met up with a few of my gf's for happy hour.  The service was decent but I definitely felt the new restaurant pains.  We had a few cocktails and ended up ordering dinner as well.  The chips and dipping sauces that come out to start were tasty.  We order several different ceviches.  The seafood in the ceviches was all very very fresh but I think it was overpowered by all the rich sauces.  I could barely taste the seafood.  The braised lamb tasted good but it didn't carry enough sauce and ended up being dry.  Also had the stirfried beef, which tasted good but wasn't anything that special to me.

It wasn't bad but it wasn't spectcular either.  I think they will improve over time and I would go back to check it as I think they have lots of potential.
author: Susan P.

description:
Had a late lunch in la mar today and I must say I was very impressed. When we arrived around 1:30 the restaurant was still packed but we only waited about 1 minute for a table. After reading some of the Yelp reviews I was prepared to get slapped or something by the hostesses! I think some of those negative reviews must come from their competition. From the minute we walking in the staff was cordial and welcoming!

I really loved the atmosphere of the restaurant with the high ceilings and bay views, can't wait for the patio to open.  We had a great waiter named Edson who formally worked at Fresca, he guided us through the menu and made great suggestions.  The food was excellent and I can't wait to go back with friends.  We'll still eat at Mi Lindo Peru for a casual meal but this is definitely a great addition for San Francisco's dynamic dining scene!

The bill for two was about 75 bucks including the tip which I feel is fairly reasonable for a nice lunch.
author: John M.

description: Got food poisoning from the fish. Server was M.I.A. most of the time. Had to chase manager to get check. Nobody bothered to offer coat check. Very unprofessional.
author: Eater S.

description:
Definitely a place I will return to!

We had a fantastic lunch here today. My dining companion went with the lamb and quite enjoyed but I was head-over-heels for all things seafood. i had a bit of ordering ADD so ended up with the sea bass sashimi (i'll give this just 3 stars.. a bit too fishy for my taste, but the sauces saved it.. or covered up). The ceviche with tuna was a love affair at first bite (tamarind take me away). We shared the vegetarian salad and liked the crispy presentation of quinoa therein. Also, the dipping sauces on offer with the veggie chip basket were each unique and absurd! So flavorful! I wonder if they'd let me take those home... Great service, nice cocktail selection, obviously great location. A small gripes-- had wanted to sit outside, but didn't realize that had to be included in our reservation.. so a word to the wiser!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Hosted a corp dinner here (approx 20 people).  They had a nice separate place for us which provided some privacy which was good.  They even printed the menu we chose for our team along with the company logo - extra nice touch.  Was a bit surprised that they were not as attentive in keeping out wine glasses filled all the time - this was a corp event and budget wasn't a main issue.  We should not have had to keep reminding them to fill our wine glasses.

All in all, a good and successful evening.
author: Lev E.

description:
We arrived at 6 pm yesterday - 30 minutes after opening - for our Sunday dinner at La Mar and the gigantic restaurant beautifully situated at Pier 1.5 was already half-full. 

I was struck with the radiant white, bright aqua & orange decor, which seemed more reminiscent of Miami than SF. The huge space is light & airy while maintaining a good level of warmth even on a chilly SF night. It does get a bit noisy as the night goes on, but that just gives one an excuse to lean in to one's gorgeous date. 

Our attentive waiter offered excellent recommendations and started us off with some potatoes/plantains chips with three different dips, supposedly rising in spiciness but actually all quite mild and savory.

For apps, we ordered the delicious cebiche tasting (including the Chifa, Nikei, Mixto, & Clásico). The Chifa & Nikei (Chinese and Japanese-influenced cebiche) were unlike anything I'd ever had at Fresca and truly a delicious meeting of cuisines. 

The servings were a bit small, but not smaller than I've had at a similar tasting at Fresca for example. I only wish there was some way of sopping up the delicious leche de tigre! 

For entrées we shared the Lomo Saltado [Peruvian stir-fry of sautéed beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce, garlic, aji amarillo with potato fries and rice] and the Seco de Cordero [succulent, braised lamb shank, mashed rice and bean tacu tacu, cilantro sauce]. Both the entrées were well-sized, the meat was beautifully tender, and the blend of spices delicious!

We rounded off the evening by sharing the light-as-air and yummy pumpkin fritters and mint tea. Dinner with tip came out to $110. 

We'll definitely be back!
author: Sharand N.

description:
Great place!  Not crowded, great happy hour drinks and food from 4-6, really good service, and price was relatively decent.  I hung out for 4 hours after work once and after 7-8 different drinks, about 4-5 different appetizers, my friend and split a $80 bill.  Not so bad.  

The Sangrias are delicious and potent.  I was kinda tipsy after 2, totally buzzed after 3, and -- after a drink break, water and food -- back to tipsy after 4.  The place isn't crowded and loud, so it's really easy to come here, grab a table or a place a the bar with friends, and enjoy good conversation.  

I'd for sure come back!
author: Ria D.

description:
Delish! 

Happy hour has great prices and drinks. Get there early because it gets packed. The pisco sour packs more of a punch than sangria.

Lunch was amazing! Nice patio looking out to the bay with views of Treasure Island and nearby anchored boats- would make an awesome place for a party or event. Wonderful Caribbean colors and Latin music flowing throughout the restaurant. I enjoyed the Mahi Mahi ceviche with peanuts, the Mahi Mahi skewer was delish as was the prawn salad.
author: Samantha S.

description:
I once dated a guy who was so disgusted by seafood that he would cringe whenever he was near anything that came from the sea.  Restaurants like La Mar would never exist in our realm of possible dining options but alas, I can now enjoy an entire meal of seafood without an ounce of guilt!

I dined at La Mar several months ago for lunch and had such a great dining experience that I went back with friends a day later for dinner. I couldn't get enough of the ceviche, scallops, and taraditos! I would definitely recommend the ceviche and causa tastings if you're undecided on what to order. 

If you're planning a visit to La Mar, take advantage of the restaurant's location and ask for patio seating, preferably under a heat lamp. The service was decent the first time I went, with the waiter struggling through the menu and specials. The second dining experience was much better as the waiter had an extensive knowledge of the food and an outgoing personality. I remember walking out and exclaiming, "I have a crush on how awesome our waiter is!" Of course he was standing right behind me!

Despite my moment of embarrassment, I'd definitely come back to La Mar for another fantastic meal!
author: Lan H.

description: 2 nights in San Fran and checking out La Mar was an excellent choice for one of those evening.  We heard about this place through my friend's co-worker. The service was AMAZING! Seriously, our server was so knowledgable about the menu and very friendly. The ceviche sampler was great. The empanadas were good but definitely a little too pricey for just 2 empanadas. I would go back again if I was in town.
author: Krystal R.

description:
Food was great super fresh and delicate. Drinks were really creative and strong. The place was quite spacious (I am talking about the lounge) was nice, for once you can talk without your neighbor eaves dropping on you...
Service was painfully slow... I mean we spent like 3 hours there, and it was drrrragging. We were 10 and we should have had 2 waiters.
author: Carpe D.

description: This place was ok but not great.  Some of the food was good but not amazing and the service was mediocre.  They seem to have a system where different people bring you food vs taking orders vs removing plates.  When one piece falls down, the whole system fails.  For instance, we ordered drinks when we got there and ordered appetizers about 10-15 minutes later.  We got our appetizers before our drinks.  My BF had an empty beer bottle and ordered another and the person who brought the new one, didn't take the old empty and it sat there for a while.  The waiter finally had to take it even though it wasn't his job to remove dishes.  The ceviche was good and the food overall would get a 3-4 star from me.  I think in San Francisco you can do better.
author: Becky T.

description:
This review if for an event only - 

I came for a happy hour for work and had a wonderful time!  Great drinks and AMAZING appetizers!! I was so pleased!

The only down side was that the reserved space (which was spacious and comfortable) was separate from the bar area.  Every time we wanted a drink we had to leave the room completely to go into the bar.  

Overall, great place for a cocktail, and from what I've had of the food, it's excellent!!
author: Alice H.

description:
This is my new favorite restaurant (on someone else's dime...preferably the company's). The restaurant is huge. You walk in and there is a nice bar to your right. They have happy hour during the week and it actually keeps pretty crowded. As you walk into the bar there is a large dining room that is very open and modern. Keep walking and you get to the amazing outdoor area. It's right on the water and there are tables, couches, and heat lamps. I've had lunch out here in the sun and dinner out here under the heat lamps and both experiences were incredibly.

On to the food...it is fantastic. Their ceviche is phenomenal. Actually, everything I've tried here was amazing. Last time I came we had this amazing ahi tuna and avocado starter. The tuna literally melted in your mouth. The empanadas are fun, especially the sampler with three different ones...I think it's pork, chicken and veggie. They also give you 
three different sauces to dip stuff into.

Honestly everything I've eaten here has been great. You should definitely check it out. The atmosphere, service, and food are wonderful...what more can you ask for?
author: Jackie G.

description:
Meh.

That pretty much describes my experience, which translates to two stars.  The place has potential for much more, but just going by my experience...

It is an absolutely beautiful place.  Big.  Great bar, expansive, spacious dining room.  Ambiance and decor were fantastic.

Menu seems great.  Started with the Mahi Mahi ceviche - or cebiche - which was fantastic.  Casua - traditional Peruvian whipped potato dish was pretty bland, perhaps because we got the vegetarian one.  Empanadas were OK, but nothing special.  My entree was tuna, salmon, and calamari served on a cast iron skillet.  The first few bites were great, but unfortunately the heat of the skilled cooked the tuna and salmon from a nice seared rare to dried out cubes in a matter of minutes.

When clearing the table, the waiter knocked my dinner companion's (red) wine glass so that the stem shattered and the wine exploded out in a shotgun pattern all over my friend.  She was in all black, so it didn't show, but she was drenched and smelled like wine.  They said that they were going to bring her another glass and I asked for one, too, and said something like, "that's the least you can do".  They brought one to her and not me. WTF?  Am I being a demanding dick, or did they just spill an entire glass of wine on this woman and not really feel the need to do anything for us other than replacing the wine?

Note to La Mar:  You won't always be the hot place in town, and you won't always have a wait list.  Treat people like shit now and see how loyal they are when you actually do need them.
author: craig F.

description:
This restaurant has many things going for it:  great location, great atmosphereand good food are among them. 

I loved the high ceilings, white woodwork and bright blue chairs and accents.  Even though it was crowded it felt pretty spacious.

In terms of food, everything was beautiful presented (which was nice since the food was a little on the pricey side), and very tasty.

Based on reviews by other yelpers, we and our friends tried the cebiche tasting which came with 4 different cebiches.  My favorite among those was what i believe to be the cebiche nikei, which was japanese-influenced.  We also tried the lomo empanadas which were quite good.  We also got the causa tasting and those were all very good.  They are like little towers of stiff mashed potatoes topped with seafood.  My favorites were those topped with dungeness crab and ahi tuna 

For dinner we had one of the specials (fish skewers), the lomo saltado (which was delicious), the chupe de campornes (a rich shrimp stew which was very tasty) and the cordero (braised lamb shank - was good but my least favorite of all the dishes.

For dessert we got the beignets, which were little chocolate doughnut balls, oozing hot chocolate with a little bit of vanilla ice cream.  They were out of this world.

This is a great restaurant to go with other people as you get to try more of the great food that way.

Was a great dinner out, and we would definitely recommend to others!
author: Emily W.

description: I was a little hesitant to try La Mar since I'm not a big seafood fan and don't care for spicy food or cilantro. At first glance I wasn't sure if I would like anything. But our friends loved it when they tried it last year, so I thought why not give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised. Our waitress Tildy was awesome. She was very attentive and friendly. She made great recommendations and made sure the dish I ordered was made without the cilantro. The food was delicious. Every course was wonderful including the lime dessert Tildy recommended. My friend cannot eat gluten and they have a gluten-free menu that is pretty substantial. She loved her food as well. The ambiance is very "Miami Beach" but in a classy way. It's a nice change from a lot of the restaurants in the area. I'm excited to share La Mar with friends in the future.
author: Kelly B.

description:
This usually isn't my thing.

You know; upscale looking (and pricing), exotic and located right on the embarcadero.  However, I'm glad to report that this place changed my typical expectations of a high end dining establishment that seemingly uses an ethnic association as their "thing".

First impressions can be misleading.  Had some drinks at the bar while waiting for the rest of my party.  They definitely went for a note of authenticity by having both Cristal and Cusquena available in bottles.  Unfortunately I didn't find either to be very good, but hey, when in Peru, drink as the Peruvians do.  Bar area is definitely nice and if beer isn't your thing, the samples I had of some of their Pisco drinks are quite delicious.

The plantain chips and dipping sauces are an excellent and unique starter.  The menu is pretty big and you'll probably find yourself faced with a fair amount of decisions.  I was tempted to overlook everything except the main courses (it's just my habit) but do yourself a favor and check out the whole menu.  You definitely can't go wrong with the ceviche flight.  Each one is pretty damn unique, not to mention tasty.  

The skewer selection is rather diverse as well.  I had the octopus skewers which were absolutely delicious.  They were cooked in a way that made their texture more meaty, although I do enjoy them raw too.

For a main course, I had the chicken stew, which wasn't mind blowing but it was still pretty damn good.  Some of my dining partners got the lamb and THAT was amazing.  Think of a huge piece of lamb, meat so tender it literally falls off the bone.  Luckily one of my dining partners got full and let me finish hers.

Even if I didn't eat my friends' food, I was definitely full just from what I ordered.  Everything was delicious and a real sense of effort was instill in the cuisine that we received.  I am impressed and will come back here.
author: Steven R.

description: The prices are high, the portions are small, and the food is just meh.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Gorgeous setting on the water in the Embarcadero with a lovely interior of clean, bright colors.  Ample seating, with great wait staff.  We had the traditional and the passion fruit pisco sour.  Both were excellent, but I liked the passion fruit even more.  The ceviche was like butter, and fresh!!!!  The lomo saltado was tender and delicious.  The yuca and platanos were yum!  The music was fun and had me singing along and ready to go out dancing.  That being said, I am always ready to dance and I kept it on the low since we were in a nice restaurant.  This is the best place to get Peruvian food that I have found.  I went with my Peruvian friend who concurs.  The owners are well known for their international status as chefs and for contributing to the Peruvian food Renaissance.
author: Debo F.

description:
My fiance, my brother, a friend and I went here for lunch today (a Saturday) and it was pretty  busy. We made a reservation for 1pm a couple of days ago but got there early and they were able to seat us right away. :) The ambiance was nice, the service was excellent (fast but not rushed and very polite without being stuffy) and the food was amazing! It is on the pricier side, but was oh so good! We were given a standard complimentary chips (potato, plantain and yam chips) and trio of dips starter that was pretty good, instead of the usual bread with butter and salsa that you get at most Peruvian places.

We ordered an Empanada sampler and the Cebiche Classico to share as appetizers. The emapanadas were really yummy - 1 chicken, 1 beef, 1 seafood and 1 mushroom. Yummy! The cebiche was melt in your mouth amazing. It was fresh mahi mahi with the right amount of savory and tart flavors as well as delicate layers of jalapeno and other flavors with a little bite at the end. It was soooo good -- the best cebiche that I have had in ages! My brother and I each had an order of a combo plate called Almuercito Criollo which was a mahi mahi skewer, a mushroom empanada and mixed seafood cebiche. It was beautifully presented and tasted even more amazing. The fresh mahi mahi was perfectly cooked - moist, tender, buttery and really well marinated. The cebiche was amazing and the empanada was delish! My fiance and our visiting friend both had the Carne (beef) skewer dish. They both said it was fantastic. The beef was tender, well marinated and cooked to perfection -- medium rare and served with chunks of potato that was also delish. I also had my standard Inka Cola - good as always. 

So for 4 entrees, two appetizers and a soda it came out to about $135 pre-tip. Not too bad, considering the quality of the food. Dinner there is pricier so I would recommend going there for lunch not only because it's easier to get in but also because of the price differential. Either way, I highly recommend trying this restaurant -- it is definitely worth it! I wish it was a bit more affordable for dinner though, as I would love to go there more regularly. Five stars for excellent food and service!
author: Samantha H.

description:
I came here with a few coworkers for happy hour and noticed that the service wasn't great but the food was delicious as were the drinks and its a great location. This past weekend, I had friends visiting from Alaska and Texas and suggested we grab a drink and some small plates at La Mar- terrible decision. We came into the lounge area and were the only ones- we ordered drinks and about 8 small plates to share between the 5 of us. Our drinks came out and about 20 minutes later, they brought our chips. A few more tables filled and we noticed they were getting food and ours still hadn't come. We ordered another round of drinks, asked about our food and were told it was on the way. About 20 more minutes went by and we got our drinks and 2 of the empanadas we ordered but nothing else. We noticed the table next to us that arrived way after us got a whole order that looked exactly like ours. We asked again about our food and they said it would be right out but they would bring more chips in the interim. Three orders of chips later, no food. Our waiter was very unaware of the fact that we didn't have food- kept telling us that "of course" it was coming and the manager was really flustered and not very apologetic nor accommodating- he blamed the printer the first time we asked and then blamed the new server who mixed up the table numbers. After about an hour and 15 minutes of waiting, I finally let him know he could cancel our food orders because we were tired of waiting. He just said fine and brought the check. He tried to explain they were really busy and he was sorry but at this point- we were really frustrated. He did comp a majority of our order (as he should have) but I was very disappointed in the service and felt bad for my guests!!! 
I'm very bummed because the food here is great and the drinks are amazing!! but I don't think I'll be returning...
author: Ashley S.

description: The "empanada sampler" is off the hook delicioso!! And definately have a "Pisco Sour". I luv this restaurant, the outdoor patio area is so lovely!
author: Susie S.

description:
My boss was given a gift card and decided to treat me out to a nice lunch.

Upon entering, there was a bar to the right with main dining in front of us. We were taken onto the patio which was waterfront. We sat in an enclosed patio that had the view of the bay.

I ordered lomo saltado. It was sooooo good! The meat was so tender and juicy with a great sauce. The potato/fries were soaked in the sauce of the meat, which added more flavor. It was a bit salty, but boy was it tasty!

I ordered a dessert. It said creme brulee, but it was not. It was more of a flan. I didn't enjoy it as I had my hopes set on a creme brulee.

I will go back here again!
author: J-nine I.

description:
So me and the Honey just spent 5 days in the palace of pleasure that is SFO / Sonoma and our meal here was the absolute transcendent highlight.

The hotel guy booked it for us, then I checked it out on the Yelp app and was happy enough. Happy does not begin to describe our experience there.

Let me tell you  -  by Embarcadero Pier One and a Half I sat down and wept.

I can count the number of times on my fingers that  I have eaten food that
has made me almost weep with joy. Waiter comes, menu looks great, yeah sure I'll have the Cebiche Mixto, I mean come on - what is it, tuna, octopus, some-other-fish, a few bits of onion and lemon juice with pepper. Big feckin deal. Give me a knife and a chopping board and I could throw that together. Oh no I coudaan. Simple food, simply made, but altogether stunning in the presentation, packaging, tasting. I could go on. But I will stop.

Everything we had was magnificent. Beer, wine, main course, dessert. The service is great - the authentic Peruvian servers come with authentic Peruvian Beatles-style mop tops, the room is great and it is right on the water.
author: Paul M.

description:
We went this place for dinner and It was an amazing meal but not for drink.
I know that SF is expensive, but is this the most overpriced drink in the city??
author: Megumi T.

description:
Excellent restaurant and bar. We sampled four types of ceviche and were impressed (by varying degrees) by each one. I would recommend everything on the menu. I would like to give 4.5 stars, as my squid in the Arroz Norteño was overcooked, but I do not feel that a few rubbery pieces of squid detracted from the meal enough to dock a full star. 

Ceviche tasting, causa tasing, empanadas del mar, arroz norteño, a couple pisco sours, and a couple cholopolitans, and we were excellent!

The cholopolitan is an awesome, awesome cocktail.
author: Brett H.

description:
Cebiche mix for the dinner was good.  You get to try 4 of them. I liked 3 of them and that' something.

Sangria not bad. Yucca fries.. love it! Also tried their empanadas.  I think I only liked their beef and there was one w/ corn in it.  They were both yummy!
Pisco Sour was really not to my taste, although it's supposed to be popular here.

Service was great all around.  We picked a great night and sat outside.  The hostess was so nice that she brought over blankets for the girls.  It was really sweet of her.
I am def. coming back.
author: AhLin C.

description: La Mar has the location, atmosphere, service, presentation, selection, creativity and taste.
author: Alexander D.

description:
We went here for our anniversary dinner, after canceling our (much more expensive and fusty) original reservations at French Laundry.  Because of that, I was really praying that La Mar would be an interesting and worthwhile substitute.

The cebiche tasting was delicious, and some of the tenderest fish I've ever had (except the halibut, that was a little chewy).  Same goes for the potato tastings, those were awesome!  Who would've thought that mashed potatoes with fish on top could be so incredible?  The tuna one was tops.  

We also had the octopus skewer.  Again, just super flavorful, tender and delish.  I've never had octopus like this before,  It was kind of smoky, bbq-y, yummy.

Pisco sours were great, I switched to caiprihanas for dinner, but they were a tad lime-y for me.

Service was excellent.  The only hitch was that the bar was behind, and our last round of drinks took forever--we were done eating by the time they arrived.  Eh, so it's dessert.  So what?

Actually, this place is perfect for happy-hour after a long day at the job.  All you need is a pisco sour to erase your workday doldrums.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Loved this place, everything about it, the food, the decor, the service...wouldn't change a thing.

Definitely a great place to visit with a group of friends, especially for girls night.  We tried the cebiche, causas and empanada tastings.  Each tasted incredible.  They are small tastings and defintiely one order wouldn't have been enough had the men in our lives been with us, but satisfied four girls just fine.

We brought a bottle of wine and when that was done the waiter recommended another great bottle of wine.  Unfortunately, I cannot remember the name of it, or our waiter.  We didn't get to try the famous Pisco Sours, but it's at the top of my order list when I get a chance to visit again.
author: Angie R.

description:
So, I  end up with my first date at this amazing place. It is a true Cebicheria. It is high end and the place shows it. Sophisticated, contemporary, and best of all comfortable. You need reservations if you want a table on the weekends. We did not have one so we sat at the bar. Perfect, I was close to my date. This is the second time I have eaten here and I kinda knew the menu so I ordered for both.

The Chipotle Mixto was amazing, the Verde was even better, we also ordered the Empanadas Sampler. The couple next to us saw that I knew how to order and they ordered the same thing. They told my date that she was very lucky to have a guy that understand how to order this stuff.... Ahem... self tapping my shoulder right now...

So, La Mar, you are the true example of the great San Francisco Cuisine we all go out for. Keep up the good work.
author: Alex V.

description:
I visited La Mar for lunch on Labor Day after a few friends suggesting that I check it out.

Started with a Pisco Sour cocktail, very good- had a foamy top that reminded me of a Ramos Fizz. Almost tasted like a Margarita, perfect for a beautiful SF day.

They brought out an assortment of chips, fresh potato chips, sweet potato and banana chips with 3 different dipping sauces (I LOVE sauce and anything).

I wound up choosing a ceviche (which they are known for) and the chicken empanadas. I couldnt decide on a ceviche choice, so the server suggested the Chinese one. Had an interesting combination of chinese crunchies, mango and fish. The fish tasted nice and fresh and the ceviche juice had a little spice to it. The empanadas were good as well.

My partner in crime had the steak sandwich on the menu (unsure of the actual authentic Menu name) with fresh avocado, and this looked yummy from across the table.

All in all, the restaurant is beautiful- nice and airy and we felt as if we were in Peru or Chile or somewhere tropical. No corners were cut when making this restaurant and the experience was great :)
author: Sarah A.

description:
My friend wanted to come here for her birthday dinner.  It was my 2nd time here.  We were promptly seated.  

We ordered ceviche, empanadas,  crab whipped potatoes, and the lamb entree to share.  The waiter brought us out some chips and 3 sauces.  Our appetizer orders came one after another and they replaced our plates after each one.  They were each delicious.  The lamb was nothing to write home about.  -1 star for that.  The portions are small and good size to share.  For dessert, we ordered the creme chocolate.  Overpriced if you ask me for the dessert. 

One thing I noticed on the bill,  the included the recommended tips starting at 18% - 25%.  Plus on top of the bill, there's a 3.5 tax for SF.  What the?   First of all,  the standard tip is 15%.  You ain't getting no 25% unless you throw in massive freebies.   

The food overall is good,  prices a little on the high side, and staff was good.  The first time around, I think we ate for 3.5 - 4 hours,  too long.
author: Albert L.

description:
MmMmMm..Those chips are delicious! We went through 4 servings of it. I also love the dipping sauces! We also got the cerbiche sampler plate. Although I don't remember which was which but I do recall liking 2 of the 4 that we had. We also got 3 entrees (2 rice dishes and something else I don't remember). The 2 rice dishes were exactly the same except one was red while the other was green. They tasted good but very pricey.
Our waitress was nice but it was really packed that day so it took us a while to flag her down. 
We sat outside because it was such a nice day. The view was wonderful and the weather was perfect. I also like the decor of this place. I felt like I was on vacation. Definitely a good place to impress a date or catch up with the girls.
author: Lee N.

description: Delicious, a rare niche of cuisine in SF, and excellent service! Great ambience, too.
author: Erica P.

description:
Mixed feelings about this place.  Been here couple of times for happy hour and dinner on the weekends.  The food stays consistent, however the crowd isn't.  During Weekdays, you'll get the Fidi and Soma people just getting of work.  On the weekends, you'll have tourists and families going.  

Food:  Alright, but I've had better.  This place is in San Mateo, "hole in the wall" place, but half the price!

Service:  I give it 5 stars.  The waitress always had a smile and had knowledge of the menu items.  Very attentive as well, but not to the point where it was disturbing.

Overall, I will definitely come back for happy Hours and dinner during the week.  Weekends, I'll skip.
author: Jay L.

description: We had high expectations because my husband was familiar with La Mar, and several restaurants owned by Gaston Acurio. However, this SF location was a disappointment. It was not up to par with the LaMar in Lima. Although the flavor was good, the typical Peruvian cuisine did not "come through" in what we ordered. At lunch time it appeared to have very few patrons. The service was attentive and knowledgeable, but the lunch menu seemed limited. We were looking forward to our LaMar San Francisco experience, but we were .diasppointed.
author: Javier P.

description: My friends and I decide to head to San Francisco for the weekend, we stop a La Mar for some food - quality of the food excellent, pisco sour delicious.  A bit expensive but loved it.
author: Vanessa V.

description:
I liked La Mar Cebicheria Peruana so much I already made another reservation to go again.  It's probably wise since Nov looks pretty booked for all the Friday and Saturday nights.  How exciting, a new restaurant that's all hyped up AND living up to the hype!

I went with 2 friends and we were immediately impressed by how big the space was.  There was an entirely separate area for the bar and another as a lounge.  The restaurant shares an equally large dining area as the exposed kitchen.  It was loud, the colors were vibrant, and we knew we could eat, drink and have fun without feeling censored or suffocated. 

We ordered the empanadas, Ceviche Crudo, Arroz Norteno and a fillet mignon in a pepper/pear (?) dish.  First off, the 3 kinds of chips along with 3 dips were fantastic.  We had to ask for seconds because they were so delicious (mostly because of the wonderful creamy dippings.)

Empanadas and Arroz Norteno were decent.  The beef dish wasn't as spicy as the waiter claimed at all and it was just not that interesting.  I think it's wise to focus on ordering only seafood at La Mar. 

The Ceviche Crudo was amazing!  The huge scallops and uni and shrimp were so fresh and mouthwatering.  The sauce wasn't overpowering at all.  

For dessert, we shared the chocolate beignets that had a good balance between bitter warm chocolate sauce and sweet cold ice cream.  A great dish to finish off a satisfying meal.

Service was attentive and friendly.  Price wasn't as bad as I imagined.  4 dishes and 1 dessert  and 1 drink was about $85 without tips.  

Not only romantic as it is right on the water, but it's probably a good place for Happy Hour too.  The drink options were abundant and the Pisco Sour that has egg white foam in it was strong, not too sweet, and quite tasty.
author: Candice B.

description: Food is great but the tall lady at the front desk is so mean. Won't seat me even if I'm 5 months pregnant waiting alone. She said it's policy. Can't believe they can't make exceptions even if I'm so obviously pregnant. Since they didn't have seats in their waiting area I had to sit on the cold marble steps in front of the front desk table. Very bad!
author: Jacqui A.

description:
i'm used to the mom and pop hole-in-the-wall peruvian restaurants so this was a shift for me. but really was a treat! great date place, business meeting, or a celebration. would recommend getting reservations. i just love that area to be on embarcadero along the water. very big and modern building. i would say to dress up for dinner.

peruvian food has some asian influences, especially japanese and i was excited to see the japanese influence in the menu. i tried a ceviche nikei with tuna, japanese cucumber, daikon - which is something i have never seen before yet kinda reminded of poke (that hawaiian cuisine does).

they offer a lot of small entrees great for sharing like the ceviche, salad, empanadas, causas (whipped potatoes topped with seafood or veggies), grilled skewers. i love grilled skewers!

then you got your entrees.  my entree was a chinese chow mein inspired dish with seafood. not bad. 

their desserts were impressive too so worth checking out if you still have room in your tummy.
author: Chanda I.

description: Second time here, and just as amazing as the first. Wonderful drinks, and haven't had a dish that didn't wow me. Most recently I found the bistec saltado to be amazing
author: M R.

description: I haven't had ceviche this good since I was in Peru 2 years ago.  The shots of Leche de Tigre were a sweet surprise, I don't think I've ever seen them available in the US before.  We had the Ceviche tasting and Causa tasting, both delicious.  The Ceviche Classico was our favorite.  Our server, Mabel, was so helpful and kind and recommended a creme brulee with masamora morada on the bottom that was too good to be true.  The picarones were also amazing.  This may have been the best meal I've ever had in my entire life!  My family is from Peru and this restaurant inspired a sense of pride and excitement in all of us.  I can't wait to go back with my husband!
author: Ia H.

description:
Hmmm it took me over a week to decide if I even wanted to write this review... so this is the third time I went to this restaurant (cuz one of my co-workers went to this same restaurant in Peru and loved it!) and I wasn't too impressed.

The best thing about this place is the Ceviche- get the sampler if you want to share.. my favorite is the Nikkei Ceviche. We also tried the Tiraditos and it was yum.

But I am seriously not impressed with the entrees (unless u get the traditional stuff I guess)

So the first time i went there- I got the traditional Peruvian Prawn soup- chupe de camarones -and loved it.

Second time - got the same thing and loved it more.

Third time- thought I'll be a little adventurous and got the arroz jugoso- one of the rice dishes - and it was like a flavorless paella.... why why why did I not get the Chupe?

Oh just remembered that they give an assortment of chips with 3 different dips which was also yummy!
author: Nini D.

description:
Food: was good but i agree that its overpriced.  
Service: the waiter was finally nice to us when he gave is the bill.
author: Ellie D.

description:
I went Sunday for lunch. We were very excited going to the first La Mar Peruvian restaurant in the U.S.  The location is excellent.  When you first sit down, you are served with a complementary portion of chips with the 3 dipping sauces. It's hard to stop once you start eating these delicious chips. They are very good and you start thinking what kind of experience is coming ahead.

We then ordered our drinks: Chicha tu ma and Pisco Sour.  My wife loved the Chicha Tu Ma, made of pisco, lime, chicha morada and passion fruit juice. The pisco sour was a bit sweet for my taste. We shared a Cebiche Clasico and Cebiche Mixto, as appetizers.  The cebiches were delicious; fresh halibut fish with a very good balanced citrus flavor. For the main dish I ordered Rocoto Relleno, my wife ordered Jalea Mixta and my daughter ordered Pasta Criolla, and we all agree that each main dish was very good. Finally, for dessert we got Picarones and Tiramisu with Lucuma ice cream, they were okay.
  
The only surprise from our whole experience for us was the portions; they were very, very small!  We felt silly because we ordered extra plates for sharing our food and realized the entrees, main dishes and desserts were so tiny that you cannot share it!  It seemed like they were worth just four tablespoons. In this economy, the owners should consider lowering the prices or increasing the portions.

Overall, it was a good meal, but more expensive than it was worth. We wished the menu had a few more dishes, like Aji de Gallina, or Papa Rellena. The service was very attentive and friendly. The total cost for 3 people was $147 including tip. We maybe will come back to La Mar but just for special occasions.
author: David U.

description:
Last Friday my girlfriends & I dined at La Mar. We ordered the ceviche sampler which offers 4 of the different types of ceviches served.  The portions are small, but good for sharing.  We also ordered 2 other ceviche dishes that were not featured in the sampler, and they were also excellent.  The empanada sampler was decent, but for some reason I felt bad for eating all of that fried food.  The ceviche is fresh, flavorful, and simply delicious.  The plantain and sweet potato chips compliment the ceviche quite well.  The cocktails are yummy because they are sweet. Two of my girlfriends left with a good buzz!  Since we were drinking we also ordered the mead dish with fries. If you are expecting french fries or papas fritas do not order this dish because it's mostly all meat featured with a few pieces of fries.  I was all about this because the meat was tender and flavorful. It also comes with rice on the side.  

The service is great. The waiters are attentive and give honest opinions on what are the top picks.  The ambiance is great - beautiful bright, vibrant colors.  I would definitely dine here again.
author: Jenn R.

description: This place is highly overrated with over priced, mediocre food and really tiny portions. The reception staff can be frosty and aloof. This restaurant is a far cry from their famed sister restaurants Gaston y Astrid in Lima, and La Mar in Brazil. Sorry, I really want to like this place, but each time I visit, I'm disappointed. There are so many wonderful restaurants in San Francisco. This is not one of them.
author: B G.

description: I can't believe this place got four stars from anyone. I've had Peruvian food and loved it, but this was very mediocre.  The weather was great and we sat outside which was lovely. The chips they serve were delicious. Cebiche was so so. Everything else was ok, but being from san Francisco, we've come to expect more.  Waitress was a bit churlish also. Will not go back.
author: Adrienne M.

description: I just got back from Peru, and my favorite and most memorable meal there was at Astrid y Gaston.  Elegant presentations, and delicious, actually filling meals!
