My son is very picky and they presented him with a panko crusted fish, bread, and a salad instead of the sandwich with the same ingredients. He was very happy. Everybody enjoyed the fried chips they set out when you sit down: fried plantains, sweet potatoes and potatoes, served with three types of "salsa." We also tried the causas and the empanadas which are fine, but for our money, we like the cebiche nikei.

Service is very accommodating and freindly if not a bit frantic at times (not our server but another was very stressed and flustered each time he passed our table).

A nice place for date night or a special occasion.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Very catchy view and the decor was refreshing. Had the cocktail special, both the cerbiche mixto and empanada sampler for appetizers, the arrioz (with prawns, squibs, rice, etc.) for main, and Graham's port (a sweet alcoholic drink) for desert. Everything was very decently prepared, though I wouldn't say the quality quite justified the price. Nothing that really stood out.

Waiters were decent, but had accents that were a little hard to comprehend.

Time: dinner with 2 friends
Food: cerbiche mixto, empanada sampler, arroz criollo
Drink: cocktail special, Graham's port (for desert)
Price: $80/person after tax and tip
author: Jack W.

description:
I have not been to the restaurant yet this is only for the bar.
My cousin and I were hi-falutin that day... tequila in champagne glasses... poppin' bottles of Cris'... *
We tried their signature drinks which were very ... limony (?) Pisque I think it's called? It was not my cup of tea though. Too strong a flavor. The bartenders were nice and friendly. The crowd was diverse but I advise going in stylish attire.
I was feeling pretty good when I left but I think I remember reading a plaque en el bano that deemed it a 'historical bathroom'

* Cristal is a Peruvian Beer and our 7 Leguas was served in a champagne glass for some reason.
author: Edi B.

description:
Came here with a friend on 10/03, I was surprised to have been able to make a reservation because of its recent opening about four days earlier but I was told that they would only be able to seat us at the ceviche bar.  I expressed my appreciation and provided my name to confirm the reservation.

The restaurant is beautiful and open, decorated throughout in a calming teal blue.  Overall it was a good experience even though we were seated at the only place the ceviche bar had a pillar blocking any sort of view.  Food was good.  A lot of dishes were either too tart or too salty.  But I love when you can tell that your seafood is fresh!  And I would love to come again and sit in the main dining hall as my friend suggested.

So why only three stars?  Because drinks were really slow!!  When alcohol is wanted, alcohol is what I should receive within a reasonable amount of time for a crowded restaurant.  But one of my drinks didn't even make it to the table...such a shame!
We're off to a bar where we can get drinks faster...
author: Ninja H.

description: One of my favs in SF. Great views, great decor, awesome service. and the food is always amazing!!!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
the ceviches are the only good things about this place.
the main courses need to be looked over again by the management or at least tasted before they go on the menu.
And a review of some of the servers wouldn't hurt either. We had a nice waiter that ended up ignoring the group and he didn't even apologize for not having our drinks and waters to us in a timely manner- like during the meal.
-so, thumbs up for the ceviches
thumbs down for main courses and service.
author: Antonio C.

description: Place sucks our food was bland and cmon thats pretty hard its cebiche wheres the "citrusyness" or seafood tasted like nothing.. Did i mention its pretty expensive for what you get and mind you'll have to stop to eat elsewhere after eating here.
author: R C.

description: I loved this place me & my wife, mother in law and 1 year old daughter came here for lunch, we got the ceviche sampler $31, empanadas sampler $19, and 2 other dishes from there entrees list and we left amazed fish was very fresh. I recommend this spot me and my wife will come here for dinner next. Dinner menu looks very promising.
author: Capellan G.

description:
They were very accommodating, and seated us early.  That was the best part of the evening!  The food was good, but it couldn't override the limited menu choices (four entrees for NYE and one was sold out before 8 PM), less-than-average service(our waiter was missing most of the evening when we needed service.  Espressos showed up 15 minutes after other after dinner coffees.), small portions, and inflated prices.  We were entertaining friends from out of country, and thought this would be fun to start our NYE celebration.  We would choose elsewhere if we could do over.  The 20% auto-added gratuity, was 19% more than our server earned.

Obviously, I cannot recommend this place.
author: Robert M.

description:
Me likey...me likey ALOT.

I liked EVERYTHING about La Mar!

I liked the way the SERVICE was quick, attentive and friendly - the servers were super nice which is awesome because we look pretty young so we don't always get the best service.  They even put up with my annoying showoff foodie questions and knew exactly what was in each dish--
Me: "So, what's in this red sauce- is this aji amarillo?"- 
Waiter: "No, it is aji arnaucho. The yellow one is aji amarillo."
Me:  "Ok, so what makes it thick, cream? 
Waiter: "Actually, we put a little crackers in it to thicken it."
Me: "So what's in this drink that makes it look like egg yolks?"
Waiter: ....
It continued like this all night long and they were totally cool about it!

 
Also, I asked whether the Chef was available and the waiter told me that he might come in later. We finished our dinner and on the way out the waiter ran over to tell us that the chef arrived so we could meet him. Awesome service!

I liked the FOOD--La Mar's food really impressed me and I eat alot of peruvian food.  

To start with, they give you a basket of chips-I think they are plantain, potato and yam chips--they were delicious! And the 3 hot sauces (mild, medium, hot) they come with were to die for, especially the hot one-  you could dip a freakin sock in it and it would taste good..yumm...    

The ceviches were delicious! I had the ceviche tasting--four different types of ceviches--nikei (Japanese style ahi), chifa (yellowtail tuna with a Chinese style sweet and vinegary dressing), traditional and mixto (mahi mahi and octopus) . We also ordered the Causa tasting which was similarly presented and excellent. 

The presentation of the food was beautiful (looks just like the pics here). If you are not into the foofy food thing then you might not really care...I admit I like foofy food and so for me the presentation was the icing on the cake!

I liked the AMBIANCE--it is right on the waterfront so there is a beautiful view, and even the inside of the restaurant itself is very beautifully designed--high ceilings, nice open kitchen, modern but not sterile. 

I liked the CHEF- we met him and he was nice..not super special nice but nice enough. 

I liked the DRINKS- I hate sweet drinks--I never ever drink them--but I tried their pisco sour and some passionfruit umbrella-ish drink and I loooved them both. Amazing!

I liked the LOCATION- right in my neighborhood and on the beautiful waterfront, just a couple steps away from Americano, Ozumo, and other pre/post-dinner drink spots.


Me no likey? Me no likey the fact that my review and the other good reviews will make it harder for me to get a table at this already popular spot! But Buddha says don't be greedy and do good for others- so here's my contribution to you yelpers...

Good food for you, good karma for me-

Me  likey that  ALOT  :)
author: amy k.

description:
HOT DAYUMMM 
The food was like little explosions of deliciousness in my mouth. I may or may not have gone home a dreamed about how fantastic it all tasted. It was so fresh and full of flavor. 
The ceviche w halibut-probably one of the best apps I've ever tasted. 
Atmosphere was popping for a Wednesday night although by 10 it seemed to clear out. 
It has entered the running for my new favorite restaurant...we shall see.
author: m g.

description:
Just had dinner at this place over the weekend. One word: underwhelming.

We ordered the entree with "seared beef and catch of the day", the better description should have been " dried beef and catch of yesterday". It consisted of cubes of old beef with not so fresh pieces of squid and some kind of fish. And it was incredibly salty. I guess it seems like they overdrenched it with soy sauce. You know, something that Chinatown restaurants do when they try to sell you yesterday's leftover food. But this is a waterfront restaurant. C'mon people! I think I consumed enough sodium for the whole year. The waiter never came around to refill the water until we were almost done with dinner. Here is the kicker..... we ordered 2 bowls of rice to help tone done the saltiness and they charged us $10 for the rice. Is there gold laced into the rice? WTF! When the waiter came around, we told him that the rice was the best part of the meal. He replied, that's what people come back for. Who ever pays $28 for old over salty meal and comes back again is a fr**king idiot. I truly can't believe how some businesses get away with this. I don't mind ponying up for good food BUT this is pure robbery. OVERPRICED subpar food!!!

So here is a recap:
1) Nice ambience and waterfront location = 4 stars
2) Waiter with an attitude = - 1 star
3) Water not refilled until the end of dinner = 0 star
4) Subpar over salty food at skyrocket prices = -1 star
5) Waiter pushing this entree (when asked for recommendation) which litterly had 8 thin sliced pieces of fish. Everyone thought it was either a joke or the first of a 2 part entree. Nope = -1 star

Overall = 1 star (and I'm being generous here)

I really didn't want to give this place or any place such a low rating, but there were just too many negatives with this experience. For anyone planning to visit this place, there are a couple consistent themes that are on this and other reviews: "pricey", "salty", and questionable "service".
author: Anthony X.

description:
Very mixed reviews on this place.  I have been dying to try this spot for quite awhile now and last Friday night seemed like the perfect time.  Arrived to a packed and jammed bar, not a bad sign.  Found a seat and settled in for a glass of vino and then some food.  First of all, the wine pours... what a joke!!!  I thought they ran out of one bottle and were heading back to grab another to top my $10 glass of wine off.  But alas no....  Hmmm....okay, then the food.  I think the food was good but it was covered so heavily in sauces I am not sure if the fish was tasty or if it was the sauce.  And very over priced for the portions. 

The service was good but at the end of the night when the bill arrived, I noticed at the bottom the recommended tips were 18%, 20% and 25%. 25%... WTF??  Who sets these tipping parameters in this country, oh wait, let me guess, the food and beverage industry.  And to rub salt further into the wound followed by a drop of lemon juice, they calculated the tips on the total.  As if  I am supposed to tip the waitress on the sales tax AND the health care surcharge.  That would have been $5 more for her based on that theory.  Oh god help this city and this tipping culture.

So basically I walked out of La Mar sober, hungry and broke.   Not a winning recipe in my book for a Friday night.  This review will have no impact on their business however  I think there are a lot of better places to go in this city.
author: Tammy M.

description:
I've only ever made it here for drinks and snacks, both of which were okay.

Tried to eat there for lunch for the first time, but left after a lukewarm reception from the hostess, and after being ignored for 15 minutes or so in the bar. Maybe I smell bad?

10 minutes into our Siberian adventure, I asked the bartender for menus. He didn't seem very happy to see me, but said he'd be "right out" with menus. Then he left the room for the next 5 minutes.

So we left.
author: Wangston P.

description:
any place that gives plantain and sweet potato and regular potato chips with three dipping sauces including one cheezy goodness and one spicy wonderfulness gets all five stars. F'ING DELICIOUS. added bonus, lovely company of coworkers with an agenda of hot topics to discuss (primarily amazing office gossip). 

loved everything we ate esp the ceviche (it was the tuna one that had avocado and this semi-sweet sauce - too lazy to look it up on the menu but you guys will figure it out if you're there), the lomo saltado, and this super spicy pepper filled with beef (again too lazy to look it up but find it - it is worth it). service was great, very helpful, recommended us to get the pisco sours rather than any of the other drinks, which he was right, and even gave us a free drink as we lingered over the gossip and tried to digest the food.
author: Cathy L.

description: This place is out of this world!!! I love Peruvian food and this place was the best Peruvian food I have ever tasted!! The ceviches were amazing and my entree was delicious! I can't remember what I had though....if you haven't yet tried Peruvian food, you are in for a real treat!!!! Service was impeccable too! My husband has a dairy and gluten intolerance and the waiter was really helpful and knowledgeable about all the dishes and helped us carefully select dishes he could eat. Outstanding!!! Can't wait to go back there!! We were too full to try the desserts. Book ahead of time as tables fill up fast.
author: Sabina H.

description:
Here's the thing: I'm not convinced that good food needs to be routinely expensive. 

La Mar is beautifully and richly appointed in terms of decor and ambiance. Azul blue, glass and steel--it wouldn't be accurate to say it was warm, but it doesn't feel cold or uninviting; polished and sleek come to mind. The vibe was what one would expect after work near the Ferry Building: suits and pencil skirts actively buzzing with banter, unwinding over cocktails and ceviche.

I sat at the bar, determined to try the Pisco Punch (an SF original), and realized there was no way I could pass up a food order. 2 appetizers seemed reasonable. I ordered the Cebiche Clasico (Halibut, habanero pepper, Peruvian corn and yam) and Causa Criolla (causa, according to their website is a "cold dish made of cooked and pressed papa (potato), ají (chili pepper), limón (lemon)...you fill it with different types of fillings such as vegetables, meat, fish and shellfish, as well as mayonnaise." Mine had Mahi Mahi, quail egg, avacado puree and Huancaina sauce). 

The Cebiche was very good--the marinade was addictingly tangy and it was hard not to drink the remains of the juice afterward. The Causa was good, but with all of the "exotic" ingredients I was disappointed to find that it mostly tasted like very well seasoned balls of mashed potatoes. Good mashed potatoes, mind you, but not what I was hoping for.

The Pisco Punch was my first and while I liked the refreshing sangria-like taste, I'm not sure it  would become a staple order for me. Still, very well made.

Really my biggest complaint was the drink and two appetizers came to nearly $50 ($48.95) including tip. The appetizer portions were relatively small and could hardly qualify as dinner and spending $50 on a pre-meal is a bit rich for my post-bailout blood.
author: Alexis W.

description:
By far the most beautiful decor around. Rich mahogany booths, high white walls and ceiling, splashes of blues, oranges and greens. 

The food is fresh and delicious. Order the Cebiche tasting platter. You get a little of everything. Yummy cocktails. Free fried plantain, potato and sweet potato crisps.

Very pricey.
author: Christina S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place more, since I'm a huge fan of ceviche/cebiche, but I just thought it was okay.  We arrived about 15 minutes early and went to the bar.  About fifteen minutes after the reservation time, the hostess came by and asked for my  name and explained that she had been looking all over for me.  I was literally five feet from her the whole time.  I guess she didn't look very far.

As far as the drinks, I thought they were in the expensive range and the wine by the glass was about half the size it should have been for the price.  

The service was okay - nothing memorable, except there were a few mess ups that were just never commented on - like bringing us plates/silverware and then taking them away without saying anything.  

We got the embanadas, which were good, but nothing spectacular, and the peanut mahi mahi cebiche, which tasted like your run of the mill cebiche, but with peanuts.  I got the first rice dish on the menu and the way my waiter sold it I thought it would be amazing.  Instead it tasted like every paella I've ever gotten at a Spanish restaurant, which is fine, but don't sell it like it's something I've never experienced before.  I think he said, "go no further in the menu" or something like that.  I wish I had gone further into the menu and tried something else.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Came here for dinner with a pretty large group of people.  We had already selected a menu.  Service was pretty slow - it took a while to get drink orders and then the servers seemed to forget who ordered what.  

The food was better than I expected, but I wasn't blown away.  There were some really inventive flavors, while the ceviches (halibut and tuna) tasted more like sashimi than ceviche.  The courses also took a pretty long time to come out, so dinner seemed to drag on forever.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Such a great restaurant.  The food was stylish and very tasty.  But the ambience was what really made it feel special.  I had dinner here recently and loved the Cebiche Nikei.  Everyone's dinner was raved about.
That dinner included a birthday and the waiter incorporated a special cake into the flow of the meal without missing a beat.
Then I had a leisure lunch with friends (so leisure that my car parked on The Embarcadero was towed at 3pm), but the waitstaff never made us feel rushed.
author: Layne G.

description:
As you walk into La Mar, if feels like you have just been whisked away to some tropical island resort. The restaurant is huge (you would never realize that from the outside), besides for the bar in the very front that you can see from the outside, there is a huge bar with blue lights surrounding it, there is the main dining area inside & there is a huge patio outside.

We arrived around 2:45pm on a Friday & were seating promptly for lunch. The restaurant seemed to be filled with a lot of tourists, but it was Friday before 4th of July & there was a huge cruise ship docked at pier 39.

The service was pretty friendly, but was not anything outstanding. After we ordered, they brought us some chips/banana chips with 3 sauces to dip them in. I couldn't figure out the flavors in the sauces (probably, because I was getting over the flu and my senses were off), they were good though.

We ordered the halibut ceviche, the mahi mahi skewers & chicken empanadas. The full order of halibut ceviche was very big, we probably could have gone with the smaller one, It was delicious, and the fish was in a milky, lime, cilantro sauce with giant corn kernels & onions on top. If I had been more hungry, I would have drank the sauce out of the bowl (actually probably not, but it was definitely delicious). The ahi ahi skewers were also very good, they had a red sauce on them and were served with sliced potatoes, giant corn kernels and an extremely hot sauce that was a light greenish color. The empanadas were served with a small salad and had an excellent flavor to them.

The food was delicious & the overall experience felt like we were on vacation, what more can you ask for? I would go back any day!
author: Elaine S.

description:
4 stars because the service took forever and they brought the wrong entree but other than that.. 
this review is for the bar area where we happily were able to watch some GolTv (soccer) while sipping on a really good sangria, eating amazing ceviches and sautas.
we had the following:
cebiche clasico
cebiche nikel
causa nikel - this was my first causa.. amazing puprle mashed potato made into a round column and on top yummy tuna and spicy sauce.. amazing presentation, great taste. highly recommend.
Carne skewer - come on.. we had to have some skirt steak.. now .. usually not a fan of skirt steak.. this was done to perfection.
Yes ladies and gents.. this was pretty much perfect.
author: Lucie T.

description: Great Ceviche and grilled meat.  Beautiful sunny back patio which is very enjoyable on the water.  Love the vibe.  Had a house specialty drink...pisco sour!
author: J H.

description:
Overall (Bar/Dinner): Very good place for Peruvian seafood cuisine.  Service and decor are good.  Food is great for the most part, though some items are worth passing over.  

Decor:
Bar was quiet, even as many big events were going on.  Perhaps this was do to inclement weather.  Restaurant takes full advantage of an ideal location.  The place is well designed, with an open feel to the kitchen area.

Service:
Good.  Very accomodative, as we were 30 minutes late to a 6pm reservation.  

Food:
Great size for 6 people to share most plates.  Overall fairly good menu considering we asked waitress to bring chef's/restaurant's best items.  Generous portions to the cebiche.  Primary reason for only four stars is that the main courses left room for improvement.  The grilled octopus was relatively bland and forgettable.
author: Bill W.

description:
Location/Ambiance:
Easy to find, parking can be expensive but if you're staying somewhere on the embarcadero, its an easy walk. Nice ambiance, very colorful pieces yet dark and moody at night for dinner. Great view on the patio. The bar atmosphere was really crowded and very much the post happy hour crowd but the restaurant was much calmer and relaxed.

Service:
We ate there on a Friday night so clearly it was crowded and our waiter had quite the crowd to attend to. We had to summon him over a few times but our junior waiter/busboy was much more attentive and even provided explanations of food that we didn't know. 

Food:
Food was lovely. I had the lomo saltado which had such tender beef, I wanted more. Veggies were cooked great and it had a nice beef/soy broth. My guests had the empanada sampler which included a corn, chicken, seafood and beef empanada. The corn one is almost sweet with a polenta like inside but all were tasty. I wouldn't recommend it as an entrée though; it is only four empanadas so you might need to grab a salad too. The atun is an ahi tuna that was seared perfectly with a peppery sauce on top and purple potatoes. I would go back and get that and the lomo saltado again. Presentation was great too. I polished it off with a refreshing hierba Buena cocktail that has a rosemary infused pisco which was perfect for a warm night.

Value:
Reasonable; entrees are between $19-$31, entrée amounts are plentiful but I would still suggest getting an appetizer if you have guests so that everyone can sample everything. 

Return:
Yes. Be sure to make reservations though if it's a weekend to avoid waiting at the busy bar.
author: Jen T.

description:
came here after Giants opening day, and like the stars say I've had better.  
We were lucky enough to score a table in the front bar area!!! 
After waiting several minutes, I flagged down a busser and he was very kind enough to bring us some menus. After more minutes the lovely server came over to take our drink order. All day long I was craving some ceviche and a pisco punch so that's what we started with 
The pisco punch was good, but in reality not worth the $12. I have no problem spending money on a delicious quality drink. But this was not it. The pisco was not of high quality and not worth the $12.
 We decide to start with a ceviche mixto about $18, (wish I could remember the name so that others do not order it)  It literally had several(a lot)  red onions, about an ounce of fish, 1(ONE)  small to medium shrimp, some calamari and some octopus... what a huge disappointment...
the flavor, just spicy 
After these failures, I could no longer give  La Mar my hard earned money.

2 drinks, 1 measely ceviche= $50 not including tip. 

=( so not worth it

1 star for ok pisco punch 
1 star to be nice
author: Debbie M.

description: Wow what a great place!!!  Ceviche was awesome, sangria is very tasty and strong and free plantane appetizers are off the hook.  Definitely one of the top 5 spots in the SF for me now.
author: Ruslan K.

description: Went here with my parents. Ate some of the most unusual/complicated/ delicious food ever.
author: Ben W.

description: Great location. Beautiful-looking restaurant, amazing patio overlooking the bay. Great service. Inventive menu. But not great food. Had many dishes, none of them impressed. Pretty good drinks though.
author: Natasha M.

description:
The buildout is beautiful (a little more inviting than the slanted door space but about the same square footage), the wait staff knew the menu inside and out and had great reccomendations about what we should try. They serve a gratis basket of fried plantains (that resemble potato chips) and dipping sauces... very classy! 

I am not a fish eater and I was expecting to see more meat dishes on the menu, but I was very happy with the selection of vegetarian dishes. I had a nice squash risotto topped with mushrooms and tomato. 

I thought I would be very put off by the lack of liquor license, but my Pisco Punch was really good, and didn't taste like a wine spritzer. 

This place felt like a great value. My friend and I each had a drink, starter and entree and the bill was under $80 (before tip). We never felt rushed, and we sat at the ceviche bar which was really intimate and comfortable. 

I highly reccomend this place and look forward to going back on a business lunch.
author: M T.

description: We've been frequenting La Mar occasionally for a few years, usually to celebrate a special event.  Unfortunately, the most recent experience left us thinking that La Mar has fallen prey to what so many other restaurants do, namely  lower their food standards slowly over time after they have made it big.  Most of the same dishes this last time were only so-so, compared to past times when they were excellent.  Maybe there is a new chef?  Maybe they decided to cater to tourists who won't be coming back anyway?  Hard to say, but the decline is very noticeable.  No longer worth the premium price tag, in my opinion, although it definitely was in the earlier days.
author: John W.

description:
my bf and I went there a few weeks ago. 
Service - Excellent - very friendly & good manner, a waiter doesn't bug you that much but keeps his/her eyes on you all the time. 

Food - good quality, fresh and unique. Nothing to complain. Good volume of food, not too little, not too much.... 

Price is bit too high, that's my concern. Definitely come back here
author: Cindy N.

description:
It's a great place to dine.

They provide chips and unique dipping sauce instead of bread, which are great. I will go back just for the chips.

We only tried the ceviche sampler and wines for snacking. The ceviches were great. I liked all 4 of them. They were all arrenged with different type of sauce referring to different type of cuisine such as Chinese, Japanese, and European. Also ordered a sashimi type of dish, but that wasn't necessary great.

The white wines there goes very well with ceviche, and they have wine tasting as well, which I will certainly try for my next visit.
author: Lance C.

description: What a great find at the Embarcadero!  The decor is bright and contemporary and the location is perfect.  On the water, yet away from the tourist trap area of Pier 38. We had lunch with my uncle and it was a perfect spot for a warm sunny Sunday afternoon, which was unusual for the last weekend in October.   We sat outside on their covered patio overlooking the water.  They have great lunch options, but I think the best deal is their pre-fix menu.  All of the food was fresh, well seasoned and prepared.  Another great thing about the location is that it's next door to the Embarcadero market which has endless local vendors and lots of fresh food and treats to take home.
author: caroline k.

description:
I don't know what has happened in less than a year but the service went down the drain.  This restaurant has been my guilty pleasure every time I would fly to SF for business or pleasure.  As I approached the restaurant my heart always skips a beat because I know the experience will be amazing however, I do not believe that I will be coming back.  The experience was meh! After having mind blowing taste bud experiences, I was treated to a sub standard experience this last visit.  

I don't know what happened but some food that should be hot was tepid and it took longer than usual get the food.  The only thing I could think was that maybe the chef(s) were changed because the food experience was sooooo different from all the other visits when those visits were constant.
author: Esther G.

description:
was there few times!!
i must say, its a great restaurant!
was twice in Peru and the food is similar to the food there!
great food! great service!
author: Ben R.

description:
Beautiful spacious restaurant.  Couple different bar areas, one secluded from the restaurant area the other central in the entrance way to the main dinning area.  Both have a great, but different feel to them (nice to have the variety and choice).

Upon being seated we were brought a basket of freshly made fried chips, plantains and dipping sauces - yummy.  We started with the Cebiche tasting dish. I had never experienced Peruvian food before and the flavors were nothing close to anything I had ever had - amazing, loved it!  We couldn't stop at one appetizer's also had the Causa tasting - again - excellent - very unique flavors and combinations of fish and potato.  For dinner I went with the Cordero -braised lamb shank.  It was pretty good, fell right off the bone.  I would recommend the dish, however, I have had better lamb dishes (the appetizers for me were definitely the highlight).

For dessert we had the Tiramisu - Excellent!!

As for drinks....we started with the Pisco Sour - perfect!  Then had a nice bottle of Malbec, recommended by the waiter.  However, we were slightly disappointed they did not have one Peruvian wine on the list.  After dinner drinks were another typical Peruvian drink - Chicha Morada a kind of sangria/tea like cold drink.

Appetizers - AWESOME
Dinner - OKAY
Drinks - EXCELLENT

Bathroom, very nice, but not at all impressed by only COLD water coming out of the hot tap!  Come-on-people  $30 for an entree - give me a little hot water to wash my hands!!
author: A W.

description: Overall, very nice restaurant. The empanadas sampler was fantastic as were the beignets.  It was a little loud, making conversation difficult, but overall a very good experience!
author: Scott G.

description: Excellent ceviche!   I'm defenitely coming back.  Went for happy hour on Sunday and the food was great.  Howver, the ceviche portions for happy hour were very small, maybe 3 small pieces of fish in a shot glass.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
This is by far one of the best Peruvian restaurants I have been to outside of actual restaurants in Peru. The ceviche (they call it cebiche) was excellent and the leche de tigre (the lime juice mix in which the chebiche was served) was excellent.

I was here for lunch with a group of eight people and the service was good. At times, it seemed a little slow, but nothing bad. The view of the bay from the back of the restaurant and the decor made up for it. They do have most of the traditional Peruvian foods, but it's more upscale and California, but still really good.

Food was a bit pricey and the portions where small. We had to order a bit more appetizers, a couple cebiche plates and the anticuchos, then expected, but they where all very good.
author: Jason T.

description: I'm a fan of this place, right by where I live and its my go-to restaurant for a nice night out type of situations. BIG plus for me is that this restaurant is big enough to accommodate walk-in's. Food is always great, and their artisan chips get me everytime.
author: Bo D.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I did enjoy the food, atmosphere and not to mention the amazing Pisco Sour's.  In fact I've been to La Mar three times in the past two weeks.

The reason for my bad review is that every time I've gone in the service was just awful.  The only people who were friendly however were the bartenders and busboys.  But the hostess was absolutely rude.  We had 5 minutes until official opening time and she rudely looked at her watch while letting out a sigh of exasperation then pointing to the bar saying sit over there.  I was with a group of sharp looking people so it was a little embarrassing since they were visiting me from out of town.  In fact they were so upset they wanted to go elsewhere from just that.  We then decided to go to the bar and the hell with everything, enjoy some damn good cebiche and drinks.  After having done so we then decided to go inside for an official sit down and were told by the manager of the establishment that perhaps our next order of drinks should be a glass of water.  My guests weren't from around here and perhaps were a little loud and boisterous but never in my life had I been so insulted.  This is San Francisco where you're supposed to enjoy yourself not a library.  

So to the owner of the establishment.  Please teach your GM and hostess some manners and tact.  I'll be going back due to my masochistic nature of being treated poorly I suppose but only, and I repeat only because of your great food and happy hour.
author: Carlos S.

description:
Great looking restaurant - love all the space - didn't seem too noisy eventhough very crowded.  It was really nice - definitely great for meeting up with friends.  The service was excellent - very attentive and helpful waiters, and efficient food delivery.

The fried chips and plantans with sauce is a nice touch  - complementary before your order (at least I think it is, didn't see any extras for this on the bill).

I was with two friends and we shared the tuna ceviche, clam and scallops, stir fried beef, and a small side salad.  I thought it was all very tasty and filling.  The only downside is the expensive prices.  I do think it's a bit pricey for a casual night out -- with a few glasses of wine, and one cocktail it came to $55 a head.

The food, service, and ambience is good - but does not warrant the high prices.  Thus I'm giving this 3 stars.
author: Gina C.

description:
As I've been doing a little Yelp catching up I almost forgot about my mid-week, mid-day visit to La Mar a few weeks ago.

A gorgeous day in SF & just got through taking a sales manager to see clients in the E.Bay & SF as we ended up on the Embarcadero. I remembered that I've wanted to go here for some time & seeing that I had a sales managers expense account at my disposal I suggested Mar.

I've got to say I'll probably agree with most of the negative menu responses in that they just tend to overpower the seafood selections with too much spice, citrus & salt.  Their basic ceviche, once stripped of it's various coatings is actually very fresh & refreshing.  The waiter must have thought I was just one of those guys who doesn't eat his veggies because that was all that was left of my plate when I was done.

Now comes the really good part.  The bar.  Perhaps the Holy Grail of fresh fruit inspired  alcoholic concoctions.  Had to start with a pisco sour, tasty.  Then felt like a nice, tall shaken top shelf, fresh citrus only margarita which was a goooood call.  I don't make em' much better (or stronger) myself.  We then split a bottle of a killer Verdejo to end the afternoon sitting out watching the Bay & everybody scurrying to & from work while we discussed "account strategy" for the next half hour.  So yeah for two it was kinda pricey (about $165 I think) but we had the typical bar tab = twice the food tab thing going so I suppose if your a lightweight you could get away cheap.   

But why?
author: Bill T.

description:
Went here with a group of friends and sat right on the water. Beautiful views, good drinks and GREAT food. The serving sizes are good too.....not TOO big. But the QUALITY of  the food is what makes this place good. I had steak and chicken skewers......AWESOME!!! The meat is marinated and melted in my mouth!!! 

Will definately go back!! Thanks Donnna!!! :D
author: D M.

description:
Every time I come here, it's an amazing experiences. Top notch service. Mouth-watering food. Strong and delicious drinks. Unbeatable atmosphere (lively but not loud; relaxing colors). 

I've been here for at least three birthdays, random happy hours, and casual dinners. I try to order something different every time (I often get the pisco sours though), and I am delighted by each dish. Few places in SF have good ceviche, and La Mar's the best. 

Something I haven't done yet is eat on the outdoor patio. I'm sure it would feel amazing on a warm or even semi-warm late afternoon/evening.

You know that if the restaurant is open in various Latin American locations as well it must be legit. If you haven't been, check La Mar out. At it's price point, it's unbeatable.
author: Rob C.

description: The food here is amazing and the service was just as great. Would definitely recommend this place. My favorite was the sea bass.
author: Christina L.

description:
The setting outside on the bay, warmed by heat lamps is fantastic. Overlooking the water is required when having delicious cebiche. If you do sit inside, you won't be disappointed. Great decor.

I went with a few girlfriends for dinner and we shared a delectable spread with fun cocktails. I recommend the pisco sour!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
heard great things about this place and wanted to love it, but i wasn't too impressed :( 

what i had:
- cebiche tasting (you get to try 4 different kinds): mixto was my fav! tons of flavor, then the nikei. the clasico and chalaco was ok, a lil bland on the flavor. the seafood was all very fresh, no complaints there. 

- empanada sampler (you get one of each kind): can't really go wrong here. each one was pretty tasty :)

- for my main, i got the chorrillana (catch of the day, which was sea bass): was really disappointed here because everything was so dry! they overcooked the fish, so it was like chicken and the mashed yucca was super dry too, so i had no mouth-watering experience :(

- my friend got the arroz criollo, which he absolutely loved. i tried a bite of that and that was cooked well. 

so all in all, it was just ok for me. the venue was great (spacious, clean, good vibes), but my food was disappointing. hope you have better luck! :)
author: Tea Lyves ..

description:
wow...i love this place!  i think i ate here twice 2 days in a row!! love the corn, the ceviche, and the paella.....even the drinks are very refreshing!
i was a little disappointed with the saltado....and the seabass skewers were rather dry.  the potato sampler thing was pretty, and interesting, but didnt really blow my mind.  But overall, i like the place, really nice place...pretty cool.
They have enough things in the menu that are very interesting and taste amazing....some are just normal....i didnt have anything i hated....but i will return to this place definitely.
author: Erick P.

description: Fantastic. Great food and service. Took some friends on their visit to San Francisco. Amazingly, it was easy to get a table. We asked to eat family style and they were happy, encouragingly, to accommodate. Started with a mixed cebiches with calamari, shrimp, and yellow tail. The leche de Tigre (the marinade) was very tasty. Bursting with flavor, but mixed so you could taste the spices and the citrus. Next we had quinoa chaufa and the flavor was amazing. Fresh green and red tomato wedges with red quinoa and spicy sauce. For the main dishes we had the mixed anticuchos or Peruvian skewers, beef, chicken and yellow tail all very well prepared and spiced, and the short ribs, so tender that no steak knife is brought. Dessert was the exclamation on the dinner. Something chocolate and good and some homemade ice cream with a caramel covered shortbread cookie. Everything was well thought out, superbly prepared, and stunningly presented. We'll definitely be coming back!
author: John M.

description: This is a bit of a limited review as we only had drinks, ceviche and one of the causas, but I was not as in love with this as I wanted to be. I LOVE LOVE LOVE ceviche  and have eaten in all over South and Central America so I wanted/hoped this was going to be great. We ordered the classico and the nikei ceviches and the vegetarian causa . Classico ceviche boring and not very flavorful. Nikei ceviche with tuna very good and we loved it. The causa was fine but did not rock our world either. Pisco sours very tasty!
author: Karla L.

description:
I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars for the food, but there are a few things that I did not like too. The setting is beautiful but the room is large and a bit noisy to have an intimate dinner or quiet conversation. When I tried to move my chair and sit 90 degrees away from my date, I was reprimanded by the hostess because there was no room for the people at the next table to enter/exit. Not true, since the other side of their table was completely free for that. As it turned out, I sat next to my date (both of us) on the bench and it was great, but I just was surprised to get busted for such an offense.
I'd recommend asking at reservation time to sit in the patio section overlooking the bay or at the counter near the kitchen, where the noise level was less and you could hear the good music.
Food-wise, it was quite enjoyable and the table service was fine. The ceviche was excellent and we enjoyed all the dishes we ordered.
author: Jake J.

description:
If only I can try their many ceviche on the menu.... (i promise i will after the baby).

It was such a nice lunch with the girls... the view from our table was simply stunning.. waterfront on Embarcadero, (not to mention the convenience that it is only 2 mins across the street from our office!!). 

Food was great and we had quite a few things to share that day... Risotto, the Paella-like rice with cilantro... and sea bass was also very nice. What we couldnt resist, was the fried potato chips that were refilled every 5 mins for our table.. we could have easily just sat there and eat nothing but that, and be totally satisfied. 

Desserts were however a little short of our expectation... we ordered the chocolate creme caramel with lemongrass.. it came with a dash of nacho looking cream (little spicy) on the side. I am sure there are fans out there who like that combination, but it wasnt to our liking. 

Overall, great spot for lunch and look forward to returning for dinner.
author: Ada W.

description: I recommend the Cebiche tasting Mixto. Very fresh,crisp,quality ingredients. The view is a plus.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
5 stars for their Pisco sours-they are probably the best ones I've had in the Bay Area.
5 stars for the grilled octopus-OMG, this was incredible.
4.5 stars for 2 kinds of ceviche we tried-they were almost perfect
4.5 stars for the service (there were a ton of empty tables but we were told only the ceviche bar was available, which was okay.
5 stars for decor and location-this place is going to be insane when the weather turns nice, with that killer outdoor area, public boat dock, and all right on the water!!!  
5 stars overall-as soon as I left, I wanted to plan my return!
author: Betsy K.

description: We only go here for drinks and sometimes their bar food, WHICH IS GREAT, if you love cocktails made from eggs and corn, this place is for you, and if you're not that person, you should be.
author: Jared Z.

description: This place was so good! I loved the empanadas and the staff was so friendly and attentive.  Definitely making a return trip asap
author: Glynis M.

description: I absolutely adore this place. Not only is it a 5 minute walk away from the office, but the ceviche & pisco sours are to die for.  The service was on point; very friendly staff.  In addition to the ceviche, we also tried the chicken empenadas, calamari, lamb, and yucca fritas... all delish!! It's unfortunate that happy hour ends @6pm....but get your HH order in on time and it's all good.  Thank you again 7x7 for the recommendation, this is a great spot to unwind w/your girlfriends at after work. :)
author: Joy A.

description: Really great place for client entertainment, business, or personal dinner. The octopus is amazing! I especially like the octopus ceviche!
author: Shannon T.

description: Love the banana chips here!  I could definitely spend all afternoon here sipping on cocktails along the Embarcadero!
author: S L.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! one of the best ceviche bars in sf and the pisco sours here are just delightful.
author: Cam N.

description: Beautiful place! I don't eat fish, but I had to try the cebiche's here! The cebiches are excellent! Loma saltado melts in your mouth, yum yum. The drinks are very good, highly recommend this place.
author: Sepas K.

description:
Was torn on this b/w 3 stars or 4 stars.

Decor and space were very cool - sleek, fresh, modern, and dramatic.

Ceviches - 5 stars for sure.  This is their specialty, their name, and their reason for existence.  We had the 4-course taster and every single one of them was tangy, citrus-y goodness.

The main courses, however, were just OK at best.  We had the fish and the lamb, and both were rather heavy and "sticky."  Perhaps this is what the Peruvian style of cooking is, but if so, then I'd rathe not pay $29 an entree for it.

My recommendation:  hit the ceviche bar for the ceviche and some cocktails, and save the main meal for someplace else.
author: Eric T.

description: Buzzy atmosphere, awesome bay views.  Great ceviche and lomo soltado, but I am missing the original Lima location.
author: Paul M.

description:
The 4 stars is for the food, not the service.

I'm not going to sit here and complain about the service. I read previous reviews about the service and knew what I was getting into. The table wasn't ready for the reservation but sometimes that can't be controlled. It's kind of sad when you have to ask for a drink or to order food but we received all we asked for. 

I've been to Peru and was excited to be able to compare the food here in SF.

The ceviche was great. I ordered the sampler so I was able to try 4 on the menu. Keep the soy marinated/asian one on the bottom of your list. You can pretty much get this anywhere.

The empanadas were delicious. Crispy and flavorful. My favorites were the mushroom and the chicken.

Tried the quinoa salad. Great if your a veggie lover. Not great if you need a savory dish.

The presentations were nice and the chips and 3 dips a tasty appetizer.

I would have loved to try the whole cooked fish. That looked awesome.
author: kelly y.

description: Terrible service. Poor cost to value ratio. At least the drinks were strong
author: Fanny C.

description: La Mar offers a great experience. The food is absolutely delicious and drinks are extremely yummy. Besides, the staff is very well trained, and our waiter was very helpful and friendly. Some people might complain it is too pricy, however I am absolutely convinced that the prices are reasonable for the quality of food and experience that you get.
author: Ksenia B.

description: I don't understand how this place got #1 Peruvian (Best of Bay List) since their ceviche was not as tasty as Limon or Fresca.  With that being said, their entrees were a lot better than their ceviche.  I especially enjoyed their causas.  Their lomo saltado was also good.  I think that their causas are their best dish though.  So, I would probably return for that.  I also liked the complimentary chips.
author: Sandy J.

description:
This place was pretty good. I thought the dishes I ordered were ok but I'd love to try their other dishes. I ordered the shrimp, scallop and uni ceviche which was pretty good but I was hoping for more uni. There was only one piece of shrimp and mostly scallops. 

I also got the tasting of the potato side dish. I thought it was interesting and my favorite was the one topped with raw tuna. My second fav was the one with the crab. The others I probably wouldn't order again. 

My friend got the beef dish with french fries which I had a bite of. The temperature of the meat was great and the flavor yummy. 

My favorite though was probably the fried plantains and chips with the three different dipping sauces they gave us in the beginning for free!! Haha. A nice change to the typical bread and butter at most restaurants. 

The ambiance and decor is wonderful. We sat in the lounge area but I'll definitely go back again and check out the main dining area.
author: Jessica T.

description: The food was decent but other than the desserts nothing really stood out and for the amount we spent, surely something should have!
author: Lisa K.

description:
We came here last Saturday night to celebrate a combined birthday party.  The restaurant is large in size and has a very open airy feeling in the front and the back and a more cozy feel in the main dining area.  

We sat in the back which is covered and has heat lamps.  We ordered the crab causas which were delicious.  Unfortunately, the food that came after was just ok.   We had some ahi causas which were fine.  We ordered several other paella type dishes, empanadas, etc.

We brought 3 bottles of wine and were only charged for one corkage which was nice.  

It was pricey at $85 pp for five people.  I would have liked the dinner to be closer to $50.  We ended up ordering much too much food and it would have been nice for the server to have directed us to order a bit less.  

They did bring us complimentary desserts for our birthday which were like chocolate covered cream puffs.  The filling in the middle was a bit frozen so it was cold on the teeth.

Parking next door in the open lot is a flat $20 or $5 for every 30 minutes.

The bathrooms are unisex and a bit funky.  I guess that they couldn't renovate the bathrooms so they have a real old feel to them.  In addition, you will always have a wait for the bathroom with only 2 of them for most of the guests.  (there is a women's only bathroom too)

The restaurant is family friendly in the back and you can hear the music.  (I've heard that you really can't hear the music in the main dining area).  It has a bit of a Miami feel to it in the back and the tables have a very Crate and Barrel feeling to them.
author: Brian L.

description:
I was having a bad day. 
Actually, let me correct myself, I was having a really really bad day. So much I was a bit speechless which rarely happens, couldn't really make a successful thought or idea or decision. 
I'd already had plans and reservations for LaMar with a buddy and couldn't really decide if i should cancel them or not due to the poor turn of events during my sad day. She showed up to pick me up early and was having the opposite kind of day that I was having. She came looking glamorous and had just received great news on an exciting job offer for a fantastic company (hint: starts w/ a Y ends with an elp!) and I wanted to share in her joy of the news. 
Then I was reminded it was drink week so it'd be extra cheap (one point towards going) and we could cross off an item from our things to eat before you die list. So we went. 
My mind was mush and I was so distracted and just talked about my sad day so I'll list out all the good things to keep it simple. 
Beautiful decor, friendly professional staff, huge space, amazing view, unique menu, fresh fish, fast service, bright pretty colors (turquoise is my current favorite so it helped my mood a lot). I can't remember which cebiche we got, it had octopus, tuna and a bunch of other stuff - very very good. I loved the chips at the beginning. 
The drink was my favorite part. PIsco sour. Had I of been in a more festive mood and didn't have my own drama to worry about I would have enjoyed several more. It will be something I will look forward to in the summer outside. 
very nice place.
author: Audrey V.

description: I've only had Peruvian food once before eating at La Mar but as before I definitely enjoyed it.  First of all the set up of the restaurant is great.  Right along the Embarcadero you would think that the place was a decent size but it was huge.  I really like the open kitchen as well.  To start you have to have the cebiches.  I'm not exactly sure what they were but they were all excellent.  The service was great too as our waitress explained everything that we had questions on...which was a lot.  For my main meal I had the Lomo Slatado which was very good and beef was super tender.  Fun times.
author: Blake B.

description: Best Peruvian food I've ever had. The atmosphere, super friendly service topped off by the best courses of food is the only way to summarise this place. Thanks again and keep up the good food and service!
author: Sonia S.

description:
This place - the only outlet in a pan-American chain that's outside of Latin America - was recommended to us by some friends, one of whom works in the Financial District and had discovered it as a good lunch spot.  We checked it out on a Saturday night and found that it attracts a big enough following to fill up the ample, buzzing dining room.

I could go into the details of the delicious cerviches on offer, but instead would recommend the "cebiche tasting" which includes samples of mahi mahi, calamari, ahi tuna and halibut with accompaniments spanning  habanerao peppe, peanuts, pickled carrots and daikon, wonton strips and so many delicious flavors in the "leche".  All delicious - one was not enough for our group, so we managed a couple during an evening of laid-back tapas-style dining and conversation.

Besides the ceviches we found room for some other appetizers - from the selection of anticuchos (traditional Peruvian skewers) the octopus with mashed potato and chimichurri sauce were sensational.  We also took a selection of "causas" - traditional Peruvian whipped potato with toppings including ahi tuna, Dungeness crab and artichoke which added further variety without being too filling.

The service is ok if a bit lackadaisical - if your server forgets to bring the fried plantain and potato chips with the dips, like ours did, then give them a prod.  They're too good to miss!  The wine list does pretty much what it needs to, but one doesn't come to a restaurant like this for an exalted oenological experience.  La Mar is all about tasty, fresh food in a lively setting, and in this respect it hits the mark.  It's a great, laid back dining experience in a buzzing room - with the kitchen fully exposed to the dining room - with wonderful views out onto the bay.  We'll be back!
author: Dom B.

description: This place is so solid. This may be one of the most underrated restaurants in the city!
author: John H.

description:
Pisco sour and personalized menu.  Compensated for the aproned gentleman at the podium who left same unmanned as I walked in the door, despite noting my entrance ... That's like a masseuse breaking skin contact at an inapt juncture ... playing with words here as much as writing a review ... 

La Mar is GREAT, GO THERE IF YOU'RE THINKING ABOUT IT!  

Yes they had those (Joe) Pis(ca-po)co bad boys served up as soon as we hit the table and once again, how "a pro pos!"  Accent grave over the "a" please.  

So anyway, oh so DESTINATION RESTAURANT.  So complimentary to the Ferry Building Plaza.  I parked across the "street" and consulted with valet parking desk about the likelihood of a ticket.  "The City just put in new meters that go till ..."   8 or 9, some ridiculous configuration ~ (City and County of San Francisco !!!  You should NOT have to feed meters after 6 pm, okay?)  Lest I digress, Valet Parking Dude said, "Well we park the cars there so ..."  *wink wink*  So you CAN play free parking roulette but if it's too much of a distraction, yes there is very excellent valet parking for a very reasonable $10 because THEY THINK OF EVERYTHING at La Mar.  Peruvian Japanese!  Exquisite freshness, dazzling presentations, skillful spicing, impeccable preparation.   I love the Ferry Building area;  It's like OUR Pike's Market and like Pike's Market, La Mar really adds and enhances the all-around excellence that you frequently encounter in this delightful area.  

Hence DESTINATION which means, it's worth the trip, it's special, it's like meeting a babe and finding out she's wicked smart and everything she does is magic.  Like the "Police" song.  With a good heart.
author: Terry A.

description:
After 3 visits, I am ready with the report card:
4 stars for the Pisco sours
2 stars for the service
3 stars for the food
The rocoto relleno is out of this world - spicy but not mouth-burning, and nicely balanced between meat, pepper, and sauce.  The aji de gallina (and maybe this is the dish itself, not La Mar's preparation) is a gummy distaster.  BUT the ceviche chifa is bright, tangy, and quite generous with large slices of delicious fish.  I love the plantains and 3 salsas that come with lunch and cocktails.  I really really really WANT to love this place, thus the multiple attempts.  Maybe just one more try before I give up...
author: Julie L.

description: the cebiche was to die for... the restaurant is pretty... views everywhere...you feel like you are in a destination restaurant...  all the dishes were unique, tasty, fresh and spiced just right.  I like hot spice, my fellow diners liked sweet..and there was something for each of us...  cannot wait to go back.
author: Billy B.

description: I've been here several times for both lunch and dinner and usually have a good time. Have been here for lunch on weekdays taking advantage of the spacious outdoor patio, soaking in the sunshine. The view is ok, kinda blocked by surrounding buildings but you see enough water and boats to set the tone. The large windows bring the water and boats in for some atmosphere. Causas are a staple order for me, ceviche and empanadas too and a mix of other items. Drinks aren't bad and the wine list is decent. A nice stop off if you are in town and like Peruvian food, but as others have mentioned it is a bit pricey. I do like it better than the more economically priced Limon.
author: C W.

description:
Be ready to spend the next year waiting for your food! 

My Boyfriend I went to eat at La Mar last night and it was a 3 hour dining experience! Our waiter that went by the name of Diego felt the need to wait 55 minute to put in my drink order and brought one of the four items that we ordered to the table every 45 minutes! 

Diego seemed to have several personal friends sitting in his area, which he decided to have long conversation with. The rest of us normal "non personal friends" of Diego's were felt to fend for ourselves, even when it comes to the request of water!

Let's start to chat about Ben, the "manager on duty" that seems to not like to manage anything! Ben looked over at my table several times throughout my 3 hour dinner, noticing the look of frustration on my face. Guess what Ben did about this.... NOTHING!! Nothing at all!!

Ben asked several of the waiters who had table "44"... which he got a lot of responses of "not I"... well guess what Ben, of course you are not going to get a response of "me, me, table 44 is mine" when your server is off Chit Chatting with everyone and their mother!

The fact that Ben had to go out of his way several times to ask who's covering our table, but never once came to the table himself was horrible management skills. 

I have called the restaurant and asked to speak to Andrew the main guy , and was told that he was on the floor and only responds to email. After reading the other reviews about this place and reading that Andrew doesn't ever get back to anyone I will start to hold my breath on this matter. 

I am just very upset that what was supposed to be a great night, turned into a night that left both of us frustrated and in a bad mood!
author: Susan B.

description:
Went with former co-workers; wanted someplace we could hang so attempted a reservation...since we had some South Bay people I tried to get in early no dice four days prior...so got reservations in the "lounge"

Three sections; the bar - on embarcadero lots of windows but not especially large...the lounge - on the pier between the lounge and the dining room; kinda feels like you are in a hallway though they have made it look decent...the dining room - nice color; good views of the water and good solid furniture.

I got there early and talked to the host; he was able to get my group on the Chef's table - noticed the patio which would be great on a rare warm day for lunch.

Started with Cebiche; have to admit was good not great.  Given the reviews we had expected this to be fantastic.  Most of the marinades were a little too strong; despite what was clearly quality fish.  Our fave was the classic

Tried the grill sampler; amazing octopus and I know you may not believe it but the beef heart was excellent.

We then all shared the ensalada nikei, arroz juguso (a paella), cordero (lamb shank) and lomo saltado (beef and rice).  All of this was really great.  Got the beignet's for dessert...

So to sum up; go for more than Cebiche; try the grilled starters...and the mains are good too...on the expensive side.
author: Omer K.

description:
I called ahead to ask what time the kitchen closes and they said 10PM. Fair enough. I showed up at 9.30PM on a Tuesday.
No host. I asked a busboy passing by "can I still get food?"...he said "yes, the host will be here anytime". I was waiting and waiting, some potential patrons walked in while I was waiting, looked around and left, probably thinking that the restaurant was already closing.
10 minutes later the host shows up, and she makes me sit AT THE BAR! are you kidding me? I was by myself (after a long work day) but I did not ask for the bar. If I wanted the bar I had just gone straight there and not wait for the host.

Anyway, I sit and go quickly through the menu. I'll just a have "cebiche clasico" and a pisco sour. I ordered the pisco sour and the cebiche from someone that was not my waiter because my waiter only showed up practically at the same time my pisco sour and cebiche  were brought to me saying "Hi, I'm John your waiter, here's your blah blah, let me konw if you have any questions". And by the way, I was expecting to have my drink while I waited for my food, not at the same time.

Anyway, in one word, AWFUL SERVICE. And I am of the ones that do not care for a smile or fake royalty treatment, I just want quick service, salt, pepper, and my glass of water full.

The pisco sour was delicious, made the way it is supposed to be.

Now, a cebiche is usually a pretty fulfilling meal. I could just have a cebiche and be done with my meal. Well, guess what? I think the cebiche consisted of 3 or 4 pieces of fish. It was good, not extraordinarily good, just good. But such a small portion for $18???? That was the second joke of the night.

I was hungry. So I decided to go for one of the causas, that at any other Peruvian restaurant, it is also a pretty fulfilling appetizer. This was the biggest joke of the night. The $12 Nikei causa consisted of three tiny pieces of causa, each one the size of half a thumb. It was delicious. The ahi tuna on top (like 1 once total or less) was also good. But, man, the portion size was just ridiculous. I felt insulted.

Of course, I was still hungry after the causa. But I was really afraid of ordering the nearly $30 lomo saltado.

I had one beer to end the night.

My tab was close to $70. And I was still hungry.

For those prices and portion size I would expect much much more. At least some good service (the service was terrible) and outstanding food! (the food was just good)

The next day I went to Limon in South Van Ness, the cebiche was DELICIOUS (so much better than La Mar's). We also got lomo saltado, anticuchos (cow heart) and a quarter chicken, yuquitas fritas and cancha plus 6 drinks. All for $75 for two people.

Go to La Mar to pretend to be fancy and be ripped off. Be smart and go to Limon.
author: Carlos M.

description: Had lunch here yesterday. Great view, tasty food, good service. Why 1 star then? Oh, just the fact that two of the three of us who ate there have spent the morning today no more than six feet from a toilet--yep, bad food poisoning. We did have cebiche and sushi (rollito nikei), so there are a few suspects as to which dish was spoiled, but you expect the raw fish to be cured and/or clean. It's a shame...totally ruined one of our two days in the city. Just scrolled down and saw that R.R. and others have had similar experiences...probably call the health dept on Monday.
author: Jeff G.

description:
The food is exceptional.  Being Peruvian I was automatically gonna compare the food to my mom's cooking. I would bring my entire Peruvian family to dine at this restaurant, that's how strongly I feel they represented my home country's cuisine. 
 We started with the cebiche mixto (small portions) it was delicious. I ordered the 'arroz nortena', which was perfectly cooked with plenty of seafood. My bf ordered 'a lo pobre' which is the skirt steak in a bed of plantains and covered in sauteed onions and tomatoes, topped with a fried egg. The steak melted in your mouth!!
 Our servers were very attentive and some were Peruvian! We ended our meal with 'picarones'...OMG! i remember eating this dessert as a child. The picarones are like doughnuts/funnel cakes.  The batter was made of sweet potato and pumpkin.  It's drizzled with 'chancaca' (similar to melted brown sugar, but better!).

Atmosphere: 5/5 stars
Food: 5/5 stars
Service: 5/5 stars
Price: $$$$ (in my opinion it was a bit overpriced)
author: Cynthia D.

description: Flavorful but overpriced food and questionable service. The lomo saltado was delicious but not worth $29, even if we could see a sliver of water from our table (for some reason the view wasn't that great even though we were near the window). Our waiter came and left four times before giving us a chance to order, and we had to stop him from leaving a fifth time by yelling after him that we were ready. They also started clearing the table while some of us were still eating. Not just taking people's plates, but taking their placemats too and wiping off the table. Kinda alienates people who are still eating.
author: Marco L.

description:
Love the cebiche - I recommend the chife and the nikei (or you should just really get the sampler).  All of the empanadas are delicious as well.  The entrees aren't quite as good but the portions are generous.  
Ambiance is great, right on the water, and is great for groups and if you just want drinks.
Highly highly recommend this place.
author: Cathy L.

description: La Mar on Pier 1.5, serves traditional Peruvian fare in a four-month old sprawling resort space with cerulean blue walls that match the bright purple yam confit and crispy yellow tail on their Technicolor menu. Try the purple corn infusion, a powerful natural antioxidant, and on your way out, you just might get a free lesson from the head bartender on Pisco Sours Quebranta (signature Peruvian Grape Brandy). Forget the Amaretto Sours, these chilled frothy concoctions are amazing!
author: jana h.

description: Came here for happy hour and was amazed by the ambiance and menu. We ordered the Pisco punch and boy did it pack a punch!  They serve everyone an order of homemade chips with these amazing dipping sauces that we devoured instantly. We shared a sampler empanada platter. Best empanadas around!  We also split an amazing halibut ceviche' with a side of yucca fries. Will definitely have to come back for dinner in the near future.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Dinner was excellent.  Noise level a little high and we were seated VERY CLOSE to the next table.  But actually that was kind of fun because we could eavesdrop on their interesting conversation!  Majority of the clients seemed to be young professionals - we went on a week night.  Waiter and service were just fine!  We'll go again.  Oh yes, parking was right across the street for $20.00.
author: Grace B.

description:
Being at La Mar was very interesting.  It felt like I wasn't in SF at all, for one, and apparently the men's toilet is a historical monument?  (see that pic below) Anyways..

I have never had Peruvian food before so I have no prior tastes to compare.  For apps, we had the tasters of cebiches and causas.  This is a can't fail unless you are hung over.  My meal was the chupe de camarones, which is like a Peruvian stew.  It wasn't too bad but a little too salty for my taste.  I definitely could not finish the soup stew at all, though I ate most of the potatoes, shrimp, and anything else inside that was not a liquid.  

Nice place to come for lunch, if I ever go to Peru would love to compare with those restaurants.
author: Yosie G.

description: Great cebiches and cocktails, great ambiance, nice staff, great views, easy to get to, parking across the street, lots of space so I rarely have to wait. Fresh and healthy.
author: Arcelia G.

description: To start off, let me tell you that I absolutely loved this place. I took my boyfriend here for dinner for his birthday this year. Yeah, we could've gotten a better table with a view of the outside patio, but we came late for our reservation so we were seated in the main dinning area. Nonetheless, the interior was very peaceful, relaxing and tropical. As for the food, we started off with drinks. I had a Waikicha and he got Crystal beer, both were very good. Then, we tried causa chicharrón and empanadas de lomo saltado, they were absolutely delicious! For the dessert, we ordered crocante de maiz. Food was great, but the fact that they charge for refills of coffee is a little bit ridiculous considering the fact that the cups are minute, thus -1 star. Otherwise, great place, definitely worth going to!
author: Karina A.

description:
Yummies! 

Cebiche - As good as it gets. Fresh and love the chunks of fish and and calamari. You taste the actual flavors of the ingredients.

Empanada Sampler - Every one was delicious

Juane - Halibut special of the night. SO GOOD. Fish cooked perfectly. 

If you are willing to the pay the price and looking for a fun place with great food, you'll get it here.
author: Jenna C.

description:
I often wish that Yelp would let you do half stars.  Sometimes I just don't feel its right to give a place 4 stars, for various reasons, but 3 stars seems to low.  

La Mar is one of those places.  This is a 4-star place when I am taking clients to lunch on my company dime.  If I had paid myself ($600 for 6 people at lunch), I would give it 3-stars.  The food was very good for the most part - though the potato things didn't blow me away, especially for the price (its friggen potato after all).  The ceviche was good, though there is much, much better in the city.  The entrees on the other hand were great.  I had the scallops with mint which was awesome.  

The service was mediocre.  It took FOREVER to get drinks, and when we repeatedly asked about it they gave us some nonsense excuse about how these drinks "take much more care to make", uh ya, you bet.  

My review is tempered by the price/service and who is paying.  If you are paying, read this as a 3-star review if it is coming out of your hard earned money, 4-stars if you are lucky enough to have the expense account rocking.

Overall - 3 1/2 Stars.
author: Andrew M.

description:
So far, our favorite spot to go to for Peruvian food. Their location is right on Embarcadero, facing the bay. The atmosphere is great, they have both indoor and outdoor sitting (although we have yet to try dining outside). There is a parking lot right next to the restaurant, I believe is $15 for a couple of hours but not sure. 

For appetizers, the Classic Cebiche, Anticucho de Corazon and Causa Sampler are all delicious. The fish used in the cebiche always feels extremely fresh. 

Recommended for entrees are Lomo Saltado and Arroz Parihuela. The flavors stay loyal to the Peruvian spices that I tried back in Peru. 

Overall, the customer service we experienced so far is good. But make sure you make reservations in advance, it can get very crowded on a weekend evening.
author: Shaggy S.

description:
Great business lunch spot.  The ceviche classico is the best with the runner up being the ceviche mixto.  The grilled squid was amazing too. The restaurant has a great wine list at relatively moderate prices- there lot's of excellent Argentinean Malbecs under $35.

This place is definitely in the rotation when I'm craving some interesting seafood.
author: todd b.

description:
This restaurant offers you the opportunity to show the exquisite  nature of Peruvian food. The presentation of the dishes is great and the drinks are just amazing.
The knowledge of Peruvian cuisine by the staff is excellent. This is surprising especially because most of the servers are not Peruvian.
I love this restaurant and I would recommended it to everybody.
author: Carlos A.

description: Delicious ceviche excellent service. Would have liked a different entree selection.
author: Mark S.

description: I don't think you can go too wrong with restaurants along the waterfront. And although I've had peruvian food only a few times before, I think cebiche (ceviche) is always a great thing to order. They have a sampler to try a variety of unique types.  The way all the food is presented is very detailed. I love seafood and ordered the halibut which was good. Also liked the views. Great place.
author: Linda H.

description:
Ive been  meaning to do this for a long time now. I am so disappointed with this  restaurant. I went back in february with my father. He came all the way from Sac, to move me and it was getting late once we were finish. He really wanted to go here and try there cebicheria, so we called to see when they closed. We spoke with them and they said they closed at 10. We arrived at 9:20 and where told the kitchen was closed. Mind you, we had been moving so we were not in the best of clothes, but we could afford to eat there. My dad was looking to spend a lot cause he heard it was really good.  My dad is also Hispanic and brought with him a hispanic coworker with him. To make the store short we had to almost argue with the manager to seat us in the bar. Than 15 minutes later the seat a white couple no problem no questions asked. The food, and beer wasnt even that amazing, plus the service sucked. I felt they were racist towards us and pulled the sirt and tie rule on us, but it isnt even a fancy restaurant. 

So word of advice dont waste your money on this place. WALK DOWN TO PIER 3 AND GO EAT AT THE PLANT, that place rocks and the people in there are amazing.(period)
author: Andrea T.

description: I went there to try it 3 months ago because I've read so many good reviews about it. When I was there I was shockingly pleased. I expected it to be really good, but it totally exceeded my expectation by far. The staffs were very friendly. The view was breath taking. The food was delicious. The price was pricey, but not outrageous. It was definitely worth it.
author: Tri N.

description:
I love ceviche, cerbiche.......fish cooked with citric acid.  

Yet when I went to La Mar, I discovered a new love and dish to crave - tiraditos, the Peruvian-equivalent to Japanese sashimi.  We ordered the tiradito clasico and it was soft, tangy and refreshing.  The cebiche clasico was decent, but definitely overshadowed by the tiradito.

Other than these exciting meal starters, the rest of the meal at La Mar is decent but nothing incredibly special.  The entree I had was a chicken stew served atop rice with quail eggs and olives - which was satisfying and great as leftovers, but a little pricey.  Buñuelos De Chocolate Caliente were nicely decorated but not the most amazing dish.

Final decision?  Go with a friend or two, catch up, get drinks and fill up on some refreshing fish on a pleasant evening.  A few ingredients for a great night!
author: Shay F.

description: Tons of options. I like tastings, b/c I always want to try everything. The colorful and complex flavored food was well complimented by a variety of sauces. Causas and beef heart were my favorites. The ceviche was too onion heavy, and the drink specials were unremarkable.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I went here for happy hour. 

The drinks are good - -mainly specialty Peruvian drinks. The wine and beer list aren't that extensive. 

It gets pretty crowded so be prepared for it to be loud and crowded...and involve some wait. The wait staff was very friendly...probably the best part of this place. It's worth stopping by to check out.
author: lindsey l.

description: After the third visit , I can say its consistently great. The halibut ceviche as well as the mixto were made from fresh ingredients and tested delicious.
author: Amit H.

description: I really love this space- so airy and tropical. I felt like I was on vacation. My only complaint was the hostess was pretty rude at the beginning when greeting us and taking us to our table. She made no conversation, only telling me that she didn't have my reservation- when I did make one. The waitress was nice. I enjoyed the lunch special with the octopus causa, cebiche mixto and the paella dish. It was filling and reasonably priced. The drink with the jelapeno is amazing!!!! Overall, a great lunch place.
author: Reena P.

description: Celebrated my birthday with my husband and it was walking distance from our hotel.  We had the ceviche sampler, Peruvian Beer and martini.  I would come back to this place; like the crowd and service.
author: Grace R.

description: So yum - went there last night for my birthday and the food was so good, the service excellent.  Even though we were about 20 minutes late, we were seated right away.  Only complaint was in the open table notes we had asked for a table with a view but got a view of the kitchen.  Which was ok because it's fun to watch them cook and prep and we noticed that there was a private party by the windows so that's probably why that request was fulfiled.  but our waiter was attentive, knowledable and had great suggestions and really took care of us. All the food was light and refreshing and the drinks delish.  left feeling full but not stuffed. atmoshere was but funky and fun and great for groups but not to loud that it wasn't romantic and the boy and i didn't have to shout.
author: natalie q.

description:
La Mar was the chosen spot for my gf's going away party. We all work in the financial district so finding somewhere convenient but special (not the usual FiDi spots like Royal Exchange, Harringtons, Nortons, Dada, etc) was our goal. After all, we had to send our gf off to New York with good (but maybe, fuzzy) memories of our last night together.
