The space is quite beautiful. High ceilings, clean lines, blue lights. Lots of loungy seating space for bar partons - perfect of our group. We sat near the cebiche bar - taking up a few tables and lots of cushy comfy chairs. Great for mingling, chatting and having some great cocktails. Prices are the norm for non-well drink kind. $10+ for a beautiful cocktail that hits the (drunk) spot quite quickly.

I'd love to return for a romantic drink and apps with the bf or for dinner with a group of friends. Then I will have more to tell re: service, food and overall experience.
author: Deann M.

description: I am really not a fish person, with sushi as an exception and now La Mar. Besides being an elegant, relaxing and stylish... a place that just breathes ambiance. There is no crowding or poor service or even a bad table really, and the space is adaptable to the needs of the restaurant. Good luck figuring out what to order because everything is delicious. Enjoy being in one of the few cities that have this delectable restaurant.
author: Natasha M.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. the first time i went I went with a Chef, so obviously its pretty solid food. My first time there was amazing, the service is great the pisco punch is out of this world. I have been here a few times and i haven't been let down once!
author: Denniz M.

description: Amazing ceviche!  Excellent skewers.  Couldn't understand the waiter...and I'm good with accents.  Energetic scene.  Wonderful pisco drinks.  Managed to be there during a Bay Fashion Magazine party (planned it that way...right!)
author: Cameron M.

description: the fish ceviche is spectacular! the causa, the empanadas, anticuchos, pan con chicaron(lunch menu), the lomo ALL GREAT.  the cholito for a refreshing cocktail!
author: Jenny P.

description: I love La Mar, they have good decor, great food but service is pretty sad its slow and you have to get attention. The chips and desserts and the fish stew and rice are the best!!
author: Joiera C.

description:
The restaurant is beautiful. The tables are nicely spaced out, you are not touching elbows with the table next to you. 

The menu is extensive and full of amazing dishes. Our group of 4 ordered 1 cebiche nikei, which was very nice, one appetizer (the chicken skewer would be highly recommended by us), and 4 main dishes to share.  We agreed that all on our table was delicious. 

For a dessert, we ordered the Bunuelos and the Tiramisu. The Bunuelos was very tasty. The Tiramisu, on the other hand, was very average and you are probably better off sticking to the Italian version.

Overall, we liked the restaurant a lot and would go back and recommend it to others.
author: Jana C.

description:
I've been meaning to write a review of La Mar for awhile now.  Some friends from work took me here for my birthday and it was wonderful.  We went for lunch and were on a tight schedule because we had to get back to work.  The Waiter was awesome and made getting in and out not only easy but enjoyable.

The food was delicious, nothing we ordered was bad from the rollo fashion to the ensalada tiradito.  

I could imagine on a warm sunny day sitting outside would be amazing, but be sure to make reservations the hostess said they are needed for the tables outside.
author: Leah A.

description: Delicious!!!!!! I have been to the sister restaurant in NY and this was ten times better. Sat at the bar alone, and left ($80 later) tipsy and satisfied. The empanadas lomo saltados were the best I have ever had. The pulpo was amazingly seasoned and perfectly cooked. My bartender was friendly and attentive, without being overbearing. I wish I cold have made it back during my time in SF.  Love love love.
author: Nicole E.

description: Happy hour is an awesome deal! Love all their ceviches. The pisco punch rocked my world.
author: Kelley D.

description: I went to La Mar with my girlfriend mid week before the dinner rush. It wasn't too crowded so we got a seat pretty quick with no reservation. I tried a couple different kinds of ceviche (can't remember names) which were all pretty good. I rate this place 4 stars because I really liked the environment, it's a cool place to go to for drinks, and I'm excited to try all the different plates.
author: Greg Poupon M.

description:
I can't stop talking this place up to my friends. I've gone there twice already, and could easily see myself returning for a third visit. La Mar incorporates all the things that make a restaurant great: 

Fantastic food: excellent Peruvian cuisine, some of it with an Asian twist. I even took my Peruvian friend there to verify authenticity :)
Great cocktails: amazing Pisco sours, actually pretty much every cocktail I drank there was amazing
Excellent (and authentic) service: charming hosts and servers provide added depth to the menu
Beautiful location/view: I didn't get seated near the window, but the location on the water makes this place that much more appealing

Here's to going a third time!
author: Keyvan R.

description:
soOo i've been wanting to go here for a LoOoOng time! and today I finally had the opportunity! and heck yeah.. this was well worth the wait!!!

Parking surprisingly was easy at 8:30pm. We made reservations on opentable to make sure we got a seat. and used our $20 opentable certificate! SCORE! :) That's one free appetizer for us! 

We ordered the Pisco Sour to start. It's frothy, then icy then juice, in that order.. if you look at the glass you can see that layer. It's not sweet enough for me.. I like things SUPER sweet so I'm a bad judge for that.. but the BF liked it. 

On to the meals. We didn't get a main course.. we stuck with the samplers.. 

We had the following:

Cebiche Tasting: (Mixto, Chifa, Nikei and Clásico) CLASICO is the BEST!!! OMG!!! Will definitely order that by itself.. the other ones were good.. but nothing as awesome as the Clasico! 

Causa Tasting: (Limeña, Criolla, Nikei, Casera) NIKEI rocks!! It's the perfect combo of texture, flavor, and spiciness for a kick. The other ones were decent.. but the crab one I liked the least... it actually reminded us of TUNA! from the can.. :( sorry

Anticucho de Corazón (Grilled beef heart with potatoes, Peruvian corn and a spicy rocoto sauce) This one was interesting. Never had heart before but if I had to compare, it's texture is somewhat comparable to Chicken gizzards. The potato was basically a slice of potato that was fried.. like a potato wedge.. nothing spectacular. I think I'd want to try the Octopus one next time. 

Empanada Sampler: We only tried the beef and seafood.. seafood one is good :) we were too full to finish the other two. But I think we would probably pass this next time and go for something in the main course section. 

soOOoo overall a wonderful experience.. but next time the MUST GETS will be the: Causa Nikei and the Clásico Cebiche!!!
author: Kristina L.

description:
Food, good. Service, not so much.

Let me complain first. Our waiter did not give us much attention. We ended up flagging the busboy on two occasions for water and for him to get our waiter so we could order food. Jesse, you are so lucky I had good company and the food was good or else I would not had tipped you 20%!! And what's up with you trying to limit our ordering? Give us what we want, don't question it. Sheesh. 

Food was pretty good. The menu was a little overwhelming. After a good 20 minutes, we finally decided to order: the causas tasting, beef hearts (yummy but really spicy sauce),  cebiche tasting, criollo tiraditos, nikei tiraditos, una (too bland). Would recommend going with a larger group so you could taste all the different things on the menu. I wanted to order more but my tummy couldn't hold any more.

One thing you must order - beignets. so, so yummy. the ice cream went really well with it. ah, i can still taste it

Carlos, I'm waiting for the sparkling sake to be on the menu....
author: Alice C.

description:
This is not hyperbole...it was the best dinner I've ever had.  May I recommend the Saltado Imperdible.  Beef tenderloin, octopus, calimari, shrimp and a few other things. The flavor and texture combined to make...perfection.  I can't think of another word.

That's all for now.
author: Chris D.

description: Went here before a show and sat outside in the winter. The food was great and the atmosphere was great. The drinks were good too. The dipping sauces for the plantain chips were great.
author: Ryan M.

description:
You walk in and you get a good vibe -- it's cool without being too hipster; nice without being too pretentious. And if you can get a place on the back patio on a warm day, you'll be treated to an amazing view of the bay bridge (and they have heaters out there in case the temperature plummets.)

I've eaten there four times (plus a few times for drinks only) and I have to say: It's all about the cebiche. I recommend the cebiche tasting which gets you four varieties that will really have your taste buds screaming "why haven't you taken us here before?" It is expensive, but this my friends is not the $3 ceviche you get at Taqueria Cancun.

I love the cebiche so much that I once ordered it for take out. The staff there was like "WTF?! Take out?" (It was still excellent, by the way.) I also attempted to order bread to soak up the heavenly goodness of the cebiche sauce -- and again, I got the "WTF?!" treatment. They were actually nice about it, but apparently they don't serve bread.

Oh and note to self: the pisco sours are sneaky strong -- after two, I was like: "ummm... I'm kind of drunk..."
author: Dan V.

description:
I am no expert on Peruvian cuisine, but me thinks there are better "Peruvian" restaurants in the city that will offer a better bang for you buck if you know what i mean.
Ceviche was bland, made me feel that the ceviche I had at the taco trucks in Mexicali were better. Service average. Cocktails: really freaking good but, not enough to make up for everything else.
Later I heard it was a franchise, then I thought that that explains a lot of things. 
My take on this place? Over rated and made me wish I had no taste buds so I could give them more than one star.
author: arthur b.

description: This place has surprisingly great vegetarian options - Chausa and Quinoa Chaufa are to die for. We love their empanadas as well! Some of the best service in the city!
author: Kintan B.

description: I discovered this restaurant by way of Cusco, Peru about a year and a half ago.  It has become my San Francisco favorite.  I have literally taken dozens of my friends to the restaurant and without exception, they love everything about it.  The decor, the interesting and tasty cocktails and of course the amazing food.  The service is always impeccable.   And if you're looking for something special for out of town guests, you can't go wrong.
author: Curt D.

description: LOVE this place.  Great Pisco Sours.  Great Food Great atmosphere.
author: Tim P.

description:
My husband and I ordered 2 appetizers, a coctail for myself, and a beer for him.  This bill was about $50!

The coctail was awful, and the appetizers not filling.  One was the one pictured above, 4 potato lumps with raw fish stuff on top - not very good, and seafood empanadas - tasted pretty good but expected more than 2!

They did serve fried plantain strips with dipping sauce, which was good.

NOT RECOMMENDED!
author: Tamar B.

description:
I doubt anyone will ever read this review as it seems that only the good reviews float to the top (strange... or paid for).  However, I strongly recommend staying away from this restaurant.  

I made a reservation to take my boyfriend out for dinner on his birthday.  On the day of our reservation, and too late to get a table anywhere else, I heard from a co-worker that both she and a friend had gotten sick after eating there.  (Not mere stomach ache, but work-leavingly violently ill).  They had been there on separate occasions, but she said that they both got the tuna entree.  She said I would probably be okay if I stayed away from that dish.  

Stupidly, I went to dinner anyways.  We ordered the cebiche tasting, beef empanada, mahi mahi skewer, and lamb shank.  It was all delicious... until I woke up at two am throwing up and didn't stop until 8.   

Of course, I realize that raw fish is always a bit of a gamble.  However, I eat sushi several times a month and have had cebiche (or ceviche) more times than I can count.  I've eaten street food in foreign countries with no problem.  Additionally, two other separate reports of food poisoning seems like more than a coincidence.  As supposedly high end as La Mar claims to be, this is just disgraceful.  

In sum, I recommend this restaurant if you need to lose 10 pounds really fast and don't mind spending the night in the bathroom - otherwise, stay away.
author: Andrea F.

description: One of the best happy hours in my neighborhood. Great pisco sour.
author: Adelia C.

description: Great food and music and atmosphere. Located right by the ocean with a view of the boats and the bay bridge on the patio which is a great place for a date! Yummy Pisco sours. The pastry chef is stunningly gorgeous and as sweet as the postres he makes *_*
author: Kevin H.

description: So Delic!! The cebiche here rocks. So tangy. Great place to have dinner or have a few drinks at the front bar.  They make really good fish entrees as well. I don't think i have ever had a bad meal or snack here! It's pricey so be prepared to pay for the yumminess!
author: Ka C.

description:
It's hard to properly replicate a piece of Latin America in the Bay Area, but La Mar has done it. With a true Latin decor complimented by rhythmic beats, the upscale setting is inviting and upbeat. The staff is friendly, good looking and well educated on the cuisine and libations; necessary when venturing into the land of Octopus skewers and cocktails of the week like the "Hechizo." The general manager and managing partner of the restaurant even made time to say hello and make sure we were enjoying our time.

The only thing that beats the friendly staff and true Latin setting is the fresh and delicious food. I highly recommend the cebiche sampler and the causa limena. All the rice dishes are delicious as well. Not only is the food great, but the presentation and abundance of different sauces provide the proverbial icing on the cake. 

Don't forget to try the Peruvian staple of the Pisco Sour, but also check out the reasonably priced wine menu, the rice beer or one of the many custom cocktails. Grab a cab because the bartenders aren't afraid to give you money's worth of booze.

I've been to La Mar three times so far and have never been disappointed. Once the summer sun soaks the back patio, the party will really start! Great for dates and groups alike.
author: Chris S.

description:
one word: YUMMY!!!!! i've had my share of pretty delectable plates of lomo saltado... and this place has definitely earned it's place among the top.  

Try the empanada sampler.. you will not be disappointed!
Actually you should probably try a lil bit everything on the menu if you can.  DELISH.

service can be a little on the cold and slow side, which is why instead of 5 i give this place 4 stars.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Nice cebiche selection for lunch...came here twice...sat outside on a not so warm day once and heaters worked with great view...other time inside.  Had all cebiche selections and giving them 4 stars for that and their decor.  I will return to try other menu items in the near future and update this post...
author: Patrick C.

description: I love the ambiance of the bar and the main dinning room.  The bar is always lively and too noisy to hear your friends talk.  The cebiches are just simply exceptional.  The main entrees leave much to be desired.  The mixed drinks are good.  Good place for a date (the dinning room) but for true Peruvian food, go to the Missions.
author: Peace L.

description:
Went to Happy Hour (M-F, 3PM-6PM) 

- Great happy hour menu (drinks for 5 and are strong; appetizer plates are $3-6 each and really tasty.)
- Even though it's happy hour, they definitely use fresh cuts of fish and seafood
- Vibe: quiet from 3PM-4:30PM so great for groups that want to catch-up, but great crowded from 5PM on. 
- Service: My first time there had good service with the waitress frequently checking in and asking how we're doing, but the second time, the waitress was awful.  Completely out of it and could not even put a smile on her face.  Slow service.  So minus one star for that

Recommendation: Must order a pisco sour
author: S c.

description: Finally a place that violates the age-old san francisco rule that it is impossible to get good food and a good view in one place. both the inside of the restaurant and of course the outside view are amazing. my one tiny quibble is that while everything we picked was great (ceviche sampler, empanada sampler and one more thing i forget), the one dish the waiter recommended wasn't so good. Was octopus, which i normally love, but the texture was off -rubbery but not in the good octopussy way. Still, great drinks and a great meal for a fairly reasonable price, given the surroundings. I'll be back.
author: Erica W.

description:
I visited La Mar on 8/27/11 with my cousin and a good friend.  We had a reservation and were promptly seated.  And then the fun began.  Victor was our waiter and he ROCKED!!!  He was super friendly, funny, attentive and clearly knew the menu inside and out.  He answered all of our questions and made some recommendations which we LOVED!  

Each dish that we ordered was delicious.  The sangria was very tasty and our dessert sampler was perfect.  And to top it all off, their coffee was divine!
author: Liza Z.

description: I have only eaten and had drinks at the bar.  I like this place and have been here a couple of times.  The pisco sour puts a smile on my face and it is hard not to have more than one.  The bar is nice, except that the hard stools can be really hard on the butt if you sit for a long time.  The beef empanadas are excellent and the dip that comes with it is very tasty.  Ceviche is also great. The atmosphere is also nice.
author: N F.

description: The octopus was good and the drinks were fabulous! we made it to our reservation late and they were still nice to us. Great service!
author: Margaux G.

description: A little pricey for something's that would cost tenth a much in Peru. But, the, it is San Francisco. The food was good, and the service outstanding.
author: T.H. J.

description:
I've been here twice,and have been really satisfied both times.  The only reason why I docked a star is because it is a little overpriced.

I am in love with their mixed chips and dip! Their pisco sours are REALLY strong (listed on the 7x7 100 Things You Must Try list) and their happy hour (4-6pm) is good! Try to get there early though because it fills up pretty quickly.

Plus points that it's easily accessible from the Embarcadero Bart, the heated patio, and corn empanadas!
author: Jaclyn F.

description: You have to order the Cebiche -- it's a house specialty.  I recommend reservations for this place.  Overall, I rate this place as very good... but at the same time.... slightly overrated?  Don't get me wrong, I plan on coming back, but this place, along with Slanted Door, are in a category of good places that seem to have wait lists and hard-to-get reservations.  Still, I plan to be back.
author: Chris W.

description: I love La Mar for pisco sours and cebiche, as well as for the beautiful space and for showing off to visitors.  Aside from that, it's a very pricey venue and not a place I feel the need to visit often.  But for a pit stop after work or on a sunny weekend afternoon, it's hard to beat.
author: Pei L.

description: Bar is great but service at front desk/reception of restaurant is horrible.  Rude and haughty.  After drinks, we decided to have dinner.  We were told only seats at the restaurant bar were available but rthe estaurant was basically empty.  OK -- we're fine with eating at the restaurant bar but there was no one at the bar and we were seated right in front a column.  We waited about 10 minutes and no server in sight. Finally, person at the front desk said we couldn't move to another seat at the empty bar because this would be confusing to the waiters since this split their serving area.  Still no waiter so we left.  Not only did we not get to taste their food which gets high reviews -- we also left with a bad taste in our mouths and won't return.
author: M E.

description:
Went to celebrate 4th of July and it was perfect. It was the first time I tried Peruvian food and Wow. I'm always picky about my servers but my server last night not only was friendly and quick, he knew the menu perfectly. Must try:
Piscou Sour 
Cebiche Nikei
Causa Tasting
Buñuelos de Chocolate Caliente
Will definitely be back!
author: Crf C.

description:
Good bye Fresca Noe Valley!!

This is THE place to go for some yummy Peruvian food. This new Gaston Acurio restaurant is as great as the one in Miraflores -Lima. Also similar look. 

Minus one start for not having my ALL time favorite :Aji de Gallina!! Come on Gaston, a restaurant without Aji de Gallina in its menu?!!... no pues...  :(
author: Luis C.

description: We had a wonderful Sunday afternoon meal. The setting is beautiful and the service was great. They have a fun and unique menu with great service to guide you to best options. Tatiana was fabulous
author: cheri w.

description:
**Four stars for unusual and tasty food
**Five stars for the bright, fantastic decor and stellar views
**One star for our surly, cranky waiter
**3.5 Stars Total

Also, $39 for a "lunch special"???
I thought the prices were OUTRAGEOUS!!
I'd come here again if someone else were paying, otherwise between the lame service and the inflated prices I'd skip it.
author: Shira G.

description: This was my first Peruvian meal and it was amazing.  Service was great and our waiter did a great job of helping me choice the right things.  Here from Idaho and planning on going back tomorrow night - in a city full of a zillion possibilities.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I feel like this food was made with love! You can't beat the beef hearts (they are the best believe me) and the empanadas rock. Best birthday dinner ever! Absolutely delicious. Peruvian delights in top form!
author: Davlyn S.

description:
This is Gaston Acurio's entry to the US market and he could not have done it better. The restaurant is in a great location and the food is exquisite. For first time explorers the cebiches are great and the potato dishes wonderful.
Highly recommended!
author: Andres P.

description:
Excellent place for cocktails and dinner on the Embarcadero.  This place is known for their cebiche so we got the sample and every single one was delicious- just the right amount of spice and tanginess.  The empanadas are also good and not too greasy, although they can be quite heavy.   Causas, as I found out- are like mashed potatoes with extra stuff- the causa limena with Dungeness crab was sooo good that my eating companion and I argued over who should get the 3rd one.  
Drinks are delicious- probably the best Pisco sour I've had (but I've never been to Peru).  If cocktails aren't your thing, wine list is pretty decent as well.
Service was on-point, not too casual or serious and very helpful answering questions for ppl unfamiliar with this type of food.
The ambiance is great- this place is pretty busy even on weeknights and it can get kinda loud so don't expect a super romantic quiet atmosphere but if you have a group and want to laugh and eat some great food, definitely give this place a try!
author: Maxine S.

description:
My friend and I were so excited to eat here after having dined at Astrid y Gaston in Lima about a year and a half ago.    My friend made reservations for her birthday for a party of ten.  We met at the bar before dinner for terrific cocktails

We tried Pisco sours all over Peru, and the version at La Mar is as good as any we had in Peru.  My friend really enjoyed the Pisco punch as well.

We ordered many appetizers to share around the table - of course the ceviche was the star but other dishes were wonderful as well.

I had the grouper - excellent because it is so hard to find on the west coast.  My friend had the lomo saltado - which she said was divine.  We will be back.
We were seated about 30 minutes late but our table was by the window, which we felt may have kept the sound down.  We were able to have a great meal and actually hear each other.

Highlights included the cebiche (halibut was a favorite around the table) , the Jalea, and Causas.

Favorite entrees included the grouper (which I had and was wonderful)
author: Sallye M.

description: best palce to get drink in the late afternoon
author: Greg D.

description: I'm definitely a fan of La Mar.  The atmosphere is awesome.  I love the space.  The bar is in the front and the restaurant is in a separate space in the back. The room is huge and the ceilings are high.  They used the original architecture of the building and made a very interesting restaurant.
author: Gary B.

description:
4.5 stars for sure.  THis place is fantastic.  What a wonderful addition to the SF food scene and in partiuclar to the overly toursity venues on Embacardero.  

La Mar is basically the more refined version of Limon and Fresca.  I am not an expert peruvian foodie but I do know good food.  I have always loved the flavors that Limon and Fresca brought out in their foods.  La Mar takes the peruvian experience to a different level of quality and delicacy.  Everything there is well executed and you can taste the utmost quality and care.  

Additionally, the space they managed to snag is awesome.  I havent seen such a great space for a rest. in a long time.  It is big and roomy, with a great view of the bay along with a great ceviche bar that serves the full menu.  The bar itself is also amazingly beautiful.  Trust me and try this place.
author: Charles C.

description: Great place to go if you are on a diet and want to develop a callous on your ass from the seating.  Looking forward to a bowl of cheerios when I get home.
author: Andrew N.

description:
Meal was fab, service was excellent, decor was bright and cheerful - especially during these winter months.  Portions are quite sizeable, so don't overdo it as I did!

The tasty fresh potato snack with the three dipping sauces was a really nice touch.

Parking was easy with the Hornblower Valet service.  Great place to bring friends or reconnect with old ones.
author: Miranda O.

description:
My mother lost her voice here because she was shouting across the table. But atmosphere is young and rather San Francisco. Food is not quite as refined as Limon in the Mission but still clean and good. I didn't like the rather Japanese tasting ahi dishes but the standard peruvian ceviches (cebiches, as they call it) are quite good and full of that to-die-for lime flavor. 

Overall, I'd go back to the expansive (lots of room at this place) restaurant but a notch up will be needed to have a really refined pleasant evening.

Also, a little light on the restrooms, even though they have three.
author: R K.

description:
I am so lucky to have a group of fantastic friends who treated me to dinner at La Mar last night for my birthday.  I may have found my new favorite spot in the city.

We were a group of about 14 and the buzz around the table was positive throughout our meal.  The restaurant is stunning, a very large space, with a modern, open, airy feel.  The bar to the side seemed to have great lighting and I could definitely picture stopping in to hang at the bar as well.

I had a minor panic attack at first as they led us to the outside patio.  It's November and it's freaking COLD at night.  I am particularly sensitive to the cold.  I thought I'd have to keep my wool coat on all night and worried that I would be uncomfortable.  But NO, they have a great set up out on the patio with super powerful heat lamps that penetrate from above.  Towards the end of the night, I wished I had worn a sleeveless blouse instead of a sweater, I was that toasty.  Kinda fun to comfortably dine outdoors next to the water in November!

The food is fabulous.  My only beef is that reading the menu got a bit confusing... it was really difficult to tell which items were starter size and which were entree size.  Luckily our server was a great help.  Although he did make us believe the starters were teensy tinsy..... don't believe them, they are pretty decent size for starters.  I shared a halibut cebiche and a kampachi tiradito and had a scallop dish for my main entree.  The cebiche was good, but the tiradito was incredible.  My mouth is watering as I recall the buttery fish soaked in a succulent sauce (not sure exactly what it was).  I enjoyed the scallops just fine, but I got a taste of a pal's seared ahi dish and wished I'd ordered that dish.  I have never tasted an ahi dish that was so meaty, it felt almost like eating steak.  

I don't know much about authentic peruvian cuisine, but it certainly felt authentic.  They start the meal off with a basket of fried plantains & potatoes (I think) with three tasty sauces to dip them in.  The sauces were all very unique, one was made with black beans, another had more of a tomato-creamy taste and the last tasted like an aioli of sorts.  I could have eaten a whole basket of those suckers (I think I may have actually!)

The service was very attentive.  They were very good about refreshing drinks and they kindly plated and served out my birthday cake.

I can't wait to go back!!
author: Sheila D.

description:
Great atmosphere, and excellent Peruvian food. 

They use real Peruvian ingredients, the aji they served with the fried banana chips was the best I've had in years.  

The ceviche is good, however, I've had better in San Francisco. It wasn't quite spicy enough and the fish was not cut into bite size pieces to let the lemon juice properly cook it. 

It's a bit pricey for what you get, but overall, a wonderful dinner experience.
author: Rebecca B.

description: The food and cocktails are fantastic. The waiter we had was adorable and very friendly. I understand and appreciate all of the work that goes into their food, and I wish it was a little less expensive. A great place for special occasions :)
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Wow...the ceviche here really was the best I've ever had. The place lived up to the hype.  Must try the cebiches and the causas. The lomo saltado was delicious as well, especially with the flavorful sauce, super tender beef, and the crispy golden potatoes.

Loved the decor too, especially the dark wood floors, white walls, large windows, and the peacock blue chairs. It kind of also has an of exotic and somewhat islandly feel.  This would be an awesome venue for a birthday party, or a special occasion like an engagement party, or a small wedding reception. 

The staff were extremely friendly, attentive, and were always smiling. I would definitely love to return here for dinner again sometime soon! 

Parking kinda sucks, but you can usually find something around drumm street, or always park in the embarcadero center lots.  Also, since the restaurant is on the waterfront, it's a great option to take a date or your significant other, since you can walk along the waterfront to admire the city's nightlights afterwards. Ya know...to be romantic or something like that hehe... =P
author: Grace Y.

description:
Had dinner there 6/12/11 with my wife & nephew.  The waiter was great. He suggested various appetizers, salads and specialties and waited until we finished each before going on to the next.  We spent a good 1:45 over dinner and everything we had was excellently and freshly prepared. 

My highest praises.
author: Vernon S.

description:
As we did not have a reservation, we went to eat at the Cebicheria bar where we were lucky to find 2 seats on Friday night. We sat at the bar, opposite the bartender which was busy all night making cocktails. We ordered the cebiche tasting which consists of 4 types of cebiche. My favorite was the cebiche nikei with ahi tuna with it's gorgeous tamarind sauce. I went to Peru for a few weeks so had high expectations for the cebiche, I was not disappointed. We followed by a nikei salad and sea bass nikei. The sea bass was beautiful cooked and served on a bed of scallions and beansprouts. The sauce was very yummy. Instead of the rice, we asked the bartender for an alternative, he suggested the quinoa. It came with beautiful beans (the name I cannot remember). The salad was big and very tasty, the sauce was a little sweet for my liking. 
The service was quick, the bartender was highly knowledgeable and give us time to order.
We were not drinking this month but I will be sure to return to sample some of the cocktails.

Decor: 3 stars
Atmosphere: 4 stars
Food: 4 stars
Service: 4 stars
author: N H.

description: I love a good pisco sour but I can't stomach a bad one. That said, La Mar has excellent pisco sours. They use a blender instead of shaking them, and the strainer they use maintains the frothy creaminess essential to a good pisco sour. Their chicha morada based cocktail is excellent as well - a nice grown-up chicha morada. Both drinks reminded me of my trip to Peru only it was much better.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I read the reviews and was excited to try this place out. The ambiance is wonderful I enjoyed the sleek designs and the blue lighting at the bar where we sat. The Pisco drinks I had were very strong which is a good thing but if you are not wanting a strong drink i suggest you try something else. 
We ordered the Cebiche, Causas sampler, and the empenadas sampler. I did not care for the cebiche all that much. For me it was too raw. It seemed like they did not let it marinate long enough. It was more of a sushi type dish with a citrus taste to it. The causas were good. I guess I hyped it up to much from all the rave reviews. The dish looked amazing and it tasted pretty good. I wasn't wowed with the taste like I was with the presentation. The empanadas were probably the best tasting thing I ate there. But, I feel like i can get a good tasting empanadas some other place that is cheaper. 
The service was kind of slow but we were in no hurry to go anywhere so it did not bother us. It just gave us more time to drink and enjoy the atmosphere. 
I do want to go back and try some other things on their menu. I could see how this place pleases a lot of people, I hope it can do the same for me next time.
author: David G.

description: I still don't understand why it's called "La Mar", when in Spanish you say El Mar, but I'll let it slide, because the food is awesome -- creative, fresh, delicious.  The portions of ceviche are pretty substantial (especially compared to some of the non-existent and overpriced portions at Fresca on Fillmore).  Outdoor space in SF seems rare, so to have a patio on the water is a real treat.  The main dining room is big and lively, and some times a bit loud, but nothing terrible.  There's a lounge area up front, I like to call it the "sexy poolside" scene.  Overall, the place has a very airy, tropical feel to it, with out it feeling like a ham-fisted South Beach decor.  In terms of meals,  I've had both dinner and lunch here, and I've also hosted a big cocktail hour event here, and every time the food and service have been great.  I'm a big fan of La Mar.
author: Virginia M.

description: I was getting ready for a disappointing experience here due to the location of this place, assuming it was some sort of tourist spot.  I'd been here for happy hour before (great spot for happy hour btw) but never dined.  I walked in for an early dinner with a work group from Chicago.  Our server alone made the experience wonderful.  My midwestern partners had never heard of cebiche nor were any of them prepared to order anything off the menu.  She was great at explaining exactly what everything was and making appropriate recommendations for our many dietary restrictions. I couldn't believe that everyone at the table, especially me, loved the cebiche! We did a lot of sharing and tasting and no one was disappointed.  Everything was delicious and the pisco sours were so bad either.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Laura S.

description:
Oh La Mar...  I love you.
I usually say this is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and I always bring out-of-towners here.  Not because it's a classic fancy restaurant that makes me all warm and fuzzy, but because it's inventive, distinct from any other place in the city, and no matter what I try here it's delicious and creative and beautiful!
I often go with the causa sampler which really shows off what they can do.  It's a great place to get a variety of dishes to share and the staff is always willing to recommend things.  There's a chip appetizer that comes with a good variety of dipping sauces and isn't too filling for a group of people.
They have great service that isn't overbearing.  Whether I'm at the bar or at a table, I feel like I get what I want without anyone hovering.  
The atmosphere is different than most well-known restaurants in the city.  They have a great amount of space so it's not difficult to get a good reservation or even drop in.  When it's nice outside, lunch out back by the boats is paradise.  It's very bright decor and you can easily read your menus in their lights in the evening.
For cocktails, they change their selection often - the calientito is my favorite so far - a warm, spice-filled drink that makes a belly happy!
author: Anna I.

description:
We started off with a drink at the bar. My wife had the Cholopolitan - she really enjoyed it - a twist on the Cosmo using Pisco sour. I did not really venture out on the drinks and stuck with vodka and tonic. 

The bar and the restaurant are very nice. The space is large and has a Miami vibe to it. We were seated close the window and seated right on top of the water. We ordered the ceviche tasting and all four had their own unique flavors. From citrus to sweet, tangy and spicy. All four were very good. Limon needs to step up, it has more to compete with. We also ordered a special of the night - Lomo saltado spring rolls. Sounds weird, but they were exceptional. Very tasty, although the sauce to dip they served with it should have been the spicier one that was served with the chips they serve to all tables. The sauce was a little too mild - lacking a strong flavor. Despite this, the rolls had great flavor and did not necessarily need any sauce for dipping. 

The octopus skewers, ehhh, not too much flavor for me. I like octopus but these were a little off the mark - I was hoping for a sweet flavor. 

The dessert - wow, deep fried pastries balls filled with melted chocolate and scoop of ice cream. Oh my...the bomb!!! Get them... 

Lastly, the service was really good. Take your time and enjoy!
author: Michael W.

description:
Wow!  This is a great and unique restaurant that takes you a way to a tropical destination.  Drinks in the bar with Emilio help set the mood with Pisco Punch.  The seating areas includes a cervichi bar with inviting lounge seating and the main dining area which celebrates the best of a sea port setting...high ceilings, turquoise blue accents, palms, and banquet benches with accent pillows.  I loved the plantain, yucca and the sweet potato chips with an accompanying dipping sauce.  Could I just say DELISH!  We ordered a mushroom risotto, corn and cilantro tamale, causas, and sashimi ceviche.  The desserts are a must!  Creative and unique as the rest of the experience. 

I really liked the fact that there were a lot of vegetarian options.  My recommendation is that if you should ask about the menu items.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, attentive and interested in making sure you enjoy the experience.  This is a great place for a romantic get-away or meeting the girls to celebrate.

Don't forget to make a reservation, the place is hopping and with good reason!  My one tiny complaint...only two bathrooms in the main lobby area.
author: Gita P.

description:
Pricey, but good. I would definitely recommend the ceviches, but I'd have to say if you are only two people you might sick of the flavor. The big surprise dish for me was definitely the octopus skewers - something you wouldn't definitely think to get but WOW! Great texture & flavor. Since it was only two of us we couldn't fit much more in (esp since we had pizzas at happy hr before coming). Sangria was good, but a little bit on the sweet side for me. Cappucino Tres Leches was so good, but again pricey...for what you are getting. I have to say though overall a great experience. The one thing I wanted to order and kept seeing everyone get was the lomo saltado - Oh, wow. Looked so good as everyone got it, but seriously upper $20s for a dish that small, seriously? Unless there is Kobe beef....

(this place is probably a better bargain @ lunch)
author: Jeannette L.

description:
I'm Peruvian descent, having eaten Peruvian food all of my life.  With that background, I can state that, in my personal opinion, La Mar is definitely a solid, upscale Peruvian restaurant.  But five stars?  As much as I enjoyed my recent visit, I can't go quite that far.

I went to La Mar recently for lunch, and I took my Peruvian parents who were visiting from SoCal along with me.  We've been to all of the Peruvian restaurants in San Francisco, since I treat them to Peruvian food whenever they visit.  This was our first time visiting La Mar, however.  My parents have been to the original La Mar restaurant in Lima, which they regard highly, so our combined expectations were high - particularly, once we saw the prices.

We all loved the atmosphere and decor.  It's young and trendy, but not obnoxious.  The bartender was also terrific.  Our pisco sours were outstanding.  We would have ordered a second round, but none of us wanted to sleep away the entire afternoon. The service was also professional and friendly.  My parents were happy that they could order in spanish for a change at an upscale San Francisco restaurant.

The food was fresh and flavorful, but we all agreed that it didn't "wow" us, like we expected from the five star reviews that this restaurant has received.  Mom had the lomo saltado, which is her favorite dish.  She orders it everywhere she can find it, but this version of traditional Peruvian comfort food was so refined that it lost some of its authenticity in the presentation and flavor.   Dad had the anticuchos, which were well-seasoned, tender, and perfectly cooked.  He ate everyting on the plate.  The picarones (peruvian donuts) were also outstanding.   The fresh, outstanding seafood is the real star here, however.  (Not a surprise, given the name of the restaurant.)   Perhaps the seafood dishes are so superb that the other choices on the menu just seemed a slight bit lackluster in comparison?  Seafood certainly lends itself to refinement, but Peruvian comfort food, less so.         

In sum, we enjoyed our visit, and will probably go back again.  But we couldn't help feeling that the prices were quite steep, particularly given that we've had other terrific Peruvian meals in San Francisco (e.g., Fresca, Mi Lindo Peru, Limon), for far less.  But this place is definitely worth checking out by all fans of Peruvian cuisine.
author: Edward T.

description: I was blown away by the excellent Peruvian dishes. We had the Cebiche sampler, empanada sampler, Anticuchos, tallarin saltado, Cristal cervesa and of course a pisco sour. The food was great. We were happy with the service, but the place was full and the waiter was kept pretty busy, so it took a while to get our drinks. Despite some of the other reviews on here, portions were good and we walked away full. I will definitely be going back!
author: Mark K.

description:
Haven't had the opportunity to have a meal there yet so this review is for cocktails and nibbles in the bar on a weeknight. Beautiful room, excellent drinks, delicious food and good happy hour specials.

A bit pricey but worth it when you want to eat gorgeous fare in a sexy room.
author: Maryann M.

description:
After returning from a trip to Lima a few years back, without trying any of Gaston Acurio's restaurants, I was thrilled to try La Mar. Although we went during the restaurant's off-hours and ordered from their bar menu, we were more than pleased.
  We got half orders of the cebiche norteño and a sampler of their causas. The cebiche was very good, with a piquant tiger's milk, sweet potatoes and the big peruvian choclo I love so much. Though it was not the most nuanced cebiche EVER, this was pretty damn good, and the quality of the fish was tops.
The standouts were the causas. You get three in a sampler, and they were so good, we got another order! They are little cylinders of vibrantly colored mashed potatoes with various toppings (tuna, asparagus and crab). Sounds not-so-exciting, until the party starts in yo mouth! For reals, they really are delicious.
The pisco drinks are gorgeous, btw. Chicha tu sour and pisco punch are socks-rockin. Sweetness and acidity are balanced perfectly and complement the flavors of the food like it's their job (oh wait...)
If you can't get to Peru any time soon, this is a fabulous entrée to modern AND traditional Peruvian cuisine.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
The service was appallingly ungracious, incompetent, and, in particular, the General Manager addressed my discretely communicated concerns in a perfunctory and meaningless manner.

First, we were greeted a haughty, unwelcoming, disdainful, young woman at reception who conveyed the impression she was providing a favor by seating us as we did not have a reservation.  Her demeanor was so offensive my guest and I considered leaving (and, in retrospect, we should have done so).

The napkin in which my silverware was wrapped was unclean, showing clear stains of lipstick from prior use.  The dessert plate I was provided was severely stained with gray smudges.  When I asked the young woman server for another plate, she launched into a lengthy explanation that the gray smudges were under the glaze on the plate.  She even went so far as to take the plate, rub it with her fingers to prove her point and replaced it before me.  I insisted the plate be exchanged.

As we left the restaurant, my guest asked a young man behind the bar near the restaurant entrance where the restroom was located.  The young man responded with a cold, blank look and without verbal response simply  shrugged his shoulders.

Before I left the restaurant, I called these deficiencies to the attention of Mr. Generalao who, while courteous in listening, merely gave me his business card asking that I call ahead in the future to advise him I would be patronizing the restaurant.  He made no effort to determine at what table we had been seated or who were the other staff about whom I expressed concerns.  A return visit is, of course, HIGHLY unlikely!
author: George D.

description:
Out-friggin-standing!  The pisco bloody mary's are stellar and the menu is a seafood-lover's delight.  Last night was our first time at La Mar so I'll be updating this review after we go back a time or two.

And the best thing...  You can SAIL to the restaurant.  The city has finally pulled its head a little bit out if it's cold and twisted hiney and put in a public dock.  But that's a different rant.

If you'd like to really impress your SO, book a sunset sail with us topped off with dinner at La Mar ~ http://www.yelp.com/biz/mission-creek-sail-tours-san-francisco.
author: Gregory S.

description:
Over-priced ceviche, over-priced entrees, over priced and not worth it, 
very bland ceviche, super lemony, and the fish is raw, ceviche is seafood cooked in acid, this was raw seafood on top of bland acid
Skip it!
author: aaron l.

description: Great ambience and great ceviche.  The service and rest of menu were pretty good, but not amazing.  Drinks are pricey. Good wine list though.
author: Matt H.

description: The pisco sours, the ceviche clasico, the lamb shank, the fritters. The fritters.  The fritters.
author: M. H.

description: Very disappointing. First, service was sub par - or ceviche arrived before wine and waiters were throwing knives and folks on the table so loud my ears hurt. Second, no atmosphere and stuffy with smells of fried food from the kitchen. Finally, food was mediocre. Very few fresh items, everything is on top or a potato or deep fried. Everything we ordered aside from ceviche was mediocre.
author: Anna P.

description:
3.5 stars for food
2-2.5 stars for service  

Been here twice.  Ironically, I would be willing to return were it not for the service.  The atmosphere is actually decent, and they play good music. 

Food:  There's better ceviche to be had elsewhere, for the price.  I liked their classic ceviche the best, and the fish is fresh, but the Japanese themes odd.  The other stuff - mashed potatoes, chicken and rice, etc. are nothing to write home about - just edible.   The fried yucca would be better without the sauce they top it with.  The empanadas were okay, but I've had better - perhaps a preference for the Argentine version.  The chips that come with the table are nice, but it's too much potatoes and too few of the better stuff - yam and plantain chips.

Service:  subpar for the kind of restaurant, and it's not just the waitstaff. The hostess was nowhere to be found, so we had to wait several minutes just to see anyone. The waitress only checked on us once, and that was to point out they had brought us the wrong dish, and we were halfway through with it.  (It was a regular half portion of a ceviche that should have come with our dinner plate.)  She only offered to correct it after I said I wasn't accepting it as a replacement.  

The other waitstaff dribbled water all over the table while refilling our glasses.  Never acknowledged eye contact.  Didn't remove dishes from our small 2 person table (I had to move the finished dishes to another table).  Had to ask for check 10min after we were done, and that was because my gf was more aggressive about getting their attention. 

Finally, for a high end restaurant, they have a weird issue with flies in the front lobby. They were there both times I went, months apart. 

Dissappointed.
author: R D.

description: Clean modern and upscale cuisine. Unexpected, yet delicious dishes and ingredients, that make you wonder why you have not tried it any earlier. The ceviches are case and point, very fresh and flavorful. The giant corn kernels are really delicious and unexpected. The quinoa and fried yucca are so well executed (again, why have I not discovered these dishes any earlier). We were lucky enough to sit next to the window with a view of the bridge, so I can't malign the ambiance, and highly recommend it for any fog-free evening.
author: Horace L.

description:
Surprised the bf last night with a sailing sunset cruise and dinner at La Mar- and the restaurant was the perfect bayside dining experience. I am huge ceviche fan (also a critical one bc I make it myself), and we got the sampler- which was divine! Loved the ahi tuna one in particular. Paired with a Pisco Sour- my mouth is watering as I write! 

We also ordered the chicken empanadas- which lacked spices and flavor- as well as the skirt steak skewer- well cooked meat but didn't have any wow factor with the sauces or potato cakes served with it. In the future, I will go back only to have ceviche and a cocktail (+ view)- as the remainder of the dishes are nothing to rave about (or spend an extra $50 on). Also, the service was quite splotchy (ex: taking plate as I was eating from it and dropping silverware in process). I wanted to give 4 stars, I really did, but just can't allow myself to... 

Bonus on the plantain/potato/yam crisps with fun sauces served before meal.
author: Rena Z.

description:
is it ceviche or cebiche? who cares - this place rocks! the food is amazing and the prices are a little steep, but what a memorable meal!

cebiche criollo $19 - Squid, shrimp, scallops, mussels, mahi mahi and sea urchin in a rich sea urchin liquid. This was much more flavorful and complex than the ahi tuna cebiche, which was good, but nothing to write home about. 

linguini negro $22 - Black squid ink linguini with seafood. This was my 1st time trying black pasta and as much as I've been looking forward to finally trying it, I was glad to find I wasn't disappointed. I could eat this dish all day long. 

arroz con pollo $21 - fried rice with chicken thigh meat and veggies. My bf went to Peru a few years back and was itching to have this classic dish again. To me, it was just fried rice, but I can understand the appeal - comfort food is always satisfying.

pisco sour $10 - a  concoction of brandy, lime juice, simple syrup, egg white, and bitters. The egg white adds a nice frothy finish to this cocktail and the lime juice gives it a nice citrus kick without it getting too sweet.
author: Lily L.

description: Had a great dinner on 2/7. Despite being very crowded and the restaurant being a large open space, it was easy to hear. The food was amazing, and I'm a picky foodie. Lots of interesting smaller plates to share, and portions were actually quite generous. The three of us shared 6 plates and were quite full. Entrees weren't as interesting to me. Service was excellent as well-- very present but not pushy. Highly recommended!
author: Shari D.

description: Good food, good service.  I had the Almercito Limeno and the Empanada Sampler, both delicious.
author: Maulik S.

description: I would recommend dining in the bar area. Seems like it's more inviting and a fun area to hang out. Sangrias during happy hour were a hit. The tapas were good, my favorite was the arroz norteno. I would definitely go back to try more of the appetizers during happy hour.
author: Lisa C.

description: The food, service, and atmosphere were fabulous. I would recommend La Mar you will love it.
author: len g.

description: Great food! Hands down best ceviche I've had in quite a while...a bit pricey for the portions, but whatever. A good value for what you get. Quality all the way. Good bar. Cool ambiance. I'd bring guests from out of town who wan a good SF seafood meal.
author: S R.

description:
Damn dude.  This place is great.  We found this place just walking along the water front on Sunday night.

Waiter was awesome and suggested a great meal for us.  

They have Pisco.  We had a couple of Pisco specialty drinks and an apertif of a shot of Pisco.  Awesome.

I liked it and would definitely eat here again.  Maybe next time in San Fran.

We had 4 dishes shared between two and it was the perfect amount of food.
author: Eric V.

description:
Had lunch here on a recent stay in the city.  It is in a wonderful location.  Right on the water by a pier.  Nothing beats a lunch outside on the bay in nice weather!  The decor is modern and colorful.  Very enjoyable.  Service was fine - the place, which is pretty big, was fairly empty - so no huge challenge for the wait staff...

We all had the skewers of different kinds of meat and poultry which my friends recommended.  I thought my chicken was good - I really liked the sauce but the side bits I didn't like as well.  The potatoes were thick and starchy and the corn, a special peruvian corn, was big and chewy - a weird texture.  I would like to go back and try other things on the menu...
author: S L.

description: Stopped in for one plate and a few drinks.  Sat in the lounge area.  Had the Peruvian ceviche with halibut.  Although the fish wasn't cut to my liking and was almost hard to swallow, the flavors of the dish were on point with seasoning and spice.  Drinks were very good, never would have thought that apple and habanero would be good in a drink until now.
author: Jim K.

description:
My first Peruvian dining experience!  I will reserve a star for after I try some other places of that nation, of which there seem to be many lately.  I can't say enough for the staff and service - down to earth and easy to question, attentive without being annoying, and the waiter was right-on with her recommendations and number of dishes.  Cebiches were wonderful, especially the yellow-sauce one with octopus slices and tenacles.  The rice dish I had was completely delicious, a dark paella-type dish with lots of squid and other sea food.  We split half of it, and were full.  Of course we had the Peruvian spring rolls before that and after the cebiche, so we had a good head start!  

I think my only actual problem with this restaurant is the complexity of the names of the foods.  I'd love to be able to say, "I had the (whatever)", instead of describing it - this could definitely be a personal problem, though, and certainly no reason not to go!

I look much forward to returning there again to try their rice-pudding spring roll with orange marmalade and passion fruit sherbet!!
author: Valerie H.

description:
What I did; what happened; what I need from you.

What I did:
Solo dinner at la mar tonight. Dined here 3x prior, and was subsequently converted into a spectacular hyperbolic promoter of this restaurant. The food here felt like a better version of the Peruvian originals where gaston's team would experiment just a bit with new flavors without flying the coop and leaving traditional recipes behind. This place was perfect and I tried to design business trips to allow for this meal. Suffice to say, this restaurant was incredibly important and special to me.  So why the past tense?

What happened:
I ordered empanada sampler - delicious, although I couldn't enjoy their deliciousness 100% because these puppies were fried and hey, I should be making smarter choices.  Then leches de tigre - phenomenal. And finally anticucho de pulpo - three deliciously charred octopus skewers. I was already devoted to these things from prior visits. And I was in a great mood because I had just purchased two pounds of fresh morels too. Life was really good. 1st skewer delicious.  2nd skewer even better. 3rd skewer, woops! It launches right off of the bamboo skewer like a coiled spring, ricocheting off my suit leaving a trail of red sauce in its wake and landing on the floor. I was stunned as if I had just been sucker-punched.  Was the skewer faulty or, egads, was it the user? Despite the fact that I was expensing this meal, I also contemplated what a financial ruin this was as 1/3 of the dish equated to $5.33, setting aside the food waste especially given how many homeless I encountered on my walk to this restaurant. The waiter then appeared and displayed an expression of unmitigated empathy as if to say, hey man I've been there.  This left me no doubt we were on the same page.  The waiter then picked up the defunct octopus from the ground and left my table. Several minutes elapsed. As time continued to pass and I saw my waiter tend to other tables and make visits to the bar and then the kitchen, my visions that my octopus portion would be restored to its original went from fait accompli to fait 'no way'.  

What I need from you:
I recognize that I am abjectly imperfect and my expectations may have been unreasonable. However, I would greatly appreciate a second opinion.  In full disclosure, one detail, albeit likely irrelevant, omitted from the above narrative was that two pisco sours were consumed in between my courses which potentially may have compromised my manual dexterity.
author: curtis k.

description:
We enjoyed our first visit to La Mar.  It was a Thursday night, and we were surprised to see it full.  But there was a good energy, and our service was excellent, despite the crowd.  We share a cebiche special, a causa, a corn empanada, and a paella-like dish, and all were very good.  Our drinks (pisco sour and a fresh raspberry cocktail) were excellent.  Our chocolate beignet dessert was a bit too decadent.

We don't eat Peruvian food very often, so this was a nice change.  We recommend La Mar and will be back.
author: Anita W.

description: The location and service were great, but the food was deeply disappointing.  The ceviche is grossly overpriced ($32 for four quite small samples that constitute about 4 small bites each) "tourist food" --- completely lacking in depth of flavor, short on spices.  If you want real ceviche in SF, go to Mochica (933 Harrison) and get the real deal for about 40% less money (oh, and you will get about twice the portion size).
author: William F.

description: This one was a bit disappointing.  Nice place and location with mediocre service.  The ceviche dishes were good, but nothing else was notable.  too much rice and not enough vegetables....heavy food with muddled flavors.  I would only return because of the beautiful setting on the Embarcadero.
author: Michele R.

description:
Many others already raved about the quality of the food, and I agree. Every bite was delicate, delicious and unique, and beautifully arranged.

However, there were a few things I didn't like at all - 

1) There were about 5 servers manning our table, and hovering over us every 3 minutes. While I appreciate the extra attention, I was confused by whom to ask for what, and the romantic dinner I was hoping for was definitely not as romantic as it could have been... I enjoy being watched only with my permission ;-).

2) The pricing only looks good until you see the size of the dishes. I've seen kittens eat more in one sitting.
author: Sandra B.

description: Went back for a revisit on Friday.  Loved the cebiche and pisco sour.  Loved the deep fried chicken empanadas.  Loved the seafood fried rice.  Also loved the cebiche bar where we sat at--- it made being swanky cool and personable.  We laughed and ate our raw seafood.  I felt like a hipster who is actually likable in the La Mar scene.
author: Jiajia C.

description: * This restaurant was recommended by the hotel concierge and usually when I travel, I kind of like to find spots on my own, but I am SO happy that I listened to the concierge's advice.  First of all, the place is really very pretty and very large and spacious.  My family loves to travel, but more than traveling, we love to EAT and we consider ourselves big foodies!  We ordered three different types of ceviche and our absolute favorite was ceviche neiche (it was made with tamarind) and OMG, it was incredible.  We also ordered the grouper, a halibut dish and their fried rice.  Everything we ate was fantastic.  On their menu, we kept seeing the words "leche de tigre" and the waiter explained that it was some fish juice with lime, garlic, spices - it sounded so intriguing we ordered an entire flight of leche de tigre shots.  If you go, make sure you order the flights -- they were all so interesting and so delicious.  Make sure  you sit at Nick's table, he is so knowledgeable and passionate about the food he makes you want to try everything.  Nick actually traveled to Peru to learn about the food he would be serving, now that's passion.  There is nothing this restaurant is missing.  A definite must!!!
author: Cynthia P.

description: Great food, and the restaurant is pretty trendy with reasonable price.  I liked the complimentary potato chips.
author: Elena L.

description:
WOW!! Incredible!! 

Now I may be a little biased seeing as I'm Peruvian, but when you have gone to MANY a Peruvian restaurant in the Bay Area you come to think that my mom's cooking is WAY better! So don't tell my mom when I say that this is by far some of the best Peruvian food that I have come across in years. I read some of the comments that rated it low...and yes I have to agree that it's LOUD, I can't comment on the bar since I made reservations and didn't deal with that donkey show. So word to the wise it to make a reservation. 

Now if you don't really know Peruvian food than some of it may seem different but the flavors are out of this world. I highly recommend that you at least try it once. Some people said the Pisco Sour was too sweet.....well yes that is usually how it is. It does say sour in the title but mainly it's sweet. They try to trick you on that, those darn Peruvians!!! Someone else wrote that the ceviche was just lime and onion. Well quite frankly the MAIN ingredients of ceviche are the fish and a LOT of lime, there is usually some more spices that make it nice and hot, but the flavor of their ceviche is really AWESOME! 

Ok I can gush more and more but I would say....try it yourself and you will be pleased! 

And don't skip out on the dessert. I would order the Picarones aka mini doughnuts!
author: Cynthia F.

description: The food and cocktails were fine.  Maybe I was not really in the mood?  (The service was wonderful.)  I'd try La Mar again.
author: Becky G.

description:
My first visit to La Mar for lunch and I am already planning my next visit! Delicious!! 

Cebiche Clasico - Halibut, was the perfect cebiche, incredible flavor, simple and delicious

Causa Limena - dungeness crab, avocado puree, quail egg, beautiful presentation, rich and yummy

Arroz norteno - seafood & rice, wonderful grilled flavor - fantastic!

I am in love with this wine and it is the perfect pairing for the seafood - definitely try a glass of the 2007 Hondarrabi Zuri - Ameztoi Txakolina from Spain.
author: KRISTIN M.

description: Location is perfect because it is within walking distance from the financial district, so I can easily catch an early dinner immediately after work. I've never tried a walk-in, and found that reservations are for me, as I've never had to wait longer than 5 min to be seated. The waiters are very attentive, as I've been here a handful of times. And this place has, hands down, the best paella I've ever encountered. Prices are reasonable for the area and the atmosphere inside is very lively and comfortable. It won't break your wallet, much, and you leave not caring because it was worth it.
author: kim p.

description: Happy hour (2 stars) is fairly priced, however the bar is small and it gets crowded fast so if you plan on taking advantage of the happy hour specials arrive early. Dinner (5 stars) is amazing and worth every penny. I recommend the ceviche sampler for starters.
author: M R.

description: Just go! It's freakn amazing food and a great crowd!
author: Christine K.

description: We dined at La Mar a few nights ago. At first glance I thought the restaurant lacked from the decor aspect, but as soon as the food arrived I knew that this was one of my favorite meals in San Francisco. The Cebiche Nikei was wonderful, the dressing was approved by the entire table. The Quinoa Chaufa was also fantastic. It was extremely similar to fried rice. I really look forward  to making it at home. The only plate we disliked was the Causa Surena. It was served freezing cold, like it had been in the fridge. I did not enjoy eating cold mashed potatoes and breaded shrimp. Over all, a very unique dining experience.
author: Margo D.

description:
Great bar, great decor, fun buzz, friendly staff, yummy drinks -- perfect for an evening with friends.  A little loud for intimate conversation -- but we're way past that at this point!  -- okay, I digreess...anyway the two little things that bugged me...the tiny (albeit cute) coed bathroom where I had a total Pyramus and Thisbe moment with the guy who was waiting -- I could practically feel his breath on me while I was in the stall!   Not what I was looking for...since there are regular bathrooms (I discovered afterward!) I think the coed one should be reserved for those in the market for casual hook-ups!  
My other little pet peeve was the fact that the very friendly waiter was really going out of his way to talk us into ordering more food (it was five women, we had appies elsewhere, planning to move on after dinner) and the dish that we gave in on was a bit of a mystery and nobody liked it (something very seafoody) -- it went untouched but of course we had to pay for it.  It didn't sit well with me.  
Other than that, fun, happy place, a great spot to start an evening.
author: Mary G.

description: This place serves the BEST food!! And when I say best I am not kidding. We had the most amazing time here looking out on the bay, eating fresh fish ceviches and sipping down delicious pisco sours.  Every dish was flavorful, fresh, and beautifully presented. Plus you can't beat the location! I wish I was lushious enough to go here more often!!! hahah
author: Laura T.

description:
I'll admit, the space is lovely and bright and fresh and cheerful.  It may smell overwhelmingly like fish when you walk in, but I guess you kind of expect that.

Because my dinner companion hates raw stuff, we skipped the ceviche, even though it's the restaurant's supposed specialty.  We did, however, have the causa limena, which was not what either of us expected.  Three dollops of mashed potatoes with mayonnaised crab on top.  Not bad, just not what we expected.

The chips (plantains, potatoes, yams) with the three dipping sauces were nice - my favorite was the full-fat cheesey one in the middle.

Our dinners were also pretty good.  I had the lomo saltado, which was nice and my dining companion's fish dish was also tasty.

Where La Mar disappointed us was on the service front.  Firstly, they were pretty slow with our drinks and it was only after we finished dinner that our wine arrived.  Also, we would have tried the dessert (I can't ever resist dessert), but again, the waiter was slow to take our order so we just passed - we had a movie to catch!
author: Marcus C.

description: Wow, what a find at the Embarcadero! We both love ceviche and eat it all the time in Mexico. This is upscale decor and great food. Prepare for the sticker shock, but it is well worth it for a special occasion. My wife had the ceviche sampler, with 3 varieties and I had the sea bass skewers. Everything was delicious and we couldn't finish our portions. Nice service and fun atmosphere. Our next trip to SF we will definitely be there!
author: Bob G.

description: I love this place...  Pricing is reasonable.  Food is great...  Grilled Beef Hearts are the best!!!
author: TERESA L.

description: La Mar is a great place for work lunches and cocktails. The service is solid and the menu and food presentation are interesting-enough to keep the conversation going (oh, and everything is delicioso). The decor is wonderful too and if you are at the right tables, you have a great view of the water. Highly recommended.
author: Jeni K.

description: Beautiful design that evokes the essence of the waterfront. Gorgeous plating and attentive, friendly service.  I had the chicken salad, which was amazingly flavorful.  Definitely recommend for lunch.
author: Eric S.

description: La Mar is a solid food restaurant, but their prices are highway robbery!  Excuse me, when did they suddenly become Fleur de Lys or Boulevard?  Almost $30 for main courses that are tapas-sized?  If you go, order a bunch of ceviches and then take advantage of the chips/dips which I can't get enough of.  Their anticuchos/skeweres were disappointing.  Skip them.  Just to prove my point, their bloody mary was $12 - good, but normal-sized.  Nothing special.  For $12, I want it decked with spicy green beans and jumbo prawns.
author: catherine g.

description: Some of the most delicious food in the city... great service and great atmosphere! I highly recommend it!
author: Rachel S.

description:
nice place, nice ambiance, good drinks, delicious food...but inconsistent!
Sometimes it's great, and other times, it's just off- which makes it a little irritating when I'm bringing clients or out of town guests here. I have to be careful about how much I talk it up because it's so hit or miss!
still gets 4 stars in my book though because when it's good, it's very good!
author: Upekkha M.

description:
Best food I've had a long time.  Every bite was better than the last.

Great atmosphere...incredible wine selection!
author: Helena G.

description: Super weird condescending hostess trying to explain that several servings of Cebiche don't constitute a meal and hence forth we couldn't take the Cebiche bar. It was very weird even for someone from the restaurant industry.
author: Mitt G.

description: Went there for a friend's birthday party. I am aware that Peruvian fare is not the most vegetarian- friendly but La Mar actually has 2 vegetarian entrees on their menu. Plus this is San Francisco, I would've expected some creativity. I got the pan friend quinoa dish and was highly disappointed. They literally took some quinoa, pan friend it with some green onions and served it on a plate. Looked like dog food...absolutely no presentation! Throw in a few colorful veggies or a few avocado slices for god's sake! It probably took them $2 to make this and the entree was $22....not only a complete rip off but such a lacking dish should never be served at a restaurant. Never going back.
author: Anitha I.

description: Absolutely fabulous.  Great food, great location!  The ceviche is the best I have ever had!  Try the grilled octopus - - not many places have it on the menu!
author: Pamela Y.

description:
Excellent, excellent, excellent. I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant. From the moment we walked in the service was very friendly and attentive. The cocktails we started with were SO GOOD (will update when their website is working and I can locate the names of what we had). The cebiche (we had the cebiche norteno) was, as expected, absolutely delicious and the main dishes were spot-on as well. Our favorite was the arroz norteno - so much flavor and fresh seafood. When the meal was over we managed to eat one dessert: bunuelos de chocolate. They are small, tasty lightly fried balls of dough filled with chocolate with a delicious scoop of ice cream on the side. I should also mention that the atmosphere in this restaurant is very cool and fun. They had great music playing all night, and despite the crowd it was easy to hear both the music and my dinner date. Al fin, this restaurant was a wonderful choice and we would definitely come back.

UPDATE: The cocktails were the Passion Andina (very refreshing) and something like the Santa Maria (it was pink and girly, but also super refreshing... the exact cocktail is not on their online menu)
author: Sara M.

description: Great cocktails and a really nice server. Those were highlights. Food was not so delightful. Ceviche did not have enough acid and fish looked like it was torn up. Huancaina sauce was watered down, a lot of sauces seemed like they were being stretched to maximum. Chifles tasted stale and picarones were way over fried. Would normally not complain about price, especially for this location, but for quality of food, was a ripoff.
author: Tony C.

description: Love love love it. Skewered octopus is a must-have. Excellent server, enrique. From start to finish a perfect meal. Not to mention the complimentary chips and delicious trio of dips. I am now in love with Peru!! We'll be back!
author: zia s.

description:
Met a friend for lunch. Here is the synopsis.

Since there are multiple entrances and more than one "Wait for Hostess to be seated" signs, I stood near one of the signs (apparently the wrong one) without a drink in hand, for awhile. Hostess presence was weak. 

Pisco Sours are the perfect "foamy margarita". Egg whites and bitters are unexplored treasures.

My Nikei Cebiche was excellent. Hawaiian poke to the next level.
Plantain and potato chips with the three sauces were also a pleasant suprise.
 
Portions are small, prices aren't.

Dining service was good, probably since we arrived for an early lunch. The decor is large open space with seating in contemporary azure and a verde/oranjo/rojo splash on menus and placemats.  Attractive staff dressed in casual negro.
Views of the bay are always nice.

Both maincourses. Pork and beef... Meh. 

I've been to  Versailles on Calle Ocho in Miami and had 'real' Cuban sandwiches and ropa vieja. While I fully recognize that Peru isn't Cuba, nobody does authentic Southamerican sandwiches on Dutch crunch. 

Take a date and impress her with the trendy decor. Get a Pisco sour (or two). People watch. Have some cebiche, but skip the main courses. Flash large cash for your drinks and cebiche and still be hungry. If she's worth it, take her somewhere else better for dinner, if not drop her off and grab a real meal solo.

In general, overpriced trendy style without authenticity.
author: Dave H.

description: La Mar was very tasty for a first try of Peruvian cuisine. A friend recommended this place, and I am glad they did! We ordered two rounds of appetizers - cebiche clasico (halibut), anticucho de pollo (chicken skewers), and empanadas de lomo saltado(beef tenderloin) for the first round, and cebiche nikei(ahi), anticucho de carne(skirt steak skewers) and empanadas de aji de gallina(stewed chicken) and all of the dishes were DELICIOUS! The house plantain/sweet potato/potato chips they served were awesome, and we had Inca Cola with dinner, which was very yummy. Pricey, but I highly recommend it! We didn't have any problems with service.
author: Laura B.

description: Had lunch here last Friday - took some South Americans who know their ceviche and Peruvian food in general.  They raved about the meal for the rest of the day.  I had one of the lunch set menu options - something like $15. Perfectly awesome!  Decent wines by the glass and some fun cocktail options as well.  Peruvian food is the rage in NY right now and I understand why - Asian influence with Latin flavor, hard to go wrong!
author: Juan Pablo S.

description: About a week ago, my boyfriend and I went to La Mar for dinner.  We ordered the ceviche sampler, empenada sampler, and the pulpo (octopus) skewers.  I would say the food was average, and would normally rate this restaurant 3 stars for the food and atmosphere...but La Mar barely deserves one star.  Two thirds the way through our dinner, I spotted large rats running on the rafters and pipes hanging from the ceiling.  We were seated directly next to the kitchen, so the rodents were practically directly over the kitchen. We were horrified! When the waiter came and asked if we wanted dessert, we told him no, and then I told him "you have critters running around the ceiling". He sighed and said that they knew, were sorry, but it has been a problem since BART has been doing work underground! He told me not to worry, that the health inspector has been there and the kitchen is clean, and also reminded me "this IS the docks, too"-as if that makes it ok for rats to be in their dining room! He tried to comp us a dessert, which we declined, and offered no other compensation.  All I wanted to do was run out of there before one of the rats dropped on my head....the last thing we wanted to do was eat anymore FOOD there! wtf.  And then no other compensation? Drinks, perhaps?  The food was not enough to get me to go back to La Mar, and after this kind of experience I doubt I will EVER be returning. GROSS.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Tonight, I decided that I should take myself out on a date. I walked along the Embarcadero and this place caught my eye as an acceptable date-for-one place. There was a large bar and a "sushi bar" area that was suitable for sitting alone. The best part was that there was a hot guy working behind the counter who was a good dinner consultant.
