Throughout the dining room, there's a mixture of brightly colored cushions and pillows in some of the loungey seating areas along with the dark woods of the tables and bar area.  The look has a very modern feel and that is both welcoming and fun.  Since all tables were already packed for lunch this Friday afternoon, we decided to eat at the dining bar (which is separate from the alcohol bar to the right of the foyer).

The food here is amazing.  As we sat down, we were greeted with sweet potato, plantain and some other root chips along with 3 dipping sauces of increasing spiciness.  The mild sauce was a little lackluster, but the medium and spicy sauces were fantastic, as were the chips.  We ordered three ceviches, the classico, crudo and nikei to share while I ordered the braised lamb shank for an entree.  My other coworkers ordered the pan seared grouper and a spicy soup with various shellfish and seafood.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  The ceviches were all very fresh, with a great balance of acidity and sweetness of each seafood.  The lamb shank was absolutely fork tender with the meat falling off the bone.  The curry sauce that accompanied it was also good, if a little heavy on the salt.  My coworkers dishes were similarly good and judgeing by how clean our plates were, you'd say we were more than satisfied.  

The service here was quick and responsive.  Our waters were kept full and finished plates were removed promptly despite the fact that the restaurant was bustling with patrons.  This definitely is not your bargain lunch as between the three of us we racked up a $130 tab including tip.  Still, I was very pleased with the overall service from beginning to end and will definitely be back here again soon.
author: Gary L.

description: I ate the original in Lima, Peru about 4 times... I thought this place would do it no justice but it came through in the end... They had many of the same dishes as the original too... Too bad it broke my wallet... Get the Chicha drinks... I wish I could make them...
author: DJ T.

description: one of my favorite places in the city. i was introduced on a first date after dying for peruvian food and i loved this place. amazing views, great ambiance, good service, yummy traditional and refreshing drinks, and fresh food. i had to reduce to 4 stars because it wasnt exactly the yummy mouth watering traditional family cooked amazing peruvian food i was used to from my favorite restaurant in la, but overall its definitely one of my go to places.
author: Naomi Z.

description: Excellent food. I am Peruvian, and the food is very authentic and delicious. Everything I have ordered here is amazing, but I love the anticuchos, ceviche, and lomo saltado. Their pisco sours are very expensive, but are very tasty and strong! Honestly, I had 3 and was pretty drunk. The restaurant is packed on the weekend nights, so make sure to make a reservation in advance. Parking is available across the street.
author: Steve S.

description: I love the ambiance... great bar!  I didn't eat here so I can't give a review on the food, but I love the location of this swanky bar.  But i did hear the food is fabulous.
author: Myra M.

description:
Had incredibly prepared Peruvian food, in an atmosphere I wasn't crazy about.  
Food -- we had an outstanding mahi mahi cebiche, the vegetarian causa, which I had never had before but was surprisingly really good, the octupus skewers (so-so), the loma saltado empanada (delicious) and the loma saltado spring roll ( a little heavy after the empanada).  Great glass of Malbec.  I'm a huge Destino fan (also Peruvian) and this place was comparable with an extensive menu, really great food.  The atmosphere -- for 6:30 PM during the summer, too bright, too loud.  I like dinner to be intimate and cozy, not blaring Mexican music and listening to the conversation of all your neighbors.  The service was very friendly but very slow.  The food gets 5 stars, but I might not go there again because I found the atmosphere not conducive for a dinner for 2.
author: Kristi S.

description: This place is fantastic.  Live Latin music and dancing.  Excellent tapas sized appetizers, good portioned entrees, and fantastic well drinks.  Pisco Sour was pink and yummy.  The cebiche dishes have an asian flair in my opinion.  Lots of ginger and lemon which yields thoughts of sushi and tartar.  I would consider this restaurant more of a twist on traditional peruvian food rather than what you would normally eat in Peru.  However, the blending of tastes, presentation, and quality is top notch.
author: Spencer Y.

description: I went with some girlfriends for a holiday celebration meal.  I may have already been in a good mood but after the exceptional service and amazing food I felt that holiday spirit for sure. I can't wait to make up an excuse to return.
author: Val G.

description: Go.  If you're thinking about it, and haven't been, just go.  Fantastic food (get the ceviche and lomo saltado), and awesome drinks.  Only complaint would be how busy it gets!
author: Jobba J.

description:
First time visiting was last year with a group of friends for a birthday party.  Great experience, yummy food and the staff kept up with all the requests from our 20 person group.

Just recently, went back for a second time but with only 2 other people and it continues to impress us.  Agree with all the other reviews that the "chips" are hard to resist so you have to pace yourself because the ceviches and causas are also out of the world.  I highly recommend the ceviche clasico, ceviche nikei and the causa nikei.

The main entrees were good but somewhat of a let-down compared to the quality of the appetizers.  Next time we go, we'll skip the main course and just order all ceviche, causas and tiraditos.
author: Anne T.

description: Ate there last night and what a great meal!  Had the Ceviche and Empanada sampler.  Some of the best I have had in the city, unreal good.  Also sit at the bar and let Saul take care of you on the drinks.  He is a mix master and makes many of his own mixers himself.  Good guy too.
author: J K.

description: Last Wednesday we happen to stop by at the tail end of happy hour. The food, drinks, and prices were fantastic. However, the cocktail waitress was rude and her service was dreadful. The ladies next to us had mentioned they had been there before on business and received the same type of service from this gal. Although the food and drinks were wonderful, we ended up not staying for dinner due to our experience and walked a few  piers down for more polite, responsive service.
author: D D.

description: I love this place.  Their sampler of ceviches makes me drool.  Their mixed drink specials are not to be missed and they mix one heck of a pisco.  The only downside is their ridiculously pretentious, rude and dismissive host/esses who will do everything in their power to keep you waiting for a table.  Just sit in the bar area- they serve a full menu there.
author: Lindsey H.

description:
If you want variety, go for the ceviche sampler.  All of them are pretty delicious!! 

If you're adventurous, the octopus skewers are not to be missed!! 
Finally tried their empanadas, and hands down our entire table liked the fish empanadas.

Their cocktails are tasty too!
author: Liz G.

description: My friend and I decided to go here to toast the holidays and it was a great experience!  We shared the ceviche sampler, empanadas, tamale and a tiradito.  Everything was very fresh and delicious!  I tried the pisco punch just to see what all the hype was about and it was good, but I'm not a fruity drink kind of person.  My friend had some bubbly with her meal and she said it was perfect with the ceviche.  We also shared the dulce de leche and it was very rich, but insanely good!  I was craving more of it today.  Our server was friendly and had great suggestions, and the decor was beautiful.  I think this place would be a perfect summertime hangout - sitting outside on their patio, enjoying the bay breeze and beautiful views, tossing back some bubbly and snacking on fresh ceviche would be a perfect afternoon.
author: Maria V.

description:
We were "greeted" by a maitre'd that couldn't be bothered to look up from her computer screen (there was no one else in the entryway).  She acted as if we were bothering her when we told her we had a reservation.  

After being seated, the service was pretty good.  The kitchen staff works very hard and generally the servers were quite welcoming.  For lunch, we had the cebiche clasico, an empanada del mar, and the dungenous crab causa limena.  

The cebiche was very nice -- very fresh halibut with red onions and habanero pepper.  Just enough heat and acid to make it quite refreshing on a hot afternoon.  The empanada was underwhelming; the filling was not particularly original or flavorful and it was not fried well.  The causa limena was well-presented - each serving had a small, soft-boiled quail egg on top and the sauce was creamy and spicy.  They were very tasty and very filling.

I would definitely come back, but next time I'm ordering only cebiche.
author: Brian K.

description: My new fav! Food is soo good and the location is nice.  Decor is cool too.  I have been about 3-4 times.  The tuna ceviche, which is more like tuna tartare, so delish.  They have these cool plates called causus. They are whipped potato but almost look like a colored marshmallow.  Then it is topped with stuff like dungeness crab.  Also try the lomo saltado which is peruvian style stir-fry of sautéed beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce, garlic with fried potatoes and rice.  I love me some red meat.  I even tried octopus skewers and they were pretty tasty!
author: Natasha L.

description: We went in here randomly because Slanted Door had absolutely no seat for us for dinner (yes, it was stupid to go without a reservation but my bf tried to convince me that it'd be OK to be there late and eat at the bar). So I went in there unwillingly not knowing what the hack they would serve. I was pleasantly surprised! First of all they served us some complimentary chips and dips. Not the usual fare, they're perfectly fried yam, plaintain, taro, and potatoes (if I remember right). The dipping sauce trio for these chips also blew me away, I loved the spicy sauce most out of the 3. The other two were also very interesting. We also ordered the South American version sodas which was a little too sweet for my taste. Their seafood fried rice (criollo) was good, comparable to a good Malaysian seafood fried rice to me. The seasoning they used in it is very unique and flavorful. And there are tons of seafood in it including lots of calamari and some good tender mussels and clams. Yum! My bf got some steak dishes called lomo saltado that looked very homemade but it was very hearty and delicious as well. My mom went crazy on her risotto with scallops. Everything was a pleasant suprise and everything looked presentable on the table. We were all impressed.
author: Jen C.

description: This place was fabulous ! The atmosphere was beautiful with a view of the ocean and boats coming in out of the bay. The food was outstanding with a unique fusion of Peruvian flavors and seafood specialties that were overflowing and absolutely delicious ! You have to try the Cebiche with tuna and causa with crabmeat and mashed potatoes- simply amazing ! Sangria was great too !
author: Apple B.

description: sat in bar area. waited 10 minutes for service. ordered vodka cocktails (not on menu, menu only had pisco drinks). waited another 10 minutes for drinks to arrive. 1 cocktail waitress serving 25 plus people in bar are (not including bar seats which were all full). not a great first impression. ordered scallop ceviche. came to table- was all calimari and shrimp. one tiny scallop at bottom of bowl. sorry, wont be back.
author: Jane C.

description:
Great setting - very helpful staff with interesting and outstanding food. The cebriche was excellent as was the prawn soup and the Thai Snapper
The wine challenge was a new concept I hadn't seen before but was interesting as well as good value
The atmosphere was something special and I am glad that we tried this restaurant
Again - one to ensure you have a reservation but a great waterside experience. I actually sat inside but the tables outside had a great view
author: Colin G.

description: YUM-O! love peruvian food and this is one of the best in the city. definitely recommend the ceviche sampler, especially the chifa and the nikei, and the octopus skewers! soo good! the plates are small but thoroughly filling. the space is gorgeous and the wine was delicious! the service was a little lacking but i'll blame it on the cuckoo table next to us.
author: Ye L.

description: oy vey!   cute waiter, lovely view, but the food was too heavy and my sister and  i both felt weighed down by it all afternoon.  i love peruvian food!  but something was off.
author: Deidre S.

description:
Let's get this out of the way first: La Mar is expensive. Like, prohibitively, embarrassingly, everyone's-looking-around-the-table-nervously expensive. For $15-20 appetizers (and up, for main courses) I was a little embarrassed about taking my family here. This restaurant is incredibly spacious, which for some reason always sends up a little red flag for me. It usually means that the restaurant is expensive or gimmicky, and in this cases, both. It's all very nicely decorated and such, but the table was set with paper placemats. Really? 

A lot of the dishes need some explanation/translation if you're not familiar with Peruvian food. It's loud inside, and if you have a big table and a petite waitress, a lot gets lost in translation. The appetizers are broken down into ceviches, mashed potatoes with various toppings, soups, and things on sticks. Entrees fall into the rice category, or something fancier. 

Nevertheless, we were all pretty adventurous eaters and ended up getting quite a few appetizers and 2 entrees to share, which I think was the best way to go (and I would recommend it for large parties). The ceviche was, as expected, very good. Large pieces of fresh fish and seafood in a tangy and refreshing "tiger milk" marinade. There was a crab claw filled with shrimp and surrounded by bok choy, that could have come out of a very fancy dim sum joint. The skewered beef heart with potatoes and a mysterious spicy red dipping sauce was my favorite. Lomo saltado was alright, but I balked at the $30 price tag for what is essentially beef stir-fry on top of french fries. Overall, the food was good. However, one area where they could use some work is their dessert menu. The bread pudding was soggy, sloppy and bland, and none of the flavors of the creme caramel were jiving. 

Personally, I wouldn't come here again unless I had an insatiable craving for top quality ceviche and didn't mind paying the price. My recommendation if you want to try out La Mar is to treat it like tapas. Or just sit at the bar and get drinks. Share a couple of appetizers family style; it will fill you up just enough, and your wallet will thank you.
author: Tammy C.

description: I went with a group on a Friday night to check out  Peruvian cuisine at Pier 1 in San Francisco. At the bar we munched on roasted corn kernals and had drinks that contained "purple corn infusion"; which gave it a mild flavor...and made me really happy. Going to the dining area we shared appetizers and munched on dried strips of platains with dipping sauces (yum). There was an appetizer that looked like grilled beef that was quite good, even after I found out it was grilled hearts (not sure what animal).  I ordered an entree called  "chupe de camarones", a traditional Peruvian prawn soup with potatoes, ají panca, peas, rice and poached egg. It was quite tasty, reminded me of comfort food.  Overall a very good dining experience, lots of tasty dishes and excellent desserts. A bit pricey  because of the location.
author: vinh t.

description: I am now on my fourth visit to this cebiche haven, I can't get enough.  I recommend all the their cebiche and pisco drinks.  Last Friday I went there with friends for a bit and few drinks for happy hour.  We never left and ending up there almost 4 hours eating each cebiche at least twice and final group of around 10 people.  Give me more.  I can't wait to hit the joint outside in the spring.
author: craig j.

description:
We have dined at this establishment for lunch and dinner, with slightly different experiences.  

For lunch, this is an excellent 360-degree experience, particularly if one dines on the patio.  The view is charming--with a Miami feel to it.  The food is extremely flavorful and very well prepared.  We ordered a rice seafood dish, and requested it to be extra-spicy (which it was indeed).  The basket of house-made "chips" with the three accompanying sauces were delicious.  The crab causa was unremarkable.  The grilled octopus appetizer was also unremarkable. The pisco-sour was artistically done and not overly sweet.  The service was attentive but not intrusive.  

For dinner, depending on the weather, patio dining may not be as pleasurable, due to the fog rolling in and the ocean breeze.  The heaters and plastic barriers do little to cut the chill.

For happy hour, drinks are very reasonably priced, and the bar is packed.  It is a high energy place for a fun drink.

Those not acquainted with Peruvian cuisine might find the description of the items on the menu to be confusing or too brief.  Looking to what others have ordered to neighboring tables might be a better way to enjoy the food here.
author: Wiley M.

description: The happy hour menu was a joke. The price you pay for the smalllll portions, it was not worth it. I would go down the street to Palomino. Found hair in our food, but we didn't get a replacment nor did the order taken off our bill. I emailed a complain, but no respond.
author: w m.

description: Had dinner here on a Sunday night at 8-ish, and the place was still busy.  Being in a converted pier, the high ceilings, white painted wall, peacock blue chairs and expanses of windows give the space a light and airy feel. Given the design and nature of the space, the noise level is surprisingly low.  As for the food, well, let's just say it was  some of the best and freshest sashimi-grade fish I've ever had. It was exquisitely presented, and the sauces and seasonings provided perfect complements. Our waiter suggested several options from the different categories of tpas-like small plates on the menu and helped my dining companion and myself put together a balanced meal.  It may not be the most traditional Peruvian food I've ever had, but who cares?  It was wonderful!  Just ask any of the coworkers and friends to whom I've been raving about it.
author: George W.

description:
I went to La Mar for my birthday because I love Peruvian food. I also went because I had heard very good things. Overall, it was a very so-so experience and I would not return.

I'll start with the food. The menu seemed very appealing and so we ordered a lot of small plates and one large. Unfortunately, I was unable to partake in their famous cevche, so I can not comment here. However, we did try the sampling of everything else, the empanadas, the kebabs, the potato dishes etc. Everything has an ok flavor but absolutely nothing we ate screamed out at us as really good or exceptional. The one thing that did come to mind, and I hate to say this is 'production line cuisine'. First, most things did not taste as if they had been carried out fresh, it seemed as if they had sat for awhile under a heat lamp or just sat on a cart. The octopus kebab-great flavor but definitely had been sitting for awhile. Same with the small plate sampling of the potato dishes. It really came across like a restaurant that was too big and too full for its own good. The empenadas-they were brought out on time although 25 minutes after the other small dishes- and they were just so so. We finished our meal with the lomo saltada which I had high expectations for. It was good, but not as good as the Peruvian restaurant Fresca or as good as our friend makes at home. A little over salted and gravied.

On the service side, our server was extremely nice, and from Peru which was nice as well, however the service was slow and getting our first drink took more than 20 minutes. When we came in, the front of the house had not taken my reservation correctly and luckily we were able to be seated-phew!. 

Overall, I was disappointed although I still enjoyed myself. It unfortunately, is tourist level food. I remember getting the same feeling when I have eaten at an Asia de cuba restaurant-great ratings but hotel worthy restaurant! If you do go, request a seat on the outdoor patio, the interior is very crowded and loud and outside is quite nice. The one thing that stood out-the freshly made chips and dips they bring out at the beginning.
author: pamela h.

description:
Was told to go there by friend who lives in the city.  It was our anniversary so we gave it a shot.
TOTALLY OVERATED!  Food is average at best.  Nothing really blew us a way.  Entrees were terrible, stay away from them.
Good atmosphere and excellent service.  I would suggest as a place to have a cocktail and appetizer at happy hour only.  
There are way too many good restaurants in the city to go back to this one.
author: danny d.

description:
So I would check this place out before it turns into a tourist location. Given the fact that it's right next to the Ferry Building, I think that's kinda inevitable.  
First off, the place is huge. We didn't have reservations but had no problem sitting at the bar which was fine. The service was not particularly good. It took forever for our drinks to come.  I wasn't that impressed by any of the cocktails either...eventually just switched back to my safety drink -  a glass of cab. The kept forgetting what food they had bought us and had to keep checking in to see what had arrived and what we were still waiting on. 
The food was good though. It was a refreshing change from my constant california cuisine (but don't get me wrong, I love Californian/Americanish..whatever... good food).  We ordered 4 or 5 things; one from each section of the menu and they were prepared well and the seafood was fresh. The chips and dips were pretty yummy too. I filled myself up on the dips and added them to almost every plate that came out. 
I'd probably come again if I was in the mood for seafood or happened to be downtown because it's convenient. It's also a good spot for bigger groups given they have so much room.
author: shadi m.

description: La Mar has OK food but their lame seating policy and snarky hostess at 12pm on 9/20 are total turn offs.  I'll never go back since their are plenty of restaurants in the city that do great food and guest service.  My party arrived on time but the La Mar hostess refused to seat us because one of our guests was running late.  If you know La Mar you know it's never full ( the dining room is massive) so I have no idea why they have this policy which justifiably has a place at smaller restaurants.  Because our late guest showed up 20 minutes late, La Mar cancelled our reservation even though the hostess knew we were waiting to be seated (and therefore I didn't receive opentable credit which was an annoying capper to the whole situation).  Sure enough when we were finally seated, there were a slew of empty tables of all sizes - plenty of two and four tops remained open through out our entire lunch.  Overall, stupid and pretentious policy is enough of a turn off never to go back to this otherwise mediocre restaurant.  Oh, and the snarky hostess at 12pm on 9/20 should be fired - there are plenty of people who need a job who know how to treat a customer right.  And yes, I'm sure she was just following management policy (which is why I'll never return) but customer service is all about delivery.  This hostess (9/20 at 12pm) might fit in at McDonalds on a good day.
author: David K.

description: I love the airy, crisp, white ambiance of La Mar. It's got a very relaxed Miami vibe to it. The ceviches are amazing; my favorite is the tuna (cebiche nikei). The calamari is excellent too (jalea).
author: T L.

description:
The first couple of times I went to la mar I knew the service was subpar but the food kept me coming back hoping service would improve.  The last time I went I experienced beyond terrible service and regardless of how much I like the food I won't go back.  Similar to a lot of the poor reviews my story is very similar:

I thought my party and I were pretty patient before deciding to leave the restaurant due to lack of customer service.  My friends and I sat at the bar area and received absolutely no service - not even a greeting or a menu.  After a couple of minutes we helped ourselves to a couple of menus while we watched the bartender attend to just about every table in the bar except us.  He actually picked up the check on our table from the previous customer and never returned with anything.  

After about 20 minutes of waiting I asked the hostess if there was a waiter in which she replied that the bartenders were servicing everyone at the bar.  I stated that we were trying to order some drinks and food.  After close to 10 more minutes of watching the bartender pretty much avoid our table we decided to leave.  I had asked to talk to a manager (which I told was Andrew) but due to the party located in the back he was unable to make a timely appearance at which point I decided I had wasted enough of my weekend at la mar.

I even took the time to draft an email to the restaurant and never heard a peep....due to the misleading star rating I'm giving it a one to hopefully keep the overall rating at somewhere near actual expectations.
author: Jay K.

description:
LOVE this place!  I have had lunch here 3 times and evening drinks 1 time, and each visit has been fabulous!

My first visit was with my 2 favorite co-workers, and the main reason we came was to visit my co-worker's boyfriend, who is a ceviche chef at La Mar.  We ate the ceviche bar and were able to watch the chefs construct these beautiful plates of ceviches and other appetizers.  One of my favorite things about La Mar is the root vegetable and fried plantain chips they serve along with 3 creamy and spicy sauces.  We ordered three ceviches to share among us:  the classico (halibut), crudo (scallops and uni) and nikei (ahi and avocado).  For our main courses were roasted grouper with manila clams, calamari, ají panca stew and green tamale cream; a braised lamb shank, mashed rice and bean tacu tacu, cilantro sauce; and Parihuela (soup with mussels, calamari, clams and mahi mahi, fermented peruvian corn cider chicha de jora, ginger and red onion).

Visit #2: I also came here with another co-worker and our boss for a holiday/celebratory lunch.  This time we ordered from the "Express Lunch Prix Fixe" menu.  There were 3 courses: appetizer, main course, and dessert, with 3 items to choose from each course.  Since there was 3 of us, we ordered one of each item on the prix fixe menu.  Everything was fabulous!  The appetizers were the ceviche mixto (mahi mahi/calamari/octapus), dungeoness crab causa (crab salad on a whipped potato), and Aguadito (calamari, mussels and manila clam soup with cilantro, yellow potato, rice and Peruvian ajís).  The main courses were a arroz criollo (similar to a paella but without the saffron); a pan-fried sea bass with mashed yucca, tamarind, red onion and tomato sauce; and sautéed beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, soy sauce, garlic, aji amarillo with potato fries and rice (which reminded me of a Chinese-styled beef and tomato stir-fry).  The desserts were: Picarones (pumpkin and sweet potato fritters with fig syrup, like beignets); grape granite with pisco sour foam; tiramisu with butterscotch ice cream.  We washed everything down with pisco sour cocktails.

Visit #3:  Drinks with my coworker and her aforementioned chef boyfriend and my husband at the bar.  It was my hubby's bday, so chef friend ordered a pisco sour for him, and the bartender gave us all pisco shots.  Pisco, if you get over the way it burns your throat, has a very floral aroma to it.  We also snacked on these right-out-of-the-fryer salted "corn nuts."

Visit #4:  Lunch with husband and friends.  Pre-lunch, husband and I had some delicious cocktails at the bar:  1) a pisco-based cocktail with prickly pear juice and 2) a brandy and Grand Marnier concoction with passion fruit juice.

The ambiance and decor is lovely, very turquoise blue and nautical.  And what a fab location, no?  The service during our 3 lunch visits was spot-on.
Will definitely return and recommend to friends!
author: Beth K.

description: One word: delicioso! I was raised on Peruvian food, and I must admit this place has great "sazon" (seasoning). I loved the food "remixes" like octopus anticuchos. The only disappointment was that my mom and I just missed their lunch hours and were too early for dinner, so we ended up eating a few dishes at the bar. Next time...
author: Alicia C.

description:
I generally post a review only when an experience either significantly exceeds or falls short of my expectations.  Unfortunately, for La Mar, it's the latter.  We arrived shortly after 9PM on a Friday evening hoping to sit at the cool blue-lit bar...only to be told rather brusquely that the bar section was closing and that we would have to be seated elsewhere (more than an hour later the bar hadn't closed).  The table we were given at the edge of the main dining room was so dimly lit (with no table lighting either) that it noticable detracted from the dining experience.  The dishes (ceviche sample, tuna and a chocolate dessert), seemed much like the service - superficial - a desultory effort  - not objectionable to be sure, but perfunctory and pretenious.   We had an ever changing cast of servers some of whom were attentive and other not at all...and we finally had to conspiucously flag one of them down after a lengthy wait to just get our check.   I had seen some glowing reviews of La Mar and was looking forward to a great dining experience, but it fell short pretty much across the board.  It wasn't quite as bad as a one star experience, but I feel like I'm being generous by giving it two.   To sum it up, I was embarrassed to have brought my date to this restaurant and am unlikely to return any time soon.

p.s. I'm a guy and La Mar has no men's bathroom.  It does have a women's room and two single unisex  facilities - which the women were also using.  Had to wait well over 5 minutes just to pee.
author: David E.

description: They have a lot of things on their menu.  If you go, stick to the cebiches and entrees.  The empanadas are weak, and the roll was terrible.  Make sure you check the menu prior to going- they have a ton of items, but most contain octopus or squid.  I'm okay with those in a couple of dishes, but it was a little frustrating trying to find dishes without them.  The desert menu was impressive.
author: Chris T.

description: three solid stars, although i'm not sure my rating accurately reflects the cuisine since i only belatedly discovered that: 1) this place was peruvian and 2) that it specializes in seafood.  i was here for a holiday party so my experience is pretty much based on the appetizers (as well as a general appreciation for the beauty of the space itself), none of which screamed peruvian or included creatures from the sea.  seemed like the waitstaff was forever handy with a platter of tasty appetizers (definitely not a complaint) with my favorites being the roasted pork sandwich, the beef empanadas and the vegetarian empanadas.  didn't care overly much for the chicken empanadas or skewers, but hey, pass me another 1-2 (or more) sandwiches, please.
author: Tina E.

description: This restaurant is a great cure for New American / Asian Fusion fatigue. The menu is thoughtful, exciting, and serious, both in concept and in execution--including dessert!
author: N M.

description: Mediocre food and terrible service. They are all very confused there and need to be re-trained or something. You're better off getting a quick bite at the bar. Don't let them tell you they do not reserve the lounge area if you call and ask. When we arrived there were reserved signed all over the lounge area. When we asked the hostess...she responded by saying "oh who told you that?". Oddly enough, we had 3 different people call on separate days and we were told "no reservations in the lounge" -- whatever! Our experience was a disaster. At least we got an apology from the manager and discount on our bill, so...
author: Tonia D.

description:
OK, the fish was actually very fresh and the sauces really tasty. BUT even when we were there when it was almost empty, the service was bad and the bar lady kept piling dirty glasses right in front of us. The bar design is poor, so you get to see how messy it is behind it. A glass actually exploded in my hand for no reason, getting me and everyone around me soaking wet, and none of the servers seemed to care for one second. The drinks were mediocre at best, and their specialty Pisco Sour came from plastic containers, so you have no idea what alcohol they use for them. Then there were the random paper place mats that made us feel as if we were 3 year old, What is with the waste of paper? even more so when they claim to care for the environment right on their menu. Obviously just a marketing remark... 
When we ordered our bill it took them forever to bring it, and then this waiter kept looking at it while he came and went doing nothing about it. Remember it was empty?
I do not think we will be back.
author: Rebeca R.

description: This seems to be a place to enjoy on a hot summer day (not a rainy one - the day we went), sipping a glass of white wine or enjoying a Pisco Sour out on the deck. The restaurant is massive. We had 3 different dishes, a ceviche (which they are known for),  a fried seafood appetizer that had octopus in it (very tasty) and oysters. We were full after having these. Would like to go back and try some of their seafood entrees. Impressive wines by the glass.
author: Lisa R.

description:
i had the empanadas de lomo saltado.

great service.
author: James R.

description: Yelp reviews were spot on. Awesome food! Pisco drinks were yummy. The ceviche were great - two were enough for four people. The fish of the day was very fresh and extremely flavorful in a mushroom broth with a side of rice. The arroz criollo is like a peruvian paella. It was very good but would probably try something else next time. The complementary plantain and sweet potato chips with three dipping sauces were a great little appetizer. The service was very attentive but not overbearing. Will definitely be back!
author: alibee i.

description: What La Mar lacks in substance, it makes up for in style. Go for the ceviche and pisco sours.
author: Ryan M.

description: When I read about the opening of La Mar Cebicheria Peruana on Pier 1-1/2, I immediately wrote an old friend in Mexico City that I studied culinary arts with.  I knew she had probably sampled La Mar's food many times at the Mexico City outpost of the Peruvian restaurant group.  With her stamp of approval and a list of recommendations, I arranged to meet a few girlfriends for lunch.  I love ceviche and consider San Francisco a reputable provider of fresh seafood thanks to its geographic location.  On this dining occasion, my memory has almost entirely failed me, but I recall adoring the food.  All the dishes we tasted (three ceviches and one causa) were clean in an almost Japanese-like presentation, flavorful, well balanced, and creative.  I really enjoy the use of hot peppers with raw fish and shellfish.  (It hasn't taken hold in sushi joints in North America, but I assure you that a sliver of jalapeño pepper soaked in soy sauce on top of sushi is explosive pleasure.)  Several of La Mar's dishes included habañero pepper, whose heat opens up the flavors of the fish and gives otherwise mild flavors a boost.  Another common ingredient in our ceviches was Peruvian Corn, which is fatter than American corn, similar to hominy, and provides a great bite of starchiness and texture.  My favorite dish was a causa called Limeña - a capsule of potato purée filled with Dungeness Crab, avocado purée, cherry tomatoes, yellow chili pepper sauce and basil cilantro oil.
author: T. L.

description: Too expensive for very small portions.  But understand you're also paying for environment and atmosphere.  Great tasting food.  Service and pisco sour is great.
author: Violet B.

description: I recommend coming here on a week night, it's a lot easier to get a table and your server can talk to you, which is important with all the different dishes.  There's so much, and it's all so good, it's hard to choose from.  Just through back a few pisco cocktails, shut your eyes and point at something.
author: Ian M.

description:
The ceviche is to die for. Great work guys. Gaston, the head celebrity-like chef of this place knows what he's doing and I trust him implicitly.  

I had an incredible time there with a friend. We stopped for a drink and ended up going through two bottles of a fantastic pinot while we ate ceviche and causes all afternoon through to the evening.

Rodrigo - thanks for the wine tip, David Family's Pinot is great. The leather label made it easy to find and for those still looking it's at www.davidfamily.com. 

Can't wait to be back in SF to head over to La Mar again. SF may be foggy sometimes but this place makes it worthwhile.
author: Joanne T.

description: We went to La Mar to celebrate our wedding anniversary and it could not have been more perfect.  The terrace has one of the best views in the city.  The service was exceptional and the food was amazing.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Laura D.

description:
The food was very yummy. We had a party of around 9 and we shared the 3-salmon skewer appetizers (~$13), the ceviche sampler (~$22) and the causa sampler. The salmon skewers were well cooked but not worth what we paid: we got 3 bite-sized portions of salmon on top of a dab of mashed potatoes. The ceviches were all tasty, I especially liked the halibut and the tuna. The causas were just ok, they are rolls of potato mash (sort of like a large tater tot but less deep fried) topped with fish of some kind. But they were also very small portions, each one is about the size of a large marshmellow (the kind used for s'mores...yum!) and I would definitely not recommend getting those. 

The entrees were extremely well prepared. My bf had a beef dish with french fries and rice (~$27) and the beef was the best I've had in a long time, very tender and flavorful. The sauce used for the dish was wonderful, I kept stealing his french fries to dip in the beef juice. I got the cau cau (~$31), which are 3 large scallops on top of risotto and topped with arugula. The scallops were perfectly cooked, slightly grilled on the outside and tender on the inside. It tasted really fresh and the scallops were slightly sweet. The risotto was too undercooked for my taste. Instead of bread at the table, they had a basket of potato, sweet potato and plaintain crisps with very yummy salsas. 

Overall the food was excellent though pricy, and the service was decent. We were seated outside and there were mega strong heaters, and we had to ask repeatedly for them to be turned off before they were. And there were some mix-ups with the  drinks and the wait staff were slow to to take our orders and bring the food. But they did pretty well considering we had 9 in our group. So overall I highly recommend this place IF you're willing to spend a lot of money.
author: Tina L.

description:
Cannot really give it any stars because we left after we were seated. My wife and I dropped in last night to see how long it would be to sit at the counter. Looking at the counter I could see many open seats. The hostess said it would be about 10 minutes and invited us to wait in the bar. Fine we had a glass of wine in the lively bar and after about 15 minutes the Hostess found us and informed us that there were no seats at the bar but that she could fit us in at a table on the enclosed heated patio. Fine.  Well they seater walked us through the restaurant revealing plenty of empty  seats at the counter as well as a plethora of other empty tables throughout the dining room. We were ushered out to the back patio that had 1 table occupied out of the 10 or so that were there. 
Pretty insulting. I have worked in the restaurant business for years and am aware that there are times that you need to manage the flow into the restaurant particularly at opening. This was not the case as this was way into the dinner time. 
I think it is just poor service and should not be tolerated at the prices that they charge.
author: Josh N.

description:
As a whole, I found La Mar to be beautiful and fun just like the one in Lima. 

I've been there a number of times but  the thing I love most about the restaurant is the overall vibe of the place.  The food is good, some things better than others but it's obvious they use quality ingredients so that and the fact that it's on the Embarcadero you have to expect to put out some cash.  If you're going to order ceviche, stick to the Classico, it's delicious, the other fussion varieties take away from the authentic simplicity that makes the dish.  Skip the Causa and the Empanadas all together, I've tried just about everything on the menu and so far, the rice dishes are my favorite.  For dessert, have one of the most typical Peruvian desserts, Picarones, they're light crispy fritters made from sweet potatoes, pumpkin and anis...super delicious.  You can get the best Pisco Sour outside of Peru here and if you're going to have a beer, try a Cristal, the national beer.  

La Mar makes up for very good but not great food with it's vibrant, cool atmosphere that is alive and pulsing all on it's own.   They have a great happy hour that is fun and exotic. The wait staff is predominantly Latin which makes the experience all the more authentic and I like that. 

Go there for the overall experience.  If you want a little slice of upscale Lima, La Mar delivers.
author: Nina C.

description:
The staff was great since we were an hour late on a weekday, totally accomodating. Great friendly and cute staff!
First off pisco sangrias... to die for! What flavors...we ordered the arroz nortena too..lovely! But the skewers of fish with that spicy sauce is something to remember. And the beef empandas(?) huge and yummy.
This is going to be the hot spot of the summer ...the location rocks and can't wait for summer nights on the decks!
author: Outrageous O.

description: I have been here three times and have had excellent food every time. The service has been fine but you really come here for the plaintain/sweet potato chips, the ceviches, the causas, and pico sour. We all got various entrees and shared, they were all excellent.
author: Deepa S.

description: Great food! I've been here for dinner and drinks several times. I finally made it for lunch and had a great meal on the back patio/deck. It felt like we were on vacation at a resort, not out to a work lunch. The ceviche, skirt steak and empanadas combo I had was amazing. The limon dessert was also incredible. Friendly, efficient service, we got there early and had a great table!
author: Mike S.

description: I know I'm probably going to get some SF heat for this review, but I really didn't think La Mar was anything extraordinary. I've been to Peru, I've been to Argentina - I've had empanadas that have changed my life. I've even tried the empanadas down in LA and they're better than those at La Mar. Too much dough, not enough flavor and the filling was not moist. The cebiche was good, not great. And the fact that the highlight of my meal was a bite of a sushi roll that we happened to order is not really a good sign. This is a South American restaurant, not a Japanese one. It was good, don't get me wrong. However, I won't be searching it out again. I don't plan on being back.
author: Amanda S.

description: Picked this spot for "after work cocktails/appetizers" with colleagues. The food was pretty tasty and interesting, but the service was not great - inattentive and not particularly friendly. Example, I ordered the San Martin cocktail. I was surprised when a beer (St. Martin, as it turns out) was dropped off in front of me. Ok, these things happen - the names are very similar. When I mention the error to the guy who delivered the beer, he glanced at me, then proceeded to walk away. um, ok... When our waiter came back, I noted the drink error. I did get the cocktail...20 minutes later. On to the food: We ordered the causa tasting. Favorites were the ones with crab and tuna. The one w/ fried fish was just not good at all and the avocado causa was pretty boring. We also ordered the cebiche tasting. High points were tuna and hamachi. Didn't care for the squid or octopus versions. Other menu highlights: Crab meatballs were spicy and delicious. Empanadas sampler was fantastic. Beef skeeters were ok - nothing special. For dessert, we sampled the chocolate beignets, which were scrumptious!.  Overall, the plates are beautiful to look at, the food is mostly quite good, and the space is fun. So, despite the service, I'd still come back here.
author: Eme L.

description:
Pro: The food IS good 

Con: Service STINKS!! I just went with some girlfriends, and my boss has now been 2x. We both agreed the service is slow, inconsistent, and unhelpful. He also noted they were out of ALL Peruvian beer (at a Peruvian restaurant, no less), Amstel Light, Absolute Vodka when he went last time. 

Conclusion: La Mar is NOT cheap. So, if you are on a budget, and want the most out of your $90/person dinner (including drinks), I'd go somewhere else.
author: Andi B.

description: I'd been to 'La Mar' before for dinner and enjoyed my meal. Although I didn't specifically remember the hostess or server, it didn't stick out in my mind as being uptight or snobby. I took a new client to lunch there this past Saturday and although I found our server to be nice, the hostess was incredibly snooty. Not friendly or hospitable, two requirements I would think are necessary when meeting and greeting customers. When we shown to our table, we asked to be seated in the shade. Again, I felt we were met with attitude and the three of us were left standing in the middle of the patio while she 'checked' if this was possible. Bear in mind, there was about 20 tables on the patio and four were occupied at the time  I understand that there's a system in place and that servers have their sections but being friendly would go a LONG way in a situation like this.  My clients and I just felt totally uncomfortable standing there like idiots.  You would think we'd asked the lady to empty out the entire patio for us! We had a seriously long wait between our starters and our main course but the server was apologetic about that and I'm sure it was a screw up in the kitchen. These things happen. The food was nice some of the portions were very small. Next time, I'd eat a protein bar before coming here!  I typically don't write bad reviews on Yelp but for a restaurant that has terrific views and a beautiful setting, I think you'd over come the price point if you felt a bit more welcomed by the staff.
author: Clare C.

description: This place is great!  Really authentic peruvian.  I have not found anywhere outside of Peru that can make a Pisco sour like these guys.  And the entire meal was amazing.  Th efish was extremely fresh, all the sauces were great, and oh the lamb!
author: Adam C.

description: The place is very hip, the food is gross.  You leave with the feeling of... what did i eat that is making me feel so gross?  The cerviche was fishy and served in clumps at room temp.  Yuck.
author: michael k.

description: After having friends rave about La Mar, I was really excited to try it.  We went as a group for lunch.  Everything was good, but not fantastic like I was expecting.  I want to go back and try other dishes because it definitely has potential.  The cebiche sampler was very good, causas sampler was good, and the empanadas were also good.  My co-worker said the corn empanada was outstanding.  for the entree, I had the Taca Taca special - it was good, but I was disappointed that it didn't have more seafood... just one shrimp, one scallop, and a couple of small pieces of fish over a large bed of chickpea puree that didn't have a lot of flavor.  for dessert, I had the picarones which were good, but not outstanding.  Overall, the appetizers were the best part.  Everything is fresh and done well, but for the price, I wasn't doing backflips.  I will go back and try again to see if other dishes are better or maybe as a happy hour and appetizer place.
author: Nedra D.

description: very good, pricey, and the waitor wasnt too friendly
author: Anthony P.

description: La Mar was delicioso!!!! We had the octopus, which was to die for, perfectly balanced leche for the ceviche and the LOMO was sooo tender!!! i do like to drink a lot BUT only sip on my drinks with my food and I tried their peruvian brandy basil mixed drink and was sooo delighted. perfect mix of flavor and alcohol, it was sooo tasty!!! I give it four stars for the price, and for the fact that we were seated in the bar area instead of the patio, although i know that might be our fault for getting there pretty late...oops, needless to say that, I can't wait to go back on a nice night and sit by the water...:)
author: joann l.

description: Great Cebiche...really nice interior decoration!highly recommended esp on a sunny day! rice dishes are delicious but really oily I would recommend sticking to Cebiche dishes
author: Mahyar K.

description: yum yum yum delicioso!  The food at La Mar was fresh and delicious. Dined at La Mar for lunch with friends. The plantain and sweet potato chips with the 3 different sauces was amazing, especially the red sauce (with a kick).   Then to the cebiche sampler -- WOW!   Wonderful tasting ahi and squid - if you like spice, there is a 1 plate with habanero.  Drooling thinking about it:)  Empanada sampler plate, good but not impressed though it's a great app to share. On to the main course.  Shared a chimichurri torta like plate.  Felt a bit too american.  Would have been perfect with the meat and fixings without bread and would have added yuca.  Selecting fries as the side made it feel too american too.  Besides that, the service was friendly and thoughtful.  We ordered a special and the kitchen ran out of  a main ingredient, but converted to another dish that made it very innovative and good. Can't wait to go again -- there is so much more to try!
author: D T.

description: Almost as good as the La Mar in Lima Peru. Great Lomo Saltado, excellent Papa Rellena and Picarones for desert :)
author: J. B.

description: I went here for dinner the other night and it's one of the better dining experiences I've had in a while. I really liked the decor of the place as it's very modern and simple. The food was very tasty. We shared 3 plates and started off with cebiche mixto. Seafood was fresh and marinated just right. We then had the empanada sampler. These were very good, fried perfectly and didn't have a greasy feel. I enjoyed all except the empanada de tamalito. I think that's because the others had better flavor and texture. That one just seemed like mushed vegetables. Our last dish, which was the best dish of all was the lomo saltado. I've had this in other peruvian restaurants but this is by far the best place. The meat was soft and tender and the vegetables were cooked perfectly. The sauce had just the right amount of saltiness to it. It was to die for! One thing I didn't like so much was that the place was very loud. It is a large open space and there isn't much within it to absorb all the noise.
author: Yelp O.

description: We organized a last minute birthday lunch for ten people today. The service was spot on and food amazing. Our server, Mario, was great. He was friendly throughout and completely unfazed by people arriving at all times (The last members of our party arrived an hour late - at 2.30pm - when they stop serving lunch). The food is unbelievable. BEST ceviche in the city. The corn in the ceviche is amazing - like nothing I've ever had before. It tastes almost meaty. I had the lamb chop special for entree - delish and served with potato in three different ways (including whipped with tuna..yum). My wife had the snapper which was perfectly cooked. Desserts are also awesome and there's been enough said about the great cocktails on yelp already (I'd recommend the flor - very refreshing). I'll definitely be back and I hope I'm in Mario's section when I do.
author: Anuj N.

description: My brother and I went to La Mar for our annual birthday celebration dinner. The bar was cool, the bar counter area looked cool; the restaurant was cool. The service person (Carson) was great. We both enjoyed our meals immensely and definitely will be back.
author: Angie W.

description: It seems like San Francisco has more nice Peruvian restaurants than almost any other city. I thought the scene was great with a spacious bar area. I probably would venture back here for the bar scene over the restaurant even though the food wasn't bad. My main reason on the lower rating though is simply that the food is good but not great. I would go to Limon any day for the food over La Mar, but the setting is certainly nicer at La Mar.
author: Randy L.

description: Had dinner here with my best friend tonight. Waiter took an hour to bring the main course...the best part of the dinner was the uncooked RAW chicken skewers. If you feel like spending the night in the ER feel free to order them. Upon notifying the manager and waiter they half heartedly apologized...comped the food and still charged us for the drinks....WTF!
author: Krishna S.

description: i've been here a couple of times. once was  for a private event and got to sample many of the dishes free.  everything was pretty good but the quantity and price is not worth paying for myself.  the pisco drinks are quite strong and delicious though.
author: Helen T.

description:
I and my husband thrilled this place. We both love seafoods so that why we always have dinner at La Mar all the time. Basicly we both tried evry dishes..
we love Cau cau  ( Scallops ), Jalea ( Mahi, mahi) and of course Cabiche.  Their food are fantastic. Love it.. and it's get pretty crowed for happy hour.
author: T K.

description: Food is good booze is good to but a bit pricy for this type of food. But look the view you get fomr the dinning room
author: Pedro V.

description: Nice option for afternoon lunch. The space is big, but well lit and with outdoor patio on the water. Cuisine is innovative. Staff is friendly; we started our waiter on a discussion of the origins of Pisco and ended up with his future travels and family tree. Will return.
author: Brett V.

description: Amazing tapas style Peruvian located right on the embarcadero. Try the anticuchos (beef heart) sounds a little daring, but to die for!
author: Monica J.

description:
This is a tough review- I would give 4 stars for the food, which was realy good, but the service was so terrible, it ruined the experience. 
The good things first:
The wine list is great. It is full of nteresting selections from Spain and South America. The food is great. Of the 6 dishes we had, I would come back to eat 4 of them again. The civiche is fantastic as are the empenadas. We had a fried fish dish- like a mix of fish and calamari in a frito misto style that was so good. 
The problem was the server, who I swear must have left for 45 minutes. A manager ended up taking over our table for a period of time, but we had to reorder things from him. We asked the food runner for an additional appetizer, but he said he couldn't help us. Our server had abandoned us and we were out of wine. One of our courses was delivered without silverware. We had to flag someone to ask for it. Most of these things are forgivable in a casual restaurant. But when you pay $250 for three people better service is a must. 
The weird thing is that the waitress showed up again at the very end of the meal like she had never left. On the bottom of the check is a gratuity suggestion, listing the amount for 18%, 20% and 25%!!!!!
Since when was 25% standard? I found this to be so offensive. I always tip 20%, but when the service here deserved half of that, they were suggesting a higher amount. Ballsey, no?
I might come back, but I doubt it.
author: Christy F.

description:
Excellent food and ambiance! I'd expect no less out of a restaurant owned by famous Peruvian restaurant owners Gaston Acurio and his wife, Astrid!

We shared the ceviche/cebiche sampler; the causa sampler (mashed potatoes with ceviche-style seafood on top--sounds odd, but it's wonderful!); a rocoto (stuffed pepper), lomo saltado (steak stir fry), and plenty of pisco sours. 

You should definitely check it out (be sure to make a reservation--it's popular!)

Plus: great location on the water; outdoor seating on a nice night; beautiful presentation; cool, modern decor; amazing, authentic and yet cutting edge takes on peruvian cuisine (novo-peruano).

Minus: Pricey; small-ish portions; only individual pisco sours and not pitchers; not a full menu of peruvian food (focus is on seafood, although you can get a few non-seafood dishes); a little noisy

Bottom line: if you like Peruvian food or are curious to give it a try, you should check it out! It's probably a little pricey to visit on a regular basis, so my standby is still Fresca.
author: J L.

description:
Also came for an early dinner before Ovo (like another reviewer yesterday).
Fairly minor negative when on arrival (10' before our reservation at 6:30P, and the place was empty), 2 out of 4 of our party were there, and we went up to the hostess and asked to be seated. After she bothered to glance up at us, she told us 'no, just let me know when you're all here', and given that it was very early, and empty, i asked if we could wait at our table, and she told us 'we think you'll enjoy the meal more if you all sit down together'. Now, come on! If your policy is not to seat incomplete parties, that's fine, but lets call it what it is, and say 'sorry, that's our policy', but instead to pretend like you're doing it for ME? really? you're doing ME a favor? puhleeze. It seems from many other reviewers that the management needs to work on their front desk service.
anyway, seated, and things very much uphill from there. 
Server excellent, helpful, and aware of our timing.
Had two cebiches (classic and neiki, classic better). 
little potatoe appetizer was excellent. 
empenada mundane.
arroz norteno fairly pedestrian, but other fish entree (like peruvian peilla) was excellent.
pisco sours wonderful and brought me back to a late night in lima.
minor other disappointment: no beer on tap, and bottled beer list very lightweight; both peruvian beers were light lagers, as was almost everything else except on good belgian beer, but clearly could do with a better variety of a few darkier, heavier beers.
So, overall, food and server excellent; front desk staff and beer selection not so much.
might go back, but didn't make an exceptional impression overall, and given the depth of good food in SF, not sure 'better than adequate' is enough.
author: neil s.

description: Very nice location and very sleek, airy interior.  Good place to impress guests, have a special date night.  We went at lunch and I would say this is sorta kid friendly during the daytime (there was one 8yo in our party) if they like seafood and lomo saltado.  Must tries: any of the cebiches, the empanadas are tasty as well.  The lomo saltado was tender, but skimpy for the price.  The octopus skewers were surprisingly tender and tasty.  I love the variety of chips (potato, plantain, yuca).  There is outdoor seating w/ heatlamps overlooking the bay.
author: win c.

description:
The food is really good, however the service was more than flat.

We started with drinks which were very good representatives of the Peruvian elixirs - these were a good way to start.

When we sat down the experience started when one of our party spilled her drink - they were slow to bring us anything to help clean up or replace our napkins.

The chair was wet and we asked to have a new one - they said of course but never did bring one.  We swapped it out with the table next to us once they left.

We ordered dinner and appetizers and wine.  After our first round of appetizers we finished our wine and the waiter took the bottle (never asked if we wanted any more wine/drinks).  Our second round of appetizers came at the same time as our entrees and only after asking and talking with a manager did they ask if we wanted more wine (which we did).  There were also many times our waters were empty and we had to ask for these to be refilled.

Two of the dinners came to the table cold and we had to return them - they arrived after the other two of us were already done with our meals.

I did talk with the management team and they did appreciate the feedback.  However the service did not get any better even after that interaction with the management team.

The cost was over $500 for four and in reality could have been higher with additional wine if they were paying any attention or offering what you would expect in service for the price/positioning of this restaurant (high end Peruvian).

I will again say the food is very good and that is the only reason I would consider going back but the service really needs to be improved quite a bit.  I did point this out to the management team that they do have an excellent executive chef and team.

Hopefully they can fix this area so it can make it a truly great experience.
author: Jody A.

description: This place is my new favorite Peruvian restaurant.Parking was easy to find, the restaurant was clean, the staff was very friendly and attentive. We ordered the Ceviche Mixto for appetizers and this is the best I've ever had. It was fresh, tasty and refreshing. For my entree' I ordered the Lomo Saltado.Very flavorful,fairly good sized portion and delicious.We also asked our server for his recommendation for a bottle of wine.  He chose the perfect wine to compliment our meals...This place gets two thumbs up in my book  =)  price wise $$$
author: rob d.

description: great food, service, and atomsphere. A new favorite.
author: Veli M.

description: wakako is right...the grilled octopus here is DELISH!  i came here again last night for a big group dinner.  our reservations were for 8 pm, and we had to get a prix fixe menu, b/c we had a large group.  we picked out the items the day before.  for $55, you get 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 sides, and a dessert, all served family style.  even tho we had already ordered, we didn't get served our first course until 9 pm!!  all in all, we didn't finish dinner until about 1130!!  once again, the food was good, and portions were very generous.
author: Helen T.

description: Pisco Sour was yummy, but I found the food to be mediocre and the quality of the ceviche to be deservedly subpar. The waitstaff were attentive, and the place slightly pricy overall, but considering the location it's about right. I won't be back.
author: S. N.

description: Don't bother, expensive, has very little to do with Peru.  Very Rude waiter, ask if we could read English!  Fresca is much much better.
author: Robert W.

description:
My Peruvian husband and I ate at La Mar on 12/8/08.  I ordered the Rocoto Relleno appetizer and Lomo Saltado as the main dish.  Both items were absolutely delicious.  The Rocoto Relleno was as good or better than I had when I visited Arequipa Peru (where Rocoto Relleno is a specialty of the region).  The Lomo Saltado was some of the best I have ever eaten.  Spices were perfect and food arrived piping hot.  

My husband had the corazon anticuchos (shish-kebabs of beef heart) as an appetizer and Cordero (lamb shank) for his main dish.  I'm not a fan of eating organ meats, but I had a bite of his anticuchos and have to admit it was wonderful and the giant choclo (corn) with the anticuchos was fabulous.  The Cordero was also very good with the tacu tacu which was served with it.  The pisco drinks are fantastic, but pricy.

The only food disappointment was the picarones for dessert.  (kind of a donut made of sweet potato batter with a molasses-like syrup).  The taste was fine, but it took a while from the time we ordered them to the time we were served - the picarones were pretty much cold instead of being hot like they should have been served.  I would have sent them back, but it was getting late and our waiter was no where to be found.  I would have given a 5 star rating to the restaurant if not for the cold picarones and the at times slow service.  

I look forward to visiting La Mar again and trying more of the menu items.
author: K N.

description:
It was a great meal, I can't wait to go back and try the sample ceviche .
We started with the pisco sour. Sort of like a margarita made with egg whites. I had a great seafood and rice dish. 
I will go again for sure.
author: Chris S.

description: This was the best food hands down I've had in a long time! I went with my boyfriends family, so I was able to try many things on the menu. The cebiche sampler was so delicious. I ordered the picante; it was prawns and crab with linguini and this sauce... was so rich yet not too strong, I dream of it now. Nothing seems to compare. Dessert was divine as was the peruvian drink I had. This restaurant comes highly, highly recommended.
author: Lisa J.

description: Fabulous Peruvian restaurant with outstanding "cebiche" (ceviche). Went there last Friday night a bit on the later side - around 9:30 p.m. and the service was really slow. That said. I had a fabulous mixed fish cebiche and vegetarian risotto. I highly recommend this place.
author: Joan L.

description: Came to La Mar for my second time, and left quite disappointed.  Ordered the cebiche clasico, but for its price, it was nothing spectacular - the fish being really bland, which for a cebiche, is really unusual.  Also had the empanada sampler. The best one was the corn and the rest were ok.  Top those two dishes with two strong pisco sours, and you'll spend $60 for nothing special.  Great ambiance but definitely not the best Peruvian food in town.  I doubt I'll go back.
author: Sofia A.

description: The place it booming EVERY night!!! The decor is beautiful! Totally love their pisco sour and housemade chips and dip!!! My fave is the Cebiche Sampler!!
author: Lacoco G.

description: they definitely have a top notch location and a great looking space. service was quick and attentive, but the food was good at best. i ordered the mushroom risotto, which was very tasty but literally came with 3 mushrooms. umm...if you're gonna call your dish mushroom risotto i think there should be a tad more mushrooms in there.
author: mary c.

description:
what is with these places that you can't even get in on a wednesday night!  it feels like i'm back in 1999 and trying to make a client dinner reservation at a hot new restaurant on a tuesday.  sadly, you couldn't get in anywhere and you had to be an expert in hot, new, HIDDEN restaurants.... 

well it seems like if you're trying to eat near the embarcadero then you're doomed to relive 1999 for as long as time passes... yes, it's wednesday and no the Dental convention isn't in town nor is JavaOne nor is OracleWorld but you just can't get a table at slanted door nor La Mar.  what is WITH that?  

we were going to make the trek to Morton's since my friends from out of town love steak but the consensus was that there were closer restaurants that were better.  after a bit of debate between Boulevard and La Mar, we opted for La Mar since i've been to boulevard a number of times already.  there were no seats, unfortunately in the dining area (again, on a wednesday? whatever).  probably the problem was exacerbated by the fact that the place looked a bit small.  the hostess did offer us the couch-like lounge area with dinner server on the coffee-table thing.  now i was fine with that. not a picky eater but we had fussy folks in the group so coffee-table dining, even though it's totally the IN thing to do, didn't fly.  however, just as we were about to roll out, a table in the bar area which was plenty big enough for 4 opened up.  The pisco sours was good although i didn't think it was as nice as the ones at Destino.  the skewers of beef were mighty tasty and the hot sauce was actually hot.  the fried fish/calamari appetizer was average.  my pork was awesome though.  not ridiculously huge but a very healthy trim cut of swine flavored with a honey glaze with a authentically peruvian style rice and plantain side.  the dishes of the others looked good as well.  i tasted some of the paella-type dish.  not a bad paella but i wasn't aware that paella was a peruvian thing.  maybe so, i thought it was spanish. 

the staff was well on top of stuff. the hostess was apologetic about being crowded even on a silly weekday eve and did her best to give us a seat.  i'll give'm 5 stars even though i suppose the pisco sour coulda been better! ;)
author: dan h.

description: We stumbled upon this restaurant while walking around. My one criteria was fresh seafood being from inland, I always look for good seafood when I'm on the coast. I get tingles each time I take a bite. The Cebiche is remarkable. I always ask for more instead of dessert. The waiters laugh at me. I've flown from Phoenix AZ just to eat there.
author: Magda P.

description:
Hi, I'm from peru,but  I live in Berkeley CA  .Last night my husband and I went to LA MAR cevicheria & peruvian restaurant and we were impress by the food. it was so good and the dinks were excellent. It's rare to find  peruvian food around the bay area.
I ate  Arroz con pollo con onion sarsa and Anticuchos de corazon both dishes were just excellent.
My husband  ate Lomito Saltado and Papa a la Huancayina  those two dishes are his very favorite . He tought that el lomito saltado is one best that he ever had in a restaurant in the USA. 
About the drinks the PISCO SOUR WERE AWESOME . La MAR uses the finest Pisco from Peru(Ica is a southern state in peru and produces the best pisco in peru). My pisco sour was so good that i order two more. My hasbund had two Cervezas Cristal (one of the bigest brewer in peru).
The service was very good , most of ther waiter was very nice friendly.what it really surprice me was that are waiter was from the same town  that I lived in peru.what a coincidence.
My husband loved the desserts, specially the lucuma tiramizu and los picarones.
I  WAS VERY HAPPY WITH THIS RESTAURANTE AND  I WILL GO BACK THERE SOON.
 GASTON (OWNER ) DID A GREAT JOB!!!
 I'LL GOING TO PERU IN MONTH , AND I WILL GO TO LA MAR
author: sara n.

description:
It's not often that you can experience a place as busy as La Mar, but with attentive service.

On top of this, the food is very good.

The Tuna was fantastic, along with the dips. The Salmon was nice, but lacked flavor.

The outdoor setting would be perfect in summer.
author: Paul L.

description:
I am giving 4 out 5 for one reason only...I have been to PERU recently...not when I was five and gramacitas cooking was to die for, but I was there in the Summer. It was amazing...and in turn, so is La Mar. Ceviches are rich and tasty. If you are into authenticity, try all but the Tuna, as that has more of Japanese "Poke-esque" flavor. The Anticuchos appetizer is way out of left field (muy diferente, if unusual) from the real thing, but damn it tastes great!  
Lomo Saltado...number 1 place for Lomo Saltado...I would like more on my plate...(-1 star for the quantity only). Drinks are tremendously good...Pisco Sour is as tasty as I had in Peru. Not too sweet and not too tart...just a great balance. Chicha Tu Ma! is a great drink too and cannot be missed for the Chicha Morada fans. All I can say is Peruvian's everywhere should be proud of getting the Gringo's out to try such a wonderful cuisine that is unique to Peru.
author: Ramon B.

description: This place is pretty freakin expensive.  If you want to come here and get cocktails I recommend only ordering 1 or 2 and not 5!  Each drink is $10.  The santa maria was good.  Nice and pink.  I lost one of my fat balls that night.  Everyone and their fatty mothers ordered the pisco sour.  I was at the bar for about 4-5 hours.  I was Dr. Fatty Phil after the 4th hour.  Some random couple sitting next to me asked me to be a neutral party in their relationship problems.  I sat there for about 20 minutes pretending to be a therapist.  I guess they have sex all the time even though they aren't officially a couple.  The guy broke up with her 6 months ago.  They work together.  They then have sex on a  work trip 6 months later.  They talk about getting back together.  The chick has the guys email password.  The guy emailed a stripper and told her to meet him in SF while he tell this girl he wants to get with her.  So they wanted to ask me who is the fucked up one out of the two of them.  The guy says she shouldn't be in his email.  The girl says he shouldn't be inviting strippers to visit him while they are trying to get back together.  I say just have sex with each other until the guy gets bored then call up the stripper to join in.  The End.  Every other drink made was a pisco sour.  They put some cool drops to give the drink a nice smell.  I kept taking the bottle and smelling it.  I bet I got everyone that ordered that drink germs.  I thought the drink itself was ok.  The bartender also made a special girl drink for me.  I then lost my other ball.  After the 5th hour I was hungry.  I ordered some flank steak dish with potatoes and a sunny side egg.  It was pretty good.  But I dunno if it was $30 good.  This is high end Peruvian food.
author: Fatty A.

description: this place is sooooooo delisious the civiche is sooooo good flavors are amazing they have the best white rice ever!!!! its defenetly the place you wanna go on a date it is romantic food is great and its in a great spot embarcadero. really nice place to go to i definetly recomend it :)
author: Michelle I.

description: I went with my boss/ friend for a very delightful lunch get together. La Mar is absolutely incredible looking inside! All the high ceiling reach windows showing the bay was amazing. Parking was super efficient right next door and only a $10 pay for the 3 hours spent. Not totally bad! The waiter was so poilte, even funny since i had been late for my lunch-in due to the giants game extended the traffic all the way back off the embarcadero to 92 expressway on the 101. Yikes! Needless to say he was very polite and made sure glasses were full. The yummy potato like chips were very satisfying and not greasy, with amazing three dips to choose from! omg! Even better then the classic chips and salsa from chevys! Sowee! Anywho, i got the lamb rolls with its on dipping sauce which were so yummy and so filling. The surrounding was very busy for a sunday afternoon and a bit chatty but not too bad were i couldn't hear my peer. Very cozy and made you feel like you were home eating with company due to their coffy seats and couch like benches. Would def bring others with for another time. Thanks again to Rach!
author: theresa j.

description: Way overpriced for the food and service they offer. $120 for two people with only one glass of wine?? Are you serious? The cev(b)iche was $15 and the portion was tiny...I can get more sushi with that amount. Try Limon or Fresca if you must have peruvian food.
author: G K.

description:
Although I am not a regular yelper, I had to share an outrageous experience I had at La Mar last week.  After a mediocre meal (great ceviches, very weak main dishes) with all around inattentive and blasé service, my friend left a 10 percent tip on his portion of the check.  As we're walking out the entry, our waiter, who until this point did not pay us very much attention, comes bounding after us and grabs my friend by the shoulder.  Fuming, he confronted my friend about the fact that  he only left a 10 percent tip and was very belligerent.  The manager came out and heard both sides of the story.  My friend explained that the service was very inattentive all night, and that it took us about 3-4 tries to get any assistance regarding wine, etc., and that the 10 percent was commiserate with the level of service and that this was a way of letting the waiter know that the service was not up to par.  At this point, we turned around and left.   

In the restaurant's defense, the manager came running out after we left the restaurant and apologized for the waiter's behavior.  The manager's entirely appropriate handling of the situation made us feel better; however, the waiter!  I sincerely hope that man takes anger management classes and leaves the service industry immediately.  As for the food, the namesake ceviches were great (the uni with sea scallops were amazing); the main dishes were mediocre (pork was very very dry; rice dishes were okay; the braised lamb was good, but nothing to write home about).  But I don't go to restaurants to first be ignored by then almost come fist to cuffs with the waiter.  LOTS of wrinkles to be ironed out here. 

Bottom line:  The food isn't good enough to warrant a visit; the space is too large and feels a bit chain-restaurant-y. I  predict that this will very soon be relegated to the tourists willing to shill out for a mediocre experience and an Embarcadero address.  The locals will stay clear of this place after the hype/publicity dies down.
author: JY Y.

description: Awesome dining experience. I ate at La Mar last weekend for the first time and was blown away. The food was delicious and the wait staff was great. We had a reservation and arrived on-time but did have to wait 20 minutes while our table was prepared (we had a group of 8). To thank us for waiting the waiter brought a round of gratis Pisco Sours to ease us into our meal. We threw ourselves at the mercy of our waiter and he led us on a journey across the menu. The highlights were the cebiches and the lomo saltado (as should be expected at a Peruvian restaurant).  Though on the expensive end of the scale I would say that La Mar is worth every penny and I will recommend this restaurant to anyone who wil listen.
author: Daniel E.

description: no more ceviche with uni and is it my imagination or are the portions smaller?  i would go for drinks and the waterfront view.
author: g. y.

description: I am not sure exactly what I ate there, but I have been back several times! I love the great food there, what else can I say!?
author: Laura R.

description:
last night i went to a 'soft opening' dinner and had a great experience... from the contemporary and subtle nautical themed decor and ambiance, to the flavors and presentation of the dishes and drinks... i'm thinking this restaurant will stick around...
